Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: AWI’s Project Manager is responsible for planning and executing water filtration related projects. They actively participate in a design team consisting of AWI’s Technical Advisors, other Project Managers and Draftsperson/Designer.At Anthratech Western Inc. (AWI) we provide water treatment solutions for industrialand municipal water and wastewater treatment plants across Canada and in select international markets. AWI is privately owned, with the head office and research and development facility located in Calgary, Alberta.Responsibilities and Duties: Defining the site-specific project scope and schedule.Procurement of components and coordination of delivery logistics.Travelling to work sites to attend meetings and complete inspections.Monitoring project process and communicating status updates to internal and external stakeholders.Scheduling and monitoring AWI’s on-site responsibilities, including equipment installation, performance testing and commissioning.Collaborate with AWI’s Document Specialist to develop project related documentation.Ensuring all aspects of the project meet company and worksite safety standards.Managing unexpected tasks that may arise, including troubleshooting requests, onsite services/repairs and small-parts orders.Supporting coworkers through collaboration, cross training and information sharing.Candidate RequirementsOur ideal candidate will have:A diploma in Engineering Technology or equivalent technical education/background.At least five-years of project management experience in a related field. Experience in a construction, engineering or similar work environment a strong asset.Project Management Professional certification an asset.A valid Alberta driver’s license (class 5) and a clean driver’s abstract.Personal and professional skills desired:Demonstrated ability to take initiative, work independently and use critical thinking to problem-solve.Ability to analyze and interpret technical information and engineering drawings.Strong communication skills (both verbal and written). Bilingual (Eng/Fre) language proficiency a strong asset.Customer service focus, with the ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.Hours of WorkCore office hours are Monday to Friday 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Occasional travel is required.CompensationCompensation will take into account the background, range of skills, knowledge and experience that the successful candidate brings to the opportunity. Following the probationary period, AWI employees are eligible for a comprehensive employee health insurance program with a health care spending account. After one year of service, AWI employees may be eligible for the AWI RRSP matching contribution plan.By submitting your resume, personal information and references to Anthratech Western Inc. you acknowledge and consent to AWI contacting your references and verifying education in order to determine your suitability for this employment opportunity.Candidates being considered for this position must pass AWI’s standard background check and screening process.The position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. No telephone, walk-in or agency inquiries.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:project management: 5 years

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: LW Survey Canada is an industry leading Geomatics provider to the energy industry. Our committed and innovative approach to using and developing new technologies enables us to provide superior quality assured and cost-effective solutions to meet our clients needs.As we expand our operations in Western Canada, we are currently looking for a Project Manager with construction and civil surveying experience. This truly unique opportunity will enable the committed individual to expand their career potential alongside the growth and enthusiasm of LW Survey Canada.Our ideal candidate will have above average technical, organizational and communication skills.ResponsibilitiesCommunicate effectively with Field Supervisors and Clients with daily project requirementsResponsible for field data review, quality control and autocad plan preparationCommunicate effectively with supervisors, project managers and clients on a daily basisThorough understanding of conventional survey practices, GPS and geospatial dataAble to understand a safe work environment and be able to perform all job task in a safe mannerEducation and ExperienceGeomatics/Survey Engineering DegreeAlberta Land Surveying designation added bonusMinimum five years relevant Project Management experienceSoftware experience: Trimble Business Center, Trimble RealWorks, Autocad Civil 3D, ArcGIS and Pix4DEmployment EnvironmentPosition is located in LW Survey head office in downtown Calgary, ABLW Survey offers a full benefit package and wage will be commensurate to applicable experience.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Senior Project Coordinator
Job_Description: About usWith significant projects completed in Canada including Fairmont Pacific Rim and Shangri-La Toronto, as well as several innovative and engaging developments underway such as Vancouver House and TELUS Sky, ICON is a multi-disciplined construction company dedicated to the art of city building and producing state-of-the-art developments with careful consideration to sustainability.Our team is comprised of talented individuals who are leaders in their industry. We have succeeded in creating some of the most important community developments. Our impressive project portfolio not only enforces our drive to partner with the best developers in North America, but our strong professional standards ensure that we are one of the best construction companies in Canada.About the roleWe have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Project Coordinator to join the experienced team working on the highly anticipated TELUS Sky building in Downtown Calgary.As Senior Project Coordinator, you will be responsible for coordinating activities and resources by working closely with the project team members and decision makers to identify and support project delivery. This includes;Assisting the Project Manager to ensure the project meets budget and scheduleMaintains project file management systemsDevelops and maintains excellent relationship with sub-trades and clientsTakes full ownership of the change order process, including proving, negotiating, processing and assessing cost and schedule impact prior to reviewing with Project ManagerTrack project deliverables and provide reporting on project progress and action itemsAssist the Project Manager with issuing subcontracts and monitors their progressEnforces contractual responsibilities with subcontractorsInvolved in all facets of project closeout, including archiving documents, execution and strategy through innovation thinkingEnsure adherence to company policies and proceduresAd-hoc tasks as required by the Project teamAbout youWe are looking for a passionate and forward thinking Senior Project Coordinator with the following attributes;Experience in High-rise Construction projects preferredStrong experience in Change Order Management essentialKnowledge of Procore software advantageousHigh attention to detail and organisation skillsKnowledge of Alberta building code and regulationsIntermediate skills in Microsoft office suiteConfident negotiator and conflict resolution skillsEffective communication skills at all levelIf you want to be on this journey with us, please click apply now!Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent

Title: Project Manager - Calgary
Job_Description: Harvard Property Management Inc. has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to join its team. Harvard is a full service real estate management company based in Western Canada that is recognized for its reputation in leadership, flexibility, quality and performance. The company oversees 8.8 million square feet of commercial properties with regional offices in Regina, Calgary, Edmonton and Winnipeg.This position will report to the Senior Project Manager and will be part of a Project Management team providing capital project management to external and internal clients. The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, contract administration and successful delivery of a variety of leasing construction and capital projects throughout Harvard’s managed portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.What you will bring to the job: - 5 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings;- The completion of a PMP designation is an asset;- Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting;- Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships;- Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines;- The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment;- Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment;- Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and- Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.What you will receive: - Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment;- Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP;- Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program;- Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and- Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. If you feel you are the person we are looking for in this position, please apply with your resume in confidence through the Careers tab at　www.hillcompanies.com.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Project Management Consultant
Job_Description: If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.   The Corporate Project Management Center's (CPMC) purpose is to support the advancement of project management excellence across The City of Calgary. As a member of the CPMC team, you will work closely with senior management, project managers and diverse project teams across the corporation to support effective project prioritization, planning and delivery through the implementation of project management principles and practices. This will be accomplished through consultations with stakeholders to determine their needs and to work collaboratively with them on solutions that address those needs. Primary duties include:  Consult with stakeholders to develop strategies to implement proven project management practices. Help project managers and project teams with the development of plans and delivery strategies to ensure project success. Apply a variety of tools and techniques to projects across a number of different business areas including infrastructure construction projects, policy development, business planning and information technology. Consult with stakeholders to develop and implement appropriate Project Management Maturity Models and Assessment Methodologies. Apply Quality Management concepts and approaches to the project management process that will enable continuous improvement.   Qualifications Degree in Business, Public Administration, Political Science or a related field plus a minimum of 4 years of progressive project management experience. Experience with Project Management Maturity Models would be considered an asset. Experience with Quality Management techniques would be considered an asset. A Project Management Professional (PMP) certificate would be considered to be an asset. Experience in a municipal government or other public sector environment is also an asset. Excellent communication, process management, change management and research skills along with a strong sense of political sensitivity. Equivalent combinations of experience and education may be considered. Pre-employment Requirements Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.  Union: Exempt (Jurisdiction Under Review)   Business Unit : Corporate Analytics & Innovation Position Type : Permanent Location : 800 Macleod Trail S.E. Compensation : Level E $77,891 – 117,609 per annum (Under Review) Days of Work : This position works a 5 day work week with one day off in a 3 week cycle. Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week Audience : Internal/External Apply By : May 30, 2018  Job ID # : 300855

Title: Project Planner
Job_Description: Project Planner-00043414-20180406 Description One of Husky’s advantages is that we are an integrated oil and gas company. From exploration to development, production, refining and marketing, we’ve got it all! Combine this with a range of learning and development tools and an inclusive work environment, and you are well-positioned for a successful career at Husky.  We have training, mentoring and career development programs and resources to help you develop both personally and professionally – as an employee or a leader. We offer many internal leadership and business skills courses along with tuition reimbursement programs for qualified employees. Every year, a significant number of our employees are able to take on new roles within the company thanks to our strong focus on hands-on learning and development. Husky is currently looking for aProject Planner at their Calgary, Alberta location.  The Project Planner is responsible for the development, implementation and sustainment of small projects portfolios, in addition to assisting the Planning & Scheduling team in meeting its functional objectives. This includes: front end planning support to projects and initiatives within Business Units, developing and maintaining project schedules by coordinating with project stakeholders to ensure successful project execution. The Project Planner is also responsible for coordinating the development and production of project status reporting. Specific responsibilities will include: Support development, implementation and sustainment of small project portfolio planning and controls Assist in front end conceptual planning for projects Develop and baseline project schedules Provide planning/scheduling support to projects in execution Provide support to plan and manage resources for projects Provide support in developing progress measurement systems Support functional initiatives to improve project planning & scheduling practices Qualifications Our ideal candidate will have the following qualifications: Post-Secondary degree in Chemical or Mechanical Engineering P. Eng Minimum 4-6 years’ experience in project planning & scheduling Minimum 4-6 years’ experience in progress and productivity measurement Understanding of Cost Control, Change Management, Estimating and Risk Management, 4-6 years Proficient in Primavera, MS Project and MS Windows, 4-6 years Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in project reporting (Progress Reports, Dashboards) Experience in gathering and analyzing large amounts of project cost and progress data Experience in small projects (TIC < $5 Million) portfolio planning Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in oil and gas industry Exposure to construction site and front end engineering development Knowledge of computer programming (C++, VBA etc) Experience with Primavera EPPM (Enterprise Project Portfolio Management) At Husky, we respect diversity and embrace an inclusive culture. We value uniqueness and different perspectives as they play a critical role in our success. To achieve this, individuals are selected based on qualifications, merit, and abilities and we encourage applications from everyone including visible minorities, Aboriginal people, women, and persons with disabilities. Husky Energy is an integrated Canadian energy company. It is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, and is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol HSE. The Company operates Upstream and Downstream business segments, with operations in Canada, the United States, China and Indonesia.  Husky's balanced growth strategy focuses on consistent execution, disciplined financial management and safe and reliable operations. Interested candidates must apply online at: www.huskyenergy.com/careers. Only those candidates who apply via Husky's online application process can be considered. We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization; however, only short-listed applicants will be contacted. #LI-Post Job Technologist Primary Location CA-AB-Calgary

Title: Executive Project Manager
Job_Description: This position performs all project management responsibilities for large scale Refining and Chemicals projects, including originating, start-up and management of large scale projects in the Engineering Construction industry valued at $500 million plus. The individual is responsible for planning, directing, supervising and controlling all technical, fiscal and administrative functions of contractual activities. An Executive Project Manager at this level will supervise one or more lower level Project Managers or the entire project staff.  Develop execution strategy/plans and manage the strategic and tactical aspects of large EPC/CM complex projects/programs which are of company-wide interest and may involve traveling, relocation or operating from a satellite office Responsible for the total execution and management of medium size Engineering, Procurement and Construction process industry projects including administration of the project, schedule and budgetary performance, quality, safety and technical detail. Candidate will be placed in the position of presenting themselves and company to the client in a professional manner. Candidate will be responsible for presentations prior to contract award, contract negotiations and ongoing project meetings/problem resolution sessions. Will handle the full performance of every phase of a major project or a group of smaller projects. Be the Safety Leader for the project and promote Jacobs � Beyond Zero� culture Utilize your skills and expertise to properly establish the project foundation based on a comprehensive understanding of the client's scope of work, budget, schedule and contractual terms and conditions Schedule and manage resources to attain cost and schedule certainty and the major project/program objectives Make responsible, strategic decisions on matters in the implementation of major projects and/or programs subject to company objectives, policy and financial controls. Apply your leadership skills to manage client and internal change; accountable to client and Jacobs for successful control and project outcome As a Leader, clearly communicate project status in terms of cost, schedule, scope and quality, in a manner consistent with client requirements As the Jacobs focal point for the project, develop and maintain positive relationships with client personnel at all levels of management, including support and participation in presentations to client's executive management team Encourage and implement successful work share execution for all engineering work Drive operational excellence by utilizing Calgary work instruction and Jacobs' standard operating procedures In a collaborative manner develop and expand our client portfolio, including support for Business Development efforts Support continuous improvement for project management/execution systems, work processes and procedures Assist in the training of project management staff Proactively participate in project reviews and audits Qualifications Qualified candidates must have previous experience on well-known projects and/or with well-known organizations within engineering and construction, including Chemicals or Hydrocarbon Projects. Candidates must have the following: A minimum of 20 years of project management experience, with 5 years specific to field experience and EPC/CM execution required BS or MS degree, significant technical expertise, and demonstrated record of leading project teams to success as a Project Manager is required Possess an expert level of competency in project management and the ability to identify/avoid potential problems or mitigate as they occur is required Experience should include managing $500+ Million TIC Projects in the Oil and Gas industry preferred Strong communication and leadership skills with detailed familiarity with project management tools, work share and effective leadership skills is preferred  At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.

Title: Estimator/Project Manager, Rocky View, AB
Job_Description: Primary Engineering and Construction Corporation (Primary) is a growth-oriented industry leader providing professional electrical engineering and construction services and specializing in emerging marketplaces in Alberta, British Columbia and Saskatchewan.  We offer design and design/build services for all types of electric utility distribution infrastructure to a wide variety of clients including electric utility companies, developers, builders, commercial and industrial businesses, oil companies, government, and private contractors. We pride ourselves on the backbone of our organization as a team of dedicated veterans with a combined 175+ years of experience in utility distribution design, maintenance, and construction. Our devotion to excellence has attracted some of the best young professional minds to our company.  We are looking for an experienced Estimator / Project Manager – Construction, accountable for estimating and project management of Electrical Utility Supply and Build Construction Projects in the Calgary area.  Your duties and responsibilities:  Maintain estimates and accuracy of estimating data in the company estimating system; Prepare construction only estimates and material take-offs for projects that support all supply/install RFP & RFQ responses; Manage projects supply / install projects quoted over $1.0m and maintain accurate project scope control; Request cost quotations from internal design, material and construction resources; Liaise with customers to negotiate and define project scopes and schedules. Be single point of contact with clients for supply and build; Verify project production progress and completion to support customer invoicing; Verify receipt of project goods purchased, or services procured, to support payment of supplier invoices; Prepare and execute customer and vendor contracts, authorize production of customer invoices and payment of supplier expenses, for the projects you sell and manage within the company signing authority policy. Escalate documents to necessary authorization levels, with recommendation for management to approve, where appropriate; Define scope and costs and market value of change orders, as required by projects. Negotiate change order acceptance with customers and suppliers; Manage customer and vendor contracted cost and project scheduling commitments; Effectively communicate with all project stakeholders on an ongoing basis; Support and assist construction supervisors in their day to day activities and tasks such as billing, as built documentation and drawings, project and contract management as time permits; Create and maintain accurate project revenue and expense budgets and schedules, including change order values, on a timely basis in company systems; Verify accuracy of monthly Work in Progress (WIP) financial reporting of the projects you sell and manage; Summarize and evaluate project financial outcomes at completion. Produce variance reports for senior management when required; Maintain estimates and accuracy of estimating data in the company estimating system.  The eligible candidate must:  Minimum 2 years post-secondary education; Minimum 5 years’ experience in electrical utility project estimating and project management; Demonstrated experience with, or exposure to, join use utility design and construction projects; A few qualifications that will help you succeed: Estimating, design, strong computer skills and ability to learn new applications efficiently; Detail driven, adaptable, excellent time management skills, problem solving and planning skills; Strong skills in written and verbal communication – ability to multi-task.  Primary offers a highly competitive compensation package including, competitive salaries, bonuses, Health & Dental benefits, flexible work schedules, paid vacation, Company Matching RRSP, flex days, and a number of career and professional development opportunities  If you are ready for a new challenge and want to make a difference in the industry, please send your resume in confidence to careers@primaryeng.com  **Please Note, you must be a Canadian Citizen or have a valid work permit**  We thank all candidates for their application however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  *Please see www.primaryeng.com for this and other positions we are recruiting.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: The Project Manager is responsible for planning, organizing, monitoring and managing the Company’s electrical utility projects - transmission lines, substations, underground installation projects. Main duties will encompass the simultaneous management of several projects ensuring that CANA Utilities’ best interests are served and the client/owners expectations are met or exceeded.  SPECIFIC RESPONSIBLITIES: To effectively complete the responsibilities of this position, the candidate must be able to complete  the following: • Support of Senior Management and provide junior staff members with training and mentoring as required. • Support to the Area Supervisor to aide in scheduling crews, projects and crew requirements. • Creation of Work In Progress reports and weekly project/crew reports for senior management. • Assist in review and analysis of project/division costs and accounting reports. Assist in development and implementation of strategies and processes for cost and revenue monitoring and tracking. • Provide pre-construction services which include preparing precise cost estimates, tendering contract bid proposals, sourcing all approvals, material take-offs, and material orders. • Show initiative to analyze and/or assist in the improvement of processes and procedures related to your duties. • Assist in the preparation of construction management submissions, project budgets, or contract negotiations. Assist in the company marketing effort where appropriate and as directed. • Coordinate with all project stakeholders (Power, Telephone, CATV, Gas and any other utilities as required) to install their equipment for the project. • Ensure that all contractual obligations of the project are understood and met by all parties. • Ordering of materials and transfer of in-stock material to specific jobs. • Prepare and submit all progress claims and progress reports. Assist the Accounting Department in follow-up and collection of payments. • Preparing as-built drawings following completion of the project and signing of the completion certificate. • Ensure that project Close-out, As-built drawings and manual requirements are met. Coordinate quality control packages and ensure customer follow-up. • Assist in development and maintenance of Safe Work and Quality Assurance & Construction processes and procedures. • Assist in networking and marketing of the corporation to Owners, Consultants and other clients. Assist in planning for the corporation by pursuing all project leads and market opportunities. • Represent the corporation in various industry and professional associations as appropriate and with the concurrence of Senior Management. • Foster team spirit and camaraderie among all staff to achieve efficient and productive performance. • Other duties as required.  QUALIFICATIONS:  A minimum of 5+ years of  Power Line or related Utility experience • Post-secondary Degree in Engineering/ Engineering Technology and or Business Administration • Strong Project Management Skills and Experience in the construction and administration of electrical utility projects - transmission lines, substations, and/or underground installations.  COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS  CANA offers a well-rounded  compensation package that includes:  Competitive  salary with annual bonus potential;   Comprehensive  benefits package including dental, optical, and medical, along with company matched pension;   A  long-term incentive program;   on-site  fitness facilities; and   No-cost  employee parking. In addition, CANA offers all its employees   Strong commitment to safety in the workplace Grounded  and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector   Commitment  to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, and varied project types and locations around Alberta

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Project Manager - (18000838) Description  At Golder, we thrive on challenges. Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.  Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?  Golder has a new opportunity for a Project Manager to join our Mining team on a full time basis based in Calgary. Your role could include involvement throughout all stages of a mining project’s life cycle (i.e. Initiation, Planning, Execution, Monitoring and Control, and Closure) for consulting specific projects.  The position will be varied but with significant focus on utilizing Golder’s internal technical resources. The majority of work will be engineering, science, and/or environmental consulting work. You will be manage projects in areas including, but not limited to, engineering design, field investigations, desktop analyses, numerical modeling, permitting, studies, research, etc. EPCM is not a focus for this position. You will support our technical mining divisions which include Mine Engineering and Stability, Mine Waste, Mine Water, Mine Environment and Mining Construction Services and the projects could be locations throughout the world.  An overview of your role will include:   Working with various internal and external stakeholders to plan various projects (scope, schedule and budget  Lead project teams, composed of mostly internal stakeholders, with some external stakeholders to execute projects to ensure that deliverables satisfy clients’ multiple needs  Assemble, manage and use a project monitoring system to monitor and track project progress with respect to schedule and budget  Utilize and follow various Golder project management policies and protocols as well as available financial tools and systems  Develop and implement project support plans (project health and safety, project quality, project risk management, project communication, project documentation, etc.)  Manage projects with technical teams to deliver on schedule and budget, and meet the technical requirements of clients and regulatory agencies, if applicable  Liaise regularly and frequently with clients and project teams to offer support and guidance  Motivate and influence various levels of technical experts toward the completion of projects on time and on budget  Manage change related scope, budget and schedule and actively communicate with the internal project team and clients  Provide leadership and guidance to junior project staff Qualifications  You will have a background in:   Minimum of 5 years as a consultant working as a project manager where the candidate leveraged internal project teams of greater than 5 people in engineering, science, environmental, or related disciplines  Has a BSc or MSc (preferred) or equivalent degree in Engineering, Science, Environmental, Business or related discipline  Project Management Professional (PMP) designation or equivalent accreditation in project management (e.g., PRINCE2, Agile, Six Sigma)  Strong knowledge of Project Management Systems  Strong understanding of the importance of health and safety in projects  Superior project planning skills, detail conscious and result oriented  Strong written and oral communications skills  High level of professionalism, integrity and ethics  Your benefits at Golder will include:  Competitive benefits and remuneration packages  Option to purchase shares in Golder  Employee owned structure - own the business, own the result  Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment  Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects  On the job training, mentoring and coaching  Global projects and travel opportunities  One of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 11 consecutive years  Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 40 countries, Golder’s 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.   Golder is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. As such, Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities, upon request.  To learn more about our company and culture click here to view The Promise of Golder video.     Primary Location: CA-AB-CALGARY Schedule: Full-time Employee Status: Regular Job Posting: May 8, 2018, 4:08:35 PM

Title: Project Manager – Renewable Energy
Job_Description: Description Calgary, AB WSP is one of the world's leading professional engineering services firms. Every day our more than 42,000 experts work to restore the natural environment and transform the built environment. In Canada, our 8000+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transport networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future. The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We’re a Forbes Top Employer in Canada, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada’s Top 100 Infrastructure Projects. At WSP , we’re proud, professional and passionate people. Join us. POSITION DESCRIPTION WSP is seeking a Project Manager to undertake construction management and Owner’s Engineer roles for Renewable Energy projects. The position will be based in our Calgary, Alberta office.  RESPONSIBILITIES Develop and manage project budgets, schedules, and resource levels Business development, market presence and client care will be important aspects of this role Contract review and management Liaise closely with the established technical teams to coordinate engineering work Create and manage inspection programs Coordination with relevant regulatory authorities and utilities Construction cost estimation Communication and documentation to support construction progress reporting Bid management Provide due diligence support for Advisory Services mandates Some travel to and from client sites and/or temporary secondment to client site may be required  QUALIFICATIONS Relevant engineering degree or a combination of related experience and education P.Eng. designation Experience undertaking the role of Owner’s Engineer and working with EPC contractors for Renewable Energy projects Proven experience leading, managing and delivering significant projects to time, cost and quality objectives Understanding of the full life-cycle of Renewable Energy projects Proven ability coordinating a multi-disciplinary team Proficiency in project planning and scheduling Demonstrable experience working cooperatively and effectively with a wide variety of stakeholders Experience with contracts and contract administration Proven business development experience Strong verbal and written communication skills Pragmatic, solutions-oriented approach to problem solving  Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits). To learn more about our firm and the projects we have been involved in, please visit our World of Possibilities microsite. WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.      Are you a returning applicant?   Previous Applicants:  Email:  Password:     If you do not remember your password click here. Title: Project Manager - 1 Year Limited Term Contract
Job_Description: Reporting to the Manager Information Technology, the IT Project Manager oversees one large project or performs a blended Project Manager / Business Analyst role on smaller projects. They will perform the role through to final implementation, ensuring the successful delivery of assigned projects in a timely, cost efficient, structured and consistent manner. This role requires strong project management, analytical, business process improvement, and inter-personnel skills. Coordinating the definition and formalized acceptance of the project scope Using formal methods to control changes to project scope Creating project schedule to enable the project team to realistically build project deliverables per the customer’s requirements and within the imposed constraints of time and budget Identifying and requesting project resources Managing the day to day aspects of the project Mentoring project team members as required Work with functional Managers / Team Leads to arrive at optimum solutions Managing and reporting status of deliverables, schedule, budget, risks and issues Creating and distributing project status reports to relevant stakeholders Identifying, managing and escalating issues and risks in a timely manner Identifying the need and possibly managing the training of end users Working with the business to clearly and accurately define their business needs and detailed requirements Identifying opportunities for business process improvements as well as proposing options for those improvements and facilitating their implementation where possible Working with IT technical resources to ensure that the business needs and requirements are understood and facilitating clarifications when needed Ensuring quality control activities are executed Delivering the end product to production in accordance with established process Qualifications  Degree or Diploma in Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience 5+ years IT Project Management experience 10+ years’ experience in a combination of business systems analysis, project management, and software development Experience in process definition, improvement and re-engineering. Exposure to a wide range of technologies including systems designed for field users as well as solid knowledge of ERP Systems, databases and systems integration. Ability to work independently and as a part of a team and manage multiple tasks in an ever-changing environment. Able to work with different client types to understand their needs, identify root causes of problems, and implement creative and pragmatic solutions. Ability to develop rapport with various client groups and personalities and maintain strong working relationships. Experience with various project delivery methodologies (waterfall, agile etc) Strong project management/business analyst and inter-personal skills Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to clearly articulate to all project members and stakeholders Ability to work independently and as a part of a team and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Comfortable working with and mentoring business analysts, technical team members and business users Experience with package implementation and vendor relationships Oilfield experience, specifically in the Energy Services sector, would be a definite asset Professional Project Management Certification (PMP, PRINCE2, MCPM) Some travel may be required, including to the United States Work is expected to be completed at the client’s office in downtown Calgary  Job Business systems analysis Primary LocationCanada-Alberta-Calgary Organization Corporate Admininistration Schedule Full-time Posting Date Mar 27, 2018, 1:00:00 AM Recruiter Marci Connors

Title: IT Project Manager
Job_Description: We are Systematix and we are currently looking for an IT Project Manager to work as part of our client’s global IT service team to deliver system solutions to meet business needs.  ABOUT THE PROJECT: As Project Manager, you will be working to support and maintain production applications as well as new development and infrastructure projects. You will follow Agile methodologies for software development. Many of the project teams are located outside of Canada and offshore. Some travel will be required.  ABOUT THE RESPONSIBILITIES:  Managing all components of moderately complex IT and/or business projects Co-ordinating activities of team, identifies necessary resources and develops schedules to meet completion deadlines Developing detailed work plans, schedules, project estimates, resource plans and status reports Verifying team adherence to control and risk implementations as well as standards and process changes Applying comprehensive understanding of how multiple areas collectively integrate within IT project leadership to contribute towards achieving business objectives Persuading and influencing others through strong communication and negotiations skills Utilizing comprehensive knowledge of multiple areas within technology to achieve technology objectives  ABOUT THE REQUIRED SKILLS:  College/University level education in areas such as Computer Science, Information Technology or Business Administration 5+ years of experience with project management PMP certification 2+ years experience in Agile environment Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills Excellent oral and written English skills Ability to work and think globally  ABOUT THE ROLE: This is a 6 month contract with a strong likelihood of renewal to be carried out at our client’s location in Calgary, AB. Possible travel will necessitate a valid passport.  APPLY NOW: If you are interested in finding out more please contact us or submit your resume to jobs@systematix.com  ABOUT SYSTEMATIX: Systematix is one of Canada’s largest privately owned National Consulting and Resourcing firms. With offices across Canada, we provide the highest caliber consulting solutions to hundreds of Regional, National, Provincial and Federal Government clientele.  At Systematix, we pride ourselves in taking care of our consultant partnerships - by doing the little things that matter - like taking the time to get to know you, knowing when an opportunity is the perfect fit, informing you every step of the way, and building the foundation for long term relationships. We do the same with our clients, concerning ourselves more with the project than the position, so that we have the information you need to ensure an opportunity is right for you. We only work with people who enjoy making a difference.  At Systematix, we bring people and projects together!

Title: PROJECT MANAGER II
Job_Description: The Yokogawa Project Manager has the ultimate responsibility for Yokogawa business at the project level. This includes the responsibility for customer satisfaction, improving margin, and for overall management of projects from initial conception through project completion. Assures projects are completed in a timely, efficient, and profitable manner while maintaining customer satisfaction by scope definition, planning, monitoring, and controlling all project resources and relationships utilizing Yokogawa ISO procedural requirements  DUTIES/RESULTS:  Manages all project planning; i.e., works with customer and project team to clearly define scope and ensure clarity of project technical schedule and budget requirements, performs billing and cash flow planning, manpower loading models; implementation plan with time lines, ensures complete understanding of customer needs by key personnel, shares information with team members; responsible for developing and maintaining required project records. Maintains consistent updates of project plan, budget and schedule. Manages cost reduction on projects while improving customer satisfaction. Manages project quality by ensuring YCA quality plan is implemented throughout the project. Manages operations and engineering at current location. Implements/utilizes tools provided to aid in managing/directing project activities. Responsible for contract growth through change order management and development of customer relationships to broaden/expand scope of work based on customer’s needs or expectations. Maintains awareness of project progress; i.e., addresses any problems on a timely basis; conducts project progress meetings; attends selected design reviews and code walk-throughs; monitors progress vs. plan; provides status reports to manager and customer; ensures change orders are properly quoted, negotiated and executed; assures execution is in accordance with unit procedures and proper methodologies. Responsible for contract compliance, including all terms/conditions scope, financial, insurance, etc. Responsible for improving cash position of each contract within terms/cancellations of contract. Develops and oversees project completion and site mobilization plan; i.e. ensures integrity of final system; conformance to contractual requirements, system acceptance by customer, delivery of specified system documentation and services; controls expenses and defines completion plans for personnel; ensures orderly transfer of project to Customer Service for long-term support; responsible for archiving project records, documentation, system tapes, and transfer of customer-accepted system with required documentation for warranty services and maintenance. Serves as YCA’s primary contact and focal point to the customer during the project; i.e., provides interface between YCA and the customer, involves other YCA personnel as appropriate; prepares all required reports; arranges joint YCA/customer project meetings; ensures customers are aware of evolving system characteristics; resolves any miscommunication; ensures customer satisfaction is maintained; makes periodic job site visits. Works with or acts as Proposal Manager on customer requirements; i.e., reviews RFP (Request for Proposal) and specification, coordinates with sales and marketing to determine scope of work and is responsible for scope definition, prepares and/or approves all cost estimates, develops preliminary implementation plan, may assist in the estimating, proposal, and sales process, controls final negotiations on engineering/construction project. Performs various management duties; i.e., provides data for YCA reports; keeps sales and marketing aware of customer interfaces; ensures project team members have the equipment, facilities, training, personnel and authority necessary to meet their objectives; interfaces with Accounting, Purchasing, H.R., as necessary. Depending on the project type and scope, the Project Manager may need to perform some of the engineering tasks. Project Manager II Skills:  Manages multiple (8-12) projects of higher complexity and/or value. Works independently of supervisor in most cases; communicates results to management; solicits support/advice/assistance when required to ensure/protect contract activities are consistent with procedures and customer requirements. Works directly with sales team members; makes sales support calls as required. Negotiates changes/C.O’s as required to meet YCA and customer goals, with supervisor approval on all critical changes. Tracks/manages and reports all financial variables to management. Implements business unit procedures, re-working tracking, documentation requirements, etc., as required to fulfill project/contract obligations. Develops skills/abilities for negotiations, including strategies, costing, scheduling, etc. Understands YCA hardware and software deliverables.  Education: B.S. degree in Computer Science, Electrical, Mechanical, Chemical Engineering or similar degree, or equivalent experience. MBA is desirable but not required. APEGA certification is required. Bilingual in English/French is preferred.  Prior Experience: Seven (7) to fifteen (15) years in digital process control systems integration, with prior experience to have included major management of engineering/technical staff.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.  Job Responsibilities/Job Functions:  Manage all aspects of the project (New Site Acquisition-Real Estate) including project scoping, resource assignment, project plan development, project tracking, monitoring and reporting through the application of proven project management principles and methodologies. Develop and maintain all project documentation (Project Plan, Issue and Action Logs, Risk Management, Communication Plan, Status Reports, Post Implementation Reviews, etc.). Identify benefits expected from initiatives and conduct post implementation reviews to report on and track results. Pull together resources effectively to implement projects. Orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish objectives. Use critical thinking skills to anticipate and manage potential risks that will arise. Communicate these to the stakeholders on a regular basis and ensure decisions are made quickly and effectively. Maintain the Project Management Office Lessons Learned database, and apply lessons learned to all initiatives. Where process creation or modification recommendations result from the lesson learned, Project Manager is responsible for determining ownership within the organization and managing the implementation of recommended solutions. Assist in the development and implementation of templates, procedures and processes as part of the continuous development of the Wireless Customer Deployment team.  Job Qualifications:  Minimum (5) years of demonstrated progressive experience in project management, preferably in projects associated with the deployment or implementation of services for customers. Preference that this experience is in telecommunications industry. Experience in managing a group of simultaneous initiatives. Post secondary education, preferably in a business administration or project management related discipline. Completely conversant in Microsoft Project and other MS Office tools. Knowledge and consistent application of proven industry standard Project Management approaches. Project Management designation an asset but not required. High level of energy and strong passion to lead team members to successful completion of projects and to ensure the delivery of a positive customer experience. Great attention to detail. Creativity, flexibility and an ability to manage time and reset priorities in a dynamic environment. Superior skill set including: analytical thinking and problem solving, coaching and leadership, presentation and facilitation, negotiation and relationship building and proficient probing, listening and positioning skills and a good risk manager.  Experience in Telco Real Estate Acquisition and associated industry relationships an asset. Experience in large telecom projects Experience and understanding of Telco lease and municipal development process. Schedule: Full Time Shift: Day Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: #700, 500 - 4 Ave Sw (056), Calgary, AB Travel Requirements: Up to 25% Posting Category/Function: Project Management & Engineering Requisition ID: 120710 WHY ROGERS? As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow. We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work: Simplify and innovate Take ownership of the what and the how Equip people to succeed Execute with discipline and pride Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today. What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You can also reach out to our team at RogersRecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process. Posting Notes: Corporate || Canada (CA) || AB || Calgary || SF: LI ||

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: This position is responsible and accountable for project management support to the Grant Management Team in initiatives outlined within the Prevention of Cancer Among Indigenous Peoples and Vulnerable Population’s Grant Management Plan (GMP). Reporting directly to the Executive Director of the PPIH SCN, the Project Manager will support pre-project activities through project initiation, planning and development, as well as supporting project implementation, evaluation and closure for projects occurring within the overall Grant Management Plan (GMP) and across three project areas: Indigenous Healthy Innovation and Cancer Prevention (HICP); Alberta Screening and Prevention in Indigenous Primary Care Settings (ASaP); and Indigenous Patient and Community Engagement Research Internship (Indigenous PaCER). Projects identified within the GMP are complex, spanning multiple AHS departments, and involving external stakeholders. Projects may have interdependencies with other provincial projects. Work requires depth and breadth of knowledge and skill to deliver solutions that address health and business needs. The Project Manager (PM) applies project management methodology and expertise, effectively provides facilitation of diverse groups who are addressing complex issues, and skilfully engages multiple stakeholders to develop effective and efficient solutions and health services. The PM manages project resources within a matrix reporting structure, and communicates regularly with multiple stakeholders. Relationship management and communication are important components of the position. The PM appropriately applies change management and process improvement principles, knowledge and expertise, and must be committed to quality improvement, and possess the skills to use data and information to effectively advance quality and innovation. Classification: Project Manager Union: Exempt Department: Resrch Proj ACPLF006735 Todd K Primary Location: Southport Tower Negotiable Location: Within Calgary Zone Temporary Employee Class: Temp F/T Benefits FTE: 1.00 Posting End Date: 22-MAY-2018 Date Available: 11-JUN-2018 Temporary End Date: 10-JUN-2020 Hours per Shift: 7.75 Length of Shift in weeks: 2 Shifts per cycle: 10 Shift Pattern: Days Days Off: Saturday/Sunday Minimum Salary: $28.20 Maximum Salary: $48.45 Vehicle Requirement: N/A Required Qualifications: Post-secondary degree in a health care profession, business or related field. 3 - 5 years of experience working in a healthcare organization of significant size, complexity and diversity. 2 - 5 years of progressive experience in project management, including extensive knowledge of project management principles, tools and methodologies. Experience leading project teams and large projects within a healthcare organization of significant size, complexity and diversity. Experience working directly with clinicians; comfortable communicating with physicians, other health care professionals and executives. Demonstrated skill in verbal and written communication. Demonstrated application of systems thinking, and change management. Demonstrated strength in verbal and written communication skills; ability to relay or explain complex issues or difficult situations. Experience with MS Office suite, including MS Project and Visio. Equivalent combinations of education and experience will be considered. Additional Required Qualifications: Training in project management methodology is required. Experience with project management is required, including facilitation/coordination of project planning, execution, monitoring, and evaluation. Ability to work effectively and efficiently in a unique project environment where project resources and subject matter experts have limited availability to contribute; ability to move projects forward within these constraints. Breadth of knowledge of healthcare and healthcare issues. Skill and experience in critical thinking, analysis, problem solving, negotiation, investigation and concerns resolution. Motivated and adaptable team player with experience coordinating/leading teams. Demonstrated ability and comfort with decision making and communication, and the ability to inspire and build confidence in others. Proven ability to foster relationships and partnerships with complex and varied internal and external individuals and groups. Ability to work independently, prioritize and meet deadlines. Ability to develop and facilitate presentations to convey information or transfer knowledge. Preferred Qualifications: Training in process improvement, change management and health services planning is an asset. All Non-Union/Exempt positions are being reviewed for possible inclusions in the AUPE General Support Services bargaining unit. If this position is impacted, the incumbent will be notified accordingly.

Title: Project Manager - Power Delivery Projects
Job_Description: Current ENMAX employees are encouraged to apply through their internal Workday access.   Posted: May 11, 2018 Closing Date: May 25, 2018 Position Type: Permanent Union: MP (Exempt)  Vision – To be Canada’s leader in the electricity industry.  Mission – We power the potential of people, businesses and communities by safely and responsibly providing electricity and energy services in ways that matter to them today and tomorrow.  Is this challenge for you? Imagine the possibilities.  You will be responsible for managing complex major projects through to successful completion.  Responsibilities: Manage complex distribution, substations, transmission, network, customer driven, and major projects within schedule, cost and regulatory requirements. Coordinate and lead matrixed project teams by setting clear expectations and utilizing resources efficiently. Oversee all project components including scope, cost, schedule, EHS, quality management, change management, and customer satisfaction. Develop and maintain detailed executable project plans and control of critical timelines/milestones. Effectively and accurately report project status, change requests, schedule and finances to internal and external customers. Provide guidance and leadership to project engineers, design engineers, construction managers, project controls, and supply chain management personnel. Manage qualified subcontractors as required to deliver project scopes and adhere to project schedules. Assist with development of capital business cases, budget development, monthly forecasting and variance rationale. Provide support to the management team for implementing process changes and improvements. Accountable for the safe execution of their projects.  Qualifications: Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering 10+ years’ experience with a power utility with directly applicable experience in construction and project management. P.Eng status with The Association of Professionals in Engineering and Geoscientists in Alberta (APEGA). PMP designation or willingness to obtain designation. Hands on experience with heavy industrial design, construction, and project management. Demonstrated ability to deliver projects to cost, schedule, quality, and EHS objectives while also delivering high customer satisfaction. Strong computers skills in MS Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word) Experience using scheduling software (MS Projects, Primavera, Maximo etc…). Experience in project cost control; schedule and critical path analysis would be an asset.  Personal Qualities: Excellent analytical and organizational skills and ability to manage a wide variety of issues and multiple projects. Driven to provide predictability and a high focus on customer satisfaction. Demonstrated excellence in communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively manage project expectations and communicate with team members. Proven, strong leadership, negotiation and conflict resolution skills. Strong team player and ability to work independently. Excellent decision making abilities with sound judgment. Sound knowledge of project management with the ability to meet project objectives.  ENMAX Values – Safety, Integrity, Accountability, Service, Teamwork, Agility, Innovation  If you share our values and would like to make a difference with your career, join the team and see where the ENMAX possibilities can take you.  What We Offer !  We offer competitive compensation including a comprehensive flexible benefits program, non-downtown location that includes great building amenities such as free onsite fitness facility with programming geared to employees needs, onsite child care centre (upon availability, offered from our ENMAX Place location 141 – 50 Ave. SE), free parking and much more.  Location: 141 - 50th Avenue SE, Calgary, AB  Note: ENMAX welcomes all qualified applicants to apply, it is our aim to have a workplace which reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. ENMAX employees are encouraged to pursue professional development opportunities through our internal Learning Centre . Must be legal to work in Canada and requires the successful completion of a criminal background check. Two pieces of valid Government issued ID will be required. Two professional references will be requested. Education requirements for this position will be verified by a third party.   Please visit our careers page to learn more about other opportunities at ENMAX Corporation.

Title: Jr. Construction Project Manager

Title: Mgr, Project Management
Job_Description: The Manager, Project Management will be an experienced professional with a strong background in team leadership, team building, collaboration, and project management best practices. Using consistent practices, we facilitate, problem solving and opportunity actualization. The successful candidate must possess a passion for discipline, excellence, along with drive to develop the skills of those around him.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities The responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:  Translating our vision, mission, values, and business unit goals into team and individual priorities; Developing and maintaining an organizational structure that balances executing consistent best practices while remaining lean and scalable, to deliver on business needs; Develop, manage and metric group budgets in order to meet the divisional needs. Implementing a collaborative Engineering, Procurement and Construction Management process including key vendor relationships; Leading and coaching a team of technical professionals to successfully execute on all projects and support the integrity of ongoing operations and the project requirements of Business Development groups. Foster a culture of internal customer service, delivering results, accountability and respect; Ensuring the teams planning processes are tied to divisional business planning processes; Building technical and managerial competency and capacity with a focus on growing employee knowledge, skill and desire; Interfacing with multiple internal stakeholders across business units; strive to execute on solutions, with a collaborative work mindset. Operate to the highest standards of safety at all times. Plan and hazard assess all work activities. Mitigate risks identified in the assessment process. Adhere to the safety obligations of Secure. Aid in the development and delivery of programs and initiatives to staff. Ability to travel to Secure project sites throughout North America on a regular basis.   Qualifications & Competencies  The successful candidate will have:  P. Eng., CET, RET or equivalent, with 10+ year’s leadership experience in management or supervisory positions. Professional experience in managing to proven project management best practices. Strong interpersonal, collaboration and communications skills. An understanding of Secure Energy’s various services, policies, procedures, and operations. Demonstrated ability in reading engineered drawings, technical specifications and contracts. Proficient in the use of project management software (MS Project, Excel, etc.). Strong attention to detail and ability to provide leadership to staff Excellent track record of identifying technical/managerial/professional areas of development for team members that will breed success, foster an environment of learning, and address developmental areas Formal training or certification in Project Management is considered an asset.  Qualifications Skills  Preferred Multi-tasking Expert Strong Customer Services Expert Self-Motivated Expert Ability to Meet Timelines Expert Interpersonal Skills Expert Microsoft Office Advanced Team Oriented Expert Managing Multiple Priorities Expert Behaviors  Preferred Innovative: Consistently introduces new ideas and demonstrates original thinking Functional Expert: Considered a thought leader on a subject Leader: Inspires teammates to follow them Team Player: Works well as a member of a group Motivations  Preferred Growth Opportunities: Inspired to perform well by the chance to take on more responsibility Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization Education  Preferred Bachelors or better. Experience  Preferred P. Eng., CET, RET or equivalent Formal training or certification in Project Management is considered an asset 10 years: Leadership experience in management or supervisory positions Licenses & Certifications  Preferred PMP Certificate

Title: Project Planner
Job_Description: One of Husky’s advantages is that we are an integrated oil and gas company. From exploration to development, production, refining and marketing, we’ve got it all! Combine this with a range of learning and development tools and an inclusive work environment, and you are well-positioned for a successful career at Husky.  We have training, mentoring and career development programs and resources to help you develop both personally and professionally – as an employee or a leader. We offer many internal leadership and business skills courses along with tuition reimbursement programs for qualified employees. Every year, a significant number of our employees are able to take on new roles within the company thanks to our strong focus on hands-on learning and development.  Husky is currently looking for a Project Planner at their Calgary, Alberta location.  The Project Planner is responsible for the development, implementation and sustainment of small projects portfolios, in addition to assisting the Planning & Scheduling team in meeting its functional objectives. This includes: front end planning support to projects and initiatives within Business Units, developing and maintaining project schedules by coordinating with project stakeholders to ensure successful project execution. The Project Planner is also responsible for coordinating the development and production of project status reporting.  Specific responsibilities will include: Support development, implementation and sustainment of small project portfolio planning and controls Assist in front end conceptual planning for projects Develop and baseline project schedules Provide planning/scheduling support to projects in execution Provide support to plan and manage resources for projects Provide support in developing progress measurement systems Support functional initiatives to improve project planning & scheduling practices Qualifications  Our ideal candidate will have the following qualifications: Post-Secondary degree in Chemical or Mechanical Engineering P. Eng Minimum 4-6 years’ experience in project planning & scheduling Minimum 4-6 years’ experience in progress and productivity measurement Understanding of Cost Control, Change Management, Estimating and Risk Management, 4-6 years Proficient in Primavera, MS Project and MS Windows, 4-6 years Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in project reporting (Progress Reports, Dashboards) Experience in gathering and analyzing large amounts of project cost and progress data Experience in small projects (TIC < $5 Million) portfolio planning Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in oil and gas industry Exposure to construction site and front end engineering development Knowledge of computer programming (C++, VBA etc) Experience with Primavera EPPM (Enterprise Project Portfolio Management) At Husky, we respect diversity and embrace an inclusive culture. We value uniqueness and different perspectives as they play a critical role in our success. To achieve this, individuals are selected based on qualifications, merit, and abilities and we encourage applications from everyone including visible minorities, Aboriginal people, women, and persons with disabilities.  Husky Energy is an integrated Canadian energy company. It is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, and is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol HSE. The Company operates Upstream and Downstream business segments, with operations in Canada, the United States, China and Indonesia.  Husky's balanced growth strategy focuses on consistent execution, disciplined financial management and safe and reliable operations.  Interested candidates must apply online at: www.huskyenergy.com/careers. Only those candidates who apply via Husky's online application process can be considered. We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization; however, only short-listed applicants will be contacted.  #LI-Post Job Technologist Primary Location CA-AB-Calgary Job Posting May 18, 2018, 10:28:33 PM Unposting Date Jun 2, 2018, 5:59:00 AM
