Title: Procurement PMO Specialist
Job_Description: Global procurement position Work with a dynamic team of procurement specialists Permanent role based in Montreal About the role We are looking for a Procurement PMO Specialist to manage Rio Tinto’s supplier outline agreements ensuring they are regularly updated, stored in the central repository system and easily assessable for reporting purposes. Another key component to this role will be the requirement to provide efficient/accurate analytics on products/services spend so that the business is able to make informed decisions minimising wastage, reducing cycle times and finding cost saving opportunities. This role is a great opportunity for someone who has strong category management/procurement reporting experience, is confident in the use of SAP and Ariba and has strong analytical skills to present meaningful data interpretation.  Reporting to the Manager - Mining Equipment, you will be: Develop a Project Management Office (PMO) for reporting across all procurement projects. Streamline the reporting and the procurement process to ensure that the procurement managers have more time to spend on driving value creation rather than on reporting Regularly engage with the business on all procurement projects to ensure the Ariba system is up to date/stored with the current supplier outline agreements Extract spend, cost saving and sourcing data. Then, manipulating and interpreting the data to present business recommendations Coordinate and consolidate information from the contracts to provide actionable reports Establish reporting protocols and work with the team to suggest process/system improvements  About you  To be successfully considered for this role, you will have: Strong analytical skills to dissect complex data and provide meaningful interpretation that present compelling case for improvements Previous experience in procurement/category management reporting Confident use in SAP and Ariba (including navigation and extracting accurate/relevant reports) A good threshold to work in a face pace environment with conflicting priorities Where you will be working Rio Tinto Procurement provides supply chain services that deliver value to the Rio Tinto Group through the strategic sourcing and buying of goods and services for all operations and businesses. Playing a fundamental role, value is achieved through uniformed processes, e-technology, increased corporate social responsibility and measurable savings for the Group.  About us  As pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress.  Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents. Aluminium and copper, diamonds, gold and industrial minerals, iron ore, coal and uranium: our materials make up the world around us. You’ll find them in smartphones, planes, cars, hospitals and throughout your home.  Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce  We are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organization and fulfilling career.  So if this sounds like you and the opportunity you are looking for, apply now.  Please note, in order to be successfully considered for this role you must complete all pre-screening questions.

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Compugen is an organization that encourages and supports ongoing training and development opportunities. We are composed of a talented, diversified workforce that performs collectively in an entrepreneurial and flexible environment. Our staff members have access to the latest and greatest technologies in performing their daily activities. Well-developed interpersonal skills Advanced skills in written and verbal communication Analytical, systematic and forward thinker Post-secondary degree/certification or equivalent PMP certification nice to have 5-7 year successful experience as a Project Manager, Project Leader or Delivery Manager is a requirement. Computer literacy; proficient in word processing, spreadsheet, flowchart & presentation and project management software tools Must be able to be comfortable in key technologies currently employed by Compugen (highly recommended) Interest in continuing to follow developments in relevant technologies (desirable) Plan and implement small to large scale projects. Direct all aspects of the project planning and execution phases. Work with project team members to create detailed project plan. Engage resources as required by the plan for the successful deployment of the project. Detail and assign work package plans. Meet regularly with the team to follow up on tasks, deliverables and issues. Communicate status to the client via written reports and meeting or teleconferences. Track project plan to baseline against time and budget constraints. Manage project scope & handle scope change requests using appropriate documentation. Log, monitor and handle project issues, analyze & recommend viable alternatives. Hold weekly team meetings and attend client meetings. Lead the Compugen team members towards the successful conclusion of the project. Act as a single point of contact for both the internal Compugen team and the client team. Manage customer expectations. Ensure a high level of customer service and view toward repeat business. Use Compugen's project methodology. Ensure proper documentation is completed & stored where accessible. Documentation includes Statement of Work, plan, schedule, scope changes log, issues log, risk assessment, minutes of status meeting and PIR. Must follow the Compugen Inc. Deployment Guidelines Must strive to improve The Deployment Guidelines Must be able to report on the P&L of all projects Must report on the customer satisfaction of the projects; target is a letter of reference or project survey. Must manage and escalate issues as required.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: AWI’s Project Manager is responsible for planning and executing water filtration related projects. They actively participate in a design team consisting of AWI’s Technical Advisors, other Project Managers and Draftsperson/Designer.At Anthratech Western Inc. (AWI) we provide water treatment solutions for industrialand municipal water and wastewater treatment plants across Canada and in select international markets. AWI is privately owned, with the head office and research and development facility located in Calgary, Alberta.Responsibilities and Duties: Defining the site-specific project scope and schedule.Procurement of components and coordination of delivery logistics.Travelling to work sites to attend meetings and complete inspections.Monitoring project process and communicating status updates to internal and external stakeholders.Scheduling and monitoring AWI’s on-site responsibilities, including equipment installation, performance testing and commissioning.Collaborate with AWI’s Document Specialist to develop project related documentation.Ensuring all aspects of the project meet company and worksite safety standards.Managing unexpected tasks that may arise, including troubleshooting requests, onsite services/repairs and small-parts orders.Supporting coworkers through collaboration, cross training and information sharing.Candidate RequirementsOur ideal candidate will have:A diploma in Engineering Technology or equivalent technical education/background.At least five-years of project management experience in a related field. Experience in a construction, engineering or similar work environment a strong asset.Project Management Professional certification an asset.A valid Alberta driver’s license (class 5) and a clean driver’s abstract.Personal and professional skills desired:Demonstrated ability to take initiative, work independently and use critical thinking to problem-solve.Ability to analyze and interpret technical information and engineering drawings.Strong communication skills (both verbal and written). Bilingual (Eng/Fre) language proficiency a strong asset.Customer service focus, with the ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.Hours of WorkCore office hours are Monday to Friday 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Occasional travel is required.CompensationCompensation will take into account the background, range of skills, knowledge and experience that the successful candidate brings to the opportunity. Following the probationary period, AWI employees are eligible for a comprehensive employee health insurance program with a health care spending account. After one year of service, AWI employees may be eligible for the AWI RRSP matching contribution plan.By submitting your resume, personal information and references to Anthratech Western Inc. you acknowledge and consent to AWI contacting your references and verifying education in order to determine your suitability for this employment opportunity.Candidates being considered for this position must pass AWI’s standard background check and screening process.The position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. No telephone, walk-in or agency inquiries.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:project management: 5 years

Title: Senior Project Coordinator
Job_Description: About usWith significant projects completed in Canada including Fairmont Pacific Rim and Shangri-La Toronto, as well as several innovative and engaging developments underway such as Vancouver House and TELUS Sky, ICON is a multi-disciplined construction company dedicated to the art of city building and producing state-of-the-art developments with careful consideration to sustainability.Our team is comprised of talented individuals who are leaders in their industry. We have succeeded in creating some of the most important community developments. Our impressive project portfolio not only enforces our drive to partner with the best developers in North America, but our strong professional standards ensure that we are one of the best construction companies in Canada.About the roleWe have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Project Coordinator to join the experienced team working on the highly anticipated TELUS Sky building in Downtown Calgary.As Senior Project Coordinator, you will be responsible for coordinating activities and resources by working closely with the project team members and decision makers to identify and support project delivery. This includes;Assisting the Project Manager to ensure the project meets budget and scheduleMaintains project file management systemsDevelops and maintains excellent relationship with sub-trades and clientsTakes full ownership of the change order process, including proving, negotiating, processing and assessing cost and schedule impact prior to reviewing with Project ManagerTrack project deliverables and provide reporting on project progress and action itemsAssist the Project Manager with issuing subcontracts and monitors their progressEnforces contractual responsibilities with subcontractorsInvolved in all facets of project closeout, including archiving documents, execution and strategy through innovation thinkingEnsure adherence to company policies and proceduresAd-hoc tasks as required by the Project teamAbout youWe are looking for a passionate and forward thinking Senior Project Coordinator with the following attributes;Experience in High-rise Construction projects preferredStrong experience in Change Order Management essentialKnowledge of Procore software advantageousHigh attention to detail and organisation skillsKnowledge of Alberta building code and regulationsIntermediate skills in Microsoft office suiteConfident negotiator and conflict resolution skillsEffective communication skills at all levelIf you want to be on this journey with us, please click apply now!Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent

Title: Project Manager - Calgary
Job_Description: Harvard Property Management Inc. has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to join its team. Harvard is a full service real estate management company based in Western Canada that is recognized for its reputation in leadership, flexibility, quality and performance. The company oversees 8.8 million square feet of commercial properties with regional offices in Regina, Calgary, Edmonton and Winnipeg.This position will report to the Senior Project Manager and will be part of a Project Management team providing capital project management to external and internal clients. The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, contract administration and successful delivery of a variety of leasing construction and capital projects throughout Harvard’s managed portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.What you will bring to the job: - 5 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings;- The completion of a PMP designation is an asset;- Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting;- Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships;- Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines;- The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment;- Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment;- Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and- Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.What you will receive: - Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment;- Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP;- Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program;- Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and- Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. If you feel you are the person we are looking for in this position, please apply with your resume in confidence through the Careers tab at　www.hillcompanies.com.Job Type: Full-time

Title: ASSISTANT PROJECT MANAGER
Job_Description: This position is for someone who is self-motivated, looking to advance in the field, using their interpersonal skills to make essential contacts for the future. If this is you, you will have a Bachelor of Science (with APEGGA eligibility), a CET and/or PMP designation, and a minimum of three years of project administration. You must have intermediate proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and Microsoft Project. Excellent written and oral communication skills are important for interactions with clients and colleagues at all levels. Strong interpersonal and organizational skills are required, as well as the ability to work independently. You should have the ability to facilitate and influence a diverse range of people. Bernelle offers a competitive salary and bonus program.  If your skills meet our requirements and you are interested in contributing to the growth of our company, please submit your resume and salary expectations directly to one of us or to info@bernelle.ca.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: LW Survey Canada is an industry leading Geomatics provider to the energy industry. Our committed and innovative approach to using and developing new technologies enables us to provide superior quality assured and cost-effective solutions to meet our clients needs.As we expand our operations in Western Canada, we are currently looking for a Project Manager with construction and civil surveying experience. This truly unique opportunity will enable the committed individual to expand their career potential alongside the growth and enthusiasm of LW Survey Canada.Our ideal candidate will have above average technical, organizational and communication skills.ResponsibilitiesCommunicate effectively with Field Supervisors and Clients with daily project requirementsResponsible for field data review, quality control and autocad plan preparationCommunicate effectively with supervisors, project managers and clients on a daily basisThorough understanding of conventional survey practices, GPS and geospatial dataAble to understand a safe work environment and be able to perform all job task in a safe mannerEducation and ExperienceGeomatics/Survey Engineering DegreeAlberta Land Surveying designation added bonusMinimum five years relevant Project Management experienceSoftware experience: Trimble Business Center, Trimble RealWorks, Autocad Civil 3D, ArcGIS and Pix4DEmployment EnvironmentPosition is located in LW Survey head office in downtown Calgary, ABLW Survey offers a full benefit package and wage will be commensurate to applicable experience.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: : Manage the execution of all website projects, large and small, ensuring that projects are executed on time and on budget Create and manage work back schedules Coordinate communications and status meeting between all internal and external stakeholders on projects Responsible for managing the execution and completion of all tasks related to website maintenance agreements Support the finding and management of contractors for projects Create training manuals and train clients on updating their websites Perform thorough QA reviews of all deliverables prior to releasing to clients Constantly monitor new industry trends and tools that can be leveraged by Trufla and educate the team on these trends and changes Help to continually evolve and improve internal processes to ensure quality and efficiency standards are maintained Support the ongoing business development efforts with website audits and estimation of potential projects  Qualifications & Competencies: Diploma or degree in Marketing, Public Relations, Management, Commerce or Business administration or equivalent work experience PMP or working towards obtaining it is considered an asset 2+ years of experience, preferably within a marketing agency, technology company or professional services firm Strong understanding of the process and steps required to deliver high quality websites and digital projects Exceptional organization and time management skills Must have good knowledge and experience in Microsoft Office Suite: PowerPoint, Excel, Word and Outlook Professional and concise communicator, able to clearly articulate your thoughts in conversations, email and presentations [Not translated in selected language]

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: LOCATION: Edmonton Commercial  The Project Manager position is responsible for achieving the overall objectives of assigned project(s), including both office and field activities. More importantly, this position will manage a successful team and drive the business.  Responsibilities: Implement and manage the Company safety program and monitor safety performance. Planning, scheduling, setting objectives and controlling activities during the construction phase of a project(s) in conjunction with the Project Superintendent and Project Team. Project administration which includes negotiating and awarding subcontracts for scopes of work, resolving issues to meet project goals, invoice review and approval, preparing progress application payments and maintain project files. Expedite all materials and equipment deliveries and monitor quality of work on site. Manage project budgets and timelines to exceed requirements. Maintain the credibility of Bird Construction and satisfaction of its clients through daily decision making and client interaction. Qualifications: Institutional and Commercial construction background is a must. Completion of P.Eng., Project Management Diploma/Degree, GSC or LEED designation(s) would be an asset. 5 - 8 years progressive experience in the General Contracting industry as a Project Manager on projects in the commercial and institutional sectors. Your demonstrated leadership, project management and problem-solving skills support your collaborative approach to delivering results. Service and results-oriented, you are able to build and steward trust with a broad network of professional colleagues, subcontractors and team members to effect competitive excellence, pride in teamwork and outstanding project delivery. You have demonstrated competence in the areas of safety, workforce management, project execution, cost control, quality and administration. Local and/or Canadian construction experience is required. We thank all applicants for their interest in working at Bird Construction; although, only those identified for further consideration will be contacted.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Trufla Technology is first of its kind – a company offering a complete suite of digital solutions for the modern insurance brokerage. From SEO and web design, to lead management, branded customer service and API’s, Trufla provides a 360° digital strategy for brokerages and reimagines the way their customers interact with insurance. Think insurance is boring? Think again. We have also reimagined what an office should be. Did you know the average person spends around 2,000 at work every year? That’s crazy and probably more time than you spend in any other area of your life. We wanted to make time at Trufla awesome. Our office space already kicks ass, but we still added a few perks: Ping-pong (for exercise) Craft soda on tap (on Fridays we add ice cream=floats) Massage chairs (the super-deluxe good ones) Flexible schedule (because life) Staff vacay (5 star of course – last year’s pool party in Mexico was epic)  Project Manager As a Project Manager, you will need to work closely with the team on delivery of projects. We are looking for an individual who takes pride in their work and has excellent organizational and time management skills. Being able to balance many competing priorities is an asset. Our ideal candidate must understand the value of communicating effectively. As a project manager, you will need to facilitate discussions across various groups to ensure that projects are kept on track and delivered on or preferably before the deadline. We are seeking out someone who is excited to bring innovative and solutions-based thinking to a growing organization. If you are passionate about customer service and it’s important for you to be a part of a team that is focused on providing exceptional support to internal and external clients, then this is a great role for you. It’s important to us that you are driven to meet deadlines, and that you flourish in an environment that is fast-paced. The position can be a stepping stone to bigger and better opportunities as we are a company that you can continually grow with. Job Description: Manage the execution of all website projects, large and small, ensuring that projects are executed on time and on budget Create and manage work back schedules Coordinate communications and status meeting between all internal and external stakeholders on projects Responsible for managing the execution and completion of all tasks related to website maintenance agreements Support the finding and management of contractors for projects Create training manuals and train clients on updating their websites Perform thorough QA reviews of all deliverables prior to releasing to clients Constantly monitor new industry trends and tools that can be leveraged by Trufla and educate the team on these trends and changes Help to continually evolve and improve internal processes to ensure quality and efficiency standards are maintained Support the ongoing business development efforts with website audits and estimation of potential projects  Qualifications & Competencies: Diploma or degree in Marketing, Public Relations, Management, Commerce or Business administration or equivalent work experience PMP or working towards obtaining it is considered an asset 2+ years of experience, preferably within a marketing agency, technology company or professional services firm Strong understanding of the process and steps required to deliver high quality websites and digital projects Exceptional organization and time management skills Must have good knowledge and experience in Microsoft Office Suite: PowerPoint, Excel, Word and Outlook Professional and concise communicator, able to clearly articulate your thoughts in conversations, email and presentations

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Are you looking for an engineering consulting firm where you can fulfill your professional and personal goals? GCM is a workplace where you can meet challenges and surpass them, independently and as part of a team. We provide a work environment that respects the individual and their family life.With more than 300 professionals, we are working in many industrial sectors across Canada. Are you a professional, who is passionate and creative? Take the opportunity to join our team by, submitting your application now. The Major Projects Group at GCM is looking for exceptional people to enhance his team.Main FunctionsIdentify client needs and define engineering mandatesPlan work activities, resources, engineering budgets and draft project execution plansMonitor and control project activities including cost and scheduleCoordinate the preparation, issuance and quality of deliverables (reports, technical drawings, cost estimates, procurement recommendations and installation specifications)Ensure coordination between the project team,client and the relationship with the clientManage changes (technical, cost, or schedule)RequirementsEducation: Engineering Bachelor’s DegreeBetween 5 to 12 years of experience in project managementKnowledge and understanding of project management as well as monitoring and controlRelevant experience in a consulting firm and heavy industries: metallurgy, refining, chemical or petrochemicalPMP Certification (optional)Able to manage a portfolio of projects.Able to work on short execution projects (6 to 12 weeks) with tight budget in a brownfield environmentProficiency in English (spoken and written), knowledge of French an assetDescription of qualificationsUnderstanding of technical issues in all disciplinesExcellent communication skills with the internal team and with clientsInspiring, motivating, positive, and constructive leadershipDemonstrate professionaljudgement when taking decisionsAbility to manage a completeproject with energy (resources, technical, business aspects)Understand, anticipate and manage important strategic issuesJob Types: Full-time, Permanent

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Job Title: Project Manager Based at: JRS Calgary Reports to: Calgary Branch Manager, JRS Engineering Job Purpose: To manage projects and develop new clients for the Calgary office  At JRS Engineering (JRS), we understand the right people can ensure a company’s success. We believe our team members are the most important part of our business. Our cooperative culture helps deliver the superior service and quality results our clients have come to expect. JRS’s mission is to lead our profession by consistently delivering high quality service, maintaining and cultivating our technical knowledge, and valuing our clients’ goals.  We are seeking analytical thinkers with experience and education in the building industry that have an aptitude for technical problem solving balanced by aesthetic sensitivity. The Project Manager role includes providing guidance to other team members in production of design documentation and implementation of designs during construction, as well as the ability to perform the work independently as required to meet deadlines. It also includes leading investigation and analysis of failed existing building envelope systems and construction site testing. Collaboration will be required with other team members including architects, owners, and contractors to ensure that their expectations and needs are understood and managed. Business development is also a key component of the role, by developing new work with both existing and new clients. The ability to understand potential opportunities in the industry, and how to best serve our clients, is required.  Technical knowledge of waterproofing, roofing, and building science fundamentals are needed. Professional development courses and seminars will supplement this.  Key Responsibilities: Managing client expectations and deliverables. Monitoring assigned resources for compliance with scope and budget Managing team expectations / timelines Reviewing past project performance with other project team members Reporting to principal in charge / project professional of record Maintaining full knowledge of the scope of work / scope of services Maintaining awareness of the project team’s activities and project status Advising client(s) of required changes in services/scope Communicating assignments, tasks and deadlines to all staff Reviewing project and assignments with staff to ensure accuracy and schedules Reviewing monthly project billing to analyze billed services and to ensure profitability and accounts are up to date Coordinating internal reviews in accordance with latest policies and practices Reporting possible changes in scope and risk issues to principal in charge / project professional of record Identifying potential issues (scope or construction) for discussion with team or principal(s) Ensuring services are compliant with scope and current JRS company standards and procedures Candidate Skills/Qualities: Independent worker; strong time management skills and works well in a team Excellent client management and people skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience working with contractors, architects and consultants A degree in construction management, engineering, architecture or similar field 5 years’ minimum experience in the building industry, preferably with direct experience in roofing, cladding, waterproofing and fenestration A solid understanding of building science, including energy-related issues Strong attention to detail Able to manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously Interest in participating in marketing activities Seattle-area experience is a plus Must have a reliable vehicle and a valid Alberta driver’s license. Join us today and grow your potential alongside our own. JRS offers competitive compensation based on experience, full benefits, and support for continuing education. To apply, please send your resume to hr@jrsengineering.com. Applications must have Project Manager – CG in the subject line. We thank all applicants, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please. No recruiters please.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Requisition Id: 15284 Department: Operations Engineering Department Summary of Responsibilities Pembina is seeking an Engineer, Projects to join our Conventional Business Unit (CBU) in Calgary, Alberta. Reporting to the Supervisor, Project Engineering (Operations), this position’s responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Development of PMO (Project Management Office) documents as required; Liaising with and coordinating project stakeholders to manage project scope, timing, resourcing, and execution; Working with the engineering team to coordinate the delivery of technical deliverables; Working with the SCM (Supply Chain Management) team to coordinate procurement and contracts as necessary for successful project execution; Working with the Pembina commissioning and Operations teams as necessary to ensure the project is appropriately commissioned and turned over; Working with the Pembina document control team to ensure all project deliverables are appropriately numbered, compiled and available for turnover to close out the project; Maintaining appropriate cost control and schedule to ensure successful project management and forecasting are in place; Coordinate and manage as necessary to establish construction contracts, construction supervisors, EHS professionals and other support staff as necessary to ensure successful field execution of the project; Coordinate as necessary with SPCC (Sherwood Park Control Center) and SCADA to coordinate commissioning activities, shutdown activities and other non-routine events as necessary for successful project execution; Consult and coordinate as necessary with the Pembina LARE (Land, Aboriginal, Regulatory, and Environmental) group; and Other general coordination duties as required to ensure the necessary stakeholders are considered as part of the project. Qualifications Preferred candidate would have at least 10 years of combined construction and engineering project experience with either a P.Eng. or CET designation; A background in the mechanical trades is a definite asset; Demonstrated experience in project coordination between design engineering, field execution teams, commissioning teams and Code inspectors; Previous EPC design experience is a definite asset; and Fluent in the tools of project management including cost control, scheduling, contracts, execution planning and project closeout. No agency calls please. Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. >

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: ABOUT US Aecon Group Inc. is Canada’s largest, publicly traded construction and infrastructure development company. Aecon and its subsidiaries provide services to private and public sector clients throughout Canada and on a selected basis internationally. Aecon Energy offers a suite of unparalleled services to some of Canada’s largest energy suppliers, providing best-in-class solutions to the oil and gas, nuclear, co-generation, and renewable sectors.  PURPOSE OF THE POSITION Reporting to the General Manager, the Project Manager will be responsible for the operational and financial performance of a designated region. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES • Responsible for the financial performance of a designated region. • Management of financial performance to ensure business plans targets are being met• Reports issues to Operations Manager regarding financial performance, workload status, potential legal issues and potential opportunities • Resolves project-level legal disputes and escalates issues to Manager• Puts in place a management team with clearly defined responsibilities covering all aspects of the operation. • Prepares staff development and succession plans for key positions in the department • Approves all expenditures and proposal pricing within limits of authority • Maintains personal contact with major clients and unions • Ensures that all activity in the designated regions is consistent with corporate and divisional strategic plans, business plans, policies and procedures KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS • Education to include a four-year engineering degree, technical college diploma or combination of technical training and/or related experience • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a Project Manager role • Experience in the Utility Contracting Industry • Electrical experience is considered an asset • Proven leadership, communication and negotiation skills• Ability to resolve project disputes with minimal assistance • Ability to Inspire and foster an environment of cooperation between different departments and co-workers • Availability to travel between all Utilities yards• Sound computer skills – MS Excel / Lotus, MS Word and MS Project • Self-motivated with good organizational skills • Ability to work independently, accurately and under pressure • Ability to see a task from conception to implementation • Adaptable to flexible work schedule when required to meet deadlines

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Our Client is looking for a Project Manager to join it’s team.   Key Skills  Must possess strong team leadership, communication and interpersonal skills. Oil and Gas experience is required. Business Development skills are highly valued. EPCM environment Broad knowledge of Engineering discipline functions Project Controls (Cost & Schedule) Special Experience  Broad experience in Oil and natural gas processing facilities including: Oil Batteries Multi-Well Tie-Ins Major Processing Plant experience such as Sulphur processing, crude oil upgrading and refinery experience. Understanding of Regulatory Processes (Western Canada & NEB) Experience in project planning & execution of FEED & Detailed Engineering phases. Technical Responsibilities  The project manager is responsible to ensure successful execution of Gas and Oil projects including facilities, pipelines, and plant modifications. Ongoing client liaison and communication throughout the project will be required. The ability to develop a rapport and a strong working relationship with the client is critical. The Project Manager will lead the communication with the EPCM discipline engineering team to ensure successful project execution. He/ she will run regular project specific meetings and be the driver of the overall project. The Project Manager will be accountable to lead his / her team of project and discipline engineers and will be ultimately responsible for success in terms of cost, quality, schedule and HSE. Growth through repeat business and generation of new business is encouraged and rewarded. Education and Qualifications  Successful candidate will be a Canadian Registered Professional Engineer (P. Eng.) Chemical or Mechanical Engineering degree preferred. Minimum 10 + years Natural Oil and Gas experience with at least 8 years EPCM background. PMP designation is an asset

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Do you enjoy working in a dynamic, high energy environment, and feed off the energy that comes from collective success? Do you thrive on creating order from chaos, and derive energy from helping teams work seamlessly together? Do you have experience working in project management role in a communications, marketing or digital agency environment? Edelman would love to get to know you! We are seeking a talented project manager in our Calgary office. The Project Manager will be responsible for managing a variety of both niche and integrated projects on a number of significant accounts. Edelman has evolved in Canada from its legacy as solely a PR agency to an integrated agency with specialties like Insights & Analytics, Paid Media, Planning & Creative and Digital Marketing. This evolution has led to both integrated AOR mandates with large Canadian brands and the awards to match from Cannes, CMAs, Strategy and the like, all wrapped in a culture that’s been awarded one of Canada’s Top 25 Great Places To Work. Responsibilities:  Manage large to complex scale programs – across geographies and within the digital, experiential and communications space – including estimating, identification of tasks, activities, and deliverable milestones as well as the documentation of the resulting plan. Work in partnership with the account lead and clients to onboard new projects, clarify their scopes and identify appropriate resources that match the right skills to the task at hand. Provide solid recommendations on timelines and budgets. Partner with other members of the national project management group, collaborating across geographies to instill project management best practices within the Edelman Canada network. Ensure projects are tracking on time, within scope and on budget. Report on project financials to account lead and senior leadership. Identify areas of potential risk as well as identify and implement risk mitigation strategies on all assigned projects. Work with project team to understand and manage expectations of both internal and external clients at the project level. Communicate potential variances upstream through senior team in timely fashion. Work with the Edelman team and with various client team members to prioritize and reconcile competing demands (resourcing, budgeting, etc.) to meet Edelman and client business needs. Identify and establish project management best practices on your accounts, and drive collaboration across specialty teams and offices. Proactively suggest new ways to streamline processes. Develop project status reports and workbacks. Run status report meetings with the team. Serve as primary escalation point for project issues that may impact the client. Work with the project team to identify options for resolution and communicate those options upstream. Attend client kick off and status meetings and participate in scoping meetings. Communicate meeting objectives to project team members, ensuring efficient scheduling and appropriate agenda and recap documentation standards are met. Actively support new business activities. Demonstrate creative problem solving and conceptual thinking on client programs and projects. Work as a strong "team player" and serve as role model to more junior team members. Live the Edelman values (the relentless pursuit of excellence, freedom to be constantly curious and courage to do the right thing).   Qualifications:  5+ years of related experience in project management; ideally from a digital, PR, marketing or advertising agency. Experience in client service and day-to-day client contact. A demonstrated ability to address client concerns thoughtfully and effectively. Ability to manage project budgets, and experience adapting to budgeting software. A demonstrated track record of developing and executing successful projects. Experience with effectively delegating and/or executing many tactical assignments and accurately judging and reviewing the work of junior staff. Creative and innovative approach to problem solving. Exceptional written and presentation skills. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is an asset. Should you be interested in applying for this role, please send your résumé and cover letter. Only those candidates short listed for an interview will be contacted. Thank you for your interest in working with Edelman.  About Us  Edelman is a leading global communications marketing firm that partners with many of the world’s largest and emerging businesses and organizations, helping them evolve, promote and protect their brands and reputations. Edelman was awarded the Grand Prix Cannes Lion for PR in 2014; six Cannes Lions in 2015; and the Grand Prix in the Titanium category in 2016. The firm was named “2016 Global Agency of the Year” by the Holmes Report, and one of Advertising Age’s “Agencies to Watch” in 2014. In 2015, Edelman was among Glassdoor’s “Best Places to Work” for the fifth time. Edelman owns specialty firms Edelman Intelligence (research) and United Entertainment Group (entertainment, sports, experiential), a joint venture with United Talent Agency. Visit http://www.edelman.com for more information.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Who we’re looking for: The Project Manager is responsible for delivering solutions, according to defined timeline, scope and budget, within a cross functional global team. Strong communication and relationship building skills are a must in this role – you will need to apply your technical and managerial skills to successfully complete the project objectives with your team, whether they are digital, traditional or a combination of the two.What you will be doing: Develop and maintain a project schedule to define activities, sequence, dependencies, work effort and durationMonitor and control key parameters (budget, scope, resources, risk, schedule) while maintaining quality standards on all deliverablesIdentify and manage project resources in collaboration with the Account ManagerEffectively understand and communicate client business requirements to your project teamDevelop, maintain and execute project plans throughout the defined project lifecyclePlan and manage all project communications within the teamWhat we need from you: 4-6 years of experience in interactive project management – digital and traditional experience preferredPrevious agency experience a strong assetDetail oriented, extremely organized, and possesses excellent communication, analytical and presentation skillsKnowledge and familiarity with digital marketing strategiesThe ability to manage a multi-disciplined, collaborative team and communicate complex and interconnected workflowsExcellent networking and liaison skills with demonstrated client management skillsDemonstrated ability to effectively manage global teams and client project budgetsPrior experience in marketing/communications preferredWho AdFarm is: We help businesses talk to agricultural, agribusiness and rural audiences in a way that makes sense. In order to succeed, AdFarmers need to understand the farm audience better than any other communications company. We do this by driving deeper.AdFarm intends to be a catalyst for the advancement of agriculture so we continue to unearth ideas that help us understand farmers and the factors that influence their buying decisions. This knowledge helps us craft messages that persuade, attract and intrigue farmers.The six AdFarm offices are based in Calgary, AB; Guelph, ON; Fargo, ND; Kansas City, MO and Sacramento, CAJob Type: Full-timeExperience:Project Management: 4 yearsEducation:AssociateLicence:Project Management Certificate

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: The Opportunity: Equinox Engineering Ltd. is a private Canadian company located in Calgary, Alberta. We provide high quality Engineering, Procurement and Construction Management (EPCM) services to our clients in Canada and worldwide.  Equinox was incorporated in 1997, and has operating centers in Calgary (Canada), Brisbane (Australia) and Mumbai (India). Equinox executes facility and pipeline projects in natural gas, conventional oil and heavy oil markets.  Key Skills  Must possess strong team leadership, communication and interpersonal skills. Oil and Gas experience is required. Business Development skills are highly valued. EPCM environment Broad knowledge of Engineering discipline functions Project Controls (Cost & Schedule) Special Experience  Broad experience in Oil and natural gas processing facilities including: Oil Batteries Multi-Well Tie-Ins Major Processing Plant experience such as Sulphur processing, crude oil upgrading and refinery experience. Understanding of Regulatory Processes (Western Canada & NEB) Experience in project planning & execution of FEED & Detailed Engineering phases. Technical Responsibilities   The project manager is responsible to ensure successful execution of Gas and Oil projects including facilities, pipelines, and plant modifications. Ongoing client liaison and communication throughout the project will be required. The ability to develop a rapport and a strong working relationship with the client is critical. The Project Manager will lead the communication with the EPCM discipline engineering team to ensure successful project execution. He/ she will run regular project specific meetings and be the driver of the overall project. The Project Manager will be accountable to lead his / her team of project and discipline engineers and will be ultimately responsible for success in terms of cost, quality, schedule and HSE. Growth through repeat business and generation of new business is encouraged and rewarded. Education and Qualifications  Successful candidate will be a Canadian Registered Professional Engineer (P. Eng.) Chemical or Mechanical Engineering degree preferred. Minimum 10 + years Natural Oil and Gas experience with at least 8 years EPCM background. PMP designation is an asset  Equinox Success Statement  Equinox believes in providing exceptional service to our clients.  Equinox delivers focused & experienced premium teams customized with the best technical expertise to align with client culture and requirements to ensure successful projects on a repeatable basis

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: At PCL, you are more than just an employee. You could be part of a team that works hard, plays hard, and makes a difference in your community. PCL offers competitive compensation packages, and a chance to be an owner in our 100-percent employee-owned company. We not only reward you financially, but give you challenging assignments and a supportive work environment which promotes personal and professional growth. Whether you are looking for a corporate or construction career, exciting opportunities are waiting for you. Our people have helped us stand out as a leading general contracting organization, which is why we are always looking for new talent-individuals who can bring innovative solutions and thinking to every project. Due to newly awarded projects, we are seeking an experienced Project Manager for our Calgary District office located in Calgary, Alberta. Responsibilities: Oversee total effort to ensure project is constructed in accordance with design, budget, schedule and quality Manage project performance, schedule and resources Work as part of a team to meet project requirements Assist in developing and monitoring project specific quality plans Understand and actively manage client expectations and contract Interface and manage relationships with project team, client representative, consultants, and trade contractors Create and influence safety culture through mentorship and modelling Mentor, coach, supervise and assess performance of direct reports and other team members Develop and oversee project closeout and commissioning plan Understand, communicate and proactively manage contract; resolves disputes Stay current with industry practices; seek new and innovative construction methods Develop the project execution plan with the superintendent Negotiate and issue subcontracts and major purchase orders; monitor their progress and schedule  Qualifications: A minimum of 7 years' progressive construction experience with a general contractor, leading up to a project manager role Post-secondary education/training in engineering, construction management or a related discipline In-depth knowledge of the construction industry and company operations, specifically construction specifications, building materials, methods, procedures, HSE and quality management practices Experience in all phases of construction projects Experience managing multiple projects and project teams, including schedule and financials Ability to establish and maintain strong key stakeholder relationships Proficiency using Microsoft Office suite and project management, schedule and estimating software Ability to identify and manage risk and opportunities on construction projects Strong planning, organization and time management skills Strong problem-solving and decision making skills Strong verbal, written,and interpersonal communication skills Ability to be flexible and work in a fast-pace environment Local market experience is an asset Preference will be given to candidates with experience in design-build, health care, or research facility projects The PCL family of companies are consistently ranked among the best companies to work for, and we aspire to be the most respected builder, renowned for excellence, leadership, and unsurpassed value. We thank all applicants for their interest in working for PCL; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Let us help you build your Legacy today.

Title: PROJECT MANAGER
Job_Description: This position is for someone who is mature, organized, enjoys people, and has a drive for success in any project they pursue. If this is you, you will also have a Bachelor of Science (preferably in Engineering), a CET or PMP designation and a minimum of five years of construction and/or development experience. You must have intermediate proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and Microsoft Project. Senior management experience with strengths in leadership and stakeholder engagement is essential. In addition, you are someone who is recognized for success in coordinating and implementing integrated initiatives involving multiple partners. Finally, your interpersonal skills, integrity, and drive for results give you the edge in collaboration and consensus building with our client groups.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: As a Project Manager at Executive Millwork you will:  Create shop drawings for production with a lean design from architectural plans. Manage multiple projects ranging from $30,000 to +$1,000,000 from kickoff to completion. Work with a team to manage project scope, constructability, budgets, materials, progress, reviews, costs, risk management and quality throughout the project. Further Executive Millworks’ continuous improvement initiative by in-depth involvement with our target value design culture Build positive business relationships with customers during site visits and in-house team work. Administer project tasks such as schedule of values, change orders and invoices. To join the EMI team the following qualifications are required:  Proven drafting and project management experience with an ability to maintain good quality control while working on multiple projects. 5 years of construction and commercial millwork experience. Solid technical knowledge of millwork, construction details and drawing interpretation. Strong organization, time management, problem solving and decision making abilities. Demonstrated skills in leadership. Trustworthy, reliable, self-motivated and passionate at delivering high quality in every aspect.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Immediately hiring for project manager who has minimum 5 years hands on experience in commercial glass and glazing plus 5 year commercial glass and glazing project management experience. Read and interpret architectural drawings well, Read and interpret shop drawings well, able to schedule job files, ordering products and materials(Glass, hardware, flashing etc)for projects. Extremely accurate with measuring projects. Good coordinating skills and work under pressure. Good customer services and communication skills. If you are have all above skills please apply with confidence. This job is permanent and full. We offer very competitive wage with good group benefits. Only qualified applications will be contacted.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Project Management: 5 yearsEducation:AssociateLocation:Calgary, ABLicence:driver's licence and a red seal journeyman certificationLanguage:English

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: This position will support Hitachi ID Systems in achieving its strategic goals as the Company is experiencing high demand for its innovative identity management solutions. We are looking for full time solution delivery professionals to assist customers with deployments and project management for its software products. As a member of the global Hitachi family, you will receive competitive pay, excellent benefits and career growth opportunities.  Responsibilities: Facilitate communication between customer, Account Manager and technical staff on project team. Work with Technical Architect and PM Lead to create the statement of work and project plan. Manage various project-related artifacts (i.e. project calendar, meeting schedules, delivery of documents). Ensure project team adheres to internal solution delivery methodology and follows strict change control procedures. Organize and maintain project schedule, time lines and ensure that milestones are met. Provide timely responses to customer requests. Help mitigate risk and manage customer expectations. Qualifications: A successful candidate must have: A bachelor's degree from an accredited university, preferably in a technical discipline. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, high energy and the ability to work within a team. Excellent organizational and time management skills. Strong technical skills associated with network technology and web based applications. 2-5 years of pertinent experience. Compensation/ benefits: Competitive salary. Extensive health benefits paid by the employer. RRSP and bonus plans. Paid vacation. Flexible work hours. Informal and rewarding work environment staffed with IT experts. Be part of a growing, stable company with a great reputation. Hitachi ID Systems is an equal opportunity employer. Together we succeed. Location: Calgary, Canada To apply: Send a resume by e-mail to jobs@Hitachi-ID.com. Be sure to include both "Job ID 999-13" in the subject line. E-mails that do not include this will not be delivered to the appropriate person. For technical positions, the resume must be either ASCII text or in PDF format. For other positions, MS-Word is also acceptable.  Qualified applicants will be contacted within two weeks for a preliminary phone interview. Successful applicants will be invited to return for a second interview and a skills evaluation.

Title: Procurement PMO Specialist
Job_Description: Global procurement position Work with a dynamic team of procurement specialists Permanent role based in Montreal About the role We are looking for a Procurement PMO Specialist to manage Rio Tinto’s supplier outline agreements ensuring they are regularly updated, stored in the central repository system and easily assessable for reporting purposes. Another key component to this role will be the requirement to provide efficient/accurate analytics on products/services spend so that the business is able to make informed decisions minimising wastage, reducing cycle times and finding cost saving opportunities. This role is a great opportunity for someone who has strong category management/procurement reporting experience, is confident in the use of SAP and Ariba and has strong analytical skills to present meaningful data interpretation.  Reporting to the Manager - Mining Equipment, you will be: Develop a Project Management Office (PMO) for reporting across all procurement projects. Streamline the reporting and the procurement process to ensure that the procurement managers have more time to spend on driving value creation rather than on reporting Regularly engage with the business on all procurement projects to ensure the Ariba system is up to date/stored with the current supplier outline agreements Extract spend, cost saving and sourcing data. Then, manipulating and interpreting the data to present business recommendations Coordinate and consolidate information from the contracts to provide actionable reports Establish reporting protocols and work with the team to suggest process/system improvements  About you  To be successfully considered for this role, you will have: Strong analytical skills to dissect complex data and provide meaningful interpretation that present compelling case for improvements Previous experience in procurement/category management reporting Confident use in SAP and Ariba (including navigation and extracting accurate/relevant reports) A good threshold to work in a face pace environment with conflicting priorities Where you will be working Rio Tinto Procurement provides supply chain services that deliver value to the Rio Tinto Group through the strategic sourcing and buying of goods and services for all operations and businesses. Playing a fundamental role, value is achieved through uniformed processes, e-technology, increased corporate social responsibility and measurable savings for the Group.  About us  As pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress.  Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents. Aluminium and copper, diamonds, gold and industrial minerals, iron ore, coal and uranium: our materials make up the world around us. You’ll find them in smartphones, planes, cars, hospitals and throughout your home.  Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce  We are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organization and fulfilling career.  So if this sounds like you and the opportunity you are looking for, apply now.  Please note, in order to be successfully considered for this role you must complete all pre-screening questions.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: LW Survey Canada is an industry leading Geomatics provider to the energy industry. Title: Project Manager/Business Analyst /Accounting System Speciali...
Job_Description: ICE®is a dynamic software company based in Calgary, offering one of the most unique and exciting work atmospheres to be found between Barlow Trail, 52 St, Glenmore and 60 St! We are currently looking for a Project Manager/Business Analyst /Accounting System Specialist......or a P.M.B.A.A.S.S...ha...jeez that might not work.....OK.....actually....... we are just looking for smart motivated people in Calgary that don’t mind being called an ICEcube or DIRTTbag! Please quote the position title in your subject line.No direct phone calls or in person visits please. DIRTT is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Key responsibilities include: Lead project management of various Access Improvement initiatives from requirements identification, design, planning, implementation, change management, and performance evaluation . Determine the scope, approach, best practices, and deliverables. Develop detailed project plans and track progress. Title: Project Manager, Senior
Job_Description: AECOM is seeking a Senior Project Manager to be based at our Calgary, Alberta office location. Please note, this position is also site-based at times.  This position is responsible for the overall operation of a project/contract to include the safety and wellbeing of its employees, safeguarding company funds and property, and generally represents the company with respect to the client. Project Managers complete projects to the satisfaction of the client, consistent with cost, schedule and contractual requirements. They ensure that established company goals are realized while maintaining client relations that will enhance future business.  May include the following responsibilities: Leadership_  + Demonstrates leadership by example with integrity and candor.  + Leads project proposal efforts for small and mid-size projects.  + Exhibits confidence and positive attitude about the project and the Company.  + Demonstrates strong interpersonal skills (e.g. conflict resolution, team builder).  + Prepares the next generation of Project Managers and leaders by providing opportunities and through networking and mentoring.  Judgment & Management of Project Risk_  + Consistently demonstrates the ability to proactively identify potential project problems or opportunities, analyze the issues using all appropriate resources, develop alternatives, and arrive at the most optimum approach to mitigate problems or exploit opportunities.  Organizational Skills_  + Demonstrates knowledge of resources and capabilities of other Groups for appropriate incorporation into project organization.  Execution Planning_  + Understands and executes the project, employing the Project Execution Plan developed in the proposal stage and expanding it to be effective and in compliance with requirements for each project phase.  + Establishes, tracks and reports status against key performance indicators or contractual metrics on a routine basis.  + Participates in the establishment of project organizational structure in support of proposal efforts.  + Capable of developing and taking responsibility for the Project Execution Plan development for small and/or medium size projects.  Contracts_  + Participates in contract negotiations.  Client Relationship_  + Clearly understands the scope of work and contract requirements or those requirements that pertain to his/her area of responsibility.  Negotiation_  + Participates with BD and BU management in assessment, strategic development, and negotiations with customers.  + May serve as the Proposal Manager of a medium to large-sized project.  Presentation Skills_  + Supports or conducts formal presentations to clients and/or management.  Minimum Requirements  Education: _  + Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Construction Management, Project Management, Facility Management or other relevant discipline  + Demonstrated equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.  Experience: _  + Entrants to this position require 12 years engineering, operations/maintenance, M&O;, construction, project controls, and/or procurement experience.  + Has a record of proven performance as Project Manager on previous project(s).  + Capable of performing as the highest project lead on a medium-risk, medium-complexity project.  + Capable of successfully performing on a $100 million project/contract.  Preferred Qualifications  N/A  What We Offer  AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E; is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees.  _NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.

Title: IT PROJECT MANAGER - TERMS
Job_Description: The City of Airdrie fosters a culture of accountability and values open dialogue, innovation and entrepreneurial spirit, collaborative relationships, learning, ownership, and encouraging the heart. We are searching for another team member who will help us get to the next level. We Are: Were a place where you can grow. Were a place where youre encouraged to learn and be innovative. Were a place where people take ownership and do what they say theyll do. Were a place where colleagues are friends and neighbours are customers. Were a place where health, wellness and safety are top of mind. Were a place where you just might be a perfect fit. Our Team: To be creative enablers of technology solutions and implementation resulting in improved efficiency and effectiveness of our customers. Train and support our customers in optimizing technology resulting in a highly-trained workforce.  As part of the IT Emerging Solutions department, this position will lead Business Technology projects throughout the project lifecycle. The prime requirement of this position is to provide project teams and stakeholders with consistent structure, methods, techniques and tools to successfully complete a project within a given timeframe, cost and scope while achieving the project objectives and goals. This position promotes project management awareness, leadership, functional consultation and guidance in the use of the corporate project management methodology and tools, and actively participates in continuous improvement to the process. The Opportunity: Lead multidisciplinary project teams throughout the project lifecycle and achieve the project objectives within the constraints of time, scope and cost.  Completion of project methods and processes including, but not limited to: Joint project planning meetingsDevelopment of proposals, charters, plans, schedules (i.e. task definition, time estimates and resource assignments) and the day to day execution of the projectProject budget managementManaging the closeout activities and completing closeout reports Ensuring project control processes are utilized such as: Tracking, monitoring and communicating project progress against the project planTracking issues, decision requests and change requests from identification through to resolutionIdentifying the impact to project scope, budget, resource requirements, timelines, etc. when changes are introduced Regular interaction and communication with stakeholders including management, project sponsors, Portfolio Management Office (PMO), and the Senior Leadership Team (SLT) which could include written and verbal progress reports and presentations  Ensuring the mechanisms for quality control are applied within projects, providing a neutral perspective and consistency of approach  Demonstrated commitment to continuous improvement of the IT Project Management Methodology by providing assistance, feedback and support for the Portfolio Management Office (PMO) You Bring: A Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or equivalent  Formal training in a recognized project management methodology  Formal training in a recognized change management methodology is an asset  Minimum of 5 years progressive experience in managing business technology projects of a large and complex nature  Ability to work independently with minimal supervision in a team environment, demonstrating sound judgment and initiative to establish priorities, meet client expectations and deadlines  Strong team leadership and ability to lead project teams to a specific goal  Strong ability to negotiate and influence, within the department, within the organization and with external vendors/suppliers  Strong communication and presentation skills, both oral and written, demonstrating tact and diplomacy in order to establish effective working relationships with external and internal stakeholders  Ability to formulate and coordinate plans for a variety of projects, sometimes concurrently  Strong problem solving, decision making and conflict resolution skills  Ability to quickly align with shifting priorities, work assignments and timelines We Offer: Along with a competitive compensation program and City paid health and dental premiums, our employees also enjoy:   Excellent health, dental, paramedical, and benefits plan  First-in-class pension plan  Career development and tuition reimbursement  Employee discounts, gym membership, social events, and health & wellness initiatives  Continuous learning through training and development is encouraged as are flexible work arrangements, when possible. We recognize that our people work best when they feel engaged in their environment and appreciated for their efforts and our overall benefits package reflects that. Additional Information: We are looking to fill 2 full time (37.5 hours per week) term positions. The terms are for 1 year with the possibility of an extension to 18 months.  A cover letter is required with all applications expressing your interest in the position, what you can bring to the job and how you meet the experience requirements.  Please upload evidence of formal training in a recognized project management methodology (for example: PMP or Prince2) Next Steps:  Candidates are invited to apply online. Postings close at 9 p.m. on the closing date listed in the posting. We recommend applying as soon as possible as we are not able to accept late applications. Please review the job competition carefully and be sure to attach any specifically requested documentation in the My Documents section of your application.  Thank you for your interest in the City of Airdrie.

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Title Senior Project Manager  Location Calgary, AB  Job Information Reporting to Manager of Project Management, the Senior Project Manager will support Whissell’s vision, mission, S.P.I.R.I.T of values and three daily pillars of safety, quality and efficiency. Working closely with the Regional Operations Manager and a Project Coordinator, the Senior Project Manager will manage site level activities as well as provide direction, coordination, control and completion of assigned projects by coordinating with both field level personnel (including Superintendents) and at the head office. The duties and responsibilities of the Project Manager may be adjusted to meet specific jobsite requirements. If the project is staffed with a Project Coordinator some of the above duties may be delegated to the Project Coordinator however, the Project Manager will still be responsible for the competent performance of all such duties. Core Responsibilities: Duties and Required Skills Act as the focal point for managing multiple projects across multiple clients, and interact with the Technical Leads/Managers, Customer, and Project Team to resolve any emerging issues Oversee and manage construction projects including the development of work plans, schedules, budgets, manpower and equipment needs Scheduling of internal pre-commencement meeting to review project specifications, bid and establish construction approach and manage permit and approvals acquisition, safety and environmental compliance Lead the development of project master CPM schedules Respond to RFP’s, create statement of works (SOW’s) and Project Change Notices for the client on behalf of the Project teams Ensure projects are executed, controlled and monitored to result in on-time, on-budget delivery, at a quality level satisfying requirements and client expectations Ensure scope changes are proactively identified and successfully negotiated with the customer Supervise and control the execution of the construction, including the fiscal and administrative functions of the project Supervise and manage project team Establish and maintain a professional relationship with the Owner, Project Engineers, local businesses, and police and fire departments Ensure strict adherence to contract specifications Compile and track quantities and costs; document, plan revisions, change notices, change orders, and all other paperwork required on the project Control purchasing, procurement, and subcontract management Plan and maintain ongoing material and resources requirements with Superintendent Coordinate and document inspections with owner representatives and Superintendent on completed work including CCC and FAC Comply with Whissell and local Occupational Health and Safety regulations Identify any additional work opportunities on the site and with the Regional Operations Manager Essential Qualifications: Eng, CET or 10+ years related industry experience or combination Ability to read and understand blueprints, specifications, schedules and costing reports Thorough understanding of construction process, environmental regulations and safety practices Self-motivated with strong time management skills Previous experience using B2W software an asset PLEASE NOTE: All Whissell employees are required to pass a Pre-Employment Drug & Alcohol Test and provide a valid Driver’s Abstract (no more than three months old) prior to starting work. To apply, email resume to careers@whissell.ca or fax to 403.236.8834, Attn: Human Resources. Whissell Contracting Ltd. would like to thank all applicants for their submissions, however, only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. No agencies please.

Title: Project Manager (Civil/Earthworks) - Southern Alberta
Job_Description: Connect with us LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter  Thinking about a change? We recognize that the construction industry is changing at a rapid pace and we continually strive to be at the forefront. Our core values empower people to deliver great careers and develop creative solutions for complex problems on some of the most intricate projects.
