Title: Project Manager (Alberta)
Job_Description: We are looking for an experienced Alberta based Project Manager to join our growing team, and to lead our growth in the Alberta market. Novacom has had a presence in Alberta for 18 years, and due to the rapid growth in volume over the past 4 years we're no longer able to manage this work out of our Vancouver office. This position is more than just a Project Management opportunity, it's a chance to join an established and fast growing company and be a part of building a great Alberta team. The role would be based out of a home office or co-working space, and would be supported by our Vancouver Head Office and our team of Alberta based Site Superintendents. The projects would be located throughout Alberta and Saskatchewan. Novacom is a leading Construction Manager and General Contractor based in Surrey, BC and working throughout Western Canada. We value people, relationships, innovation and culture. We believe in constantly improving ourselves to provide the best possible service to our clients. Our core business is commercial construction and renovations of financial institutions, restaurants, offices and retail spaces. We're doing construction differently, and we're thinking outside the box about how we can improve our company and our industry. If you're looking for a company with a family dynamic where you can have opportunities to grow, be challenged and known by your co-workers, then come join us! Requirements Personal Characteristics:  Driven - self-motivated and driven to push things forward no matter the circumstance Energetic - engaged personality that takes on complex challenges with enthusiasm Independent - ability to communicate effectively with team, but also act authoritatively on your own Humble - willingness to admit when you've made a mistake and take ownership Administrative - ability to track schedules, change orders, field reports, weekly progress reports etc. Financial Focus - desire to meticulously manage project budgets and financial reporting Personable - able to build and maintain solid relationships with vendors and clients Communicator - good at proactively with subtrades and team, strong verbal & written communication skills Organizer- meticulous in site organization Mobile - willing to travel to various sites across Alberta & Saskatchewan for site meetings, visits, interface etc. Qualifications: 5-10 years' experience in the commercial construction field, preferably in a Project Management capacity Construction knowledge - overall understanding of construction process, sequencing, etc. Post-secondary, technical education (BCIT) or similar in a construction or industry-related program Responsibilities: Project Startup - issuing contracts, requesting insurance and bonds, WCB notices, etc. Project Documentation - using Timberline and Microsoft software to manage labour, materials, and equipment, cost coding, submittals, schedules, meeting minutes, change orders, etc. Subtrade/Supplier Management - ability to manage construction subtrades and suppliers, and mitigate issues that may arise in the course of a project Site Superintendent Interface - ability to work in partnership with Site Superintendent to deliver a high quality finished product while managing the schedule and budget Client Interface - meeting with architects, consultants, and clients to manage project issues and maintain positive working relationships Budget Management - continuous monitoring and management of project budget, ability to minimize project costs through inventive methods and regular financial reporting to management Invoicing - preparation of monthly progress claims, review and approval of subtrade and supplier invoices Benefits Salary will be commensurate with experience

Title: Project Management Office (PMO) Manager
Job_Description: Universal Geomatics Solutions Corp. is seeking a PMO Manager to join our team. Location is dependent on the ideal candidate and will be in one of our offices (Calgary, Edmonton, or Grande Prairie).The PMO Manager will be responsible for the supervision of the project management team for all offices. This individual will coordinate the planning, executing, and delivering of projects on time, within budget, and in accordance to specifications. To achieve these important goals, the PMO Manager will define project requirements and scope, acquire project resources, and provide training and guidance to the department.OpportunityOversee the project management department by ensuring operational requirements are met by supervising, mentoring, coordinating, and scheduling activities within the department.Active member of the project management team.Coordinate and work with department manager’s to assign resources to projects based on skill set, client relations, and training opportunities to meet project deliverables.Assist Project Managers with client relationships as required.Provide regular reports to the Vice President of Operations.Ensures adherence to company policies and performance standards and takes corrective action to improve results by counselling and disciplining employees when necessary.Maintain company standards and other associated work instruction documents in accordance with the requirements of the Quality Management System.Ensure all employees are following the proper safety protocol and held accountable for all aspects of the safety program.Perform additional assignments and responsibilities as required.RequirementsUniversity degree in Geomatics, or diploma in a related discipline.Minimum 10 years of direct work experience in project management.Knowledge and understanding of legal and/or construction surveying.Being a Professional Land Surveyor in Alberta is a strong asset.Multiple commissions as a Land Surveyor is also an asset.Demonstrated success in project delivery and execution of project management methods.Superb communication skills; able to build and maintain lasting relationships with business units, corporate departments, key managers, and clients.Highly effective negotiation, diplomatic, and conflict resolutions skills.Strong knowledge of financial management, technology management, and internal controls.Familiar with databases and operating systems.Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills.Company BenefitsOutstanding work environment that fosters safety, encourages teamwork, and challenging work opportunities.Career and personal development opportunities.Comprehensive benefits package, employee assistance program, and RRSP matching.Universal Geomatics Solutions Corp.is an employee-owned, high-performance, progressive consultancy providing comprehensive surveys, geomatics, and project management services to a variety of industries since 1986.At UGSC our people drive us forward. We strive to hire, train, and retain smart, driven individuals. UGSC's diverse work force creates an exciting and dynamic working atmosphere. We empower through education and training, recognize excellence, and challenge each other.Our core purpose is Helping Those Around Us Succeed.Combined with our core values we are an employer of choice. Join our team and see your opportunities made real.We thank you for your interest in Universal Geomatics Solutions Corp., however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:project management: 10 yearsEducation:Associate

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: BE Innovative. BE Influential. BE the Right Partner. Be all that and more at Colliers Project Leaders. Join our team as a Senior Project Manager for Infrastructure Services in Calgary.  At Colliers Project Leaders, we help our clients succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.  In this role, you’ll join our team of experts who lead building and infrastructure projects. Through our Get it Right Solution™, you’ll ensure we get it ready, get it built and get it performing - so investors, owners and occupants are certain of success.  With over 600 employees and 27 + office locations throughout Canada and the Middle East, Colliers Project Leaders offers a multi-cultural, multi-generational work environment where we cultivate excellence, develop leaders and deliver on our clients’ vision. Colliers Project Leaders is part of Colliers International Group Inc. (NASDAQ: CIGI; TSX: CIGI), an industry leading global real estate with more than 16,000 skilled professionals operating in 66 countries. To learn more about Colliers Project Leaders, visit www.colliersprojectleaders.com.  We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team.  Who you are  We’re looking for experienced project managers who are looking for the right opportunity to leverage their strong reputation in the infrastructure services sector into a successful leadership role. You bring a wealth of experience leading projects varying in scope and complexity in the delivery of municipal and infrastructure projects including transportation systems such as roadways, bridges, and transit ways, water and wastewater management, and other horizontal infrastructure projects.  You’re already known as a trusted advisor to your clients and have built strong, lasting relationships with senior leaders. You bring in-depth knowledge and have led and managed complex projects from start to finish – on time and on budget. You also maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients, keeping them in mind for new business and sales opportunities.  Are you looking to build upon your reputation as a project leader to make a difference for new clients and businesses? Look no further.  Responsibilities  What success looks like: You’ve completed a number of municipal and infrastructure projects, varying in size and scope ideally in the relation to transportation systems, water and waste water management and other horizontal infrastructure You work closely with clients in the early conceptual stages of project initiation to ensure a strategic approach to project planning, setup and delivery You are a trusted advisor to the client, applying your understanding of design, construction and operation of horizontal municipal infrastructure Your clients are impressed with your ability to represent their best interests regarding contractual and technical issues Your project teams rely on your ability to manage change, communicate and coordinate between multiple stakeholders, resolve issues, and deliver projects on time and on budget A strong ability to lead the control of project related documents and deliver all work in accordance with company standards and procedures You maintain contact with existing and prospective clients and respond to business development and sales opportunities with support from the Business Development Team, Principal or Regional Vice President Qualifications  What you bring: A university degree or diploma in civil engineering or a related discipline A minimum of 10 to 15 years of experience in project coordination and management, representing owners to multiple stakeholders in the delivery of infrastructure projects for municipalities Strong knowledge of various construction methodologies, project management models and financial management, as well as building codes, contract law and relevant legislation Previous exposure to capital and municipal planning for horizontal infrastructure projects Experience leading or considerably contributing to the preparation of RFP/Q’s, tenders and tender awards Eng. or CET designation required and PMP considered an asset  Bonus skills and experience: Strong leadership and organizational skills with a proven ability to effectively influence others and resolve client, project and technical issues Excellent communication and presentation skills Proficient in MS Project, Title: Senior Project Manager, Engineering- Calgary or Port Coquitl...
Job_Description: Job Description Senior Project Manager, Engineering- Calgary, AB or Port Coquitlam, BC  Position Summary: Reporting to the Director, Engineering, the Senior Project Manager, Engineering is accountable for successful completion of various capital projects while providing technical support and guidance in troubleshooting plant equipment and service issues. Title: Technology Project Manager
Job_Description: DIFFERENT BY DESIGN At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career.  Join the momentum. We are currently seeking a Project Manager for our growing Technology team. MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Driving innovation throughout the firm, our Technology team provides industry-leading solutions that enable MNP to better serve our clients and people. We deliver on the strategic needs of service lines, industry and specialty groups, and operations at all levels throughout the firm. Our specialists develop, enable and support initiatives that allow MNP to deliver client service, collaborate, communicate and operate reliably and efficiently.  RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS Performance Expectations  Develop a project management framework, appropriate for the technology needs of the Firm Coordinate with cross-functional project teams across the organization to plan, coordinate and manage technology projects ranging from software development, implementation and process improvement Collaborate with a variety of stakeholders and other subject matter experts, including the Development team to apply project structure and to drive multiple initiatives forward Create and maintain project documentation, plans, schedules and timelines, facilitate meetings and workshops and communicate project milestone progress on a regular basis Create and maintain formal and informal plans, schedules and timelines including project charter, user manuals and other documentation, as required Manage change in a complex and dynamic environment Balance technology and business issues and communicate appropriately with both technology and business experts Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches in order to improve work processes Manage, mentor, motivate and coach a team of Business Analysts and Quality Assurance Specialists towards professional and personal development by setting clear expectations, providing feedback and addressing performance issues promptly Coordinate resources by managing project performance and ensuring timely execution of deliverables Promote regular attendance, balanced lifestyle and high standard of team wellness Conduct formal, written annual performance reviews Develop a thorough understanding of MNP’s services, businesses and industry Credentials  Completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in Technology or related discipline preferred Minimum of five (5) years of experience in project management in a technology focussed role Proven track record of successful program/project execution Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate teams and influence across organizational boundaries Demonstrated knowledge of modern software development methodologies - Agile/Scrum and Iterative Experience with technology and software development projects in a professional services organization would be considered an asset Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics  Integrity – professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships Energy – displays enthusiasm, optimism, drive and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle Diversity – understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences Communication – effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others Client Service Excellence – understands the importance of quality client service by being courteous, responding to client requests in a timely manner and monitoring satisfaction Teamwork & Relationship Development – works collaboratively with team members in order to achieve a common goal and develops, maintains and strengthens relationships with others, both inside and outside the Firm Accountability – takes responsibility for one’s own performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals; is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making Flexibility – effectively manages multiple assignments, adapts to changing priorities and is able to work independently or as part of a team TOTAL REWARDS MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events and professional development assistance.  MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world.  #LI-LL1

Title: Project Manager - Midstream Gas Program
Job_Description: Reporting to the Director of Operations – Western Canada, the Midstream Gas Program Project Manager position will involve the below three distinct responsibilities, each relating to SNC-Lavalin’s strategic plan of increasing the company’s share of the Midstream EP, EPCM, & EPC market within the Midstream Gas market in Canada.  Responsibilities  Project Manager (75% of time) - Responsible for the full execution of the feed / detailed engineering / construction phases of gas compression projects in Western Canada. Direct the efforts of the full engineering, procurement, construction management, and commissioning team in creating the execution plans, organization, and contracts needed to deliver the project within the stated cost and schedule. Continue to build a positive relationship with highly important & strategic clients who have significant future work in the area. Full project accountability that is monitored through monthly reporting to the project sponsors. Portfolio may include projects for the SNC-Lavalin ”Production & Processing Solutions” (PPS) business.  Proposal Manager (15% of time) - Responsible for developing and managing Midstream Gas proposals within Western Canada. Working with sales, engineering, procurement, construction, and high-value remote offices to develop winning project execution plans, manhour estimates, and detailed cost estimates. Collaborate with SNC construction to form strategic alliances and partnerships where required to execute construction. Collaboration with commercial and risk managers to appropriate the proper risk and contingency allowances required to achieve set P&L goals.  BD Support (10% of time) – Responsible to work with the local Western Canada Business Development Director to promote EPC solutions for clients in Western Canada (BC and Alberta). Increase the existing client base to include new clients and elaborate existing E&P relationships to grow SNC’s scope to include EPC solutions.  Requirements Professional Engineer (P.Eng) Mechanical background preferred 10 – 15 Years experience in the EPC industry Significant gas compression experience Experience managing projects in the $10MM to $60MM TIC range. Strong technical apprehension and awareness of regulatory codes & requirements Knowledge of local Western Canadian engineering and construction practices Past experience with Tier 1 & Tier 2 Midstream Gas Producers Proven ability to manage multiple clients and contractor interfaces Superior skills in managing client relationships Both lump sum and unit rate contract experience Field experience as a Field Engineer, Engineering Manager, or Coordinator is an asset Strong commercial, risk management, and change management skills. Computer skills - MS office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)    Worker Type Employee  Job Type Regular   At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

Title: Senior Business Process Project Manager
Job_Description: Position Summary: The Senior Business Process Project Manager is a key role in 3esi-Enersight’s Business Improvement initiatives. The successful candidate will be able to transition rapidly and effectively between hands-on project management within individual projects in support of overall program goals and deliverables, and high-level relationship building and program strategy planning and execution. The ideal candidate will have a proven history of project execution success, recommending and implementing change through developing business process improvements, and identifying potential risks.  Responsible for applying standard project management techniques and methods while directly interacting with stakeholders to ensure quality of the customer experience.  Key Responsibilities:  Perform 3esi-Enersight Project Management duties utilizing the company’s project & program management methodology and best practices for the organization Engage in a process of continuous improvement in order to mature and improve internal business processes and integrated business workflows Frequently and proactively communicate Project deliverables including managing expectations, presenting and interfacing with stakeholders and sponsors Deliver key company initiatives on schedule, on budget, and to specification Resolve any issues using appropriate conflict resolution skills Manage full Project lifecycle including initial planning, scoping, scheduling, resourcing, monitoring project implementation metrics, action items, and deliverables, performing quality control and validation activities, and project closure activities Previous experience with company integrations, M&A; experience an asset Lead companywide process improvement through providing project management resources and support to large-scale departmental and cross-functional projects  Accountability and Authority:  Accountable for ensuring project activities occur and milestones and are completed Accountable for ensuring project work does not proceed if not funded (i.e., over budget) without internal approval Accountable for providing monthly department progress report to Executive team Accountable for global project deliverables being delivered on time, on budget, and clear of significant quality issues  Key Competencies:  Excellent communication skills, and the confidence to communicate effectively to staff and at all levels of management including C Suite Strong technical skills, with ability to think through details and tactics without losing sight of overall strategic goals Strong cross functional management skills Excellent presentation and Excel skills Set achievable goals and deadlines. Maintain committed to achieving goals in the face of obstacles and frustrations. Have a strong sense of urgency about solving problems and attaining favorable results Manage and oversee all levels of project implementations Manage multiple priorities and have excellent organizational skills Effective leadership attributes; delegate tasks and train others  Qualifications:  10+ years professional experience as a Project Manager and 5+ years a Business Process Improvement role University Degree, preferably Business or equivalent MBA, or other advanced management training, desired PMI Project Manager Professional (PMP) Designation, PMI Program Management Professional (PgMP), Prince2 or equivalent, desired Previous experience with budgeting, execution or program management processes will be beneficial Complete working knowledge of Change Management and associated Best Practices Experience with business architecture and business process management methodologies Valid passport required  Other: Some international travel can be expected (20 to 30%)

Title: Project Manager - Buildings
Job_Description: Career Opportunity - Project Manager - Buildings Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, you’ll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. You’ll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. We rank among Canada’s largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If you’re eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you.   Our career opportunities extend well beyond construction and engineering. We also offer exciting career growth and development in areas such as: accounting; administration; asset management; business development; communications; estimating; finance; health, safety, environment and quality; human resources; information systems/technology; investments; legal and risk management; purchasing; and SAP. As a member of one of these groups, you will play an essential role in supporting the successful execution of our projects and overall business operations by advising and applying your expertise to various improvement initiatives within your functional area.   The Project Manager reports directly to the Operations Manager and is responsible for providing oversight to junior staff in the coordinator, scheduling, quantity surveying, reporting, and quality control functions. You will develop best-in-class project management skills working in a large General Contractor; we manage the construction of large, complex, technically challenging and rewarding buildings.   As a Project Manager at Graham you will: Manage financial aspects of contracts to protect the company’s interests and maintain good relationships with client Ensure that projects are constructed in accordance with design, budget and schedule Assist, review and negotiate contracts; liaising with legal counsel, as appropriate, in conjunction with the Senior Project Manager Develop, recommend and implement the project plan, after being awarded the project Coach/mentor, provide direction, and review the performance of personnel reporting directly to you Monitor and control progress, costs and budgets throughout the project Review each project’s progress with the project staff as the project proceeds Act to resolve disputes between the Company and owner, or Company and subcontractors when possible prior to escalating Identify required and optional changes in project scope; negotiate change orders with the owner To be Successful at Graham, you will have the following qualifications and experience: or Qualifications/Experience: Civil or Structural engineering degree or equivalent training and experience 7-10 years of project management experience constructing buildings at a large General Contractor Have a thorough knowledge of all aspects of construction (technology, equipment, materials, negotiation, engineering, estimating, scheduling and safety) To be Successful at Graham, you will have the following qualifications and experience: Civil or Structural engineering degree or equivalent training and experience 7-10 years of project management experience constructing buildings at a large General Contractor Have a thorough knowledge of all aspects of construction (technology, equipment, materials, negotiation, engineering, estimating, scheduling and safety) Compensation and Benefits: Competitive salary with annual bonus potential Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan. Ownership and long term equity opportunities What we can offer you: Strong commitment to safety in the workplace Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America   Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law.   We're Building careers, not filling jobs.   View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/.  Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website.  Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you.   Graham Management Services LP  110, 115 Quarry Park Rd SE  Calgary, AB T2C 5G9  Fax: 403.258.2807 Job Code: BM-18-027 #LI-BM1

Title: Project Manager - Small Capital Projects
Job_Description: Avenue Living Communities, a fast-paced, fast-growing owner and operator of apartment buildings in Western Canada, is seeking a Project Manager to join our team. Backed by our entrepreneurial spirit, passion and commitment to great customer service and satisfaction, we have acquired a portfolio in excess of 6000 apartments since our inception in 2006 and are continuing with this aggressive growth plan. To support this growth we are seeking to welcome the right candidate into our family. Our people are our unique business advantage. Avenue Living Communities, a fast-paced, fast-growing owner and operator of apartment buildings in Western Canada, is seeking a Project Manager to join our team. Backed by our entrepreneurial spirit, passion and commitment to great customer service and satisfaction, we have acquired a portfolio in excess of 6000 apartments since our inception in 2006 and are continuing with this aggressive growth plan. To support this growth we are seeking to welcome the right candidate into our family. Our people are our unique business advantage. Responsibilities: Complete construction projects ensuring the health and safety of our tenants and employees. Site Inspections - Acquisition / Refinancing. Capital Planning. Maintain and Update Capital Planning Database. Create Capex scenarios and reports as needed. Project Manage Capital Upgrades < $25,000. Design/Engineering. Tendering / preparation of RFPs. Complete municipal building and development permits where required. AFE & Purchase Order Approval Process. Construction Management & Progress Inspections. Managing Payments / Cashflow planning. Major incident / insurance claim inspections. Procurement - vetting of new contractors and suppliers. Supply Chain / warehousing support. Operations Support. Fleet Management. Other internal projects as required (change management, IT). Complete drawings and/or floor plans in AutoCAD (or Turbo CAD). Provide weekly updates on projects to stakeholders. Coordinate project activities with both our field staff and Calgary head office. Requirements & Qualifications 3-5 Years' experience executing upgrade projects on Multi-Family Apartment buildings. Construction estimating or site-supervisor experience. An Engineering or Engineering Technologist degree would be considered an asset. Experience with the full project life cycle of building upgrades from planning and design through to completion. Experience managing roofing, siding, mechanical, HVAC, electrical, balcony, carpentry and interior renovation projects. Experience working with municipal authorities. Expect to spend 50-75% of your time travelling to our buildings across our portfolio. Ability to manage a large volume of small projects in parallel. Exceptional problem solving capability. Asbestos or mold abatement experience would be considered an asset. Proficiency in CAD (such as AutoCAD or TurboCAD) considered an asset. Our commitment is to our people…because it is our people that decide our direction through hard work, a passion for customer service and always keeping in mind that we are part of a team. Together we succeed. The avenue to your next career opportunity awaits – let's redefine your impossible and discover your true potential! If you are ready to join a dynamic, growth-oriented company: apply today Apply online or by email to careers@avenueliving.ca and state the title and location of the position you are applying for. There is no end date for this posting, we will keep looking for the very best candidate to join the avenue living family.  ***Only those candidates determined to be fully qualified for the position noted above will be contacted for interviews. Avenue Living Communities is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. avenue livings hiring policy is to recruit and select the best applicant for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications for the position. avenue living does not discriminate against applicants based on race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability or a conviction for which a pardon has been granted

Title: Advertising Agency Project Manager
Job_Description: Overview: We are currently seeking a Project Manager for our Calgary office. This role will interact with Account Managers and other team members from across the agency, and lead successful delivery of online and offline projects for our clients. Core Duties and Responsibilities include: The Project Manager is ultimately responsible for the successful development of both online and offline projects, working with a cross-functional, multi-disciplinary team of resources to ensure projects are delivered on-time and on budget with complete accuracy. Planning, scheduling and control of all project activities toward these objectives, applying technical, theoretical and managerial skills to satisfy project requirements, while building positive professional relationships with vendors, colleagues and associates. Working both independently and with team members to estimate costs for new project work, including change management elements on active projects. Providing regular updates on project status and budget. Development of specs for projects as needed. Quality assurance and proof-reading of all project work. Practices project management principles, methods and techniques; recommends process/procedural improvements. Performs other tasks as assigned and willingness to go above and beyond Desired skills and experience: 5+ years of work related experience required, in role(s) that required careful data reporting, analysis and data collection from multiple, varied sources. Advertising agency experience an asset. Experience in managing projects budgets and schedules for: Print, Broadcast (Television, Radio), Direct Mail, Websites, Digital Marketing – Online Display & Rich Media, Email, Social Media and CRM projects Proven experience in and successful management of projects with cross-functional teams (Client Marketing, Creative, Production, Strategy, Media, Interactive and Events) A deep understanding of print production, broadcast production, website development methodologies and experience in managing websites in multiple programming languages (HTML, ASP, ASP.NET, PHP and Flash) is an asset Strong understanding and continuous execution of the fundamentals of project management, including: Scoping Project Specifications, Scheduling, Risk Management, Issue Management, Change Management, etc. PMP or CAMP certifications preferred. Expert in PowerPoint, Word and Excel Strong teamwork, communication and interpersonal skills Please apply including your resume and cover letter, or send both to: careers@venturecommunications.ca While we appreciate all applications, only selected candidates will be contacted.

Title: Project Manager:
Job_Description: H2Safety Services Inc. is looking for a Project Manager to join our team. Under the guidance and supervision of the VP Operations, the primary function of the PM position is to manage the creation of Emergency Response Plans and all other products related to a complete Emergency Response Management Program. The Project Manager is the key client contact and interacts with the client to assist them in managing their Emergency Response Management Program. The Project Manager is an expert in all relevant government requirements and directives.more...  Who we are:  H2Safety Services Inc. is a consulting business that provides Emergency Response and Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) management programs to Oil and Gas sectors throughout Western Canada, the Northwest Territories, the United States, and Southeast Asia. We are a Calgary-based business that takes pride in delivering exceptional service and quality products to our clients at a competitive price. We have talented and dedicated employees who thrive in our fun-filled, busy and flexible work environment. As part of this team, you will discover that our desire for excellence is a rewarding part of all careers at H2Safety.  What we have to offer:  Start at three weeks of paid vacation Comprehensive health care plan Company matching RRSP program Annual performance bonus Long-term incentive program Tuition subsidy for job-related courses Fitness incentive Employee referral incentive Flexible start / finish times to accommodate personal schedules Free and convenient office parking An independent work environment where you have the freedom to decide how things get done Great co-workers that work hard, take pride in their work and support each other A work hard / play hard environment Responsibilities:  Conducts gap analyses on client’s Emergency Response Management Programs based on applicable regulations and identifies program deficiencies. Works with each client to develop and maintain their Emergency Response Management Program to meet regulatory requirements and client standards while staying within the client’s budget. Provides expertise and support to clients in regards to the impact of existing and new regulations on their Emergency Response Management Program. Determines the scope of work of each project and works with the Finance Department to develop budgets, quotes and invoices. Conducts external kickoff meetings with clients either in person or over the phone. Manages the creation and maintenance of Emergency Response Plans. This includes managing a project team consisting of members from various internal company departments (Engineering, GIS, IT, Public Involvement, Training, Printing, Admin, etc.). Manages and develops a small team of direct reports on a day to day basis. Provides regular status updates to and has regular meetings with clients. Plans and schedules project timelines, milestones and resources using the appropriate tools and methods. Aggressively manages project timelines to ensure regulatory and client deadlines are met. Conducts demos of H2Safety software for clients and other interested parties. May be required to conduct training sessions, assist with resident contacts or fill in anywhere else additional resources or support might be required to complete a project. Develops best practices and tools for project execution and management. Identifies and successfully resolves issues and conflicts that develop on the project. Builds, develops, and grows any business relationships vital to the success of the project. Qualifications  Project management experience (3+ years). University degree or equivalent. High level of initiative and self-motivation. Able to prioritize work and work accurately under the pressure of multiple deadlines with frequent interruptions and changing priorities. Strong time management and organizational skills. Willing to put in extra time if required to meet client expectations and deadlines. Skilled at establishing rapport and building strong relationships with clients. Able to travel to the field as needed for kickoff meetings, training, etc. Be able to work flexibly and deal with change. Able to work independently and use analytical and decision-making skills to offer solutions and resolve problems in a variety of contexts. Able to elicit cooperation from a wide variety of sources, including upper management, clients, and staff. Able to adapt to various communications styles of team members and contractors who come from a broad spectrum of disciplines. Strong customer service skills. Ability to communicate effectively at a professional level, including reading, writing and presentation skills. Strong computer skills. An understanding of emergency response plans is an asset but not a requirement. If you are interested in this position, please send a cover letter and resume to careers@h2safety.ca  We thank all applicants for their interest in our position at H2Safety Services Inc., however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Project Manager

Title: Project Manager - Calgary
Job_Description: Harvard Property Management Inc. has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to join its team. Harvard is a full service real estate management company based in Western Canada that is recognized for its reputation in leadership, flexibility, quality and performance. The company oversees 8.8 million square feet of commercial properties with regional offices in Regina, Calgary, Edmonton and Winnipeg.This position will report to the Senior Project Manager and will be part of a Project Management team providing capital project management to external and internal clients. The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, contract administration and successful delivery of a variety of leasing construction and capital projects throughout Harvard’s managed portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.What you will bring to the job: - 5 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings;- The completion of a PMP designation is an asset;- Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting;- Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships;- Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines;- The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment;- Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment;- Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and- Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.What you will receive: - Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment;- Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP;- Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program;- Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and- Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. If you feel you are the person we are looking for in this position, please apply with your resume in confidence through the Careers tab at　www.hillcompanies.com.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: AWI’s Project Manager is responsible for planning and executing water filtration related projects. They actively participate in a design team consisting of AWI’s Technical Advisors, other Project Managers and Draftsperson/Designer.At Anthratech Western Inc. (AWI) we provide water treatment solutions for industrialand municipal water and wastewater treatment plants across Canada and in select international markets. AWI is privately owned, with the head office and research and development facility located in Calgary, Alberta.Responsibilities and Duties: Defining the site-specific project scope and schedule.Procurement of components and coordination of delivery logistics.Travelling to work sites to attend meetings and complete inspections.Monitoring project process and communicating status updates to internal and external stakeholders.Scheduling and monitoring AWI’s on-site responsibilities, including equipment installation, performance testing and commissioning.Collaborate with AWI’s Document Specialist to develop project related documentation.Ensuring all aspects of the project meet company and worksite safety standards.Managing unexpected tasks that may arise, including troubleshooting requests, onsite services/repairs and small-parts orders.Supporting coworkers through collaboration, cross training and information sharing.Candidate RequirementsOur ideal candidate will have:A diploma in Engineering Technology or equivalent technical education/background.At least five-years of project management experience in a related field. Experience in a construction, engineering or similar work environment a strong asset.Project Management Professional certification an asset.A valid Alberta driver’s license (class 5) and a clean driver’s abstract.Personal and professional skills desired:Demonstrated ability to take initiative, work independently and use critical thinking to problem-solve.Ability to analyze and interpret technical information and engineering drawings.Strong communication skills (both verbal and written). Bilingual (Eng/Fre) language proficiency a strong asset.Customer service focus, with the ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.Hours of WorkCore office hours are Monday to Friday 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Occasional travel is required.CompensationCompensation will take into account the background, range of skills, knowledge and experience that the successful candidate brings to the opportunity. Following the probationary period, AWI employees are eligible for a comprehensive employee health insurance program with a health care spending account. After one year of service, AWI employees may be eligible for the AWI RRSP matching contribution plan.By submitting your resume, personal information and references to Anthratech Western Inc. you acknowledge and consent to AWI contacting your references and verifying education in order to determine your suitability for this employment opportunity.Candidates being considered for this position must pass AWI’s standard background check and screening process.The position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. No telephone, walk-in or agency inquiries.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:project management: 5 years

Title: Project Manager, Operations Project Delivery (Specified Term...
Job_Description: The Alberta Electric System Operator is responsible for the safe, reliable, and economic planning and operation of the Alberta Interconnected Electric System. We provide open and non-discriminatory access to Alberta’s interconnected power grid and also facilitate Alberta’s competitive wholesale electricity market which, in 2017, had 291 participants and approximately $3 Billion in annual energy transactions. Working closely with the Operations Project Delivery Program Manager, the Project Manager is responsible for delivering projects directly related to the enhancement and improvement of the Energy Management System, Market Applications and other supporting systems including compliance projects and business processes as well as other corporate and facilities projects. Projects include software applications upgrades, new system development, other systems applications projects required due to changes in industry regulations and other corporate or facilities projects.  The Project Manager will be required to deliver all phases of the project management lifecycle and be able to manage multiple projects in parallel without impacting quality. This role requires an individual who is an excellent communicator as there is significant cross functional collaboration and the need to lead through influencing and consensus building.  The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in Systems Applications upgrades in an IT environment, will be flexible, self-motivated and able to work effectively with other disciplines and other business groups across the AESO. Teamwork, forward thinking and the ability to manage the business objectives are key attributes.  Accountabilities: The Project Manager is accountable for the following:  Initiating systems application development projects including preparing necessary project documents (portfolio registration documents, business cases, project charters etc.) Creating work breakdown structure (WBS), delivery schedules, cost estimates and identifying resource requirements for the projects Defining clear project scope, business objectives and business benefits for the initiatives in collaboration with key stakeholders and senior management Tracking and actively managing project scope, budget, timelines and resources Ensuring all project deliverables meet the established level of quality Monitor the project objectives and benefit measures upon which the project will be evaluated upon completion Establishing communication plans to update stakeholders on the progress of the project(s) at the various levels in the organization as required Communicating and managing project dependencies across business units Managing project risks/ issues /constraints and escalate as required Negotiating and managing vendors’ project deliverables Creating process workflows of current and future state processes Ensuring project deliverables meet business, security, privacy, compliance, and operational needs Provide regular status updates and reporting for various levels of leadership Navigate complex conversations, facilitate decision making, and communicate outcomes, while utilizing project management principles and models.  Education / Degree / Certification:  Bachelor’s Degree of Engineering (APEGA-P.Eng.), Computer Sciences, Business or other related field or equivalent work / industry experience Project Management Professional designation (PMP)  Job Experience:  Minimum 10 years leading and directing a portfolio of projects with a high degree of complexity and multiple stakeholders in an technical applications environment for business software tools Demonstrated achievement in driving business process changes and process improvements Prior experience in technology, regulatory/compliance projects or facility initiatives Prior experience in projects that involve multiple business units or have multiple internal and external stakeholders Knowledge of the Alberta Interconnected Electric System, WECC, NERC or previous utility experience would be an asset Experience using the Microsoft Office suite and MS Project to produce project deliverables Experience creating business cases and statement of work for highly complex projects Well-developed leadership, communication, negotiating, influencing and inter-personal skills, with the drive and commitment to achieve business objectives A practical, adaptable, innovative, collaborative and solution-focused approach to issues Experience working with both business leaders and technical specialists Experience managing multiple project responsibilities in parallel  Applications accepted online via aeso connect until May 31, 2018 The Alberta Electric System Operator, and its members, officers, employees and agents (collectively, the "AESO") is committed to protecting personal information provided to it. By submitting your personal information to the AESO for the purpose of pursuing employment with the AESO, you hereby consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal information by the AESO, in accordance with the provisions of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act of Alberta , as amended from time to time.

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking a Senior Project Manager . This is a permanent position scheduled to start in May.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Managing the program and related projects within the relevant portfolio as defined within the strategic theme and performance expectations; on time, within scope, on budget, and meeting quality standards;  Managing the program / project financials, across cost budgets, expense budgets and SAP;  Managing multiple / simultaneous programs and projects, which includes; Initiating, Planning, Executing, Monitoring, Controlling, and Closing;  Working with project sponsor, program managers, and customers to complete project statement of work, which includes; goals, accountabilities, deliverables, milestones, required resources, budget, and timing;  Identification of internal/external stakeholders and expectation management throughout project life cycle;  Resolving any issues and or solve problems throughout the project life cycle;  Effectively managing project scope by ensuring any changes to scope are documented and approved;  Providing project leadership, working with Delivery Director by ensuring there are clear goals, motivating team members, resolving conflict and demonstrating appreciation for team member contributions;  Managing and coordinating the delivery of project activities and project performance (on time, within scope, on budget, and meeting quality standards), as defined in the project statement;  Identify resource requirements, acquiring project team, setting clear expectations, and evaluating assignment performance;  Serving as a mediator / liaison between the business, management, stakeholders, and project team members; and,  Developing, monitoring, and controlling all aspects of project delivery, for: Integration, Management, Scope Management, Time Management, Cost Management, Quality Management, Human Resource Management, Communications Management, Risk/Issue Management and Procurement Management.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: Post-secondary education (University, College), in Business, Engineering, Technology or Computer Science;  Ten plus (10+) plus years of experience leading, delivering Telecom, Network, Infrastructure and security related projects;  Project Management Professional designation (PMP) or equivalent competency;  Advanced program / project management practical expertise across knowledge areas; scope, time, cost, quality, staffing, communication, risk, procurement, and integration management;  Advanced knowledge of project management planning tools (such as MS Project) and associated MS Office products (such as; Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint);  Experience / successful track record, working in a team-oriented environment (demonstrated ability to develop and maintain collaborative working relationships);  Ability to rapidly adapt, set priorities and respond to changes in fast-paced environment;  Excellent communication, organizational, multitasking, problem solving and negotiating skills;  Experience with decision and problem solving at the root cause and complexity level;  Demonstrated capability in leading, mentoring, coaching / influencing; and,  Experience in understanding business / technical strategies and communicating these needs to the governing bodies, to ensure programs / projects and services are delivered as agreed.  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.

Title: Project Coordinator
Job_Description: Why the Stampede?  For over 100 years the Calgary Stampede has been the heart and soul of our city. It is both where and how we come together to celebrate our unique brand of western hospitality and community spirit. As we embark on the next chapter of our story, we will deliver exceptional experiences that entertain, educate and engage visitors. We will build inspired spaces to bring our community together to celebrate, and we will further energize the brand that has come to define our city. Our vision is to create a world-class, year-round gathering place for the community.  Position Summary   The Project Coordinator is an administrative support role within the Business Service team. The successful candidate will implement operational plans, contributing to and supporting both the Business Service team and other teams in the Calgary Stampede as well as internal and external stakeholders.  Responsibilities  Responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:  Conduct administration, accounting, reporting and process maintenance. This will also include risk mitigation factors. Develop process maps and training throughout the park. Develop plans for implementation of net new or updated processes Responsible for research and development around the Calgary Stampede policies. Support project teams in organizational project delivery  Qualifications  The ideal candidate will be proactive, optimistic and have worked in a dynamic environment where they have experience delivering on multiple priorities and will hold the following qualifications:   At least, High School Diploma Working Knowledge of Microsoft Project and Visio will be an asset Strong organizational skills Basic understanding of Business Analyst and Project Management methodologies A minimum of two years’ experience in an administrative support role or related experience  Benefits  The Calgary Stampede offers a unique and exciting work environment, an excellent total compensation package and the opportunity for advancement and employee training.  To Apply  To apply, please submit your resume.  All applicants are thanked in advance and only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Title: Project Coordinator
Job_Description: ABOUT US Aecon Group Inc. is an industry-leading construction and infrastructure development company at the forefront of our economy’s strongest growth sectors – Infrastructure, Energy, Mining. Aecon and its subsidiaries provide services to private and public sector clients throughout Canada and on a selected basis internationally. Aecon Utilities is Ontario's premier utility contractor, averaging more than 1000 skilled trades people, project managers and clerical staff. Our respected personnel are well equipped with more than 1500 major pieces of equipment, including one of the largest directional drilling fleets in Ontario. POSITION OVERVIEW Reporting to the Manager, Operations, the Project Coordinator will be responsible for accurately tracking the cost of labour, equipment, subcontractors and materials for the installation or relocation of underground utilities within multi-faceted infrastructure projects.Also, coordinating related contract administration, procurement and invoicing functions for awarded projects.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Provides Manager of Operations with data and project analysis Supports project Superintendent and Foremen in management of projects and crews Tracks productivity, costs and progress on projects Performs quantity take-off from construction drawings Monitors and provides job cost reports to management on active projects Creates and submits progress and final invoicing Coordinates the preparation and submission of shop submittals and as-built drawings Provides data and input for month-end reconciliations Communicates with customer technical support departments Provides technical support to field staff Maintains files and correspondence on active and completed projects Performs other duties and responsibilities as required  KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS Graduate from Civil or Electrical Engineering/ Technologist / Construction Management program or equivalent Minimum of 2 years of experience in the construction industry in a similar role Experience in the utility industry is a strong asset Capable of reading and understanding construction drawings and documents Sound computer skills – MS Excel, MS Word, MS Project Experience with SAP is a strong asset Strong communication skills – oral and written Self motivated with good organizational skills Ability to work accurately under pressure Adaptable to flexible work schedule when required to meet deadlines Ability to work with others as a team Valid driver’s license and access to reliable transportation Willing to travel for specific project assignments is a strong asset Aecon accommodates. Upon request, Aecon accommodates candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

Title: Project Coordinator
Job_Description: We are looking for a qualified Rotating Equipment Project Coordinator with the ability to work within a multi-discipline engineering team and vendors. We serve many different market sectors including Oil & Gas, Mining & Metals, Chemical & Petrochemical, Pulp & Paper, Municipal Water & Wastewater Treatment etc.  ACCOUNTABILITY: Broad position responsibilities will include: Being accountable under direction of project manager for the day-to-day functions related to coordination and driving projects towards ensuring on time performance, superior quality and profitability Be a main point of contact for customers, the company?s internal organization, represented manufacturers and suppliers as they relate to projects. Act as a facilitator in the absence of the Project Manager. Represent Project Team in the daily production meeting. Uphold the corporate values of The Company. Customer satisfaction and meeting agreed deadlines/schedules. Follow company policies and developing long-range goals and objectives to ensure continuous growth and improvement. CORE AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY: Acting as a project team leader, assist the Project Manager for projects in coordinating, planning, communicating and executing the delivery of core project component. Plan, coordinate and administer the Hand-Over Process from Estimation / Inside Sales to Projects Team. Maintain, organize and update project binder during the course of project. Plan project, procure resources, monitor profitability and develop high level schedule for projects and provide weekly updates of such Coordination with Document control for the timely submission of documents according to forecast submittal dates and monitor document status. Set-up project meetings with internal and external stakeholders and prepare meeting agendas Assist the Project Manager in the quotation process Manage project invoicing, financial updates and cost tracking. Administrate project close-out, archive project documents Coordinate with shop manager/supervisors and QC department for the smooth execution and completion of fabrication, assembly & production as per project schedule. Facilitate goods returns with Inventory Management & Purchasing. Any other duties as required for the execution and completion of projects as advised by immediate Supervisor SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS: Degree or Diploma in a related field (or equivalent industry experience).3-5 years of experience supporting Project Managers in the delivery of highly technical, large scale rotating equipment projects.Registered with PMI (Project Management Institute) as CAPM or PMP (or equivalent industry experience).Experience with MS Project is mandatory and above average computer skillsFamiliarity with rotating equipment packaged systemsUnderstanding of general layout of equipment packages, P&IDs, piping design and relevant industry standards and codes.Experience in coordination with structural and piping fabrication shop.Good understanding of manufacturing (fabrication, machining and assembly) processes.Good knowledge of industry standards such as API, ASME, CWB, ABSA, OH&S, ANSI, etc.Excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills.Excellent problem solving abilities and can work with minimum supervision.Detail-oriented, with an emphasis on quality of work.Proven exceptional work-ethic, self-motivated, and highly driven.Flexibility and willingness to perform other duties as required.Effective communication skills including verbal, written and presentation skills.Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities. May require overtime work under direction of immediate supervisorFrequent shop visits as required. Disclaimer The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

Title: Project Manager - Building Envelope

Title: Construction Project Manager
Job_Description: CONSTRUCTION PROJECT MANAGER Real Estate Services Calgary, AB 12 Month Contract Bentall Kennedy, a member of the Sun Life Investment Management group of companies, is one of North America's largest real estate investment advisors. We are Canada's largest property manager, providing comprehensive real estate services to our clients. Bentall Kennedy serves the interests of more than 550 institutional investors across office, retail, industrial, and residential properties throughout North America. As a leader in Responsible Property Investing, we are committed to best-in-class environmental, social and governance practices in developing, leasing and managing commercial real estate. For more information, visit www.bentallkennedy.com. Bentall Kennedy promotes a corporate culture that attracts and retains the highest caliber people. We encourage opportunities for growth, development and promotion by providing our employees with the resources to work effectively and continually strive to perform better. We are committed to a safe and sustainable work environment. Job Summary: Located in Calgary and responsible for projects in the Prairie Region, this 12 month contract position for a Construction Project Manager will report directly to the Vice President, Construction. This position will be responsible for all aspects of ongoing major development and construction projects across all asset classes adding to the Prairie Region portfolio. Required responsibilities and qualifications are outlined below. Responsibilities: Ensure excellent relations through personal contact and excellent customer service. Work with all parties to establish budgets and assist with cost benefit analysis. Coordinate request for proposals and securing design consultants. Coordinate with designers & consultants to ensure drawings, specifications and contract documents are prepared on time and on budget. Work with consultant team to secure permits, municipal approval and entitlements. Assist with preparation, issuance and formal closings of tenders. Ability to analyze tenders and make recommendations to internal and external clients. Act as the owner representative and ensure their best interests are always maintained. Represent the owner for general contract administration for projects. Attend all construction and site meetings for assigned projects. Manage consultants and contractors to ensure each project is completed on time, within budget and according to established specifications. Alert internal clients of all issues impacting quality, timing and cost of assigned projects. Sign off on all payables for capital projects and ensure payments of obligations are met. Track all budgets, costs to complete, cost variances and provide updates to internal and external clients as required. Provide monthly project reports including cost reporting. Obtain close out documentation for all projects including turnover of newly developed asset to Property Management group. Manage project completion process, including turnover, budget reconciliation and close out. When tenant is commencing with improvement work, review and approve tenant design documentation, attend tenant site meetings and general supervision of tenant construction. When landlord is commencing with tenant improvement work, responsibility to coordinate entire process of tenant fit out of newly developed space is required. Make recommendations for the continuous improvement of policies and procedures. Embrace and pro-actively support Bentall Kennedy's culture of environmental sustainability, and corporate and social responsibility. Other duties as required and assigned from time to time. Qualifications: Experience – Minimum 7 years' of project management expertise across all asset classes. Education – Related post-secondary diploma or degree required relative to the position. In addition, a high level of design and construction knowledge as well as industry knowledge is required. Relationship/Leadership Skills – Able to communicate effectively and professionally, both oral and written; able to develop and sustain cooperative working relationships with senior management, contractors, tenants and the public; able to partner with clients to meet client needs; self-motivated, professional and flexible; able to motivate, empower and coach/counsel staff in the achievement of performance goals. Organizational/Multi-Task Skills – Able to allocate time effectively, work under pressure and manage tight deadlines; able to handle multiple demands and competing priorities, adapt to new ideas and constant changes; able to cope with changing client needs and deliver successful results within agreed upon timeframes; very detail oriented. Decision Making Skills – Able to resolve problems using facts and sound reasoning; able to achieve goals using a strategic approach; proven innovation with a willingness to manage and adapt to change. Computer Skills – Advanced knowledge of Word and Excel. Knowledge of MS Projects would be an asset. Travel – This position may require the ability to travel for 4 to 6 days per month. Proponents should have flexibility to meet this potential demand.

We advise multinationals, international organizations and businesses in the setup of international benefit programs, providing related services with high added value. We cover the risk of health, life, disability, and emergency medical assistance for more than 330,000 insured members by means of our four regional offices (Calgary, Paris, Dubai, and Shanghai); all sharing the same integrated information system. MSH INTERNATIONAL is committed to fostering a workplace that promotes diversity and inclusion and is proud to have a multicultural team of more 60 nationalities speaking over 40 different languages.The BenefitsMSH INTERNATIONAL recognizes the hard work and commitment of their employees and offers, in addition to a competitive salary, a comprehensive benefits package, including:Sales Compensation incentiveHealth & Drug BenefitsEAP BenefitsLife Insurance and Accidental Death & Dismemberment BenefitsShort Term Disability BenefitsDeferred Profit Sharing PlanWellness/Health Facility BenefitHealth Care Spending AccountMSH INTERNATIONAL also recognizes the importance of workplace & life balance, offering flexible working schedules.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Project Management: 2 yearsinsurance industry: 3 yearsgroup benefits: 2 yearsEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Calgary, AB

Title: Project Manager Assistant
