Title: Senior Wildlife Biologist/Project Manager
Job_Description: THE OPPORTUNITYTriton Environmental Consultants Ltd. (Triton) is seeking an enthusiastic, highly motivated senior wildlife biologist and project manager to lead our wildlife group in Calgary, Alberta. Our existing projectsencompass Western Canada and will provide the successful candidate with exciting and rewarding opportunities for career development.Triton is an employee-owned environmental consulting firm with nearly 30 years of experience responding to the environmental needs of resource developers across all sectors, as well as all levels of government. Our clients look to us to provide a wide range of scientific, technical, and management expertise that merge to provide practical environmental solutions. Triton’s offices are geographically situated to provide effective service delivery within Western Canada. Our multi-disciplinary team comprises environmental professionals specializing in aquatic and terrestrial biology, soils science, vegetation ecology, environmental assessment, environmental auditing, environmental monitoring/inspection, and resource management.Triton will provide you with a challenging and supportive working environment and a management team dedicated to promoting your personal and professional growth. We offer a competitive wage and benefits package.THE ROLEThe successful candidate will lead our wildlife department in Calgary. Our senior specialists and project managers are the cornerstone of our company and are committed to outstanding client service. In this role you will be responsible for managing and delivering the technical components of wildlife programs and providing senior mentorship to our wildlife staff. Specific duties may include:Planning and managing a diverse array of wildlife projectsPreparing permit applicationsLiaising with clients, regulators, and contractorsWriting high-quality reports, cost estimates, and proposalsAnalysing complex biophysical data and completing statistical analysisManaging projects or managing the wildlife portions of multi-disciplinary projectsLeading technical teams to ensure the quality, cost, and timeliness of deliverablesContributing specialist expertise to multi-disciplinary projectsProviding mentorship and training for our wildlife teamMaintaining client relationships and supporting business developmentWorking collaboratively within Triton corporate cultureSKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONSSc. or M.Sc. in biology or a related fieldBiol. or eligible for registration with the Alberta Society of Professional BiologistsMinimum of ten years of relevant experienceAdvanced multi-jurisdictional knowledge of provincial and federal environmental regulations, policies, and permit application processesEffective technical writing skills, including report and proposal preparationExtensive experience designing and leading wildlife field programs, including wildlife and wildlife habitat surveys, breeding bird surveys, amphibian surveys, reptile surveys, specific species surveys, and pre-construction nest sweepsSpecies at Risk experience, particularly with listed prairie speciesExperience with bat surveys, including acoustic survey techniques, considered an assetExperience with caribou and caribou habitat considered an assetProven ability to work independently with minimal supervisionExcellent verbal communications skillsDetail oriented with solid organizational and time management skillsStrong interpersonal skills and collaborative working styleSuperior problem-solving skills, with the ability to think outside the boxHOW TO APPLYIf this opportunity sounds like you, and you are serious about joining a progressive team of environmental consultants, pleaseapply with a resume and cover letter.Closing Date: May 24, 2018Competition Reference: SWBCA-0518We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: FirstOnSite is looking for an experienced Project Manager to be part of our growing team in Calgary!  The Project Manager is responsible for the success of assigned projects, in conjunction with the property owner, adjuster, or insurance company. The Project Manager ensures that the project is completed on time and to the required quality standard within agreed specifications. The focus of the PM role is to scope projects and estimate the work required to restore properties to their pre-disaster state.  Primary Responsibilities: Interacts with clients to develop applicable solutions that will respond to their situation and needs. Prepares accurate quotations through job costing and estimation, ensuring target margins are met. Manages all aspects of water claims i.e. mitigation, equipment selection, equipment staging, psychometrics and reports. Ensures that Emergency and Rebuild timelines are met and in alignment with policy and guidelines. Participates in growing the best quality team to achieve the objectives of our corporate strategic plan. Ensures project requirements are being fulfilled and deadlines and milestones are achieved. Inspects progress and work quality throughout the project. Develops and maintains strong relationships and acts as a prime liaison with policy holders, adjustors and insurance providers. Resolves disputes and complaints, where possible. Generates new leads through relationships with adjusters, property managers, and other key players.  Factors for Success: Detailed understanding of reconstruction practices for property that has suffered water, wind, mould, fire and vandalism damages Knowledge of building construction & codes Knowledge of the laws and ordinances regulating building construction Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and oral Proficiency in MS Office Skills (Excel, Word and Outlook) Experience with Xactimate Basic accounting competency with an understanding of invoicing, billing procedures Experience planning and monitoring budgets  FirstOnSite Restoration is the largest independent disaster restoration company in Canada. We provide unsurpassed emergency response, restoration and reconstruction services to the insurance industry, residential, commercial and industrial customers. With coast-to-coast coverage and 24/7 emergency service, we offer a wide range of services that remediate conditions caused by fires, floods, winds, mould, environmental hazards, accidents and other casualties at any type of facility.  Why choose to be part of the FirstOnSite team?  Exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental and vision. Employee Assistance Program Educational assistance, professional development, and internal growth opportunities Opportunity for National career movement Variable pay/Incentive plan opportunities Access to a company vehicle Option to travel and assist with large coast to coast projects  Interested candidates whose resume and cover letter best demonstrate how they meet the qualifications of the position will be contacted for an interview. Candidates must be able to provide a clear criminal background check to be eligible for hire.

Title: Project Manager - Infrastructure
Job_Description: Career Opportunity – Project Manager – Infrastructure Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, you’ll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. You’ll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. We rank among Canada’s largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If you’re eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). About The Role The Project Manager reports directly to the Senior Project Manager and will have an in-depth knowledge of Infrastructure/Civil construction projects. As a Project Manager at Graham you will: Assist in pursuing and securing new work for the company through collaboration with our work winning team; Develop, recommend, and implement the project execution plan, schedule, and budget following project award; Ensure that the project is constructed in accordance with the Client’s design, specifications, budget, and schedule; Liaising with legal counsel in conjunction with the Operations Manager, assist in the review and negotiation of contracts and subcontracts; Manage financial aspects of contracts and participate in risk management activities in order to protect the company’s interests and maintain good relationships with our clients; Identify required and optional changes in project scope; negotiate change orders with the owner; manage potential claims on a proactive basis and practice a claims avoidance approach; Ensure that the project is constructed in accordance with design, budget and schedule Assist, review and negotiate contracts; liaising with legal counsel, as appropriate, in conjunction with Operations Manager Develop, recommend and implement the project plan, after being awarded the project Coach/mentor, provide direction, and review the performance of personnel reporting directly to the Project Manager Monitor and control progress, costs and budgets throughout the lifecycle of the project; Act to resolve disputes between the Company and our clients, or the Company and our subcontractors on a proactive basis and with a focus on building long-term relationships; Actively participate in the recruitment, retention, development, and performance management of our Project Coordinators, Field Engineers, Superintendents, and other project support staff. Qualifications/Experience: Civil, Mechanical, or Structural Engineering degree or related technical degree. A Professional Engineering designation would be considered an asset. At least 3 -5 years’ experience leading Infrastructure Projects ($5-30 million) with a General Contractor. Knowledge and experience related to water projects, wastewater projects, and bridge projects. Mechanical and electrical background would be an asset. Detailed understanding of all aspects of construction: technology, equipment, materials, bid management, claims management, safety, and quality. A willingness to travel on a temporary basis to project sites throughout Alberta is considered an asset. Compensation and Benefits: Competitive salary with annual bonus potential Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan. Ownership and long term equity opportunities About Us What we can offer you: Strong commitment to safety in the workplace Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. We're Building careers, not filling jobs. View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/. Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you. Graham Management Services LP 10840 27th Street SE Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 Fax: 403.570.5190

Title: Client Project Manager
Job_Description: AGAT Laboratories is a full-service laboratory with locations across Canada. We are the most diversified laboratory in Canada; our scientists are highly-skilled and specialized in the fields of biochemistry, chemistry, microbiology, geology, engineering and other specialty services. With a broad range of staff experience and state-of-the-art instrumentation, we provide cross-analytical solutions for the Environmental, Energy, Mining, Transportation, Industrial, Agri-food and Life Sciences sectors.Job Description: This is a Full time permanent position. As a Client Project Manager, you will be part of a team responsible for building and maintaining strong relationships with our clients. You possess excellent customer service skills and the ability to multitask and work under pressure. You are the first line of communication between our clients and the laboratories.Your specific day to day duties will include: Answering multiple technical questions in a timely fashionEnsure lab results are delivered on timeEnsure client special requests are fulfilled as per their specificationsEnsuring all QC measures have been met before reports are presented to the clientProactively ensure overall satisfaction of clients including communication to management team as appropriateResearch all client inquiries to complete resolution, enter corresponding orders/quotes with complete documented follow upProvide clear, concise and accurate information to operations as it pertains to client projects (including but not limited to rush and ongoing projects)Report analytical results to clients within expected turnaround times (TAT’s)Qualifications: Customer Service ExperienceBachelor in Chemistry or related Science background.Helpful, good natured and friendly even under pressureExcellent written and verbal communicationExcellent computer skills; knowledgeable with Microsoft Office Suite, able to learn lab information systemsMust be organized and able to multi-task; can successfully deliver on multiple deadlinesExcellent time-managementWilling to work as part of a teamIndustry knowledge would be a significant assetAGAT Laboratories would like to thank all applicants; however only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. Send your resume and your cover letter in Word or PDF format via http://www.agatlabs.com/careers. We are committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process and work environment. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise the hiring manager of any accommodations that are required. Any information received relating to accommodations will be treated as confidential.Thank you for your interest in AGAT Laboratories.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentExperience:Customer Service: 1 yearEducation:AssociateLocation:Calgary, AB

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Compugen is an organization that encourages and supports ongoing training and development opportunities. We are composed of a talented, diversified workforce that performs collectively in an entrepreneurial and flexible environment. Our staff members have access to the latest and greatest technologies in performing their daily activities. Well-developed interpersonal skills Advanced skills in written and verbal communication Analytical, systematic and forward thinker Post-secondary degree/certification or equivalent PMP certification nice to have 5-7 year successful experience as a Project Manager, Project Leader or Delivery Manager is a requirement. Computer literacy; proficient in word processing, spreadsheet, flowchart & presentation and project management software tools Must be able to be comfortable in key technologies currently employed by Compugen (highly recommended) Interest in continuing to follow developments in relevant technologies (desirable) Plan and implement small to large scale projects. Direct all aspects of the project planning and execution phases. Work with project team members to create detailed project plan. Engage resources as required by the plan for the successful deployment of the project. Detail and assign work package plans. Meet regularly with the team to follow up on tasks, deliverables and issues. Communicate status to the client via written reports and meeting or teleconferences. Track project plan to baseline against time and budget constraints. Manage project scope & handle scope change requests using appropriate documentation. Log, monitor and handle project issues, analyze & recommend viable alternatives. Hold weekly team meetings and attend client meetings. Lead the Compugen team members towards the successful conclusion of the project. Act as a single point of contact for both the internal Compugen team and the client team. Manage customer expectations. Ensure a high level of customer service and view toward repeat business. Use Compugen's project methodology. Ensure proper documentation is completed & stored where accessible. Documentation includes Statement of Work, plan, schedule, scope changes log, issues log, risk assessment, minutes of status meeting and PIR. Must follow the Compugen Inc. Deployment Guidelines Must strive to improve The Deployment Guidelines Must be able to report on the P&L of all projects Must report on the customer satisfaction of the projects; target is a letter of reference or project survey. Must manage and escalate issues as required.

Title: Project Manager - Calgary
Job_Description: Harvard Property Management Inc. has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to join its team. Harvard is a full service real estate management company based in Western Canada that is recognized for its reputation in leadership, flexibility, quality and performance. The company oversees 8.8 million square feet of commercial properties with regional offices in Regina, Calgary, Edmonton and Winnipeg.This position will report to the Senior Project Manager and will be part of a Project Management team providing capital project management to external and internal clients. The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, contract administration and successful delivery of a variety of leasing construction and capital projects throughout Harvard’s managed portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.What you will bring to the job: - 5 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings;- The completion of a PMP designation is an asset;- Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting;- Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships;- Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines;- The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment;- Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment;- Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and- Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.What you will receive: - Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment;- Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP;- Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program;- Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and- Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. If you feel you are the person we are looking for in this position, please apply with your resume in confidence through the Careers tab at　www.hillcompanies.com.Job Type: Full-time

The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. Title: Calgary - Project Manager
Job_Description: Harvard Property Management Inc. has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to join its team. Harvard is a full service real estate management company based in Western Canada that is recognized for its reputation in leadership, flexibility, quality and performance. The company oversees 8.8 million square feet of commercial properties with regional offices in Regina, Calgary, Edmonton and Winnipeg.  This position will report to the Senior Project Manager and will be part of a Project Management team providing capital project management to external and internal clients. The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, contract administration and successful delivery of a variety of leasing construction and capital projects throughout Harvard’s managed portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.  Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.  What you will bring to the job:  3 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings; Accreditation in civil or architectural technology or engineering; the completion of a PMP designation is an asset; Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting; Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships; Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines; The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment; Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment; Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.  What you will receive:  Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment; Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP; Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program; Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.  Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. Title: Project Manager - Multi-Family Projects
Job_Description: Homes by Avi takes pride in reshaping the face of Alberta’s communities. We’ve consistently maintained our direction, always remaining focused on the human factor and the details that set Homes by Avi apart from the competition. We’re proud that we have been building homes for Albertans for forty years, but most of all, we are proud that, through our craft, we are able to make dreams reality.  By redefining multi-family developments, our broad range of communities includes Calgary townhomes and mid-rise residential developments, as well as townhomes in Edmonton. Each of the Avi Urban multi-family developments conveys our passion for design and reputation of building quality homes. Required Skills Project Manager - Multi-Family Projects  Your main role will be to ensure that assigned multi family projects are completed on time, within budget and to the quality standards of Homes by Avi, and Alberta New Home Warranty. You will be responsible for producing accurate quantity take offs, creating, managing and maintaining project cost budgets and keeping the project on schedule while flagging and communicating potential issues with upper management. You will report directly to the Production Manager and will liaise with suppliers and trades to ensure efficiency in costs, quality and timeliness. Required Experience If you have 5+ years of on-the-job multi family project management experience, construction estimating knowledge, exceptional customer service, a combination of commercial & residential experience as well as working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite of products, we want you to join our team. Relevant project management certification and PHBI courses will be considered an asset.  If you are looking for a place to continue your project management career and make your own dreams a reality, submit your cover letter and resume via the Careers section of our website.  Homes by Avi is an equal opportunity employer. All employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities.

Title: Manager, Project Management - NPI
Job_Description: Purpose of the position Reporting to the Director, Strategic Supply Management you will lead a team of project managers responsible for new product introductions, product transfers and customer specific projects. You will be responsible to manage and maintain the NPI process aligned with Smart’s ‘Commercialization’ process.  Responsibilities and accountabilities Ownership and execution of projects post “Commercialization”, managing and interfacing with all functions in Smart to ensure that all aspects of the “product” meet customer and achieve Smart’s objectives in terms of quality, cost, service to the committed schedules. Develop plans, resources and project management methodologies, to ensure that Smart’s “Time to Market” product introductions meet “business case” objectives. Develop and manage individual and team objectives per SMART’s performance management system. Hold people accountable, measure accomplishments, provide feedback, delegate and keep people informed. Manage Operations project management resources in Calgary and in remote locations. Personally, drive key projects specific to Global Operations including those focused on improving processes. Ensure projects are adequately represented and manage resource constraints collaboratively with the other Operations and Product Development Functional managers. Lead analyses on global operational supply chain options related to make versus buy decisions, and expansion/modification of manufacturing, logistics or design sites. Provide business cases to support recommendations. Develop and maintain overall excellence in project management skills and methodologies. Develop and manage annual budgets of the department including departmental expenses, project expenses, and project capital. Supervision provided and received Manage a team of professionals in the new product introduction group including, procurement, component engineering, quality, manufacturing and test engineering extending to other functional groups including Product Development, Product Management, Marketing and Finance. Receive guidance on overall company objectives and individual performance from Director, Strategic Supply Management. Working conditions Significant travel will be required as part of this role. Travel can be both in Canada and internationally. This position will require frequent conference calls outside of normal business hours. Education and work experience Degree in Engineering preferred. MBA an asset. Strong leadership skills with 5+ years’ experience as a people Manager 10 years of relevant operations and/or project management with a broad understanding of key manufacturing areas including: planning, procurement, logistics and manufacturing engineering Experience with a variety of technologies including, electronics assembly, plastics, metal fabrication and test systems. Excellent communication, presentation, written, and interpersonal skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, uses multiple problem-solving skills and techniques and great at gleaning meaning from what-ever data is available Extremely, strong organization skills, coupled with project management, and collaboration aptitudes. Demonstrated success in a dynamic, team-based environment Experience using PLM system an asset, ie. Agile, Windchill Project Management certification preferred.

Title: Project Manager - Branch
Job_Description: Position Overview  Manage the event crew, operational elements, and & client’s expectations while on show site. Ensure successful and profitable execution of projects from signed sales proposal to final invoicing. Assist the sales team in determining event technical requirements and communicate with all parties involved to collect and disseminate information required for execution. Analyze equipment and labor requirements, coordinate the fulfillment of these requirements, and communicate execution plan.  Key Job Responsibilities  Event and Labor Management  Schedule and supervise on-site crew including full-time and part-time employees. Negotiate rates for outside labor. Prepare and implement technical production schedules as necessary to coordinate all crew, vendors and deliveries. Supervise and coordinate any required purchase orders, travel requirements, or per diem requests for assigned crewmembers. Communicate project scope, execution plan, and individual responsibilities with crew and manage to plan requirements. Designate crew leads and review all necessary information to ensure successful event for the client and PSAV. Operate equipment as necessary. Utilize and mentor regional PSAV technicians on event execution and best practices to help improve the local knowledge base and overall level of experience in the market. Conduct local training sessions as directed.  Event Planning  Generate schedules and drawings, contact venue to coordinate project including load in / out procedures, power, loading dock permissions, etc. Maintain focus on client needs by attending client meetings, creating and maintaining organized show files, and responding to client concerns, questions, and problems. Assist the sales team to help determine equipment needs and technical solutions for assigned project. Supervise the creation of CAD documents and renderings that are accurate and convey the intent of the technology. Review all sales documents to confirm that the equipment and technical positions will in fact meet the client’s needs, and that profit forecast assumptions are attainable.  Required Skills 5 years technical experience in the Corporate Staging or Broadcast industry, including 1 year in a supervisory role Proven track record managing projects and multiple priorities in a fast paced environment Works well under pressure Ability to multi task Strong written and oral communication skills Strong Technical Background Strong Client relationship skills MS Office experience preferred CAD knowledge / experience preferred HS Diploma required  PSAV is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices. PSAV will provide accommodation to people with disabilities upon request throughout our recruitment process.  #LI-LD1 Required Experience : 5 years tech experience in the Corporate Staging or Broadcast industry, including 1 year in a supervisory role  Strong written and oral communication skills  Strong Technical Background  Strong Client relationship skills  Works well under pressure  Ability to multi task  MS Office experience preferred  CAD knowledge / experience preferred  HS Diploma required  Job Location Calgary,Alberta,CA  Position Type Full-Time/Regular

Title: Service Project Manager
Job_Description: Tasks The successful candidate will manage projects and contracts related to service of ABB equipment in various industries as well as developing and maintaining partnership relationships with ABB clients and suppliers. Main responsibilities of the Service Project Manager include: - Manage moderately complex projects and service contracts; - Establish, monitor and adjust project schedule and communication flow; - Coordinate project team effort including engineering, testing, site work activities, etc.; - Control project documentation; - Assess and manage project risks and opportunities; - Work in accordance with ABB procedures using applicable tools; - Ensure contract completion to meet or exceed the expected profitability; - Review status, monitor, analyze and report on contract performance; - Approve purchase orders on related projects; - Open, manage and invoice related to the project or contract; - Serve as primary interface between customers and project teams on all contractual matters; - Build relationships with and influence internal and external stakeholders to deliver successful projects; - Resolve disputes over back charges, delays, warranties, etc.; - Report opportunities and problems to ABB management in a timely manner; - Ensure/manage customer satisfaction and responsiveness to customers; - Ensure quality and continuous performance improvement; - Review and approve relevant ABB Change Orders; - Pursue opportunities for additional sales and change orders related to the assigned projects; - Prepare quotes and implement contract changes based on customer requests using support of relevant ABB personnel; - Conduct meetings in an efficient manner. - Other duties as assigned Requirements - Engineering, Technology and/or Project Management designation (Electrical Degree or Diploma) - Experience and understanding of DCS (Distributed Control Systems) and/or electrical control apparatus/systems would be an asset - Experience with ABB technologies and internal processes would be an asset - 5 to 10 years of industry exposure - Self-motivated and ability to work in a team environment as well as autonomously (as required) - Excellent communication skills – written and oral - Strong interpersonal skills with customers and co-workers are critical - Strong computer skills – Word, Excel, Email and Internet based applications. - Experience with SAP required - Experience in accounting / financial transactions related activities - Must be detail oriented - Self-starter, motivated, positive outlook, willingness to take on new and unfamiliar tasks. - Must be able to multi-task and work in a positive manner with co-workers, suppliers and customers - Able and willing to work overtime if needed to address cyclic workloads Additional Information ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and values a diverse workforce. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities. In support of our Employment Equity Program, women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply and self-identify in the application process. We also offer a stimulating work environment, competitive salaries and a complete benefits package. ABB is prepared to act on requests for disability accommodations that might be required to allow any disabled person to access our facility. Please advise us if any attending person requires/requests some specific form of disability accommodation. The masculine form is used as neutral gender and includes men and women.

Title: Senior Construction Project Manager
Job_Description: Position Overview  We are looking for experienced project managers looking to take the next step in their career. We are seeking entrepreneurial leaders who treat each project as if they are running a business; providing outstanding customer service and delivering a project that is profitable and safe. The Project Manager is responsible for all aspect of the project over its entire lifespan (plan, execute, monitor and finalize) according to deadlines and approved budget. This individual identifies and gathers the stakeholders and resources required to build the project team and follows project management best practices to define the project scope, budget, and schedule as well as identifies project risks and opportunities for continuous improvement. Key Responsibilities The responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:  Owning the success, safety, quality and profitability of a project. Develop project plans, including scope, budget, schedule, and project team responsibilities to accomplish project objectives. Ensure projects are executed in accordance with contracts, drawings and specifications. Responsible for continual cost control, management and forecasting of projects. Review and approval of required project administration and documentation. Manage project contract agreements to ensure they are reviewed, processed and executed. Prepare and collect progress billings and holdback receivables in a timely manner. Manage subcontractors and suppliers. Develop and lead project coordinators and junior project managers. Maintain excellent communication with the client before, during and after the project. Negotiate contracts, change management and claims. Provide proactive leadership in safety by insuring all company, client and legislated Safety policies and procedures are met or exceeded. Ensure all necessary project safety provisions and procedures are implemented on each project.  Qualifications and Education Requirements The successful candidate will have:  Post-secondary education – Civil Engineering, Pipeline Engineering, Environmental Engineering or Environmental Science Degree or equivalent Engineering Technologist program. Civil construction experience, in some capacity, in their career, in civil construction Proficient in the use of project management software (MS Project, Excel, etc.). Project Management experience related to construction, pipelines and oil and gas. Professional experience in managing to proven project management best practices. Ideally, knowledge of applicable pipeline codes and regulations including CSA Z662 and CSA Z245.30. The ability to work collaboratively and communicate with varied stakeholders and groups. Ability to develop relationships with in a project setting. Strong writing skills to develop clear and concise project planning documents. Formal training or certification in Project Management is considered an asset.  Qualifications Skills  Preferred Computer Skills Intermediate Interpersonal Skills Expert Managing Multiple Priorities Expert Attention to Detail Expert Ability to Meet Timelines Expert Behaviors  Preferred Loyal: Shows firm and constant support to a cause Leader: Inspires teammates to follow them Functional Expert: Considered a thought leader on a subject Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well Education Required Bachelors or better in Engineering or related field.  Experience Required Civil construction experience 7-10 years: Project management experience related to construction, pipelines and Oil & Gas  Licenses & Certifications Required PMP Certificate

Title: Senior Municipal Project Manager
Job_Description: Ready to put your project management expertise to work on complex, municipal water projects? Are you great with people and have a track record managing teams that get the job done? Parsons is now hiring an experienced Senior Municipal Project Manager with a desire to work on creating innovative, practical solutions to various municipal water projects in Calgary that enhance the urban fabric of our community.  In this role you will be responsible for the scope development, scope management and commercial performance of the project to meet project goals and objectives. Plans and defines program goals and devises methods to accomplish them; develops in-depth knowledge of client objectives, contract terms and corporate policies. Provides technical leadership in the area of environmental assessment and water utility infrastructure. You will be responsible for identification, definition and execution of major water utility infrastructure and environmental assessment projects and opportunities, as well as lead and assist Program and Business Development Managers in pursuit of new business.  SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES :   Lead by example in the promotion of Parsons Core Values - Safety, Quality, Integrity, Diversity, Innovation, and Sustainability Performs business development activities in a "seller-doer" role including client research, targeting projects, developing win-strategies, establishing project revenue and profit targets, developing scopes of work, WBS/budgets, schedules, writing proposals, client presentations, and participating in contract negotiations Develops and implements project management plans for stewarding multiple projects to meet or exceed client and internal expectations Accountable to the clients for the delivery of the engineering work generated by the team including overall quality, schedule compliance, and budget adherence. Responsible for project change management Accountable to the internal organization for the delivery of the project financial commitments and compliance with contractual targets Possesses experience in the design of water utility infrastructure (potable, wastewater, and storm) including pump / lift stations, linear infrastructure, siphons, stormwater management and drainage, stormwater Low-Impact Development installations. Experience in river engineering and hydrology is an asset. Excellent report writing skills and abilities to present technical presentations to clients as well as the public at conferences Experience working on projects for The City of Calgary Water Resources and Services as well as similar groups in surrounding municipalities and communities. Additional skills such as master planning, site development for design of utilities Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.   PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE: 4-year degree in Engineering (or related field) and 15+ years of related work experience. Professional Engineer Alberta (APEGA) registration required Requires excellent interpersonal team skills to function in integrated project teams and respond to customer/stakeholder demands. Candidates must have demonstrated ability to effectively communicate (both verbally and in writing) with team members, managers, and clients on highly complex and difficult engineering/software issues pertaining to assigned tasks.

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Compugen is an organization that encourages and supports ongoing training and development opportunities. We are composed of a talented, diversified workforce that performs collectively in an entrepreneurial and flexible environment. Our staff members have access to the latest and greatest technologies in performing their daily activities. Well-developed interpersonal skills Advanced skills in written and verbal communication Analytical, systematic and forward thinker Post-secondary degree/certification or equivalent PMP certification nice to have 5-7 year successful experience as a Project Manager, Project Leader or Delivery Manager is a requirement. Computer literacy; proficient in word processing, spreadsheet, flowchart & presentation and project management software tools Must be able to be comfortable in key technologies currently employed by Compugen (highly recommended) Interest in continuing to follow developments in relevant technologies (desirable) Plan and implement small to large scale projects. Direct all aspects of the project planning and execution phases. Work with project team members to create detailed project plan. Engage resources as required by the plan for the successful deployment of the project. Detail and assign work package plans. Meet regularly with the team to follow up on tasks, deliverables and issues. Communicate status to the client via written reports and meeting or teleconferences. Track project plan to baseline against time and budget constraints. Manage project scope & handle scope change requests using appropriate documentation. Log, monitor and handle project issues, analyze & recommend viable alternatives. Hold weekly team meetings and attend client meetings. Lead the Compugen team members towards the successful conclusion of the project. Act as a single point of contact for both the internal Compugen team and the client team. Manage customer expectations. Ensure a high level of customer service and view toward repeat business. Use Compugen's project methodology. Ensure proper documentation is completed & stored where accessible. Documentation includes Statement of Work, plan, schedule, scope changes log, issues log, risk assessment, minutes of status meeting and PIR. Must follow the Compugen Inc. Deployment Guidelines Must strive to improve The Deployment Guidelines Must be able to report on the P&L of all projects Must report on the customer satisfaction of the projects; target is a letter of reference or project survey. Must manage and escalate issues as required.

Title: Project Manager, Product Development (Calgary, AB)
Job_Description: Project Manager – Product Development – Calgary, AB    Position Overview We are seeking an enthusiastic and highly motivated Project Manager with an in-depth knowledge of insurance to work closely with our Sales, Account Management and Marketing Teams to manage projects for the development and launch of new as well as existing products. The Project Manager, Product Development will be responsible for the coordination the proposal and renewal process in collaboration with various departments.  Key Responsibilities  Establish and maintain positive client relationships. Understand client needs, and advocate on behalf of clients to ensure project success;  Build, develop, and maintain business/team relationships, vital to the success of the project;  In collaboration with senior management and stakeholders, define project scope, objectives and deliverables that support client goals;  Develop and deliver full-scale project plans, progress reports, and required documents to clients and internal project team;  Set and continually manage project expectations with team members and other stakeholders;  Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path;  Liaise with client and project stakeholders on an ongoing basis; communicate expectations to team member and external parties in a timely and clear fashion;  Contribute to a multi-disciplinary team environment to create comprehensive, strategic solutions for clients, based on their business goals;  Draft and submit budget proposals, and recommend subsequent budget changes where necessary;  Manage changes in project scope, identify potential crises and devise contingency plans;  React to project adjustments and alterations promptly and efficiently;  Conduct project closeout summaries and create recommendation reports to identify successful and unsuccessful project elements;  Analyse profitability, revenue, bill rates, and utilization across multiple projects;  Interaction, assistance and negotiation with MSH internal underwriters, client services and direct sales force personnel;  Providing proposals that accurately reflect that client needs are technically accurate, grammatically correct and can withstand a high degree of external and internal scrutiny;  Creation, review and analysis of proposals and renewal memos;  Preparation of internal implementation and renewal notification;  Coordinate, manage, and track proposals and renewals.  Other duties as requested and required.  Qualifications  3-5 years relevant experience in the insurance industry;  1-3 years Life and Health insurance experience;  2 years’ experience in Project Management;  Post-secondary degree in Business Administration;  Advanced skills with MS Office (Mainly Word and Excel);  Required Skills  Demonstrated ability to develop, launch, and manage new and existing products;  Demonstrated ability to develop productive working relationships with other departments;  Ability to exercise independent judgement or initiative;  Productive under minimal supervision;  Strong relationship building skills with internal and external parties. About: We are a leading worldwide provider of expatriate insurance solutions. We advise multinationals, international organizations and businesses in the setup of international benefit programs, providing related services with high added value. We cover the risk of health, life, disability, and emergency medical assistance for more than 330,000 insured members by means of our four regional offices (Calgary, Paris, Dubai, and Shanghai); all sharing the same integrated information system. MSH INTERNATIONAL is committed to fostering a workplace that promotes diversity and inclusion and is proud to have a multicultural team of more 60 nationalities speaking over 40 different languages.    MSH INTERNATIONAL Americas – 2018 Page 1 of 2 The Benefits MSH INTERNATIONAL recognizes the hard work and commitment of their employees and offers, in addition to a competitive salary, a comprehensive benefits package, including:  Sales Compensation incentive  Health & Drug Benefits  EAP Benefits  Life Insurance and Accidental Death & Dismemberment Benefits  Short Term Disability Benefits  Deferred Profit Sharing Plan  Wellness/Health Facility Benefit  Health Care Spending Account  MSH INTERNATIONAL also recognizes the importance of workplace & life balance, offering flexible working schedules.  MSH INTERNATIONAL Americas – 2018 Page 2 of 2

Title: Project Manager, Calgary, Alberta
Job_Description: Project Manager, Calgary, Alberta Killam Apartment REIT, based in Halifax, Nova Scotia, is one of Canada’s largest residential landlords, owning, operating and developing multi-family apartments and manufactured home communities. Killam’s current portfolio includes $2.4 billion in real estate assets. Killam’s strategy to maximize its value and long-term profitability includes concentrating on three key areas of growth: 1) increasing earnings from its existing portfolio, 2) expanding its portfolio and diversifying geographically through accretive acquisitions, with an emphasis on newer properties, and 3) developing high-quality properties in its core markets. Killam’s Trust Units are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol KMP.UN. Killam is an award-winning employer, having been recognized as one of the Best Places to Work in Atlantic Canada, Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, as well as one of Canada’s Top Small and Medium Employers. Reporting to the Vice President of Developments, the Project Manager will coordinate development projects, acquisitions and other capital projects in the Calgary area. The candidate, an independent self-starter with exceptional communication and reporting skills, has a solid understanding of building construction, project management, and financial analysis. This is an opportunity to join a growing and innovative organization as we expand our operations in Western Canada. Responsibilities: Oversee and project manage new multi-residential construction projects Generate financial analysis of new developments and acquisitions including budgets Prepare partner updates Visit sites to review issues and provide direction to the construction managers Review third party and construction manager reports Review contracts and change orders Investigate sites for viability of development  Profile and Core Competencies:  Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Architecture Minimum of two to three years of experience in a similar role Experience in the construction industry, specifically in building construction Knowledge of mechanical, electrical, structural and architectural plans Proven project management skills and experience Strong supervisory and leadership skills Organizational skills and attention to detail Strong decision making skills and business acumen Ability to work independently and in a team environment Strong written and verbal communication skills Some travel will be required  A competitive salary and benefits package is offered commensurate with required skills and experience. Qualified applicants may submit their resumes through Killam’s online application system. Closing date: Friday, May 25, 2018 We thank you for your interest in Killam and all qualified applicants will be considered; however, only those chosen for an interview will be contacted. Please no phone calls.

Title: Project Manager – Calgary
Job_Description: Commercial Construction Project Manager  Are you inspired by mutual respect and solid relationships? Do you have a desire to learn and to share what you’ve learned? Does the opportunity to work for a 100% employee-owned company appeal to you? Want to be part of something bigger than yourself. We are an award winning, leading Canadian builder that seeks a Commercial Construction Project Manager in our Calgary District.  Are you someone who can work in a fast-paced environment and thrives on deadlines? We are looking for an energetic individual to support our Operations Team. In this role your main responsibilities will be:  Adopt and integrate all Chandos project management systems; Manage project activities throughout the life cycle of the project, including the allocation of adequate resources, scheduling, documentation, and budgets; Achieve the project budget and complete accurate monthly forecasts; Liaise with client representatives, architect representative, subcontractors, etc. As the successful candidate for this position, you will bring your:  Technical diploma in a construction-related field (CET) or related engineering degree; a Gold Seal certification would be desirable; 8 years of progressively responsible work experience in Alberta within the Commercial/ Institutional construction industry; Commitment to working in a team environment, and good team-building abilities; Superior leadership qualities with a demonstrated track record of dealing successfully with internal and external clients; Able to interpret and effectively manage multiple and competing priorities and timelines. Our unique culture attracts a high calibre employee, whether it’s in the field or office. Those who thrive at Chandos do so because they understand that their success is dependent on the collective effort. That’s because every Chandos employee demonstrates our core values “WE BUILD BETTER TOGETHER.”  Where do you stand in your current career? Are you fine with status quo, or do you want an opportunity to make an impact? At Chandos, it’s about alliances and ideas not egos or agendas. If you’re looking for the opportunity to make your mark, we should talk. So, send us your cover letter, resume, and salary expectations. Because opportunity is one thing we’re very big on at Chandos.

Title: Project Manager - Calgary
Job_Description: Harvard Property Management Inc. has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to join its team. Harvard is a full service real estate management company based in Western Canada that is recognized for its reputation in leadership, flexibility, quality and performance. The company oversees 8.8 million square feet of commercial properties with regional offices in Regina, Calgary, Edmonton and Winnipeg.This position will report to the Senior Project Manager and will be part of a Project Management team providing capital project management to external and internal clients. The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, contract administration and successful delivery of a variety of leasing construction and capital projects throughout Harvard’s managed portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.What you will bring to the job: - 5 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings;- The completion of a PMP designation is an asset;- Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting;- Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships;- Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines;- The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment;- Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment;- Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and- Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.What you will receive: - Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment;- Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP;- Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program;- Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and- Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. If you feel you are the person we are looking for in this position, please apply with your resume in confidence through the Careers tab at　www.hillcompanies.com.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Project Manager (Calgary)
Job_Description: Job Description Project Manager (Calgary) Are you looking to be part of an Innovative, Environmentally conscious and Collaborative team? If so, look no further. One of the top ten general contractors in Canada and part of the largest construction organization in North America, Clark Builders serves industrial, commercial and institutional market sectors. Clark Builders core values represent the spirit that our company was founded on: Respect Others, Have a Can-Do Attitude, Succeed as a Team, Lead with Courage, Deliver Results. They are more than words: each one underlies the commitment that we bring to every person we meet, every team we build and every project we work on, start to finish. We are looking for team members interested in working in an Innovative, environmentally conscious and collaborate team.  Reporting overall to the Vice President, Operations; on a day-to-day basis the Project Manager will be reporting and taking direction from his/her Project Executive in all aspects of the construction process on the project that they are assigned. The Project Manager working with the Project Superintendent will be responsible for and not limited to managing safety, quality, risks, maximizing project earnings, human resources and staff training, client expectations, accurate financial reporting and assuring efficient, timely, fulfillment of all corporate and project obligations, complete communications among all project team members and organizations to construct the project on time, within the budget and to the quality specified. The Project Manager role is diverse, and varies between each project. The Project Manager is also responsible to foster and develop client, consultant, third party and trade relationships in the course of their duties. Duties/Responsibilities: Project Start Up: Chair the project handover meeting from Project Development/Estimating Conduct project trade buyout meetings Conduct project startup meetings for individual trades Utilities and site services applications Permit applications. Review and or prepare prime contract against submitted tender and/or proposal, ready for senior management review and client /consultant review Quantity take-offs for a various scopes of the project. Finalize Prime Contractor. Client Risk assessment. Prepare project execution plan. Establish project organization charts and staffing needs. Assist in estimating tender closeout and buy outs. Setup project addition form, financials and billing schedule. Prepare staffing and resources plan. Prepare logistics planning. Establish file management plan. Procurement management, project buyout and award. Prepare and issue letter of intents (LOI) and subcontracts. Put in place bonding and insurance. Finalize project estimates. Safety planning including assistance with re-project hazard assessments, ongoing safety inspections, ongoing safety hazard assessment and other duties. Understand and abide by the requirements of the CB Safety and Loss Prevention Policies and Procedures Understand and abide by the requirements of the local building authorities, develop and maintain relationships with permits and licensing personnel including building inspectors Quality control planning. Communications plan. Create and manage schedule. Strategic and fee enhancement planning. Establish and manage client and corporate objective. Modify project plan for success. Project Execution and Document Control: Track productivity and performance of the project. Project accounting. Manage stakeholder expectations Chair the Quarterly operational review meetings Manage staff assignments. Prepare a cash flow project and manage the project in accordance with the cash flow requirements. Advise management of pending risk elements and seek assistance on all risk matters or legal matters. Establish and manage document control process. Establish and manager the quality control plan. Establish and manage the project schedule, including the implementation of the Last Planner System. Chair trade, owner/consultant meetings and issue minutes. Chair, site safety meetings and issue minutes Project accounting and cost control, including working with project accountants Monthly financial reports and eCMS, including the preparation of monthly project reports, both internal and external including the monthly MOR report. Time cards. PO and subcontract claims. Client billings including preparation, payment, etc. Dispute and claim management. Lead and train project teams including developing and mentoring support staff including project coordinators, junior project managers Resolve trade and performance issues. Provide regular management of Key Project Indicators (KPI’s) Project Close Out:  Prepare the project close out procedures including punch lists, start up and handover requirements Manage the trade contractor deliverables for project close out, including startup, warranties, demonstration requirements Administrative project closure. Trade/Subcontracts. Prime contractor. Commissioning and equipment start-up. Training seminars. City inspections. Final and holdback invoices and payment Final consultant and schedule C’s. Substantial completion certificate. Warranty period. Support and grow ongoing sub-trade and client relationships. Assist in obtaining work by way of completing a portfolio of successful projects. Participate in project interviews. Participate in CBU Leadership. Ensure internal and external requirements are achieved. Manage financial collection and closeout. Other duties and responsibilities as required. Skills & Knowledge: Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills. The ability to efficiently assist and administer multiple tasks. Analytical thinker to interpret information in order to understand issues. Ability to make decisions on a variety of levels of complexity, ambiguity and risk. Can define tasks and milestones to achieve objectives while ensuring optimal use of resources. Can prevent, manage and resolve conflicts. Questions conventional approaches, explores alternatives and provides innovative solutions. Can identify, assess and mange risks while striving to meet objectives. Qualifications & Experience: A Post-Secondary Certificate/Degree in Engineering or the equivalent of a designated Professional Engineer or a Technical School graduate in a Construction related discipline. Minimum 5 years’ experience working in a Project Manager role in Construction on projects up to $50 million Management organization, managing construction of Commercial, Industrial or Institutional buildings. Can lead, mentor and motivate medium to large project teams with a hands-on approach Must be able to competently manage the construction process from project startup to project closeout for all sizes and levels of complexity projects. Actively participate in career development opportunities Undertake and receive required safety training in accordance with policies. Healthcare experience is an asset Competencies: Networking and relationship building; Customer focus; Teamwork; Interpersonal skills; Results focus; Integrity; Leadership; Managing for results; Developing others; Risk Management; Creative thinking; Conflict resolution; Planning and organizing; Decision Making; and, Analytical thinking
