The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.What you will bring to the job: - 5 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings;- The completion of a PMP designation is an asset;- Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting;- Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships;- Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines;- The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment;- Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment;- Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and- Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.What you will receive: - Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment;- Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP;- Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program;- Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and- Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. If you feel you are the person we are looking for in this position, please apply with your resume in confidence through the Careers tab at　www.hillcompanies.com.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: An exceptional opportunity currently exists to join one of North America’s leading management training and productivity improvement consulting firms with a solid reputation for delivering quantifiable and sustainable operational and financial results to our diverse Client base.  Parisella, Vincelli Associates Consulting Group (PVA) is made up of a dedicated and passionate group of professionals from a variety of professional disciplines. Our mandate is to improve our Client’s operational and financial performance through a wide variety of techniques including: on-the-floor one-on-one coaching, development and installation of Management Operating Systems, enhanced work methods, streamlined business processes, etc. Our business mantra is three-fold: Targeted Performance; Measurable Results; and Sustainable Change. We are currently building a database of potential candidates, who will eventually join our growing team of experienced and dedicated professionals. You have proven experience managing project teams within the following disciplines: change management, productivity management, process improvement, process re-engineering, cycle-time enhancements, organizational redesign, and supply chain management.  As a Project Manager, you are looking for a team environment which is fast paced, challenging, and motivating, while providing you with a career path where you will be assigned to our Clients’ sites located across North America, and to improve their business processes through PVA’s proven approach and methodology.  Required Qualifications  Minimum 5-7 years of experience in related consulting industries, with a proven track record supported by a minimum 3-5 years of experience as a Project Manager  Direct involvement in implementing organizational and performance based change initiatives, and successfully working with various improvement methodologies and their application in the Client’s work environment through multidisciplinary project teams  Bachelor’s Degree such as a BA, BSc, BComm, or BBA (MBA or Master’s is an asset) with a focus on operations management, organizational development, business management, performance enhancement, etc.  Diversified business background and acumen, supported by strong analytical and mathematical proficiencies  Strong training and one-on-one coaching skills  Excellent communication and presentation skills (both oral and written)  Proficient with Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, Power Point, etc.)  Demonstrated ability to lead, manage and motivate project teams to succeed in a dynamic, fast paced, and results oriented environment  Demonstrated ability to adapt quickly in a constantly changing project environment  Organized, disciplined, and motivated to succeed  Preferred Qualifications  Excellent understanding, knowledge, and / or expertise in business sectors such as: Automotive, Consumer Goods & Services, Energy & Resources, Forest Products, Health Care, Manufacturing, Mining & Metals, Telecommunications, and Transportation & Logistics  Demonstrated knowledge / understanding of concepts such as Lean, Six Sigma, TQM, JIT, MRP, ERP, procurement, etc  Fluency in a second language (French)  Proficiency with project management and application software Must Have the Following Requirements  Ability to travel 100% of the week (from Sunday night to Friday)  Have a valid Driver’s licence  Valid passport (American or Canadian)  Why join PVA?  Dynamic, challenging and results oriented team environment supported by a passionate group of professionals  Growth potential and continuous learning opportunities  Competitive salary and benefits package  Permanent, full-time position (not contract work)  Retirement program participation (RRSP in Canada / 401K in the USA)  Annual vacation & sick day allotments and an exclusive Travel Day Program  Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

Title: Construction Project Coordinator
Job_Description: Position Overview  We are looking for recently graduated engineers and engineering techs who have a passion to learn, a high energy level and an interest in a career in civil construction. We are seeking individuals who want to jump start their careers by joining an entrepreneurial organization that will expose them to a wide variety of work types and geographies and provide them with the skills to grow. The Project Coordinator is responsible for supporting senior project managers in all aspects of a project over its entire lifespan (plan, execute, monitor and finalize) according to deadlines and approved budget. This individual is critical to the success of our projects and the delivery of high quality, safe and profitable projects. Secure commits to develop project coordinators who successfully meet expectations, to ensure they have the skills and experiences to become successful project managers in our organization.  Key Responsibilities:  The responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:  Proactively identifying project needs and anticipating requests from the project team Assist senior project manager in achieving project goals in regard to Safety, Cost, Productivity, Schedule, and QA/QC. Provide data to the senior project manager for cost control, management and forecasting of projects. Assist in the development of proposals to customers. Project administration and documentation. Prepare and collect progress billings and holdback receivables in a timely manner. Manage subcontractors and suppliers.  Qualifications and Educational Requirements:  The successful candidate will have:  High energy level and a positive attitude. Ability to read and understand contracts, drawings and specifications. Post-secondary education - Engineering or Environmental Science Degree or EIT, or CET. Proficient computer skills (MS Office & MS Project at a minimum). Experience in the Construction industry, in any capacity, would be a definite asset. Skills in project and scope planning, project implementation, data organization and in report writing. Excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills. Detail-oriented, team player comfortable operating under firm schedule milestones. Strong work ethic, and eager to learn. A class 5 driver’s license.  Qualifications Skills  Preferred Microsoft Office Some Knowledge Team Oriented Expert Interpersonal Skills Expert Attention to Detail Expert Behaviors  Preferred Team Player: Works well as a member of a group Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity Education Required Bachelors or better in Engineering or related field.  Experience Required Experience in the Construction industry, in any capacity, would be a definite asset. Preferred Skills in project and scope planning, project implementation, data organization and in report writing Licenses & Certifications Required Drivers Licence (Class 5)

Title: Flooring Sales and Project Manager
Job_Description: Job purpose: oversees planning,implementation,tracking of a specific short term projects.Experienced and knowledge of project management is required.Job Type: CommissionExperience:Sales: 3 years

Title: Project Coordinator/Trainer
Job_Description: Trufla Technology is first of its kind – a company offering a complete suite of digital solutions for the modern insurance brokerage. From SEO and web design, to lead management, branded customer service and API’s, Trufla provides a 360° digital strategy for brokerages and reimagines the way their customers interact with insurance. Think insurance is boring? Think again. We have also reimagined what an office should be. Did you know the average person spends around 2,000 at work every year? That’s crazy and probably more time than you spend in any other area of your life. We wanted to make time at Trufla awesome. Our office space already kicks ass, but we still added a few perks: Ping-pong (for exercise) Craft soda on tap (on Fridays we add ice cream=floats) Massage chairs (the super-deluxe good ones) Flexible schedule (because life) Staff vacay (5 star of course – last year’s pool party in Mexico was epic)  PROJECT COORDINATOR/TRAINER ABOUT YOU The project coordinator/trainer is a dynamic role that works with both internal and external clients. This individual must be high organized with high attention to detail and exceptional customer service skills. PROJECT COORDINATOR DUTIES Manage new build projects, work on time line and make sure developers are on track Gather required information from clients Follow up with clients for requirements and branding approvals Act as a graphic support Testing of new builds – apps, portal, administration and reporting Track client usage on apps Manage all support requests  TRAINER DUTIES Onboarding new clients – coaching clients to increase adoption of the system Data Analysis (as requested) Client sign up procedures Create and maintain supporting documents  QUALIFICATIONS 3+ years of customer service experience Post-secondary degree or diploma in Project Management or Business Administration Demonstrates initiative and decision-making skills Experience with data management Experience with application support Outstanding interpersonal and communications skills, both verbal and written  VALUES & COMPETENCIES Positive attitude and enthusiasm for employee training and development Flexible and adaptable with proven problem solving ability High degree of professionalism and integrity Demonstrated accountability and reliability in the quality and timeliness of work Works well within a team and independently and able to adjust to tight and changing deadlines Critical thinker with strong attention to details [Not translated in selected language]

Title: Project Coordinator - Calgary
Job_Description: You want a career where you utilize your exceptional communication skills. You are capable of coordinating all the city construction approvals. You want to embrace our vision and our values around our people (learning, growing, and having fun), our business (longevity, sustainability, growth), and our community (pride, impact, legacy).  Join our fast-paced and motivated team at Strategic Group, Calgary, as the Project Coordinator. You will work with and support the Project Manager, Superintendent and other members of the team.  Job Requirements  As our Project Coordinator, you will: Have a minimum of 2 years construction experience Have a certificate or degree in a related field Receive all invoices, maintain all the related paper administrative work on site and act as main liaison with the team in Head Office Issue all change orders and site instructions to subtrades on site Prepare, submit and track requests for information Coordinate all the shop drawings from subtrades and ensure they have been communicated to all the stakeholders Deal with the procurement for the day to day operations on site Send award and rejection letters for subtrades Coordinate and schedule utilities Coordinate weekly meetings and take minutes Liaison with City for construction needs Create and maintain hand over manuals to client Track inventory and rental equipment on site Be efficient in MS Office and MS Project Have a proficient knowledge on budgets

Title: Project Coordinator, Agriculture
Job_Description: Why the Stampede?  For over 100 years the Calgary Stampede has been the heart and soul of our city. It is both where and how we come together to celebrate our unique brand of western hospitality and community spirit. As we embark on the next chapter of our story, we will deliver exceptional experiences that entertain, educate and engage visitors. We will build inspired spaces to bring our community together to celebrate, and we will further energize the brand that has come to define our city. Our vision is to create a world-class, year-round gathering place for the community.  Position Summary  We are looking for a proactive and responsible project coordinator to support Agriculture programs. This position is a member of the Agriculture and Western Events team responsible for providing event coordination and administrative support to the management group, agriculture programming managers and volunteers on execution of year-round agriculture programs. The project coordinator works closely with the programming managers to prepare comprehensive action plans, including resources, time frames and budgets for programs. To succeed in this role you should have excellent organizational and problem solving skills, as well as formal communication writing skills.  Note: this is a casual part-time position ranging from 0-44 hours per week.  Responsibilities  The project coordinator’s duties are to ensure the agriculture program managers and the agriculture management team is supported. Responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:  Assisting with the coordination of program schedules, resources and communications. Liaising with the agriculture program managers to identify and coordinate program requirements. Support the creation and maintenance of comprehensive program plans, documentation and reports. Prepare for meetings with the committees and employees through room bookings, catering requirements and room setups. Provide back-up administrative assistance such as reception duties and data entry. Support special projects and program initiatives as assigned. Support the Agriculture & Western Events department through office management, including, but not limited to, ordering office supplies, mail distribution, agenda creation, travel booking, record minutes and process information as requested. Qualifications  The ideal candidate will be proactive, optimistic and have worked in a dynamic environment where they have experience delivering on multiple priorities, meeting deadlines and communicating effectively and will hold the following qualifications:  Proven work experience as a project or programming coordinator. Related post-secondary degree or diploma in agriculture, business or event management. Ability to multitask while maintaining strict deadlines. Excellent organizational skills with an ability to think proactively and prioritize work. Excellent problem solving and interpersonal skills are essential. Strong oral and written communication skills via phone, email and in person. Concise and accurate business writing skills with the ability to analyze and merge information into clear and concise reports. Advance computer skills with a thorough understanding of Microsoft office Suite is required Understanding of basic accounting principles is required. Benefits  The Calgary Stampede offers a unique and exciting work environment, an excellent total compensation package and the opportunity for advancement and employee training.  To Apply  To apply, please submit your resume. All applicants are thanked in advance and only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Title: Project Coordinator (Calgary)
Job_Description: Job Description Project Coordinator (Calgary) Are you looking to be part of an Innovative, Environmentally conscious and Collaborative team? If so, look no further. One of the top ten general contractors in Canada and part of the largest construction organization in North America, Clark Builders serves industrial, commercial and institutional market sectors. Clark Builders core values represent the spirit that our company was founded on: Respect Others, Have a Can-Do Attitude, Succeed as a Team, Lead with Courage, Deliver Results. They are more than words: each one underlies the commitment that we bring to every person we meet, every team we build and every project we work on, start to finish. We are looking for team members interested in working in an Innovative, environmentally conscious and collaborate team.  Reporting to the Project Manager(s), the Project Coordinator will be responsible for assisting the Project Manager(s) in all aspects of the project that is assigned. Project Coordinator role is diverse, varies between each project. With your Project Manager(s) oversight, duties and responsibilities include and are not limited to:  Duties and Responsibilities:  Project Start Up Tendering and bid evaluations. Utilities and site services applications. Permit applications. Quantity take-offs for a various scopes of the project. Letter of intent and Subcontracts preparation. Development of the project communication plan. Schedule preparation. Project Execution and Document Control Document Control Request for Information (RFI). Site Instructions (SI). Submittals. Change Requests (CRX). Change Orders (CO). Monitor and maintain the quality plan (QA/QC). Monitor and maintain the schedule. Facilitate meetings. Record and compile meeting minutes. Follow up on meeting minute action items. Track productivity and performance of the project. Project accounting basics. Project Closeout Review, track and communicate punch and deficiency lists. Administrative duties around the project closure. Remove all insurance. Closeout utilities and site services. Remove temporary facilities. O & M Manuals. Assist with inspections, owner training and coordinate owner occupancy. Support and grow ongoing subtrade and client relationships Skills & Knowledge: Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills. The ability to efficiently assist and administer multiple tasks. Analytical thinker to interpret information in order to understand issues. Ability to make decisions on a variety of levels of complexity, ambiguity and risk. Can define tasks and milestones to achieve objectives while ensuring optimal use of resources. The ability to read, understand and interpret technical drawings and specifications. Skills and knowledge with the construction process. Qualifications & Experience: A Post-Secondary Certificate/Degree in Engineering or the equivalent of a designated Professional Engineer or a Technical School graduate in a Construction related discipline. Must have experience working in a Project Coordinator role for a Commercial, Industrial, or Institutional Construction organization. Experience must include competently delivering on Project Coordinator tasks with in the phases of the construction process from project startup to project closeout. Competencies: Networking and relationship building; Customer focus; Teamwork; Interpersonal skills; Results focus; and Integrity.

Title: Chief Project Controls Specialist
Job_Description: Maintains project ledgers showing budget line items, commitments, expenditures and forecasts. controls coupled with analysis activities  Direct all cost engineering functions, including cost forecasting, cost control, change management and cost analysis  Lead all planning, and scheduling functions, including schedule development, control, analysis, and ongoing recommendations for improvement  Interface with other project team members, including Engineering, Construction, Procurement, Office planning, IT, Accounting, Treasury, Tax, Contracts and Legal, to facilitate compliance with execution strategy and objectives  Provide status reports and related project reporting analyses to company and client management  Identify problems and coordinate with the project team to correct and ensure work is being coordinated between the other departments and offices to meet project requirements  Prepare various project controls plans and reports, financial summaries, and related activities for project management on assigned projects  Serve as a liaison with business unit functional management to coordinate workload and staffing plans, work processes, and procedures  Evaluate projects at each stage of development to ensure cost and financial activities of the project team inclusive of ensuring client/contractual obligations have been met  Plan and assist with anticipated staffing requirements for assigned projects  Review contract drafts and related terms & conditions to ensure they meet project controls requirements and coordinate development of data in support of contract compliance  Prepare, coordinate, and deliver project controls presentations to internal management and to client, as required  Participate in the development and training of assigned personnel and in the implementation of training programs  Qualifications  12+ years of experience is required  Experience working onvarious projects to include coordinating and executing project issues required  Specific experience and demonstrated skill in directing cost engineering functions, including cost estimating, cost control, change management and cost analysis required  Experience with directing, planning, and scheduling functions, including schedule development, control, and analysis required  Strong leadership skills with the ability to successfully direct and motivate a team inclusive of interacting with client personnel required  Advanced knowledge of engineering, procurement, contracts, and construction projects in the Oil & Gas industry required  Significant experience in project controls, commercial operations, and/or prime contract experience with emphasis on project controls and financial issues required  Broad knowledge of Project Control Systems and processes including leading schedule processing software, databases and spreadsheet Title: Project Assistant - Calgary, AB
Job_Description: CH2M is now Jacobs. Work as a project assistant supporting clients in Calgary while having a hand in transforming tomorrow.  Jacobs is seeking a full-time Project Assistant for our Calgary office. Each day you will be an important part of the project team as you assist with a variety of tasks and represent Jacobs to our clients over the phone, email and face to face, as well as assisting staff. The successful candidate will perform a variety of administrative and clerical support tasks, including supporting Project Managers and biophysical specialists with the scheduling and logistics for environmental field work. Tasks will include, but not be limited to, the following:  Providing professional and efficient administrative support to our project managers, project teams and local leadership Scheduling and tracking of field work and travel requirements for numerous projects Assisting with travel arrangements and logistics Working with safety, procurement and legal representatives to ensure all project arrangements meet insurance and safety requirements Scheduling meetings using Microsoft Outlook Organizing catering for meetings and performing pre/post-meeting functions Preparing meeting agendas, preparing meeting PowerPoint presentations, taking and preparing detailed meeting notes Preparing drafts and finals of correspondence and reports for internal staff and external clients Assisting staff with the preparation and submission of expense reports Assisting other Project Assistants with tasks, as required  The minimum qualifications for this position are: High School graduate or equivalent Minimum of 2+ years of relevant experience Proficiency with Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint Ability to multitask A can-do attitude  The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience: Oracle experience Experience working in a consulting or engineering environment Proven self-starter Demonstrated organization skills and attention to detail Proven high-level of professionalism, diplomacy and strong customer service skills  Join CH2M and love what you do. Focus on tackling the toughest challenges with a smile as you support the development of life changing infrastructure that improves the Calgary area. See the inherent value in your point of view as you deliver for our clients. At CH2M, the greatest challenges provide the biggest rewards. Each day, your drive and creative ideas will be providing solutions that help build a better tomorrow. Whether it is the pride that comes with accomplishment, personal growth or making a difference in the world, you will discover true success in a career that brings out the best in you at CH2M. Developing People through Challenging Projects.

Title: Senior Project SCM Specialist
Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Project SCM Specialist role will report to the Supervisor, Project SCM. The Senior Project SCM Specialist is responsible for providing contract and procurement support for a variety of pipeline and facilities projects within the Project Development Group.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Preparing request for proposal (RFP) documents associated with the execution of a new power project, as well as, supporting the team as required with RFPs for capital projects including facilities and pipelines. Managing the RFP process and correspondence with contractors, suppliers and service providers. Collaboration with multiple disciplines within the Project Development Group in preparation of RFP’s, purchase orders and contracts. Collaboration with Inter Pipeline’s legal department to ensure proper review of all contract documents. Purchase order and contract formation. Administration of purchase orders and contracts. Negotiation of purchase order and contract terms and conditions. Overseeing engineering and procurement firms’ procurement and contract activities. Attendance at project meetings providing updates and reports to project management. Facilitating the implementation of corporate initiatives related to SCM. Providing guidance and mentoring personnel in the best practices of contract and procurement management. Supporting SCM related activities within SAP.  Education, Skills and Experience: Post-Secondary Degree. 10 years of industry experience related to procurement and contracts, preferably in a project environment. Strong communication skills, good organizational skills and proficient in MS Office. The following will be considered strong assets: Power industry experience; SAP experience; and, SCMP/CPSM designation(s).

Title: Project Management Office (PMO) Team Lead
Job_Description: Universal Geomatics Solutions Corp. is seeking a Project Management Office (PMO) Team Lead to join our team. Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: The Project Manager takes a lead role on projects, liaises directly with the client/owners and is responsible for ensuring the delivery of the project on time and in budget. To be successful in this position, you must have previous end-to-end construction experience on heavy civil projects and a demonstrated track record of leading and executing profitable projects while building talent capability. You will be given the opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects across Western Canada in both operational and procurement (estimating) roles The position requires the planning, directing, and coordinating of engineering, construction, and scheduling activities on a project to ensure that goals or objectives are accomplished within the prescribed timeframe and funding parameters by performing duties personally or through the project team engaged on the project, as more explicitly defined below: Responsibilities Lead and manage the construction efforts, ensuring the successful completed project is delivered on time and in budget. You will have responsibility for overall forecasting, cost management, contingency planning and securing the profitability of the project. Support the estimating team in the bidding and pursuit process. Develop and maintain successful client/owner and JV Partner relationships on behalf of Flatiron, which can include overcoming challenges and differences of opinions insuring win-win outcomes best for the project and business. Establish and implement project objectives, policies, procedures, and performance standards in line with corporate policies. Leading by example, you will provide positive safety leadership to the project, promoting our "Don't Walk By" safety standard and Company Values. Assist in reviewing and negotiating contracts, liaising with legal counsel as appropriate in conjunction with the leadership team. Assemble key personnel for the project, utilizing internal resources as well as external through your existing network. Manage financial aspects of contracts to protect the company's interests and maintain strong relationships with client. Contribute technical direction to the pre-award process by determining project scope, planning, and estimating and during construction, act as a technical resource for the project team. Lead the project team (including staff from other groups (e.g. JV partners) and sub-consultants and sub-contractors) and coordinate all project resources. Monitor/control construction progress to ensure project is built on schedule and within budget. Continuously review field operations, ensuring that the project is constructed safely and in accordance with all design, budgetary and scheduling obligations. Draft briefs and reports summarizing project performance for use by senior leadership. Identifying required and optional changes in project scope and negotiate change orders with the owner. Supervisory Responsibility: Consistently demonstrates him/herself professionally and carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities may include attracting, selecting, onboarding and retaining talent; planning, assigning, and directing work; performance management of team members including annual performance appraisals, disciplinary actions, addressing complaints and resolving problems; building talent and succession within the team. Qualifications The successful candidate will possess the following skills and experience: A Bachelor degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management or related field from an accredited institution or equivalent training and experience is highly regarded 5+ years of proven Project Management experience with a General Contractor Substantial experience on heavy civil projects (bridges, roads, highways, rail etc) will be highly regarded Exposure to estimating will be a plus. Proven success in delivering high quality projects on time and on budget Experienced in liaising with clients, consultants, and management of site staff and subcontractors Be skilled in anticipating project needs with sufficient lead-time to avoid delays in production Demonstrated negotiation skills and ability to represent all project matters on behalf of the Company and/or Joint Venture related to cost, schedule & contract matters with owner, partners and/or subcontractors Productivity tracking and monitoring for self-performed scopes Project cost forecasting experience Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal Executive Presentation Skills Proven ability to work through and overcome conflicts productively and while maintaining professionalism at all times Demonstrate an overriding commitment to health, safety and environmental responsibility Position requires extensive travel to project sites Must be willing and able to relocate based on business needs and project assignments

Title: Project Manager/Project Assistant

The PM will work with internal and external construction personnel to ensure project construction is executed in a timely and efficient manner while maintaining integrity of design and will work closely with the project team to ensure budgets are maintained and projects are delivered on time.Job DutiesPRE-PROJECT RESPONSIBILITIES:Review with the Estimator to understand the job scope, contents of estimate, and intended schedules.Review design options, to understand the costs, quality and availability of materials.Reply to all RFI’, etc.ON-GOING PROJECT RESPONSIBILITIESPrepare project files and document submittals.Coordinate pre-start up meetings with client representative and all trades involved.Understand and assist in planning and executing work procedures; scheduling, managing and maintaining projects and budgets, work with operations to help coordinate various phases of construction to prevent delays.Assist Operations with change orders to ensure additional work is properly completed.Ensure projects are completed within schedule and on budget while providing a high level of customer service to clients.Provide comprehensive project management throughout the life cycle of the project.Monitor project progress, update project information, ordering materials for ongoing projects, coordinate components for projects and meet with clients.Manage customer experience with various project issue.Manage progress invoicing.Manage budget and billingsPOST PROJECT RESPONSIBILITIESPrepare all the necessary closeout documentation such as as-built plans, warranty forms, etc.Ensure all project deficiency is addressed prior to closing of the project.RequirementsSkills and TrainingDegree in construction management, architecture, engineering or related experienceExcellent project management skillsCompetencies surrounding building products, construction details and relevant rules, regulations and quality standardsExperience and ExpectationsProficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Project and other related systems.Previous experience in PM would be considered an asset.Working ConditionsUse of Personal Protection Equipment may be required (e.g. hard-hat, safety boots, etc.).Hazards associated with the construction industry.Occasional travel will be required with out of town projectsBusiness OverviewLeeswood is a rapidly growing construction company within the ICI industry and aims to deliver the highest quality and customer service to our clients.Why LeeswoodLeewood’s main goal is to achieve success. That is why we go above and beyond to demonstrate our commitment to our customers, ensure the safety of our employees, and protect our communities with the highest degree of integrity and enthusiasm. We are committed to sustainable and ethical growth where you can contribute in a meaningful way.Start your career at one of Alberta’s growing companies. We are looking for people who have the best to offer and provides the same in return. We offer very competitive and comprehensive compensation package, including, an industry leading benefits package, and health & wellness programs.Leeswood is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment.Job Type: Full-timeRequired experience:Project Management: Min 5 yearsJob Type: Full-timeExperience:Project Management: 5 years

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: AWI’s Project Manager is responsible for planning and executing water filtration related projects. They actively participate in a design team consisting of AWI’s Technical Advisors, other Project Managers and Draftsperson/Designer.At Anthratech Western Inc. (AWI) we provide water treatment solutions for industrialand municipal water and wastewater treatment plants across Canada and in select international markets. AWI is privately owned, with the head office and research and development facility located in Calgary, Alberta.Responsibilities and Duties: Defining the site-specific project scope and schedule.Procurement of components and coordination of delivery logistics.Travelling to work sites to attend meetings and complete inspections.Monitoring project process and communicating status updates to internal and external stakeholders.Scheduling and monitoring AWI’s on-site responsibilities, including equipment installation, performance testing and commissioning.Collaborate with AWI’s Document Specialist to develop project related documentation.Ensuring all aspects of the project meet company and worksite safety standards.Managing unexpected tasks that may arise, including troubleshooting requests, onsite services/repairs and small-parts orders.Supporting coworkers through collaboration, cross training and information sharing.Candidate RequirementsOur ideal candidate will have:A diploma in Engineering Technology or equivalent technical education/background.At least five-years of project management experience in a related field. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. No telephone, walk-in or agency inquiries.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:project management: 5 years

Title: Project Manager - Calgary
Job_Description: Harvard Property Management Inc. has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to join its team. Harvard is a full service real estate management company based in Western Canada that is recognized for its reputation in leadership, flexibility, quality and performance. The company oversees 8.8 million square feet of commercial properties with regional offices in Regina, Calgary, Edmonton and Winnipeg.This position will report to the Senior Project Manager and will be part of a Project Management team providing capital project management to external and internal clients. The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, contract administration and successful delivery of a variety of leasing construction and capital projects throughout Harvard’s managed portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.What you will bring to the job: - 5 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings;- The completion of a PMP designation is an asset;- Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting;- Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships;- Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines;- The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment;- Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment;- Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and- Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.What you will receive: - Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment;- Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP;- Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program;- Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and- Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. If you feel you are the person we are looking for in this position, please apply with your resume in confidence through the Careers tab at　www.hillcompanies.com.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Project Management Technician
Job_Description: Working for BBA means being part of a team of talented people who have the passion to succeed and the drive to excel in order to provide first-class service to clients.  Recognized for its extensive field experience and cutting-edge expertise, BBA has been delivering a comprehensive range of consulting engineering services for over 35 years, from studies and design to commissioning and then operational support. Our firm is supported by a network of offices across Canada to carry out mandates at the local, national and international levels.  BBA provides a stimulating and friendly working atmosphere. We focus on building teams with complementary talents and provide employees with a work environment conducive to developing their skills.  BBA is a Canada's Best Employer recipient from Aon Hewitt and is part of the prestigious Platinum Club of the Best Managed Companies, which unites companies that have held onto their title for over six consecutive years. For BBA, making the list speaks to the rigour of our practices and our unique approach to employee and client relations.  To find out more about BBA, follow us on LinkedIn and connect with our talent acquisition specialists: http://www.linkedin.com/company/bba_2. Job Description : Ensure steps for the project management process are applied.Set up the project structure approved by the Project Manager (PM) at the start of each project and incorporate it into the management system in an optimal manner.Identify and implement the various project management tools based on needs and in cooperation with the PM, and update them continuously and rigorously. Gather progress stages and integrate them into the system using the optimal method.Analyze the progress made in the project and discuss detected gaps and anomalies (CPI, ETC, EAC) with the PM, and notify project members. Submit and explain the results to the PM and assist him or her if actions are required.Prepare and revise project change notices and have them validated by the PM.Perform internal and external follow-ups, until the project change notices are incorporated.Ensure billing for projects that will be under your responsibility.Gather and produce supporting documents required for billing (time sheets, time report, etc.).Gather relevant information and prepare the monthly report for review by the PM.Ensure that all costs were charged to the project before closeout and make sure that all follow-up files are complete (list of deliverables, quality file, etc.). Support the PM in completing quality reviews with members of the project team.Use the BBA coding and filing system.Support project teams with activities related to coordination and travel to the site, where required.  Work Schedule : 37.5 Skills : AdaptableAbility to maintain positive peer relationshipsAbility to learn on the fly and for self-developmentPossess functional and technical skills and an ability to learnCommitted to the firm's successIndependentResults-orientedSense of planning and organizationAutonomy and leadership Requirements : DCS in Administration, ACS in Project Management Technology or a combination of relevant education and work experience At least 3 years of experience in project managementStrong abilities in management, communication and multidisciplinary team supportSolid negotiation and problem-solving skillsExcellent spoken and written communication in EnglishKnowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and Microsoft ProjectAsset: Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics AX and PrismOccasionally replace the Receptionist BBA is committed to promoting diversity and employment equity. Title: SaaS Implementation Manager
Job_Description: Benevity is seeking a Project Manager ( a key member of our Professional Services team) with a demonstrated track record in SaaS implementations.  You enjoy variety and the challenge of leading, managing and performing tasks on both major software implementations and ad hoc projects . You would operate as a dedicated client advocate who leads, develops and executes implementation plans for Benevity products & solutions to ensure our clients are successful. You are a quick study, able to learn new products and processes easily, and you enjoy leveraging that knowledge to help clients take advantage of new solutions provided by a game-changing software company.  You are someone who is technically-oriented with expert organizational skills, strong presentation skills and exemplary project management skills. You have the ability to train users effectively in a variety of environments, with a strong passion in solutioning and its ability to drive change to business outcomes. You must be client-obsessed with strong communication and analytical skills. You must be able to articulate value, inspire and be comfortable consulting and collaborating with our clients remotely or in-person.  An adept communicator, you can translate difficult concepts into layman’s terms and act as the interpreter between technical and non-technical project stakeholders. If you like being at the centre of projects and guiding them to success with a company helping its clients to change the world, read on!  Who we are  Benevity is a software company working to build better and more engaging ways for companies to unite their people around doing the right thing. For us, doing well by doing good is way more than just a tagline, but on the subject of tag, we hope you’re “it!” We’re a growing company and we’re looking for just the people to help us take our business (and Goodness) to the next level.  If you joined us you’d be joining a diverse, dedicated, and passionate team that works hard day in and day out to deliver and develop innovative solutions and peerless customer service to our growing ranks of raving fans (aka our amazing clients). You’d be working with, and for, some of the most iconic companies and charitable organizations in the world to make a real difference in their communities (and on a global scale). If you’d describe yourself as self-driven, flexible, inclusive, cooperative, quick-learning, and unafraid to tackle hard problems head-on, we want you as part of our team. And we want you to know what we think wearing jeans to work is absolutely acceptable—and feel to bring your pup along for the ride.  Though we may have outgrown our “startup” label, our fun, flexible tech culture has grown with us and still fits perfectly. More than all of that, we have a heart and hold Goodness at the forefront of everything we do. We’re getting all As as a registered B Corporation, meaning we’re happy to be counted among a growing number of companies who’re committed to higher social and sustainability standards.  What you will do  Own project implementation and delivery for Benevity clients. Manage the successful implementation of Benevity products and other ad hoc projects for prospective and existing clients, contributing to long-term client satisfaction and healthy adoption rates.  Work with key client contacts and stakeholders to understand, define and document business requirements for system configuration, development and implementation.  Collaborate with internal stakeholders (i.e., project developers, report developers, QC analysts, Business manager, and Client Service) to ensure efficient and effective system configuration, development, testing, billing, training and implementation.  Provide support to the Sales team during the pre-sales cycle to give prospective and existing clients insight into implementation processes. You’ll provide guidance on how various challenges may be resolved, enabling the team to hit their targets.  Partner with clients to identify key business goals and objectives to align products and services with the clients desired outcomes.  Conduct requirements gathering sessions and customized training sessions via online webinars, phone or in-person.  Set clear project expectations and achievable timeline goals required to execute the technical and business objectives based on the scope of the launch and supporting adoption and rollout with a solutions-oriented approach.  Manage multiple projects at once while paying strict attention to detail.  Provide regular status reporting and meet with clients regularly to discuss project progress, outstanding project tasks and risks.  Maintain an in-depth understanding of Benevity’s suite of products, and services.  What you bring  2-4 years' experience managing software implementation projects relevant work experience in account management, business analysis, consulting, Professional Services or other implementation and delivery type roles.  A Bachelors’ degree  Excellent organizational skills and great leadership aptitude.  Experience conducting client needs analysis and configuring a software platform to meet those needs.  Strong client management experience, especially related to SaaS.  Expert-level project management skills and an ability to work with multiple Enterprise clients at a time to deliver on milestones, and tasks within the scope and on time.  Strong analytical skills, detail oriented, ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.  Technical understanding – not afraid to question and investigate so that challenges can be resolved quickly.  Professional, motivated and flexible – enthusiastic about using process to deliver but understand that there’s a time and a place to go with the flow.  Can-do attitude – happily takes on any relevant task; comfortable in a fast-paced, dynamic, growing company culture.  Motivated self-starter that works well both alone and with a team.  Manages multiple projects at once while paying strict attention to detail.  Excellent verbal and written communications skills.  What you can expect  A once-in-a-career opportunity to join a mission-driven growth company on a growth trajectory and with a unique, ultra-engaged culture.  Join a team of innovative thinkers, keen to be part of a growing company that is all about helping businesses create innovative corporate and workplace giving and other Goodness programs.  Work in a fast-paced environment for a dynamic, rapidly growing company with a history of proven success and stunning colleagues.  Connect with a rapidly growing and passionate group in an open, collaborative and fun environment.  While we are grateful and appreciative of every application, we are only able to respond to those candidates selected for an interview.

Title: Senior Project Coordinator

This includes;Assisting the Project Manager to ensure the project meets budget and scheduleMaintains project file management systemsDevelops and maintains excellent relationship with sub-trades and clientsTakes full ownership of the change order process, including proving, negotiating, processing and assessing cost and schedule impact prior to reviewing with Project ManagerTrack project deliverables and provide reporting on project progress and action itemsAssist the Project Manager with issuing subcontracts and monitors their progressEnforces contractual responsibilities with subcontractorsInvolved in all facets of project closeout, including archiving documents, execution and strategy through innovation thinkingEnsure adherence to company policies and proceduresAd-hoc tasks as required by the Project teamAbout youWe are looking for a passionate and forward thinking Senior Project Coordinator with the following attributes;Experience in High-rise Construction projects preferredStrong experience in Change Order Management essentialKnowledge of Procore software advantageousHigh attention to detail and organisation skillsKnowledge of Alberta building code and regulationsIntermediate skills in Microsoft office suiteConfident negotiator and conflict resolution skillsEffective communication skills at all levelIf you want to be on this journey with us, please click apply now!Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent

Title: Environmental Project Manager
Job_Description: Local Unit & Position Description DNV GL - Renewables Advisory is currently seeking a motivated and passionate Environmental Project Manager The Project Manager will join the multi-disciplinary Environmental and Permitting Services (EPS) Section within DNV GL. The dynamic working environment will require easily adaptable and technical employees to provide services across a wide range of active projects, including those in the development, design, construction, and operational phases of project lifecycles. DNV GL is looking for a versatile individual with experience and training in relevant fields such as biology (wildlife, ecology, or conservation focus), land use planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy or a similar field. The selected individual will be responsible for guiding renewable projects through regulatory processes, interfacing with the Alberta Utilities Commission, Alberta Environment and Parks, Saskatchewan MOE and other agencies, and providing support to construction and operational compliance. This position is based out of our Calgary office.  Tasks may include:  Conduct the following studies: Site selection and characterization studies Permitting and compliance matrix Technical permitting studies, such as visual impact assessments, and management plans Lead environmental assessments and environmental impact statements Zoning variance, local ordinance compliance, conditional use, and other permit applications Set project milestones for scope, schedule, and budget and ensure milestones are met Perform technical checking and initial approval of certain work products conducted by junior staff Collaborate directly with other business groups to complete multi-disciplinary deliverables Attend agency and municipality meetings, open houses, and stakeholder engagement sessions Prepare or coordinate standard proposals and bids Support the team members in preparing special or large-scale proposals and bids Promote the EPS Group through professional engagement with existing and potential clients Actively seek out practical and realistic business development opportunities in the Canadian market Participate in R&D projects under the coordination of the Team Leader Engage in facilitating innovative and new service offerings to anticipate/meet market needs Position Qualifications Position Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, namely land use planning, environmental planning, environmental science/engineering, biology, or environmental law/policy; Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in permitting Advanced knowledge of environmental assessment regulatory frameworks in AB and SK and the ability to quickly adapt to and learn new regulatory frameworks for international jurisdictions; Proficiency with MS Office Word/Excel/Access; Experience leading environmental permit applications; Excellent analytical and reporting abilities; Excellent written and verbal English communication skills Individual should display a positive, team-oriented attitude to match our friendly work environment; Demonstrated skills in project coordination, agency consultation, and environmental analysis; and Willingness and ability to travel up to 5% of the time domestically to conferences, client meetings, project sites, agency and internal meetings. We conduct pre-employment drug and background screening  Preferred skills (not required)  Understanding of Canadian wind and solar markets Master’s degree in a relevant field, namely land use planning, landscape architecture, environmental planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy Project Management Professional (PMP) or other technical accreditation such P.Eng., P.Geo, P.Biol., etc. is preferred Experience in conducting environmental and permitting due diligence reviews and understanding of international standards (Equator Principles, IFC Performance Standards) Experience leading proposals efforts and large environmental permit applications for energy projects Immigration-related benefits (for example, visa sponsorship) are not available for this position  Opportunities Beyond Business  DNV GL is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Our mission is to safeguard life, property and the environment. By joining us, you will work toward our meaningful vision: to make a global impact for a safe and sustainable future. DNV GL offers a congenial working environment, competitive salaries, and an exceptional benefits package. Please visit our website at www.dnvgl.com Company & Business Area Description DNV GL is a global quality assurance and risk management company. Driven by our purpose of safeguarding life, property and the environment, we enable our customers to advance the safety and sustainability of their business.  We provide classification, technical assurance, software and independent expert advisory services to the maritime, oil & gas, power and renewables industries. We also provide certification, supply chain and data management services to customers across a wide range of industries.  Combining technical, digital and operational expertise, risk methodology and in-depth industry knowledge, we empower our customers’ decisions and actions with trust and confidence. We continuously invest in research and collaborative innovation to provide customers and society with operational and technological foresight.  With origins stretching back to 1864 and operations in more than 100 countries, our experts are dedicated to helping customers make the world safer, smarter and greener.  DNV GL delivers world-renowned testing and advisory services to the energy value chain including renewables and energy efficiency. Our expertise spans onshore and offshore wind power, solar, conventional generation, transmission and distribution, smart grids, and sustainable energy use, as well as energy markets and regulations. Our experts support customers around the globe in delivering a safe, reliable, efficient, and sustainable energy supply.

Title: Project Coordinator - Interiors
Job_Description: This position can be based out of our Calgary, Edmonton, or Vancouver office.  The Project Manager is responsible for all projects that require some level of coordination or other factors deemed necessary to require dedicated project management. This position will handle a variety of sized projects and can span all activities of supporting a project (i.e. site visits, oversee installation, walk throughs, product selection, product specification, applying appropriate discounting, preparing proposals, order management, installation management and punch list resolution).  This position will work very closely with the Furniture Account Manager, Furniture Coordinator and CAD Specifier or may need to work independently to ensure the customer’s needs are met. This position requires some for independent judgment to ensure projects reach completion.  Key Responsibilities: Act as point of contact from order entry to completion of project, working with internal and external customers for planning and executing of each project, and ensure all logistical requirements are being met.  Participate with internal team to understand scope of each project and gain all installation and/or delivery costs.  Attend client meetings, on-site measurements / inventory, construction meetings, and vendor meetings as required.  Deficiency resolution – work with internal team to manage and resolve all deficiencies.  Qualifications: Secondary School completion; Product Management training and/or experience in contract furniture industry.  2-3 years experience in handling furniture related processes and and/or installation experiences.  Project management, safety training, and/or LEED certification a plus.  Written and verbal communication skills with the ability to influence multiple stakeholders at all levels of the organization.  Ability to develop and sustain productive customer relationships.  Ability to lead and engage a work team to deliver results and achieve project objectives in a timely manner.  Ability to identify project and sales opportunities to drive company revenue.  Ability to travel within a given market or geography.  Grand & Toy offers competitive wages and benefits packages based on education and experience. We proudly provide comprehensive training for all new associates, along with incentives such as our associate/corporate discounts and rewards programs for management positions. We celebrate employment equity and diversity. We are committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Project Administrator
Company: ISL Engineering and Land Services Ltd
Job_Description: ISL Engineering and Land Services Ltd. is an award-winning full-service consulting firm dedicated to working with all levels of government and the private sector to deliver planning and design solutions for transportation, water, and land projects. Our commitment to client success is built on a strong foundation: we know the communities we serve. This local knowledge, combined with our range of expertise and depth of experience, helps us meet the unique challenges of every project and better understand the role of sustainable solutions in all phases of a project’s life cycle. ISL Engineering and Land Services is proud to be among Canada’s 30 most environmentally-conscious employers as well as a Platinum Level Small and Medium Best Employer in Canada. ISL supports diversity and is an employment equity employer. ISL offers opportunities for career development, an employer paid benefits plan, Group RRSP program and competitive salaries with opportunities for an annual bonus. We are seeking a Project Administrator for our Calgary office. In this role, you will be assisting Managers and Project Managers within our Transportation discipline on project and business-related administrative tasks. This is a deadline-driven, hands-on, full-time, salaried position and is intended for career-oriented applicants who are seeking a long-term career in office administration.  The position is a new role within ISL’s Calgary office and we envision the successful candidate will be a self-starter who helps refine and expand their role with time, including by observing and working with the team so that you come to anticipate and address their organization needs in advance. By taking on these administrative tasks, the success of this role will be demonstrated in measurably freeing up the time of our management team to focus on project-related and strategic priorities. The role will be well suited to applicants who are passionate and driven to grow their administrative career in an industry-leading organization.  Responsibilities may include: Preparation of meeting minutes Maintain a project database for use in revenue and resource workload projections Maintain and develop project checklists Maintain lists for client contacts, events and sales pipeline opportunities Maintain lists for staff events, training courses and conferences Arrange registration and travel for events, training courses and conferences Maintain a team experience and project database for use with preparation of proposals Assistance with preparation of proposals Assistance with technical writing, proof reading and checking final reports Production of technical reports, drawing packages, or other documents Quality assurance checks of drawings, reports and documents (for appearance / aesthetics, nomenclature, spelling, and annotation) Assist in the implementation and ongoing maintenance of SharePoint sites for projects or teams Preparation of client transmittals and communications Digital and hard-copy filing Organize and assist in the implementation of project-specific digital filing systems Transcribing and summarizing public engagement feedback or similar information Preparation of formal agreement documents Maintain a compiled list of Professional Services and Sub-consultant Agreements Assistance with project accounting and invoicing Organize meetings including room management, booking, catering, etc. Working proactively with the general office administration team to coordinate tasks or obtain assistance in their areas of responsibility In future, potentially assisting with recruitment and training of other Project Administrators to support other office disciplines   Requirements: Minimum 3-5 years of office experience Excellent verbal and written English communication skills High level of attention to detail Demonstrated strong work ethic and commitment to quality and support of process improvement Self-motivated and proactive administrator who seeks to understand the needs of the team with time, and to proactively learn, anticipate and address organization needs in advance Expert knowledge of Microsoft Word including templates Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel including filters, formulas and pivot tables Strong time management and organizational skills, with demonstrated ability for self-management of multiple simultaneous priorities or deadlines Ability to read and interpret instructions, identify problems or missing information and address them proactively Creative problem solver who works in a professional and ethical manner   Qualities Considered an Asset: Prior experience in the civil engineering consulting industry Formal education / diploma in office administration or management Accounting experience (invoicing, budgets, etc.) Experience using other Microsoft Office products (Outlook, PowerPoint, Project, OneNote) Experience using PDF software for combining files, adding bookmarks, and completing markups Experience using SharePoint or other document management software  Want to find out more about this or other ISL career opportunities? Visit us online at www.islengineering.com  Department: Transportation This is a permanent full time position

Title: Project Administrator
Job_Description: People: Our Strength, Our Future  A career at Black & McDonald will grant you the opportunity to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement, help reinforce our values and shape our contribution to community, and drive our continued success. Our vision is to be the best company to work for; the best company for safety, quality and value; the best company for customer service; and the best company for technical expertise.  Position Summary  The Site Administrator will assist with the overall administrative direction for the assigned project. They will assist with the overall performance, including costs, schedule, and project status while maintaining excellent relations with the employees, subcontractors, consultants, and our clients.  Duties & Responsibilities  Assist the Project Manager in planning & scheduling  Support the site with trade and subcontractor coordination  Respond to customer calls in a professional and efficient manner  Assist with new employee file coordination including orientation, dispatch slips and hiring kit  Weekly timesheet reporting  Assist with safety documentation and record, material/equipment procurement  Documentation control – photocopy and collate documents for distribution, mailing and filing  Preparing of documentation to assist Accounts Receivable/Payable (eg. invoices, purchase orders) etc.  Productivity reports  Manage RFI log  Other duties as assigned  Competency Requirements  Energetic and organized  Effective written and verbal communication skills  Excellent interpersonal skills  Education & Skill Requirements  2+ years of experience in construction site administration  Post-secondary education in Electrical Engineering Technology  Experience working on a utility (electrical/civil) project sites is an asset  Experience working on a substations project is an asset  JDE experience is an asset

Title: Transportation Project Manager
Job_Description: The Transportation Division of AECOM is seeking a creative, highly talented Mid-Level/Senior Project Manager for immediate employment in the Calgary, AB office. The appropriately qualified applicant will be able to demonstrate an established career in the Transportation industry, specific to multi-disciplinary transportation projects.  The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:  + Overall project management and leadership in developing opportunities  + Defining project scope, developing project plans, developing project schedules and developing and tracking fee estimates and project baselines and budgets  + Tracking project progress of deliverables, milestones and other commitments to clients  + Determining and taking corrective actions on contractual, technical and commercial issues  + Building, organizing and motivating project teams and managing daily activities and resources  + Identifying services to be provided by external companies and negotiating agreements  + Chairing internal and external, stakeholder or client, meetings representing AECOM  + Ensuring client satisfaction and overseeing quality review process for submittals  + Analyzing and managing project risk  + Managing reports and necessary documentation  + Developing policies and procedures to support the achievement of project objectives  Minimum Requirements  + Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent  + 5+ years of project management experience  + Significant experience in project management  + Experience in budgeting, reporting, scheduling  + Experience writing and winning significant proposals  + Experience with business development  + Experience interacting at an executive level (both internal and external)  + Must have experience managing multi-disciplinary transportation projects  + Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)  + Proficiency in MS Word and Excel  Preferred Qualifications  + P.Eng designation  + Practical project management experience (project)  + Foundational experience that might include design and/or site work and/or construction / operations  + Experience working on projects for Alberta Transportation, City of Calgary, Federal Government or similar  + US or overseas experience is considered acceptable / equivalent to Canadian experience, but regional (Western Canada) experience is ideal  + Should have a demonstrable network of client and engineering contacts  What We Offer  AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  _NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: _  _Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.

Title: Project Manager - Energy and Building Maintenance, Calgary (...
