Title: Project Manager- Calgary
Job_Description: Looking for a Project Manager in Calgary! At Harbinger Network we have partnered with a client who is looking for an Civil Project Manager to join their team. This is a great opportunity to work with a team that is well-respected in the industry. If you are interested in working for a growing organization with lots of growth opportunities what are you waiting for!? Apply today! The Project Manager reports directly to the Executive VP. The PM is in charge of coordinating and exercising functional authority for all, initiating, planning, executing, monitoring & control, integration, and closing of the civil projects within his area of assigned authority. More specifically the Senior Project Manager will:  Collaborate in the prequalification phase, coordinating with the assistance of the Business Development Director (BDD) or other company personnel all information from the Head Quarters (HQ) and other branches required for each prequalification. Collaborate with the BDD and VP in the negotiation of the agreements with the partners always coordinating with the internal legal services of the company the drafting of the legal agreements. Assist the BDD during the Bid Tendering Stage in order to take advantage of the knowledge of: Assist with bids by providing input into bid strategy, planning and costing. Prepare and distribute confidentiality agreements with Consultants, Subcontractors and Contractors. Coordinate with third parties for the taking of quantities. Ensure that the planning and schedule is been followed during the construction phase and report to the VP any important situation or delay that he/she may observe. This position will collaborate with the estimating department to ensure complete, competitive and sustainable submissions  Qualifications: Construction professional with at least 7 years' experience Proven in technical or managerial functions: Project Management, Project Engineering, Civil Engineering Design, Engineering Consulting, and Construction Management. Experience in Heavy Civil projects is essential: roads, bridges, rail Good knowledge of Alberta's construction codes and standards. Excellent communication and organizational skills. Excellent proficiency with Microsoft Office products including MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Outlook, etc. Apply with confidence as Harbinger Network respects your privacy and will keep your application private and confidential. While only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview, be sure to continually check out website for other related positions as they are posted. www.harbingernetwork.ca Why many like you are joining our NETWORK Harbinger Network Inc. is recognized by construction professionals across Canada for working in partnership with them to effectively meet their career objectives with the best companies in Canada. Harbinger Network has an outstanding and proven track record of placing top professionals with the most sought-after construction companies based on important considerations including: salary and benefits, location, projects and career path. Harbinger Network specializes in the following industries: ICI Buildings - schools, hospitals, rec centres, police stations, retrofits, renovations , corporate interiors, tenant improvements, various commercial facilities Heavy/Civil Construction - bridges, tunnels, roads, highways, sewers, water main, wastewater treatment plants, pumping stations, purification Mechanical and Electrical High-Rise Commercial and Residential Low-Rise residential Owner's Representatives Sub Contractors and Suppliers all divisions To learn more about Harbinger Network and opportunities within the construction industry, visit: www.harbingernetwork.ca or contact us at 905-257-9691  *INCLUDE A PROJECT LIST WITH RESUME*

Title: Leases Project Analyst (Temporary)
Job_Description: Leases Project Analyst (Temporary), Calgary, AB Why work at Nutrien? Great question! Safety is a core value at Nutrien. Keeping every employee safe, healthy and secure is our top priority. Nothing is more important than seeing our people go home safe at the end of every single day. While working here you will have the opportunity to grow your career while helping us feed the future. We pride ourselves in hiring from a variety of backgrounds and truly believe that it is our differences that make us stronger so we hope you will join us. In addition to exciting and challenging opportunities, Nutrien offers competitive salaries, great benefits and performance based incentives. Outside of the skills and necessary qualifications, you will be committed to sustaining our safe and positive work environment while welcoming working side by side others in a diverse culture. Culture at Nutrien is the core of everything we do and all employees are respectful of diverse opinions and views. The purpose of the Business Analyst role is to document and assist in implementation of the future state business processes that will be impacted by the new standard International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) 16 – Leases. This is to gain a complete understanding of the impact and aid our business partners in identifying the future processes and documenting those processes to support the transition to the new standard. *Please note that this is a temporary, full-time position (40 hours per week), expected to end February 2019* Key Tasks: Facilitation of information gathering and process design through interviews, existing documentation analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and business process modeling this will primarily be for the future state process redesign to support the new accounting standards Acting as a Liaison between Finance and our Business Partners to uphold a clear understanding of future state process requirements and to ensure functional deliverables align with the stakeholders needs Proactive communication and collaboration with external and internal stakeholders to develop: Process Flows, Report design, Test Plans, Defect / Enhancement tracking, Business Process Procedures (BPPs) Working independently with stakeholders, as well as under the direction of project managers. Collaboration with subject matter experts and functional business leads to establish the future state process and impacts Producing deliverables according to standard templates appropriate for project scale Assist in user acceptance testing, test planning, development of test cases and test execution management to ensure alignment with original requirements, process definition and future compliance. Skills: Knowledge of Agriculture, Manufacturing and Supply Chain an asset Competent and proficient understanding of a variety of technology platforms, including ERP’s such as SAP and PeopleSoft, as well as current Microsoft and Internet technologies Excellent analytical and organizational skills with expert fluency in Excel, Visio and PowerPoint. Previous project experience Business aptitude for strategy and benefits realization alignment Knowledge and experience with Business Process modeling tools and techniques Understanding of the IT Life Cycle Proven capability and experience managing requirements gathering initiatives across multiple teams and business areas Exceptional communication, both written and verbal, and facilitation skills Qualifications: A Finance background with knowledge of accounting practice. A background of 3 years minimum of practical experience in business analysis and processes A professional degree or a combination of education and experience may also be considered Nutrien is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We encourage applications from all well qualified candidates who reflect the diversity of the regions where we operate. This includes recognizing the voluntary identification of status such as gender, sexual orientation, visible minority, Indigenous status, persons with disabilities, and veterans, where applicable. If this sounds like a good match, apply now. This job will remain posted until filled. You may be required to undergo a background check and substance test in accordance with Nutrien policies. While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Title: Project Management
Job_Description: We’re Hiring! PROJECT COORDINATOR  POSITION OVERVIEW  The Project Coordinator supports the Business Development team with overall administration and coordination of large and small translation and interpretation projects. He/she collaborates with in-house and external project personnel to deliver overall project performance including schedule, costs, quality, and client satisfaction. The Project Coordinator Position is expected to move to a Project Management/Account Executive role as the position develops.  Type – Full-time, Permanent  Salary – TBD  RESPONSIBILITIES  PROJECT MANAGEMENT  Manages component(s) of projects of small, medium or large scope and complexity, in conjunction with the AE or BDR and the client. Components include financial cost control, sub-contract management, document submittal, client relations, reporting, and quality control. ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT  Engages new clients and past clients to conduct discoveries in order to better grasp their needs on an ongoing basis as well as an assessment of their current project scope. Develops and maintains a current client database with frequent contact and follow up. BUDGET  Achieve the project budget and meet or exceed target net margin by negotiating with project personnel and by keeping all relevant vendor information up-to- date SCHEDULE  Create timelines & schedules based on translator’s ability to complete large and small projects then establish a deadline agreeable with the client and the translator(s). Meet or beat all project milestones and project schedule by timely processing of project deliverables PROJECT ADMINISTRATION  Coordinate required shipping and receiving of Hard-Copy Translations Track all project data and information and submit reports of activity Responsible for coordination of project documentation, which includes Translation Request Forms, Interpreter Request Forms, meeting minutes/conversations with clients regarding all project criterion Assist PM/AE to prepare bids including scopes of work and manage RFQ’s and bid queries QUALITY  Deliver scope while meeting or exceeding Languages in Motion’s and Client’s standards for projects by ensuring all translations submitted have been reviewed and proofread. Ensure client satisfaction after Interpretation Assignments by calling and obtaining client feedback. CONTRACT MANAGEMENT  Prepare subcontractor contracts for approval and track active and expired agreements Maintain accurate and up-to- date logs (Vendor/Subcontractor, Costs, Owner etc.) SUB-CONTRACTOR MANAGEMENT  Track and follow through with translators/interpreters on changes in pricing, language rarity, and schedule. PROJECT CLOSE-OUT  Coordinate, motivate and facilitate the completion of the projects with clients and project personnel ensuring all documentation has been recorded, invoices are settled and all relevant project data is effectively stored.  REQUIREMENTS  At least 2-3 years of experience in a project management environment Extremely capable and professional written and oral skills in American/Canadian English (complete fluency: native/near native level of fluency) Has worked in a multi-disciplinary environment A Degree or Diploma from a recognized University Excellent capability with Microsoft Excel Adept capability within Gmail, Google Drive, DropBox, MS Word, and Powerpoint Professional Phone and email etiquette Competent with new software and computer applications Provides a high level of customer service Develops relationships with internal and external project personnel and clients Can work and communicate effectively with team members, clients, subcontractors, and the general public Takes responsibility for the results of his/her work ASSETS  Experience creating and maintaining sites within Office 365 and Sharepoint Project Manager (PMP) Certification Competent in Podio – Project Management in order to plan, track and coordinate projects considered an asset Reading and comprehension of English Legal and technical terminology, as well as familiarity with multiple languages Diploma or degree in Business Administration or above Translation certification or a second/third language

Title: Project Manager/Project Assistant
Job_Description: Job SummaryThe Project Manager (PM) will be responsible for all aspects of project management, including start-up, obtaining building permits, preparing tenders, budgets, estimates and construction schedules. The PM will work with internal and external construction personnel to ensure project construction is executed in a timely and efficient manner while maintaining integrity of design and will work closely with the project team to ensure budgets are maintained and projects are delivered on time.Job DutiesPRE-PROJECT RESPONSIBILITIES:Review with the Estimator to understand the job scope, contents of estimate, and intended schedules.Review design options, to understand the costs, quality and availability of materials.Reply to all RFI’, etc.ON-GOING PROJECT RESPONSIBILITIESPrepare project files and document submittals.Coordinate pre-start up meetings with client representative and all trades involved.Understand and assist in planning and executing work procedures; scheduling, managing and maintaining projects and budgets, work with operations to help coordinate various phases of construction to prevent delays.Assist Operations with change orders to ensure additional work is properly completed.Ensure projects are completed within schedule and on budget while providing a high level of customer service to clients.Provide comprehensive project management throughout the life cycle of the project.Monitor project progress, update project information, ordering materials for ongoing projects, coordinate components for projects and meet with clients.Manage customer experience with various project issue.Manage progress invoicing.Manage budget and billingsPOST PROJECT RESPONSIBILITIESPrepare all the necessary closeout documentation such as as-built plans, warranty forms, etc.Ensure all project deficiency is addressed prior to closing of the project.RequirementsSkills and TrainingDegree in construction management, architecture, engineering or related experienceExcellent project management skillsCompetencies surrounding building products, construction details and relevant rules, regulations and quality standardsExperience and ExpectationsProficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Project and other related systems.Previous experience in PM would be considered an asset.Working ConditionsUse of Personal Protection Equipment may be required (e.g. hard-hat, safety boots, etc.).Hazards associated with the construction industry.Occasional travel will be required with out of town projectsBusiness OverviewLeeswood is a rapidly growing construction company within the ICI industry and aims to deliver the highest quality and customer service to our clients.Why LeeswoodLeewood’s main goal is to achieve success. That is why we go above and beyond to demonstrate our commitment to our customers, ensure the safety of our employees, and protect our communities with the highest degree of integrity and enthusiasm. We are committed to sustainable and ethical growth where you can contribute in a meaningful way.Start your career at one of Alberta’s growing companies. We are looking for people who have the best to offer and provides the same in return. We offer very competitive and comprehensive compensation package, including, an industry leading benefits package, and health & wellness programs.Leeswood is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment.Job Type: Full-timeRequired experience:Project Management: Min 5 yearsJob Type: Full-timeExperience:Project Management: 5 years

Title: Project Manager

(AWI) we provide water treatment solutions for industrialand municipal water and wastewater treatment plants across Canada and in select international markets. Title: Project Manager

Title: Project Manager - Calgary
Job_Description: Harvard Property Management Inc. has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to join its team. Harvard is a full service real estate management company based in Western Canada that is recognized for its reputation in leadership, flexibility, quality and performance. The company oversees 8.8 million square feet of commercial properties with regional offices in Regina, Calgary, Edmonton and Winnipeg.This position will report to the Senior Project Manager and will be part of a Project Management team providing capital project management to external and internal clients. The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, contract administration and successful delivery of a variety of leasing construction and capital projects throughout Harvard’s managed portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.What you will bring to the job: - 5 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings;- The completion of a PMP designation is an asset;- Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting;- Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships;- Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines;- The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment;- Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment;- Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and- Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.What you will receive: - Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment;- Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP;- Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program;- Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and- Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. If you feel you are the person we are looking for in this position, please apply with your resume in confidence through the Careers tab at　www.hillcompanies.com.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Senior Project Manager, Liquid Terminals, Oil & Gas
Job_Description: Description  CALGARY WSP is one of the world's leading professional engineering services firms. Every day our more than 37,000 experts work to restore the natural environment and transform the built environment. In Canada, our 8000+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transport networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future. The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We’re a Forbes Top Employer in Canada, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada’s Top 100 Infrastructure Projects. At WSP , we’re proud, professional and passionate people. Join us.  POSITION DESCRIPTION In Canada, WSP is one of the largest professional services firms with approximately 7,800 employees, mainly engineers, technicians, scientists, environmental experts and architects, based in all Canadian provinces. WSP's Oil & Gas division is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta and ready to apply the experience and enthusiasm of our people to your energy challenges. Our more than 420 engineering and technical specialists work across all oil and gas sub-specialties – with the proven experience to effectively develop and optimize projects – safely, cost-effectively, with an approach focused on creating long-term partnerships and repeat business. From small installations to multi-phase megaprojects, WSP engineers excel through our: Tailor-made solutions that are adaptable and flexible Commitment to delivering cost and schedule certainty Robust quality control, quality review processes Innovative templating/standardization experience The number one question we ask is “What’s right for the client?” WSP’s Oil & Gas expertise is supported by the strong global network and resources of WSP Global worldwide. All activities are undertaken in support of the WSP Canada strategic plan. RESPONSIBILITIES Reporting to the Director - Projects, the Senior Project Manager, Liquid Terminals will be responsible for management of assigned projects following appropriate project management methodology including gathering and defining comprehensive project requirements, establishing proper strategies for estimating, ensuring strategic alignment with business needs, developing project charters, project execution plans, budgets and schedules; Utilizing existing relationships in the midstream Oil & Gas sector, builds relationships with key internal and external clients, industry organizations, teaming partners, and stakeholders to identify opportunities and grow the business; Identifies variances from the project plans, budgets and schedules, develops and implements changes as necessary to ensure that the project remains within specified scope and is within time, cost, and quality objectives. Ensure that appropriate Management of Change procedures are followed to increase project budgets to accommodate client requests; Support project initiation with senior management following appropriate project management methodology including gathering and defining comprehensive project requirements, determining staffing requirements, and forming cross-functional project teams where necessary; Lead negotiations with service contractors in the event of project changes and contractual disputes; Coordinate and provide direction for budget development, purchasing, engineering, accounting, cost, and construction functions as they relate to the completion of the project; Actively participates on internal team(s) that focus on continuous improvement of the business Lead and manage the project closeout process; Other duties as assigned.  QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering; PMP certification is preferred; Senior level technical knowledge of piping systems, field erected tanks, rotating equipment, minimum applicable design requirements and associated equipment and materials; At least 15 of overall experience managing mid to large size capital projects in the midstream oil and gas sector; At least 10 years experience in project management of midstream projects; Project Controls experience is a plus; Experienced in the design and construction of greenfield and brownfield liquid terminals; Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to prioritize tasks and effectively manage the expectations of external stakeholders; Excellent computer skills; Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills.    Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).  To learn more about our firm and the projects we have been involved in, please visit our World of Possibilities microsite. WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted. Company: WSP Canada Inc. #LI-LP1      Are you a returning applicant?   Previous Applicants:  Email:  Password:     If you do not remember your password click here. Title: Divisional Industrial Project Manager
Job_Description: Position: Divisional Industrial Project Manager  Location: Calgary, AB  Westburne, a division of Rexel (RXL: Euronext Paris), is a Canadian market leader in energy, lighting, wire and cable, automation and connected network solutions.  DESCRIPTION  We are currently looking for a self-motivated individual to become an integral part of our team at our Calgary location. If you want to work in a dynamic team environment and you excel when being trusted with responsibility, then Westburne is the place for you.  Responsibilities:  Management of industrial project groups Apply organizational policies and ensure adherence to implemented procedures at all levels Train and manage employees within the departments Resolve customer and supplier disputes Review supplier and customer terms and condition documents Maintain contact with customers and vendors to build a lucrative business relationship Conduct regular job status update meetings with sales force and management Evaluate job closing losses Obtain and analyze quote requests from contractors, sales representatives and bid depository Overlook specifications and determine if product requirements are achievable and profitable to the company Coordinate the quotation from various sources to organize a complete package for the customer Oversee order placements with manufacturers for quoted material on project orders Release reviewed material for shipment and expedite orders according to stipulated delivery schedule Review schedule of delivery dates Complete closing sheets on all quoted jobs  Qualifications:  College diploma in business/sales/marketing or equivalent education and/or experience 5 years of related experience in the industry, including a minimum of 1 year personnel management experience Project management experience Product knowledge of the electrical business is essential Excellent interpersonal, time management and negotiation skills Computer literacy – proficient with MS Office, Internet & IBM AS/400 knowledge Experience in quotations/project coordination is a definite asset  Why Westburne?  Westburne, a division of Rexel, is the Canadian market leader in the B2B supply of electrical, alternative energy, lighting, wire and cable, automation and connected enterprise solutions. With over 100 locations, we are proud to offer rewarding careers to over 1000 Canadians across the country.  What We Can Offer You  Our employees enjoy a dynamic and ever-changing work environment. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and pension packages, and the opportunity for continued growth across the organization.  Westburne provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants. We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.  Learn more about life at Westburne by visiting lifehere.westburne.ca (http://lifehere.westburne.ca/) or our page on LinkedIn.  If you require any accommodation in the application process, please contact us with the “Need Help” button in Fitzii.

Title: Project Manager – Building Projects
Job_Description: 05/02/2018  001753  Pomerleau is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder.  Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do.  The Opportunity  Jump in and imagine the possibilities as a Project Manager with Pomerleau. Using your proven experience and leadership capabilities, you will take on a lead role in project management and delivery. With your solution focused and team oriented attitude, you will lead a collaborative team of construction professionals who match your drive for excellence. Using your client centric approach and proven technical expertise, you embrace the role of being a trusted leader for our team and steadfast advisor for our clients to successfully execute every exciting and challenging project you take on.  Success is in the details and the core of what you do. As a Project Manager, you are a scheduling guru keeping project goals, execution, people and communication always top of mind. As a key member of our team, we will rethink construction together, from idea to completion. Everywhere. All the time. Period.  What YOU Will Do  Grow and maintain strong relationships with team members, trade partners, consultants and clients to achieve the project goals and vision. Develop and drive the construction schedule in conjunction with the project team ensuring that completion dates and milestones are met. Put your problem-solving skills to work and recommend innovative methods that will increase effectiveness and efficiency to ensure project excellence and productivity. Use your proactive approach to ensure compliance with our first-class Quality Program. Utilize your experience in trade partner selection and coordination of their activities.

Title: Project Administrator
Job_Description: L'administrateur de projet est responsable de la gestion des opérations quotidiennes en ce qui a trait aux projets assignés. The Project Administrator is responsible for handling the day to day operations for assigned projects. Detailed Description · Assurer l'administration de projet pour les projets assignés à l'intérieur de l'entreprise. · Offrir un soutien aux exécutions courantes et la supervision des projets. · Instaurer des objectifs pour les projets qui correspondent aux besoins de l'entreprise. · Coordonner les exigences techniques associées au projet avec les clients internes et les clients externes. · Développer les coûts, les prix et planifier les données des projets. · Faire en sorte que les projets soient instaurés et menés à terme. Effectuer la liaison avec le personnel et les directeurs de services compétents lors de la réalisation du projet, le cas échéant.  · Provide project administration on assigned projects within the company.  · Support day-to-day implementation and direction for projects. · Implement project requirements consistent with business needs. · Coordinate project-related technical requirements with internal and external customers. · Develop cost, pricing, and schedule data for projects. · Insure implementation and completion of projects. · Liaison with appropriate personnel and department managers as appropriate when performing project activities.  Performs other duties as required Job Requirements EXPÉRIENCE Expérience de travail directe en gestion de projet, y compris dans tous les aspects de l'élaboration et de l'exécution de projet. - 2 Exigée EXIGENCES ET APTITUDES Solides aptitudes à la résolution de problèmes et capacité d'analyser les processus du travail pour les clients internes et les clients externes. Apte à mener des recherches sur les questions et les produits liés au projet. Capacité à fixer des priorités et d'exécuter des tâches efficacement. Excellente aptitude à la communication orale et écrite. Solides connaissances en informatique. ENVIRONNEMENT DE TRAVAIL TRAVAIL DE BUREAU – EN GÉNÉRAL, LE TRAVAIL S'EFFECTUE DANS UN BUREAU DOTÉ DE L'ÉQUIPEMENT STANDARD. L'ÉCLAIRAGE ET LA TEMPÉRATURE SONT ADÉQUATS, ET IL N'Y A AUCUN DANGER NI AUCUNE CONDITION DÉSAGRÉABLE COMME LE BRUIT, LA POUSSIÈRE, ETC. EXIGENCES LIÉES À LA CONDITION PHYSIQUE LE TRAVAIL EST HABITUELLEMENT SÉDENTAIRE, MAIS PEUT EXIGER DE SE TENIR DEBOUT OU DE MARCHER POUR UNE PÉRIODE ALLANT JUSQU'À 10 % DU TEMPS. EXIGENCES MENTALES L'EMPLOYÉ DOIT ORGANISER ET COORDONNER DES EMPLOIS DU TEMPS. L'EMPLOYÉ DOIT ANALYSER ET INTERPRÉTER DES DONNÉES COMPLEXES. L'EMPLOYÉ DOIT FAIRE DE LA RÉSOLUTION DE PROBLÈMES. L'EMPLOYÉ DOIT COMMUNIQUER AVEC LE PUBLIC. L'employé doit gérer d'autres employés.  REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES  · Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze workflow/processes to support internal and external customers · Adept at conducting research into project-related issues and products · Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks · Strong written and verbal communication skills · Strong computer skills  EXPERIENCE  2 - 3 years direct work experience in a project management capacity, including all aspects of project development and execution Additional Details For WESCO locations in Canada, we offer a competitive compensation and flexible benefit plan, pension plan, educational assistance plan and more. Please note, in the recruitment process accommodations for applicants with disabilities are available upon request. WESCO values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Senior Project Manager - Infrastructure
Job_Description: Career Opportunity – Senior Project Manager – Infrastructure Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, you’ll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. You’ll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. We rank among Canada’s largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If you’re eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). About The Role As a key member of the Western Canada Infrastructure team, the Senior Project Manager will be leading the Water and Waste Water Portfolio of Projects reporting into the Operational Managers for Alberta and British Columbia. As a Senior Project Manager at Graham you will: Manage financial aspects of multiple contracts to protect the company’s interests and maintain good relationships with client Work closely with Business Development team to identify strategic opportunities for Western Canada Infrastructure team as it relates to Water and Waste Water Projects Ensure projects are constructed in accordance with design, budget and schedule Assist, review and negotiate contracts; liaising with legal counsel, as appropriate, in conjunction with Operations Manager Develop, recommend and implement the project plan, after being awarded the project Coach/mentor, provide direction, and review the performance of personnel reporting directly to the Project Manager Monitor and control progress, costs and budgets throughout the project Act to resolve disputes between the Company and owner, or Company and subcontractors when possible prior to escalating Identify required and optional changes in project scope; negotiate change orders with the owner Manage claims and claims avoidance Qualifications/Experience: Civil or Structural Engineering degree or related technical degree At least 15 years’ experience preferably in the Water/Wastewater sector. Experience leading Infrastructure Water Projects ($5- 50 million) with a General Contractor Mechanical and electrical background would be an asset. Detailed understanding of all aspects of construction: technology, equipment, materials, bid management, claims management and safety Compensation and Benefits: Competitive salary with annual bonus potential Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan. Ownership and long term equity opportunities About Us What we can offer you: Strong commitment to safety in the workplace Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. We're Building careers, not filling jobs. View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/. Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you. Title: Senior Project Manager – Calgary
Job_Description: Are you inspired by mutual respect and solid relationships? Do you have a desire to learn and to share what you’ve learned? Does the opportunity to work for a 100% employee-owned company appeal to you? Want to be part of something bigger than yourself. We are an Award winning, leading Canadian builder that seeks a Senior Project Manager working in our Calgary office.  Are you someone who can work in an extremely fast paced environment and thrives on deadlines? We are looking for an energetic individual to support our Operations Team. In this role your main responsibilities will be:  Adopt and integrate all Chandos project management systems; Manage project activities throughout the life cycle of the project, including the allocation of adequate resources, scheduling, documentation, and budgets; Achieve the project budget and complete accurate monthly forecasts; Liaise with client representatives, architect representative, subcontractors, etc. As the successful candidate for this position, you will bring your:  Technical diploma in a construction-related field (CET) or related engineering degree; a Gold Seal certification would be desirable; 15 years of progressively responsible work experience in Alberta within the Commercial/ Institutional construction industry; Commitment to working in a team environment, and good team-building abilities; Superior leadership qualities with a demonstrated track record of dealing successfully with internal and external clients; Able to interpret and effectively manage multiple and competing priorities and timelines. Our unique culture attracts a high calibre employee, whether it’s in the field or office. Those who thrive at Chandos do so because they understand that their success is dependent on the collective effort. That’s because every Chandos employee demonstrates our core values “WE BUILD BETTER TOGETHER.”  Where do you stand in your current career? Are you fine with status quo, or do you want an opportunity to make an impact? At Chandos, it’s about alliances and ideas not egos or agendas. If you’re looking for the opportunity to make your mark, we should talk. So, send us your cover letter, resume, and salary expectations. Because opportunity is one thing we’re very big on at Chandos.

Title: Senior Project Manager (Calgary)
Job_Description: Job Description Senior Project Manager (Calgary) Are you looking to be part of an Innovative, Environmentally conscious and Collaborative team? If so, look no further. One of the top ten general contractors in Canada and part of the largest construction organization in North America, Clark Builders serves industrial, commercial and institutional market sectors. Clark Builders core values represent the spirit that our company was founded on: Respect Others, Have a Can-Do Attitude, Succeed as a Team, Lead with Courage, Deliver Results. They are more than words: each one underlies the commitment that we bring to every person we meet, every team we build and every project we work on, start to finish.  Reporting overall to the Vice President, Operations; on a day-to-day basis the Senior Project Manager will be reporting and taking direction from his/her or Project Executive in all aspects of the construction process on the project that they are assigned. The Senior Project Manager working with the Project Superintendent will be responsible for and not limited to managing safety, quality, risks, maximizing project earnings, human resources and staff training, client expectations, accurate financial reporting and assuring efficient, timely, fulfillment of all corporate and project obligations, complete communications among all project team members and organizations to construct the project on time, within the budget and to the quality specified. Project Manager role is diverse, and varies between each project.  The Senior Project Manager is also responsible to foster and develop client, consultant, third party and trade relationships in the course of their duties.  Duties/Responsibilities:  Project Start Up: Chair the project handover meeting from Project Development/Estimating Conduct project trade buyout meetings Conduct project startup meetings for individual trades Utilities and site services applications Permit applications. Review and or prepare prime contract against submitted tender and/or proposal, ready for senior management review and client /consultant review Quantity take-offs for a various scopes of the project. Finalize Prime Contractor. Client Risk assessment. Prepare project execution plan. Establish project organization charts and staffing needs. Assist in estimating tender closeout and buy outs. Setup project addition form, financials and billing schedule. Prepare staffing and resources plan. Prepare logistics planning. Establish file management plan. Procurement management, project buyout and award. Prepare and issue letter of intents (LOI) and subcontracts. Put in place bonding and insurance. Finalize project estimates. Safety planning including assistance with re-project hazard assessments, ongoing safety inspections, ongoing safety hazard assessment and other duties. Understand and abide by the requirements of the CB Safety and Loss Prevention Policies and Procedures Understand and abide by the requirements of the local building authorities, develop and maintain relationships with permits and licensing personnel including building inspectors Quality control planning. Communications plan. Create and manage schedule. Strategic and fee enhancement planning. Establish and manage client and corporate objective. Modify project plan for success.  Project Execution and Document Control: Track productivity and performance of the project. Project accounting. Manage stakeholder expectations Chair the Quarterly operational review meetings Manage staff assignments. Prepare a cash flow project and manage the project in accordance with the cash flow requirements. Advise management of pending risk elements and seek assistance on all risk matters or legal matters. Establish and manage document control process. Establish and manager the quality control plan. Establish and manage the project schedule, including the implementation of the Last Planner System. Chair trade, owner/consultant meetings and issue minutes. Chair, site safety meetings and issue minutes Project accounting and cost control, including working with project accountants Monthly financial reports and eCMS, including the preparation of monthly project reports, both internal and external including the monthly MOR report. Time cards. PO and subcontract claims. Client billings including preparation, payment, etc. Dispute and claim management. Lead and train project teams including developing and mentoring support staff including project coordinators, junior project managers Resolve trade and performance issues. Provide regular management of Key Project Indicators (KPI’s).  Project Close Out: Prepare the project close out procedures including punch lists, start up and handover requirements Manage the trade contractor deliverables for project close out, including startup, warranties, demonstration requirements Administrative project closure. Trade/Subcontracts. Prime contractor. Commissioning and equipment start-up. Training seminars. City inspections. Final and holdback invoices and payment Final consultant and schedule C’s. Substantial completion certificate. Warranty period. Support and grow ongoing sub-trade and client relationships. Assist in obtaining work by way of completing a portfolio of successful projects. Participate in project interviews. Participate in CBU Leadership. Ensure internal and external requirements are achieved. Manage financial collection and closeout. Other duties and responsibilities as required.  Skills & Knowledge: Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills. The ability to efficiently assist and administer multiple tasks. Analytical thinker to interpret information in order to understand issues. Ability to make decisions on a variety of levels of complexity, ambiguity and risk. Can define tasks and milestones to achieve objectives while ensuring optimal use of resources. Can prevent, manage and resolve conflicts. Questions conventional approaches, explores alternatives and provides innovative solutions. Can identify, assess and mange risks while striving to meet objectives. Qualifications & Experience: A Post-Secondary Certificate/Degree in Engineering or the equivalent of a designated Professional Engineer or a Technical School graduate in a Construction related discipline. Minimum 10 years’ experience working in a Project Manager role for a Construction Management organization, managing construction of Commercial, Industrial or Intuitional buildings. Can lead, mentor and motivate medium to large project teams. Must be able to competently manage the construction process from project startup to project closeout for all sizes and levels of complexity projects. Actively participate in career development opportunities Undertake and receive required safety training in accordance with policies. Competencies: Networking and relationship building; Customer focus; Teamwork; Interpersonal skills; Results focus; Integrity; Leadership; Managing for results; Developing others; Risk Management; Creative thinking; Conflict resolution; Planning and organizing; Decision Making; and, Analytical thinking.

Title: Project Manager-Retrofit
Job_Description: Reporting directly to the Manager, Retrofit Projects; the Retrofit Project Manager is to ensure the success of the project from purchase order stage through to job completion. This is a technical role with a focus on partnering with Sales, Field Service, the Customer, and all other cross functional teams to ensure the success of the project. Success in this role means executing the project on schedule and within budget without compromising quality or safety, as well as meeting or exceeding customer expectations to ensure repeat business.  Key Functions: Manage the project in its entirely from purchase order stage through to completion Understanding and implementing project scope and client specifications Sizing and selection of all system components based on required performance Manage and oversee the Engineering and Design of the project including the BOM’s Sign off of all drawings ensuring their accuracy and completeness Maintain project schedule(s) and responsible for maintaining sold margins Issue change orders when applicable for changes in scope of supply Coordinate with procurement, suppliers, production and service to ensure timeliness, accuracy, and quality of final product Primary customer contact during job execution Assist Sales/Applications during the quoting phase to ensure accuracy and completeness Job site visits as required for successful quote preparation and job execution Participate in training and educational programs as required for ongoing success of the position Develop and maintain department policies and procedures including Engineering/Design, Safety, HR, and QA/QC.  Assist with mentoring new Project Managers as they join the Compass team  Education and Experience: Engineer or Technologist Degree 3 – 5 years of gas compression or related industry experience  Ability to work with and understand Engineered drawings; P&ID;’s, GA’s, etc. Ability to lead, coach, and mentor staff Delegate work effectively, quick problem solving and conflict resolution Strong People and Employee Relations Skills Strong Organizational and Time Management skills Good written and oral communication  Duties are subject to change at any time according to the needs of the location or company. Other duties may be assigned, in addition to or in lieu of, those described above.

Title: Intermediate IT Project Manager – Digital Operations
Job_Description: Calgary, AB  Job Summary  The role of the Project Manager is to successfully lead a cross-functional project team to successful project completion, delivering customer facing, POS, digital signage and digital application projects in an Omnichannel retail environment. The Project Manager is accountable for delivering a solution within project constraints, namely scope, budget, and schedule.  Responsibilities  The Project Manager will use formal project management techniques and interact with clients and other stakeholders to ensure projects are completed within scope, cost and execution commitments.  Plan and successfully deliver digital signage and digital retail experiences projects while managing risk, complexity and change.  Plan and manage medium to large complex projects up to $1.0M in capital.  Manage project schedules and budgets to ensure project completion on time, on budget, and within scope and agreed performance metrics;  Provide senior management and the PMO with regular project updates including status reports, project health and financial information;  Analyze project risk and execute appropriate risk management strategies;  Develop project documentation ensuring alignment with business goals and properly defined project scope, deliverables, risk analysis and resource requirements;  Manage implementation of applications through participation in development processes alongside technical leads.  Work with digital procurement team to plan and execute capital purchases and assist in contract negotiation and vendor relationship management.  Work with the Project Administrator to ensure project financial tracking is current and accurate;  Provide leadership to the cross-functional project team in accordance with the project mandate and company’s strategic objectives;  Set project team expectations, and clearly document project success factors;  Uphold efficient communication practices to ensure the project team operates efficiently and effectively.  Required Skills and Experience  5+ years of progressive experience, including 3+ years of Project Management experience and/or 3+ years of Business Analysis experience;  Experience managing all projects through concept, discovery, design, implementation and closure phases.  Experience leading project teams of 5+ members;  Experience managing more than 1 project at a time;  Experience in creating project plans using formal PM methodologies.  Retail experience preferred, even if non-IT.  Excellent oral and written communication skills;  Demonstrated ability to successfully navigate multi-stakeholder relationships, particularly at the senior management level.  Excellent interpersonal skills;  Superior organizational skills and ability to manage time effectively and efficiently;  Demonstrated ability in successfully managing client relationships;  Thorough understanding of project management processes, practices and tools;  The ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with changing priorities;  Demonstrated ability to engage in industry best practice solution development methodologies  Experience managing network implementation projects and working knowledge of IT infrastructure is an asset;  Experience managing Infrastructure Delivery, Systems Integration, Software Development, A/V implementation, and e-Business projects is an asset;  Working knowledge of drawings/blueprints and an understanding of construction practices is an asset;  Experience conducting vendor negotiations, experience developing contract terms and conditions is an asset;  Desired Behaviours  Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers.  Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives.  Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs.  Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups.  Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation.  Academic / Educational requirements  Must have formal Project Management training  A university degree in the field of engineering, computer science or equivalent combination of education and experience.  A graduate degree in a business discipline is considered an asset.  Working Conditions  Incumbent will be occasionally required to travel, for brief trips (up to 1 week).  Hiring contact: smears@tundratechnical.ca  Tundra Technical Solutions would like to thank you for the interest you have demonstrated in this opportunity. However, only candidates with the required skills will be contacted.  Tundra Technical Solutions is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workplace .  Not interested in this position, but know somebody who might be? Check out our Referral Reward Program, referrals are a big secret behind our success. As always, we’re on the lookout for great people. And we know that you know great people. Simply click on ‘Tell a Friend’ option to refer a friend.  Tundra Technical Solutions is among North America’s leading providers of Information Technology and Engineering staffing and consulting services. Our success and our clients’ success are built on a foundation of service excellence. Rather than continually trying to sell to new clients and companies and simply filling databases with candidates, we focus on developing stronger relationships and deeper knowledge of our existing clients’ challenges and opportunities.  Open ears. Open minds. Open futures  The Tundra team has over 600 years of experience, from a wide variety of disciplines – recruiting executives, business owners and technical consultants. Our combined experience ensures that your needs are covered from every possible direction.

Title: Project Quotations Specialist/Estimator
Job_Description: The Project Quotations Specialist/Estimator will candidate will work with the local sales team to prepare fire system project quotations for electrical contractors and distributors, and review plans and specifications to design a cost effective solution that meets all relevant codes and standards. Key Responsibilities:  Prepare work to be accomplished by gathering information and requirements; setting priorities. Prepare project budget by studying drawings; updating specifications; identifying and projecting costs for each elevation. Evaluate offers to purchase by costing changes, additions, and site requirements. Obtain bids from vendors and subcontractors by specifying materials; identifying qualified subcontractors; negotiating price. Resolve cost discrepancies by collecting and analyzing information. Prepare special reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends. Maintain quality service by following organization standards. Maintain continuity among corporate, regional, and local work teams by documenting and communicating actions, irregularities, and continuing needs. Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed  Skills and Qualifications:  Degree or diploma in a related field 3+ years’ of experience in Estimating Experience in analyzing information and developing budgets Strong attention to detail, with a focus on quality Strong communication, problem-solving and decision making skills Ability to work with others in a team environment Preference will be given to candidates with experience in building fire systems  What Mircom Offers:  A great working environment with opportunity for career advancement Competitive salary Group Insurance benefits Company RRSP program

Title: Environmental Project Manager
Job_Description: Parsons is hiring an experienced Project Manager with a desire to work on creating innovative, practical solutions to various environmental problems. The successful candidate will manage environmental site investigation and remediation projects of varying size and complexity, which would include supervision of junior professional staff and technical staff involved in the field investigations, budget control, client liaison and report preparation and review. In addition, the professional would also mentor and provide technical support to more junior staff, as required. A diverse background in environmental site assessment, remediation, risk assessment, and field sampling (soils, groundwater, and surface water) would be considered an asset.  Responsibilities:  Ability to communicate effectively, orally and in writing. Experience in preparing correspondence, written reports and presentations (for regulators / clients and senior personnel). Ability to manage inter-disciplinary teams of professionals and supporting labour categories. Ability to integrate competing and/or conflicting elements into the planning and execution processes so that project requirements flow smoothly. Acts as the Company representative with the client and selected subcontractors during work execution. Negotiates changes to the scope of work with the client and key subcontractors. Markets and secures additional work with client. Responsible for following up on instructions and commitments associated with the project. May participate in negotiations with regulatory agencies and in public meetings in support of clients. Works with other managers, project engineers, and discipline leads to develop budgets, schedules, and plans for the various elements of a project. Ensures that the project meets or exceeds goals established in these plans. Works with the key project individual to devise and execute actions plans to rectify potential cost overruns or delays, or to accommodate significant changes to the scope of work. Advises the client and company management of any such changes. The Project Manager is specifically responsible for maintaining current and timely change orders. Promotes technical and commercial excellence on the project through application of Quality Assurance processes. Monitors and reports to management on the progress of all project activity, including significant milestones, and any conditions, which would affect project cost or schedule.   PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:  4-year degree in Environmental, Chemical, Engineering or related technical/business field 4-8 years of experience in the environmental industry preforming technical and project management duties. Direct experience working at downstream and/or upstream oil and gas sites is preferred. Excellent written and oral communications skills and knowledge of industry practices and regulations (including, but not limited to: Alberta Tier 1 Soil and Groundwater Remediation Guidelines, Alberta Tier 2 Soil and Groundwater Remediation Guidelines and the Saskatchewan Environmental Code). Must be knowledgeable of current technology and how it can be effectively utilized on projects. Professional designation (or the ability to obtain one) as a professional geologist, engineer, biologist or agrologist in Alberta and/or Saskatchewan is desired

Title: Project Manager/Engineer
Job_Description: We have an opening for full-time Project Manager/Engineer in our Calgary office that will be responsible for executing integrated construction projects while following corporate quality standards throughout the project life cycle within our Power & Building Solutions group. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Manage large scale electrical based (low and medium voltage) projects such as Electrical and VFD buildings from quotation throughout design, construction, delivery and support. Act as project subject matter expert (SME) for supplied integrated equipment. Act as the primary point of contact for clients, subcontractors, senior management and the project team. Manage multiple stakeholders and vendors while maintaining and developing client relationships throughout the project and post-completion review. Be an active participant in the high level design, including general arrangements and optimizing building layouts. Manage and provide input on all drawing review cycles from IFA to As Built from the client, subcontractors and internal teams. Have a working knowledge of the document control process to properly expedite supplier and client data deliverables based on the approved Vendor Drawing and Data Requirements (VDDR) list. Manage project execution to ensure adherence to budget, schedule, change management, risk management, scope and specifications. Chair and manage all project meetings including kickoff meetings, pre fabrication meetings, client status reviews and executive status updates. Take an active role in the execution and construction of projects including subcontractor site visits, fabrication yard inspections and testing programs. Support the Inside Sales Team during the Request for Quotation (RFQ) process. Prepare periodic status and progress reports/presentations for clients and Tundra’s Executive Committee. Requirements Minimum 5-10 years of project management experience, focusing on industrial construction. A bachelor’s degree/diploma in engineering from an APEGA or ASET with a focus in electrical engineering. PMP Designation is an asset. Thorough understanding of electrical design, schematics, specifications and codes/standards. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills – both verbal and written. Applied understanding of document control processes and tracking change through the project life cycle. Proficiency of the Microsoft Office Suite including MS Project, Excel, Word, PowerPoint. SAP experience an asset. Must have a valid driver’s license and passport. Minimal travel required. Benefits We offer a base salary with benefits and a generous compensation package. We have a strong philanthropic presence within Alberta and work closely with charities such as The Kids Cancer Care Foundation of Alberta, motionball and others. We are always looking to provide our employees with different opportunities to give back to the community, often during work hours.

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Compugen is an organization that encourages and supports ongoing training and development opportunities. We are composed of a talented, diversified workforce that performs collectively in an entrepreneurial and flexible environment. Our staff members have access to the latest and greatest technologies in performing their daily activities. Well-developed interpersonal skills Advanced skills in written and verbal communication Analytical, systematic and forward thinker Post-secondary degree/certification or equivalent PMP certification nice to have 5-7 year successful experience as a Project Manager, Project Leader or Delivery Manager is a requirement. Computer literacy; proficient in word processing, spreadsheet, flowchart & presentation and project management software tools Must be able to be comfortable in key technologies currently employed by Compugen (highly recommended) Interest in continuing to follow developments in relevant technologies (desirable) Plan and implement small to large scale projects. Direct all aspects of the project planning and execution phases. Work with project team members to create detailed project plan. Engage resources as required by the plan for the successful deployment of the project. Detail and assign work package plans. Meet regularly with the team to follow up on tasks, deliverables and issues. Communicate status to the client via written reports and meeting or teleconferences. Track project plan to baseline against time and budget constraints. Manage project scope & handle scope change requests using appropriate documentation. Log, monitor and handle project issues, analyze & recommend viable alternatives. Hold weekly team meetings and attend client meetings. Lead the Compugen team members towards the successful conclusion of the project. Act as a single point of contact for both the internal Compugen team and the client team. Manage customer expectations. Ensure a high level of customer service and view toward repeat business. Use Compugen's project methodology. Ensure proper documentation is completed & stored where accessible. Documentation includes Statement of Work, plan, schedule, scope changes log, issues log, risk assessment, minutes of status meeting and PIR. Must follow the Compugen Inc. Deployment Guidelines Must strive to improve The Deployment Guidelines Must be able to report on the P&L of all projects Must report on the customer satisfaction of the projects; target is a letter of reference or project survey. Must manage and escalate issues as required.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: AWI’s Project Manager is responsible for planning and executing water filtration related projects. They actively participate in a design team consisting of AWI’s Technical Advisors, other Project Managers and Draftsperson/Designer.At Anthratech Western Inc. (AWI) we provide water treatment solutions for industrialand municipal water and wastewater treatment plants across Canada and in select international markets. AWI is privately owned, with the head office and research and development facility located in Calgary, Alberta.Responsibilities and Duties: Defining the site-specific project scope and schedule.Procurement of components and coordination of delivery logistics.Travelling to work sites to attend meetings and complete inspections.Monitoring project process and communicating status updates to internal and external stakeholders.Scheduling and monitoring AWI’s on-site responsibilities, including equipment installation, performance testing and commissioning.Collaborate with AWI’s Document Specialist to develop project related documentation.Ensuring all aspects of the project meet company and worksite safety standards.Managing unexpected tasks that may arise, including troubleshooting requests, onsite services/repairs and small-parts orders.Supporting coworkers through collaboration, cross training and information sharing.Candidate RequirementsOur ideal candidate will have:A diploma in Engineering Technology or equivalent technical education/background.At least five-years of project management experience in a related field. Experience in a construction, engineering or similar work environment a strong asset.Project Management Professional certification an asset.A valid Alberta driver’s license (class 5) and a clean driver’s abstract.Personal and professional skills desired:Demonstrated ability to take initiative, work independently and use critical thinking to problem-solve.Ability to analyze and interpret technical information and engineering drawings.Strong communication skills (both verbal and written). Bilingual (Eng/Fre) language proficiency a strong asset.Customer service focus, with the ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.Hours of WorkCore office hours are Monday to Friday 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Occasional travel is required.CompensationCompensation will take into account the background, range of skills, knowledge and experience that the successful candidate brings to the opportunity. Following the probationary period, AWI employees are eligible for a comprehensive employee health insurance program with a health care spending account. After one year of service, AWI employees may be eligible for the AWI RRSP matching contribution plan.By submitting your resume, personal information and references to Anthratech Western Inc. you acknowledge and consent to AWI contacting your references and verifying education in order to determine your suitability for this employment opportunity.Candidates being considered for this position must pass AWI’s standard background check and screening process.The position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. No telephone, walk-in or agency inquiries.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:project management: 5 years

Title: Continuous Improvement Energy Manager
Job_Description: Summary The primary objective of this position is to help commercial and industrial program participants apply the principles of continuous improvement to energy management. This position will be responsible for coaching energy teams in identifying, evaluating and implementing energy efficiency activities in commercial and industrial facilities. Previous experience with manufacturing processes and and commercial buildings is preferred.   This position will be in the Calgary, Alberta office of CLEAResult. It will include some travel and a valid driver’s license is required.  Job Description Responsibilities of this dynamic role include leading group workshops and providing individual energy coaching for commercial and industrial faciltiies. Candidates should have extensive experience with the application of Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma principles.  Key duties and skills required for the coaching element of this position include:  Overall program management delivering consulting services to multiple customers Meticulous project management and tracking Motivating and coaching plant management and teams Guiding the development of overall continuous improvement plans Facilitating training workshops and onsite energy audits and other one-on-one events Analyzing performance of commercial and industrial processes using monitoring equipment and statistical analysis Technical report writing for technical and non-technical audiences Ability to coordinate internally and externally with a broad group of stakeholders to ensure alignment and delivery of program requirements and goals Excellent written communication skills for presentations, technical reports, e-mail, and other written documents Outstanding oral communication skills will be necessary for telephone, one-on-one communication, and presentations to groups Project management expertise to successfully deliver projects on time and budget Exceptional customer service The ability to work with a team and give and take direction to/from co-workers.  Education/Experience/Skills:  Bachelor’s degree required 5-10 years of experience in mechanical, electrical, chemical, industrial, energy or facility engineering or a related field. Experience with energy engineering principles, methods, and techniques in industrial/agricultural facilities, systems, and processes is required. A range of experience with the following systems is desired: HVAC, lighting, chillers and refrigeration, variable frequency drives, compressed air, and process equipment. Preference given to those with a Professional Engineer (PE) license, Certified Energy Manager (CEM), Certified Practitioner in Energy Management Systems (CP EnMS) or other similar certification, and willingness to pursue additional certifications and training.  Additional Job Description Equal Opportunity Employer As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees.
