Title: Senior Project Manager, P3 Highway-Bridge
Job_Description: AECOM’s Transportation practice is seeking a senior project manager for large and complex multi-disciplinary Highway-Bridge projects in Western Canada. This position can be based in either AECOM’s Edmonton, Calgary, or Burnaby offices.  The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:  + Managing large and complex projects for Provincial highway clients  + Preparing P3/design-build bids/proposals for new work  + Business development /developing leads aiding in winning new work  + Preparing, monitoring and forecasting budgets/costs and project schedules  + Building project teams and managing project staffing (using a disbursed engineering model)  + Preparing and monitoring scopes of work and methodologies  + Chairing frequent meetings (internal and client)  + Overseeing quality review process for submittals  + Non-project management project, or non-core, work could include some or all of design reviews, scheduling, report writing, presenting  + Mentor and challenge developing staff so they grow in their careers  + The candidate must have experience dealing with both clients and technical staff  + The candidate must have experience interacting at an executive level (both internal and external)  + The candidate should have a technical foundation in design or construction  Minimum Requirements  + Bachelor's degree  + 10+ years of experience managing highway projects  + Must have been the project manager or design manager for projects with fees greater than $10 million and/or construction values of greater than $250 million  + Must have P3 / Design-Build project experience (including both Bid and Execution phases)  + Must have experience managing large and complex multi-disciplinary projects (e.g. road, bridge, drainage, lighting, ITS, environmental, etc.)  + Eligible for P.Eng. registration with APEGA and APEGBC  + Must have Highway project management experience (ideally with Alberta Transportation and/or BC MoTI)  + Must have experience managing projects with fees greater than $10 million and/or construction values of greater than $250 million  + Must have P3 / Design-Build project experience (including both Bid and Execution phases)  + Significant experience in project management  + Experience in budgeting, reporting, scheduling  + Experience writing and winning significant proposals  + Experience with business development  + Experience interacting at an executive level (both internal and external)  + Must have experience managing multi-disciplinary highway and bridge projects  + Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)  + Proficiency in MS Word and Excel  Preferred Qualifications  + 15 years of experience with at least 10 years managing highway projects  + Have or be eligible for registration with APEGA and APEGBC  + PMP designation  + MBA designation  + Foundational experience that might include design and/or site work and/or construction /operations  + Experience working on projects for Alberta Transportation (AT) or BC Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure (MoTI)  + Value Engineering credentials would be an asset  + US or overseas experience will be considered, but regional (Western Canada) experience is considered key  + Experience with various delivery / procurement methods is required including design-build and P3  + Should have a demonstrable network of client and engineering contacts  What We Offer  AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E; is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees.  _NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.

Title: Managing Director and Team Lead, Project Finance
Job_Description: Helping Albertans achieve their dreams by turning the complex world of banking into brilliantly simple solutions. That’s ATB. Is that you? Coach of the Year. Magnificent Mentor. Visionary. Motivator. Team Player. Whether at work or out in your community, you are the person that knows how to bring it all together. You’re a natural leader and your passion and excitement comes from knowing that your efforts make a significant difference in the lives of your team members, customers and the community around you. Managing Director and Team Lead, Project Finance Corporate Financial Services We have an exciting opportunity for a hungry, driven, people-oriented individual who wants to lead a dynamic team of financial professionals to increase and retain business, and maximize the relationships and profitability of a portfolio of growing Exploration & Production clients. Reporting to the Vice President – Corporate Financial Services (CFS), this role is responsible for managing and growing the Project Finance business across the three main lines of business: (1) advisory, (2) debt solutions to the midstream, energy, and P3 space, and (3) deposits. This role will also be responsible for managing the business planning, budgeting and goal setting for the group in conjunction with finance and senior management. They will be accountable for defining, creating, and executing on the strategic direction of the group. The MD, Project Finance will also partner closely with internal and external stakeholders to build impactful relationships to enhance CFS’s market presence and contribute to our customer obsession. This leadership position will assist in the origination and meet annual volume and direct contribution objectives through strategic efforts internally and externally. The successful candidate will demonstrate exceptional leadership abilities to support the team and existing clients, while attracting new clients to ATB. The primary focus of this is role is to develop new opportunities and to enhance ATB’s presence and profile in the Project Finance space by participating in a wide-range of business and community activities. We are looking for a business savvy, fearless, yet accurate and calculated leader with a reputation for execution, excellence and exceptional relationship-building skills. A courageous problem solver - we like to hire people who can think through problems and develop solutions that make sense for the business, for our team members and for our leaders. ATB is an organization that is focused on results and we are looking for someone who continuously finds ways to get things done, regardless of circumstance. We look for leaders who inspire those around them to achieve exceptional outcomes. ATB has always been more than a bank and we are never happy with the status quo. We are looking for someone who has aspirations to reimagine existing processes and be relentlessly innovative. Someone who genuinely believes that financial markets can have a transformational impact on our clients’ businesses, and has an understanding of the mechanics behind it. Specific Accountabilities: Guide the Project Finance team in expanding the business offerings into the PF advisory services space. The successful candidate must be able to position themselves and the team for success in the marketplace in order to continue to enhance the business Guide and assist the team in maintaining a constant pipeline of business consisting of new prospects, deals in various stages of negotiations, and business that will close within a short timeframe Complete the budget and business planning for the group, that will be used by senior management and finance for goal setting and tracking financial performance Meet or exceed goals and targets related to growth or maintenance of the teams assigned portfolio, including profitability goals and targets and or other agreed objectives Proactively analyze client files of existing relationships for opportunities to maximize the relationship by understanding the client’s needs and providing solutions through ATB and CFS lines of business Analyze and negotiate customer and new prospect deals to ensure profitability of the relationship with acceptable credit risk Ensure the team adheres to credit decisions / recommendations that are in accordance with sound credit granting principles and are in accordance with policy and procedures Establish and enhance ATB's presence and profile in the market by participating in business and community activities Build and maintain effective relationships with counterparts at other Financial Institutions to facilitate syndicated or other shared lending solutions Lead, coach and mentor Directors and Portfolio Managers to ensure customer service expectations and credit quality are maintained Connect and collaborate with the many business partners in ATB, while acting as a role model for ATB Leadership Attributes and CFS Values Job Requirements Competencies/Skill-Sets Required: 10+ years Commercial/Corporate lending experience 5+ years of experience in corporate finance, structured finance, project finance or large corporate credit Undergraduate degree in relevant discipline (i.e. economics, accounting, engineering, finance, etc.). MBA, CA, CFA would be considered an asset Experience in the Capital Market space would be considered an asset Strong personal computer skills, preference to experience with Microsoft & Google applications Proven Leadership skills, appreciation for how the organization works together and willingness to foster our working relationship with all parts and people of ATB Financial Strong knowledge of commercial lending policies and products Proven ability to provide creative solutions Demonstration of passion and hunger for achieving results with a proven ability to meet growth targets Exceptional business development and relationship building skills Strong awareness of capital market activities, products and services and ability to identify opportunities for referral to ATB/CFS relationships including AltaCorp Capital Inc. Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to work flexible hours including weekends and evenings  So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. As an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans. Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Advancement. Fun. Rewards… We get it.

Title: Junior Project Coordinator - 8 Month Term
Job_Description: MINTO PROPERTIES INC. Position: Project Coordinator Role & responsibilities: Conducts pre and post project delivery inspections to determine work required and review quality of work completed. Assists with scheduling of trades and deliveries in coordination with project schedule. Assists in maintaining project files, checklists, schedules and other documentation as directed. Assists in managing project costs, managing budgets and tracking projects costs as directed. Reads and reviews architectural drawings to ensure project details are implemented; Inspects and reports concerns in quality workmanship; Troubleshoots in collaboration project team on technical and administrative issues; Directs trades in conducting repairs when required; Issues purchase orders for approval Maintains the highest standards of quality workmanship and leaves space clean after repairs; Communicates and deals with the trades with regards to their deficiencies; Conducts quality control inspections at various stages of construction. Schedules inspections to facilitate building permit requirements, electrical, mechanical and structural engineering review as required Communicates and coordinates with operational personnel, other team members, construction and property management to ensure project objectives are met at all levels; Other duties within the scope, spirit and purpose of the job, as requested by management Qualifications 2 to 3 years experience as a Project Coordinator; College diploma, or in progress in appropriate construction or project management related field considered an asset; Level 1 First Aid and Basics of Supervision, are considered an asset. Strong organizational skills; A solid understanding of all construction trades and construction techniques; Well versed with applicable building codes, Health & Safety and WSIB regulations; Ability to understand and interpret drawings and specifications; Ability to work well with customers, trades, fellow employees and managers; Self-motivated, strong analytical skills and detail-oriented; Experience using Microsoft Word and Excel; experience with Microsoft Project considered an asset; Excellent verbal and written communications skills; Must have driver’s license in good standing; and personal vehicle in good working order.

Title: Civil Underground Project Manager
Job_Description: Bluebird Contracting Services, part of the Trotter & Morton Group of Companies, is a full-service civil contractor completing quality projects for residential, commercial, industrial, and civil clients in Alberta's construction and energy industries. Our operations include: demolition, site preparation, excavation, underground service installation, paving and road construction, concrete services, rail and rail maintenance, and remediation services.  We are looking to hire individuals who will contribute to our team of dedicated personnel by bringing their experience and high-quality workmanship to every project.  Roles and Responsibilities  Manage and supervise day-to-day operations of the project team Initiate, review, and oversee all required project administration and documentation Ensure contract agreements are secured, reviewed, processed, and executed Review, finalize, and distribute project budget Conduct pre-construction turnover meetings for all assigned projects Make sure all required permits and licenses are obtained and posted Initiate set-up, monitoring, and update of project schedule Coordinate all required procurement of materials and equipment, to meet or improve on established schedule dates and budget costs Responsible for subcontract agreement negotiation, preparation, processing and execution Provide reliability that all required submittal review, processing, and approvals. Ensure submittal logs are set-up and maintained Procurement of all materials and equipment Develop, submit, and obtain approval of billing schedule of values Manage execution of contract scope of work, including changes in conditions Responsible for overall financial performance of assigned projects, including continual cost control, manage billing, change orders and forecasting Manage all subcontractors and suppliers Establish compliance with Company policies and procedures Ensure all projects are closed-out in an organized and timely manner Conduct post-construction close-out meetings for assigned projects Make constructive suggestions to the Division Manager on improving procedures, productivity, and efficiency  Required Skills Professional, approachable, and customer-service oriented Strong work ethic and positive team attitude Attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy Good mathematical and analytical skills Ability to prioritize workloads Strong communication skills Ability to lead and foster a positive work environment Advanced computer skills (MS Office, Project and Access) Estimating and scheduling experience Proficiency with Viewpoint software is an asset  Required Experience Completion of a Civil Engineering Degree, CET preferred or equivalent experience Other additional education would be considered an asset Minimum of 5 years of experience required, within civil construction Previous experience in an earthworks and underground civil project management role  Additional Requirements  GSC or PMP Designation is preferred B2W – TRACK experience is preferred  The Underground Project Manager will be required to operate a Company Vehicle; the successful candidate must possess a valid driver’s license and provide a clean driver’s abstract as a condition of employment.  Our Commitment to Diversity  The Trotter & Morton Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to hiring talented, qualified professionals without regard to race, age, gender, or any other protected ground and to providing an environment without discrimination.  Every effort is made to provide fair and equal employment and development opportunities and to ensure that our policies regarding hiring, compensation, promotions, and transfers are based solely on skills and capabilities, job requirements, job performance, and other job-related criteria.  We thank all applicants in advance, however, we will only contact candidates selected for an interview.

Title: Health & Safety Project Specialist
Job_Description: The Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics QSHE / Administration is responsible to support the implementation, maintenance and monitoring of the QSHE Management System for all locations offering Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics services across the Country. The Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics QSHE / Admin Specialist will support the Branch Managers and Distribution Center Managers and Department Managers handling Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics clients to ensure application and execution of Compliance Obligations with all interested parties including quality agreements, legal requirements, KN Policies, Employees Safety, Quality of work and Client requirements. Furthermore, the position will oversee the administrative requirements for contract and document control, assistance with tender requests and maintenance of industry databases.   Main Duties and Responsibilities:   Planning:  To ensure that the Quality, Safety, Health, Environment and Security standards are implemented and maintained in all locations with Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics services across Canada. To be the main pivot point for communication between the Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics branch offices and the QSHE Head Office Team  Development:  To work with Health & Safety Project Specialist (QSHE) to ensure constantly review and updates of the Quality Management System and the auditing tools.  Documentation:  To design, implement review and maintain QSHE Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics documentation up to date to ensure conformity to the requirements and effective operation of the QSHE Management System within the Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics industry and KN Policies. To ensure record keeping of minutes of meetings and action logs to ensure completion and filing. (QSHE File in sharing folder of locations handling Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics businesses) To ensure submission of documentation and maintenance of the KN Canada information of the external databases utilized by the industry clients to qualified the third parties. ISNET, Avetta, Complyworks,etc  Administration:  Set up and maintain centralized Document Control System for contract administration. Assist in RFP / RFI process to provide administrative support to Tender Manager for corporate and QSHE info.  Audits:  To plan and conduct audits to the third parties to ensure compliance with the Qualification Process and Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics requirement necessary to work in the Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics industry . To review and provide feedback to ensure the Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics qualification process is aligned and includes the legal requirements and client obligations including the approval of vendors hiring. To follow up with Audit TIPs to ensure proper CAPA application and closing To attend client audits and external audits new, renewal of certifications required for the industry such as 18001, COR certification.  Reports:  Analysis of QSHE Reports and control of QSHE Action Logs applicable to the Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics offices  Customer Complaints and TIPs  To review TIPs corrective preventive actions and act as QM within the system for proper closing as per TIP Tool process  Key Performance Indicators:  Oversee the development of QSHE KPIs and continuous improvement at the Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics locations.  Training:  Conduct QSHE training for Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics new employees Conduct refresher QSHE training for Projects, Oil & Gas and Marine Logistics employees    Your skills and experience  Minimum 3 years of indirect or direct Project / Oil & Gas experience. Qualified H & S professional, full knowledge and understanding of O&G Industry Standards particularly as it refers to transportation (onshore and offshore) and lifting at heights, Federal and Provincial Regulations, Employments Standards, Human Rights, Environment and Auditing Experience  Knowledge required:  Provincial Occupational Health and Safety Acts and Regulations ISO 9001 - 14001 - COR - 18001  Education required:  ISO 9001-14001-8001 Auditor certification  Skills required:  Organization Skills, People Skills, Confidentiality, Interrogation Skills, Detailed Oriented, Problem Solving Skills, Customer Oriented, Process Oriented, Facilitator skills We offer competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits package, employee discounts, tuition reimbursement, excellent training programs and a highly dynamic global work environment.  If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.   At this time, we are considering only local candidates who are able to work without employer sponsorship. No agencies or phone calls, please. Only those candidates whose experience best meets our requirements will be contacted.   Kuehne + Nagel Ltd. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.     About Kuehne + Nagel With over 76,000 employees at some 1,300 locations in over 100 countries, the Kuehne + Nagel Group is one of the world’s leading logistics companies. Its strong market position lies in the seafreight, airfreight, contract logistics and overland businesses, with a clear focus on providing IT-based integrated logistics solutions. Further information can be found at www.kuehne-nagel.com

Title: Project Manager – Gas Turbine Controls & Commissioning (NOC...

able to adapt to new technologies rapidly Ability to plan, prioritize, and work under pressure to meet set deadlines Ability to work successfully both individually and within team environments Highly motivated and ability to conduct themselves in a professional manner Focused on client service Results driven individual who takes ownership of problems and sees them through to completion Experience in the following would be an asset for the position: Previous experience with rotating equipment controls design (turbines, reciprocating engines, pumps, compressors, turbo-expanders, etc.) Previous experience in the natural gas processing industry within a related technical field Practical experience participating in or leading HAZOP, Risk Analysis, Incident investigations Presentation and training course development and delivery Technical proposal development  Wage: $50.00/hour  Benefits: Comprehensive company benefits plan after standard 3 month probation period (extended health care, dental, accidental death and dismemberment, long-term disability and life insurance, $500 health spending account and relevant policies), work-related travel expense policies, moving allowance of $10,000 and other applicable relocation assistance policies. Title: Project Manager (Civil Engineering)
Job_Description: Job Description  Here’s how we work: The Calgary office is hiring a Project Manager to join the Engineering team. The Engineering department consists of 28 members structured into two (2) teams: design and construction. Both teams consist of project managers, project engineers, specialist engineers, designers, contract administrators, civil technologists and drafters. They are structured to work collectively and concurrently, supporting each other throughout the various stages of projects from conceptual to detailed design to construction and post-construction. This collaboration and support also extends to the other departments within IBI Group such as planning, architecture, landscape architecture, geomatics, and urban design. The versatility of our professionals and designers and their unique strengths, extensive exposure and diverse experiences create for a multi-disciplinary team that is effective in delivering quality projects in accordance with client expectations as well as creating a progressive environment for the growth and development of young professionals and designers.  Our previous and current projects consist of a mix between private and public sector. The following is a list of some of our current notable projects: 17th Avenue SE/Stampede Trail SE: Extension and Enhancement of Roadway and Public Realm Green Line LRT Enabling Works Infrastructure Projects Stonegate Landing Subdivision/DSSP Symon’s Valley Ranch  Most of the things you'll work on: Liaise with clients to coordinate and implement their expectations and visionWorking with senior management in pursuing business development opportunities, determine client requirements and preparing proposals for consideration for public and private sector clientsInteract with other senior engineers to coordinate staffing, quality control and prioritizationManage projects from initial feasibility assessments through design and constructionThe preparation of designs for residential, industrial and commercial land development projectsDevelopment and delivery of calculations for site grading, establishment of utility and roadway requirements for translation into working drawingsPerform preliminary engineering assessments of proposed developmentsManage approval processes with municipalities and other agenciesPrepare and review specifications and drawings to ensure compliance with designProvide guidance and mentorship to junior engineers and technologists Participate in Contract Administration of construction projects while in progress and upon completion for adherence to plans, specifications and regulations Qualifications  You'll need to have: Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering from an accredited universityKnowledge and experience with City of Calgary design guidelines and standardsProficiency with AutoCAD Civil 3D for design purposes is requiredPractical design and construction experience in municipal engineering including roads, drainage, water distribution, sewer, and utilities designUnderstanding of land development approval processesExperience in small localized water/wastewater systems considered a bonus Additional Information  IBI Group aspires to create a friendly, professional and influential team-building environment. The office hosts numerous social and family events throughout the year to build and strengthen ties between employees, their families and the community. IBI Group Calgary is also a participant in the annual Calgary Corporate Challenge competing with other firms in support of local charities, team-building, corporate interaction and healthy active lifestyles. As a professional working in the Calgary office, you will have the opportunity to work alongside seasoned individuals, a diversity of projects and collaborating with teams across the organization. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. IBI Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Project Manager - Calgary
Job_Description: Harvard Property Management Inc. has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to join its team. Harvard is a full service real estate management company based in Western Canada that is recognized for its reputation in leadership, flexibility, quality and performance. The company oversees 8.8 million square feet of commercial properties with regional offices in Regina, Calgary, Edmonton and Winnipeg.This position will report to the Senior Project Manager and will be part of a Project Management team providing capital project management to external and internal clients. The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, contract administration and successful delivery of a variety of leasing construction and capital projects throughout Harvard’s managed portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.What you will bring to the job: - 5 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings;- The completion of a PMP designation is an asset;- Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting;- Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships;- Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines;- The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment;- Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment;- Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and- Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.What you will receive: - Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment;- Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP;- Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program;- Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and- Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. If you feel you are the person we are looking for in this position, please apply with your resume in confidence through the Careers tab at　www.hillcompanies.com.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Compugen is an organization that encourages and supports ongoing training and development opportunities. We are composed of a talented, diversified workforce that performs collectively in an entrepreneurial and flexible environment. Our staff members have access to the latest and greatest technologies in performing their daily activities. Well-developed interpersonal skills Advanced skills in written and verbal communication Analytical, systematic and forward thinker Post-secondary degree/certification or equivalent PMP certification nice to have 5-7 year successful experience as a Project Manager, Project Leader or Delivery Manager is a requirement. Computer literacy; proficient in word processing, spreadsheet, flowchart & presentation and project management software tools Must be able to be comfortable in key technologies currently employed by Compugen (highly recommended) Interest in continuing to follow developments in relevant technologies (desirable) Plan and implement small to large scale projects. Direct all aspects of the project planning and execution phases. Work with project team members to create detailed project plan. Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Our client, a recognized leader in the manufacture of electrical automation products has a long-standing reputation for success through innovation. With a history of advancing and pioneering new technologies for their clients, they are often considered best in class both as a leader of solutions and as an employer of choice. As a member of the national project management team, and reporting to the Canadian Director, you will take the reigns as the liaison between clients, manufacturing, engineering and all key stake holders on projects of scope up to $50M. You will be strategically involved from the bid stage of projects through to project completion. Someone that can be responsible for the project schedule, budgeting, risk assessment and mitigation, cost analysis and resource allocation. Previous track record of leading successful multi million-dollar projects Above average communication skills both written and verbal.  Total Rewards: As well as working for a great company, you will enjoy competitive base salary, bonus, great benefits, long term incentives, and excellent opportunity for career progression.  If this sounds like an opportunity you would like to learn more about please apply by selecting the Apply Option below or send your resume directly via email to Sean Baker: sbaker@locksearchgroup.com Please be sure to indicate “Project Manager” in the subject line.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Our client, a large midstream oil and gas company, is seeking a Project Manager to join their team in Calgary, AB.  Reporting to the Manager, Pipe Integrity Project Management East, this role will execute projects relating to pipeline maintenance projects in Central and Eastern Canada. The successful candidate will work closely with Pipeline Engineering, Construction Services, Environment, Land and various other internal groups in the head office and field locations to ensure safe and reliable pipeline systems.  Responsibilities  The successful candidate will provide Project Management and Project Engineering expertise for various Pipeline maintenance activities such as: integrity digs, installation of in-line inspection launchers and receivers, remedial geotechnical projects, and pipe replacements. Specific duties will include: Provide support to the Engineering team on cost estimating and scheduling during the definition phase;Develop project execution plans and schedules, project proposals and regulatory applications;Project manage sanctioned projects during the implementation phase;Perform time and cost management of the project including budgets and schedules. And managing project cost change control and variance reporting of cost, scope and scheduleProvide weekly and monthly updates on project performance metrics;Coordinate or direct the work of external consultants;Demonstrate an understanding of the numerous department stakeholders' expectations and expert contributions and how they can contribute to the project success;Optimize and align project resources in each region;Provide support during the construction phase in the field;Support emergency response activities;Support the development and implementation of TransCanada's project management tools, standards and processes to support the implementation of capital and maintenance programs within Canada;Other tasks as required.  Qualifications and Education  Qualifications: A strong commitment to Safety and the Environment;Understanding of project management methodologies;Excellent communication skills (written and verbal);Strong interpersonal skills;Self-starter that can work well within a team environment;Good relationship building skills both internally and externally;Ability to quickly understand new processes and related issues;Excellent computer skills - experience with MS Project and Microsoft Web access;Strong analytical, problem solving and negotiation skills.  Education/Experience: University degree in Engineering/Commerce or related technical school diploma;Minimum 4 to 8 years of progressive industry related experience;Eligible for Professional Engineering Status with APEGA; orRecognized Project Management training with PMP certification would be considered an asset.  About Fircroft: Fircroft has been placing people in specialist technical industries for approaching half a century, focusing on mid to senior level engineers for contract and permanent roles worldwide. By applying for this job you give consent for Fircroft to contact you, via email & telephone, to discuss your application along with future positions and Fircroft's services.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client to recruit for a Project Manager.  The Project Manager will be held accountable for managing labour, purchasing, administration, cost control, supplier and subcontractor coordination, communication, scheduling, change order verification, financial ownership of your projects, establishing and managing client relationships.  The Role:  Participate in Estimating turnover meetings and Preconstruction meetings. Work closely with and support our union Foreman with respect to project execution. Manage the labour work force on your respective project with the support and direction of our Labour Manager. Complete monthly financial forecasting reports and participate in our project status review (PSR) meetings. Build and maintain subcontractor and supplier relationships; review contracts for scope, maintain productivity, quality, and costs and ensure the projects are completed in a manner that supports the overall strategic and operational objectives of the company. Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops and seminars; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional organizations. Attend client and construction meetings as required and to disseminate the information to our work force and subcontractors. Manage, verify all change order pricing and documentation. Overall management and oversight of the project team, and projects progress and successful close out.  If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to Andreea Blanch, Consultant, Aplin Engineering & Technical. Our professional consultants are passionate about helping you find a fulfilling job or career and ensuring your complete satisfaction with our process. Our proven track record, nearly 4 decades long, is largely due to our team of highly skilled and successful specialists. Through superior service and a commitment to long-term relationships, we provide deep specialization in core areas for complete recruiting and HR solutions across Canada - all from one source. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!  Learn more about David Aplin Group and view all of our current job opportunities, career tips, and tools at www.aplin.com.

Title: Biologist/Project Manager
Job_Description: We have an immediate requirement for a Biologist / Project Manager to join our Infrastructure Group in Calgary and our growing biophysical team in the Alberta Business Unit. This opportunity will allow you to work on a wide variety of projects across many market sectors, with a current emphasis on water resource projects. KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Infrastructure Group in Alberta and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. This role will give you the opportunity to: Be a project manager, technical advisor and client contact for environmental projects and the environmental tasks of multi-disciplinary design projects Oversee baseline characterization of environmental resources and environmental effects assessment, engaging members of a team of technical specialists, as required Prepare reports and contribute to multi-disciplinary projects by applying your specific technical knowledge and experience Manage preparation and submission of regulatory applications to meet project schedules and serve as primary point of contact for liaising with regulatory agencies Develop budgets and engage in cost estimating and tracking Engage in business development and proposal writing Provide mentorship and guidance to junior team members Provide exceptional service to and develop strong relationships with our key clients, both internal and external to the organization Work with a strong team of talented professionals in a small, cohesive company culture Travel within Canada, primarily Alberta, British Columbia and Saskatchewan If you have a Bachelor or Master’s degree in Biology or Ecology, are registered or eligible to register as a Professional Biologist and have a minimum of 7 years of experience in a similar consulting environment, we want to hear from you! We value your: Experience and knowledge in various market sectors including water resources, infrastructure, transportation, mining, hydropower, and oil and gas. Understanding of design project workflows and consulting business practices Strong technical skills and knowledge - we will consider candidates from a variety of specialized technical backgrounds (e.g., aquatic, wildlife, vegetation, or soils) that demonstrate the requisite project management and regulatory coordination skill set and an ability to contribute to multi-disciplinary teams Strong working knowledge of Municipal, Provincial and Federal environmental legislation and permitting processes Strong initiative, innovation and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive toward long-term success Superior verbal and written communication skills including your experience in writing proposals, technical reports and general project correspondence Exceptional team spirit, interpersonal skills and your ability to build long-term, successful relationships with our clients and our project teams Willingness and availability to travel and work flexible hours when required to meet project requirements About Us: Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the water resources, hydropower, municipal, mining, transportation, geotechnical, oil & gas, and environmental sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton, and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the Water, Power and Transportation, Oil Sands developments, Mining, and Oil and Gas market sectors. We are a leader in multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, dam and hydraulic structures design, water resources engineering, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, and environmental and reclamation services. We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. Are you up to the challenge? If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number 1343-A18. We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Title: Senior Project Manager, P3 Transit (Calgary)
Job_Description: AECOM’s Transportation practice is seeking a Senior Project Manager for large and complex multi-disciplinary Transit-Rail projects (heavy rail and LRT) based in our Calgary, AB office.  The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:  + Managing large and complex projects for transit clients  + Preparing P3 bids/proposals for new work  + Business development / developing leads aiding in winning new work  + Preparing, monitoring and forecasting budgets/costs and project schedules  + Building project teams and managing project staffing (using a disbursed engineering model)  + Preparing and monitoring scopes of work and methodologies  + Chairing frequent meetings (internal and client)  + Overseeing quality review process for submittals  + Non-project management project, or non-core, work could include some or all of design reviews, scheduling, report writing, presenting  Minimum Requirements  + Bachelor's degree in relevant field  + 10+ years of experience, with 3+ years managing transit projects  + Have been the project manager or design manager for projects with fees greater than $25 million and/or construction values of greater than $500 million  + Have P3 / Alternative Delivery project experience (including both Bid and Execution phases)  + Have experience managing large and complex multi-disciplinary projects (e.g. track, civil, systems, structural, architectural, environmental, electrical, streetscaping, operations, vehicles, etc.)  + Must have Transit project management experience (ideally transit-rail experience)  + Must have experience managing projects with fees greater than $25 million and/or construction values of greater than $500 million  + Must have P3 / Alternative Delivery project experience (including both Bid and Execution phases)  + Significant experience in project management  + Experience in budgeting, reporting, scheduling  + Experience writing and winning significant proposals  + Experience with business development  + Experience interacting at an executive level (both internal and external)  + Must have experience managing multi-disciplinary Transit projects  + Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)  + Proficiency in MS Word and Excel  + Must have experience dealing with both clients and technical staff  + Must have experience interacting at an executive level (both internal and external)  Preferred Qualifications  + 20+ years of experience, with 3+ years managing transit projects  + PMP designation  + P.Eng designation  + MBA designation  + Foundational experience that might include design and/or site work and/or construction / operations  + Experience working on projects for TransLink, Edmonton Transit, Calgary Transit, Sound Transit, TriMet, or similar  + US or overseas experience is considered acceptable / equivalent to Canadian experience, but regional (Western Canada or US Pacific North-West) experience is ideal  + Experience with various delivery / procurement methods is required including design-build and P3  + Should have a demonstrable network of client and engineering contacts  What We Offer  AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E; is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees.  _NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.

Title: Senior Project Manager with Agile & Scrum Master experience...
Job_Description: Our valued client requires the need of a Senior Project Manager with Agile & Scrum Master experience to aid in multiple concurrent projects and deliver on project objectives. This individual will partner with stakeholders to lead, recommend and develop best process practices for the delivery of agile projects and timelines. This role will play a critical role within the scrum team as a mentor and coach and is responsible for the facilitation of day to day agile principles and practices.  Task include but not limited to: Lead teams on how to use Agile/Scrum practices to produce high quality products that meet user story acceptance criteria and satisfy customer needs. See Agile projects from initiation through release, provide oversight to ensure alignment of Agile/Scrum practices, including but not limited to: project kick-off, sprint, release and deployment planning. Facilitate discussion leading to collective decision-making, goal setting and conflict resolution within the team. Serve as an Agile Coach and a liaison between the product owner, development team, and management in order to ensure that the requirements are met. Lead daily scrum, sprint planning, sprint demo (with the Product Owner), and retrospective meetings. Provide timely communication to stakeholders throughout the sprint process. Guides the team to be self-organized to advance the Agile Scrum best practices. Manages multiple projects and interfaces with product owners. Remove obstacles to delivery success through the proactive management of external dependencies, team problem-solving and the development of new solutions or approaches to ongoing challenges. Create and maintain open communication within the scrum team to create a trusting and safe team environment. Facilitate and engage in business analysis, user experience and technical conversations across platforms and multiple levels of influence. Communicate and report team progress, status updates, product demos and accomplishments ensuring transparency of progress and outcomes. Provide proactive coaching to the team and recommend continuous improvement of processes and tools to optimize team productivity, quality and speed-to-market. Embrace change, influence and coach team members on agile principles and practices Collaborate with other Agile Coaches to facilitate increasing maturity and effectiveness in the application of Agile across the organization.  Job Requirements: 3+ years experience in an Agile environment (medium-to-large scale initiatives) using influence to facilitate outcomes Agile Management Framework (User Stories, Burndown techniques, Acceptance Test Driven Development, Continuous testing, etc.) 2+ years experience as a Scrum Master Strong experience in communicating complex information and concepts to a variety of audiences, including executive management to support decision making (written and verbal). Experience in Virtual story board tools and train the key stakeholders on the virtual story board tools (Trello, Stories onboard, etc.) Nice to Have Skills: PMP designation is considered an asset Certified Scrum Master / Agile Practitioner or designation in progress an asset Financial institution knowledge is considered an asset Expertise and Skills Project Management, Project Manager 5 - 7 years Priority Requirements Must-have: Please describe your experience as a Senior Project Manager with Agile & Scrum Master experience aiding in multiple concurrent projects? Must-have: Please describe your experience working in a collaborative, team oriented environment, managing relationships across the organization in a wide range of roles and at differing levels across the organization? Must-have: Please state your experience of how you have integrated Agile operations within your previous projects? Work Environment Location: Calgary NE Duration: 3-6 months plus possible extensions

Title: Senior Project Coordinator
Job_Description: About usWith significant projects completed in Canada including Fairmont Pacific Rim and Shangri-La Toronto, as well as several innovative and engaging developments underway such as Vancouver House and TELUS Sky, ICON is a multi-disciplined construction company dedicated to the art of city building and producing state-of-the-art developments with careful consideration to sustainability.Our team is comprised of talented individuals who are leaders in their industry. We have succeeded in creating some of the most important community developments. Our impressive project portfolio not only enforces our drive to partner with the best developers in North America, but our strong professional standards ensure that we are one of the best construction companies in Canada.About the roleWe have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Project Coordinator to join the experienced team working on the highly anticipated TELUS Sky building in Downtown Calgary.As Senior Project Coordinator, you will be responsible for coordinating activities and resources by working closely with the project team members and decision makers to identify and support project delivery. This includes;Assisting the Project Manager to ensure the project meets budget and scheduleMaintains project file management systemsDevelops and maintains excellent relationship with sub-trades and clientsTakes full ownership of the change order process, including proving, negotiating, processing and assessing cost and schedule impact prior to reviewing with Project ManagerTrack project deliverables and provide reporting on project progress and action itemsAssist the Project Manager with issuing subcontracts and monitors their progressEnforces contractual responsibilities with subcontractorsInvolved in all facets of project closeout, including archiving documents, execution and strategy through innovation thinkingEnsure adherence to company policies and proceduresAd-hoc tasks as required by the Project teamAbout youWe are looking for a passionate and forward thinking Senior Project Coordinator with the following attributes;Experience in High-rise Construction projects preferredStrong experience in Change Order Management essentialKnowledge of Procore software advantageousHigh attention to detail and organisation skillsKnowledge of Alberta building code and regulationsIntermediate skills in Microsoft office suiteConfident negotiator and conflict resolution skillsEffective communication skills at all levelIf you want to be on this journey with us, please click apply now!Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent

Title: Project Manager - Calgary
Job_Description: Harvard Property Management Inc. has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to join its team. Harvard is a full service real estate management company based in Western Canada that is recognized for its reputation in leadership, flexibility, quality and performance. The company oversees 8.8 million square feet of commercial properties with regional offices in Regina, Calgary, Edmonton and Winnipeg.This position will report to the Senior Project Manager and will be part of a Project Management team providing capital project management to external and internal clients. The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, contract administration and successful delivery of a variety of leasing construction and capital projects throughout Harvard’s managed portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.What you will bring to the job: - 5 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings;- The completion of a PMP designation is an asset;- Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting;- Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships;- Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines;- The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment;- Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment;- Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and- Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.What you will receive: - Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment;- Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP;- Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program;- Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and- Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. If you feel you are the person we are looking for in this position, please apply with your resume in confidence through the Careers tab at　www.hillcompanies.com.Job Type: Full-time

This truly unique opportunity will enable the committed individual to expand their career potential alongside the growth and enthusiasm of LW Survey Canada.Our ideal candidate will have above average technical, organizational and communication skills.ResponsibilitiesCommunicate effectively with Field Supervisors and Clients with daily project requirementsResponsible for field data review, quality control and autocad plan preparationCommunicate effectively with supervisors, project managers and clients on a daily basisThorough understanding of conventional survey practices, GPS and geospatial dataAble to understand a safe work environment and be able to perform all job task in a safe mannerEducation and ExperienceGeomatics/Survey Engineering DegreeAlberta Land Surveying designation added bonusMinimum five years relevant Project Management experienceSoftware experience: Trimble Business Center, Trimble RealWorks, Autocad Civil 3D, ArcGIS and Pix4DEmployment EnvironmentPosition is located in LW Survey head office in downtown Calgary, ABLW Survey offers a full benefit package and wage will be commensurate to applicable experience.Job Type: Full-time

Job_Description: 05/02/2018  001435  Pomerleau is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Title: Project Manager - NGL Facilities
Job_Description: Design Group has partnered with a leading midstream operator in their search for a Project Manager. This individual will lead the successful execution of multiple NGL projects.  This is a contract opportunity.  Key Activities and Responsibilities : Work closely with Business Development, Operations, Engineering and other internal groups to support the development and implementation of new projects  Manage AFE and internal project management systems, including design, cost estimates, reporting, construction, and commissioning efforts for viable projects  Ensure projects are completed safely, with minimal environmental impact, within all rules, regulations and industry best practices, on budget, on time, and are an operational success  Support the ongoing development of Engineering and Technical Standards  Complete operating cost estimates for new business opportunities  Respond to field and office technical requests as required  Knowledgeable in all current operating standards, codes, rules and regulations that impact pipeline and NGL facilities  Education, Skills and Experience: The successful candidate will be a Professional Engineer with a minimum of 7 years of related experience. Title: Power Transmission Project Manager
Job_Description: This is a high ranking opportunity in our client's Power Transmission department to oversee projects ranging as high as $100M. Due to unprecedented growth, even in these economic times, they have created this senior management role to aid the development of their power transmission business into new frontiers. You’ll be responsible for everything from estimating & preconstruction services through to the organization, planning & execution of projects. This will include effective project management and operation of the work crews. Working closely with the VP of Operations you will build upon existing marketing and business development plans, identifying, pursuing and securing new Transmission business. You will target owners, consultants and direct clients to build on an already established reputation for quality & value. You’ll also be responsible for planning and executing existing transmission projects keeping a focus on optimizing profitability. This will require effective project management, risk management, costing, scheduling and administration skills. You’ll be looked upon to think outside-the-box on projects, recommending innovative methods, materials, equipment and work practices. As an industry veteran you will have the inside scoop on industry developments such as the changing labour market, legislation, regulations, insurance issues and other project risks. With a tireless focus on team building you’ll be expected to foster a team spirit and camaraderie with your staff to optimize performance and employee involvement. This company is proud of their team and the growth they’ve realized regardless of the times. They are involved in an exciting array of cutting-edge projects and will offer you the newest & best technologies to get the job done. You will be in a position to express your creativity and implement new practices & procedures – leaving a lasting mark on the industry. Job Requirements Professional Engineer’s certification or IP certification in the Powerline or Power Systems Engineer trade  15 years or more of experience blending field & office responsibilities  An extremely strong awareness of the power transmission industry and technological & operational innovations  A natural tendency to lead a team by being a part of the team  Exceptional communication & business development skills  Professional & warm interpersonal skills with the ability to build lasting relationships with customers, management, co-workers and subordinates  A commitment to ongoing personal development and the development of your team  An even mindset under pressure and in tough situations  A ‘can-do’ attitude with the priority of making a difference in the industry To Apply To apply for this job, please send a resume and covering letter to jobs@cms-management.com. We thank all project manager candidates interested in this position, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. CMS will keep your information in a private database in the event that another, more suitable position becomes available.

Title: Sr. Project Administrative Assistant
Job_Description: Performs a variety of administrative/clerical support tasks for a specific project, business, or technical unit. Labor charges or normally billed to client contracts. Exercises more independence in day-to-day operations. Individuals would generally support a senior manager, function or group. Title: Project Manager - Mechanical
Job_Description: Job Field: Project Management Job Type: Full time Length of Assignment:  SUMMARY  BGIS, A Brookfield Company, is looking for a Project Manager - Mechanical to join our growing team! We are currently seeking a Project Manager with mechanical design experience for the Calgary area, who would have to manage several building projects in client leased and owned buildings as well as provide mechanical expertise for mechanical designs/scopes. The type of projects are primarily replacement of electro-mechanical equipment and building components due to end of life, addition of electro-mechanical equipment due to growth of our client's network, increasing electro-mechanical resiliency and upgrade of existing building equipment to meet the latest environmental requirements. Many of these buildings house telecom (voice, internet and TV), IT equipment (data centres), studio’s and offices which are essential to client services, therefore proper planning, scope and risk management are required in the realization of the projects.  The position would be for an intermediate to senior candidate and the individual is expected to be autonomous and would receive some coaching. The position also requires good communication and customer relation with our internal clients.  The Project Manager will perform/have the following duties/responsibilities as regrouped in the three main areas below:  1. Project Delivery in Mission Critical Environments: Replacement or addition of building systems such as electrical, stand-by power, UPS, mechanical, HVAC, plumbing, fire detection, sprinkler, DDC, etc. in buildings housing telecom equipment, data centers, production studios (radio and television); Taking into account building codes, occupational health and labor regulations; Taking into account complexity of construction issues and risk mitigation for work in a live technical environments; Work with internal groups such as program management, engineering. procurement, transaction management and operations teams, internal clients (requester of the project such as telecom, IT or production operating groups) to ensure the appropriate project delivery and maintaining good relations. 2. Project Management Processes and Quality Assurance:  Use project plans, schedules and budgets to ensure the highest quality of delivery in accordance to project requirements (key date and client standards); Ensure that the team (consultants, contractors, Real Estate Engineering, buildings operation) delivers projects for the client, on time, within budget and according to internal customer requirements; Take a pro-active approach in the planning of key activities and therefore eliminate surprises/delays; Obtain competitive prices and ensure that the client receives the maximum value for the products and services; Suggest when appropriate ways to improve existing processes or reduce cost without reducing on required quality 3. Communication and reporting:  Produce reports in order to keep the various internal groups informed on the project progress (schedule and budget), potential problems to come with a mitigation plan; Develop and maintain good working relations with our internal groups (engineering, program, operations and internal clients) in order to demonstrate the added value that the Real Estate groups bring to their business As Mechanical Engineer, the role is to:  Provide technical support to buildings operation when there are mechanical issues on HVAC, water towers, chillers, condensers, CRAH and CRAC units, pumps, valves, sprinkler systems, emergency generator ventilation/exhaust systems Prepare risk mitigation strategies based on reliability and resiliency Base on project requirements (life cycle, growth, de-risk, improvements) provide mechanical technical expertise in preparing the scope/design intent which will then be used to tender for consultant design Work with and review consultant mechanical design to ensure they are as per client Standards and scope Provide mechanical expertise for commissioning of mechanical systems during projects The approximate work load split between the project manager role and mechanical engineering role is expected to be PM = 80% and Mech Eng = 20%). Although the engineer will be located in Calgary, some of the sites that he will have to manage are located in other regions of Alberta such as Edmonton and Manitoba such as Winnipeg both also covers rural sites in those provinces. So the engineer will be expected to travel at times.  Essential skills/competencies:  University degree in Project Management and/or Mechanical Engineering from a recognised university Registered professional engineers in Alberta PMP certification would be preferred A minimum of 5 years of project management and/or construction experience A minimum of 5 years of mechanical system design and construction supervision Experience in managing projects in Data Center or telecommunication industry preferred. Knowledge/experience in use of Project Management software/tools (Microsoft Project, Excel, Power Point, PMWeb, etc.), Good knowledge in the following areas: codes, detailed estimating, SOX Autonomous, but also a team player Flexible to deal with tight deadlines and a quickly changing environment Detail oriented with strong analytical and problem solving skills Fluent in English (oral and written) with excellent communication abilities; knowledge of French (an asset but not mandatory)

Title: Estimator/Project Manager

Previous experience estimating in these fields preferred;Leadership skills withproven track record in successfully estimating small to large scale projectsGood understanding of mechanical and structural drawings and ability to interpret schematics and P&ID;’sExcellent and proven organizational skills and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks within a fast-paced work environment;Excellent interpersonal and communications skill, both written and oral;Demonstrated computer software proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel) and MS projectsRequired ExperienceCompletion of a Mechanical or Structural Engineer degree or CET would be an asset;Minimum 2 years of experience in industrial construction**BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES: Professional and approachableHighly AnalyticalStrong work ethic and positive team attitudeStrong attention to detailAbility to establish a strong communication and credibility with clients' management teams through the highest level of professionalism and integrityBright, quick, articulate, excellent presentation and interpersonal skillsPassionate about business results, with a strong sense of accountability, metrics and ownershipStrong organization and prioritization skillsCOMPENSATION: Bigfoot Industrial offers a Competitive salary between $70,000 to $80,000 based on qualifications and previous experience with a bonus/incentive structure. Benefits package after 3 month probation period.About Bigfoot Industrial Services: Bigfoot Industrial Services Ltd. is an industry leading, full service, Millwright, Welding, Fabrication and Construction Management Company servicing both the Industrial and Commercial sectors.Our market focus includes, however is not limited to; oil and gas, manufacturing, distribution, food production, and agricultural. Our geographic market served is mainly Calgary and the surrounding area, however we have the capability of taking business on anywhere in Alberta, British Columbia, and Saskatchewan. We continue to thrive as a business by offering quality service, quality products, and by following a business development strategy consisting of an expert sales team, an educated estimating team, and a group of dedicated millwright and welding tradesmen. What distinguishes Bigfoot Industrial from their competitors is the quality of their trades people, their ingenuity, the unparalleled customer service experience and the products offered coupled with competitive pricing.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Estimating: 2 yearsEducation:Bachelor's
