Title: Project Manager - Electrical
Job_Description: The Calgary office of Smith and Andersen is currently seeking an Electrical Project Manager. You’re all about prioritization. While everyone else is focused on their individual tasks, you’ve got an eye on the larger goals, and have a detailed road map for how to meet those goals. When others work with you, they know that deadlines won’t slip and details won’t get missed. As a natural leader, you’re happiest when everyone is moving in the same direction, and you never hesitate to step up and get others the answers they need. You have clear communication skills, and can effectively wield those skills to make sure clients, consultants, and contractors are kept in the loop. You can easily manage multiple tasks without getting frazzled, and are eager to take on some of the biggest and most exciting projects in the country.  Does this sound like you? If so, here are some of the more detailed responsibilities you can expect in this position:  Prepares, or assists Principal-in-charge with, the development of all system engineering concepts (e.g. design brief) and concept report. Reviews and manages the design in terms of construction budgets. Performs, or arranges for, reviews of existing installation and interprets/manages the impact on the project. Prepares all calculations and selects all equipment. May assign tasks to designer and CAD Technician where appropriate. Fully understands Codes and Standards relevant for the project and is able to communicate all requirements to the internal project team, external project team, owner, and Authorities Having Jurisdiction. Ensures proper coordination of document with the internal and external project team (architect, interior designer, and other disciplines). Fully understands (construction) project procurement methodologies and is able to recommend or apply such method for the project Responsible for reviewing all deliverables for the project whether reports, calculations, drawings, or/and specifications. Reviews for completeness and accuracy at various stages of development and as defined by internal total quality management. Promotes and enforces company standards relating to project administration, documentation and processes such as total quality management. Where requested by the Principal-in-charge or Associate Principal act as contract administrator for designated projects, ensuring timely completion of all contract administration activities for project. Ensures that shop drawing review process takes place within project timelines. Coordinates with the contract administration team regarding drawing reviews, proper set up of contract administration process and site activities. Prepares all change notices or reviews change notices issued by contract administration team. Responsible for ensuring tasks are completed both accurately and with the assigned hours/fee. Responds to both technical and financial queries related to the project. Keeps the Principal-in-charge or Associate Principal advised of all changes in scope of work and prepares amendments to the contract (e.g. Request of Additional fee-RAF) for review and submission to client. Supports the process of accounts receivable. Responsible for ensuring the internal project team discipline coordination processes are complete. Prepares and continually monitors a schedule of tasks required to complete the project including hours to perform tasks and critical data required for performance. Liaises with external consultants, vendors as required to ensure smooth project delivery. Organizes and attends meetings including client meetings. Capable to deliver presentations to client/owner. A few more qualifications which will help you with these responsibilities:  Possess 3 or more years of project engineering experience in the field of electrical building services A senior C.E.T. with equivalent experience and abilities will also be considered Demonstrate a strong leadership qualities and ability to work independently Demonstrate the ability to work in a complex environment, dealing with multiple projects and clients Possess sound communications skills as demonstrated through client and staff relations Demonstrate experience working with other consultants and contractors, and coordination of major projects Knowledgeable about the provincial building code, electrical code, CSA, ULC, IEEE, IES and NFPA standards Have excellent problem solving and decision-making skills LEED certification / Experience implementing sustainable design (LEED projects) is an asset Strong knowledge of engineering concepts, methods and standards. Demonstrates initiative and practical problem solving. To apply for this position, please email your resume and cover letter to careers@smithandandersen.com. Please place the job title and office location in the subject line of the email.  Appropriate accommodations will be provided to candidates upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process. Successful applicants will be advised of Smith + Andersen’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended.  Only qualified candidates will be contacted.  Smith + Andersen is a trusted Canadian consulting engineering firm with offices in Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton, Winnipeg, London, Toronto, Ottawa, and Halifax. Founded in 1965, our firm has organically grown from an established reputation as trusted mechanical and electrical consultants, reaching new levels of engineering and design excellence in the communications, security, and audiovisual fields, and providing enhanced services such as lighting, building automation systems, and intelligent integrated systems design. Thanks to our client-focused approach, our team is consistently called upon to apply efficient, sustainable, and reliable design and engineering solutions on the most exciting projects across Canada. From fully-integrated hospitals and welcoming schools, to healthy workplaces and secure transit stations, our team has established lasting relationships with public and private sector clients across the country. Smith + Andersen is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Project Manager - Calgary
Job_Description: Harvard Property Management Inc. has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to join its team. Harvard is a full service real estate management company based in Western Canada that is recognized for its reputation in leadership, flexibility, quality and performance. The company oversees 8.8 million square feet of commercial properties with regional offices in Regina, Calgary, Edmonton and Winnipeg.This position will report to the Senior Project Manager and will be part of a Project Management team providing capital project management to external and internal clients. The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, contract administration and successful delivery of a variety of leasing construction and capital projects throughout Harvard’s managed portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.What you will bring to the job: - 5 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings;- The completion of a PMP designation is an asset;- Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting;- Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships;- Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines;- The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment;- Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment;- Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and- Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.What you will receive: - Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment;- Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP;- Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program;- Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and- Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. If you feel you are the person we are looking for in this position, please apply with your resume in confidence through the Careers tab at　www.hillcompanies.com.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Compugen is an organization that encourages and supports ongoing training and development opportunities. We are composed of a talented, diversified workforce that performs collectively in an entrepreneurial and flexible environment. Our staff members have access to the latest and greatest technologies in performing their daily activities. Well-developed interpersonal skills Advanced skills in written and verbal communication Analytical, systematic and forward thinker Post-secondary degree/certification or equivalent PMP certification nice to have 5-7 year successful experience as a Project Manager, Project Leader or Delivery Manager is a requirement. Computer literacy; proficient in word processing, spreadsheet, flowchart & presentation and project management software tools Must be able to be comfortable in key technologies currently employed by Compugen (highly recommended) Interest in continuing to follow developments in relevant technologies (desirable) Plan and implement small to large scale projects. Direct all aspects of the project planning and execution phases. Work with project team members to create detailed project plan. Engage resources as required by the plan for the successful deployment of the project. Detail and assign work package plans. Meet regularly with the team to follow up on tasks, deliverables and issues. Communicate status to the client via written reports and meeting or teleconferences. Track project plan to baseline against time and budget constraints. Manage project scope & handle scope change requests using appropriate documentation. Log, monitor and handle project issues, analyze & recommend viable alternatives. Hold weekly team meetings and attend client meetings. Lead the Compugen team members towards the successful conclusion of the project. Act as a single point of contact for both the internal Compugen team and the client team. Manage customer expectations. Ensure a high level of customer service and view toward repeat business. Use Compugen's project methodology. Ensure proper documentation is completed & stored where accessible. Documentation includes Statement of Work, plan, schedule, scope changes log, issues log, risk assessment, minutes of status meeting and PIR. Must follow the Compugen Inc. Deployment Guidelines Must strive to improve The Deployment Guidelines Must be able to report on the P&L of all projects Must report on the customer satisfaction of the projects; target is a letter of reference or project survey. Must manage and escalate issues as required.

Title: Project Manager - LRT
Job_Description: Number: 20669 Location: Calgary Date Posted: April 03, 2018 Project Manager Our client is currently developing major LRT infrastructure projects in two major Canadian cities – these multi-billion-dollar projects are expected to last through 2021 and deliver dozens of miles of new light rail track across the Canadian landscape. Due to the scale and scope of these projects, our client is seeking candidates who can provide Subject Matter Expertise regarding the unique needs of large LRT projects, including Project Managers with: 15+ years in leadership roles on large construction projects in the infrastructure industry Significant (5+ years) experience overseeing major construction in the LRT industry Ability to work with both internal and external stakeholders to ensure the project runs smoothly Strong background in cost planning and contract management for major infrastructure projects Comfortability working within a multi-cultural project environment Prior working experience in the Canadian infrastructure construction market (preferred, but not required)  Who are we? The company’s head office is in Norway, supporting key operational offices in Australia, China, Japan, South Korea, Singapore, Trinidad, UK and USA. With senior business management coming direct from the energy sector, the company’s ethos is to provide the highest level of service to candidates and customers alike. Following key successes in Europe and Australasia, the company has initiated an ambitious expansion strategy, targeting the Americas, Middle East & Africa, with particular focus on the subsurface, drilling & completions sector and the expanding LNG market, as well as infrastructure and transportation construction.  Competentia is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or other status protected by law or regulation.   Competentia, participates in E-Verify as required by law.

Title: Assistant Professor, Engineering Project Management in Energ...
Job_Description: Position Overview The Department of Civil Engineering, in the Schulich School of Engineering at the University of Calgary, is pleased to invite applications for a tenure-track faculty position at the rank of Assistant Professor in the area of Engineering Project Management in Energy Sector. The preferred start date of the appointment is July 1, 2018 or as negotiated.   The successful applicant will be expected to teach courses in Engineering Project Management as well as fundamental and advanced courses in Civil Engineering. The main criteria for selection are research and teaching excellence. The successful candidate will provide evidence of high quality scholarly output that demonstrates potential for independent research leading to peer-reviewed academic publications and securing of external research funding, active engagement with industry, and supervision of graduate students. The candidate must also be able to demonstrate a strong academic background and research expertise in Engineering Project Management in Energy Sector, and an ability to work as part of our highly-collaborative research teams. Specialization and expertise are required in one or more of the following areas: Major Energy-related Projects Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) Supply Chain Management Entrepreneurship and Innovation Assistant Professors will dedicate their time to teaching our undergraduate and graduate programs, continue to engage in high impact research, submit scholarly works to high quality publications, and provide service with the university and within our profession.  Candidates must hold a B.Sc. in Engineering and a Ph.D. in Engineering or a closely related discipline; a strong research track record; a demonstrated ability in teaching excellence or evidence of excellence in teaching at a university level. Relevant industrial experience is an asset. Complementing the current faculty, the incumbent is expected to participate in joint projects, and develop a strong independent research program. Working as a team and providing service to your Department, Faculty and University are required. Candidates should have strong oral and written English communication skills.  Candidates must be a registered professional engineer or eligible for registration as a professional engineer with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA). Information about becoming a professional engineer can be found online.  The Schulich School of Engineering is committed to fostering diversity through cultivating an environment where people with a variety of backgrounds, genders, interests and talents feel welcome and included. In 2016, the Schulich School of Engineering was recognized with the KNOVO Award of Distinction to honour the school’s commitment to diversity and equity.  Interested individuals are encouraged to submit an application online via the 'Apply Now' link and are advised that the application process allows for only four attachments. Your four application attachments should be organized as follows: Attachment 1: Curriculum Vitae, Name and contact information of at least three referees (referees will only be contacted if the applicant is short-listed for the position) and samples of 3 scholarly publications. Attachment 2: All Postsecondary Academic Transcripts (B.Sc., M.Sc., and Ph.D.) Attachment 3: Statement of teaching interests with respect to technical subject areas and how you would plan and deliver an undergraduate engineering course (not to exceed two pages) Attachment 4: Statement of proposed research (not to exceed two pages), that includes: Research objectives Recent activity in this area Methodology (how the research will be conducted) Significance and potential impact of the research Link to the University of Calgary’s Strategic Research Themes Applications are encouraged as soon as possible and will be accepted until June 30, 2018.  Salary is competitive and will be determined according to the successful applicant's accomplishments, experience and qualifications.  The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their academic and professional success while they are here. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.  About the Department The Department of Civil Engineering offers B.Sc., M. Eng., M.Sc., and Ph.D. degrees in a variety of specializations. The University of Calgary is a comprehensive research university with close to 30,000 full-time students, including over 5,000 graduate students. It is in the Canadian top ten in a broad cross-section of measures including: research funding, endowment, graduation of Ph.D. students, fundraising, and the quality of professoriate. The Schulich School of Engineering supports the University of Calgary vision of Eyes High to become one of Canada’s top five research universities. Related information can be found at the department website. Additional Information To learn more about academic opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our Academic Careers website. For more information about the Schulich School of Engineering visit Careers in the Schulich School of Engineering. About the University of Calgary  The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit ucalgary.ca.  About Calgary, Alberta Calgary is one of the world's cleanest cities and has been named one of the world's most livable cities for years. Calgary is a city of leaders - in business, community, philanthropy and volunteerism. Calgarians benefit from a growing number of world-class dining and cultural events and enjoy more days of sunshine per year than any other major Canadian city. Calgary is less than an hour's drive from the majestic Rocky Mountains and boasts the most extensive urban pathway and bikeway network in North America.

Title: Project Manager, Alberta Lands Surveyor/Articling Pupil
Job_Description: Who we are:  Challenger Geomatics Ltd. is a diverse geomatics company providing innovative surveying and mapping solutions to the public, government and industry across Western and Northern Canada and internationally since 1984. The company is wholly owned by its employees and has a staff of more than 160 dedicated employees based in Calgary, Grande Prairie, Edmonton, Fort McMurray, Yellowknife and Whitehorse.  Does Your Career Require a Challenge?  Challenger offers challenging and rewarding employment along with on the job training and educational courses that allow our team members to rise to their full potential. We pride ourselves in offering opportunities for growth across all our offices. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages to our employees. Challenger looks for "talent"- people who will be challenged and engaged in a growing company. We know that it is through our talent that we can continue to attain our goals and realize our vision.  Ready to join the Challenger team?  We have been growing in all areas and continue to seek out passionate and innovative people who strive for excellence. Our growth is your opportunity!  We are currently seeking the talent of a Project Manager, Alberta Lands Surveyor/Articling Pupil (ALS)  Position Overview: Reporting to the Vice President, the Project Manager is accountable for the management of a project or portion of a project. The Project Manager’s duties include marketing, project planning, customer liaison, cost control and supervision of staff working on their projects, and completing field survey tasks as required.  General Responsibilities:  Assumes responsibility for defining with the client, each project’s scope, time lines and fees Develops each project plan, assigns tasks to field and office staff and holds personnel accountable for performance Responsible for the management of the project. Continuously monitor project performance in meeting budgetary and profit targets, and initiate appropriate changes as required Mentors field and office staff including on site supervision when required Liaises with project clients on an on-going basis, keeping the client informed as to progress and problems, and, dealing with client complaints, queries etc. Monitor the performance of personnel assigned to the project for the purpose of maintaining service quality and continuous improvement Ensures each project is carried out according to the standards set out by the company’s health and safety program; regulatory requirements; professional requirements; and Challenger policy and procedures Keeps abreast of technical, professional or regulatory developments affecting field and office procedures and is knowledgeable to expert in their use Provide information required for the development of client invoices and assist in collections on an as-required basis Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:  Solid working knowledge of MicroSurvey, AutoCAD and the operation of Leica and Trimble GPS and Total Station instruments Experience with supervising the work of others Possess the ability to provide exceptional customer service Solid written and verbal communications skills Ability to manage time and prioritize tasks Qualifications:  Graduate geomatics engineer or technologist, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience Minimum of 5 years of office and/or field experience in surveying Professional designation in a geomatics, survey or engineering field, or a designation near completion, would be considered an asset for this position Valid Class 5 driver’s license

Title: Project Manager – PAS Implementation
Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking a Project Manager – PAS Implementation for a seven (7) month contract opportunity, scheduled to begin immediately.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Clearly defining project objectives;  Understanding and managing the Project Sponsor’s priorities;  Leveraging the client’s estimating guidelines and best practices to create realistic schedules and budgets for projects;  Managing a large team of resources, vendors, and multiple business partners;  Ensuring successful Project Delivery (i.e. delivering a quality solution on schedule, within the approved budget and scope);  Coordinating the efforts of Project team members, including vendors;  Managing resource utilization on the Project to meet approved scope, schedule, and budget;  Actively managing the Project plan, progress, budget sheet, forecasts, and earned value;  Executing proactive Change Management;  Planning and executing Risk and Issue Management strategies, leveraging Health Checks for independent assessment and action plans for at risk Projects;  Engaging and managing all applicable Project Vendors or Suppliers as per contract terms and conditions;  Managing expectations of stakeholders and communication progress;  Acting as primary conduit of communication within and outside the Project team with respect to Project activities;  Ensuring all required project documentation is timely, complete, and of high quality;  Providing oversight, guidance, motivation, roadblock removal, and escalation support for project team members;  Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and decompose high-level information into details; and,  Driving and challenging business units on their assumptions of how to execute their plans.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: A minimum of ten (10) years’ IT Project Management experience;  Comprehensive knowledge of Project Management principles, methods, and techniques;  Strong stakeholder management skills;  The ability to facilitate multiple business areas to agree on scope and requirements;  Excellent teamwork, communication, and interpersonal skills;  Excellent planning, forecasting, and organization skills;  The ability to be self-motivated and able to produce a high quality of work with limited supervision;  Excellent critical thinking, problem solving, and decision making skills;  The ability to be hands on and lead teams as required;  Experience with Production accounting (PAS, Prism, SAP) is nice to have;  Project Management experience on large initiatives is nice to have;  Formal Project Management training and/or designation (i.e. PMP) is nice to have;  Data migration background is nice to have; and,  Previous vendor management experience is nice to have.  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.

Title: Intern, Project Coordinator - Buildings Division
Job_Description: Internship  05/11/2018  Internship  Pomerleau is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder. Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do.  The Opportunity  Curious about interesting and impactful work in construction? Even going as far as gaining real world work experience? What about being a part of a student community with many other students during your work term? Peaked your interest yet? If this speaks to you, it’s your time to shine.  Pomerleau is home to an innovative environment allowing students like you an opportunity to thrive. Working with and supporting our Project Management teams, you can take your ideas and passion for construction to the next level. Get hands-on experience working on state-of-the-art projects and develop skills working with some of the best minds in the industry. The pace and path you choose to grow and launch your career is your choice – but let us help you get there. As a key member of our team, we will rethink construction together, from idea to completion. Everywhere. All the time. Period.  What YOU Will Do  Jump in and experience first-hand the on-site construction project management process Assist the project team with daily tasks, coordination and project support Take pride in learning about shop drawings and effectively monitor them Collaborate and keep the lines of communication open when working with team members, trade partners, consultants and clients Embrace the learning experience and be open to taking on new challenges What YOU Will Bring  Currently enrolled in a recognized Engineering or Construction Management degree or diploma program Solid written and verbal communication skills Strong computer skills with enthusiasm for innovation A positive mindset and sense of excitement for being in the action everyday on-site A proven track record of team collaboration The ability to work throughout the Greater Alberta Area  What’s in it for YOU?  The Ability to make a difference and build something extraordinary with our team The chance to work with leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities Getting to work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team Opportunities to do challenging work Opportunities to building close relationships peers and other business partners  At Pomerleau we focus on results-oriented, passionate and rigorous people who participate in ambitious and complex projects. You have the profile we are looking for?

Title: Senior Project Manager with an infrastructure background to...
Job_Description: Our client is looking for a Senior Project Manager with an infrastructure background to lead multiple cloud migration projects related to infrastructure and applications. Related items include coordinating Network, Security and File services deliverables being executed by vendor and organizations resources. The role reports the Program Manager on the Cloud Migration Program within the Corporate Services Delivery team.  Project Overview: The client has a Cloud Migration Program in flight with multiple projects within. The program includes: Migration to Azure Cloud services Migration to Data Centre Microsoft Office 365 rollout (Cloud) SharePoint rollout (Cloud) IT Service Model design and implementation and other application upgrades to Cloud Required Experience: The successful candidate must have infrastructure project experience and be able to multitask multiple projects/ streams of work. The PM will be required to facilitate comprehensive WBS, resource plans, schedules, financial forecasts and consistent and meaningful status reporting.   Skills & Qualifications: Post-secondary qualifications in a relevant discipline such as Computer Science or Information Systems, PMP certification preferred 5+ years relevant experience as a Project Manager Experience with infrastructure projects Experience working with mixed project teams of employees, contractors and vendor resources Very strong stakeholder management and vendor management experience Process focus, with strong experience and knowledge on IT project delivery methodologies and best practices; High level of skill developing schedules with MS Project, as well as strong skills in the MS Office suite (Excel in particular), experience with Microsoft VSTS or TFS would be valuable; Comfortable working in a dynamic environment with tight schedule and budget constraints Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills Ability to wear multiple hats and assist with or lead organizational change management activities Expertise and Skills Project Management, Project Manager 5 - 7 years Priority Requirements Must-have: Please comment on your recent experience as a Senior Project Manager where you have managed cloud migration projects. Must-have: Provide comments on your recent experience working on infrastructure projects, including network, security and file services

Title: PMC Engineering Sales & Project Management Representative
Job_Description: The objective for the position is to create opportunities for sales through specification development, project and opportunity intelligence gathering, project management, communication, and working the commercial team through to PPG’s success on large new construction and large capital projects. The Engineering and Project Rep will work within but not limited to a defined territory and shall be responsible for specification and project related activities within the assigned select group of specifying owners, architects and engineers.  Specific job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  Develop new and maintain existing specification position within all available documents such as Master, Project, Budget, and Structural Drawings with PPG’s inclusion within the Structural Steel, Fireproofing, Pipe, Tank, Secondary Containment, and Field Painting Schedule and Specifications. Develop multiple contacts within the firm and contract chain to identify sources of influences vertically throughout the firm’s organization. Identify and track the contract chain progression including awards of key projects within USCA (United States & Canada) or globally by firm and/or owner. Communicate all useful project development, contract awards and developments to the commercial team, management and other members of Engineering and Projects organization, regardless of project location. Utilize company provided market data, including project data, to both identify new project opportunities and track ongoing ones. Record, maintain, and report key intelligence within company provided CRM (Customer Relationship Management) software. Actively participate in industry associations for the purpose of developing contacts and gathering client/customer and competitor intelligence. (Examples such as involvement in NACE, SSPC, CIS, and AWWA) Qualifications Requirements:  A college degree or equivalent in a related engineering discipline, especially civil/structural or construction management is preferred. In lieu of college degree, ten years minimum experience in paint or high performance coatings sales or technical sales. The candidate is expected to have and maintain a valid driver’s license. The position requires up to 70% overnight travel via rail and air carriers and company provided automobile.   PPG Canada is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. Accommodation is available, upon request, for candidates participating in the recruitment process.  We thank all those who apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Sales and Project Management Representative, Flooring
Job_Description: RGO Flooring Ltd. is currently recruiting for a Sales and Project Management Representative. Reporting to the President, this position is responsible for selling products and services to a wide range of accounts and customers. The Sales and Project Management Representative is accountable for increasing profitable sales and expanding customer base. The successful candidate will have experience with project management, budgets, and dealing with sub-contract installers. The successful candidate for this role owns a record of sales achievement alongside a minimum of ten years experience and training. In addition, they possess an advanced knowledge of own and competitor policies, products, services and/or technology.  Responsibilities NEW CLIENT IDENTIFICATION AND ACQUISITION Find new business, follow leads, make sales calls and maintain contact with existing customers. Analyze customer’s requirements, review drawings and recommend products. Generate proposals, pricing, and prepares quotes for potential projects. CUSTOMER SERVICE/FOLLOW THROUGH Visiting client sites. Work with Clients, Designers and Installation crews on following through from sales to delivery, installation and final inspection. Follow up to ensure that deficiencies are corrected to the satisfaction of the customer. ADMINISTRATIVE Preparation of quotes, specification and checks in conjunction with President. Inputting orders into system. Maintain accurate and current records. Training and mentoring new staff. Attending department and company meetings. Approving and forwarding invoices to clients on completed projects. Qualifications High School Diploma. Post-Secondary Education, an asset. 5-10 years experience in a retail sales environment Must have reliable personal vehicle available for business use. Valid class 5 drivers license Positive optimistic approach Self-Motivated, action oriented Takes personal responsibility for actions If you are seeking an exciting challenge and meet or exceed our qualification requirements, please submit your resume to hr@rgo.ca  We appreciate the interest of all applicants and will contact qualified candidates.

Title: Senior Project Manager - Transportation Infrastructure
Job_Description: CIMA+ is currently seeking applications for an experienced Senior Project Manager – Transportation Infrastructure for our Calgary, Alberta office. We are interested in qualified individuals with more than 15 years of progressive experience leading the design and delivery of major transportation infrastructure projects. The successful candidate should have strong transportation project experience, superb interpersonal skills, and excel in written and verbal communication. We are looking for a formidable individual who wants to be challenged and is ready to join a dynamic team that is rapidly expanding. CIMA+ is a well-established, multidisciplinary, Canadian engineering firm with expanding operations in Western Canada.  Responsibilities Lead large multidisciplinary teams throughout the entire project life-cycle for major transportation infrastructure projects including urban roadways, highway interchanges, bridges, transit (LRT/BRT), intermodal yards; as well as other civil works such as site grading and stormwater management facilities Oversee engineering, detailed design, tender preparation, and consultant services during construction Accountable for budget, schedule and meeting the quality requirements of the Client while maintaining effective communication with the Client and stakeholders Coordinate in-house support and subconsultant disciplines Train and mentor less-experienced employees Collaborate with other offices and sector groups Lead technical report writing, including preparation of public documents Lead project progress and technical meetings Cost estimating Risk management Manage project budgets/schedules and ensure adequate staff on-hand to execute projects Maintain Client liaison and meet Client requirements as per contractual agreements Support business development by maintaining existing Client relationships and establishing new ones Lead and/or support opportunity pursuits and preparation of proposals  Qualifications Strong leadership skills, team spirit and a capacity for finding solutions to problems A university degree in Civil Engineering, combined with a minimum of 15 years’ transportation project management experience A minimum of 5 years’ relevant project management experience in Alberta Licensed by the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) as a Professional Engineer (P. Eng.) Experience working in a multidisciplinary team environment Design-build / P3 experience Construction site experience Familiarity with TAC design principles, as well as the relevant policies, processes and procedures of The City of Calgary and Alberta Transportation Familiar with project scheduling software Exceptional communication skills including a strong command of English (written and verbal) Ability to travel on occasion

Title: Project Manager (2130)
Job_Description: On Side Restoration is seeking a Project Manager to join our Calgary team.About On Side RestorationOn Side Restoration is one of Canada’s leading restoration companies. Since 1979, we have expanded to 21 branches coast to coast from Victoria, BC to St. John’s, Newfoundland. Further information about On Side can be found at www.onside.caWhy work with us?Imagine a world where we wake up each day inspired to go to work, feel safe while we’re there, and return home at the end of the day fulfilled by the work we do – feeling that we have contributed to something greater than ourselves. employees!We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, which includes: Excellent health plan, including medical, dental, long-term disability (LTD) and life insurance.Opportunity for promotional opportunities and national career movement.How do we create a successful company in which people can develop and enjoy working together?Inspire people to do the things that inspire themRemain totally committed to our customer’s satisfactionProvide services of the greatest qualityConduct business with the highest ethicsInvest in our people through education and continual trainingKeep a willingness and readiness to changeMaintain active communication and support group-performance and cooperationMeet and exceed industry key performance indicators“If you believe what we believe then we want to talk to you!”Responsibilities :Project ManagementCommunicate effectively and efficiently with all stakeholders to establish clear expectations for all phases of the work to be performedPerform site inspections and accurately record required emergency and repair work detailsEnsure the preparation of accurate quotationsBe available to respond to 24 hour emergency restoration and mitigation calls during on call statusCreate and execute project schedules using proprietary software and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirementsEffectively apply our methodology and company protocolsManage existing client relationships and foster and grow new relationships with industry partnersConsistently meet or exceed industry monitored KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators)Work with our internal operations team in a respectful and professional manner to direct and manage all aspects of the restoration workProject Accounting & Financing ManagementManage project budget/estimateEnsure timely and accurate invoicing for each projectWork with your team to follow up with outstanding receivablesQualification and Requirements: Minimum 3 years Project externally;Be flexible, adaptable and able to work effectively in a variety of settings and as a member of a team.Time management with an emphasis on communicating clear and realistic expectations;Embrace and share On Side Restorations core values and leadership practices;Focus on the team and helping others to achieve common goals.If this is you and you want to be part of this Title: Procurement PMO Specialist
Job_Description: Global procurement position Work with a dynamic team of procurement specialists Permanent role based in Montreal About the role We are looking for a Procurement PMO Specialist to manage Rio Tinto’s supplier outline agreements ensuring they are regularly updated, stored in the central repository system and easily assessable for reporting purposes. Another key component to this role will be the requirement to provide efficient/accurate analytics on products/services spend so that the business is able to make informed decisions minimising wastage, reducing cycle times and finding cost saving opportunities. This role is a great opportunity for someone who has strong category management/procurement reporting experience, is confident in the use of SAP and Ariba and has strong analytical skills to present meaningful data interpretation.  Reporting to the Manager - Mining Equipment, you will be: Develop a Project Management Office (PMO) for reporting across all procurement projects. Streamline the reporting and the procurement process to ensure that the procurement managers have more time to spend on driving value creation rather than on reporting Regularly engage with the business on all procurement projects to ensure the Ariba system is up to date/stored with the current supplier outline agreements Extract spend, cost saving and sourcing data. Then, manipulating and interpreting the data to present business recommendations Coordinate and consolidate information from the contracts to provide actionable reports Establish reporting protocols and work with the team to suggest process/system improvements  About you  To be successfully considered for this role, you will have: Strong analytical skills to dissect complex data and provide meaningful interpretation that present compelling case for improvements Previous experience in procurement/category management reporting Confident use in SAP and Ariba (including navigation and extracting accurate/relevant reports) A good threshold to work in a face pace environment with conflicting priorities Where you will be working Rio Tinto Procurement provides supply chain services that deliver value to the Rio Tinto Group through the strategic sourcing and buying of goods and services for all operations and businesses. Playing a fundamental role, value is achieved through uniformed processes, e-technology, increased corporate social responsibility and measurable savings for the Group.  About us  As pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress.  Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents. Aluminium and copper, diamonds, gold and industrial minerals, iron ore, coal and uranium: our materials make up the world around us. You’ll find them in smartphones, planes, cars, hospitals and throughout your home.  Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce  We are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organization and fulfilling career.  So if this sounds like you and the opportunity you are looking for, apply now.  Please note, in order to be successfully considered for this role you must complete all pre-screening questions.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: AWI’s Project Manager is responsible for planning and executing water filtration related projects. They actively participate in a design team consisting of AWI’s Technical Advisors, other Project Managers and Draftsperson/Designer.At Anthratech Western Inc. (AWI) we provide water treatment solutions for industrialand municipal water and wastewater treatment plants across Canada and in select international markets. AWI is privately owned, with the head office and research and development facility located in Calgary, Alberta.Responsibilities and Duties: Defining the site-specific project scope and schedule.Procurement of components and coordination of delivery logistics.Travelling to work sites to attend meetings and complete inspections.Monitoring project process and communicating status updates to internal and external stakeholders.Scheduling and monitoring AWI’s on-site responsibilities, including equipment installation, performance testing and commissioning.Collaborate with AWI’s Document Specialist to develop project related documentation.Ensuring all aspects of the project meet company and worksite safety standards.Managing unexpected tasks that may arise, including troubleshooting requests, onsite services/repairs and small-parts orders.Supporting coworkers through collaboration, cross training and information sharing.Candidate RequirementsOur ideal candidate will have:A diploma in Engineering Technology or equivalent technical education/background.At least five-years of project management experience in a related field. Experience in a construction, engineering or similar work environment a strong asset.Project Management Professional certification an asset.A valid Alberta driver’s license (class 5) and a clean driver’s abstract.Personal and professional skills desired:Demonstrated ability to take initiative, work independently and use critical thinking to problem-solve.Ability to analyze and interpret technical information and engineering drawings.Strong communication skills (both verbal and written). Bilingual (Eng/Fre) language proficiency a strong asset.Customer service focus, with the ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.Hours of WorkCore office hours are Monday to Friday 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Occasional travel is required.CompensationCompensation will take into account the background, range of skills, knowledge and experience that the successful candidate brings to the opportunity. Following the probationary period, AWI employees are eligible for a comprehensive employee health insurance program with a health care spending account. After one year of service, AWI employees may be eligible for the AWI RRSP matching contribution plan.By submitting your resume, personal information and references to Anthratech Western Inc. you acknowledge and consent to AWI contacting your references and verifying education in order to determine your suitability for this employment opportunity.Candidates being considered for this position must pass AWI’s standard background check and screening process.The position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. No telephone, walk-in or agency inquiries.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:project management: 5 years

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Compugen is an organization that encourages and supports ongoing training and development opportunities. We are composed of a talented, diversified workforce that performs collectively in an entrepreneurial and flexible environment. Our staff members have access to the latest and greatest technologies in performing their daily activities. Well-developed interpersonal skills Advanced skills in written and verbal communication Analytical, systematic and forward thinker Post-secondary degree/certification or equivalent PMP certification nice to have 5-7 year successful experience as a Project Manager, Project Leader or Delivery Manager is a requirement. Computer literacy; proficient in word processing, spreadsheet, flowchart & presentation and project management software tools Must be able to be comfortable in key technologies currently employed by Compugen (highly recommended) Interest in continuing to follow developments in relevant technologies (desirable) Plan and implement small to large scale projects. Direct all aspects of the project planning and execution phases. Work with project team members to create detailed project plan. Engage resources as required by the plan for the successful deployment of the project. Detail and assign work package plans. Meet regularly with the team to follow up on tasks, deliverables and issues. Communicate status to the client via written reports and meeting or teleconferences. Track project plan to baseline against time and budget constraints. Manage project scope & handle scope change requests using appropriate documentation. Log, monitor and handle project issues, analyze & recommend viable alternatives. Hold weekly team meetings and attend client meetings. Lead the Compugen team members towards the successful conclusion of the project. Act as a single point of contact for both the internal Compugen team and the client team. Manage customer expectations. Ensure a high level of customer service and view toward repeat business. Use Compugen's project methodology. Ensure proper documentation is completed & stored where accessible. Documentation includes Statement of Work, plan, schedule, scope changes log, issues log, risk assessment, minutes of status meeting and PIR. Must follow the Compugen Inc. Deployment Guidelines Must strive to improve The Deployment Guidelines Must be able to report on the P&L of all projects Must report on the customer satisfaction of the projects; target is a letter of reference or project survey. Must manage and escalate issues as required.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Requisition Id: 15284 Department: Operations Engineering Department Summary of Responsibilities Pembina is seeking an Engineer, Projects to join our Conventional Business Unit (CBU) in Calgary, Alberta. Reporting to the Supervisor, Project Engineering (Operations), this position’s responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Development of PMO (Project Management Office) documents as required; Liaising with and coordinating project stakeholders to manage project scope, timing, resourcing, and execution; Working with the engineering team to coordinate the delivery of technical deliverables; Working with the SCM (Supply Chain Management) team to coordinate procurement and contracts as necessary for successful project execution; Working with the Pembina commissioning and Operations teams as necessary to ensure the project is appropriately commissioned and turned over; Working with the Pembina document control team to ensure all project deliverables are appropriately numbered, compiled and available for turnover to close out the project; Maintaining appropriate cost control and schedule to ensure successful project management and forecasting are in place; Coordinate and manage as necessary to establish construction contracts, construction supervisors, EHS professionals and other support staff as necessary to ensure successful field execution of the project; Coordinate as necessary with SPCC (Sherwood Park Control Center) and SCADA to coordinate commissioning activities, shutdown activities and other non-routine events as necessary for successful project execution; Consult and coordinate as necessary with the Pembina LARE (Land, Aboriginal, Regulatory, and Environmental) group; and Other general coordination duties as required to ensure the necessary stakeholders are considered as part of the project. Qualifications Preferred candidate would have at least 10 years of combined construction and engineering project experience with either a P.Eng. or CET designation; A background in the mechanical trades is a definite asset; Demonstrated experience in project coordination between design engineering, field execution teams, commissioning teams and Code inspectors; Previous EPC design experience is a definite asset; and Fluent in the tools of project management including cost control, scheduling, contracts, execution planning and project closeout. No agency calls please. Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. >

Title: Intermediate Estimator/Project Coordinator
Job_Description: Our client builds some of Canada’s most interesting public art and creative construction projects and we are looking for an Estimator/PC to lead multiple architectural projects and provide leadership to our estimating team. Experience in fabrication, custom commercial or residential projects is preferred.Principle ResponsibilitiesThis is a blended role requiring a candidate to provide estimates and coordinate and manage projects from 100K up to approximately 2,000,000Leads pursuit teams and estimate, proposal and tender submissionsManages project risk by thoroughly estimating the scope, specifications, site conditions etc.Attends pre-tender meetings to prepare accurate estimatesPrepares takeoffs/estimates for assigned jobsOrders Bid Bonds, Performance Bonds, Agreements to Bonds, Tender deposits, WSIB Certificates, Insurance Certificates, CAD 7s, Letters of Reference, CCDC DocumentsPrepares and follows up on quotations and tendersReviews all contracts and accepted quotationsPrepares budget for entire project prior to bid dateEvaluates estimates with team prior to tender closingClosing /Negotiating of tenders with clients, owners, general contractors etcManages the handoff if awarded projects to project managersBuilds and maintains effective relationships with customers, design and project management teams, subcontractors and suppliersStays aware and informed of all new materials or techniques by attending material manufacturer’s seminars, trade shows, etcPrepares specifications to be used to collect subcontractor quotesWhat is in it for you?Job Satisfaction: You will get to directly participate in some of Canada’s most interesting (and high profile) creative construction and art projects.Job Variation: You will never get bored in this fast paced environment. Every project is different and every day comes complete with its own unique challenges and problems for you to solve.Job Opportunity: You will be exposed to opportunities to grow and develop our relatively young business into one of the world’s premiere manufacturing companies. We have not plateaued and do not plan on doing so any time soon.Culture: You will get to work with fun, dynamic and highly skilled people that are driven to succeed. Remuneration: You will be paid relative to the experience you bring and your accomplishments; you will be rewarded with company success. You will get a company phone, plenty of vacation, and be added to our benefits program.QualificationsCompletion of a relevant post-secondary program (Engineering, Architectural Technology Diploma, etc.) or equivalent work experienceMinimum 3 years of Estimating experience Solid knowledge of construction, steel fabrication, concrete, carpentry, custom manufacturing processes, and the ability to read drawingsExperience tendering to subcontractors and negotiating and administering contractsStrong prioritization and organizational skillsDetail -orientedExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work in a fast paced team environmentExcellent time management skills with the ability to multitaskDemonstrated ability to work both as part of a team and independentlyProven analytical and problem-solving skillsProficiency with Autocad and Solidworks considered an assetPlease note the role requires some travel and on-site visits. If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, please apply through this posting. We regret that only candidates that are being considered for this opportunity will be contacted.Thank you!Job Type: Full-time

Title: Project Manager (2130)
Job_Description: On Side Restoration is seeking a Project Manager to join our Calgary team.About On Side RestorationOn Side Restoration is one of Canada’s leading restoration companies. We respond 24/7 to emergencies affecting residential and commercial properties. We differentiate ourselves through our people and our commitment to excellent customer service, and through industry leading proprietary software. Since 1979, we have expanded to 21 branches coast to coast from Victoria, BC to St. John’s, Newfoundland. We have a Team of over 700+ experienced and certified staff members, with over 300 emergency response vehicles, and 5,000+ pieces of specialty equipment. Further information about On Side can be found at www.onside.caWhy work with us?Imagine a world where we wake up each day inspired to go to work, feel safe while we’re there, and return home at the end of the day fulfilled by the work we do – feeling that we have contributed to something greater than ourselves. This is the world we envision.Our environment: Is friendly, and we love to do company-wide fun things!Is never boring...every day is something different!We provide great learning opportunities to our employees!We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, which includes: Excellent health plan, including medical, dental, long-term disability (LTD) and life insurance.Opportunity for promotional opportunities and national career movement.How do we create a successful company in which people can develop and enjoy working together?Inspire people to do the things that inspire themRemain totally committed to our customer’s satisfactionProvide services of the greatest qualityConduct business with the highest ethicsInvest in our people through education and continual trainingKeep a willingness and readiness to changeMaintain active communication and support group-performance and cooperationMeet and exceed industry key performance indicators“If you believe what we believe then we want to talk to you!”Responsibilities :Project ManagementCommunicate effectively and efficiently with all stakeholders to establish clear expectations for all phases of the work to be performedPerform site inspections and accurately record required emergency and repair work detailsEnsure the preparation of accurate quotationsBe available to respond to 24 hour emergency restoration and mitigation calls during on call statusCreate and execute project schedules using proprietary software and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirementsEffectively apply our methodology and company protocolsManage existing client relationships and foster and grow new relationships with industry partnersConsistently meet or exceed industry monitored KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators)Work with our internal operations team in a respectful and professional manner to direct and manage all aspects of the restoration workProject Accounting & Financing ManagementManage project budget/estimateEnsure timely and accurate invoicing for each projectWork with your team to follow up with outstanding receivablesQualification and Requirements: Minimum 3 years Project Management experience within the restoration or construction industriesMinimum 2 years’ experience using Xactimate is required, successfully preparing residential and commercial estimates for a variety of insurer profiles; - Level 2 certification or equivalent industry experience is preferred.Level 2 certification or equivalent industry experience is preferred.IICRC Certifications, minimum Water Damage Restoration (WRT)Experience using MS Outlook, Word & Excel required.Skills and competences: Proven ability to build and maintain strong working relationships both internally and externally;Be flexible, adaptable and able to work effectively in a variety of settings and as a member of a team.Time management with an emphasis on communicating clear and realistic expectations;Embrace and share On Side Restorations core values and leadership practices;Focus on the team and helping others to achieve common goals.If this is you and you want to be part of this great team, we definitely want to hear from youJob Type: Full-time

Title: Project Manager, Restoration and Construction
Job_Description: We are seeking an organized and dynamic manager to estimate and oversee disaster restoration and construction, in both residential and commercial settings. Our clients are mostly insurance companies/adjusters and property managers, and our responsibility is to deliver satisfaction and a high quality product to the property owner and the insurance client or commercial manager.Responsibilities include estimating clean-up and reconstruction, acting as principle contact for the customer, securing the work and running the job to completion. We want someone who is going to be aggressive in hunting and securing new work as well as delivering on our promises to keep our customers satisfied. You’ll report to the GM and work closely with the Administration Team, the Operations Team and the Construction Manager.You need to like multitasking, a fast-paced environment and great people. You’ll also need to possess exceptional attention to detail, strong technical/computing skill and strong people skills. We can train you in the restoration industry; just bring the transferable skills! Those with experience estimating and managing construction in both commercial and residential environments preferred.There are good financial reasons to work with us also. The pay is attractive and our employees all participate in a benefit plan. We offer other tangible and intangible rewards.Join our award-winning company. In recent years we have won the President’s Achievement Award (given to top Canadian franchise) and the ServiceMaster Expert Award (for International Finalists), as well as BOMA's Pinnacle Award for service that is above & beyond. We pride ourselves in having great teams, great people and a fantastic new site from which to work.Apply now if this sounds like a fit for you; we'd be excited to hear from you.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Interior Project Sales Coordinator
Job_Description: The Interior Project Sales Coordinator (PSC) is responsible for driving the store’s interior installs projects and providing customers with a superior experience from beginning to end on their home installation projects including kitchens, bathrooms, laundry rooms, basement renovations, flooring, and hard surface counter tops. Superior customer service skills, superior project management skills and a desire to achieve results are essential for success in this role.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Develops sales plans in order to reach annual sales and margin objectives Actively generates sales through qualifying potential customers; repeat customers and through referrals Executes project and design consultations, including store showroom tours and on occasion in home; Produces design layouts with plans, elevations and 3D renderings, proposing products available in store or through special orders; Provides quotes to customers, including a detailed scope of work, project timelines and financial proposal including promoting financing plans offered by RONA Follows up and closes sales in order to meet sales and gross margin objectives; Facilitates the smooth and efficient processing of all customer transactions, including payment Ensures the smooth and efficient processing of all in-stock purchases and special orders; Liaises as necessary with customers and contractors (via visits, phone exchanges or e-mail) at all phases of the project’s realization to ensure superior customer satisfaction; Problem solves and advocates fairly for the customer, the contractors and RONA Manages customer escalations efficiently in order to reduce customer dissatisfaction; Facilitates relations between store departments and employees in order to ensure successful completion of the total project, including training employees on sales tactics and related programs; Occasionally schedules and completes on-site visits and inspections with customers and contractors Promotes other channels of RONA’S installs sales portfolio; Executes the Install Sales store signage strategy • Exceptional customer service skills 3 years’ experience in interior project sales and management; Proven sales performance in previous roles, ideally in environments where financing is offered and guarantees are part of the offer; Passion for design and home improvement; Solid computer skills in recognized specialized design software (2020) and Microsoft Office suite; Superior product expertise; Advanced project management knowledge; Flexible work schedule, including ability to work evenings and week-ends; Autonomy and excellent organizational skills with the ability to balance competing priorities

Title: Project Manager – Windows 10 Migration
Job_Description: Calgary and region, AB  We are looking for a strong Windows 10 Migration Project Manager to drive the Enterprise Desktop upgrade across the organization. Due to acquisitions it is currently diverse desktop environment of > 2700 users across multiple locations in several Canadian provinces and US States. Title: Commercial Construction Project Manager - Calgary
Job_Description: Abrs is recruiting for a Commercial Construction Project Manager in Calgary. Seeking a Project Manager experienced in construction of buildings using reinforced concrete, structural steel, timber and masonry. Title: Senior Project Manager to work within the energy trading gro...
Job_Description: Our growing client is looking for a Senior Project Manager to work within the energy trading group in leading the implementation of a Rail terminal System (Geometrix) and to conduct a feasibility study around Business Intelligence/Analytics initiatives (Power BI and Azure). The successful candidate may also take on other projects as priorities shift.  Projects Include: First project is in the logistic space and is focused around implementing Rail terminal System (Geometrix) at 4 facilities. The client currently already has Geometrix at other facilities and so this would be implementing the system at new sites. The second project is in their commercial space and the project is approved for a feasibility. The PM would lead the feasibility around their Business Intelligence and Analytics solutions.   Required Skills: Post-secondary qualifications in a relevant discipline such a Computer Science or Information Systems, PMP certification preferred 7+ years relevant experience as a Project Manager Experience working with mixed project teams of employees, contractors and vendor resources and Offshore developers Very strong stakeholder management and vendor management experience Experience mentoring junior resources Process focus, with strong experience and knowledge on IT project delivery methodologies and best practices High level of skill developing schedules with MS Project, as well as strong skills in the MS Office suite (Excel in particular), experience with VSTS or TFS would be valuable Comfortable working in a dynamic environment with tight schedule and budget constraints Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills Ability to wear multiple hats and assist with or lead organizational change management activities Expertise and Skills Project Management, Project Manager 5 - 7 years Priority Requirements Must-have: Please comment on your background as a Senior Project Manager leading system implementations for Rail Terminal System AND/OR business intelligence solutions (Power BI and Azure are beneficial). Nice-to-have: Client has a strong preference for candidates who have worked with Energy Trading groups within the Oil and Gas industry. Please indicate where you have this experience.

Title: Sessional Instructor, Fundamentals of Project Management, Ha...
Job_Description: Position Description The Haskayne School of Business invites applications for a Sessional Instructor to teach the following course in the area of Marketing, Tourism & Business and Environment during the Fall 2018 Session. This semester runs from September 1, 2018 until December 31, 2018. BSEN 691 L01 - Fundamentals of Project Management R, 18:30-21:15, SH 280 Qualifications: MBA degree or equivalent and work experience in the field are desirable. Previous post-secondary teaching experience is a requirement. The application deadline is May 28, 2018. To apply, submit a letter of application to the attention of Lynne Ricker, Area Chair, MKTG, TOUR, & BSEN Area and send to: Leslie Holmes, Area Administrator Marketing, Tourism & Business & Environment Area Haskayne School of Business, SH487A University of Calgary 2500 University Drive NW Calgary, Alberta T2N 1N4 Phone: 403-220-3998 Email: leslie.holmes@haskayne.ucalgary.ca In support of your application, please provide the following: Current CV containing a discussion of relevant teaching experience (courses taught, textbooks used, where and when taught) Previous teaching evaluations, if applicable Three (3) letters of reference Any additional information including any restrictions (e.g. scheduling constraints) that you may have to strengthen your application and assist in the selection process. Please note that incomplete applications will not be considered. The amount of remuneration is calculated according to the Collective Agreement, Schedule B. Please see the Faculty Association’s website for further information regarding conditions of employment and remuneration. We thank you for your application. Only successful applicants will be contacted. The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their academic and professional success while they are here.
