In this connection, at the time of your application, please answer the following question: Are you a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident of Canada? (Yes/No) Additional Information To learn more about academic opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our Academic Careers website. For more information about the Haskayne School of Business visit Careers in the Haskayne School of Business. About the University of Calgary  The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit ucalgary.ca.  About Calgary, Alberta Calgary is one of the world's cleanest cities and has been named one of the world's most livable cities for years. Calgary is a city of leaders - in business, community, philanthropy and volunteerism. Calgarians benefit from a growing number of world-class dining and cultural events and enjoy more days of sunshine per year than any other major Canadian city. Calgary is less than an hour's drive from the majestic Rocky Mountains and boasts the most extensive urban pathway and bikeway network in North America.

Title: Sr. Project Manager – Ecommerce, EDI, Distributed Order Mana...
Job_Description: Calgary, AB  Job Summary  The purpose of the Senior Project Manager is to successfully lead a cross-functional project team to successful project completion following the SDLC (Solution Development Life-Cycle). The Project Manager is accountable for delivering a solution within project constraints, namely scope, budget and schedule.  The Senior Project Manager will use formal project management techniques and interact with clients and other stakeholders to ensure projects are completed within scope, cost and execution commitments.  Responsibilities  Plan and successfully deliver large, highly visible IT projects with high risk, complexity and change management;  Follow the appropriate SDLC for each project;  Set project team expectations, and clearly document project success factors;  Provide extensive communications to senior management as required;  Implement efficient communication practices to ensure the that the project team operates efficiently and effectively;  Identify, secure and lead large multi-stream project teams;  Provide leadership to the project team while respecting the project mandate and the company’s values;  Manage project schedules and budgets to ensure project completion on time, on budget, and within scope and agreed performance metrics;  Analyze project risk and execute risk management strategies;  Develop project charters ensuring alignment with business goals and properly defined project scope, deliverables, risk analysis and resource requirements;  Work with the business and the Project Office Administrator to ensure that all elements of the AFE are complete and accurate;  Prepare and possibly present regular project status reports;  Manage both departmental and cross-functional projects as required;  Work with the Project Office Administrator to ensure project financial tracking is current and accurate;  Manage the implementation of assigned projects to meet stakeholder expectations measured by a project post-mortem.  Mentor more junior project staff.  Required Skills and Experience  10+ years of progressive experience, including 5+ years experience in a relevant industry vertical. (Retail / Wholesale Distribution, CPG, WMS, EDI, JDA, Sterling DOM, etc.)  Must have experience with package (COTS) customization and deployment  Must have experience in one or more areas of Supply Chain, Warehouse/Distribution management, Warehouse Automated Material Handling Equipment & EDI transactions.  Experience with IBM’s Sterling Distributed Order Management (DOM) is highly valued.  Experience in Demand Management and Replenishment an asset, especially exposure to JDA PMM or Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) like Manhattan.  Experience managing all phases of large and complex projects;  Experience leading project teams of 10+ members;  Solid SDLC application development experience;  Possess a good sense of how business needs can be met through innovative technology solutions;  Demonstrated excellence in communication and leadership aptitudes;  Experience managing Systems Integration, Software Development, Package Implementation, and e-Business projects;  Experience in creating project plans using formal PM methodologies.  Knowledge of business process analysis and design;  Solid understanding of project management processes, practices and tools;  Understanding of large system implementation, Systems Integration, Software Development, Package Implementation, and e-Business technology;  Knowledge of Project Management Principles and methodology.  Academic / Educational requirements  Must have formal Project Management training  A university degree or equivalent combination of education and experience  Keys  Strong PM with a demonstrated ability to deliver.  Ability to deal with a variety of stakeholders, including senior management.  Ability to deal with difficult stakeholders and effectively manage expectations.  Ability to build relationships.  Ability to manage a cross functional team which would include the ability to communicate effectively with the technical team members and the business people on the project.  Needs to have integration experience with big systems/applications: JDE, JDA, SAP, I2 Solutions, ERP  Needs to have COTS implementation experience as company doesn’t customize their own systems they buy it off the rack and then integrate it.  Has to have managed a large team – 25 people +  Worked with big budgets around the half a million dollar area  Doesn’t need configuration experience  Ability to understand and follow project delivery methodologies. An understanding around when to apply the right one, and an understanding around how to adjust those methodologies.  Bias against people who always play multiple roles (i.e. Project Manager, Business Analyst, and Architect) on their projects.  Additional: Previous experience in one or more of the following areas: relevant industry vertical. (Retail / Wholesale Distribution, CPG, WMS, EDI, JDA, Sterling DOM, etc.)  Must be able to manage multiple projects at once  Excellent communication skills with technical teams as well as business teams  Interest in mentoring junior / intermediate PMs  Focus on forward planning  Understanding of strategic vs tactical delivery  Understanding of SDLC  Hiring contact: smears@tundratechnical.ca  Tundra Technical Solutions would like to thank you for the interest you have demonstrated in this opportunity. Title: Project Coordinator - Buildings
Job_Description: 05/08/2018  001762  Pomerleau is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder.  Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do.  The Opportunity  Jump onboard and join our collaborative project team to explore and support project growth and execution. With a proven track record of coordination experience, your drive for project excellence is unparalleled. Focused on supporting your fellow Project team members, you will drive for results through the coordination of all project activities.  Organization, finding meaning in the details, solutions and growth are your passion. As a Project Coordinator, you manage several activities and deadlines to gain a clearer picture of client, team and project needs. You have the profile we are looking for?

Title: Project Manager – Store Systems – Retail – Mat Leave Cover
Job_Description: Calgary, AB  What you’ll do  In this role, you will be expected to: Develop, review and maintain store systems project standard framework, processes and store architecture standards based on IT requirements and lessons learned.  Manage new store build projects, store relocation projects, and store decommissioning projects.  Support popup stores while managing stakeholder expectations.  Organize, attend and participate in stakeholder meetings.  Organize meetings with 3rd party vendors and other internal IT groups to review project plans.  Coordinate 3rd party vendors and internal IT teams activities and responsibilities.  Manage existing and new 3rd party vendors to get work completed within scope, on time and within budget, and manage processing their invoices.  Produce technical and store operations feasibility options for project requests.  Identify and discuss the impact of store layout into the technology integration activities.  Create a project plan [define sub goals, milestones and tasks, time and resource planning].  Monitor project progress and success [assess risks and hazards to the success of the project and take appropriate measures for avoidance].  Document and follow up on important actions and decisions from meetings.  Ensure projects adhere to frameworks and all documentation is maintained appropriately for each project.  Assess project risks and issues and provide solutions where applicable.  Submit and manage Change tickets and adhere to internal Change Management processes.  Identify any potential inventory shortages and work with Store System Inventory Coordinator to get the required inventory purchased.  Ensure stakeholder views are managed towards the best solution and escalate issues when required.  Ensure a solid communication plan is put in place and employed with all stakeholders involved.  Report statuses of all on-going projects and provide metrics on completed projects.  Provide availability to work after hours and weekends as business needs require.  Provide on call support during last 2 weeks of new store builds, store relocations and store decommissioning.  Who you are  We are looking for a high performing individual who: Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit, a bias for action, and a desire to work with key stakeholders to drive innovation in the retail environment and in-store e-commerce;  Is direct and truthful, and builds trust and credibility with co-workers, vendors, and customers by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values;  Demonstrates a desire to help and is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs;  Is committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives, and working collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives;  Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups;  Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused;  Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation.  What you’ve done  Three years of experience in IT or Retail  Three years of experience as a Business Analysis  Three years of experience as a Project Manager  University degree with a Business or Technology focus is considered an asset  Project Management Professional or related discipline is considered an asset  Hiring contact: smears@tundratechnical.ca  Tundra Technical Solutions would like to thank you for the interest you have demonstrated in this opportunity. However, only candidates with the required skills will be contacted.  Tundra Technical Solutions is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Title: Project Manager - Calgary
Job_Description: Harvard Property Management Inc. has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to join its team. Harvard is a full service real estate management company based in Western Canada that is recognized for its reputation in leadership, flexibility, quality and performance. The company oversees 8.8 million square feet of commercial properties with regional offices in Regina, Calgary, Edmonton and Winnipeg.This position will report to the Senior Project Manager and will be part of a Project Management team providing capital project management to external and internal clients. The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, contract administration and successful delivery of a variety of leasing construction and capital projects throughout Harvard’s managed portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.What you will bring to the job: - 5 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings;- The completion of a PMP designation is an asset;- Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting;- Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships;- Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines;- The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment;- Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment;- Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and- Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.What you will receive: - Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment;- Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP;- Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program;- Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and- Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. If you feel you are the person we are looking for in this position, please apply with your resume in confidence through the Careers tab at　www.hillcompanies.com.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Sr. Project Manager – Ecommerce, EDI, Distributed Order Mana...
Job_Description: Calgary, AB  Job Summary  The purpose of the Senior Project Manager is to successfully lead a cross-functional project team to successful project completion following the SDLC (Solution Development Life-Cycle). The Project Manager is accountable for delivering a solution within project constraints, namely scope, budget and schedule.  The Senior Project Manager will use formal project management techniques and interact with clients and other stakeholders to ensure projects are completed within scope, cost and execution commitments.  Responsibilities  Plan and successfully deliver large, highly visible IT projects with high risk, complexity and change management;  Follow the appropriate SDLC for each project;  Set project team expectations, and clearly document project success factors;  Provide extensive communications to senior management as required;  Implement efficient communication practices to ensure the that the project team operates efficiently and effectively;  Identify, secure and lead large multi-stream project teams;  Provide leadership to the project team while respecting the project mandate and the company’s values;  Manage project schedules and budgets to ensure project completion on time, on budget, and within scope and agreed performance metrics;  Analyze project risk and execute risk management strategies;  Develop project charters ensuring alignment with business goals and properly defined project scope, deliverables, risk analysis and resource requirements;  Work with the business and the Project Office Administrator to ensure that all elements of the AFE are complete and accurate;  Prepare and possibly present regular project status reports;  Manage both departmental and cross-functional projects as required;  Work with the Project Office Administrator to ensure project financial tracking is current and accurate;  Manage the implementation of assigned projects to meet stakeholder expectations measured by a project post-mortem.  Mentor more junior project staff.  Required Skills and Experience  10+ years of progressive experience, including 5+ years experience in a relevant industry vertical. (Retail / Wholesale Distribution, CPG, WMS, EDI, JDA, Sterling DOM, etc.)  Must have experience with package (COTS) customization and deployment  Must have experience in one or more areas of Supply Chain, Warehouse/Distribution management, Warehouse Automated Material Handling Equipment & EDI transactions.  Experience with IBM’s Sterling Distributed Order Management (DOM) is highly valued.  Experience in Demand Management and Replenishment an asset, especially exposure to JDA PMM or Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) like Manhattan.  Experience managing all phases of large and complex projects;  Experience leading project teams of 10+ members;  Solid SDLC application development experience;  Possess a good sense of how business needs can be met through innovative technology solutions;  Demonstrated excellence in communication and leadership aptitudes;  Experience managing Systems Integration, Software Development, Package Implementation, and e-Business projects;  Experience in creating project plans using formal PM methodologies.  Knowledge of business process analysis and design;  Solid understanding of project management processes, practices and tools;  Understanding of large system implementation, Systems Integration, Software Development, Package Implementation, and e-Business technology;  Knowledge of Project Management Principles and methodology.  Academic / Educational requirements  Must have formal Project Management training  A university degree or equivalent combination of education and experience  Keys  Strong PM with a demonstrated ability to deliver.  Ability to deal with a variety of stakeholders, including senior management.  Ability to deal with difficult stakeholders and effectively manage expectations.  Ability to build relationships.  Ability to manage a cross functional team which would include the ability to communicate effectively with the technical team members and the business people on the project.  Needs to have integration experience with big systems/applications: JDE, JDA, SAP, I2 Solutions, ERP  Needs to have COTS implementation experience as company doesn’t customize their own systems they buy it off the rack and then integrate it.  Has to have managed a large team – 25 people +  Worked with big budgets around the half a million dollar area  Doesn’t need configuration experience  Ability to understand and follow project delivery methodologies. An understanding around when to apply the right one, and an understanding around how to adjust those methodologies.  Bias against people who always play multiple roles (i.e. Project Manager, Business Analyst, and Architect) on their projects.  Additional: Previous experience in one or more of the following areas: relevant industry vertical. (Retail / Wholesale Distribution, CPG, WMS, EDI, JDA, Sterling DOM, etc.)  Must be able to manage multiple projects at once  Excellent communication skills with technical teams as well as business teams  Interest in mentoring junior / intermediate PMs  Focus on forward planning  Understanding of strategic vs tactical delivery  Understanding of SDLC  Hiring contact: smears@tundratechnical.ca  Tundra Technical Solutions would like to thank you for the interest you have demonstrated in this opportunity. However, only candidates with the required skills will be contacted.  Tundra Technical Solutions is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workplace .  Not interested in this position, but know somebody who might be? Check out our Referral Reward Program, referrals are a big secret behind our success. As always, we’re on the lookout for great people. And we know that you know great people. Simply click on ‘Tell a Friend’ option to refer a friend.  Tundra Technical Solutions is among North America’s leading providers of Information Technology and Engineering staffing and consulting services. Our success and our clients’ success are built on a foundation of service excellence. Rather than continually trying to sell to new clients and companies and simply filling databases with candidates, we focus on developing stronger relationships and deeper knowledge of our existing clients’ challenges and opportunities.  Open ears. Open minds. Open futures  The Tundra team has over 600 years of experience, from a wide variety of disciplines – recruiting executives, business owners and technical consultants. Title: Assistant Professor, Engineering Project Management in Energ...
Job_Description: Position Overview The Department of Civil Engineering, in the Schulich School of Engineering at the University of Calgary, is pleased to invite applications for a tenure-track faculty position at the rank of Assistant Professor in the area of Engineering Project Management in Energy Sector. The preferred start date of the appointment is July 1, 2018 or as negotiated.   The successful applicant will be expected to teach courses in Engineering Project Management as well as fundamental and advanced courses in Civil Engineering. The main criteria for selection are research and teaching excellence. The successful candidate will provide evidence of high quality scholarly output that demonstrates potential for independent research leading to peer-reviewed academic publications and securing of external research funding, active engagement with industry, and supervision of graduate students. The candidate must also be able to demonstrate a strong academic background and research expertise in Engineering Project Management in Energy Sector, and an ability to work as part of our highly-collaborative research teams. Specialization and expertise are required in one or more of the following areas: Major Energy-related Projects Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) Supply Chain Management Entrepreneurship and Innovation Assistant Professors will dedicate their time to teaching our undergraduate and graduate programs, continue to engage in high impact research, submit scholarly works to high quality publications, and provide service with the university and within our profession.  Candidates must hold a B.Sc. in Engineering and a Ph.D. in Engineering or a closely related discipline; a strong research track record; a demonstrated ability in teaching excellence or evidence of excellence in teaching at a university level. Relevant industrial experience is an asset. Complementing the current faculty, the incumbent is expected to participate in joint projects, and develop a strong independent research program. Working as a team and providing service to your Department, Faculty and University are required. Candidates should have strong oral and written English communication skills.  Candidates must be a registered professional engineer or eligible for registration as a professional engineer with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA). Information about becoming a professional engineer can be found online.  The Schulich School of Engineering is committed to fostering diversity through cultivating an environment where people with a variety of backgrounds, genders, interests and talents feel welcome and included. In 2016, the Schulich School of Engineering was recognized with the KNOVO Award of Distinction to honour the school’s commitment to diversity and equity.  Interested individuals are encouraged to submit an application online via the 'Apply Now' link and are advised that the application process allows for only four attachments. Your four application attachments should be organized as follows: Attachment 1: Curriculum Vitae, Name and contact information of at least three referees (referees will only be contacted if the applicant is short-listed for the position) and samples of 3 scholarly publications. Attachment 2: All Postsecondary Academic Transcripts (B.Sc., M.Sc., and Ph.D.) Attachment 3: Statement of teaching interests with respect to technical subject areas and how you would plan and deliver an undergraduate engineering course (not to exceed two pages) Attachment 4: Statement of proposed research (not to exceed two pages), that includes: Research objectives Recent activity in this area Methodology (how the research will be conducted) Significance and potential impact of the research Link to the University of Calgary’s Strategic Research Themes Applications are encouraged as soon as possible and will be accepted until June 30, 2018.  Salary is competitive and will be determined according to the successful applicant's accomplishments, experience and qualifications.  The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their academic and professional success while they are here. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.  About the Department The Department of Civil Engineering offers B.Sc., M. Eng., M.Sc., and Ph.D. degrees in a variety of specializations. The University of Calgary is a comprehensive research university with close to 30,000 full-time students, including over 5,000 graduate students. It is in the Canadian top ten in a broad cross-section of measures including: research funding, endowment, graduation of Ph.D. students, fundraising, and the quality of professoriate. The Schulich School of Engineering supports the University of Calgary vision of Eyes High to become one of Canada’s top five research universities. Related information can be found at the department website. Additional Information To learn more about academic opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our Academic Careers website. For more information about the Schulich School of Engineering visit Careers in the Schulich School of Engineering. About the University of Calgary  The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit ucalgary.ca.  About Calgary, Alberta Calgary is one of the world's cleanest cities and has been named one of the world's most livable cities for years. Calgary is a city of leaders - in business, community, philanthropy and volunteerism. Calgarians benefit from a growing number of world-class dining and cultural events and enjoy more days of sunshine per year than any other major Canadian city. Calgary is less than an hour's drive from the majestic Rocky Mountains and boasts the most extensive urban pathway and bikeway network in North America.

Title: Intermediate Estimator/Project Coordinator
Job_Description: Our client builds some of Canada’s most interesting public art and creative construction projects and we are looking for an Estimator/PC to lead multiple architectural projects and provide leadership to our estimating team. Experience in fabrication, custom commercial or residential projects is preferred.Principle ResponsibilitiesThis is a blended role requiring a candidate to provide estimates and coordinate and manage projects from 100K up to approximately 2,000,000Leads pursuit teams and estimate, proposal and tender submissionsManages project risk by thoroughly estimating the scope, specifications, site conditions etc.Attends pre-tender meetings to prepare accurate estimatesPrepares takeoffs/estimates for assigned jobsOrders Bid Bonds, Performance Bonds, Agreements to Bonds, Tender deposits, WSIB Certificates, Insurance Certificates, CAD 7s, Letters of Reference, CCDC DocumentsPrepares and follows up on quotations and tendersReviews all contracts and accepted quotationsPrepares budget for entire project prior to bid dateEvaluates estimates with team prior to tender closingClosing /Negotiating of tenders with clients, owners, general contractors etcManages the handoff if awarded projects to project managersBuilds and maintains effective relationships with customers, design and project management teams, subcontractors and suppliersStays aware and informed of all new materials or techniques by attending material manufacturer’s seminars, trade shows, etcPrepares specifications to be used to collect subcontractor quotesWhat is in it for you?Job Satisfaction: You will get to directly participate in some of Canada’s most interesting (and high profile) creative construction and art projects.Job Variation: You will never get bored in this fast paced environment. Every project is different and every day comes complete with its own unique challenges and problems for you to solve.Job Opportunity: You will be exposed to opportunities to grow and develop our relatively young business into one of the world’s premiere manufacturing companies. We have not plateaued and do not plan on doing so any time soon.Culture: You will get to work with fun, dynamic and highly skilled people that are driven to succeed. Remuneration: You will be paid relative to the experience you bring and your accomplishments; you will be rewarded with company success. You will get a company phone, plenty of vacation, and be added to our benefits program.QualificationsCompletion of a relevant post-secondary program (Engineering, Architectural Technology Diploma, etc.) or equivalent work experienceMinimum 3 years of Estimating experience Solid knowledge of construction, steel fabrication, concrete, carpentry, custom manufacturing processes, and the ability to read drawingsExperience tendering to subcontractors and negotiating and administering contractsStrong prioritization and organizational skillsDetail -orientedExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work in a fast paced team environmentExcellent time management skills with the ability to multitaskDemonstrated ability to work both as part of a team and independentlyProven analytical and problem-solving skillsProficiency with Autocad and Solidworks considered an assetPlease note the role requires some travel and on-site visits. If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, please apply through this posting. We regret that only candidates that are being considered for this opportunity will be contacted.Thank you!Job Type: Full-time

Title: Senior Project Manager with Agile & Scrum Master experience...
Job_Description: Our valued client requires the need of a Senior Project Manager with Agile & Scrum Master experience to aid in multiple concurrent projects and deliver on project objectives. This individual will partner with stakeholders to lead, recommend and develop best process practices for the delivery of agile projects and timelines. This role will play a critical role within the scrum team as a mentor and coach and is responsible for the facilitation of day to day agile principles and practices.  Task include but not limited to: Lead teams on how to use Agile/Scrum practices to produce high quality products that meet user story acceptance criteria and satisfy customer needs. See Agile projects from initiation through release, provide oversight to ensure alignment of Agile/Scrum practices, including but not limited to: project kick-off, sprint, release and deployment planning. Facilitate discussion leading to collective decision-making, goal setting and conflict resolution within the team. Serve as an Agile Coach and a liaison between the product owner, development team, and management in order to ensure that the requirements are met. Lead daily scrum, sprint planning, sprint demo (with the Product Owner), and retrospective meetings. Provide timely communication to stakeholders throughout the sprint process. Guides the team to be self-organized to advance the Agile Scrum best practices. Manages multiple projects and interfaces with product owners. Remove obstacles to delivery success through the proactive management of external dependencies, team problem-solving and the development of new solutions or approaches to ongoing challenges. Create and maintain open communication within the scrum team to create a trusting and safe team environment. Facilitate and engage in business analysis, user experience and technical conversations across platforms and multiple levels of influence. Communicate and report team progress, status updates, product demos and accomplishments ensuring transparency of progress and outcomes. Provide proactive coaching to the team and recommend continuous improvement of processes and tools to optimize team productivity, quality and speed-to-market. Embrace change, influence and coach team members on agile principles and practices Collaborate with other Agile Coaches to facilitate increasing maturity and effectiveness in the application of Agile across the organization.  Job Requirements: 3+ years experience in an Agile environment (medium-to-large scale initiatives) using influence to facilitate outcomes Agile Management Framework (User Stories, Burndown techniques, Acceptance Test Driven Development, Continuous testing, etc.) 2+ years experience as a Scrum Master Strong experience in communicating complex information and concepts to a variety of audiences, including executive management to support decision making (written and verbal). Experience in Virtual story board tools and train the key stakeholders on the virtual story board tools (Trello, Stories onboard, etc.) Nice to Have Skills: PMP designation is considered an asset Certified Scrum Master / Agile Practitioner or designation in progress an asset Financial institution knowledge is considered an asset Expertise and Skills Project Management, Project Manager 5 - 7 years Priority Requirements Must-have: Please describe your experience as a Senior Project Manager with Agile & Scrum Master experience aiding in multiple concurrent projects? Must-have: Please describe your experience working in a collaborative, team oriented environment, managing relationships across the organization in a wide range of roles and at differing levels across the organization? Must-have: Please state your experience of how you have integrated Agile operations within your previous projects? Work Environment Location: Calgary NE Duration: 3-6 months plus possible extensions

VMWare) Servers Databases Desktop Virtualization Storage Technologies Data center consolidation or migration project experience. Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: AWI’s Project Manager is responsible for planning and executing water filtration related projects. They actively participate in a design team consisting of AWI’s Technical Advisors, other Project Managers and Draftsperson/Designer.At Anthratech Western Inc. (AWI) we provide water treatment solutions for industrialand municipal water and wastewater treatment plants across Canada and in select international markets. Bilingual (Eng/Fre) language proficiency a strong asset.Customer service focus, with the ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.Hours of WorkCore office hours are Monday to Friday 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Occasional travel is required.CompensationCompensation will take into account the background, range of skills, knowledge and experience that the successful candidate brings to the opportunity. Title: Project Manager - Calgary
Job_Description: Harvard Property Management Inc. has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to join its team. Harvard is a full service real estate management company based in Western Canada that is recognized for its reputation in leadership, flexibility, quality and performance. The company oversees 8.8 million square feet of commercial properties with regional offices in Regina, Calgary, Edmonton and Winnipeg.This position will report to the Senior Project Manager and will be part of a Project Management team providing capital project management to external and internal clients. The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, contract administration and successful delivery of a variety of leasing construction and capital projects throughout Harvard’s managed portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to maintain positive, mutually beneficial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Project Manager will also assist the Technical Services team in achieving its goals and objectives. This high level of commitment to service requires the employee to be flexible in their work hours which includes after-hours coordination & available for response 24 hours each day, except during excused absence.Pre-construction and planning responsibilities include accurate cost estimating, budgeting, preliminary scheduling and design consultation; along with development of RFP’s for design and engineering services, construction tendering documents, evaluation and interpretation of contract documents, and award verification with the owner. Upon award, duties include project scheduling, stakeholder coordination, communication, on-site quality control, cost control, contract administration and post construction wrap up.What you will bring to the job: - 5 or more years’ experience within a commercial construction environment, ideally within occupied buildings;- The completion of a PMP designation is an asset;- Familiarity with local regulatory, consulting and construction industry participants, practices and permitting;- Strong communication, collaboration and conflict resolution skills that enable positive and beneficial relationships;- Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem solving abilities to consistently meet deadlines;- The ability to work independently using personal initiative and sound judgment;- Advanced technological skills in a Microsoft Office workplace environment;- Availability to work outside regular business hours as required to supervise work in progress; and- Willingness to travel and assist in project management opportunities wherever Harvard conducts business.What you will receive: - Flexible scheduling of work hours in a performance driven and merit based work environment;- Competitive salary, incentive pay and benefits, health plan, retirement savings plan & group RRSP;- Additional benefits including children’s scholarship and a wellness program;- Comprehensive orientation, training and support; and- Encouragement of lifelong learning through education and training opportunities.Harvard is committed to providing challenging and rewarding employment opportunities. If you feel you are the person we are looking for in this position, please apply with your resume in confidence through the Careers tab at　www.hillcompanies.com.Job Type: Full-time

Job_Description: Calgary, AB  Job Summary  The purpose of the Senior Project Manager is to successfully lead a cross-functional project team to successful project completion following the SDLC (Solution Development Life-Cycle). The Project Manager is accountable for delivering a solution within project constraints, namely scope, budget and schedule.  The Senior Project Manager will use formal project management techniques and interact with clients and other stakeholders to ensure projects are completed within scope, cost and execution commitments.  Responsibilities  Plan and successfully deliver large, highly visible IT projects with high risk, complexity and change management;  Follow the appropriate SDLC for each project;  Set project team expectations, and clearly document project success factors;  Provide extensive communications to senior management as required;  Implement efficient communication practices to ensure the that the project team operates efficiently and effectively;  Identify, secure and lead large multi-stream project teams;  Provide leadership to the project team while respecting the project mandate and the company’s values;  Manage project schedules and budgets to ensure project completion on time, on budget, and within scope and agreed performance metrics;  Analyze project risk and execute risk management strategies;  Develop project charters ensuring alignment with business goals and properly defined project scope, deliverables, risk analysis and resource requirements;  Work with the business and the Project Office Administrator to ensure that all elements of the AFE are complete and accurate;  Prepare and possibly present regular project status reports;  Manage both departmental and cross-functional projects as required;  Work with the Project Office Administrator to ensure project financial tracking is current and accurate;  Manage the implementation of assigned projects to meet stakeholder expectations measured by a project post-mortem.  Mentor more junior project staff.  Required Skills and Experience  10+ years of progressive experience, including 5+ years experience in a relevant industry vertical. (Retail / Wholesale Distribution, CPG, WMS, EDI, JDA, Sterling DOM, etc.)  Must have experience with package (COTS) customization and deployment  Must have experience in one or more areas of Supply Chain, Warehouse/Distribution management, Warehouse Automated Material Handling Equipment & EDI transactions.  Experience with IBM’s Sterling Distributed Order Management (DOM) is highly valued.  Experience in Demand Management and Replenishment an asset, especially exposure to JDA PMM or Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) like Manhattan.  Experience managing all phases of large and complex projects;  Experience leading project teams of 10+ members;  Solid SDLC application development experience;  Possess a good sense of how business needs can be met through innovative technology solutions;  Demonstrated excellence in communication and leadership aptitudes;  Experience managing Systems Integration, Software Development, Package Implementation, and e-Business projects;  Experience in creating project plans using formal PM methodologies.  Knowledge of business process analysis and design;  Solid understanding of project management processes, practices and tools;  Understanding of large system implementation, Systems Integration, Software Development, Package Implementation, and e-Business technology;  Knowledge of Project Management Principles and methodology.  Academic / Educational requirements  Must have formal Project Management training  A university degree or equivalent combination of education and experience  Keys  Strong PM with a demonstrated ability to deliver.  Ability to deal with a variety of stakeholders, including senior management.  Ability to deal with difficult stakeholders and effectively manage expectations.  Ability to build relationships.  Ability to manage a cross functional team which would include the ability to communicate effectively with the technical team members and the business people on the project.  Needs to have integration experience with big systems/applications: JDE, JDA, SAP, I2 Solutions, ERP  Needs to have COTS implementation experience as company doesn’t customize their own systems they buy it off the rack and then integrate it.  Has to have managed a large team – 25 people +  Worked with big budgets around the half a million dollar area  Doesn’t need configuration experience  Ability to understand and follow project delivery methodologies. An understanding around when to apply the right one, and an understanding around how to adjust those methodologies.  Bias against people who always play multiple roles (i.e. Project Manager, Business Analyst, and Architect) on their projects.  Additional: Previous experience in one or more of the following areas: relevant industry vertical. (Retail / Wholesale Distribution, CPG, WMS, EDI, JDA, Sterling DOM, etc.)  Must be able to manage multiple projects at once  Excellent communication skills with technical teams as well as business teams  Interest in mentoring junior / intermediate PMs  Focus on forward planning  Understanding of strategic vs tactical delivery  Understanding of SDLC  Hiring contact: smears@tundratechnical.ca  Tundra Technical Solutions would like to thank you for the interest you have demonstrated in this opportunity. Title: Project Scheduler - 252089
Job_Description: Project Scheduler On behalf of our client Procom is seeking a Project Scheduler to be accountable for creating and managing the integrated program plan.  Project Scheduler Job Details   Work with all project managers to ensure that each PM has an appropriate project schedule for their project – the plan must be fit-for-purpose for the individual project, plus fit-for-purpose for roll-up to the master program schedule. Create and maintain the overall rolled-up program level schedule and resource plan. Create and maintain the executive overview schedule. Conduct analysis of the program schedule and resourcing, including but not limited to – critical-path analysis, identification of inter-project scheduling dependencies and challenges, identification of inter-project resource dependencies and challenges, and identification of external schedule dependencies and challenges. Track and report program milestones. Propose, to the applicable stakeholders, corrective actions for challenges that are identified. Work with all stakeholders to identify opportunities for synergies that lead to cost reduction and/or schedule reduction and/or quality improvements.  Project Scheduler Must Have Skills   A minimum of 5 years executing program planning. A demonstrated understanding of IT technologies and the management of IT projects. Fully conversant with waterfall project management, plus at least a basic understanding of agile project management. Expert level understanding of MSProject and proven ability to set up enterprise MSProject environments that allow for roll up of individual projects into a master schedule. A demonstrated ability to coach PMs at many skill levels in project planning techniques and the use of MSProject. Fully proficient in the use of Microsoft tools (Excel, MSWord, Vision, PowerPoint, etc.). A demonstrated ability to provide accurate and timely data in a large-scale program environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to smoothly interact with stakeholders at many levels in a large multi-national enterprise.  Project Scheduler Nice to Have Skills   Exposure to wide-area network projects and programs. Exposure to field telecommunications projects. PMP designation. A degree in engineering or computer science.  Project Scheduler Assignment Length 13 months  Project Scheduler Start Date May 1, 2018

Title: Project Manager – Store Systems – Retail – Mat Leave Cover

Title: Senior Project Manager – Civil Works
Job_Description: 04/03/2018  001613  Pomerleau is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder.  Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do.  WHAT WILL YOU DO IN A WEEK? :  Under the supervision of the Project Director, the Senior Project Manager for Civil works ensures the overall supervision and coordination of all the steps of the various construction projects, namely collaboration with subcontractors, close relationship with the client, and monitoring costs and schedules. Coordinate the work in collaboration with the superintendent—schedule, manpower and equipment requirements, etc.;Manage changes and instructions;Manage plans, specs, and addenda. Manage calls for bids and related contracts—can change from one project form to another Prepare all the documents to launch calls for bids;Draw up a detailed schedule—dates, main construction steps, constraints, work method;Launch and manage calls for bids;Finalize plans and specs;Analyze and negotiate bids;Prepare recommendations as well as contract awards and then obtain client’s approval;Award contracts;Set up and conduct initial meetings with major subcontractors on the project. Project Coordination Establish work methods in collaboration with the superintendent;Draw up list of activities in order to enable preparing the prevention program;Establish a list of items for cost follow-up and project accounting;Issue purchase orders for construction site materials at construction site;Settle disputes in collaboration with the superintendent;Perform breakdown and invoicing;Organize and conduct construction site meetings as required;Supervise site wrap-up manual preparation with administrative assistant. Project Follow-Up Perform administrative follow-up—costs, contingencies, boards, claims, etc.;Confirm implemented technical follow-up—technical data sheets, inspections, etc.;Follow up on notices of change—estimation, bid to client, negotiation, issuance of orders and/or of contract.  DO YOU HAVE THESE QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS? :  Bachelor’s degree or Diploma in Civil Engineering or another construction related disciplineAt least 8 years’ experience managing Civil construction projectsStrong skills in management, communication, negotiation, and problem solvingAbility to exercise initiative and leadership, offering mentorship to more junior team members WHY JOIN POMERLEAU`S TEAM? :  Competitive salary 4 weeks’ vacation Group insurance (health spending account) Group RRSP Monthly public transit pass paid by employer Fitness center membership: 50% reimbursed by employer Employee assistance program Ongoing training offered throughout the year Young, dynamic environment Excellent career opportunities Summer hours PARTICULARITY:  The retained candidate will be subject to an administrative security check At Pomerleau, we focus on results-oriented, passionate and rigorous people who participate in ambitious and complex projects. You have the profile we are looking for?

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Compugen is an organization that encourages and supports ongoing training and development opportunities. We are composed of a talented, diversified workforce that performs collectively in an entrepreneurial and flexible environment. Our staff members have access to the latest and greatest technologies in performing their daily activities. Well-developed interpersonal skills Advanced skills in written and verbal communication Analytical, systematic and forward thinker Post-secondary degree/certification or equivalent PMP certification nice to have 5-7 year successful experience as a Project Manager, Project Leader or Delivery Manager is a requirement. Computer literacy; proficient in word processing, spreadsheet, flowchart & presentation and project management software tools Must be able to be comfortable in key technologies currently employed by Compugen (highly recommended) Interest in continuing to follow developments in relevant technologies (desirable) Plan and implement small to large scale projects. Direct all aspects of the project planning and execution phases. Work with project team members to create detailed project plan. Engage resources as required by the plan for the successful deployment of the project. Detail and assign work package plans. Meet regularly with the team to follow up on tasks, deliverables and issues. Communicate status to the client via written reports and meeting or teleconferences. Track project plan to baseline against time and budget constraints. Manage project scope & handle scope change requests using appropriate documentation. Log, monitor and handle project issues, analyze & recommend viable alternatives. Hold weekly team meetings and attend client meetings. Lead the Compugen team members towards the successful conclusion of the project. Act as a single point of contact for both the internal Compugen team and the client team. Manage customer expectations. Ensure a high level of customer service and view toward repeat business. Use Compugen's project methodology. Ensure proper documentation is completed & stored where accessible. Documentation includes Statement of Work, plan, schedule, scope changes log, issues log, risk assessment, minutes of status meeting and PIR. Must follow the Compugen Inc. Deployment Guidelines Must strive to improve The Deployment Guidelines Must be able to report on the P&L of all projects Must report on the customer satisfaction of the projects; target is a letter of reference or project survey. Must manage and escalate issues as required.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: AWI’s Project Manager is responsible for planning and executing water filtration related projects. They actively participate in a design team consisting of AWI’s Technical Advisors, other Project Managers and Draftsperson/Designer.At Anthratech Western Inc. (AWI) we provide water treatment solutions for industrialand municipal water and wastewater treatment plants across Canada and in select international markets. AWI is privately owned, with the head office and research and development facility located in Calgary, Alberta.Responsibilities and Duties: Defining the site-specific project scope and schedule.Procurement of components and coordination of delivery logistics.Travelling to work sites to attend meetings and complete inspections.Monitoring project process and communicating status updates to internal and external stakeholders.Scheduling and monitoring AWI’s on-site responsibilities, including equipment installation, performance testing and commissioning.Collaborate with AWI’s Document Specialist to develop project related documentation.Ensuring all aspects of the project meet company and worksite safety standards.Managing unexpected tasks that may arise, including troubleshooting requests, onsite services/repairs and small-parts orders.Supporting coworkers through collaboration, cross training and information sharing.Candidate RequirementsOur ideal candidate will have:A diploma in Engineering Technology or equivalent technical education/background.At least five-years of project management experience in a related field. Experience in a construction, engineering or similar work environment a strong asset.Project Management Professional certification an asset.A valid Alberta driver’s license (class 5) and a clean driver’s abstract.Personal and professional skills desired:Demonstrated ability to take initiative, work independently and use critical thinking to problem-solve.Ability to analyze and interpret technical information and engineering drawings.Strong communication skills (both verbal and written). Bilingual (Eng/Fre) language proficiency a strong asset.Customer service focus, with the ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.Hours of WorkCore office hours are Monday to Friday 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Occasional travel is required.CompensationCompensation will take into account the background, range of skills, knowledge and experience that the successful candidate brings to the opportunity. Following the probationary period, AWI employees are eligible for a comprehensive employee health insurance program with a health care spending account. After one year of service, AWI employees may be eligible for the AWI RRSP matching contribution plan.By submitting your resume, personal information and references to Anthratech Western Inc. you acknowledge and consent to AWI contacting your references and verifying education in order to determine your suitability for this employment opportunity.Candidates being considered for this position must pass AWI’s standard background check and screening process.The position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. No telephone, walk-in or agency inquiries.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:project management: 5 years

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Requisition Id: 15284 Department: Operations Engineering Department Summary of Responsibilities Pembina is seeking an Engineer, Projects to join our Conventional Business Unit (CBU) in Calgary, Alberta. Reporting to the Supervisor, Project Engineering (Operations), this position’s responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Development of PMO (Project Management Office) documents as required; Liaising with and coordinating project stakeholders to manage project scope, timing, resourcing, and execution; Working with the engineering team to coordinate the delivery of technical deliverables; Working with the SCM (Supply Chain Management) team to coordinate procurement and contracts as necessary for successful project execution; Working with the Pembina commissioning and Operations teams as necessary to ensure the project is appropriately commissioned and turned over; Working with the Pembina document control team to ensure all project deliverables are appropriately numbered, compiled and available for turnover to close out the project; Maintaining appropriate cost control and schedule to ensure successful project management and forecasting are in place; Coordinate and manage as necessary to establish construction contracts, construction supervisors, EHS professionals and other support staff as necessary to ensure successful field execution of the project; Coordinate as necessary with SPCC (Sherwood Park Control Center) and SCADA to coordinate commissioning activities, shutdown activities and other non-routine events as necessary for successful project execution; Consult and coordinate as necessary with the Pembina LARE (Land, Aboriginal, Regulatory, and Environmental) group; and Other general coordination duties as required to ensure the necessary stakeholders are considered as part of the project. Qualifications Preferred candidate would have at least 10 years of combined construction and engineering project experience with either a P.Eng. or CET designation; A background in the mechanical trades is a definite asset; Demonstrated experience in project coordination between design engineering, field execution teams, commissioning teams and Code inspectors; Previous EPC design experience is a definite asset; and Fluent in the tools of project management including cost control, scheduling, contracts, execution planning and project closeout. No agency calls please. Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. >

Title: Sr. Project Manager – Ecommerce, EDI, Distributed Order Mana...
Job_Description: Calgary, AB  Job Summary  The purpose of the Senior Project Manager is to successfully lead a cross-functional project team to successful project completion following the SDLC (Solution Development Life-Cycle). The Project Manager is accountable for delivering a solution within project constraints, namely scope, budget and schedule.  The Senior Project Manager will use formal project management techniques and interact with clients and other stakeholders to ensure projects are completed within scope, cost and execution commitments.  Responsibilities  Plan and successfully deliver large, highly visible IT projects with high risk, complexity and change management;  Follow the appropriate SDLC for each project;  Set project team expectations, and clearly document project success factors;  Provide extensive communications to senior management as required;  Implement efficient communication practices to ensure the that the project team operates efficiently and effectively;  Identify, secure and lead large multi-stream project teams;  Provide leadership to the project team while respecting the project mandate and the company’s values;  Manage project schedules and budgets to ensure project completion on time, on budget, and within scope and agreed performance metrics;  Analyze project risk and execute risk management strategies;  Develop project charters ensuring alignment with business goals and properly defined project scope, deliverables, risk analysis and resource requirements;  Work with the business and the Project Office Administrator to ensure that all elements of the AFE are complete and accurate;  Prepare and possibly present regular project status reports;  Manage both departmental and cross-functional projects as required;  Work with the Project Office Administrator to ensure project financial tracking is current and accurate;  Manage the implementation of assigned projects to meet stakeholder expectations measured by a project post-mortem.  Mentor more junior project staff.  Required Skills and Experience  10+ years of progressive experience, including 5+ years experience in a relevant industry vertical. (Retail / Wholesale Distribution, CPG, WMS, EDI, JDA, Sterling DOM, etc.)  Must have experience with package (COTS) customization and deployment  Must have experience in one or more areas of Supply Chain, Warehouse/Distribution management, Warehouse Automated Material Handling Equipment & EDI transactions.  Experience with IBM’s Sterling Distributed Order Management (DOM) is highly valued.  Experience in Demand Management and Replenishment an asset, especially exposure to JDA PMM or Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) like Manhattan.  Experience managing all phases of large and complex projects;  Experience leading project teams of 10+ members;  Solid SDLC application development experience;  Possess a good sense of how business needs can be met through innovative technology solutions;  Demonstrated excellence in communication and leadership aptitudes;  Experience managing Systems Integration, Software Development, Package Implementation, and e-Business projects;  Experience in creating project plans using formal PM methodologies.  Knowledge of business process analysis and design;  Solid understanding of project management processes, practices and tools;  Understanding of large system implementation, Systems Integration, Software Development, Package Implementation, and e-Business technology;  Knowledge of Project Management Principles and methodology.  Academic / Educational requirements  Must have formal Project Management training  A university degree or equivalent combination of education and experience  Keys  Strong PM with a demonstrated ability to deliver.  Ability to deal with a variety of stakeholders, including senior management.  Ability to deal with difficult stakeholders and effectively manage expectations.  Ability to build relationships.  Ability to manage a cross functional team which would include the ability to communicate effectively with the technical team members and the business people on the project.  Needs to have integration experience with big systems/applications: JDE, JDA, SAP, I2 Solutions, ERP  Needs to have COTS implementation experience as company doesn’t customize their own systems they buy it off the rack and then integrate it.  Has to have managed a large team – 25 people +  Worked with big budgets around the half a million dollar area  Doesn’t need configuration experience  Ability to understand and follow project delivery methodologies. An understanding around when to apply the right one, and an understanding around how to adjust those methodologies.  Bias against people who always play multiple roles (i.e. Project Manager, Business Analyst, and Architect) on their projects.  Additional: Previous experience in one or more of the following areas: relevant industry vertical. (Retail / Wholesale Distribution, CPG, WMS, EDI, JDA, Sterling DOM, etc.)  Must be able to manage multiple projects at once  Excellent communication skills with technical teams as well as business teams  Interest in mentoring junior / intermediate PMs  Focus on forward planning  Understanding of strategic vs tactical delivery  Understanding of SDLC  Hiring contact: smears@tundratechnical.ca  Tundra Technical Solutions would like to thank you for the interest you have demonstrated in this opportunity. However, only candidates with the required skills will be contacted.  Tundra Technical Solutions is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Title: Project Manager – Store Systems – Retail – Mat Leave Cover
Job_Description: Calgary, AB  What you’ll do  In this role, you will be expected to: Develop, review and maintain store systems project standard framework, processes and store architecture standards based on IT requirements and lessons learned.  Manage new store build projects, store relocation projects, and store decommissioning projects.  Support popup stores while managing stakeholder expectations.  Organize, attend and participate in stakeholder meetings.  Organize meetings with 3rd party vendors and other internal IT groups to review project plans.  Coordinate 3rd party vendors and internal IT teams activities and responsibilities.  Manage existing and new 3rd party vendors to get work completed within scope, on time and within budget, and manage processing their invoices.  Produce technical and store operations feasibility options for project requests.  Identify and discuss the impact of store layout into the technology integration activities.  Create a project plan [define sub goals, milestones and tasks, time and resource planning].  Monitor project progress and success [assess risks and hazards to the success of the project and take appropriate measures for avoidance].  Document and follow up on important actions and decisions from meetings.  Ensure projects adhere to frameworks and all documentation is maintained appropriately for each project.  Assess project risks and issues and provide solutions where applicable.  Submit and manage Change tickets and adhere to internal Change Management processes.  Identify any potential inventory shortages and work with Store System Inventory Coordinator to get the required inventory purchased.  Ensure stakeholder views are managed towards the best solution and escalate issues when required.  Ensure a solid communication plan is put in place and employed with all stakeholders involved.  Report statuses of all on-going projects and provide metrics on completed projects.  Provide availability to work after hours and weekends as business needs require.  Provide on call support during last 2 weeks of new store builds, store relocations and store decommissioning.  Who you are  We are looking for a high performing individual who: Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit, a bias for action, and a desire to work with key stakeholders to drive innovation in the retail environment and in-store e-commerce;  Is direct and truthful, and builds trust and credibility with co-workers, vendors, and customers by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values;  Demonstrates a desire to help and is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs;  Is committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives, and working collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives;  Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups;  Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused;  Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation. Open ears. Open minds. Open futures  The Tundra team has over 600 years of experience, from a wide variety of disciplines – recruiting executives, business owners and technical consultants. Our combined experience ensures that your needs are covered from every possible direction.

Title: Senior Project Manager – Civil Works
Job_Description: 04/03/2018  001613  Pomerleau is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder.  Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do.  WHAT WILL YOU DO IN A WEEK? :  Under the supervision of the Project Director, the Senior Project Manager for Civil works ensures the overall supervision and coordination of all the steps of the various construction projects, namely collaboration with subcontractors, close relationship with the client, and monitoring costs and schedules. Coordinate the work in collaboration with the superintendent—schedule, manpower and equipment requirements, etc.;Manage changes and instructions;Manage plans, specs, and addenda. Manage calls for bids and related contracts—can change from one project form to another Prepare all the documents to launch calls for bids;Draw up a detailed schedule—dates, main construction steps, constraints, work method;Launch and manage calls for bids;Finalize plans and specs;Analyze and negotiate bids;Prepare recommendations as well as contract awards and then obtain client’s approval;Award contracts;Set up and conduct initial meetings with major subcontractors on the project. Project Coordination Establish work methods in collaboration with the superintendent;Draw up list of activities in order to enable preparing the prevention program;Establish a list of items for cost follow-up and project accounting;Issue purchase orders for construction site materials at construction site;Settle disputes in collaboration with the superintendent;Perform breakdown and invoicing;Organize and conduct construction site meetings as required;Supervise site wrap-up manual preparation with administrative assistant. Project Follow-Up Perform administrative follow-up—costs, contingencies, boards, claims, etc.;Confirm implemented technical follow-up—technical data sheets, inspections, etc.;Follow up on notices of change—estimation, bid to client, negotiation, issuance of orders and/or of contract.  DO YOU HAVE THESE QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS? :  Bachelor’s degree or Diploma in Civil Engineering or another construction related disciplineAt least 8 years’ experience managing Civil construction projectsStrong skills in management, communication, negotiation, and problem solvingAbility to exercise initiative and leadership, offering mentorship to more junior team members WHY JOIN POMERLEAU`S TEAM? :  Competitive salary 4 weeks’ vacation Group insurance (health spending account) Group RRSP Monthly public transit pass paid by employer Fitness center membership: 50% reimbursed by employer Employee assistance program Ongoing training offered throughout the year Young, dynamic environment Excellent career opportunities Summer hours PARTICULARITY:  The retained candidate will be subject to an administrative security check At Pomerleau, we focus on results-oriented, passionate and rigorous people who participate in ambitious and complex projects. You have the profile we are looking for?

Title: Intermediate and Senior-level Full Stack Developers
Job_Description: About this job Location options: Paid relocationJob type: Full-timeExperience level: Mid-Level, SeniorRole: Full Stack DeveloperIndustry: Financial Services, FinTech, SaaSCompany size: 501-1k peopleCompany type: PublicTechnologies java, spring, rest Job description ob description Solium needs Intermediate and Senior-level Full Stack Developers who want to write great programs. Do you want to work with a system that gets a half million logins from one hundred thousand users per month? How about write code for an industry-leading financial services platform that transacts more than ten billion dollars a year? Do you think it would be cool to be a part of the team that expands this platform to transact one trillion dollars for ten million users?  Have you ever wanted to be in a Guild?  Have you yearned to hear "that sounds great go ahead and try it out"?You aren't dogmatic; you're pragmatic. You know that "agile" means adapting to deliver value to customers, not necessarily any of the individual practices surrounding it. You care about automated tests and code reviews, and when the build breaks, you don't run git blame. You find the root cause and fix it. You embrace the hard problems like localization, security, and timezones. You want to move our code, style and performance in the right direction and be an influencer.It doesn't matter if it's Ant or Gradle, Struts or Spring, jQuery or GWT - you know it or you can pick it up. You aim to build commercial products that people use - technology is just a means to an end. We are looking for developers of all experience levels to help us build a fast, reliable, secure, and resilient enterprise platform on a global scale.Things we believe:  Results matter, not the clock.     Code and technology are what we use to solve problems, not the whole of our job. Continuously Improving, learning everyday through pairing, Lunch and Learns and mentorship.      You are passionate about about what you do and you take pride in your craft. Great programmers are great programmers whether they work in Java, .Net, React Native or C++ Free tools are great unless they aren't the best. We use high-end Linux workstations with big monitors and tools like IDEA, JRebel and the Atlassian suite to keep us in the zone.  Skills & Requirements Things we like:    Prior experience with production large-scale distributed systems Familiarity with technologies we use (Java, Spring, GWT, Struts, JPA, EJB, REST)      A hunger for tracking down root causes - no matter how deep the rabbit hole       A BS in CS is appreciated but not necessary with the right background  What you'll do:  Be customer focused - learn about the business to help bring value to our customers Act technology driven - design, implement, and test new functionality    Work closely with QA - we fix our own bugs       Work with Product Management to deliver material value to our clients      Do full stack dev from the DB to the UI       Use your experience to help the whole team get better  What you'll get:           Market rate salary based on experience          An amazing on-boarding experience on Shareworks, Dev Culture, How we do things and even "reforming" you from .Net to Java           Participation in annual bonus plan and stock incentives   Share Purchase Plan with company contributions (we are public and profitable!)            Casual Environment - we aren’t a bank, they just happen to be clients 20 Paid Days off + 11 stat holidays (and 5 week sabbatical after 5 years) The occasional spontaneous Nerf War Relocation Assistance available for the right candidates  If you've read this far and you're thinking "I want to be a part of this", we agree! Just send an email to dev-careers@solium.com with Intermediate OR Senior Dev Applicant in the subject and we'll talk about how your career is about to get better. These jobs are full time positions in Calgary, Alberta, Canada.  In addition to being a Canadian citizen or having permanent resident status, you must live in Calgary or be willing to move.

Title: .NET Full-Stack Web Developer
Job_Description: About this job Compensation: C$80k - 120kJob type: Full-timeExperience level: Mid-Level, SeniorRole: Full Stack DeveloperIndustry: Agile Software Development, Data & Analytics, Energy & CommoditiesCompany size: 11-50 peopleCompany type: PrivateTechnologies c#, asp.net-mvc, sql, angular, asp.net-web-api Job description EnergyIQ is looking for a Senior Full-Stack .NET Web Developer in a full-time, permanent position to help us deliver new and enhanced functionality in all of our applications - Trusted Data Manager (TDM), IQexchange and IQinsights.
