These commercial applications allow data management and geoscience teams in the energy industry to create, manage, analyze and continually improve the trustworthiness and quality of their data, and the certainty of their business decisions. Our platform supports users in both on-premise and cloud environments, with a vision to be completely cloud-hosted in three years. We need to deliver a lot in 2018, so we need to add smart, fun people to our development team to get through it all.  The technology stack you’ll be working with includes ASP.NET MVC, ASP.NET WebApi, SQL Server, ElasticSearch, JavaScript, KendoUI, Angular. We work in C# a lot, but we're open to other languages and tools when we see the right fit in our toolkit. We are advocates for keeping things simple, delivering end-to-end before optimizing, and reviewing designs against acceptance criteria constantly to ensure that we're delivering what is needed by users now, not over-designing for the future. We are passionate about clean, well-designed code that requires minimal maintenance and is well-tested by developers and testers alike – creating great functionality for users while keeping our quality high with automated and manual testing. A typical day in this role includes a short stand-up team meeting in the morning, coding on sprint commitments, meeting with the product owner to further define requirements or review your UI design, catching up with others over lunch, mentorship time with younger developers, and a weekly demo to the team of the new features or fixes deployed. What you’ll be doing  Hands-on coding efforts to contribute to the sprint and release commitments Develop in a highly collaborative environment side-by-side with software testers, developers and business representatives. Participation in release/iteration planning, story/bug effort estimation. Code reviews to identify required improvements, technical risks, performance impacts, and dependencies of new development efforts. Technical designs of new functionality and application enhancements.  What you need  Brains, a sense of humour, and pride in your craft. Bring proactiveness and creativity in your solutions and a passion for tech and coding. Proficiency (5+ years) in the full stack of the .NET Framework – front-end development in common JavaScript frameworks on top of middle-tier controllers and services and back-end supporting services and libraries - C# preferred. 3+ years recent experience in either Oracle or SQL Server. Hands-on experience with Angular, JavaScript, KendoUI, JQuery with good UI design.  What else we look for  Experience with current designs and implementations of RESTful APIs. Recent experience with TeamCity build tools, ReSharper code tools, and an agile software development workflow based upon JIRA and Confluence. A strong interest in collaboration and mentorship Laughing and smiling in the face of adversity, able to roll with the punches.  How do you find out more? Our interview process consists of several stages, each one allowing us get to know youbetter, professionally and technically. It is also an opportunity for you to gain a betterunderstanding of our culture and the work we do here at EnergyIQ. The process usually takes us a few weeks after we start the initial reviews. The stages include:  CV and Portfolio Review Phone Interview Face to Face Interview Reference Check  In our face-to-face interview we show you the office, our products and the architecture, and give you the chance to talk to one of the team about the role.

Title: Software Developer / Programmer (Exciting and great variety)
Job_Description: About this job Compensation: C$48k - 69k | EquityJob type: Full-timeExperience level: Junior, Mid-Level, LeadIndustry: Enterprise Software, Security Software, Software Development / EngineeringCompany size: 51-200 peopleCompany type: PrivateTechnologies .net, c#, database, enterprise, objective-c Job description Not your everyday software developer position. Challenging and fast moving, yet friendly and supportive: a career you will look forward to every day. Work with intelligent people in an exciting environment where every month is different.   Positions Available:  Multiple positions ranging from intermediate up to team lead level (based on skill, regardless of the amount of experience or education), opening up immediately and throughout the year. Additional positions for specialists (for example, Android programming, user interface programming, etc). Tell us your strengths and we’ll go from there. Other Positions: We are also hiring for other positions (software tester, business analyst, project manager, graphic designer, and front-end GUI designer). You may apply for multiple positions separately. If you know someone in any of these areas, please do them a quick and friendly favour by letting them know about this posting.  Position Overview:  Full time and permanent. Fast moving in terms of variety of work and expectations. Flexible hours (for example: choose to start your day between 6am and 10am, work late some days and shorter on others). Gain valuable career experience in the newest highlevel technologies (C#, .NET 5, Java, MVC7, WCF, web services, SOA, Swift/Objective-C, Xamarin, F#). Gain experience with many advanced software engineering tools and techniques (code generation, object relational mappers, advanced .NET reflection, etc). Gain experience with both small and large projects, with involvement throughout the product life-cycle. Opportunities to be involved with higher level architecture and design. Mentoring from experienced software architects and some of the smartest peers in the country, on exciting projects that you can really sink your teeth into. A blend of programming methodologies (deliberately part way between agile, Kanban, and waterfall plus occasional extreme and pair programming methodologies). Does not involve a lot of boring technical support or fixing broken legacy applications. Most of the learning is through hands-on trying and doing and collaborating. Meetings and formal training are minimized. Rarely requires meeting with a client for those who prefer not to. Environment allows for some privacy at your workstation as well as time to concentrate without distractions when you need it.  Requirements:  Highly intelligent. Fast learner and enjoys learning. Passionate about making software and very good at it. Gets deeply involved with challenges and will persevere at length to achieve victory. Takes pride in work. A deep appreciation for reusable code and the benefits of object oriented design. No specific requirements for formal education or industry experience. We evaluate each applicant based on merit rather than formalities.  Nice To Have:  Ability to see opportunities for improvement everywhere. Experience with .NET or mobile development. Pragmatic approach to balancing perfectionism with getting the job done.  About The Work Environment:  Friendly, non-threatening, and non-political environment. Mid-sized company but retaining the speed and flexibility of a smaller company. We are a great environment for both outgoing people and those who are very shy and introverted (applicable to non-client facing positions). We strive to have every employee sitting near a window for natural light and to have plenty of plants throughout the office; we care about employee health. Free onsite massage therapy. Private nap rooms for isolated thinking time or for taking a nap if you didn’t sleep well last night. Atrium to enjoy the sun during lunch. Social events worth remembering (fencing competitions, curling, video game or board game parties, coding competitions, commando combat training, robotics club coming soon, etc). An example of our culture: Lunch together is in a very comfy sofa room, and even the quiet types are comfortable there. Unlimited access to pillage our kitchens for caffeine, sugar, healthy snacks, soups, and more :) Additional perks that are cost-shared like motorized sit-stand desks. Task focused: everyone in the company heavily uses centralized to-do lists to stay organized, prioritize, and coordinate. Fast paced  Applying:  What do you have to lose by exploring the possibility? Applying does not take long and we keep your application confidential (never disclosed to existing employer). Apply online today at https://careers.pleasantsolutions.com Even if you don't have your resume updated or ready to go, apply anyways, we want to hear from you! Please do not apply via email, use only the https://careers.pleasantsolutions.com link to apply.

Title: Turnaround Manager
Job_Description: <strong>Turnaround Manager</strong> <br/><br/> Why work at Nutrien? Great question! <br/><br/> Safety is a core value at Nutrien. Keeping every employee safe, healthy and secure is our top priority. Nothing is more important than seeing our people go home safe at the end of every single day. <br/><br/> While working here you will have the opportunity to grow your career while helping us feed the future. We pride ourselves in hiring from a variety of backgrounds and truly believe that it is our differences that make us stronger so we hope you will join us. <br/><br/> In addition to exciting and challenging opportunities, Nutrien offers competitive salaries, great benefits and performance based incentives. <br/><br/> Outside of the skills and necessary qualifications, you will be committed to sustaining our safe and positive work environment while welcoming working side by side others in a diverse culture. Culture at Nutrien is the core of everything we do and all employees are respectful of diverse opinions and views. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Tasks:</strong> <ul> <li>Phase 1 & 2</li>  <ul> <li>Strategy & Preliminary Development: Leads site and central team resources through long range strategy, and preliminary turnaround development; training and leading site leadership through the staging plan, including upkeep and reporting</li> </ul>  <li>Phase 3 & 4</li>  <ul> <li>Development, Optimization, Pre-TA: Responsible for ongoing monitoring of TA staging plan, leading both internal and external resources to complete all staging activities; accountable to central and senior leadership to complete all preparation milestones on time; main activities include ensuring scope is defined and challenged, creating the budget and AFE, responsible for the org structure, ensuring all TA resources are properly trained</li> </ul>  <li>Phase 5 Pre-Turnaround</li>  <ul> <li>The TA manager will move from a “staging” leadership role into an execution manager role, ensuring all pre-work is completed prior to TA, transition of all resources into their TA execution roles, and ensuring all supporting processes are in place and effective</li> </ul>  <li>Phase 6 Execution</li>  <ul> <li>Leads the site execution leadership team through the TA; ensures daily monitoring of turnaround performance against all goals; reviews performance, ensures analysis in deficient areas, and drives decisive decision making to meet all goals; strong field presence to monitor, coach, and motivate</li> </ul>  <strong><li>Phase 7 Post TA:</li>  </strong>  <ul> <li>Accountable to complete the orderly administrative, labour, and accounting closeout of the turnaround, including post-mortems, investigations/root cause analyses, and other closeout documentation - and, ensures on-time and on-budget completion of post work</li></ul> </ul> <strong><strong>Skills:</strong></strong> <ul> <li>Embodies a “Commitment to Zero” attitude towards personal safety</li><li>Expert leadership, conflict resolution, and team building skills</li><li>Subject matter expert in turnaround drivers, processes, challenges, and strategies</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Strong ability to strategize, and tie together different processes and systems</li><li>Strong ability to gather user requirements, research industry best practices, understand and influence culture, and assimilate into successful business systems</li><li>Ability to work autonomously and provide own work direction with highly complex, and business significant subject matter</li><li>Knowledgeable in the operation and maintenance of Ammonia and Urea production (or equivalent).</li><li>Intermediate or higher skills in Excel</li><li>Knowledgeable of financial and/or management accounting terms and systems</li><li>Knowledgeable of other MS Office systems (Word, Power Point, Project etc.), Primavera and SAP (or comparable CMMS/ERP system)</li> </ul> <strong><strong>Qualifications:</strong></strong> <ul> <li>Trade/Power Engineering Certification or Bachelor Degree (Engineering Preferred)</li><li>CMRP, PMP, or equivalent an asset</li><li>10 years of increasing responsibilities in a turnaround environment, including experience as T/A manager</li> </ul> Nutrien is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We encourage applications from all well qualified candidates who reflect the diversity of the regions where we operate. This includes recognizing the voluntary identification of status such as gender, sexual orientation, visible minority, Indigenous status, persons with disabilities, and veterans, where applicable. <br/><br/> If this sounds like a good match, apply now. This job will remain posted until filled. You may be required to undergo a background check and substance test in accordance with Nutrien policies. <br/><br/> While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted. <br/><br/> **EOE race/color/sex/sexual orientation/gender identity/disability/vet

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Current ENMAX employees are encouraged to apply through their internal Workday access. <br/><br/> <strong>Posted: May 11, 2018</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Closing Date: May 25, 2018</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Position Type: Permanent</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Union: MP (Exempt)</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Vision –</strong> To be Canada’s leader in the electricity industry. <br/><br/> <strong>Mission –</strong> We power the potential of people, businesses and communities by safely and responsibly providing electricity and energy services in ways that matter to them today and tomorrow. <br/><br/> <strong>Is this challenge for you? Imagine the possibilities.</strong> <br/><br/> You will be responsible for managing complex major projects through to successful completion. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Manage complex distribution, substations, transmission, network, customer driven, and major projects within schedule, cost and regulatory requirements.  <ul> <li>Coordinate and lead matrixed project teams by setting clear expectations and utilizing resources efficiently.</li><li>Oversee all project components including scope, cost, schedule, EHS, quality management, change management, and customer satisfaction.</li></ul></li> </ul>   <ul> <li>Develop and maintain detailed executable project plans and control of critical timelines/milestones.</li><li>Effectively and accurately report project status, change requests, schedule and finances to internal and external customers.</li><li>Provide guidance and leadership to project engineers, design engineers, construction managers, project controls, and supply chain management personnel.</li><li>Manage qualified subcontractors as required to deliver project scopes and adhere to project schedules.</li><li>Assist with development of capital business cases, budget development, monthly forecasting and variance rationale.</li><li>Provide support to the management team for implementing process changes and improvements.</li><li>Accountable for the safe execution of their projects.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering</li><li>10+ years’ experience with a power utility with directly applicable experience in construction and project management.</li><li>P.Eng status with The Association of Professionals in Engineering and Geoscientists in Alberta (APEGA).</li><li>PMP designation or willingness to obtain designation.</li><li>Hands on experience with heavy industrial design, construction, and project management.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to deliver projects to cost, schedule, quality, and EHS objectives while also delivering high customer satisfaction.</li><li>Strong computers skills in MS Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word)</li><li>Experience using scheduling software (MS Projects, Primavera, Maximo etc…).</li><li>Experience in project cost control; schedule and critical path analysis would be an asset.</li> </ul> <strong>Personal Qualities:</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent analytical and organizational skills and ability to manage a wide variety of issues and multiple projects.</li><li>Driven to provide predictability and a high focus on customer satisfaction.</li><li>Demonstrated excellence in communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively manage project expectations and communicate with team members.</li> <li>Proven, strong leadership, negotiation and conflict resolution skills.</li><li>Strong team player and ability to work independently.</li><li>Excellent decision making abilities with sound judgment.</li><li>Sound knowledge of project management with the ability to meet project objectives.</li> </ul> <strong>ENMAX Values</strong> – Safety, Integrity, Accountability, Service, Teamwork, Agility, Innovation <br/><br/> If you share our values and would like to make a difference with your career, join the team and see where the ENMAX possibilities can take you. <br/><br/> <strong><u><u>What We Offer</u>!</u></strong> <br/><br/> We offer competitive compensation including a comprehensive flexible benefits program, non-downtown location that includes great building amenities such as free onsite fitness facility with programming geared to employees needs, onsite child care centre (upon availability, offered from our ENMAX Place location 141 – 50 Ave. SE), free parking and much more. <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> 141 - 50th Avenue SE, Calgary, AB <br/><br/> <strong>Note:</strong> <ul> <li>ENMAX welcomes all qualified applicants to apply, it is our aim to have a workplace which reflects the diversity of the communities we serve.</li><li>ENMAX employees are encouraged to pursue professional development opportunities through our internal <strong>Learning Centre.</strong></li><li>Must be legal to work in Canada and requires the successful completion of a criminal background check. Two pieces of valid Government issued ID will be required.</li> <li>Two professional references will be requested.</li><li>Education requirements for this position will be verified by a third party.</li> </ul> <strong>Please visit our careers page to learn more about other opportunities at ENMAX Corporation.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>#LI-POST</strong>

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: <div>At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people. <br/><br/> Job Responsibilities/Job Functions:   <ul> <li>Manage all aspects of the project (New Site Acquisition-Real Estate) including project scoping, resource assignment, project plan development, project tracking, monitoring and reporting through the application of proven project management principles and methodologies.</li> <li>Develop and maintain all project documentation (Project Plan, Issue and Action Logs, Risk Management, Communication Plan, Status Reports, Post Implementation Reviews, etc.).</li> <li>Identify benefits expected from initiatives and conduct post implementation reviews to report on and track results.</li> <li>Pull together resources effectively to implement projects. Orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish objectives.</li> <li>Use critical thinking skills to anticipate and manage potential risks that will arise. Communicate these to the stakeholders on a regular basis and ensure decisions are made quickly and effectively.</li> <li>Maintain the Project Management Office Lessons Learned database, and apply lessons learned to all initiatives. Where process creation or modification recommendations result from the lesson learned, Project Manager is responsible for determining ownership within the organization and managing the implementation of recommended solutions.</li> <li>Assist in the development and implementation of templates, procedures and processes as part of the continuous development of the Wireless Customer Deployment team.</li> </ul>  <strong>Job Qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>Minimum (5) years of demonstrated progressive experience in project management, preferably in projects associated with the deployment or implementation of services for customers. Preference that this experience is in telecommunications industry.</li> <li>Experience in managing a group of simultaneous initiatives.</li> <li>Post secondary education, preferably in a business administration or project management related discipline.</li> <li>Completely conversant in Microsoft Project and other MS Office tools.</li> <li>Knowledge and consistent application of proven industry standard Project Management approaches.</li> <li>Project Management designation an asset but not required.</li> <li>High level of energy and strong passion to lead team members to successful completion of projects and to ensure the delivery of a positive customer experience.</li> <li>Great attention to detail.</li> <li>Creativity, flexibility and an ability to manage time and reset priorities in a dynamic environment.</li> <li>Superior skill set including: analytical thinking and problem solving, coaching and leadership, presentation and facilitation, negotiation and relationship building and proficient probing, listening and positioning skills and a good risk manager.</li> </ul>  Experience in Telco Real Estate Acquisition and associated industry relationships an asset. <br/> Experience in large telecom projects <br/> Experience and understanding of Telco lease and municipal development process.<br/> <div><strong>Schedule:</strong> Full Time</div><div><strong>Shift:</strong> Day</div><div><strong>Length of Contract:</strong> Not Applicable (Regular Position)</div><div><strong>Work Location:</strong> #700, 500 - 4 Ave Sw (056), Calgary, AB</div> <div><strong>Travel Requirements:</strong> Up to 25%</div><div><strong>Posting Category/Function:</strong> Project Management & Engineering</div><div><strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 120710</div><div><strong>WHY ROGERS?</strong></div><div>As a proud Canadian company, we&apos;re dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.</div> <br/> <div><strong>We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:</strong></div><ul><li>Simplify and innovate</li><li>Take ownership of the what and the how</li><li>Equip people to succeed</li><li>Execute with discipline and pride</li><li>Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver</li> </ul>  <div>Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today.</div><div>What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered.</div><div>We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You can also reach out to our team at RogersRecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.</div><div>Posting Notes: Corporate || Canada (CA) || AB || Calgary || SF:LI ||</div></div>

Title: Relationship Manager
Job_Description: Benevity grew by a whopping 5,869% last year; we were the third fastest-growing company according to Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50. And we’re not slowing down! We are looking for an experienced account manager to join our responsive, passionate Client Success team. Ideally with a background in software or technology and/or business analysis, you love getting to know your clients’ businesses and helping them succeed. If you like to focus on solutions and act as the advocate for client goals and best practice, this could be the position you’ve been looking for! <br/><br/> Who we are <br/><br/> Benevity is a software company working to build better and more engaging ways for companies to unite their people around doing the right thing. For us, doing well by doing good is way more than just a tagline, but on the subject of tag, we hope you’re “it!” We’re a growing company and we’re looking for just the people to help us take our business (and Goodness) to the next level. <br/><br/> If you joined us you’d be joining a diverse, dedicated, and passionate team that works hard day in and day out to deliver and develop innovative solutions and peerless customer service to our growing ranks of raving fans (aka our amazing clients). You’d be working with, and for, some of the most iconic companies and charitable organizations in the world to make a real difference in their communities (and on a global scale). If you’d describe yourself as self-driven, flexible, inclusive, cooperative, quick-learning, and unafraid to tackle hard problems head-on, we want you as part of our team. And we want you to know what we think wearing jeans to work is absolutely acceptable—and feel to bring your pup along for the ride. <br/><br/> Though we may have outgrown our “startup” label, our fun, flexible tech culture has grown with us and still fits perfectly. More than all of that, we have a heart and hold Goodness at the forefront of everything we do. We’re getting all As as a registered B Corporation, meaning we’re happy to be counted among a growing number of companies who’re committed to higher social and sustainability standards. <br/><br/> What you will do  <ul> <li>Be responsible for management of client relationships, which includes things like attending to clients’ daily enquires, as well as longer-term needs, such as software enhancement projects.</li> <li>Be the main point of contact to resolve a broad range of client issues (many of them unprecedented!), ranging from technical software challenges, to charity inquiries, donation and volunteering data and much more, collaborating with multiple internal teams to drive solutions.</li> <li>Execute the day-to-day administrative functions of clients’ programs, which vary across clients (i.e. technical software support, bulk data uploads, reporting, and much more).</li> <li>Train clients on Benevity’s always-evolving software products, and maintaining and deepening your own knowledge as well (there are new software releases nearly every month).</li> <li>Develop strong knowledge of clients’ corporate social responsibility and employee engagement program goals in order to advise on optimal usage of Benevity’s products and best practices to grow their programs.</li> <li>Assist with clients’ unique reporting needs, as well as provide regular reports on standard metrics – gaining a deep understanding of our reporting tool will be necessary.</li> <li>Participate as part of a team in software implementations for new clients, and enhancement projects for existing clients.</li>  </ul> What you bring  <ul> <li>3+ years in an account management role, ideally with 2 or more of those years supporting a SaaS application or otherwise demonstrated technical aptitude.</li> <li>A love of solving mysteries, navigating the unknown, and working collaboratively to find unique solutions.</li> <li>A high level of technical curiosity.</li> <li>Exceptional, proven client service skills.</li> <li>A desire to learn something new each and every day.</li> <li>Excellent organizational skills and strong multi-tasking abilities, thriving on multiple projects and tasks in a fast-paced environment.</li> <li>Attention to detail, and commitment to quality and continuous improvement.</li> <li>Professional demeanour and ability to communicate and build relationships with clients long-distance.</li> <li>Can-do attitude and willingness to lead a variety of projects to support the Client Success team.</li> <li>Experience with corporate social responsibility programming and/or employee engagement is an asset.</li>  </ul> What you can expect  <ul> <li>An environment where constant learning is the norm.</li> <li>To rapidly evolve beyond your previous experience.</li> <li>Opportunity to work with Fortune 500 clients in a fast-paced environment for a dynamic company with a history of proven success.</li> <li>Join a team of innovative thinkers as part of a rapidly growing company that is all about helping businesses create innovative corporate and workplace giving programs.</li> <li>Connect with a passionate group in an open, collaborative, and fun environment.</li> </ul> While we sincerely appreciate every application received, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Overview<br/><br/>Corrpro Canada Inc, an Aegion company, is looking for a <strong>Project Manager</strong> to join our team in <strong>Calgary, AB</strong>. <br/><br/> Corrpro is North America's largest corrosion engineering, cathodic protection, and corrosion monitoring business for the protection and preservation of infrastructure. Corrpro provides professional corrosion consulting and cathodic protection engineering services to major oil companies, government agencies, municipal water, sewer and gas utilities, universities, and public transportation agencies. Corrpro has complete construction installation and maintenance services, including crews and equipment to install any type of cathodic protection system for any type of structure.<br/><br/>Responsibilities   <ul>   <li>Plan and coordinate multiple projects of extended duration</li> <li>Oversee the assignment of work to approximately 5 to 10 staff members to effectively utilize resources and meet commitments to customers</li>   <li>Assist with the review of all customer contracts, purchase orders, and work authorizations regarding proposed scope of work, customer expectation, and project objectives.</li> <li>Monitor operations personnel to ensure they are using the most appropriate methods and procedures to meet the requirements established with customers</li> <li>Work within allotted time constraints to complete project deliverables</li> <li>Generate and ensure all project documentation is technically correct and meets the Company’s minimum performance standards</li> <li>Ensure that billing sheets are accurately prepared and submitted to customers</li> <li>Assist in the analysis of the monthly Job Cost Report for individual projects and ensure budget goals are met</li> <li>Assist with new capital expense requirements during the preparation of each fiscal year’s budget</li> <li>Participate in meetings with clients</li> <li>Contact customer regularly to maintain open communication of job schedule</li> <li>Direct customer service and follow-up efforts to assure continuing conformance of projects to all requirements, including but not limited to customer requirements, testing requirements, cost and profitability requirements, and growth requirements</li> <li>Develop, organize and maintain engineering specifications / standards by consolidating and assimilating best operating practices</li> <li>Additional duties as assigned</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>   <ul>   <li>Technical Diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience</li> <li>3+ years’ experience in a project management role</li> <li>7+ years’ experience in Oil & Gas or Construction Industries</li> <li>Prior direct or indirect supervisory experience required</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Able to interact effectively with clients</li> </ul> <strong>Additional Requirements</strong>  <ul>   <li>Able to work independently</li> <li>Able to work in the field in various weather conditions</li> <li>Flexible work hours</li> </ul>

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: At Golder, we thrive on challenges. <br/><br/> <strong> Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.</strong>  <br/><br/> Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment? <br/><br/> Golder has a new opportunity for a <strong>Project Manager</strong> to join our <strong>Mining</strong> team on a <strong>full time</strong> basis based in <strong>Calgary.</strong> Your role could include involvement throughout all stages of a mining project's life cycle (i.e. Initiation, Planning, Execution, Monitoring and Control, and Closure) for consulting specific projects. <br/><br/> The position will be varied but with significant focus on utilizing Golder's internal technical resources. The majority of work will be engineering, science, and/or environmental consulting work. You will be manage projects in areas including, but not limited to, engineering design, field investigations, desktop analyses, numerical modeling, permitting, studies, research, etc. EPCM is not a focus for this position. You will support our technical mining divisions which include Mine Engineering and Stability, Mine Waste, Mine Water, Mine Environment and Mining Construction Services and the projects could be locations throughout the world. <br/><br/> An overview of your role will include:  <li> Working with various internal and external stakeholders to plan various projects (scope, schedule and budget</li> <li> Lead project teams, composed of mostly internal stakeholders, with some external stakeholders to execute projects to ensure that deliverables satisfy clients' multiple needs</li> <li> Assemble, manage and use a project monitoring system to monitor and track project progress with respect to schedule and budget</li> <li> Utilize and follow various Golder project management policies and protocols as well as available financial tools and systems</li> <li> Develop and implement project support plans (project health and safety, project quality, project risk management, project communication, project documentation, etc.)</li> <li> Manage projects with technical teams to deliver on schedule and budget, and meet the technical requirements of clients and regulatory agencies, if applicable</li> <li> Liaise regularly and frequently with clients and project teams to offer support and guidance</li> <li> Motivate and influence various levels of technical experts toward the completion of projects on time and on budget</li> <li> Manage change related scope, budget and schedule and actively communicate with the internal project team and clients</li> <li> Provide leadership and guidance to junior project staff <br/><br/> <strong>You will have a background in:</li>  </strong>  <li> Minimum of 5 years as a consultant working as a project manager where the candidate leveraged internal project teams of greater than 5 people in engineering, science, environmental, or related disciplines</li> <li> Has a BSc or MSc (preferred) or equivalent degree in Engineering, Science, Environmental, Business or related discipline</li> <li> Project Management Professional (PMP) designation or equivalent accreditation in project management (e.g., PRINCE2, Agile, Six Sigma)</li> <li> Strong knowledge of Project Management Systems</li> <li> Strong understanding of the importance of health and safety in projects</li> <li> Superior project planning skills , detail conscious and result oriented</li> <li> Strong written and oral communications skills</li> <li> High level of professionalism, integrity and ethics <br/><br/> <strong> Your benefits at Golder will include:</strong> </li> <li> Competitive benefits and remuneration packages</li> <li> Option to purchase shares in Golder</li> <li> Employee owned structure - own the business, own the result</li> <li> Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment</li> <li> Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects</li> <li> On the job training, mentoring and coaching</li> <li> Global projects and travel opportunities <br/><br/> <strong> One of Canada's Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 11 consecutive years</strong>  <br/><br/> Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 40 countries, Golder's 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors. <br/><br/> Golder is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. As such, Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities, upon request. <br/><br/> <strong> To learn more about our company and culture click here to view</strong>  <strong> The Promise of Golder</strong>  <strong> video.</strong> </li>

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Do <br/> you enjoy working in a dynamic, high energy environment, and feed off the <br/> energy that comes from collective success? <br/><br/> Do <br/> you thrive on creating order from chaos, and derive energy from helping teams <br/> work seamlessly together? <br/><br/> Do <br/> you have experience working in project management role in a communications, <br/> marketing or digital agency environment? <br/><br/> <strong>Edelman</strong> <br/> would love to get to know you! <br/><br/> We <br/> are seeking a talented project manager in our Calgary office. The Project <br/> Manager will be responsible for managing a variety of both niche and integrated <br/> projects on a number of significant accounts. <br/><br/> Edelman has evolved in Canada from its legacy as solely a PR <br/> agency to an integrated agency with specialties like Insights & Analytics, <br/> Paid Media, Planning & Creative and Digital Marketing. This evolution has <br/> led to both integrated AOR mandates with large Canadian brands and the awards <br/> to match from Cannes, CMAs, Strategy and the like, all wrapped in a culture <br/> that’s been awarded one of Canada’s Top 25 Great Places To Work. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Manage large to complex scale <br/> programs – across geographies and within the digital, experiential and <br/> communications space – including estimating, identification of tasks, <br/> activities, and deliverable milestones as well as the documentation of the <br/> resulting plan.</li><li>Work in partnership with the account lead and clients to onboard <br/> new projects, clarify their scopes and identify appropriate resources that <br/> match the right skills to the task at hand. Provide solid recommendations on timelines and budgets.</li><li>Partner with other members of the national project management <br/> group, collaborating across geographies to instill project management best <br/> practices within the Edelman Canada network.</li><li>Ensure projects are tracking on time, within scope and on budget. <br/> Report on project financials to account lead and senior leadership.</li><li>Identify areas of potential risk as well as identify and implement <br/> risk mitigation strategies on all assigned projects.</li><li>Work with project team to understand and manage expectations of <br/> both internal and external clients at the project level. Communicate potential <br/> variances upstream through senior team in timely fashion.</li><li>Work with the Edelman team and with various client team members to <br/> prioritize and reconcile competing demands (resourcing, budgeting, etc.) to <br/> meet Edelman and client business needs.</li><li>Identify and establish project management best practices on your <br/> accounts, and drive collaboration across specialty teams and offices. Proactively suggest new ways to streamline <br/> processes.</li><li>Develop project status reports and workbacks.Run status report meetings with the team.</li><li>Serve as primary escalation point for project issues that may impact <br/> the client. Work with the project team to identify options for resolution and <br/> communicate those options upstream.</li><li>Attend client kick off and status meetings and participate in <br/> scoping meetings. Communicate meeting objectives to project team members, <br/> ensuring efficient scheduling and appropriate agenda and recap documentation <br/> standards are met.</li><li>Actively support new business activities.</li><li>Demonstrate creative problem solving and conceptual thinking on <br/> client programs and projects.</li><li>Work as a strong "team player" and serve as role model <br/> to more junior team members.</li><li>Live the Edelman values (the relentless pursuit of excellence, <br/> freedom to be constantly curious and courage to do the right thing).</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>5 years of related experience in project management; ideally from a digital, PR, marketing or advertising agency.</li><li>Experience in client service and day-to-day client contact. A demonstrated ability to address client concerns thoughtfully and effectively.</li><li>Ability to manage project budgets, and experience adapting to budgeting software.</li><li>A demonstrated track record of developing and executing successful projects.</li><li>Experience with effectively delegating and/or executing many tactical assignments and accurately judging and reviewing the work of junior staff.</li><li>Creative and innovative approach to problem solving.</li><li>Exceptional written and presentation skills.</li><li>Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is an asset.</li> </ul> Should you be interested in applying for this role, please send your résumé and cover letter. Only those candidates short listed for an interview will be contacted. Thank you for your interest in working with Edelman.

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: <div>Requisition Id: 15284 <br/><br/> Department: Operations Engineering Department <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is seeking an Engineer, Projects to join our Conventional Business Unit (CBU) in Calgary, Alberta. Reporting to the Supervisor, Project Engineering (Operations), this position’s responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:  <ul>  	<li>Development of PMO (Project Management Office) documents as required;</li> <li>Liaising with and coordinating project stakeholders to manage project scope, timing, resourcing, and execution;</li> <li>Working with the engineering team to coordinate the delivery of technical deliverables;</li> <li>Working with the SCM (Supply Chain Management) team to coordinate procurement and contracts as necessary for successful project execution;</li> <li>Working with the Pembina commissioning and Operations teams as necessary to ensure the project is appropriately commissioned and turned over;</li> <li>Working with the Pembina document control team to ensure all project deliverables are appropriately numbered, compiled and available for turnover to close out the project;</li> <li>Maintaining appropriate cost control and schedule to ensure successful project management and forecasting are in place;</li> <li>Coordinate and manage as necessary to establish construction contracts, construction supervisors, EHS professionals and other support staff as necessary to ensure successful field execution of the project;</li> <li>Coordinate as necessary with SPCC (Sherwood Park Control Center) and SCADA to coordinate commissioning activities, shutdown activities and other non-routine events as necessary for successful project execution;</li> <li>Consult and coordinate as necessary with the Pembina LARE (Land, Aboriginal, Regulatory, and Environmental) group; and</li> <li>Other general coordination duties as required to ensure the necessary stakeholders are considered as part of the project.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Preferred candidate would have at least 10 years of combined construction and engineering project experience with either a P.Eng. or CET designation;</li> <li>A background in the mechanical trades is a definite asset;</li> <li>Demonstrated experience in project coordination between design engineering, field execution teams, commissioning teams and Code inspectors;</li> <li>Previous EPC design experience is a definite asset; and</li> <li>Fluent in the tools of project management including cost control, scheduling, contracts, execution planning and project closeout.</li> </ul> <strong>No agency calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. <br/><br/> Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. <br/><br/> Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. <br/><br/> Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. <br/><br/> Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. <br/><br/> ></div>  <br/>

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: <strong>Company Description:</strong> <br/><br/> Gevity is an international informatics and management consulting company offering a full range of interdisciplinary professional services to clients seeking to build sustainable and effective health care and social services systems. Through our focus on the unique needs of the health care, social services and life sciences sectors, we work to support healthier lives through connected systems. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description:</strong> <br/><br/> This position requires an individual who is able to manage, coordinate and guide clients, providing strategic advice, while leading projects to fulfill that strategic vision. This individual coordinates a diverse team of professionals to ensure that project tasks are completed on time and within budget while engaging clients at the project management, executive and senior executive levels, ensuring accountability to organization strategy and objectives throughout. They are the liaison between the client and the project team, and are responsible for delivery from inception to sign-off. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> Expertise in effectively managing multiple stakeholders and developing and maintaining healthy stakeholder relationships. <br/><br/> Proven ability to proactively resolve performance, scope, cost and schedule issues with stakeholders as they arise. <br/><br/> Proven experience in ensuring accurate and timely communications to stakeholders including monitoring the communication network between the project team, and internal and external stakeholders and introducing changes where required. <br/><br/> Ability to clearly define scope and compliance with overall organizational goals; to manage and monitor project performance, identify issues and opportunities early and take pre-emptive actions if required. <br/><br/> Experience in developing and managing the schedule of all elements of a project including routine monitoring of performance and developing corrective action plans. <br/><br/> Proven expertise in defining project quality requirements and ensuring that the right systems are in place and applied. <br/><br/> Ability to provide clear and focused leadership for the project team to create a vision for project success and a strategy to fit that vision. <br/><br/> Focus on milestone and other key project objectives achievement. Ability to provide mentoring and participate in staff performance evaluations. <br/><br/> Expertise in identifying, managing and mitigating project risks and opportunities and monitoring the closure of all identified risks and opportunities. <br/><br/> Sets clear objectives for the procurement of additional project resources as required. <br/><br/> Ensures that services meet specifications and are delivered on-time and within budget. <br/><br/> Produces weekly and monthly status reports that clearly highlights the status, and identify where impacts or issues pose a risk to the schedule. <br/><br/> Manages project team logistics. <br/><br/> <strong>Required Skills & Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> Five or more years proven successful project management experience for health and/or social service related projects. <br/><br/> Capability to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously. <br/><br/> Excellent verbal and written communication skills, consideration to those bilingual in French and English. <br/><br/> Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. <br/><br/> Develops project documents according to standard templates, using natural language. <br/><br/> The ability to effectively deal with remote teams and users. <br/><br/> Ability for some travel is preferred. <br/><br/> <em>Gevity is an equal opportunity employer. Proof of credentials, as well as a criminal check, may be required for successful applicants. Resumes will be kept on file and candidates may be contacted for future opportunities.</em>

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: <strong>PROJECT MANAGER</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>POSITION OVERVIEW</strong> <br/><br/> This role works as part of the Project Team, assisting with the development of scope and schedule for project work on a client account. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <ul> <li>Support project executives on all projects of all size and complexity Proactively manage project-related issues on account or assignment.</li><li>Develop scope and schedule for assigned projects.</li><li>Conduct, document, and communicate all meetings notes (weekly meeting, projectkick-off meetings, etc.)</li><li>Coordinate and track all Vendor RFP’s. Maintain accurate and consistent electronic files and documentation.</li><li>Coordinate activities of consultants, contractors and sub-contractor</li><li>Pre-qualify consultants, contractors and sub-contractors to ensure qualifications are in order (certificate of insurance, security clearances, contractor orientation documents, liciences, etc.)</li><li>Interact and negotiate with consultants, contractors and subcontractors</li><li>Interact and maintain positive working relationships with other JLL teams including accounting, facility management, CMMS and energy teams.</li><li>Assist in the utility rebate application process as warranted by project type.</li><li>Prepare/update project status reports, request process purchase orders and invoices, update data in OVP for tracking reports and maintain files for due diligence and financials.</li><li>Demonstrate a proactive focus on client and project requirements in a timely and cost effective manner.</li><li>Demonstrate proficiency in the use and application of all PDS technology as required for assigned projects.</li><li>Conduct inspection visits and document, communicate, and resolve all items completed that deviate from issued criteria.</li><li>Complete or work with the projecct co-ordinator for all administrative tasks related to project delivery, execution and closeout.</li><li>Ensure accurate management of all accounts receivables to maintain a level not to exceed planned working capital charge as set by corporate finance, account finance team and/or the Regional Operations Manager.</li><li>Assist Local PDS Team in meeting AGM numbers on a Regional and National level as determined on a yearly basis by the Management Executive Committee (not applicable to Accounts).</li><li>Comply with all Jones Lang LaSalle policies and procedures, including but not limited to ethics and business practice.</li> </ul> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <ul> <li>Ability to prepare and track budgets</li><li>Understanding of technical requirements for a business relocation</li><li>Familiarity and ability to read architectural, electrical, mechanical and structural drawings</li><li>Familiarity and ability to complete (desktop) assessments of projects related to energy consumming assets.</li><li>Flexibility with work hours and travel as needed</li><li>Hold a valid Canadian drivers licience</li><li>5 - 10 years practical experience in a project construction management required</li><li>5 years experience working on energy prjects as asset.</li><li>Highly organized with strong analytical skills</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills with an ability to interact with executive level external and internal clients</li><li>Ability to multi-task and work both in a team and independently</li><li>Organizational skills and ability to identify and manage priorities</li><li>Excellent written, verbal communication and proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite</li><li>Detail oriented</li> </ul> <strong>JLL Is an Equal Opportunity Employer</strong> <br/><br/> JLL is committed to developing and maintaining a diverse workforce. JLL strongly believes in equal opportunity extended to all individuals in all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, discipline, layoff, recall and termination without regard to race, color, religion, belief, creed, age, sex, pregnancy or maternity (including childbirth and related conditions), family responsibility (e.g. child care, elder care), nationality, ethnic or national origin or ancestry, citizenship, marital status, civil partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, veteran’s status, genetic information, trade union membership, social position, political view or status as a qualified individual with a disability, protected leave status or any other protected characteristic in accordance with applicable law. The company also endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for known physical or mental limitations of otherwise qualified employees and applicants with disabilities unless the accommodations would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business and ensures that employment decisions are based only on valid job requirements. <br/><br/> For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy at https://jll2.sharepoint.com/CorporatePolicies/HR%20Policies/Equal%20Employment%20Opportunity%20and%20Affirmative%20Action.pdf. <br/><br/> If you have questions about careers at JLL or are disabled and require further assistance in applying for a position, please contact us at careers@am.jll.com

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Overview<br/><br/>Corrpro Canada Inc, an Aegion company, is looking for a <strong>Project Manager</strong> to join our team in <strong>Calgary, AB</strong>. <br/><br/> Corrpro is North America's largest corrosion engineering, cathodic protection, and corrosion monitoring business for the protection and preservation of infrastructure. Corrpro provides professional corrosion consulting and cathodic protection engineering services to major oil companies, government agencies, municipal water, sewer and gas utilities, universities, and public transportation agencies. Corrpro has complete construction installation and maintenance services, including crews and equipment to install any type of cathodic protection system for any type of structure.<br/><br/>Responsibilities   <ul>   <li>Plan and coordinate multiple projects of extended duration</li> <li>Oversee the assignment of work to approximately 5 to 10 staff members to effectively utilize resources and meet commitments to customers</li>   <li>Assist with the review of all customer contracts, purchase orders, and work authorizations regarding proposed scope of work, customer expectation, and project objectives.</li> <li>Monitor operations personnel to ensure they are using the most appropriate methods and procedures to meet the requirements established with customers</li> <li>Work within allotted time constraints to complete project deliverables</li> <li>Generate and ensure all project documentation is technically correct and meets the Company’s minimum performance standards</li> <li>Ensure that billing sheets are accurately prepared and submitted to customers</li> <li>Assist in the analysis of the monthly Job Cost Report for individual projects and ensure budget goals are met</li> <li>Assist with new capital expense requirements during the preparation of each fiscal year’s budget</li> <li>Participate in meetings with clients</li> <li>Contact customer regularly to maintain open communication of job schedule</li> <li>Direct customer service and follow-up efforts to assure continuing conformance of projects to all requirements, including but not limited to customer requirements, testing requirements, cost and profitability requirements, and growth requirements</li> <li>Develop, organize and maintain engineering specifications / standards by consolidating and assimilating best operating practices</li> <li>Additional duties as assigned</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>   <ul>   <li>Technical Diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience</li> <li>3+ years’ experience in a project management role</li> <li>7+ years’ experience in Oil & Gas or Construction Industries</li> <li>Prior direct or indirect supervisory experience required</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Able to interact effectively with clients</li> </ul> <strong>Additional Requirements</strong>  <ul>   <li>Able to work independently</li> <li>Able to work in the field in various weather conditions</li> <li>Flexible work hours</li> </ul>

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: <P><EM>My Career. My Company. My Legacy. </EM></P> <P> </P> <P></P> <P>At PCL, you are more than just an employee. You could be part of a team that works hard, plays hard, and makes a difference in your community. PCL offers competitive compensation packages, and a chance to be an owner in our 100-percent employee-owned company. We not only reward you financially, but give you challenging assignments and a supportive work environment which promotes personal and professional growth. </P> <P><BR>Whether you are looking for a corporate or construction career, exciting opportunities are waiting for you. Our people have helped us stand out as a leading general contracting organization, which is why we are always looking for new talent-individuals who can bring innovative solutions and thinking to every project. </P> <P><BR>Due to newly awarded projects, we are seeking an experienced<STRONG> Project Manager</STRONG> for our <STRONG>Calgary</STRONG> District office located in<STRONG> Calgary, Alberta.</STRONG> <STRONG>Responsibilities:</STRONG></P> <UL> <LI>Oversee total effort to ensure project is constructed in accordance with design, budget, schedule and quality</LI> <LI>Manage project performance, schedule and resources</LI> <LI>Work as part of a team to meet project requirements</LI> <LI>Assist in developing and monitoring project specific quality plans</LI> <LI>Understand and actively manage client expectations and contract</LI> <LI>Interface and manage relationships with project team, client representative, consultants, and trade contractors</LI> <LI>Create and influence safety culture through mentorship and modelling</LI> <LI>Mentor, coach, supervise and assess performance of direct reports and other team members</LI> <LI>Develop and oversee project closeout and commissioning plan</LI> <LI>Understand, communicate and proactively manage contract; resolves disputes</LI> <LI>Stay current with industry practices; seek new and innovative construction methods</LI> <LI>Develop the project execution plan with the superintendent</LI> <LI>Negotiate and issue subcontracts and major purchase orders; monitor their progress and schedule</LI></UL> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Qualifications:</STRONG></P> <UL> <LI> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> A minimum of 7 years' progressive construction experience with a general contractor, leading up to a project manager role</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Post-secondary education/training in engineering, construction management or a related discipline</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>In-depth knowledge of the construction industry and company operations, specifically construction specifications, building materials, methods, procedures, HSE and quality management practices</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience in all phases of construction projects</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience managing multiple projects and project teams, including schedule and financials</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to establish and maintain strong key stakeholder relationships</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Proficiency using Microsoft Office suite and project management, schedule and estimating software</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to identify and manage risk and opportunities on construction projects</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong planning, organization and time management skills</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong problem-solving and decision making skills</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong verbal, written,and interpersonal communication skills</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to be flexible and work in a fast-pace environment</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Local market experience is an asset</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Preference will be given to candidates with experience in design-build, health care, or research facility projects</DIV></LI></UL> <P><STRONG></STRONG> </P> <P><STRONG>Working Conditions:</STRONG></P> <P><STRONG></STRONG> </P> <P>The PCL family of companies are consistently ranked among the best companies to work for, and we aspire to be the most respected builder, renowned for excellence, leadership, and unsurpassed value.</P> <P> </P> <P>We thank all applicants for their interest in working for PCL; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.</P> <P> </P> <P>Let us help you build your<STRONG><EM> Legacy</EM></STRONG> today.<BR></P> <P> </P><br></br>

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: <strong>Project Manager (Calgary)</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Are you looking to be part of an Innovative, Environmentally conscious and Collaborative team? If so, look no further.</em> <br/><br/> One of the top ten general contractors in Canada and part of the largest construction organization in North America, Clark Builders serves industrial, commercial and institutional market sectors. Clark Builders core values represent the spirit that our company was founded on: Respect Others, Have a Can-Do Attitude, Succeed as a Team, Lead with Courage, Deliver Results. They are more than words: each one underlies the commitment that we bring to every person we meet, every team we build and every project we work on, start to finish. We are looking for team members interested in working in an Innovative, environmentally conscious and collaborate team. <br/><br/> Reporting overall to the Vice President, Operations; on a day-to-day basis the Project Manager will be reporting and taking direction from his/her Project Executive in all aspects of the construction process on the project that they are assigned. The Project Manager working with the Project Superintendent will be responsible for and not limited to managing safety, quality, risks, maximizing project earnings, human resources and staff training, client expectations, accurate financial reporting and assuring efficient, timely, fulfillment of all corporate and project obligations, complete communications among all project team members and organizations to construct the project on time, within the budget and to the quality specified. The Project Manager role is diverse, and varies between each project. <br/><br/> The Project Manager is also responsible to foster and develop client, consultant, third party and trade relationships in the course of their duties. <br/><br/> <strong>Duties/Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Project Start Up:</strong> <ul> <li>Chair the project handover meeting from Project Development/Estimating</li><li>Conduct project trade buyout meetings</li><li>Conduct project startup meetings for individual trades</li><li>Utilities and site services applications</li><li>Permit applications.</li><li>Review and or prepare prime contract against submitted tender and/or proposal, ready for senior management review and client /consultant review</li><li>Quantity take-offs for a various scopes of the project.</li><li>Finalize Prime Contractor.</li><li>Client Risk assessment.</li><li>Prepare project execution plan.</li><li>Establish project organization charts and staffing needs.</li><li>Assist in estimating tender closeout and buy outs.</li> <li>Setup project addition form, financials and billing schedule.</li><li>Prepare staffing and resources plan.</li> <li>Prepare logistics planning.</li> <li>Establish file management plan.</li><li>Procurement management, project buyout and award.</li><li>Prepare and issue letter of intents (LOI) and subcontracts.</li><li>Put in place bonding and insurance.</li><li>Finalize project estimates.</li> <li>Safety planning including assistance with re-project hazard assessments, ongoing safety inspections, ongoing safety hazard assessment and other duties.</li> <li>Understand and abide by the requirements of the CB Safety and Loss Prevention Policies and Procedures</li> <li>Understand and abide by the requirements of the local building authorities, develop and maintain relationships with permits and licensing personnel including building inspectors</li><li>Quality control planning.</li> <li>Communications plan.</li><li>Create and manage schedule.</li><li>Strategic and fee enhancement planning.</li> <li>Establish and manage client and corporate objective.</li> <li>Modify project plan for success.</li>  </ul> <strong>Project Execution and Document Control:</strong> <ul> <li>Track productivity and performance of the project.</li><li>Project accounting.</li> <li>Manage stakeholder expectations</li><li>Chair the Quarterly operational review meetings</li><li>Manage staff assignments.</li><li>Prepare a cash flow project and manage the project in accordance with the cash flow requirements.</li><li>Advise management of pending risk elements and seek assistance on all risk matters or legal matters.</li> <li>Establish and manage document control process.</li><li>Establish and manager the quality control plan.</li><li>Establish and manage the project schedule, including the implementation of the Last Planner System.</li><li>Chair trade, owner/consultant meetings and issue minutes.</li><li>Chair, site safety meetings and issue minutes</li> <li>Project accounting and cost control, including working with project accountants</li><li>Monthly financial reports and eCMS, including the preparation of monthly project reports, both internal and external including the monthly MOR report.</li><li>Time cards.</li><li>PO and subcontract claims.</li><li>Client billings including preparation, payment, etc.</li><li>Dispute and claim management.</li> <li>Lead and train project teams including developing and mentoring support staff including project coordinators, junior project managers</li><li>Resolve trade and performance issues.</li><li>Provide regular management of Key Project Indicators (KPI’s)</li>  </ul> <strong>Project Close Out:</strong> <br/><br/> Prepare the project close out procedures including punch lists, start up and handover requirements <ul>   <ul> <li>Manage the trade contractor deliverables for project close out, including startup, warranties, demonstration requirements</li><li>Administrative project closure.</li> <li>Trade/Subcontracts.</li><li>Prime contractor.</li><li>Commissioning and equipment start-up.</li><li>Training seminars.</li><li>City inspections.</li><li>Final and holdback invoices and payment</li> <li>Final consultant and schedule C’s.</li><li>Substantial completion certificate.</li><li>Warranty period.</li> </ul>  <li><div>Support and grow ongoing sub-trade and client relationships.</div></li><li><div>Assist in obtaining work by way of completing a portfolio of successful projects.</div></li><li><div>Participate in project interviews.</div></li><li><div>Participate in CBU Leadership.</div></li><li><div>Ensure internal and external requirements are achieved.</div></li><li><div>Manage financial collection and closeout.</div> </li><li><div>Other duties and responsibilities as required.</div> </li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Knowledge:</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills.</li><li>The ability to efficiently assist and administer multiple tasks.</li> <li>Analytical thinker to interpret information in order to understand issues.</li> <li>Ability to make decisions on a variety of levels of complexity, ambiguity and risk.</li> <li>Can define tasks and milestones to achieve objectives while ensuring optimal use of resources.</li> <li>Can prevent, manage and resolve conflicts.</li><li>Questions conventional approaches, explores alternatives and provides innovative solutions.</li> <li>Can identify, assess and mange risks while striving to meet objectives.</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications & Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>A Post-Secondary Certificate/Degree in Engineering or the equivalent of a designated Professional Engineer or a Technical School graduate in a Construction related discipline.</li><li>Minimum 5 years’ experience working in a Project Manager role in Construction on projects up to $50 million</li><li>Management organization, managing construction of Commercial, Industrial or Institutional buildings.</li><li>Can lead, mentor and motivate medium to large project teams with a hands-on approach</li><li>Must be able to competently manage the construction process from project startup to project closeout for all sizes and levels of complexity projects.</li><li>Actively participate in career development opportunities</li><li>Undertake and receive required safety training in accordance with policies.</li><li>Healthcare experience is an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Competencies:</strong> <ul> <li>Networking and relationship building;</li><li>Customer focus;</li> <li>Teamwork;</li> <li>Interpersonal skills;</li> <li>Results focus;</li> <li>Integrity;</li><li>Leadership;</li><li>Managing for results;</li><li>Developing others;</li><li>Risk Management;</li><li>Creative thinking;</li><li>Conflict resolution;</li><li>Planning and organizing;</li><li>Decision Making; and,</li><li>Analytical thinking</li>  </ul>

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: <div>Requisition Id: 15284 <br/><br/> Department: Operations Engineering Department <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is seeking an Engineer, Projects to join our Conventional Business Unit (CBU) in Calgary, Alberta. Reporting to the Supervisor, Project Engineering (Operations), this position’s responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: <ul> <li>Development of PMO (Project Management Office) documents as required;</li><li>Liaising with and coordinating project stakeholders to manage project scope, timing, resourcing, and execution;</li><li>Working with the engineering team to coordinate the delivery of technical deliverables;</li><li>Working with the SCM (Supply Chain Management) team to coordinate procurement and contracts as necessary for successful project execution;</li><li>Working with the Pembina commissioning and Operations teams as necessary to ensure the project is appropriately commissioned and turned over;</li><li>Working with the Pembina document control team to ensure all project deliverables are appropriately numbered, compiled and available for turnover to close out the project;</li><li>Maintaining appropriate cost control and schedule to ensure successful project management and forecasting are in place;</li><li>Coordinate and manage as necessary to establish construction contracts, construction supervisors, EHS professionals and other support staff as necessary to ensure successful field execution of the project;</li><li>Coordinate as necessary with SPCC (Sherwood Park Control Center) and SCADA to coordinate commissioning activities, shutdown activities and other non-routine events as necessary for successful project execution;</li><li>Consult and coordinate as necessary with the Pembina LARE (Land, Aboriginal, Regulatory, and Environmental) group; and</li><li>Other general coordination duties as required to ensure the necessary stakeholders are considered as part of the project.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>Preferred candidate would have at least 10 years of combined construction and engineering project experience with either a P.Eng. or CET designation;</li><li>A background in the mechanical trades is a definite asset;</li><li>Demonstrated experience in project coordination between design engineering, field execution teams, commissioning teams and Code inspectors;</li><li>Previous EPC design experience is a definite asset; and</li><li>Fluent in the tools of project management including cost control, scheduling, contracts, execution planning and project closeout.</li> </ul> <strong>No agency calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. <br/><br/> Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America&apos;s energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers&apos; products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. <br/><br/> Powering Pembina&apos;s growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. <br/><br/> Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. <br/><br/> Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta&apos;s Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. <br/><br/> ></div>
