Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: <ul>    <ul>  <li> <strong>Reference Number</strong>:Construction</li> <li> <strong>Location</strong>: Calgary, Canada</li> <li> <strong> Salary</strong> : Circa 125K</li> <li> <strong>Sector</strong>: Construction</li>   </ul>    </ul>  <div> We are currently recruiting for a Project Manager for our client in Alberta to be based in Calgary working on multi unit high rise construction projects.<br/><br/>As a single point of contact to the client you will be responsible for project budgeting, cost control, cost forecasting, scheduling, and quality control and delivery for the projects. <br/><br/> This role will work in cooperation with other team members and the operations manager and Site superintendents. <br/><br/> Projects will be over $30million in value so will require experience managing projects above this figure. You must also have experience in construction projects over 15 storeys high. <br/><br/> For this position you must be based in Canada currently and have 10 years experience in multi unit high rise construction projects with a minimum of 5 years project management experience. At least 3 project completed from start to finish. <br/><br/> You will need to have experience in project managing construction projects for construction contractors and be well versed in maintaining and developing relationships with clients, developers, consultants, and trade partners.</div><br/>  <div> <div> Job Reference Number (Copy from above – required) </div></div>

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: Category : Project Management <br/> Location/City : AB - Home Based <br/>  <br/> Athenian Group is a full-service placement agency providing Professional Technical Recruitment, Staffing and Payroll services to Canadas top Consulting, Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction companies.Our focus is on providing businesses with the highest quality of worker for both contract and permanent staff positions.Our client is a leading geohazard mitigation firm operating throughout the Canada and the United States. Presently working on a number of projects in Alberta and seeking to add a few new members to their team.We are currently seekingProject Manager Soil & Slope StabilizationSUMMARY OVERVIEW:Manage soil & slope stabilization projects across Canada and potentially the United States as well. Qualified candidates must be able to maintain high levels of customer service with out of the box thinking while meeting deadlines and working in a flexible environment critical to an emergency contractor.Duties include all aspects of project creation and management including site visits, estimating, engineering, project submittals, fostering new and ongoing relationships with clients, in-house crews and engineers. All work would be conducted from the road or from candidates home office.QUALIFICATIONSCollege in Construction Management or other comparable degree requiredPrevious experience in construction project management, geotechnical construction industry, public sector transportation, or soil stabilization / foundation construction required.Construction management background and experience in project management and estimation required.Outstanding communication skills (written and oral, virtual and in-person).POSITION REQUIREMENTS & RESPONSIBILITIES:You must be a team player, willing to work outdoors and have attention to detail.Drivers License;5+ Years Project Management ExperienceIf you or someone you know is interested in this position please contact;Jason Wahl - Managing PartnerAthenian Group Ltd.403 969 9962877 596 5522205 5th Avenue SW, Suite #3300Calgary, AlbertaT2P 2V7jason@atheniangroup.cawww.atheniangroup.ca

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: ABOUT US Aecon Group Inc. is Canadas largest, publicly traded construction and infrastructure development company. Aecon and its subsidiaries provide services to private and public sector clients throughout Canada and on a selected basis internationally. Aecon Energy offers a suite of unparalleled services to some of Canadas largest energy suppliers, providing best-in-class solutions to the oil and gas, nuclear, co-generation, and renewable sectors. PURPOSE OF THE POSITION Reporting to the General Manager, the Project Manager will be responsible for the operational and financial performance of a designated region. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES • Responsible for the financial performance of a designated region. • Management of financial performance to ensure business plans targets are being met• Reports issues to Operations Manager regarding financial performance, workload status, potential legal issues and potential opportunities • Resolves project-level legal disputes and escalates issues to Manager• Puts in place a management team with clearly defined responsibilities covering all aspects of the operation. • Prepares staff development and succession plans for key positions in the department • Approves all expenditures and proposal pricing within limits of authority • Maintains personal contact with major clients and unions • Ensures that all activity in the designated regions is consistent with corporate and divisional strategic plans, business plans, policies and procedures KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS • Education to include a four-year engineering degree, technical college diploma or combination of technical training and/or related experience • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a Project Manager role • Experience in the Utility Contracting Industry • Electrical experience is considered an asset • Proven leadership, communication and negotiation skills• Ability to resolve project disputes with minimal assistance • Ability to Inspire and foster an environment of cooperation between different departments and co-workers • Availability to travel between all Utilities yards• Sound computer skills MS Excel / Lotus, MS Word and MS Project • Self-motivated with good organizational skills • Ability to work independently, accurately and under pressure • Ability to see a task from conception to implementation • Adaptable to flexible work schedule when required to meet deadlines

Title: Managing Director and Team Lead, Project Finance
Job_Description: <div><div></div>  <div>  <p>Helping Albertans achieve their dreams by turning the complex world of banking into brilliantly simple solutions. That’s ATB. Is that you? </p>  <p>Coach of the Year. Magnificent Mentor. Visionary. Motivator. Team Player. Whether at work or out in your community, you are the person that knows how to bring it all together. You’re a natural leader and your passion and excitement comes from knowing that your efforts make a significant difference in the lives of your team members, customers and the community around you. </p>  <strong>Managing Director and Team Lead, Project Finance<br> Corporate Financial Services </strong>  <p>We have an exciting opportunity for a hungry, driven, people-oriented individual who wants to lead a dynamic team of financial professionals to increase and retain business, and maximize the relationships and profitability of a portfolio of growing Exploration & Production clients.</p>  <p>Reporting to the Vice President – Corporate Financial Services (CFS), this role is responsible for managing and growing the Project Finance business across the three main lines of business: (1) advisory, (2) debt solutions to the midstream, energy, and P3 space, and (3) deposits. This role will also be responsible for managing the business planning, budgeting and goal setting for the group in conjunction with finance and senior management. They will be accountable for defining, creating, and executing on the strategic direction of the group. The MD, Project Finance will also partner closely with internal and external stakeholders to build impactful relationships to enhance CFS’s market presence and contribute to our customer obsession. </p>  <p>This leadership position will assist in the origination and meet annual volume and direct contribution objectives through strategic efforts internally and externally. The successful candidate will demonstrate exceptional leadership abilities to support the team and existing clients, while attracting new clients to ATB. The primary focus of this is role is to develop new opportunities and to enhance ATB’s presence and profile in the Project Finance space by participating in a wide-range of business and community activities. </p>  <p>We are looking for a business savvy, fearless, yet accurate and calculated leader with a reputation for execution, excellence and exceptional relationship-building skills. A courageous problem solver - we like to hire people who can think through problems and develop solutions that make sense for the business, for our team members and for our leaders. ATB is an organization that is focused on results and we are looking for someone who continuously finds ways to get things done, regardless of circumstance. We look for leaders who inspire those around them to achieve exceptional outcomes. ATB has always been more than a bank and we are never happy with the status quo. We are looking for someone who has aspirations to reimagine existing processes and be relentlessly innovative. Someone who genuinely believes that financial markets can have a transformational impact on our clients’ businesses, and has an understanding of the mechanics behind it.</p>  <p><strong>Specific Accountabilities:</strong></p>  <ul><li>Guide the Project Finance team in expanding the business offerings into the PF advisory services space. The successful candidate must be able to position themselves and the team for success in the marketplace in order to continue to enhance the business </li> <li>Guide and assist the team in maintaining a constant pipeline of business consisting of new prospects, deals in various stages of negotiations, and business that will close within a short timeframe</li> <li>Complete the budget and business planning for the group, that will be used by senior management and finance for goal setting and tracking financial performance</li> <li>Meet or exceed goals and targets related to growth or maintenance of the teams assigned portfolio, including profitability goals and targets and or other agreed objectives</li> <li>Proactively analyze client files of existing relationships for opportunities to maximize the relationship by understanding the client’s needs and providing solutions through ATB and CFS lines of business </li> <li>Analyze and negotiate customer and new prospect deals to ensure profitability of the relationship with acceptable credit risk</li> <li>Ensure the team adheres to credit decisions / recommendations that are in accordance with sound credit granting principles and are in accordance with policy and procedures</li> <li>Establish and enhance ATB's presence and profile in the market by participating in business and community activities</li> <li>Build and maintain effective relationships with counterparts at other Financial Institutions to facilitate syndicated or other shared lending solutions</li> <li>Lead, coach and mentor Directors and Portfolio Managers to ensure customer service expectations and credit quality are maintained </li> <li>Connect and collaborate with the many business partners in ATB, while acting as a role model for ATB Leadership Attributes and CFS Values</li> </ul>  </div>  </div>  <div>  <div>    Job Requirements    </div>  <div>  <p><strong>Competencies/Skill-Sets Required:</strong></p>  <ul><li>10+ years Commercial/Corporate lending experience</li> <li>5+ years of experience in corporate finance, structured finance, project finance or large corporate credit</li> <li>Undergraduate degree in relevant discipline (i.e. economics, accounting, engineering, finance, etc.). MBA, CA, CFA would be considered an asset</li> <li>Experience in the Capital Market space would be considered an asset</li> <li>Strong personal computer skills, preference to experience with Microsoft & Google applications</li> <li>Proven Leadership skills, appreciation for how the organization works together and willingness to foster our working relationship with all parts and people of ATB Financial</li> <li>Strong knowledge of commercial lending policies and products</li> <li>Proven ability to provide creative solutions</li> <li>Demonstration of passion and hunger for achieving results with a proven ability to meet growth targets</li> <li>Exceptional business development and relationship building skills</li> <li>Strong awareness of capital market activities, products and services and ability to identify opportunities for referral to ATB/CFS relationships including AltaCorp Capital Inc.</li> <li>Excellent communication and presentation skills</li> <li>Ability to work flexible hours including weekends and evenings</li> </ul><p><br> So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. As an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans. Sound like a team you want to be a part of?</p>  <p><strong>Advancement. Fun. Rewards… We get it.<br> To learn more visit atb.com.</strong></p>  <p>To read our employer reviews visit our Glassdoor page.</p>  <p>Online applications are preferred. ATB Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the high number of resumes we receive, only short-listed candidates will be contacted.</p>  <p>If you're application is shortlisted, we might ask you to participate in a digital interview.</p>  <p>Please click the following link for information on communities where ATB thrives.</p>  <p>#LI-PRIO</p>  </div>  </div><br>Apply

Title: Engineering Manager
Job_Description: Sargent & Lundy is a worldwide leader in professional services for the electric power industry. Our distinctive capabilities provide domestic and international clients and partners with a thoroughly reliable source of comprehensive expertise. We continuously strive to build dynamic teams to support our future growth. We provide opportunity, challenge and competitive compensation within a positive work environment that motivates employees to build careers within our company. <br/><br/> Rapid expansion of our business in Canada has created an opportunity for an engineering manager to get in on the ground floor of an opportunity to open and grow an office in Calgary. The position would include marketing, business development, and coordination of work with our corporate office. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Project Director, this role will be primarily accountable for project development and growing the office. You would be responsible for integrating the new office and staff members with the home office. This includes design and efficiency of business processes and procedures. Mentoring and training new employees. <br/><br/> Other duties include: Interfacing with existing company resources to increase business development opportunities within Alberta; managing external relationships with engineering consultants and contractors, as well as joint venture relationships and executing project work plans. <br/><br/> * Must possess a Bachelor of Science in an Engineering discipline. <br/><br/> * 15+ years of experience in the design of engineering systems for non-commercial, heavy industrial plants (power preferred), with a focus on integrated, detailed system design for new plants, modifications, or replacements. Experience must include the selection of equipment, control philosophy and the preparation of calculations and specifications. <br/><br/> * Extensive experience managing large engineering projects including combined cycle and co-generation <br/><br/> * Experience leading business development efforts to capture work. <br/><br/> * Extensive knowledge and applied experience in all aspects of project engineering & design. <br/><br/> * Experience serving as firm/client liaison in a support or lead engineering role. <br/><br/> * Strong leadership skills and the ability to create and motivate staff. <br/><br/> * Experience in reviewing design drawings. <br/><br/> * Excellent written and verbal communication skills. <br/><br/> * Extensive work experience in Alberta is essential. <br/><br/> * P-eng License preferred. <br/><br/> * Highly preferred but not required is experience in construction and start-up. <br/><br/> #LI-LISL INDEEDSL

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: The Calgary office of Smith and Andersen is currently seeking an Electrical Project Manager. You’re all about prioritization. While everyone else is focused on their individual tasks, you’ve got an eye on the larger goals, and have a detailed road map for how to meet those goals. When others work with you, they know that deadlines won’t slip and details won’t get missed. As a natural leader, you’re happiest when everyone is moving in the same direction, and you never hesitate to step up and get others the answers they need. You have clear communication skills, and can effectively wield those skills to make sure clients, consultants, and contractors are kept in the loop. You can easily manage multiple tasks without getting frazzled, and are eager to take on some of the biggest and most exciting projects in the country. <br/><br/> Does this sound like you? <strong>If so, here are some of the more detailed responsibilities you can expect in this position:</strong> <ul> <li>Prepares, or assists Principal-in-charge with, the development of all system engineering concepts (e.g. design brief) and concept report. Reviews and manages the design in terms of construction budgets.</li> <li>Performs, or arranges for, reviews of existing installation and interprets/manages the impact on the project.</li> <li>Prepares all calculations and selects all equipment. May assign tasks to designer and CAD Technician where appropriate.</li> <li>Fully understands Codes and Standards relevant for the project and is able to communicate all requirements to the internal project team, external project team, owner, and Authorities Having Jurisdiction.</li> <li>Ensures proper coordination of document with the internal and external project team (architect, interior designer, and other disciplines).</li> <li>Fully understands (construction) project procurement methodologies and is able to recommend or apply such method for the project</li> <li>Responsible for reviewing all deliverables for the project whether reports, calculations, drawings, or/and specifications. Reviews for completeness and accuracy at various stages of development and as defined by internal total quality management.</li> <li>Promotes and enforces company standards relating to project administration, documentation and processes such as total quality management.</li> <li>Where requested by the Principal-in-charge or Associate Principal act as contract administrator for designated projects, ensuring timely completion of all contract administration activities for project.</li> <li>Ensures that shop drawing review process takes place within project timelines.</li> <li>Coordinates with the contract administration team regarding drawing reviews, proper set up of contract administration process and site activities.</li> <li>Prepares all change notices or reviews change notices issued by contract administration team.</li> <li>Responsible for ensuring tasks are completed both accurately and with the assigned hours/fee.</li> <li>Responds to both technical and financial queries related to the project.</li> <li>Keeps the Principal-in-charge or Associate Principal advised of all changes in scope of work and prepares amendments to the contract (e.g. Request of Additional fee-RAF) for review and submission to client.</li> <li>Supports the process of accounts receivable.</li> <li>Responsible for ensuring the internal project team discipline coordination processes are complete.</li> <li>Prepares and continually monitors a schedule of tasks required to complete the project including hours to perform tasks and critical data required for performance.</li> <li>Liaises with external consultants, vendors as required to ensure smooth project delivery.</li> <li>Organizes and attends meetings including client meetings.</li> <li>Capable to deliver presentations to client/owner.</li> </ul> A few more <strong>qualifications which will help you with these responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Possess 3 or more years of project engineering experience in the field of electrical building services</li> <li>A senior C.E.T. with equivalent experience and abilities will also be considered</li> <li>Demonstrate a strong leadership qualities and ability to work independently</li> <li>Demonstrate the ability to work in a complex environment, dealing with multiple projects and clients</li> <li>Possess sound communications skills as demonstrated through client and staff relations</li> <li>Demonstrate experience working with other consultants and contractors, and coordination of major projects</li> <li>Knowledgeable about the provincial building code, electrical code, CSA, ULC, IEEE, IES and NFPA standards</li> <li>Have excellent problem solving and decision-making skills</li> <li>LEED certification / Experience implementing sustainable design (LEED projects) is an asset</li> <li>Strong knowledge of engineering concepts, methods and standards.</li> <li>Demonstrates initiative and practical problem solving.</li> </ul> To apply for this position, please email your resume and cover letter to careers@smithandandersen.com. Please place the job title and office location in the subject line of the email. <br/><br/> Appropriate accommodations will be provided to candidates upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process. Successful applicants will be advised of Smith + Andersen’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended. <br/><br/> Only qualified candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> <em>Smith + Andersen is a trusted Canadian consulting engineering firm with offices in Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton, Winnipeg, London, Toronto, Ottawa, and Halifax. Founded in 1965, our firm has organically grown from an established reputation as trusted mechanical and electrical consultants, reaching new levels of engineering and design excellence in the communications, security, and audiovisual fields, and providing enhanced services such as lighting, building automation systems, and intelligent integrated systems design. Thanks to our client-focused approach, our team is consistently called upon to apply efficient, sustainable, and reliable design and engineering solutions on the most exciting projects across Canada. From fully-integrated hospitals and welcoming schools, to healthy workplaces and secure transit stations, our team has established lasting relationships with public and private sector clients across the country. Smith + Andersen is an Equal Opportunity Employer.</em>

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: very power project is a community project—whether it’s a gas plant conversion, a transmission line corridor, or a wind development. Our goal is to improve industrial, business, and local communities through our project work. We see beyond the project at hand to where our work fits in the big picture. Join a team that does more than generate and deliver electricity through its work; join a team that powers growth and advances communities. <br/> As a result of new and expanding business opportunities, Stantecs Power group is currently seeking a Project Manager in our Lethbridge or Calgary Office. <br/> Your Duties <br/> Reporting to the Power Practice Leader in Renewables, the successful candidate will apply a diversified knowledge of engineering principles and practices as applied to renewable energy engineering, design, and construction in the wind and solar industry. Responsibilities include but are not limited to <br/> Lead assigned projects from inception to completion. <br/> Prepare and manage equipment specifications; analyze bids, project analysis, budgets, schedules, including work breakdown structure (WBS), worRecruiter planning and resource allocations <br/> Negotiate project scope and key performance indicators with clients. <br/> Build long term business relationships with the client and client’s management. <br/> Lead scoping studies and feasibility studies. <br/> Plan, organize and manage the day to day activities of the project by planning the project, delegation of responsibilities and establish the quality management program. <br/> Reporting the progress of the project to the client. <br/> Act as a resource and mentor to other engineering staff. <br/> Your Capabilities and Credentials <br/> Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field from an accredited post-secondary institution, or will consider relevant education and work experience in the power sector. <br/> Minimum of 5 years of Project Management experience in a consulting environment. <br/> Experience in some or all of the following areas would be considered an asset Wind and solar project site selection and permitting, general arrangement and layout, equipment selection and specification, component and material assemblies, one and single-line diagrams, access roadway layout, cabling and associated conduit systems. <br/> Project Management Professional (PMP) certification would be an asset but is not mandatory. <br/> Demonstrated ability to communicate, collaborate and interact with clients and other project team members. <br/> Strong understanding and experienced in planning/scheduling techniques and cost and risk management. <br/> Proficient in the use of computer software used for the planning, analysis, and design of renewable energy projects. <br/> Proficient in the use of typical office computer software such as WORD, EXCEL, PROJECT, ADOBE ACROBAT . <br/> Demonstrated technical and report writing skills.

Title: Senior Manager Security & Life Safety
Job_Description: <p><b>Build your future with Cadillac Fairview!</b></p><p>At Cadillac Fairview, we are so much more than our properties. We are building leaders at all levels. We offer the challenge of interesting work, a great organizational culture, the opportunity to collaborate with the best in the business, and support for your growth and development. We reward values-based behavior and superior results with a competitive rewards package that includes best-in-class benefits and pension. Cadillac Fairview is where you can make a difference, and where it all comes together. </p><p> </p><p><b>Role Summary:</b></p><p>The Senior Manager, Security & Life Safety is responsible for leadership and management of the functional, technical and applied security and life safety program at properties that have a high public profile, or are a complex mixed-use property of both office and retail offerings, or are situated as challenging and high-volume urban properties. The Senior Manager of Security and Life Safety guides the development and execution of strategic property security and life safety initiatives, and ensures the property security and life safety team executes on the senior manager’s vision and that of National Security Operations. Reporting to the General Manager with a supplementary reporting line to National Security Operations, this position is ultimately responsible for the effective and efficient execution of all operational aspects of the Security and Life Safety Department. The Senior Manager for Security and Life Safety will coordinate a variety of activities that align corporately from National Security Operations, where these activities are of strategic importance to the corporation in the disciplines of physical and cyber security, and with regard to occupational health and fire safety. Where required, the position will support the broader corporate security framework by participating and having responsibility over components of key corporate initiatives such as Brand Alignment, Counter-terrorism, Cyber Security, and Health & Safety. A significant responsibility of this role is the implementation, upkeep and testing of emergency response plans to ensure the property is adequately prepared to deal with a wide range of potential risk events.<b> </b></p><p> </p><p><b>You will:</b></p><ul><li>Provide subject matter expertise on security and life safety operations and technologies</li><li>Holds the key responsibilities and accountabilities at the property for the complex of regulatory and practical elements of the occupational health & safety, fire safety, and general life safety requirements.</li><li>The position is responsible for bringing together and leading across the variety of functional roles at the property, including Security, Operations, Marketing and otherwise, where the collective effort is required to fulfill the regulatory requirements for health and safety, fire systems and general life safety</li><li>With respect to corporate governance requirements on health & safety, fire safety and life safety compliance, this position reports performance to the National Security Operations group for quarterly reporting to the corporate Board of Directors</li><li>Responsible for collecting and reporting performance data to National Security Operations in support of corporate business objectives</li><li>The established authority at the property on issues relating to security and life safety to both internal stakeholders and clients, including but not limited to: threat and risk assessments; security and life safety business practices and business models; business case proposals and recommendations; financial accountability, and performance standards</li><li>Stimulates continual improvement practices (long and short-term outlooks) in operational practices and innovation around the use of technology, catering to a combination of high risk and sophisticated tenant requirements in complex retail and office environments</li><li>Reviews and approves budgets relating to the annual departmental expenditures, such as on security contracts, salaries, and technology (capital) before final sign-off by General Managers, VPs Operations, or higher</li><li>Ensures annual expenditures align with company security operating strategies, business models and technology standards and principles prior to review and approval of security technology business cases for final sign-off by the General Manager</li><li>The position is responsible to remain abreast of emerging societal and industry trends and ensure the property security and life safety program is equipped to address evolving security risks and life safety needs. From a planning perspective, the Senior Manager, Security & Life Safety will focus attention on maintaining company standards and industry best practices in the areas of Emergency Management, Operating Procedures, Capital and Operational Budgeting and other relevant Security and Life Safety Department functions</li><li>The Senior Manager, Security & Life Safety will establish and maintain key contacts with internal, tenant, public authority, supplier, and security industry stakeholders, including local police, fire and emergency medical services representatives</li><li>Develop and implement policies and procedures relating to security operations, security guard behaviors and other matters critical to the safe and secure management of the property</li><li>Project leadership and scope-approval authority of security and life safety projects, including leadership and management of capital project efforts against business plan timelines, expenditures, financial and ethical controls</li><li>At a property level, develop measures and oversee the delivery of efficiency and effectiveness in the design, purchasing, and implementation of security technologies, by ensuring through final business case approval that all installations comply with national standards, deliver on strategic business objectives, and are both resilient and reliable</li><li>Prepare projections, and costs for the property relating to physical security and security technology for annual operational expenditures and 10-year capital plans</li><li>Ongoing oversight to ensure all aspects of the security and life safety management program are assessed and updated regularly to remain current with Cadillac Fairview standards and industry best practice, and to continually achieve operational and fiscal efficiency</li><li>Oversee and execute the implementation of a security strategy via regular and ongoing liaison with National Security Operations and property management to ensure a consistent level of service delivery and financial effectiveness</li><li>As part of a commitment to continual improvement, conduct reviews of internal property business processes in areas such as security operating practices e.g. use of force, emergency management, fire safety systems and procedures, health and safety and business continuity, and make broadly applicable policy and procedural changes to close evident gaps, or where the incumbent leads opportunities for improvement in effectiveness or in terms of achieving longer range national objectives relating to security and life safety, as set out by the Director of National Security Operations</li><li>Is an effective leader behind the CF brand owing to the impact of the property’s role and image within the community </li></ul><p> </p><p><b>You have:</b></p><ul><li>Community college diploma in a related discipline of Security and Life Safety, Risk Management or Criminology (or equivalent business management qualification)</li><li>Four-year undergraduate or college degree or post-graduate studies up to and including Master’s Degree a definite asset</li><li>A minimum of 7 years working in a commercial real estate security and life safety environment, or equivalent – or equivalent work experience</li><li>A minimum of 5 years of security and life safety management experience, ideally at a series of properties of increasingly complex scope – or equivalent work experience</li><li>Professional security industry accreditation, including (CPP, ASP, PSP </li><li>Exceptional written and verbal communication skills a pre-requisite</li><li>Ability to inter-relate with members of corporate and tenant senior management both internally and externally</li><li>Excellent public speaking and presentation skills in group settings</li><li>Exceptional problem solving, analytical and decision making skills required</li><li>Strong organizational, prioritization and time management skills</li><li>Ability to delegate and follow up effectively</li><li>Tact and diplomacy in dealings at all levels of the organization</li><li>Team player</li><li>Flexible and adaptable in dealing with a diversity of situations and people</li><li>Exceptional reporting and business proposal writing skills</li><li>Ability to work in a challenging, fast-paced, multi-tasked environment</li></ul><p> </p><p>Are you up for the challenge? At CF, we believe our people are core to our success. Join our award-winning team, where your talent and commitment to excellence are welcomed, valued and respected!</p><p> </p><p><em>Accommodation for applicants with disabilities during the recruitment, assessment, and/or selection process is available.</em></p>

Title: Project Manager
Job_Description: FirstOnSite is looking for an experienced Project Manager to be part of our <br/> growing team in Calgary! <br/><br/> The Project Manager is responsible for the success of assigned projects, in <br/> conjunction with the property owner, adjuster, or insurance company. The Project <br/> Manager ensures that the project is completed on time and to the required <br/> quality standard within agreed specifications. The focus of the PM role is to <br/> scope projects and estimate the work required to restore properties to their <br/> pre-disaster state. <br/><br/> <strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Interacts with clients to develop applicable solutions that will respond to <br/> their situation and needs. <br/><br/> Prepares accurate quotations through job costing and estimation, ensuring <br/> target margins are met. <br/><br/> Manages all aspects of water claims i.e. mitigation, equipment selection, <br/> equipment staging, psychometrics and reports. <br/><br/> Ensures that Emergency and Rebuild timelines are met and in alignment with <br/> policy and guidelines. <br/><br/> Participates in growing the best quality team to achieve the objectives of <br/> our corporate strategic plan. <br/><br/> Ensures project requirements are being fulfilled and deadlines and <br/> milestones are achieved. <br/><br/> Inspects progress and work quality throughout the project. <br/><br/> Develops and maintains strong relationships and acts as a prime liaison with <br/> policy holders, adjustors and insurance providers. <br/><br/> Resolves disputes and complaints, where possible. <br/><br/> Generates new leads through relationships with adjusters, property managers, <br/> and other key players. <br/><br/> <strong>Factors for Success:</strong> <br/><br/> Detailed understanding of reconstruction practices for property that has <br/> suffered water, wind, mould, fire and vandalism damages <br/><br/> Knowledge of building construction & codes <br/><br/> Knowledge of the laws and ordinances regulating building construction <br/><br/> Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and oral <br/><br/> Proficiency in MS Office Skills (Excel, Word and Outlook) <br/><br/> Experience with Xactimate <br/><br/> Basic accounting competency with an understanding of invoicing, billing <br/> procedures <br/><br/> Experience planning and monitoring budgets <br/><br/> FirstOnSite Restoration is the largest independent disaster restoration company <br/> in Canada. We provide unsurpassed emergency response, restoration and <br/> reconstruction services to the insurance industry, residential, commercial and <br/> industrial customers. With coast-to-coast coverage and 24/7 emergency service, <br/> we offer a wide range of services that remediate conditions caused by fires, <br/> floods, winds, mould, environmental hazards, accidents and other casualties at <br/> any type of facility. <br/><br/> Why choose to be part of the FirstOnSite team? <br/><br/> Exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental and vision. <br/><br/> Employee Assistance Program <br/><br/> Educational assistance, professional development, and internal growth <br/> opportunities <br/><br/> Opportunity for National career movement <br/><br/> Variable pay/Incentive plan opportunities <br/><br/> Access to a company vehicle <br/><br/> Option to travel and assist with large coast to coast projects <br/><br/> Interested candidates whose resume and cover letter best demonstrate how they <br/> meet the qualifications of the position will be contacted for an interview. <br/> Candidates must be able to provide a clear criminal background check to be <br/> eligible for hire.

Title: Strategy & Analytics Manager
Job_Description: <div><div>Helping Albertans achieve their dreams by turning the complex world of banking into brilliantly simple solutions. That’s ATB. Is that you? <br/><br/> Coach of the Year. Magnificent Mentor. Visionary. Motivator. Team Player. Whether at work or out in your community, you are the person that knows how to bring it all together. You’re a natural leader and your passion and excitement comes from knowing that your efforts make a significant difference in the lives of your team members, customers and the community around you.<br/><br/><strong>Strategy & Analytics Manager</strong><br/><br/>You’ve got a strong internal drive, an entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for making a difference through your work. You describe yourself as someone who loves to live outside your comfort zone, a trailblazer who constantly seeks new ways to learn and grow. You are passionate about reporting and analytics, and thrive on unearthing its story and transforming it into real business solutions. <br/><br/> If that sounds like you, the Strategy & Analytics Manager role in the ATB Corporate Financial Services (CFS) team is THE place to work for you.  <br/><br/> CFS brings industry specific banking solutions to our clients through our relationship approach. Over the years CFS has been a catalyst for growth and diversification in the province, through our support of Alberta-based entrepreneurs and business professionals. Although the complexity of these businesses has grown, our clients are all entrepreneurs at heart and by being the bank of entrepreneurs we will ensure we have the expertise and solutions needed to help clients and organizations drive growth and success in this province. <br/><br/> <strong>This position is available as a one year burst / contract opportunity!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>THE OPPORTUNITY:</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Director of Strategy and Analytics, the Strategy & Analytics Manager will be required to partner with internal stakeholders and external sources to gain knowledge and insights on our business and industry. The successful candidate for this role will use quantitative and qualitative skills to translate insights into effective strategies that will help to optimize business performance and measure outcomes. This position will collaborate and build strong relationships with CFS leaders and key internal stakeholders across ATB to provide meaningful insights and solutions for our business. <br/><br/> <strong>YOUR IMPACT:</strong> <ul> <li>Work with the CFS business to identify opportunities, either current or future state, and explore how to best implement solutions through data, strategic planning, or working with business partners</li> <li>Support senior leadership in CFS to execute on strategic goals aligned to ATB’s overall direction</li> <li>Partner with CFS leaders to gain insight into their lines of business to identify key performance metrics and industry comparisons</li> <li>Work collaboratively with our Transformation teams to bridge the gap between business & technical resources</li> <li>Perform industry analysis to identify competitive positioning, industry trends, benchmarking, & best practices</li> <li>Identify enterprise and strategic alignment on business and technical initiatives by conducting enterprise analysis, which may include; feasibility assessments, needs assessments, gap analyses and solution assessments</li> <li>Assess corporate impacts of changes and recommend reporting strategies</li> <li>Consult with business partners and determine how people, data, processes, and information technology can best improve performance  <ul> <li>Work collaboratively to identify project timelines, expectations, and support teams through any change management as needed</li> </ul>  </li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div><strong>As the ideal candidate you possess the following:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>ATTRIBUTES FOR SUCCESS:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Connector:</strong> You build relationships naturally, and bring people of mutual interest together easily</li> <li><strong>Translator:</strong> You have an uncanny capacity to convert large volumes of information, complex or ambiguous, into readily-understood communication</li> <li><strong>Hungry:</strong> You combine the intrinsic motivation and drive to excel with the ability and determination to achieve success</li> <li><strong>Collaborator: </strong> You are a strong partner</li> <li><strong>Customer Service Passion: </strong> You have an unrelenting desire for exceptional service by going beyond expectations</li> <li><strong>Business Judgment:</strong> You are keenly aware of business issues, processes and outcomes that could affect ATB & the client</li> </ul> <strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or diploma with Commerce, IT, Finance or Business Administration, a CFA, CPA or MBA would be considered an asset</li> <li>5+ years of experience in Treasury, Finance, Data Analysis or equivalent, previous experience within the banking industry would be considered an asset </li> <li>Advanced and broad knowledge of business issues, processes, and strategic planning, as well as, IT resources and enabling technologies</li> <li>Excellent analytical skills including the ability to build financial models </li> <li>Demonstrated capacity to build reciprocal and value-added relationships with internal stakeholders</li> <li>A natural ability to influence and negotiate through a focused lens on listening and searching for comparable solutions</li> <li>Strong interpersonal skills with a keen aptitude for communicating effectively through verbal and written communication</li> </ul> As a team member with the Corporate Financial Services (CFS) group at ATB, you can expect: <ul> <li>Challenging work that serves as a stepping stone or building block for a fulfilling career in financial services</li> <li>The opportunity to work in a results oriented work environment – giving you the autonomy to be where you want to be, when you need to be</li> <li>The ability to grow your career without ever having to leave ATB</li> <li>The capacity to work with in house experts who understand the in’s and out’s of Alberta and are all dedicated to the success of the province</li> <li>Bragging rights! Knowing you work for an employer who is a true partner to Alberta</li> </ul> So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. As an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans. Sound like a team you want to be a part of? <br/><br/> <strong>Advancement. Fun. Rewards… We get it. <br/> To learn more visit atb.com.</strong> <br/><br/> To read our employer reviews visit our Glassdoor page. <br/><br/> Online applications are preferred. ATB Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the high number of resumes we receive, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> Special conditions: Please note that this temporary position will expire on May 31, 2019. <br/><br/> If you're application is shortlisted, we might ask you to participate in a digital interview. <br/><br/> Please click the following link for information on communities where ATB thrives. <br/><br/> #LI-DNP <br/><br/>  </div>  </div>  <br/>Apply

Title: Assistant Project Manager
Job_Description: <strong>Company Overview</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Do you want to work with one of Canada’s top oil and gas companies represented by an award-winning staffing agency? Look no further and join the Spirit circle today!</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> Our large oil and gas company in Fort McMurray, AB is currently recruiting 6 Assistant Project Managers for a 5 month contract. This role will support Execution PM and Area PM personnel in managing workload. <br/><br/> This is a Fort McMurray based position with a 5x2 8hr work schedule (with the exception of the 1 week per month when the company has a ADO, contractors may work 4x3 10hr week. <br/><br/> <strong>This position is located in Fort McMurray, AB and local candidates are preferred. Non-local candidates will be</strong> <strong>considered,</strong><strong> but must be willing to secure their own accommodations, as there is no camp, LOA, or accommodation allowance provided.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong>  <ul> <li>Assistance project manager will be assigned to work with Project Managers or Area Project Manager to assist in any or all aspects of project work and team leadership.</li> <li>Candidates must be self-starters, able to work independently, seek out others and information to complete actions.</li> <li>Candidates must be able to coordinate and facilitate meetings, prepare and present to superiors, take actions and independently seek out resolutions.</li> <li>Clear and active communication is necessary.</li> <li> This is a plant environment where PM’s work directly with operations and construction personnel regularly.</li> <li>Candidates are to b 0-5 years or experience.</li> </ul> <strong> Qualifications and Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>Engineering in Training or Professional Engineer of Alberta, P.Eng (mandatory)</li> <li>Construction, Project Management or Project Engineering or Engineering in the Alberta Oilsands (asset but not necessary)</li> <li>Successfully pass a criminal background check</li> <li>This position is classified as safety sensitive, therefore you must also be able to pass a drug & alcohol test</li> <li>Possession of or eligible to obtain a passport</li> <li>Valid OSSA BSO or OSSA Orientation and CSTS</li> </ul> <strong>**We thank all applicants for applying, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted directly**</strong>

Title: Manager, Planning and Projects
Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 22583 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the director, central enablement, you will be responsible for the strategic development and evaluation, as well as the selection and process requirements of our field logistics initiatives. You will manage the executive of step change initiatives for field logistics to drive business goals and objectives. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Support field logistics leaders to develop strategic plans, advise and measure progress of the plans </li><li>Managing the execution of step change initiatives for field logistics to drive business goals and objectives</li><li>Developing project and change management capabilities within the field logistics organization</li><li>Support the development of our budget, business plan, key performance indicators (KPIs) and monthly stewardship reports</li><li>Oversee development and maintenance of operational reporting capabilities</li><li>Support and provide guidance as it relates to project management accountabilities and responsibilities</li><li>Develop and lead effective change management techniques, plans and related deliverables </li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education: <ul> <li>Ten or more years of experience in project management, with a focus on continuous improvement of projects, and/or operations</li><li>Integrated project delivery, business process improvement and business transformation experience preferred</li><li>Three or more years of experience leading a team</li><li>Experience in the oil and gas industry is preferred</li><li>Post-secondary degree is required</li><li>Project or Change management certification is considered an asset</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge: <ul> <li>Good knowledge of project and program management methodologies and processes</li><li>In-depth understanding of communications and strategic framework and operating model development</li><li>Capable of managing complex budgets; budget development, cost control and financial analysis</li><li>You are someone that fosters a continuous improvement mindset within the team</li><li>You have demonstrated leadership experience, including consultative leadership to cross functional teams at all levels within the organization</li> </ul> <strong>Working Conditions</strong> <ul> <li>Some travel may be required, primarily to the Wood Buffalo region</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Suncor is committed to accessibility and accommodations will be provided to applicants upon request. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. <br/><br/> Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong> <br/><br/> JOB CATEGORY: Business Professionals

Title: Executive Project Manager
Job_Description: With 2016 revenues of approximately $10.9 billion, Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. (Jacobs) is one of the largest publicly traded (NYSE: JEC) and diverse providers of professional technical services in the world. Founded in 1947, the company now has nearly 54,000 employees that help us prosper in diverse industries by holding true to our values and culture. Headquartered in Dallas, Texas, our global network spans more than 230 offices in countries across North America, South America, Europe, the Middle East, Australia, Africa and Asia. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/><br/> This position performs all project management responsibilities for large scale Refining and Chemicals projects, including originating, start-up and management of large scale projects in the Engineering Construction industry valued at $500 million plus. The individual is responsible for planning, directing, supervising and controlling all technical, fiscal and administrative functions of contractual activities. An Executive Project Manager at this level will supervise one or more lower level Project Managers or the entire project staff. <br/><br/> <ul> <li>Develop execution strategy/plans and manage the strategic and tactical aspects of large EPC/CM complex projects/programs which are of company-wide interest and may involve traveling, relocation or operating from a satellite office</li><li>Responsible for the total execution and management of medium size Engineering, Procurement and Construction process industry projects including administration of the project, schedule and budgetary performance, quality, safety and technical detail.</li><li>Candidate will be placed in the position of presenting themselves and company to the client in a professional manner.</li><li>Candidate will be responsible for presentations prior to contract award, contract negotiations and ongoing project meetings/problem resolution sessions.</li><li>Will handle the full performance of every phase of a major project or a group of smaller projects.</li><li>Be the Safety Leader for the project and promote Jacobs � Beyond Zero� culture</li><li>Utilize your skills and expertise to properly establish the project foundation based on a comprehensive understanding of the client's scope of work, budget, schedule and contractual terms and conditions</li><li>Schedule and manage resources to attain cost and schedule certainty and the major project/program objectives</li><li>Make responsible, strategic decisions on matters in the implementation of major projects and/or programs subject to company objectives, policy and financial controls.</li><li>Apply your leadership skills to manage client and internal change; accountable to client and Jacobs for successful control and project outcome</li><li>As a Leader, clearly communicate project status in terms of cost, schedule, scope and quality, in a manner consistent with client requirements</li><li>As the Jacobs focal point for the project, develop and maintain positive relationships with client personnel at all levels of management, including support and participation in presentations to client's executive management team</li><li>Encourage and implement successful work share execution for all engineering work</li><li>Drive operational excellence by utilizing Calgary work instruction and Jacobs' standard operating procedures</li><li>In a collaborative manner develop and expand our client portfolio, including support for Business Development efforts</li><li>Support continuous improvement for project management/execution systems, work processes and procedures</li><li>Assist in the training of project management staff</li><li>Proactively participate in project reviews and audits</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Qualified candidates must have previous experience on well-known projects and/or with well-known organizations within engineering and construction, including Chemicals or Hydrocarbon Projects. Candidates must have the following:</strong></div><ul><li>A minimum of 20 years of project management experience, with 5 years specific to field experience and EPC/CM execution required</li><li>BS or MS degree, significant technical expertise, and demonstrated record of leading project teams to success as a Project Manager is required</li><li>Possess an expert level of competency in project management and the ability to identify/avoid potential problems or mitigate as they occur is required</li><li>Experience should include managing $500 Million TIC Projects in the Oil and Gas industry preferred</li><li>Strong communication and leadership skills with detailed familiarity with project management tools, work share and effective leadership skills is preferred</li> </ul> At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.

Title: Project Manager – Building Projects
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/>   <div> <div><strong>05/02/2018</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>001753</strong></div> <br/><strong>Pomerleau</strong> is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder. <br/><br/> Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do. <br/><br/> <strong>The Opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> Jump in and imagine the possibilities as a Project Manager with Pomerleau. Using your proven experience and leadership capabilities, you will take on a lead role in project management and delivery. With your solution focused and team oriented attitude, you will lead a collaborative team of construction professionals who match your drive for excellence. Using your client centric approach and proven technical expertise, you embrace the role of being a trusted leader for our team and steadfast advisor for our clients to successfully execute every exciting and challenging project you take on. <br/><br/> Success is in the details and the core of what you do. As a Project Manager, you are a scheduling guru keeping project goals, execution, people and communication always top of mind. As a key member of our team, we will <strong>rethink construction together</strong>, <strong>from idea to completion</strong>. <strong>Everywhere</strong>. <strong>All the time</strong>. <strong>Period</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>What YOU Will Do</strong>  <ul> <li>Grow and maintain strong relationships with team members, trade partners, consultants and clients to achieve the project goals and vision.</li> <li>Develop and drive the construction schedule in conjunction with the project team ensuring that completion dates and milestones are met.</li> <li>Put your problem-solving skills to work and recommend innovative methods that will increase effectiveness and efficiency to ensure project excellence and productivity.</li> <li>Use your proactive approach to ensure compliance with our first-class Quality Program.</li> <li>Utilize your experience in trade partner selection and coordination of their activities.</li> <li>Apply your financial management experience to plan, manage and respect project budgets, costs and associated purchasing.</li> <li>Share your knowledge and be a role model through mentorship opportunities with project team members.</li> <li>Keep the lines of communication open regarding project status and updates.</li> <li>Be an expert in risk management to ensure any associated project risk is minimized.</li> <li>Take pride in compiling and completing companywide project reports.</li> <li>Demonstrate leadership in Health, Safety and Environmental Protection on the project. Effectively apply the requirements of the project specific safety standards to promote Pomerleau’s HS&E standards, applicable OH&S acts, regulations and codes with all employees and trade partners on the project.</li> <li>Celebrate project success and completion and be a key member of the project wrap-up process.</li> </ul> <strong>What YOU Will Bring</strong>  <ul> <li>5-7 years’ experience in the ICI construction industry.</li> <li>University Degree/Technology Diploma in Engineering, or a combination of education and industry experience.</li> <li>A proven track record of project success and team collaboration.</li> <li>Outstanding leadership and organizational skills with the ability to effectively influence others and successfully resolve a variety of client, project and technical issues to bring the project to successful completion.</li> <li>Strong knowledge of construction and project methodologies, financial management, as well as building codes and associated legislation.</li> <li>Role model status for health and safety as well as quality.</li> <li>A passion to develop, maintain and execute the project schedule.</li> <li>Good computer skills and previous experience with scheduling software.</li> </ul> <strong>WHY JOIN POMERLEAU`S TEAM? :</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary</li> <li>4 weeks’ vacation</li> <li>Group insurance (health spending account)</li> <li>Group RRSP</li> <li>Monthly public transit pass paid by employer</li> <li>Fitness center membership: 50% reimbursed by employer</li> <li>Employee assistance program</li> <li>Ongoing training offered throughout the year</li> <li>Young, dynamic environment</li> <li>Excellent career opportunities</li> <li>Summer hours</li> </ul> <strong>PARTICULARITY:</strong>  <ul> <li>The retained candidate will be subject to an administrative security check</li> </ul> At Pomerleau, we focus on results-oriented, passionate and rigorous people who participate in ambitious and complex projects. You have the profile we are looking for? Apply now to be part of our team. <br/><br/> Only retained candidates will be contacted. We may consider your CV for other positions. <br/><br/> Pomerleau is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive working environment where all employees are treated fairly.</div>  <br/>

Title: Regulatory Compliance Manager
Job_Description: <div><div>Helping Albertans achieve their dreams by turning the complex world of banking into brilliantly simple solutions. That’s ATB. Is that you?<br/><br/><strong>Regulatory Compliance Manager</strong><br/><br/>The Regulatory Compliance Manager is a strategic partner with compliance and business expertise who supports ATB Financial’s business units and strategic service units to make informed decisions about key business initiatives, product launches, risk management and strategic directions. The Regulatory Compliance Manager is responsible to interpret, analyze and advise on ATB Financial’s regulatory requirements to ensure that the business units and the strategic service units manage compliance risk in their business activities in line with ATB Financial’s overall strategic, tactical and operational direction. <br/><br/> The primary focus of the Regulatory Compliance Manager is to provide compliance advice; provide analysis and direction; identify and risk assess applicable regulatory requirements, evaluate the effectiveness of controls implemented by business units and review enterprise projects to ensure compliance with applicable legislation. The Regulatory Compliance Manager combines knowledge of risk management with a comprehensive understanding of ATB Financial’s activities to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements by identifying regulatory developments, emerging compliance risk and engaging in early risk analysis. <br/><br/> Through the implementation and monitoring of the compliance program, the Regulatory Compliance Manager assists business units and strategic service units to manage and meet their compliance obligations, thereby enhancing ATB Financial’s operational efficiency. <br/><br/> The Regulatory Compliance Manager supports the embedding of ATB Financial’s Compliance Program enterprise wide through keeping abreast of regulatory developments, review and testing of business units’ compliance controls to assess effectiveness and contributes to giving ATB Financial a strategic competitive advantage by protecting its reputation, lowering the cost of capital, reducing costs and minimizing the risk of investigation, prosecution and penalties and preventing the loss of new and existing customers. <br/><br/> <strong>You will find success based on your abilities in the following areas:</strong> <ul> <li>Conducts legal and regulatory research and identifies ATB Financial’s compliance obligations, track and risk assess new and emerging laws, rules, regulations and prescribed practices applicable to ATB Financial. </li> <li>Analyzes regulatory requirements and provides regulatory assessments to develop and implement detailed strategy, plans and risk identification processes to support the creation of enterprise wide policies and standards by effectively translating laws and regulations into operational functions and action steps for execution and compliance adherence.</li> <li>Liaises with business units and strategic service units to understand their compliance obligations, risks, processes and controls to develop required reporting and/or monitoring regimes.</li> <li>Delivers effective advice on regulatory compliance requirements to business units/strategic support units and provide guidance in establishing day to day regulatory compliance controls.</li> <li>Conducts risk analysis, compliance reviews and investigations, test the effectiveness of compliance controls, identify gaps, work with business units to develop remediation plans, and follows through to resolution and escalate when appropriate.</li> <li>Prepares compliance metrics, key risk indicators and reporting of breaches above set thresholds.</li> <li>Works with business units and strategic service units to design and implement changes to business policies, processes and procedures as appropriate.</li> <li>Participates in developing, and implementing changes to ATB Financial’s compliance policies and procedures.</li> <li>Undertakes business unit reviews and prepare materials in support of required regulatory reporting and in response to regulatory inquiries, examinations and investigations.</li> <li>Provides compliance advice to business units to assist the development of new products and services to ensure that ATB Financial is compliant with its regulatory obligations while remaining competitive in the financial services market.</li> <li>Promotes a risk-aware culture; ensures efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required enterprise standards and processes.</li> <li>Works on projects and initiatives as directed by the Director, Regulatory Compliance and Chief Privacy Officer and assist in preparing reports as requested.</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div><strong>As the ideal candidate you possess:</strong> <ul> <li>University Degree or College Diploma - degree in law, finance, business administration or related field is preferred</li> <li>Minimum or a combined 5 years experience in a risk, compliance, or audit setting in a financial institution, established securities dealer or regulatory agency</li> <li>Superior knowledge of regulations, requirements, industry standards and best practices applicable to financial institutions. Specific knowledge of PCI-DSS requirements and Payments Canada modernization efforts would be an asset.</li> <li>An enquiring mind, sound judgment and a strategic thinker who can, when appropriate, be tactical and pragmatic</li> <li>Ability to learn, adapt and remain resilient in a dynamic regulatory and business environment</li> <li>Strong project management skills with a proven track record of success with regulatory compliance and technology-based compliance projects</li> <li>Strong ability to handle complex issues and a high volume workload with varied time expectations</li> <li>Strong team, interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively both independently and as a team member</li> <li>Effective communicator (both verbal and written) and excellent negotiation and interpersonal skills and ability to work with senior level management in an independent manner</li> <li>Excellent knowledge of control testing, reporting procedures and record keeping</li> <li>Experience with GRC systems, preferably MetricStream GRC</li> </ul> So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. As an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans. Sound like a team you want to be a part of? <br/><br/> <strong>Advancement. Fun. Rewards… We get it. <br/> To learn more visit atb.com.</strong> <br/><br/> To read our employer reviews visit our Glassdoor page. <br/><br/> Online applications are preferred. ATB Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the high number of resumes we receive, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> For additional information on this posting, please contact Chike Unaegbunam, Director Regulatory Compliance and Chief Privacy Officer at 780-408-7588 or at cunaegbunam@atb.com. [Note: please apply using our online system and not the contact's email address].  <br/><br/> If your application is shortlisted, we might ask you to participate in a digital interview. <br/><br/> Please click the following link for information on communities where ATB thrives. <br/><br/> #LI-PRIO</div>  </div>  <br/>Apply

Title: Project Manager, Senior
Job_Description: <strong>Business Line</strong> Oil + Gas <br/><br/> <strong>Position Title</strong> Project Manager, Senior <br/><br/> Canada - Alberta <br/><br/> Calgary <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is seeking a Senior Project Manager to be based at our Calgary, Alberta office location. Please note, this position is also site-based at times. <br/><br/> This position is responsible for the overall operation of a project/contract to include the safety and wellbeing of its employees, safeguarding company funds and property, and generally represents the company with respect to the client. Project Managers complete projects to the satisfaction of the client, consistent with cost, schedule and contractual requirements. They ensure that established company goals are realized while maintaining client relations that will enhance future business. <br/><br/> May include the following responsibilities: <br/><br/> <strong><em>Leadership</em></strong>  <ul> <li>Demonstrates leadership by example with integrity and candor.</li>  <li>Leads project proposal efforts for small and mid-size projects.</li>  <li>Exhibits confidence and positive attitude about the project and the Company.</li>  <li>Demonstrates strong interpersonal skills (e.g. conflict resolution, team builder).</li>  <li>Prepares the next generation of Project Managers and leaders by providing opportunities and through networking and mentoring.</li> </ul> <strong><em>Judgment & Management of Project Risk</em></strong>  <ul> <li>Consistently demonstrates the ability to proactively identify potential project problems or opportunities, analyze the issues using all appropriate resources, develop alternatives, and arrive at the most optimum approach to mitigate problems or exploit opportunities.</li> </ul> <strong><em>Organizational Skills</em></strong>  <ul> <li>Demonstrates knowledge of resources and capabilities of other Groups for appropriate incorporation into project organization.</li> </ul> <strong><em>Execution Planning</em></strong>  <ul> <li>Understands and executes the project, employing the Project Execution Plan developed in the proposal stage and expanding it to be effective and in compliance with requirements for each project phase.</li>  <li>Establishes, tracks and reports status against key performance indicators or contractual metrics on a routine basis.</li>  <li>Participates in the establishment of project organizational structure in support of proposal efforts.</li>  <li>Capable of developing and taking responsibility for the Project Execution Plan development for small and/or medium size projects.</li> </ul> <strong><em>Contracts</em></strong>  <ul> <li>Participates in contract negotiations.</li> </ul> <strong><em>Client Relationship</em></strong>  <ul> <li>Clearly understands the scope of work and contract requirements or those requirements that pertain to his/her area of responsibility.</li> </ul> <strong><em>Negotiation</em></strong>  <ul> <li>Participates with BD and BU management in assessment, strategic development, and negotiations with customers.</li>  <li>May serve as the Proposal Manager of a medium to large-sized project.</li> </ul> <strong><em>Presentation Skills</em></strong>  <ul> <li>Supports or conducts formal presentations to clients and/or management.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Education:</em></strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in Engineering, Construction Management, Project Management, Facility Management or other relevant discipline</li>  <li>Demonstrated equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.</li> </ul> <strong><em>Experience:</em></strong>  <ul> <li>Entrants to this position require 12 years engineering, operations/maintenance, M&O, construction, project controls, and/or procurement experience.</li>  <li>Has a record of proven performance as Project Manager on previous project(s).</li>  <li>Capable of performing as the highest project lead on a medium-risk, medium-complexity project.</li>  <li>Capable of successfully performing on a $100 million project/contract.</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> N/A <br/><br/> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <br/><br/> At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees. <br/><br/> <em>NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Job Category</em></strong> <em>Program and Project Management</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Business Group</em></strong> <em>Construction Services Group (CS)</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Country</em></strong> <em>Canada</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Position Status</em></strong> <em>Full-Time</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Requisition/Vacancy No.</em></strong> <em>187153BR</em> <br/><br/> <em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.</em>

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: <strong>Senior Project Manager (Calgary)</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Are you looking to be part of an Innovative, Environmentally conscious and Collaborative team?
