If so, look no further.</em> <br/><br/> One of the top ten general contractors in Canada and part of the largest construction organization in North America, Clark Builders serves industrial, commercial and institutional market sectors. Clark Builders core values represent the spirit that our company was founded on: Respect Others, Have a Can-Do Attitude, Succeed as a Team, Lead with Courage, Deliver Results. They are more than words: each one underlies the commitment that we bring to every person we meet, every team we build and every project we work on, start to finish. <br/><br/> Reporting overall to the Vice President, Operations; on a day-to-day basis the Senior Project Manager will be reporting and taking direction from his/her or Project Executive in all aspects of the construction process on the project that they are assigned. The Senior Project Manager working with the Project Superintendent will be responsible for and not limited to managing safety, quality, risks, maximizing project earnings, human resources and staff training, client expectations, accurate financial reporting and assuring efficient, timely, fulfillment of all corporate and project obligations, complete communications among all project team members and organizations to construct the project on time, within the budget and to the quality specified. Project Manager role is diverse, and varies between each project. <br/><br/> The Senior Project Manager is also responsible to foster and develop client, consultant, third party and trade relationships in the course of their duties. <br/><br/> <strong>Duties/Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Project Start Up:</strong> <ul> <li>Chair the project handover meeting from Project Development/Estimating</li><li>Conduct project trade buyout meetings</li><li>Conduct project startup meetings for individual trades</li><li>Utilities and site services applications</li><li>Permit applications.</li><li>Review and or prepare prime contract against submitted tender and/or proposal, ready for senior management review and client /consultant review</li><li>Quantity take-offs for a various scopes of the project.</li><li>Finalize Prime Contractor.</li><li>Client Risk assessment.</li><li>Prepare project execution plan.</li><li>Establish project organization charts and staffing needs.</li><li>Assist in estimating tender closeout and buy outs.</li> <li>Setup project addition form, financials and billing schedule.</li><li>Prepare staffing and resources plan.</li> <li>Prepare logistics planning.</li> <li>Establish file management plan.</li><li>Procurement management, project buyout and award.</li><li>Prepare and issue letter of intents (LOI) and subcontracts.</li><li>Put in place bonding and insurance.</li><li>Finalize project estimates.</li> <li>Safety planning including assistance with re-project hazard assessments, ongoing safety inspections, ongoing safety hazard assessment and other duties.</li> <li>Understand and abide by the requirements of the CB Safety and Loss Prevention Policies and Procedures</li> <li>Understand and abide by the requirements of the local building authorities, develop and maintain relationships with permits and licensing personnel including building inspectors</li><li>Quality control planning.</li> <li>Communications plan.</li><li>Create and manage schedule.</li><li>Strategic and fee enhancement planning.</li> <li>Establish and manage client and corporate objective.</li> <li>Modify project plan for success.</li>  </ul> <strong>Project Execution and Document Control:</strong> <ul> <li>Track productivity and performance of the project.</li><li>Project accounting.</li> <li>Manage stakeholder expectations</li><li>Chair the Quarterly operational review meetings</li><li>Manage staff assignments.</li><li>Prepare a cash flow project and manage the project in accordance with the cash flow requirements.  <ul> <li>Advise management of pending risk elements and seek assistance on all risk matters or legal matters.</li> </ul></li> <li>Establish and manage document control process.</li><li>Establish and manager the quality control plan.</li><li>Establish and manage the project schedule, including the implementation of the Last Planner System.</li><li>Chair trade, owner/consultant meetings and issue minutes.</li><li>Chair, site safety meetings and issue minutes</li> <li>Project accounting and cost control, including working with project accountants</li><li>Monthly financial reports and eCMS, including the preparation of monthly project reports, both internal and external including the monthly MOR report.</li><li>Time cards.</li><li>PO and subcontract claims.</li><li>Client billings including preparation, payment, etc.</li><li>Dispute and claim management.</li> <li>Lead and train project teams including developing and mentoring support staff including project coordinators, junior project managers</li><li>Resolve trade and performance issues.</li><li>Provide regular management of Key Project Indicators (KPI’s).</li> </ul> <strong> Project Close Out:</strong> <ul> <li>Prepare the project close out procedures including punch lists, start up and handover requirements</li><li>Manage the trade contractor deliverables for project close out, including startup, warranties, demonstration requirements</li><li>Administrative project closure.</li><li>Trade/Subcontracts.</li><li>Prime contractor.</li><li>Commissioning and equipment start-up.</li><li>Training seminars.</li><li>City inspections.</li><li>Final and holdback invoices and payment</li> <li>Final consultant and schedule C’s.</li><li>Substantial completion certificate.</li><li>Warranty period.</li><li>Support and grow ongoing sub-trade and client relationships.</li><li>Assist in obtaining work by way of completing a portfolio of successful projects.</li><li>Participate in project interviews.</li><li>Participate in CBU Leadership.</li><li>Ensure internal and external requirements are achieved.</li><li>Manage financial collection and closeout.</li> <li>Other duties and responsibilities as required.</li>  </ul> <strong> Skills & Knowledge:</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills.</li><li>The ability to efficiently assist and administer multiple tasks.</li> <li>Analytical thinker to interpret information in order to understand issues.</li> <li>Ability to make decisions on a variety of levels of complexity, ambiguity and risk.</li> <li>Can define tasks and milestones to achieve objectives while ensuring optimal use of resources.</li> <li>Can prevent, manage and resolve conflicts.</li><li>Questions conventional approaches, explores alternatives and provides innovative solutions.</li> <li>Can identify, assess and mange risks while striving to meet objectives.</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications & Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>A Post-Secondary Certificate/Degree in Engineering or the equivalent of a designated Professional Engineer or a Technical School graduate in a Construction related discipline.</li><li>Minimum 10 years’ experience working in a Project Manager role for a Construction Management organization, managing construction of Commercial, Industrial or Intuitional buildings.</li><li>Can lead, mentor and motivate medium to large project teams.</li> <li>Must be able to competently manage the construction process from project startup to project closeout for all sizes and levels of complexity projects.</li><li>Actively participate in career development opportunities</li><li>Undertake and receive required safety training in accordance with policies.</li> </ul> <strong> Competencies:</strong> <ul> <li>Networking and relationship building;</li><li>Customer focus;</li> <li>Teamwork;</li> <li>Interpersonal skills;</li> <li>Results focus;</li> <li>Integrity;</li><li>Leadership;</li><li>Managing for results;</li><li>Developing others;</li><li>Risk Management;</li><li>Creative thinking;</li><li>Conflict resolution;</li><li>Planning and organizing;</li><li>Decision Making; and,</li><li>Analytical thinking.</li> </ul>

Title: Trade Marketing Manager
Job_Description: <div> <div> Job Title</div><br/>  <div> Trade Marketing Manager</div>  </div><br/>   <div> <div> Location</div><br/>  <div> Calgary - Calgary, AB T2C 4M8 CA (Primary)</div> </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Department</div><br/>  <div> Marketing</div>  </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Status</div><br/>  <div> Permanent Full-time</div>  </div><br/>   <div> <div> # of Hires Needed</div><br/>  <div> 1</div>  </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Description</div><br/>  <div>Since its reopening in 1988, Sleeman Breweries has grown to become the third-largest brewer in Canada. Formed by merging three of Canada’s best craft breweries and acquired in 2006 by Sapporo Breweries, we’ve built an incredible portfolio of beer brands in Canada; great Canadian brands such as Sleeman, Okanagan Spring and Unibroue, combined with world-class beers such as Sapporo, Old Milwaukee and Pabst Blue Ribbon. After all, we believe Canadians deserve better beer. <br/><br/> Key Responsibilities Include:   <ul> <li>Oversee the development and execution of BTL marketing programs such as promotions, events, and sponsorships and POS for all brands</li> <li>Work closely with National Brand Managers to ensure alignment to national brand strategies.</li> <li>Evaluate marketing activity performance and effectiveness</li> <li>Track industry trends, competitive activity and actively monitor brand performances via continuous trade presence.</li> <li>Manage the regional below the line budget.</li> <li>Play an active role in the demand planning processes to ensure in-market promotional activity is accurately captured.</li> <li>Main liaison with sales and participate in sales planning meetings to ensure flawless execution.</li> <li>Lead and provide coaching Brand Activity Manager (BAM)</li> <li>Occasionally lead special projects for the marketing function or market.</li> <li>Conduct in-depth market assessment as part of the annual planning process</li> <li>Foster internal and external industry and trade relationships.</li> <li>Recommend and implement continuous improvement, best practices and MUDA reduction opportunities.</li> <li>Maintain compliance with all Canadian advertising law, standards, and liquor board regulations.</div></li>  </ul>  </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div>Requirements:   <ul> <li>Minimum of 5 years of experience in related role in a consumer packaged goods (CPG) environment, including at least 2 years in a management position</li> <li>1 – 2 years of experience in project management considered an asset</li> <li>Solid track record of developing and implementing tactical plans.</li> <li>Strong business acumen and people management skills</li> <li>Knowledge of sales in a retail environment considered an asset</li> <li>Strong analytical thinking and budget management skills</li> <li>Proven ability to work effectively on multiple cross-functional teams, and engage effectively with all internal and external stakeholders</li> <li>Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal; superior presentation skills</li> <li>Strong computer skills, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook</li> <li>Acceptable criminal background check</li> <li>Post-secondary education in Marketing or related business field <br/><br/> We thank all candidates for their interest however only those selected to proceed will be contacted.</div></li>  </ul>  </div> <br/>

Title: Supplier Management Program Manager
Job_Description: <div><div>Helping Albertans achieve their dreams by turning the complex world of banking into brilliantly simple solutions. That’s ATB. Is that you? <br/><br/><strong>Supplier Management Program Manager</strong><br/><br/><strong>An introduction to us and the role:</strong> <br/><br/> We’re not your average company, we’re the second best place to work in Canada and because of that we have high expectations of who gets the opportunity to work with us to transform banking and uphold our incredible, people first culture.  <br/><br/> Are you a Supplier Management guru, who has a passion for leading a team? Do you like creating a vision and executing on it? The Procurement department is seeking a Supplier Management Program Manager to develop and execute a supplier management program as part of our Procurement reimagine. It will provide you the opportunity to utilize your procurement, strategic partnering and governance best practice knowledge and skills. This critical role will support supplier management and third party risk management. The Procurement team is responsible for sourcing suppliers, hosting competitive bidding, negotiation contracts, establishing supplier compliance and governance programs to ensure the most value can be realized while supporting our business, and contributing to mutual success with our suppliers. Are you excited to be a part of a new and exciting team? <br/><br/> Reporting to the Director, Supplier Management & Long Term Planning, the Supplier Management Program Manager provides oversight for the development, implementation, and monitoring of the Supplier Management Program to ensure delivery of a compliance and value-add comprehensive program. It will include the creation of the vision, framework, program and all associated materials, while working closely with our Continuous Improvement team to create the processes. In this role, you will ensure that suppliers are appropriately segmented in accordance with applicable regulations and ATB’s supplier standards, processes and procedures. You will support ATB to capture maximum value and realize the highest possible quality of service from suppliers through supplier performance management. This role also provides oversight for project management and governance, third party risk management, change management, and continuous improvement of supplier management at ATB. <br/><br/> The Supplier Management Program Manager will work with peers in the Account & Category Management group to facilitate business unit stakeholders to acquire goods and services in accordance with the Supplier Management Program and category specific strategies. They will engage with key business team members across ATB and are responsible for providing coaching and guidance to Account & Category Managers, Supplier Management Program team members and/or business partners directly on how to drive performance and compliance of contracts. <br/><br/> <strong>What’s the opportunity all about?</strong> <ul> <li>Lead the development and execution of the Supplier Management Program to ensure contract compliance and reduce contract value leakage</li> <li>Lead the development and execution of the Supplier Management Rollout & Communications Plan for sustainment while working closely with ATB’s Communication Experts  <ul> <li>Lead training initiatives for Procurement and business partners to execute the Supplier Management Program to drive performance and compliance of contracts</li> </ul>  </li> <li>Continuous improvement and supplier performance management  <ul> <li>Lead supplier compliance and third party risk mitigation governance and leading best practice activities</li> <li>Oversee day to day volumes, performance and qualification process effectiveness and output</li> <li>Identify gaps in supplier governance and performance and how to best address through process improvements and/or training</li> </ul>  </li> <li>Responsible for day to day management of the Supplier Management team work loads, capability, prioritization, productivity, troubleshooting, and issue and conflict resolution</li> <li>Supporting the development of skills and execution of talent management plans for current and future team needs</li> <li>Lead performance management for the Supplier Management team</li> <li>Participate in Procurement long term planning and strategic decision making</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div><strong>To really thrive and be successful in this role, we’d love for you to come to the table with:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum Bachelor’s degree; Master’s degree in Business Administration, Procurement, or Supply Chain Management is preferred or relevant experience</li> <li>Additional relative certifications are preferred (e.g. Contracts, People Management, Facilitation, Project Management)</li> <li>A designation or enrollment in a Contract Management or Supply Chain Management program (such as IACCM, SCMA, CSCMP, ISM, APICS)</li> <li>Preference will be giving to candidates with knowledge and experience in third party compliance and risk management</li> <li>Significant experience in procurement and supply chain, especially supplier/contract management</li> <li>Expert knowledge of public sector procurement rules and regulatory compliance</li> <li>Minimum of 2 years of direct leadership experience </li> <li>Demonstrated ability to effectively manage, motivate and direct staff</li> <li>Strategically minded, able to develop a vision and drive team towards it</li> <li>Skilled resolving the root cause(s) of complex problems impacting people, process and program issues</li> <li>Ability to influence others without positional authority</li> <li>Working knowledge of the banking industry, third party risk management, and managing customer experience is an asset</li> <li>Superior written and oral communication skill</li> <li>Knowledge and experience with systems such as Google Suite and industry standard procurement and supply chain technologies</li> </ul> So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. As an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans. Sound like a team you want to be a part of? <br/><br/> <strong>Advancement. Fun. Rewards… We get it. <br/> To learn more visit atb.com.</strong> <br/><br/> To read our employer reviews visit our Glassdoor page. <br/><br/> Online applications are preferred. ATB Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the high number of resumes we receive, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> If your application is shortlisted, we might ask you to participate in a digital interview. <br/><br/> Please click the following link for information on communities where ATB thrives. <br/><br/> #LI-PRIO</div>  </div>  <br/>Apply

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: <div>Senior Project Manager - Gibson Energy ULC <br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary Head Office <br/> <strong>Job status:</strong> Permanent Full time <br/><br/> <strong>PRIMARY PURPOSE OF JOB:</strong> <br/><br/> The primary responsibilities within the Senior Project Manager role are to plan and execute Capital projects of various sizes. <br/><br/> <strong>ACCOUNTABILITIES:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Manage the planning and execution of capital projects following Gibson Energy processes.</li> <li>Liaise with project sponsors to define project scope, manage sponsor objectives and project engineering requirements.</li> <li>Prepare Project Charters, FEED studies (AFE scope, cost estimate and project schedules), direct various teams on DBM preparation and during execution of capital projects.</li> <li>Prepare various project documents (execution plans, scoping documents, WBS, meeting summaries, etc.).</li> <li>Provide regular project reporting to management.</li> <li>Manage project scope, costs, schedules and risks.</li> <li>Manage relationships with various project internal and external stakeholders</li> <li>Provide engineering support to the terminals and pipelines Operations group on routine, technical and operational issues.</li> <li>Develop practical solutions to technical issues.</li> <li>Perform other duties as required.</li> <li>Demonstrates a personal commitment and proactive approach to Health, Safety, Security & Environment (HSS&E) through participation in all applicable HSS&E programs and ensures safe operation of the branch, team or unit and compliance with all Company HSS&E policies and procedures.</li> </ul> <strong>KEY SKILLS:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Functional technical skills: proven project execution, knowledge of Alberta business practices and regulatory environment.</li> <li>Proven excellence in spoken and written communication.</li> <li>Team player, possessing strong analytical skills.</li> <li>Proven experience with terminal and pipeline projects.</li> <li>Demonstrates ability to manage various project stakeholders.</li> <li>Willing and flexible to work on both large and small projects.</li> <li>Demonstrates working knowledge of project planning, scope, cost and schedule control, risk management, etc.</li> <li>Proficiency with standard engineering and project management tools in a Windows environment.</li> <li>Effective prioritization and work efficiency.</li> <li>Ability to manage several concurrent and varied projects.</li> </ul> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Completion of a university degree B.Sc. in Mechanical, Process or Chemical Engineering</li> <li>Minimum 10 years related Project Management experience</li> <li>Minimum 10 years of experience in the design and operation of oil and gas facilities</li> <li>Registered with APEGGA</li> <li>Prior experience with large crude oil terminals and pipelines an asset.</li> <li>Prior experience with regulatory bodies an asset.</li> </ul> <strong>DISCLAIMER:</strong> <br/><br/> The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees so classified. <br/><br/> Please note: all employment offers are contingent upon completion of satisfactory background check, which, depending upon the position and function you are applying for, may include the following: criminal background check, employment references, employment verification, credit inquiry check and education/credential verification.</div> <br/>

Title: Maintenance Manager
Job_Description: Headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia, QuadReal Property Group is a Canadian real estate investment, development and management company operating on a global scale. <br/><br/> The company’s $24.5 billion portfolio spans 23 Global Cities across 17 countries. Owned by British Columbia Investment Management Corporation (BCI), formerly bcIMC, one of Canada’s largest institutional investors, QuadReal was established to manage its real estate investment portfolio. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Resident Services Manager, the Maintenance Manager may lead a team of Maintenance Technician(s), depending on the property. The Maintenance Manager will be responsible for the overall preventive, corrective, and emergency maintenance of the property, with a goal of promoting exceptional resident satisfaction through the delivery of great service to all residents at all times. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>General Maintenance</strong> <ul> <li>Maintain a thorough knowledge and understanding of all building mechanical systems (i.e., pumps, life safety systems, HVAC, swimming pools, and other systems depending on the specific property);</li><li>Perform daily site inspections, interior and exterior, and document all findings utilizing Yardi Voyager Mobile Maintenance;</li><li>Conduct weekly vacant suite inspections;</li><li>Ensure completion of maintenance repairs on a timely basis to ensure resident satisfaction and safety following priority guidelines;</li><li>Ensure all exterior areas of the front entrance sidewalks, roadway, and walk ways leading to any entrance and exit doors are free of dirt, debris, ice, and snow;</li><li>Ensure completion of general maintenance in parking garages/lots, mechanical rooms, on rooftops and in other common areas;</li><li>Oversee suite turnovers for the property; ensure completion of minor suite renovations or upgrade work including painting and general carpentry;</li><li>Take photos of deficiencies and finished work as required for documenting maintenance repairs and damage utilizing Yardi Voyager Mobile Maintenance;</li><li>Accompany all vendors and contractors in resident suites at all times;</li><li>Ensure all tools and cleaning equipment are maintained and serviced regularly;</li><li>Ensure waste and recycling duties are completed on established pick-up days;</li><li>Maintain up-to-date MSDS worksheets for maintenance products and adherence by the OH&S rules and regulations;</li><li>Assist with onsite management of capital projects, execution of the capital plan, and identifying issues for current or future repair;</li><li>Emergency response and on-call duty, as required; and</li><li>Perform other duties as required. Must be able to lift at least 25 kilograms.</li> </ul> <strong>Management (if applicable) and Administration</strong> <ul> <li>Lead on-site Maintenance Technician(s) and manage daily maintenance activities at the property;</li><li>Coordinate Maintenance Technician(s) and vendor scheduling and oversee quality of work performed;</li><li>Motivate and develop site maintenance team, managing performance to expectations and established standards. Be responsible and accountable for the supervision and activities of the team, recognize and reward for exemplary performance;</li><li>Coordinate month-end duties and responsibilities, including suite pre-inspection, and scheduling of contractors and staff for turnover of suites utilizing Yardi Voyager;</li><li>Maintain part stock, maintenance supplies, appliance inventory, and complete regular inventories. Work with Resident Services Manager to order supplies as necessary to ensure the proper operation of the property;</li><li>Ensure maintenance records, operational guides, files, and documentation are maintained accurately and timely and in accordance with established procedure utilizing Yardi Voyager;</li><li>Comply with regular fire and life safety standards including monthly testing and annual drills; and</li><li>Maintain all logs and safety checks.</li> </ul> <strong>Health and Safety</strong> <ul> <li>Ensure compliance with all legislation, including but not limited to: The Residential Tenancies Act, Labour Relations Act, Fire Code and Occupational Health and Safety Act;</li><li>Understand and adhere to QuadReal’s Health and Safety policy; ensure a thorough knowledge and understanding of emergency procedures including fire, flood, and mold remediation for all staff;</li><li>Comply with regular fire and life safety standards including monthly testing and annual drills;</li><li>Familiarity with the emergency operation of electrical systems, elevator, boiler/chiller, fire panel and life safety systems, mechanical systems, sprinkler and timer systems;</li><li>Ensure all vendors and contractors comply with the established Health and Safety policy, and immediately report any infractions, hazardous conditions, or damaged equipment to the Resident Service Manager;</li><li>Ensure the effective monitoring and control of all building access including cylinder lock and electronic systems; and</li><li>Secure laundry rooms, recreation areas, locker rooms, and other common areas at designated times.</li> </ul> <strong>Customer Service</strong> <ul> <li>Uphold QuadReal’s mission, vision, and values serving as a brand and cultural ambassador for our residents, co-workers, vendors, and the public;</li><li>Professionally and courteously handle all inquiries, feedback, complaints, or concerns;</li><li>Interact with residents in a diplomatic manner; and</li><li>Foster and develop a customer service culture amongst all staff.</li> </ul> <strong>Experience and Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>High school diploma supplemented with post-secondary courses or certification. WHMIS and First Aid Training an asset;</li><li>Three years of progressive experience in all areas of building operations, including mechanical, fire and safety, electrical, and HVAC systems;</li><li>Experience leading teams preferred;</li><li>Ability to communicate with co-workers and management effectively and professionally, both oral and written;</li><li>Superior ability to develop and sustain cooperating working relationships with staff, contractors;</li><li>Knowledge of MS Office and Yardi Voyager preferred;</li><li>Familiarity with smart phone and tablet technology</li> </ul> QuadReal Property Group will provide reasonable accommodation at any time throughout the hiring process for applicants with disabilities or for those needing job postings in an alternate format. If you require accommodation, please advise the Talent Acquisition team member you are working with and include the following: Job posting #, your name and your preferred method of contact.

Title: Senior Manager Operations
Job_Description: <div><div> <strong>Senior Manager Operations</strong><br/><br/><strong>Who are we?</strong> <br/> Listening to Albertans. Going deeper to understand who they are and where they’re going. Translating the complex world of banking and investing into brilliantly simple solutions. Creating happiness and doing things other banks wouldn’t do. That’s ATB Investor Services.  <br/><br/> ATB Investor Services is the wealth management division of ATB Financial. Our team of advisors have a passion for listening to the needs of their clients; a desire to develop trusting relationships through smart, simple and helpful investment advice; and a commitment to helping Albertans live the life they want to live.  <br/> <strong> </strong> <br/> <strong>Who are you? </strong> <br/> Communicator, Problem Solver, Negotiator, Decision Maker. Whether at work or out in your community, you are the person that knows how to bring it all together. You’re a natural leader and your passion and excitement comes from knowing that your efforts make a significant difference in the lives of your team members, customers and the community around you.  <br/><br/> <strong>The role:</strong> <br/> The Senior Manager, Operations is a key member of the Operations team responsible for continually enhancing the core operating environment to meet the evolving business demands of the Investment Industry Regulatory Organization of Canada (IIROC) and Alberta Securities Commission (ASC). This position is responsible for leading teams within Operations. This position will lead key activities and projects such as process re-engineering, communication initiatives, management reporting, vendor management, internal controls, and audit activities.  <br/><br/> <strong>You will find success in your ability to:</strong> <ul> <li>Develop and execute the Operations business plan while collaborating closely with the Managing Director, Investment Operations.</li> <li>Lead the delivery of effective operations services to support all wealth management entities. </li> <li>Continually analyze operating results and costs to maximize ability to meet service level targets and realize operating efficiencies.</li> <li>Create and maintain a high performing team by keeping employees engaged and delivering a focused performance management approach.</li> <li>Develop and maintain effective relationships with key stakeholders and service partners such as Advisory Services, Solutions, Talent, and external partners to maximize operational efficiency & service delivery.</li>   <li>Acts as subject matter expert and provides expertise regarding critical Operations issues. </li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div><strong>As the ideal candidate you possess:</strong> <ul> <li>University Degree or Diploma in Business, or equivalent related experience</li> <li>8-10 years operations management experience within the wealth management industry </li> <li>Completion of the Canadian Securities Course </li> </ul> <strong>As the ideal candidate the following would be a asset: </strong> <ul> <li>Completion of the Financial Planning Course </li> <li>Completion of the Branch Managers Course</li>   <li>Completion of the Partners, Directors, and Officers course</li> <li>Licensed as an IIROC Registered Representative</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>WORKING WITH ATB</strong> <br/><br/> Click here to meet some of our team members and hear why they love working with us. You can also check out employee reviews on our Glassdoor page. Want to know more? Discover the ATBIS Journey, learn about our offerings and meet our ATBIS Executive team. <br/><br/> So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow.  <br/><br/> ATB has been named one of Canada’s 50 Best Employers by Report on Business Magazine, one of the 50 Best Workplaces in Canada by the Great Place to Work Institute, and one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Top Employers for Young People and Alberta’s Top 50 Employers by Mediacorp Canada Inc. As well, Alberta Venture magazine named ATB Financial Alberta’s Most Respected Corporation in the area of corporate social responsibility. <br/><br/> <strong>HOW TO APPLY</strong> <br/><br/> Online applications are preferred. ATB Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the high number of resumes we receive, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> If your application is shortlisted, we might ask you to participate in a digital interview. <br/><br/> #LI-PRIO</div>  </div>  <br/>Apply

Title: Project Coordinator
Job_Description: ABOUT US Aecon Group Inc. is an industry-leading construction and infrastructure development company at the forefront of our economys strongest growth sectors Infrastructure, Energy, Mining. Aecon and its subsidiaries provide services to private and public sector clients throughout Canada and on a selected basis internationally. Aecon Utilities is Ontario's premier utility contractor, averaging more than 1000 skilled trades people, project managers and clerical staff. Our respected personnel are well equipped with more than 1500 major pieces of equipment, including one of the largest directional drilling fleets in Ontario.POSITION OVERVIEWReporting to the Manager, Operations, the Project Coordinator will be responsible for accurately tracking the cost of labour, equipment, subcontractors and materials for the installation or relocation of underground utilities within multi-faceted infrastructure projects.Also, coordinating related contract administration, procurement and invoicing functions for awarded projects.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES *Provides Manager of Operations with data and project analysis<br/> *Supports project Superintendent and Foremen in management of projects and crews<br/> *Tracks productivity, costs and progress on projects<br/> *Performs quantity take-off from construction drawings<br/> *Monitors and provides job cost reports to management on active projects<br/> *Creates and submits progress and final invoicing <br/> *Coordinates the preparation and submission of shop submittals and as-built drawings<br/> *Provides data and input for month-end reconciliations<br/> *Communicates with customer technical support departments<br/> *Provides technical support to field staff<br/> *Maintains files and correspondence on active and completed projects<br/> *Performs other duties and responsibilities as required<br/><br/>KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS *Graduate from Civil or Electrical Engineering/ Technologist / Construction Management program or equivalent<br/> *Minimum of 2 years of experience in the construction industry in a similar role<br/> *Experience in the utility industry is a strong asset<br/> *Capable of reading and understanding construction drawings and documents<br/> *Sound computer skills MS Excel, MS Word, MS Project<br/> *Experience with SAP is a strong asset<br/> *Strong communication skills oral and written<br/> *Self motivated with good organizational skills<br/> *Ability to work accurately under pressure<br/> *Adaptable to flexible work schedule when required to meet deadlines<br/> *Ability to work with others as a team<br/> *Valid drivers license and access to reliable transportation<br/> *Willing to travel for specific project assignments is a strong asset<br/><br/>Aecon accommodates.
