Title: Project Manager (Oil & Gas)
Job_Description: Our client is a North American leading engineering and construction company focused on delivering successful midstream, storage, and pipeline related projects to their energy clients world-wide. <br/><br/> They currently have an immediate need for an experienced Project Manager. <br/><br/> <strong>Overview:</strong> <br/><br/> Plan, coordinate and manage all engineering activities for Engineering, EPCM or EPC projects. Provide engineering leadership to promote the successful execution of projects with a focus on cost effectiveness, constructability and schedule. <br/> Technical Support - Provide engineering technical support for total project effort including project schedule development; participation in construction planning and design; resolution of design conflicts; constructability reviews, etc. <br/> Engineering Compliance - Ensure project engineering activities comply with company and contract requirements and support overall project schedule. <br/> Schedule Compliance - Interface with all engineering departments/disciplines as required in the establishment of project schedules and resolving schedule problems. <br/> Engineering Management - Manage engineering staff assigned to designated project. Duties include personnel planning/administration and workflow assignments. Develop, implement and administer project engineering procedures and other work control and reporting documents. <br/> Client Interface - Represent Company, project team and/or engineering department during bid process, project scope development, client meetings and project management meetings. <br/> Constructability Reviews - Interface with Project Manager and Project Superintendents necessary to review constructability of design with the goal of meeting quality, cost and schedule commitments. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> Bachelor or Master's degree in an Engineering Discipline <br/> Minimum 15 years of experience in oil and gas engineering design <br/> Minimum 5 years of experience as a Project Manager on complex, multi-discipline engineering, EPCM or EPC projects <br/> Must be licensed as a professional engineer in Alberta, British Columbia or Saskatchewan <br/> Experience working as an oil and gas owner company internally, managing consulting companies, is preferred. <br/><br/> <strong>Skills required:</strong> <br/><br/> Must possess superior engineering skills and be capable of interacting with all engineering disciplines <br/> Must be familiar with applicable codes, standards, and acceptable industry practices, etc. <br/> Must have excellent communication skills and be capable of interacting with peers, project managers, site managers and clients <br/> Must have a proven track record of accomplishment as a lead design engineer on oil and gas projects and be capable of working in a team of engineers, designers and support personnel <br/> Possess working knowledge of scheduling techniques utilizing Microsoft Project, Primavera P3 and Expedition project management software

Title: SaaS Implementation Manager
Job_Description: Benevity is seeking a Project Manager (a key member of our Professional Services team) with a demonstrated track record in SaaS implementations. <br/><br/> You enjoy variety and the challenge of leading, managing and performing tasks on both major software implementations and ad hoc projects. You would operate as a dedicated client advocate who leads, develops and executes implementation plans for Benevity products & solutions to ensure our clients are successful. You are a quick study, able to learn new products and processes easily, and you enjoy leveraging that knowledge to help clients take advantage of new solutions provided by a game-changing software company. <br/><br/> You are someone who is technically-oriented with expert organizational skills, strong presentation skills and exemplary project management skills. You have the ability to train users effectively in a variety of environments, with a strong passion in solutioning and its ability to drive change to business outcomes. You must be client-obsessed with strong communication and analytical skills. You must be able to articulate value, inspire and be comfortable consulting and collaborating with our clients remotely or in-person. <br/><br/> An adept communicator, you can translate difficult concepts into layman’s terms and act as the interpreter between technical and non-technical project stakeholders. If you like being at the centre of projects and guiding them to success with a company helping its clients to change the world, read on! <br/><br/> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> Benevity is a software company working to build better and more engaging ways for companies to unite their people around doing the right thing. For us, doing well by doing good is way more than just a tagline, but on the subject of tag, we hope you’re “it!” We’re a growing company and we’re looking for just the people to help us take our business (and Goodness) to the next level. <br/><br/> If you joined us you’d be joining a diverse, dedicated, and passionate team that works hard day in and day out to deliver and develop innovative solutions and peerless customer service to our growing ranks of raving fans (aka our amazing clients). You’d be working with, and for, some of the most iconic companies and charitable organizations in the world to make a real difference in their communities (and on a global scale). If you’d describe yourself as self-driven, flexible, inclusive, cooperative, quick-learning, and unafraid to tackle hard problems head-on, we want you as part of our team. And we want you to know what we think wearing jeans to work is absolutely acceptable—and feel to bring your pup along for the ride. <br/><br/> Though we may have outgrown our “startup” label, our fun, flexible tech culture has grown with us and still fits perfectly. More than all of that, we have a heart and hold Goodness at the forefront of everything we do. We’re getting all As as a registered B Corporation, meaning we’re happy to be counted among a growing number of companies who’re committed to higher social and sustainability standards. <br/><br/> <strong>What you will do</strong>  <ul> <li>Own project implementation and delivery for Benevity clients. Manage the successful implementation of Benevity products and other ad hoc projects for prospective and existing clients, contributing to long-term client satisfaction and healthy adoption rates.</li> <li>Work with key client contacts and stakeholders to understand, define and document business requirements for system configuration, development and implementation.</li> <li>Collaborate with internal stakeholders (i.e., project developers, report developers, QC analysts, Business manager, and Client Service) to ensure efficient and effective system configuration, development, testing, billing, training and implementation.</li> <li>Provide support to the Sales team during the pre-sales cycle to give prospective and existing clients insight into implementation processes. You’ll provide guidance on how various challenges may be resolved, enabling the team to hit their targets.</li> <li>Partner with clients to identify key business goals and objectives to align products and services with the clients desired outcomes.</li> <li>Conduct requirements gathering sessions and customized training sessions via online webinars, phone or in-person.</li> <li>Set clear project expectations and achievable timeline goals required to execute the technical and business objectives based on the scope of the launch and supporting adoption and rollout with a solutions-oriented approach.</li> <li>Manage multiple projects at once while paying strict attention to detail.</li> <li>Provide regular status reporting and meet with clients regularly to discuss project progress, outstanding project tasks and risks.</li>   <li>Maintain an in-depth understanding of Benevity’s suite of products, and services.</li>  </ul> <strong>What you bring</strong>  <ul> <li>2-4 years' experience managing software implementation projects relevant work experience in account management, business analysis, consulting, Professional Services or other implementation and delivery type roles.</li> <li>A Bachelors’ degree</li> <li>Excellent organizational skills and great leadership aptitude.</li> <li>Experience conducting client needs analysis and configuring a software platform to meet those needs.</li> <li>Strong client management experience, especially related to SaaS.</li> <li>Expert-level project management skills and an ability to work with multiple Enterprise clients at a time to deliver on milestones, and tasks within the scope and on time.</li> <li>Strong analytical skills, detail oriented, ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.</li> <li>Technical understanding – not afraid to question and investigate so that challenges can be resolved quickly.</li> <li>Professional, motivated and flexible – enthusiastic about using process to deliver but understand that there’s a time and a place to go with the flow.</li> <li>Can-do attitude – happily takes on any relevant task; comfortable in a fast-paced, dynamic, growing company culture.</li> <li>Motivated self-starter that works well both alone and with a team.</li> <li>Manages multiple projects at once while paying strict attention to detail.</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communications skills.</li> </ul> <strong>What you can expect</strong>  <ul> <li>A once-in-a-career opportunity to join a mission-driven growth company on a growth trajectory and with a unique, ultra-engaged culture.</li> <li>Join a team of innovative thinkers, keen to be part of a growing company that is all about helping businesses create innovative corporate and workplace giving and other Goodness programs.</li> <li>Work in a fast-paced environment for a dynamic, rapidly growing company with a history of proven success and stunning colleagues.</li> <li>Connect with a rapidly growing and passionate group in an open, collaborative and fun environment.</li> </ul> While we are grateful and appreciative of every application, we are only able to respond to those candidates selected for an interview.

Title: Senior Manager, Transformation Risk Reporting & Leadership
Job_Description: <div><div> <strong>Senior Manager - Transformation Risk Reporting & Leadership – Integrity Risk Leadership & Insights (IRL&I)</strong><br/><br/>We can transform banking, reimagine it, make banking work for people. We’re on a journey to make meaningful impacts on an industry that has the power to transform a person’s life. When we talk about transformation at ATB Financial, we’re not just talking about pie in the sky ideas, we’re listening and collaborating to bring those ideas to life. To put it simply, we’re on a mission to reinvent how banking can support people's lives. We’re going to provide meaningful solutions to problems, deepen our connection with customers and while we’re at it, transform ourselves from the inside out.  <br/><br/> We need collaborative visionaries and executors who are eager to listen to our customers in order to do things other banks wouldn’t do. We’re building a team of relentless, passionate and inquisitive ATB transformers to build our bench strength in disrupting ourselves before we get disrupted.  <br/><br/> Want to be a part of our story? If you’re looking for an organization where you can use your talents to do remarkable things, you may be the alpha to our beta and we encourage you to read on. <br/><br/> <strong>TEAM TRANSFORMATION:</strong> <br/><br/> We’re invested in transparency being a key part of our recruitment process, so we encourage you to check out and join our Team Transformation Talent Community on LinkedIn to gain real insight on our culture and what it's really like to be an ATB Transformer. You can check it out and join us at https://www.linkedin.com/groups/13551363. <br/><br/> Also, to learn more our work and the transformative projects we have on the go connect with us at https://atbalphabeta.com/. <br/><br/> <strong>THE OPPORTUNITY:</strong> <br/><br/> Integrity Risk Leadership & Insights’ priority is to analyze, understand & translate risk in its many forms, provide expert advice and guide solutions to help the Transformation team merge reasonable risk enablement with reaching goals, resulting in achieving deeper happiness. We know that meeting our goals depends directly on the quality of our people and that is why we strive to attract, retain and develop the best talent available. <br/> <strong> </strong> <br/> Reporting to the Leader, IRL&I, your primary responsibility is for the strategic provision of risk enablement, analysis and reporting leadership within ATB Financials’ Transformation group. As Senior Manager-Transformation Risk Reporting & Leadership, you hone in on risk management inherent to technology, governance, and security risk, and ensure risk is known, measured, and managed in partnership with ATB policy, standards, best practices, frameworks, compliance guidelines and regulations. You will also be pivotal to supporting the IRL&I team’s risk management partnerships with Transformation Pillars, by continually identifying and capturing ongoing risk changes as ATB transforms banking. <br/> <strong> </strong> <br/> <strong>You will find success based on your ability to:</strong> <ul> <li>Coordinate updates to key policies, frameworks and other CMC reportable documents. i.e. Transformation’s risk appetite contributions. </li> <li>Provide continuous improvement to reporting, including a focus on scenario/impact analysis. </li> <li>Coordinate and prepare concise, meaningful presentation information on risk items and regulatory compliance risks reporting. i.e. ORC, ERMC, CMC, Compliance Committees, etc.</li> <li>Develop and provide landscape view of pillar and transformation risk.</li> <li>Lead ongoing development of the risk universe with Enterprise Risk Management (ERM).</li> <li>Share as Storyteller for risk enablement, by providing a strong risk culture focus/advocacy, and ever increase risk knowledge for Transformation.</li> <li>Drive development and continuous improvements for both KPI's and KRI’s.</li> <li>Provide seasonal/ad hoc support for Integrity Risk Leadership - Assurance to: discuss scope, impacts, track resolutions/non-resolutions, along with accurate outputs for:   <ul> <li>Internal Controls over Financial Reporting (ICOFR), Interac, Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) and Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) B-10. </li> </ul>  </li> <li>Provide risk support on varied projects across Transformation to: research potential risks, mitigate risk on POCs, monitor/track mitigation plans, and be a trusted advisor for risk and/or engagement of appropriate risk advisor subject matter experts as needed.</li> <li>Support Risk & Control Assessments (RCA) by providing completion or review support to Director - Risk Leadership, as required. </li> <li>Provide experienced risk support for New Initiatives Risk Assessment Process (NIRAPs) to: complete or review for adequacy both risk identification/consistency, provide additional layer of analysis based on multiple projects’ NIRAPs, and craft Executive Level summaries as required. </li> <li>Show initiative, self-motivation, effective work habits, and being an influencer of others. </li> <li>Assess and identify issues and share recommendation, mitigation/action, risk plans with Transformation Pillars as required. </li> <li>Complete on-time management responses with assessments of: gaps, trends, anomalies, threat indicators, multiple inputs, viewpoints and technical details, in a fast paced environment, often without clearly defined characteristics and asserting facts without bias.</li> <li>Analyze data regularly, including vendor risks, to identify security risks using developed SMART metrics information.</li> <li>Act as risk council as needed, translating requests by providing risk input to project applicable stage gate meetings, project risk assessments and annual Internal Audit plans.</li> <li>Build on strong understanding and knowledge of technology standards, frameworks and regulations along with commonly used concepts, practices and procedures for same.</li> <li>Display poise and ability to act calmly and competently in high pressure, high stress situations.</li> <li>Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills, and be highly accurate and analytical. </li> <li>Provide strong facilitation and communication skills including sharing technical content and risk related concepts to non-technical audiences.</li> <li>Maintain excellent time management, organizational and prioritization skills.</li> <li>Be a natural innovator, developing and building value, opportunity and meaning for your work.</li> <li>Provide active coaching, mentorship, leadership and development of supporting team members, all the while keeping the ATBs and the Customer Experience top of mind.</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div><strong>As the ideal candidate you possess:</strong>  <ul> <li>Risk Management training and experience – University/College degree/diploma or at least 8+ years in the risk consulting or IT industry, or a combination.</li> <li>Experience with Enterprise Risk Management.</li> <li>Experience with IT risk management, compliance and governance related field of work, including BCP practices.</li> <li>Have understanding of International Standards and Frameworks. </li> <li>Certifications such as CRISC, CRMA, CISA, CIA and CISSP are assets.</li> </ul> <strong>ATTRIBUTES FOR SUCCESS:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>You focus on impact over hard work:</strong> what isn't of a concern is the hours you work, but your results and impact on team members and customers</li> <li><strong>You like to solve difficult problems, together:</strong> no one said transforming banking was going to be easy, but we’re collectively reimagining it and there are no solo heroes welcome</li> <li><strong>You operate with a mentality of Build-Measure-Learn:</strong> our agile mindset is not just for our technical teams, it's a mindset that every one of us is asked to operate from. We move fast, we make mistakes but we measure the impact, learn, grow and change as a result </li> <li><strong>You focus on 10X and leave the incremental thinking at home:</strong> if something doesn't have significant impact, you are the person to challenge whether or not it's worth doing</li> <li><strong>You do it with passion or not at all:</strong> you’re inspired by our purpose and you see the link between yourself and the work you are doing to transform banking </li> <li><strong>You’re comfortable with being uncomfortable:</strong> we won’t always have the answers and change is a constant in our world. As a Transformer you trust in our vision and own an attitude of willingness and patience </li> </ul>   <br/> As a team member with the Transformation team at ATB, you can expect:  <ul> <li>No day will ever be the same - we’re learning, iterating and making big steps towards our vision of transforming an entire industry, everyday</li> <li>The ability to grow a career within an inspiring, impact focused culture where you are surrounded by changemakers and leaders that empower you to use your voice to make banking work for people</li> <li>To be a part of the energy of an organization that is unlike any other, where you may pinch yourself on the daily and wonder how you got so lucky</li> <li>Bragging rights! You get to call yourself a Transformer and an ATBer and know you play a direct role in helping us become a cutting edge financial institution (it’s going to feel more like a technology company, but either way it’s hella cool.) </li> </ul>   <br/> And being part of ATB Financial you get: <ul> <li>An excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. </li> <li>Amazing benefits for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments needs.</li> <li>Be a part of an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans.</li> </ul> If you want to know more, read our employer reviews visit our Glassdoor page. <br/><br/> Online applications are preferred. ATB Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the high number of resumes we receive, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> If your application is shortlisted, we might ask you to participate in a digital interview. <br/><br/> Please click the following link for information on communities where ATB thrives. <br/><br/> #LI-PRIO</div>  </div>  <br/>Apply

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Overview<br/><br/><strong>BE Innovative. BE Influential. BE the Right Partner</strong>. Be all that and more at Colliers Project Leaders. Join our team as a Senior Project Manager for Infrastructure Services in Calgary. <br/><br/> At Colliers Project Leaders, we help our clients succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed. <br/><br/> In this role, you’ll join our team of experts who lead building and infrastructure projects. Through our <strong>Get it Right Solution™,</strong> you’ll ensure we get it ready, get it built and get it performing -- so investors, owners and occupants are certain of success. <br/><br/> With over 600 employees and 27 + office locations throughout Canada and the Middle East, Colliers Project Leaders offers a multi-cultural, multi-generational work environment where we cultivate excellence, develop leaders and deliver on our clients’ vision. Colliers Project Leaders is part of Colliers International Group Inc. (NASDAQ: CIGI; TSX: CIGI), an industry leading global real estate with more than 16,000 skilled professionals operating in 66 countries. To learn more about Colliers Project Leaders, visit www.colliersprojectleaders.com. <br/><br/> We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> We’re looking for experienced project managers who are looking for the right opportunity to leverage their strong reputation in the infrastructure services sector into a successful leadership role. You bring a wealth of experience leading projects varying in scope and complexity in the delivery of municipal and infrastructure projects including transportation systems such as roadways, bridges, and transit ways, water and wastewater management, and other horizontal infrastructure projects. <br/><br/> You’re already known as a trusted advisor to your clients and have built strong, lasting relationships with senior leaders. You bring in-depth knowledge and have led and managed complex projects from start to finish – on time and on budget. You also maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients, keeping them in mind for new business and sales opportunities. <br/><br/> Are you looking to build upon your reputation as a project leader to make a difference for new clients and businesses? Look no further.<br/><br/>Responsibilities<br/><br/><strong>What success looks like:</strong>  <ul>   <li>You’ve completed a number of municipal and infrastructure projects, varying in size and scope ideally in the relation to transportation systems, water and waste water management and other horizontal infrastructure</li> <li>You work closely with clients in the early conceptual stages of project initiation to ensure a strategic approach to project planning, setup and delivery</li> <li>You are a trusted advisor to the client, applying your understanding of design, construction and operation of horizontal municipal infrastructure</li> <li>Your clients are impressed with your ability to represent their best interests regarding contractual and technical issues</li> <li>Your project teams rely on your ability to manage change, communicate and coordinate between multiple stakeholders, resolve issues, and deliver projects on time and on budget</li> <li>A strong ability to lead the control of project related documents and deliver all work in accordance with company standards and procedures</li> <li>You maintain contact with existing and prospective clients and respond to business development and sales opportunities with support from the Business Development Team, Principal or Regional Vice President</li> </ul>  Qualifications<br/><br/><strong>What you bring:</strong>  <ul>   <li>A university degree or diploma in civil engineering or a related discipline</li> <li>A minimum of 10 to 15 years of experience in project coordination and management, representing owners to multiple stakeholders in the delivery of infrastructure projects for municipalities</li> <li>Strong knowledge of various construction methodologies, project management models and financial management, as well as building codes, contract law and relevant legislation</li> <li>Previous exposure to capital and municipal planning for horizontal infrastructure projects</li> <li>Experience leading or considerably contributing to the preparation of RFP/Q’s, tenders and tender awards</li> <li>Eng. or CET designation required and PMP considered an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus skills and experience:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Strong leadership and organizational skills with a proven ability to effectively influence others and resolve client, project and technical issues</li> <li>Excellent communication and presentation skills</li> <li>Proficient in MS Project, MS Word and MS Excel</li> </ul>

Title: Project Manager – Renewable Energy
Job_Description: <div><div> <strong>WSP</strong> is seeking a Project Manager to undertake construction management and Owner’s Engineer roles for Renewable Energy projects. The position will be based in our Calgary, Alberta office. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Develop and manage project budgets, schedules, and resource levels</li>   <li>Business development, market presence and client care will be important aspects of this role</li>  <li>Contract review and management</li>  <li>Liaise closely with the established technical teams to coordinate engineering work</li>  <li>Create and manage inspection programs</li>  <li>Coordination with relevant regulatory authorities and utilities</li>  <li>Construction cost estimation</li>  <li>Communication and documentation to support construction progress reporting</li>   <li>Bid management</li>  <li>Provide due diligence support for Advisory Services mandates</li>   <li>Some travel to and from client sites and/or temporary secondment to client site may be required</li> </ul> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Relevant engineering degree or a combination of related experience and education</li>  <li>P.Eng. designation</li>  <li>Experience undertaking the role of Owner’s Engineer and working with EPC contractors for Renewable Energy projects</li>   <li>Proven experience leading, managing and delivering significant projects to time, cost and quality objectives</li>  <li>Understanding of the full life-cycle of Renewable Energy projects</li>  <li>Proven ability coordinating a multi-disciplinary team</li>  <li>Proficiency in project planning and scheduling</li>  <li>Demonstrable experience working cooperatively and effectively with a wide variety of stakeholders</li>  <li>Experience with contracts and contract administration</li>  <li>Proven business development experience</li>   <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills</li>  <li>Pragmatic, solutions-oriented approach to problem solving</li> </ul> Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits). <br/><br/> To learn more about our firm and the projects we have been involved in, please visit our <strong> World of Possibilities</strong> microsite. <br/><br/> <strong><em>WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</em></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.</em></strong></div> </div><div></div>

Title: Project Manager - Mobile
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> The IBM Interactive Experience (IBMiX) Digital Platforms team develops complete mobile solutions for our customers.The IBMiX's Digital Platform team is a global leader in providing clients with mobile application development and system integration related services and support capabilities. <br/><br/> The Digital Platforms team designs and develops mobile solutions for a variety of device platforms including: iOS, Android, BlackBerry and Windows Mobile. <br/><br/> This position is for the IBMiX Digital Platforms team based in Downtown Toronto.Our team is looking for a Project Manager with a demonstrated background in mobile solutions and who excels at leading project teams to deliver our best-of-breed solutions to clients. <br/><br/> As an IBM Project Manager (PM) the candidate will enjoy the diverse challenges, clients, work environments and schedules that come with delivering innovative projects, on-time and on-budget.Skills for this position require applicants who are equally adept at people and business management. Besides the knowledge of methods to initialize, plan, execute, control and monitor a project, IBM PMs use skills and leadership competencies for team building, client relations, negotiation, decision making, problem solving and conflict management. Ensuring scope, cost, schedule and contractual deliverables, you'll apply techniques for planning, tracking, change control and risk management. IBM project managers are on the frontlines every day; partnering with clients to help shape their projects every step of the way.   <ul> <li>Manage Agile Program with 5-12 squads by aligning teams to work towards a common goal</li> <li>Facilitate launch of new Program Increments, Lead PI planning and execution</li> <li>Train Executives, Leaders, Managers and Teams on SAFe</li> <li>Create and update the Implementation plans and metrics</li> <li>Track and communicate program progress/status</li> <li>Identify risks and escalate them through the appropriate channels</li> <li>Clear blockers for the team to progress on an ongoing basis</li> <li>Contribute ideas and best practices across the team</li> <li>Identify, scope, and estimate change requests and additional opportunities with clients</li> <li>Lead IBM Governance activities and related communication</li> </ul>  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in a computing, math, engineering, business, or information technology related field of study.</li><li>3+ years of software Agile Program Management experience</li><li>Experienced in project financial management and forecasting</li><li>Demonstrated experience with both Agile and Waterfall methodologies</li><li>Successful delivery of programs on time and on budget</li><li>Proven ability to work in a customer facing/consulting environment</li><li>Experience leading projects through all phases of the lifecycle</li><li>Strong written, verbal and presentation skills</li><li>Ability to lead lasting relationships with clients</li><li>English: Fluent</li><li><strong>Accreditations desired:</strong> CSM Certified Scrum Master, SPC SAFe Program Consultant, PMI ACP or PMP</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in a computing, math, engineering, business, or information technology related field of study.</li><li>5+ years of software Agile Program Management experience</li><li>Experienced in project financial management and forecasting</li><li>Demonstrated experience with both Agile and Waterfall methodologies</li><li>Successful delivery of programs on time and on budget</li><li>Proven ability to work in a customer facing/consulting environment</li><li>Experience leading projects through all phases of the lifecycle</li><li>Strong written, verbal and presentation skills</li><li>Ability to lead lasting relationships with clients</li><li>English: Fluent</li><li><strong>Accreditations desired:</strong> CSM Certified Scrum Master, SPC SAFe Program Consultant, PMI ACP or PMP</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>

Title: Restoration Project Manager
Job_Description: The Peak Group of Companies is a North American leader in home improvement. We are a diversified group, supplying a vast array of innovative products throughout Canada and the United States as well as operating Canada’s largest B2B and B2C exterior home installations’ company. <br/><br/> Peak is a highly valued, strategic partner of Home Depot. Our unique business platform perfectly aligns with Home Depot’s do-it-yourself, do-it-for-me and professional customer, and our best in class products and broad range of home installation services are offered through Home Depot’s massive retail network. <br/><br/> The greatest strength of Peak is our people, a team of remarkably talented, vibrant and competitive individuals. Quick to act and passionate to win, the Peak team continuously drives the company’s growth, which in turn continuously provides individual career growth. This formula for success is entrenched in our culture, where innovation is encouraged, talent and teamwork are celebrated and where results and success are rewarded. <br/><br/> We are looking for two (2) dedicated individuals who thrive in a deadline driven environment to join us as a Restoration Project Manager (Insurance), to be based out of our office in Calgary, AB. <br/><br/> As our <strong>Restoration Project Manager / Insurance</strong> you ensure the client’s restoration project is delivered on time and at the required quality standard, while focusing on a very high level of customer service. <br/><br/> The successful candidate will also assist in property inspections and developing estimates. In addition, the RPM will be responsible for market share growth, secured through business development initiatives, including networking and developing existing customer relations. <br/><br/> <strong>The Role:</strong> <ul> <li>Manage insurance claim including: inspections, developing scope of work, managing policyholder and adjuster expectations</li><li>Assure all quality assurance policies and procedures are being met</li><li>Generate leads by building strong work relationships with Insurance Adjuster and other business partners</li><li>Assist in the development and implementation of new sales strategies</li><li>Work collaboratively with the customer service team assuring all system notes are answered accurately and promptly</li><li>Assist in resolving customer complaints in an effective manner and on a timely basis</li><li>Ensure all notes and updates are being made in all internal systems</li><li>Region of coverage is Calgary, AB</li><li>Travel to other branches when required.</li> </ul> <strong>Your Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum 3 years’ experience in the restoration/renovation industry</li><li>Minimum 5 years’ in experience in a sales/business development field</li><li>Strong relationship building skills</li><li>Individual must be self-motivated and sales driven</li><li>An understanding of reconstruction practices for property that has suffered exterior damage caused by wind, hail etc.</li><li>Knowledge in roofing, siding and building envelope</li><li>Strong communication and sales skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Computer skills required – effectively use Word, Excel, Outlook</li><li>Ability to work occasional evenings and weekends.</li> </ul> The Peak Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We respect the dignity and worth of every individual in the workplace and value the importance of diversity, fairness, and trust. We offer a dynamic work environment and a competitive compensation package. Our goal is to attract, develop, and engage employees with exceptional ability and diverse backgrounds.

Title: Transportation Project Manager
Job_Description: <strong>Business Line</strong> Transportation <br/><br/> <strong>Position Title</strong> Transportation Project Manager <br/><br/> Canada - Alberta <br/><br/> Calgary <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> The Transportation Division of AECOM is seeking a creative, highly talented Mid-Level/Senior Project Manager for immediate employment in the Calgary, AB office. The appropriately qualified applicant will be able to demonstrate an established career in the Transportation industry, specific to multi-disciplinary transportation projects. <br/><br/> The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:  <ul> <li>Overall project management and leadership in developing opportunities</li>  <li>Defining project scope, developing project plans, developing project schedules and developing and tracking fee estimates and project baselines and budgets</li>  <li>Tracking project progress of deliverables, milestones and other commitments to clients</li>  <li>Determining and taking corrective actions on contractual, technical and commercial issues</li>  <li>Building, organizing and motivating project teams and managing daily activities and resources</li>  <li>Identifying services to be provided by external companies and negotiating agreements</li>  <li>Chairing internal and external, stakeholder or client, meetings representing AECOM</li>  <li>Ensuring client satisfaction and overseeing quality review process for submittals</li>  <li>Analyzing and managing project risk</li>  <li>Managing reports and necessary documentation</li>  <li>Developing policies and procedures to support the achievement of project objectives</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent</li>  <li>5+ years of project management experience</li>  <li>Significant experience in project management</li>  <li>Experience in budgeting, reporting, scheduling</li>  <li>Experience writing and winning significant proposals</li>  <li>Experience with business development</li>  <li>Experience interacting at an executive level (both internal and external)</li>  <li>Must have experience managing multi-disciplinary transportation projects</li>  <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)</li>  <li>Proficiency in MS Word and Excel</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>P.Eng designation</li>  <li>Practical project management experience (project)</li>  <li>Foundational experience that might include design and/or site work and/or construction / operations</li>  <li>Experience working on projects for Alberta Transportation, City of Calgary, Federal Government or similar</li>  <li>US or overseas experience is considered acceptable / equivalent to Canadian experience, but regional (Western Canada) experience is ideal</li>  <li>Should have a demonstrable network of client and engineering contacts</li> </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <br/><br/> <em>NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES:</em> <br/><br/> <em>Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Job Category</em></strong> <em>Program and Project Management</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Business Group</em></strong> <em>Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS)</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Country</em></strong> <em>Canada</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Position Status</em></strong> <em>Full-Time</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Requisition/Vacancy No.</em></strong> <em>185453BR</em> <br/><br/> <em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.</em>

Title: Senior Project Manager - Transportation Infrastructure
Job_Description: <div><div><em>CIMA+ is currently seeking applications for an experienced <strong>Senior Project Manager – Transportation Infrastructure</strong> for our Calgary, Alberta office. We are interested in qualified individuals with more than 15 years of progressive experience leading the design and delivery of major transportation infrastructure projects. The successful candidate should have strong transportation project experience, superb interpersonal skills, and excel in written and verbal communication.</em> <br/><br/> <em>We are looking for a formidable individual who wants to be challenged and is ready to join a dynamic team that is rapidly expanding. CIMA+ is a well-established, multidisciplinary, Canadian engineering firm with expanding operations in Western Canada.</em><br/><br/><u>Responsibilities</u>   <ul> <li>Lead large multidisciplinary teams throughout the entire project life-cycle for major transportation infrastructure projects including urban roadways, highway interchanges, bridges, transit (LRT/BRT), intermodal yards; as well as other civil works such as site grading and stormwater management facilities</li>  <li>Oversee engineering, detailed design, tender preparation, and consultant services during construction</li>  <li>Accountable for budget, schedule and meeting the quality requirements of the Client while maintaining effective communication with the Client and stakeholders</li>  <li>Coordinate in-house support and subconsultant disciplines</li>  <li>Train and mentor less-experienced employees</li>  <li>Collaborate with other offices and sector groups</li>  <li>Lead technical report writing, including preparation of public documents</li>  <li>Lead project progress and technical meetings</li>  <li>Cost estimating</li>  <li>Risk management</li>  <li>Manage project budgets/schedules and ensure adequate staff on-hand to execute projects</li>  <li>Maintain Client liaison and meet Client requirements as per contractual agreements</li>  <li>Support business development by maintaining existing Client relationships and establishing new ones</li>  <li>Lead and/or support opportunity pursuits and preparation of proposals</li> </ul>  <u>Qualifications</u>   <ul> <li>Strong leadership skills, team spirit and a capacity for finding solutions to problems</li>  <li>A university degree in Civil Engineering, combined with a minimum of 15 years’ transportation project management experience</li>  <li>A minimum of 5 years’ relevant project management experience in Alberta</li>  <li>Licensed by the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) as a Professional Engineer (P. Eng.)</li>  <li>Experience working in a multidisciplinary team environment</li>  <li>Design-build / P3 experience</li>  <li>Construction site experience</li>  <li>Familiarity with TAC design principles, as well as the relevant policies, processes and procedures of The City of Calgary and Alberta Transportation</li>  <li>Familiar with project scheduling software</li>  <li>Exceptional communication skills including a strong command of English (written and verbal)</li>  <li>Ability to travel on occasion</li> </ul>  </div> </div><div></div> <br/> Apply Now!

Title: Project Coordinator
Job_Description: <strong>Project Coordinator (Calgary)</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Are you looking to be part of an Innovative, Environmentally conscious and Collaborative team? If so, look no further.</em> <br/><br/> One of the top ten general contractors in Canada and part of the largest construction organization in North America, Clark Builders serves industrial, commercial and institutional market sectors. Clark Builders core values represent the spirit that our company was founded on: Respect Others, Have a Can-Do Attitude, Succeed as a Team, Lead with Courage, Deliver Results. They are more than words: each one underlies the commitment that we bring to every person we meet, every team we build and every project we work on, start to finish. We are looking for team members interested in working in an Innovative, environmentally conscious and collaborate team. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Project Manager(s), the Project Coordinator will be responsible for assisting the Project Manager(s) in all aspects of the project that is assigned. Project Coordinator role is diverse, varies between each project. With your Project Manager(s) oversight, duties and responsibilities include and are not limited to: <br/><br/> <strong>Duties and Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Project Start Up</strong> <ul> <li>Tendering and bid evaluations.</li><li>Utilities and site services applications.</li><li>Permit applications.</li><li>Quantity take-offs for a various scopes of the project.</li><li>Letter of intent and Subcontracts preparation.</li> <li>Development of the project communication plan.</li><li>Schedule preparation.</li> <li>Project Execution and Document Control</li> </ul> <strong>Document Control</strong> <ul> <li>Request for Information (RFI).</li><li>Site Instructions (SI).</li><li>Submittals.</li><li>Change Requests (CRX).</li><li>Change Orders (CO).</li><li>Monitor and maintain the quality plan (QA/QC).</li><li>Monitor and maintain the schedule.</li><li>Facilitate meetings.</li><li>Record and compile meeting minutes.</li><li>Follow up on meeting minute action items.</li><li>Track productivity and performance of the project.</li><li>Project accounting basics.</li>  </ul> <strong>Project Closeout</strong> <ul> <li>Review, track and communicate punch and deficiency lists.</li><li>Administrative duties around the project closure.</li><li>Remove all insurance.</li><li>Closeout utilities and site services.</li><li>Remove temporary facilities.</li><li>O & M Manuals.</li><li>Assist with inspections, owner training and coordinate owner occupancy.</li> <li>Support and grow ongoing subtrade and client relationships</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Knowledge:</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills.</li><li>The ability to efficiently assist and administer multiple tasks.</li> <li>Analytical thinker to interpret information in order to understand issues.</li> <li>Ability to make decisions on a variety of levels of complexity, ambiguity and risk.</li> <li>Can define tasks and milestones to achieve objectives while ensuring optimal use of resources.</li> <li>The ability to read, understand and interpret technical drawings and specifications.</li><li>Skills and knowledge with the construction process.</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications & Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>A Post-Secondary Certificate/Degree in Engineering or the equivalent of a designated Professional Engineer or a Technical School graduate in a Construction related discipline.</li><li>Must have experience working in a Project Coordinator role for a Commercial, Industrial, or Institutional Construction organization.</li><li>Experience must include competently delivering on Project Coordinator tasks with in the phases of the construction process from project startup to project closeout.</li>  </ul> <strong>Competencies:</strong> <ul> <li>Networking and relationship building;</li> <li>Customer focus;</li> <li>Teamwork;</li><li>Interpersonal skills;</li> <li>Results focus; and</li> <li>Integrity.</li>  </ul>

Title: Senior Project Manager - Infrastructure Services
Job_Description: <strong>BE Innovative. BE Influential. BE the Right Partner</strong>. Be all that and more at Colliers Project Leaders. Join our team as a Senior Project Manager for Infrastructure Services in Calgary. <br/><br/> At Colliers Project Leaders, we help our clients succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed. <br/><br/> In this role, you’ll join our team of experts who lead building and infrastructure projects. Through our <strong>Get it Right Solution™,</strong> you’ll ensure we get it ready, get it built and get it performing -- so investors, owners and occupants are certain of success. <br/><br/> With over 600 employees and 27 + office locations throughout Canada and the Middle East, Colliers Project Leaders offers a multi-cultural, multi-generational work environment where we cultivate excellence, develop leaders and deliver on our clients’ vision. Colliers Project Leaders is part of Colliers International Group Inc. (NASDAQ: CIGI; TSX: CIGI), an industry leading global real estate with more than 16,000 skilled professionals operating in 66 countries. To learn more about Colliers Project Leaders, visit www.colliersprojectleaders.com. <br/><br/> We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> We’re looking for experienced project managers who are looking for the right opportunity to leverage their strong reputation in the infrastructure services sector into a successful leadership role. You bring a wealth of experience leading projects varying in scope and complexity in the delivery of municipal and infrastructure projects including transportation systems such as roadways, bridges, and transit ways, water and wastewater management, and other horizontal infrastructure projects. <br/><br/> You’re already known as a trusted advisor to your clients and have built strong, lasting relationships with senior leaders. You bring in-depth knowledge and have led and managed complex projects from start to finish – on time and on budget. You also maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients, keeping them in mind for new business and sales opportunities. <br/><br/> Are you looking to build upon your reputation as a project leader to make a difference for new clients and businesses? Look no further. <br/><br/> <strong>What success looks like:</strong> <ul> <li>You’ve completed a number of municipal and infrastructure projects, varying in size and scope ideally in the relation to transportation systems, water and waste water management and other horizontal infrastructure</li><li>You work closely with clients in the early conceptual stages of project initiation to ensure a strategic approach to project planning, setup and delivery</li><li>You are a trusted advisor to the client, applying your understanding of design, construction and operation of horizontal municipal infrastructure</li><li>Your clients are impressed with your ability to represent their best interests regarding contractual and technical issues</li><li>Your project teams rely on your ability to manage change, communicate and coordinate between multiple stakeholders, resolve issues, and deliver projects on time and on budget</li><li>A strong ability to lead the control of project related documents and deliver all work in accordance with company standards and procedures</li><li>You maintain contact with existing and prospective clients and respond to business development and sales opportunities with support from the Business Development Team, Principal or Regional Vice President</li> </ul> <strong>What you bring:</strong> <ul> <li>A university degree or diploma in civil engineering or a related discipline</li><li>A minimum of 10 to 15 years of experience in project coordination and management, representing owners to multiple stakeholders in the delivery of infrastructure projects for municipalities</li><li>Strong knowledge of various construction methodologies, project management models and financial management, as well as building codes, contract law and relevant legislation</li><li>Previous exposure to capital and municipal planning for horizontal infrastructure projects</li><li>Experience leading or considerably contributing to the preparation of RFP/Q’s, tenders and tender awards</li><li>Eng. or CET designation required and PMP considered an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus skills and experience:</strong> <ul> <li>Strong leadership and organizational skills with a proven ability to effectively influence others and resolve client, project and technical issues</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills</li><li>Proficient in MS Project, MS Word and MS Excel</li> </ul>

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: <strong>Company Description:</strong> <br/><br/> Gevity is an international informatics and management consulting company offering a full range of interdisciplinary professional services to clients seeking to build sustainable and effective health care and social services systems. Through our focus on the unique needs of the health care, social services and life sciences sectors, we work to support healthier lives through connected systems. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description:</strong> <br/><br/> This position requires an individual who is able to manage, coordinate and guide clients, providing strategic advice on an enterprise scale, while leading projects to fulfil that strategic vision. This individual coordinates a diverse team of professionals to ensure that project tasks are completed on time and within budget while engaging clients at the senior project management, executive and senior executive levels, ensuring accountability to organization strategy and objectives throughout. They are the liaison between the client and the project team, and are responsible for delivery from inception to sign-off. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> Expertise in effectively managing multiple stakeholders and developing and maintaining healthy stakeholder relationships. <br/><br/> Proven ability to proactively resolve performance, scope, cost and schedule issues with stakeholders as they arise. <br/><br/> Proven experience in ensuring accurate and timely communications to stakeholders including monitoring the communication network between the project team, and internal and external stakeholders and introducing changes where required. <br/><br/> Ability to clearly define scope and compliance with overall organizational goals; to manage and monitor project performance, identify issues and opportunities early and take pre-emptive actions if required. <br/><br/> Experience in developing and managing the schedule of all elements of a project including routine monitoring of performance and developing corrective action plans. <br/><br/> Proven expertise in defining project quality requirements and ensuring that the right systems are in place and applied. <br/><br/> Ability to provide clear and focused leadership for the project team to create a vision for project success and a strategy to fit that vision. <br/><br/> Focus on milestone and other key project objectives achievement. <br/><br/> Ability to provide mentoring and participate in staff performance evaluations. <br/><br/> Expertise in identifying, managing and mitigating project risks and opportunities and monitoring the closure of all identified risks and opportunities. <br/><br/> Sets clear objectives for the procurement of additional project resources as required. Ensures that services meet specifications and are delivered on-time and within budget. <br/><br/> Produces weekly and monthly status reports that clearly highlight the status, and identify where impacts or issues pose a risk to the schedule. <br/><br/> Develops project documents according to standard templates, using natural language. <br/><br/> <strong>Required Skills and Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> Post-secondary education in Health Informatics, Information Management or Information Technology (or relevant area) <br/><br/> Seven or more years proven successful project management experience for health and/or social service related projects. <br/><br/> PMP or PRINCE II certification. <br/><br/> CPHIMS-CA Certification preferred. <br/><br/> Ability to effectively manage project team logistics. <br/><br/> Capability to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously. <br/><br/> Excellent verbal and written communication skills. <br/><br/> Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. <br/><br/> The ability to effectively deal with remote teams and users. <br/><br/> Ability to travel. <br/><br/> <em>Gevity is an equal opportunity employer. Proof of credentials, as well as a criminal check, may be required for successful applicants. Resumes will be kept on file and candidates may be contacted for future opportunities.</em>

Title: Project Manager – Process
Job_Description: <div>Job Type Full Time</div> <div>Job ID PMPRO</div> <div>Job Description <br/>  <br/> Reporting to the Process Division Manager, the Project Manager will ensure the success of the project from purchase order stage through to unit completion. Success in this role will be determined by timeliness and accuracy of deliverables to internal and external customers, client management, and margin maintenance. <br/><br/> attend production meetings</li> <li>Conduct sales binder scope/estimate review prior to kickoff meeting</li> <li>Collaborate with inside sales and process engineering to confirm equipment suitability for intended use.</li> <li>Aid in schedule development with PM/Design/Production</li> <li>Schedule and chair sales kickoff meetings.</li> <li>Uphold and to company standard practices and guidelines to ensure consistency</li> <li>Review and approve pressure vessel drawings for technical and operational suitability.</li> <li>Review and approve flowsheet and layout drawings for technical and operational suitability</li> <li>Facilitate smooth fabrication and assembly phase by addressing inquiries from shop personnel.</li> <li>Enable smooth field installation and start-up by addressing inquiries from customer personnel on installation site.</li> <li>Develop and implement internal projects, department standards, and other projects as needed</li> </ul>  </div> <div>Requirements <br/>  <br/> <strong>Education and Experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Engineering Technologist or Bachelor of Science in Engineering</li> <li>Minimum 4 years of Project Management experience required</li> <li>Process engineering or instrumentation background is an asset.</li> <li>Project Management education, experience in a process equipment manufacturing environment a strong asset</li> <li>Working knowledge of relevant API and ASME codes including those governing plant control, shutdown, and relief</li> <li>Proven people and employee relations skills and experience</li> <li>Strong organizational and time management skills</li> <li>Good written and oral communication</li> <li>Delegate work effectively</li> <li>Quick problem solving and conflict resolution</li> <li>Competent current Engineering Software and Microsoft Office Products</li> </ul>  May be assigned other duties, in addition to or in lieu of those described above, and any duties are subject to change at any time according to the needs of the location or company. <br/><br/> <strong>Company Description</strong> <br/><br/> Everything we do at Compass Compression is geared towards providing industry leading
