applications including; Gas Gathering and Processing, Acid Gas, Vapour Recovery, Gas Lift, Storage, Separation, Refrigeration, Overheads and Solution Gas. We complement our Compressor and Process packages with in-house engineering, quality fabrication, field services and retrofitting capabilities to ensure support throughout the project lifecycle. Compass employees are team players focused on working together to consistently deliver value to our clients. Our expanding team is always looking for knowledgeable, ambitious and innovative professionals who can help us grow<br/>  <div>  <div> <strong>www.compassnrg.com</strong></div> </div>  <br/>our business.</div>

Title: Project Manager, Building Science
Job_Description: <strong>Project Manager</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Building Science & Sustainability</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Calgary or Edmonton, Alberta</strong> <br/><br/> Our Building Science and Sustainability Group provides integrated solutions to commercial, industrial, institutional and residential real estate clients who require reliable and cost effective project delivery in both new and retrofit construction. The combined skills of our engineers, architects, technicians and support personnel with their diverse backgrounds in design, project management and construction provide clients with a team recognized as leaders in the field. <br/><br/> Our Calgary and Edmonton offices are currently seeking Project Managers to perform and manage building science investigations, undertake new construction and remediation design and conduct on-site inspection and reporting services for Pinchin’s comprehensive client base. <br/><br/> <strong>Highlights of the role:</strong> <ul>  <li>Challenging work with a diverse group of national, regional and local clients</li> <li>Performing a variety of building science assessments and overseeing projects through to successful completion</li> <li>Building your leadership and mentorship skills by working with junior staff and a support team on projects</li> <li>Partnering with finance and administration support staff to address the financial aspects of project work</li> <li>Opportunities in Client Management, including participation in initiatives with our Marketing department to build new client relationships and maintain existing ones</li> <li>Significant growth potential</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul>  <li>P. Eng. or eligibility for P. Eng. status, or registered Architect</li> <li>Registered Roof Observer (RRO) or Registered Roof Consultant (RRC) designation would be an asset</li> <li>5 or more years of relevant experience with building envelope assessment and restoration design</li> <li>Thorough knowledge of the construction and performance of various building envelope assemblies and building science concepts</li>  <li>Ability to work well in a team environment</li>  <li>Familiarity with invoicing, budgeting, and other areas of project related financial management</li> <li>Experience with business development initiatives and client interaction</li>  </ul> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul>  <li>Perform building science assessments and lead investigations</li>  <li>Design and oversee building envelope restoration and new construction</li> <li>Schedule and conduct site visits and inspections</li> <li>Review construction work and report on progress and quality assurance</li> <li>Collate, interpret and analyze data in relation to regulatory and legislative requirements</li> <li>Coordinate permit application activities and duties</li> <li>Schedule and supervise sub-contractors and liaise between clients and subcontractors</li> <li>Represent the company in a professional and courteous manner</li> <li>Participate in business development and marketing to new and existing clients</li> <li>Foster and maintain long-term client relationships</li>  </ul> All technical staff require a car, valid driver’s license, and insurance as travel around the designated region is occasionally required. There are times when security clearance is required in order to gain access to a job site so a Criminal Background Check will be conducted. <br/><br/> We are proud to say we have been a “Best Place to Work” in the Great Place to Work competition for 10 consecutive years. We offer annual profit sharing, RRSP matching, a fitness reimbursement program and many other perks and benefits. <br/><br/> To apply for this position, please click “Apply” above. We appreciate submissions from all applicants; however, only those invited to interview will be contacted.<br/><br/>

Title: Project Manager - Freight/ Heavy Rail
Job_Description: <div><strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 4967 <br/><br/> <strong>Job Category:</strong> Infrastructure <br/><br/> With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we understand that challenges are changing rapidly in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff with experience in over 150 countries to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Manage projects including interfacing and reporting to clients, monitoring and managing budgets and schedules, and general project coordination;</li><li>Manage complex, multi-disciplinary, high-risk projects from start to close-out to meet Hatch commitments;</li><li>Scheduling, budgeting, and coordination of design disciplines and sub consultants;</li><li>Plan, organize and work with technical groups in the delivery of rail engineering project requirements including the provision of technical support to designers;</li><li>Provide leadership on technical design and deliverable requirements including: vertical and horizontal alignments; quantity and construction cost estimates; engineering design reports; technical specifications; material and equipment selection; cost estimates; construction contract documentation; compilation of design/construction drawings; etc.;</li><li>Provide support to business development and strategic initiatives, including preparation of proposals;</li><li>Provide local / remote support to other Canadian regions in the development and delivery of project requirements;</li><li>Through project efforts and involvement in industry activities, develop and maintain client relations.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>A Civil Engineering degree from a recognized university;</li><li>P. Eng designation is required, PMP would be an asset;</li><li>8+ years of project management experience for heavy rail and/or large complex transit projects;</li><li>Technically familiar with railway engineering design requirements and projects;</li><li>In depth understanding of CP, CN and AREMA specifications;</li><li>Experience and a successful track record working on CN and/or CP heavy rail projects would be a definite asset for this position;</li><li>Past work experience with a railway, consulting or construction firm would be an asset;</li><li>Must have sound knowledge of current engineering and construction principles, methods and practices;</li><li>Some familiarity with various civil engineering software design tools would be an asset;</li><li>Track record of delivering projects on time and to budget;</li><li>Experience with Railway Rules and Regulations and Safety /Operations Procedures is an asset;</li><li>Ability to communicate effectively and professionally with all levels of staff and clients (both written and orally);</li><li>Excellent technical writing skills;</li><li>Ability to work with minimal supervision;</li><li>Ability to maintain good working relationships with the various parties involved in the process;</li><li>Time management skills and ability to adapt to change;</li><li>Ability to effectively switch between various tasks and assignments;</li><li>Excellent analytical, problem-solving, attention to detail and decision-making skills;</li><li>Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills in complex and changing environments.</li> </ul> We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected status. If you have any special needs requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.</div>

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Overview<br/><br/>Compugen is an organization that encourages and supports ongoing training and development opportunities. We are composed of a talented, diversified workforce that performs collectively in an entrepreneurial and flexible environment. Our staff members have access to the latest and greatest technologies in performing their daily activities.<br/><br/>Responsibilities<br/><br/>Plan and implement small to large scale projects. <br/><br/> Direct all aspects of the project planning and execution phases. <br/><br/> Work with project team members to create detailed project plan. <br/><br/> Engage resources as required by the plan for the successful deployment of the project. <br/><br/> Detail and assign work package plans. <br/><br/> Meet regularly with the team to follow up on tasks, deliverables and issues. <br/><br/> Communicate status to the client via written reports and meeting or teleconferences. <br/><br/> Track project plan to baseline against time and budget constraints. <br/><br/> Manage project scope & handle scope change requests using appropriate documentation. <br/><br/> Log, monitor and handle project issues, analyze & recommend viable alternatives. <br/><br/> Hold weekly team meetings and attend client meetings. <br/><br/> Lead the Compugen team members towards the successful conclusion of the project. <br/><br/> Act as a single point of contact for both the internal Compugen team and the client team. <br/><br/> Manage customer expectations. <br/><br/> Ensure a high level of customer service and view toward repeat business. <br/><br/> Use Compugen's project methodology. <br/><br/> Ensure proper documentation is completed & stored where accessible. Documentation includes Statement of Work, plan, schedule, scope changes log, issues log, risk assessment, minutes of status meeting and PIR. <br/><br/> Must follow the Compugen Inc. Deployment Guidelines <br/><br/> Must strive to improve The Deployment Guidelines <br/><br/> Must be able to report on the P&L of all projects <br/><br/> Must report on the customer satisfaction of the projects; target is a letter of reference or project survey. <br/><br/> Must manage and escalate issues as required.<br/><br/>Qualifications<br/><br/>Well-developed interpersonal skills <br/><br/> Advanced skills in written and verbal communication <br/><br/> Analytical, systematic and forward thinker <br/><br/> Post-secondary degree/certification or equivalent <br/><br/> PMP certification nice to have <br/><br/> 5-7 year successful experience as a Project Manager, Project Leader or Delivery Manager is a requirement. <br/><br/> Computer literacy; proficient in word processing, spreadsheet, flowchart & presentation and project management software tools <br/><br/> Must be able to be comfortable in key technologies currently employed by Compugen (highly recommended) <br/><br/> Interest in continuing to follow developments in relevant technologies (desirable)<br/><br/>Employment Equity Statement<br/><br/>Consistent with our commitments to equity and diversity, we actively recruit from all designated groups. We also provide employment accommodation upon request to current staff members and to applicants during the recruitment process. We aim to provide a work environment where excellence is allowed to flourish and diversity is prized. Compugen is committed to providing accommodation throughout the interview and employment process. If you require an accommodation, the hiring manager and the human resources contact will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description: <div>We’re seeking a Product Manager who is ready for a high impact leadership opportunity, one that spans across all departments in Clio. Not only will you be learning something new every day, you’ll be working with a great team that traces its roots to places like Amazon, Expedia as well as a number of fast-moving, scrappy startups. You are the type that is as comfortable conducting deep dives into specific problem spaces as you are pitching executives and stakeholders on product strategy. You’ve also got a passion for understanding customers and have the skills to translate that into persuasive stories that inspire. <br/><br/> Founded in 2008, Clio is transforming the practice of law, for good. Whether it's our industry-leading cloud-based practice management platform, our ground-breaking Legal Trends Report or our ever-popular Clio Cloud Conference, Clio is at the forefront of advancing the legal sphere. With the help of the cloud, we make lawyers’ lives simpler and help them better organize and manage their legal practices. <br/><br/> As one of Canada’s fastest-growing companies with international reach, we employ over 250 individuals with a rapidly growing customer base spanning 90 countries. Clio has been recognized as one of CIX’s Top 20 Most Influential Technology Companies, one of Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers, and has one of Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures. Additionally, for the last two years, we have been recognized on Deloitte's Fast50 Fast500 lists</div><br/>  <div><strong>You will:</strong>  <ul> <li>Be the owner of an exciting product portfolio that will allow you to have a big impact on how lawyers practice law and make legal services more accessible.</li>   <li>Connect with internal and external customers to gather feedback that will drive your product strategy and roadmap.</li> <li>Balance the qualitative with the quantitative by using data to support and guide your decision making.</li>   <li>Understand the trends and disruptive impact of technology and invent on behalf of our customers to keep them ahead of the curve.</li> <li>Work across Clio departments (Development, Design, Marketing, Sales, Support etc) to ship and launch products that customers love. Own your portfolio and run it like your own business.</li> </ul> <strong>You should have:</strong>  <ul> <li>A philosophy around what great product management is. Tell us who your role model PMs are.</li>   <li>Great written and verbal communication skills.</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to execute projects successfully.</li> <li>Experience working with software development and design teams.</li>   <li>Humility plus strong opinions that are loosely held.</li> <li>Ability to travel up to 10% of the year.</li> </ul> <strong>You may have:</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years as a Product Manager. SaaS experience a bonus.</li> <li>A portfolio of successes that demonstrate your ability to think strategically and to place thoughtful bets.</li> <li>A great mind for effective prioritization.</li> <li>A university degree.</li>  </ul> <strong>Why Clio?</strong> <br/><br/> We could talk to you about our ping pong table, beer taps, yoga classes, and nap room, but, we know you’re looking for more than that. Instead, here are a few of the things that set us apart and make us the employer of choice for top talent in Canada and beyond:  <ul> <li>The chance to do work that matters on a product that truly changes lives. This is the place for driven people who want to make their mark.</li> <li>The freedom to choose your own path (and change it) to build a meaningful career that works for you.</li> <li>Excellent health and dental coverage, vacation time, parental leave options and education spending</li> <li>An RRSP matching program</li> <li>Regular games nights and team outings with the best co-workers you’ll ever work with</li> </ul> <strong>Diversity and Inclusion</strong> <br/><br/> We believe that ensuring diversity and inclusion will produce a better place to work and a better product. We encourage all candidates to apply.</div> <br/>

Title: Environmental Project Manager
Job_Description: Local Unit & Position Description<br/><br/>DNV GL - Renewables Advisory is currently seeking a motivated and passionate Environmental Project Manager The Project Manager will join the multi-disciplinary Environmental and Permitting Services (EPS) Section within DNV GL. The dynamic working environment will require easily adaptable and technical employees to provide services across a wide range of active projects, including those in the development, design, construction, and operational phases of project lifecycles. DNV GL is looking for a versatile individual with experience and training in relevant fields such as biology (wildlife, ecology, or conservation focus), land use planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy or a similar field. The selected individual will be responsible for guiding renewable projects through regulatory processes, interfacing with the Alberta Utilities Commission, Alberta Environment and Parks, Saskatchewan MOE and other agencies, and providing support to construction and operational compliance. This position is based out of our Calgary office. <br/><br/> <strong>Tasks may include:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong> <ul>   <li>Conduct the following studies:</li>  </strong>   <ul>   <li>Site selection and characterization studies</li> <li>Permitting and compliance matrix</li> <li>Technical permitting studies, such as visual impact assessments, and management plans</li> <li>Lead environmental assessments and environmental impact statements</li>   <li>Zoning variance, local ordinance compliance, conditional use, and other permit applications</li> </ul>  <li>Set project milestones for scope, schedule, and budget and ensure milestones are met</li> <li>Perform technical checking and initial approval of certain work products conducted by junior staff</li> <li>Collaborate directly with other business groups to complete multi-disciplinary deliverables</li> <li>Attend agency and municipality meetings, open houses, and stakeholder engagement sessions</li> <li>Prepare or coordinate standard proposals and bids</li> <li>Support the team members in preparing special or large-scale proposals and bids</li> <li>Promote the EPS Group through professional engagement with existing and potential clients</li> <li>Actively seek out practical and realistic business development opportunities in the Canadian market</li> <li>Participate in R&D projects under the coordination of the Team Leader</li> <li>Engage in facilitating innovative and new service offerings to anticipate/meet market needs</li> </ul>  Position Qualifications<br/><br/><strong>Position Qualifications</strong>  <ul>   <li>Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, namely land use planning, environmental planning, environmental science/engineering, biology, or environmental law/policy;</li> <li>Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in permitting</li>   <li>Advanced knowledge of environmental assessment regulatory frameworks in AB and SK and the ability to quickly adapt to and learn new regulatory frameworks for international jurisdictions;</li> <li>Proficiency with MS Office Word/Excel/Access;</li> <li>Experience leading environmental permit applications;</li> <li>Excellent analytical and reporting abilities;</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li>   <li>Individual should display a positive, team-oriented attitude to match our friendly work environment;</li>   <li>Demonstrated skills in project coordination, agency consultation, and environmental analysis; and</li> <li>Willingness and ability to travel up to 5% of the time domestically to conferences, client meetings, project sites, agency and internal meetings.</li> <li>We conduct pre-employment drug and background screening</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred skills (not required)</strong>  <ul>   <li>Understanding of Canadian wind and solar markets</li> <li>Master’s degree in a relevant field, namely land use planning, landscape architecture, environmental planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy</li> <li>Project Management Professional (PMP) or other technical accreditation such P.Eng., P.Geo, P.Biol., etc. is preferred</li> <li>Experience in conducting environmental and permitting due diligence reviews and understanding of international standards (Equator Principles, IFC Performance Standards)</li> <li>Experience leading proposals efforts and large environmental permit applications for energy projects</li> <li>Immigration-related benefits (for example, visa sponsorship) are not available for this position</li> </ul> <strong>Opportunities Beyond Business</strong> <br/><br/> DNV GL is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. <br/><br/> Our mission is to safeguard life, property and the environment. By joining us, you will work toward our meaningful vision: to make a global impact for a safe and sustainable future. DNV GL offers a congenial working environment, competitive salaries, and an exceptional benefits package. <br/><br/> Please visit our website at www.dnvgl.com<br/><br/>Company & Business Area Description<br/><br/>DNV GL is a global quality assurance and risk management company. Driven by our purpose of safeguarding life, property and the environment, we enable our customers to advance the safety and sustainability of their business. We provide classification, technical assurance, software and independent expert advisory services to the maritime, oil & gas, power and renewables industries. We also provide certification, supply chain and data management services to customers across a wide range of industries. <br/><br/> Combining technical, digital and operational expertise, risk methodology and in-depth industry knowledge, we empower our customers’ decisions and actions with trust and confidence. We continuously invest in research and collaborative innovation to provide customers and society with operational and technological foresight. With origins stretching back to 1864 and operations in more than 100 countries, our experts are dedicated to helping customers make the world safer, smarter and greener. <br/><br/> DNV GL delivers world-renowned testing and advisory services to the energy value chain including renewables and energy efficiency. Our expertise spans onshore and offshore wind power, solar, conventional generation, transmission and distribution, smart grids, and sustainable energy use, as well as energy markets and regulations. Our experts support customers around the globe in delivering a safe, reliable, efficient, and sustainable energy supply.

Title: Senior Business Process Project Manager
Job_Description: Position Summary:The Senior Business Process Project Manager is a key role in 3esi-Enersight’s Business Improvement initiatives. The successful candidate will be able to transition rapidly and effectively between hands-on project management within individual projects in support of overall program goals and deliverables, and high-level relationship building and program strategy planning and execution. The ideal candidate will have a proven history of project execution success, recommending and implementing change through developing business process improvements, and identifying potential risks. <br/><br/> Responsible for applying standard project management techniques and methods while directly interacting with stakeholders to ensure quality of the customer experience. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Perform 3esi-Enersight Project Management duties utilizing the company’s project & program management methodology and best practices for the organization</li> <li>Engage in a process of continuous improvement in order to mature and improve internal business processes and integrated business workflows</li> <li>Frequently and proactively communicate Project deliverables including managing expectations, presenting and interfacing with stakeholders and sponsors</li> <li>Deliver key company initiatives on schedule, on budget, and to specification</li> <li>Resolve any issues using appropriate conflict resolution skills</li> <li>Manage full Project lifecycle including initial planning, scoping, scheduling, resourcing, monitoring project implementation metrics, action items, and deliverables, performing quality control and validation activities, and project closure activities</li> <li>Previous experience with company integrations, M&A experience an asset</li> <li>Lead companywide process improvement through providing project management resources and support to large-scale departmental and cross-functional projects</li> </ul>  <strong>Accountability and Authority:</strong>   <ul> <li>Accountable for ensuring project activities occur and milestones and are completed</li> <li>Accountable for ensuring project work does not proceed if not funded (i.e., over budget) without internal approval</li> <li>Accountable for providing monthly department progress report to Executive team</li> <li>Accountable for global project deliverables being delivered on time, on budget, and clear of significant quality issues</li> </ul>  <strong>Key Competencies:</strong>   <ul> <li>Excellent communication skills, and the confidence to communicate effectively to staff and at all levels of management including C Suite</li> <li>Strong technical skills, with ability to think through details and tactics without losing sight of overall strategic goals</li> <li>Strong cross functional management skills</li> <li>Excellent presentation and Excel skills</li> <li>Set achievable goals and deadlines. Maintain committed to achieving goals in the face of obstacles and frustrations. Have a strong sense of urgency about solving problems and attaining favorable results</li> <li>Manage and oversee all levels of project implementations</li> <li>Manage multiple priorities and have excellent organizational skills</li> <li>Effective leadership attributes; delegate tasks and train others</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>10+ years professional experience as a Project Manager and 5+ years a Business Process Improvement role</li> <li>University Degree, preferably Business or equivalent</li> <li>MBA, or other advanced management training, desired</li> <li>PMI Project Manager Professional (PMP) Designation, PMI Program Management Professional (PgMP), Prince2 or equivalent, desired</li> <li>Previous experience with budgeting, execution or program management processes will be beneficial</li> <li>Complete working knowledge of Change Management and associated Best Practices</li> <li>Experience with business architecture and business process management methodologies</li> <li>Valid passport required</li> </ul>  <strong>Other:</strong> <br/><br/> Some international travel can be expected (20 to 30%)

Title: Project Coordinator
Job_Description: Job Description<br/> <div>You want a career where you utilize your exceptional communication skills. You are capable of coordinating all the city construction approvals. You want to embrace our vision and our values around our people (learning, growing, and having fun), our business (longevity, sustainability, growth), and our community (pride, impact, legacy). <br/><br/> Join our fast-paced and motivated team at Strategic Group, Calgary, as the<strong> Project Coordinator.</strong> You will work with and support the Project Manager, Superintendent and other members of the team.</div> <br/>Job Requirements <br/><br/> As our <strong>Project Coordinator,</strong> you will:  <ul> <li>Have a minimum of 2 years construction experience</li> <li>Have a certificate or degree in a related field</li> <li>Receive all invoices, maintain all the related paper administrative work on site and act as main liaison with the team in Head Office</li> <li>Issue all change orders and site instructions to subtrades on site</li> <li>Prepare, submit and track requests for information</li> <li>Coordinate all the shop drawings from subtrades and ensure they have been communicated to all the stakeholders</li> <li>Deal with the procurement for the day to day operations on site</li> <li>Send award and rejection letters for subtrades</li> <li>Coordinate and schedule utilities</li> <li>Coordinate weekly meetings and take minutes</li> <li>Liaison with City for construction needs</li> <li>Create and maintain hand over manuals to client</li> <li>Track inventory and rental equipment on site</li> <li>Be efficient in MS Office and MS Project</li> <li>Have a proficient knowledge on budgets</li> </ul>

Title: Project Manager - Multi-Family Projects
Job_Description: <strong>Homes by Avi</strong> takes pride in reshaping the face of Alberta’s communities. We’ve consistently maintained our direction, always remaining focused on the human factor and the details that set Homes by Avi apart from the competition. We’re proud that we have been building homes for Albertans for forty years, but most of all, we are proud that, through our craft, we are able to make dreams reality. <br/><br/> By redefining multi-family developments, our broad range of communities includes Calgary townhomes and mid-rise residential developments, as well as townhomes in Edmonton. Each of the Avi Urban multi-family developments conveys our passion for design and reputation of building quality homes.<br/><br/>Required Skills<br/><br/><strong>Project Manager - Multi-Family Projects</strong> <br/><br/> Your main role will be to ensure that assigned multi family projects are completed on time, within budget and to the quality standards of Homes by Avi, and Alberta New Home Warranty. You will be responsible for producing accurate quantity take offs, creating, managing and maintaining project cost budgets and keeping the project on schedule while flagging and communicating potential issues with upper management. You will report directly to the Production Manager and will liaise with suppliers and trades to ensure efficiency in costs, quality and timeliness.<br/><br/>Required Experience<br/><br/>If you have 5+ years of on-the-job multi family project management experience, construction estimating knowledge, exceptional customer service, a combination of commercial & residential experience as well as working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite of products, we want you to join our team. Relevant project management certification and PHBI courses will be considered an asset. <br/><br/> If you are looking for a place to continue your project management career and make your own dreams a reality, submit your cover letter and resume via the Careers section of our website. <br/><br/> <em>Homes by Avi is an equal opportunity employer. All employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities.</em>

Title: Project Scientist, Wildlife Biologist
Job_Description: <div><div> WSP is currently seeking a Wildlife Biologist to join our Ecology department, located at our Calgary or Edmonton office. Working under the general direction of Ecology and EIA Team Lead, this position will be responsible for participating in wildlife related project field work. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Leading or participating in wildlife related field work</li>  <li>Wildlife data analysis and management</li>  <li>Interpretation and assessment of wildlife species habitat requirements</li>  <li>Assist in proposal writing, study design and implementation</li>  <li>Perform background research and analysis, including consultation with government agencies</li>  <li>Deliver high quality reports on time and within budget, drawing upon technical and scientific knowledge, training and experience;</li>  <li>Manage small to medium-sized projects, communicating with clients and reporting to senior staff</li>  <li>Work within a team environment and communicate effectively with all levels of staff</li>  <li>Training and mentoring of junior staff</li>  <li>Field work and travel is required</li>  <li>Other duties as assigned/required</li> </ul> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong>  <ul>  	<li>A University degree (B.Sc or M.Sc) in Ecology, Biology, and/or other Biological Science</li>  <li>Registered as a P.Biol. with the Alberta Society of Professional Biologists, or eligible for registration</li>  <li>Minimum of 5-10 years of field experience is preferable</li>  <li>Experience working in ecosystems within Alberta</li>  <li>Wildlife identification skills and experience in conducting field surveys in Alberta. Credible experience with breeding bird surveys in Alberta. Experience in amphibian and reptile survey techniques, and winter wildlife tracking.</li>  <li>Willingness to work in the field, occasionally in remote locations and outside standard office hours</li>  <li>Baseline reporting and environmental impact assessment project experience</li>  <li>Understanding of application of federal Species at Risk Act and provincial Endangered Species Act</li>  <li>Ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as within a team environment and under deadlines</li>  <li>Excellent communication and organization skills</li>  <li>Demonstrated technical writing skills</li>  <li>Highly developed computer skills with Microsoft including Excel, and Word</li> </ul> Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits). <br/><br/> To learn more about our firm and the projects we have been involved in, please visit our <strong>World of Possibilities</strong> microsite. <br/><br/> <strong><em>WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</em></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.</em></strong> <br/><br/> Company: WSP Canada Inc.</div> </div><div></div>

Title: Supervisor, Project Engineering
Job_Description: <div>Requisition Id: 15286 <br/><br/> Department: Operations Engineering Department <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is seeking a Supervisor, Project Engineering (Operations), to join our Conventional Business Unit (CBU) in Calgary, Alberta. Reporting to the Manager, Operations Engineering, the successful candidate will coordinate and manage the Project Engineering team within the Operations Engineering group. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:  <ul>  	<li>Working with the Manager, Operations Engineering to clearly establish project management processes, templates, and execution strategies for the project management team;</li> <li>Accountable to manage projects from inception to completion of commissioning and turnover which will include coordination with Operations personnel, management of engineering resources (either internal or external), development and management of procurement and contract activities, management of construction execution teams and management of commissioning activities;</li> <li>Development of PMO (Project Management Office) documents as required;</li> <li>Liaising with and coordinating project stakeholders to manage project scope, timing, resourcing, and execution;</li> <li>Working with the engineering team to coordinate the delivery of technical deliverables;</li> <li>Working with the SCM (Supply Chain Management) team to coordinate procurement and contracts as necessary for successful project execution;</li> <li>Working with the Pembina commissioning and Operations teams as necessary to ensure the project is appropriately commissioned and turned over;</li> <li>Working with the Pembina document control team to ensure all project deliverables are appropriately numbered, compiled and available for turnover to close out the project;</li> <li>Maintaining appropriate cost control and schedule to ensure successful project management and forecasting are in place;</li> <li>Coordinate and manage as necessary to establish construction contracts, construction supervisors, EHS professionals and other support staff as necessary to ensure successful field execution of the project;</li> <li>Coordinate as necessary with SPCC (Sherwood Park Control Center) and SCADA to coordinate commissioning activities, shutdown activities and other non-routine events as necessary for successful project execution;</li> <li>Consult and coordinate as necessary with the Pembina LARE (Land, Aboriginal, Regulatory and Environmental) group; and</li> <li>Other general coordination duties as required to ensure the necessary stakeholders are considered as part of the project.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Preferred candidate would have at least 10 years of combined construction and engineering project experience with either a P.Eng. or CET designation.;</li> <li>A background in the mechanical trades is a definite asset;</li> <li>Demonstrated experience in project coordination between design; engineering, field execution teams, commissioning teams and Code inspectors;</li> <li>Previous EPC design experience is a definite asset; and</li> <li>Fluent in the tools of project management including cost control, scheduling, contracts, execution planning and project closeout.</li> </ul> <strong>No agency calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. <br/><br/> Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. <br/><br/> Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. <br/><br/> Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. <br/><br/> Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. <br/><br/> ></div>  <br/>

Title: Senior Project Manager, P3 Highway-Bridge
Job_Description: <strong>Business Line</strong> Transportation <br/><br/> <strong>Position Title</strong> Senior Project Manager, P3 Highway-Bridge <br/><br/> Canada - Alberta <br/><br/> Calgary <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> AECOMs Transportation practice is seeking a senior project manager for large and complex multi-disciplinary Highway-Bridge projects in Western Canada. This position can be based in either AECOMs Edmonton, Calgary, or Burnaby offices. <br/><br/> The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:  <ul> <li>Managing large and complex projects for Provincial highway clients</li>  <li>Preparing P3/design-build bids/proposals for new work</li>  <li>Business development /developing leads aiding in winning new work</li>  <li>Preparing, monitoring and forecasting budgets/costs and project schedules</li>  <li>Building project teams and managing project staffing (using a disbursed engineering model)</li>  <li>Preparing and monitoring scopes of work and methodologies</li>  <li>Chairing frequent meetings (internal and client)</li>  <li>Overseeing quality review process for submittals</li>  <li>Non-project management project, or non-core, work could include some or all of design reviews, scheduling, report writing, presenting</li>  <li>Mentor and challenge developing staff so they grow in their careers</li>  <li>The candidate must have experience dealing with both clients and technical staff</li>  <li>The candidate must have experience interacting at an executive level (both internal and external)</li>  <li>The candidate should have a technical foundation in design or construction</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree</li>  <li>10+ years of experience managing highway projects</li>  <li>Must have been the project manager or design manager for projects with fees greater than $10 million and/or construction values of greater than $250 million</li>  <li>Must have P3 / Design-Build project experience (including both Bid and Execution phases)</li>  <li>Must have experience managing large and complex multi-disciplinary projects (e.g. road, bridge, drainage, lighting, ITS, environmental, etc.)</li>  <li>Eligible for P.Eng. registration with APEGA and APEGBC</li>  <li>Must have Highway project management experience (ideally with Alberta Transportation and/or BC MoTI)</li>  <li>Must have experience managing projects with fees greater than $10 million and/or construction values of greater than $250 million</li>  <li>Must have P3 / Design-Build project experience (including both Bid and Execution phases)</li>  <li>Significant experience in project management</li>  <li>Experience in budgeting, reporting, scheduling</li>  <li>Experience writing and winning significant proposals</li>  <li>Experience with business development</li>  <li>Experience interacting at an executive level (both internal and external)</li>  <li>Must have experience managing multi-disciplinary highway and bridge projects</li>  <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)</li>  <li>Proficiency in MS Word and Excel</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>15 years of experience with at least 10 years managing highway projects</li>  <li>Have or be eligible for registration with APEGA and APEGBC</li>  <li>PMP designation</li>  <li>MBA designation</li>  <li>Foundational experience that might include design and/or site work and/or construction /operations</li>  <li>Experience working on projects for Alberta Transportation (AT) or BC Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure (MoTI)</li>  <li>Value Engineering credentials would be an asset</li>  <li>US or overseas experience will be considered, but regional (Western Canada) experience is considered key</li>  <li>Experience with various delivery / procurement methods is required including design-build and P3</li>  <li>Should have a demonstrable network of client and engineering contacts</li> </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <br/><br/> At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees. <br/><br/> <em>NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Job Category</em></strong> <em>Program and Project Management</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Business Group</em></strong> <em>Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS)</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Country</em></strong> <em>Canada</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Position Status</em></strong> <em>Full-Time</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Requisition/Vacancy No.</em></strong> <em>187168BR</em> <br/><br/> <em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.</em>

Title: Project Manager - Mechanical
Job_Description: <div><div><strong>SUMMARY</strong> <br/><br/> BGIS, A Brookfield Company, is looking for a Project Manager - Mechanical to join our growing team! We are currently seeking a Project Manager with mechanical design experience for the Calgary area, who would have to manage several building projects in Bell leased and owned buildings as well as provide mechanical expertise for mechanical designs/scopes. The type of projects are primarily replacement of electro-mechanical equipment and building components due to end of life, addition of electro-mechanical equipment due to growth of Bell’s network, increasing electromechanical resiliency and upgrade of existing building equipment to meet the latest environmental requirements. Many of Bell’s buildings house telecom (voice, internet and TV), IT equipment (datacenter), studio’s and offices which are essential to Bell services, therefore proper planning, scope and risk management are required in the realisation of the projects. <br/><br/> The position would be for an intermediate to senior candidate and the individual is expected to be autonomous and would receive some coaching. The position also requires good communication and customer relation with our internal clients. <br/><br/> The Project Manager will perform/have the following duties/accountabilities as regrouped in the three main areas below: <br/><br/> 1. <u>Project Delivery in Mission Critical Environments</u>:  <ul> <li>Replacement or addition of building systems such as electrical, stand-by power, UPS, mechanical, HVAC, plumbing, fire detection, sprinkler, DDC, etc. in buildings housing telecom equipment, data centers, production studios (radio and television);</li>  <li>Taking into account building codes, occupational health and labor regulations;</li>   <li>Taking into account complexity of construction issues and risk mitigation for work in a live technical environments;</li>  <li>Work with internal groups such as program management, engineering. procurement, transaction management and operations teams, internal clients (requester of the project such as telecom, IT or production operating groups) to ensure the appropriate project delivery and maintaining good relations.</li>  </ul> 2. <u>Project Management Processes and Quality Assurance</u>:  <ul> <li>Use project plans, schedules and budgets to ensure the highest quality of delivery in accordance to project requirements (key date and Bell standards);</li>  <li>Ensure that the team (consultants, contractors, Bell Real Estate Engineering, buildings operation) delivers projects for Bell, on time, within budget and according to internal customer requirements;</li>  <li>Take a pro-active approach in the planning of key activities and therefore eliminate surprises/delays;</li>  <li>Obtain competitive prices and ensure that Bell gets the maximum value for the products and services;</li>  <li>Suggest when appropriate ways to improve existing processes or reduce cost without reducing on required quality</li> </ul> 3. <u>Communication and reporting</u>:  <ul> <li>Produce reports in order to keep the various internal groups informed on the project progress (schedule and budget), potential problems to come with a mitigation plan;</li>  <li>Develop and maintain good working relations with our internal groups (engineering, program, operations and internal clients) in order to demonstrate the added value that Bell Real Estate groups brings to their business</li> </ul> As Mechanical Engineer, the role is to:  <ul> <li>Provide technical support to buildings operation when there are mechanical issues on HVAC, water towers, chillers, condensers, CRAH and CRAC units, pumps, valves, sprinkler systems, emergency generator ventilation/exhaust systems</li>  <li>Prepare risk mitigation strategies based on reliability and resiliency</li>  <li>Base on project requirements (life cycle, growth, de-risk, improvements) provide mechanical technical expertise in preparing the scope/design intent which will then be used to tender for consultant design</li>  <li>Work with and review consultant mechanical design to ensure they are as per Bell Standards and scope</li>  <li>Provide mechanical expertise for commissioning of mechanical systems during projects</li> </ul> The approximate work load split between the project manager role and mechanical engineering role is expected to be PM = 80% and Mech Eng = 20%). Although the engineer will be located in Calgary, some of the sites that he will have to manage are located in other regions of Alberta such as Edmonton and Manitoba such as Winnipeg both also covers rural sites in those provinces. So the engineer will be expected to travel at times. <br/><br/> <strong>Essential skills/competencies:</strong>  <ul> <li>- University degree in Project Management and/or Mechanical Engineering from a recognised university</li>   <li>- Registered professional engineers in Alberta</li>  <li>- PMP certification would be preferred</li>   <li>- A minimum of 5 years of project management and/or construction experience</li>  <li>- A minimum of 5 years of mechanical system design and construction supervision</li>   <li>- Experience in managing projects in Data Center or telecommunication industry preferred.</li>   <li>- Knowledge/experience in use of Project Management software/tools (Microsoft Project, Excel, Power Point, PMWeb, etc.),</li>   <li>- Good knowledge in the following areas: codes, detailed estimating, SOX</li>  <li>- Autonomous, but also a team player</li>  <li>- Flexible to deal with tight deadlines and a quickly changing environment</li>  <li>- Detail oriented with strong analytical and problem solving skills</li>  <li>- Fluent English (oral and written) with excellent communication abilities; knowledge of French (desirable but not mandatory)</li> </ul> <strong>About Bell</strong> <br/><br/> Bell is Canada's largest communications company, providing consumers and business with solutions to all their communications needs: Data-center (Q9/NHS), Bell Mobility wireless, high-speed Bell Internet, Bell TV, Bell Home Phone local and long distance, and Bell Business Markets IP-broadband and information and communications technology (ICT) services. Bell Media <strong>is Canada’s premier multimedia company with leading assets in television, radio and digital media, including CTV, Canada’s #1 television network, and the country’s most-watched specialty channels. Bell Real Estate group manages over 8,000 buildings across Canada and the US.</strong></div> </div><div></div>

Title: Project Manager - Information Technology
Job_Description: <strong>Veris Inc.</strong> a Gevity company<strong>,</strong> is growth and project-oriented consulting firm that exists to deliver results. Veris works with medium to large organizations to improve operational performance, enhance organizational effectiveness and sustain positive results. These are just a few of the business problems we solve everyday. Our clients trust us to step confidently into challenging situations and produce the right responses. Our people find demonstrating results and a focus customer success rewarding and these values are ingrained within our culture. We foster long term, close working relationships with our consultants and are seeking individuals who desire a personal, team oriented approach to offering professional business solutions. <br/><br/> We are seeking a seasoned Project Manager with experience with Website projects. The successful consultant will have exceptional leadership qualities and will be responsible to:  <ul> <li>Apply Veris' established project management framework and standards to the delivery of solutions to our clients</li> <li>Educate and review established project procedures, processes, and methods with clients and their people</li> <li>Initiate projects with stakeholders and develop Project/Program Scopes and Charters for acceptance</li> <li>Develop clear resource, communication, and project management plans that address all established objectives for client projects or programs</li> <li>Work with clients to procure necessary resources and assets to complete delivery of selected solutions</li> <li>Communicate effectively with all key project stakeholders and Executive Sponsorship</li> <li>Influence and motivate project team members and other resources to meet and complete the highest quality of project deliverables</li> <li>Monitor and control project scope, budget and schedule</li> <li>Ensure project issues are identified resolved with appropriate timing and productive measures</li> <li>Identify areas of project risk and act appropriately</li> <li>Effectively close a project with client approval and satisfaction</li> <li>Review and document lessons learned within projects and make applicable recommendations for project framework refinements and adjustments</li> <li>Interview project stakeholders at project closure to garner feedback as to success, process, and overall quality of engagement</li> <li>Influence project stakeholders to follow standard project framework processes throughout the project's lifecycle</li> </ul> <strong>YOU DEMONSTRATE</strong> the following:  <ul> <li>Experience on a website projects (internal and/or external)</li> <li>A College/University education and 7-10 years IT or Business Project Management work experience or equivalent combination</li> <li>PRINCE 2 or PMP Certification or PMP Certification in process</li> <li>The ability to apply project methodology procedures to assigned project(s)</li> <li>A proven track record of managing projects and successfully implementing and managing formal quality processes in projects</li> <li>Exposure to large projects and/or management consulting</li> <li>Understanding and application of PMI principles, concepts and techniques on related projects</li> <li>Excellent communication (verbal and written), presentation, training and leadership skills</li> <li>Strong customer service skills</li> <li>The ability to express complex ideas clearly in written format</li> <li>Excellent facilitation skills – a true “self starter”</li> <li>Professional accuracy with high attention to detail</li> <li>Experience delivering Project Management in the telecom sector preferred</li> </ul> Interested? We’d like to hear from you! We are open to out consultant out-side of the Calgary area, however please note that rate must be inclusive of travel and living expenses. <br/><br/> We thank you for your interest but only those being considered will be contacted. <br/><br/> Job Type: Contract <br/><br/> Contract rates between $70/hr and $95/hr

Title: Project Manager – Retrofit
Job_Description: <div>Job Type Full Time</div> <div>Job ID PMRET06</div> <div>Job Description <br/>  <br/> <strong>Project Manager – Retrofit</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting directly to the Manager, Retrofit Projects; the Retrofit Project Manager is to ensure the success of the project from purchase order stage through to job completion. This is a technical role with a focus on partnering with Sales, Field Service, the Customer, and all other cross functional teams to ensure the success of the project. Success in this role means executing the project on schedule and within budget without compromising quality or safety, as well as meeting or exceeding customer expectations to ensure repeat business. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Functions:</strong>   <ul> <li>Manage the project in its entirely from purchase order stage through to completion</li> <li>Understanding and implementing project scope and client specifications</li> <li>Sizing and selection of all system components based on required performance</li> <li>Manage and oversee the Engineering and Design of the project including the BOM’s</li> <li>Sign off of all drawings ensuring their accuracy and completeness</li> <li>Maintain project schedule(s) and responsible for maintaining sold margins</li> <li>Issue change orders when applicable for changes in scope of supply</li> <li>Coordinate with procurement, suppliers, production and service to ensure timeliness, accuracy, and quality of final product</li> <li>Primary customer contact during job execution</li> <li>Assist Sales/Applications during the quoting phase to ensure accuracy and completeness</li> <li>Job site visits as required for successful quote preparation and job execution</li> <li>Participate in training and educational programs as required for ongoing success of the position</li> <li>Develop and maintain department policies and procedures including Engineering/Design, Safety, HR, and QA/QC.</li> <li>Assist with mentoring new Project Managers as they join the Compass team</li> </ul>  </div> <br/> <div>Requirements <br/>  <br/> <strong>Education and Experience:</strong>   <ul> <li>Engineer or Technologist Degree</li> <li>3 – 5 years of gas compression or related industry experience</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Ability to work with and understand Engineered drawings; P&ID’s, GA’s, etc.</li> <li>Ability to lead, coach, and mentor staff</li> <li>Delegate work effectively, quick problem solving and conflict resolution</li> <li>Strong People and Employee Relations Skills</li> <li>Strong Organizational and Time Management skills</li> <li>Good written and oral communication</li> </ul>  Duties are subject to change at any time according to the needs of the location or company. Other duties may be assigned, in addition to or in lieu of, those described above. <br/><br/> Compass prefers to promote from within wherever possible and will interview all interested internal candidates. This position may also be advertised externally. Employees are encouraged to refer any external candidates who may be qualified for the position. Compass reserves the right to choose the most suitable candidate for the position.</div>

Title: Technology Project Manager
Job_Description: At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career. <br/><br/> Join the momentum. We are currently seeking a Project Manager for our growing Technology team. MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Driving innovation throughout the firm, our Technology team provides industry-leading solutions that enable MNP to better serve our clients and people. We deliver on the strategic needs of service lines, industry and specialty groups, and operations at all levels throughout the firm. Our specialists develop, enable and support initiatives that allow MNP to deliver client service, collaborate, communicate and operate reliably and efficiently. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Expectations</strong> <ul> <li>Develop a project management framework, appropriate for the technology needs of the Firm</li><li>Coordinate with cross-functional project teams across the organization to plan, coordinate and manage technology projects ranging from software development, implementation and process improvement</li> <li>Collaborate with a variety of stakeholders and other subject matter experts, including the Development team to apply project structure and to drive multiple initiatives forward</li> <li>Create and maintain project documentation, plans, schedules and timelines, facilitate meetings and workshops and communicate project milestone progress on a regular basis</li><li>Create and maintain formal and informal plans, schedules and timelines including project charter, user manuals and other documentation, as required</li><li>Manage change in a complex and dynamic environment</li><li>Balance technology and business issues and communicate appropriately with both technology and business experts</li><li>Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches in order to improve work processes</li> <li>Manage, mentor, motivate and coach a team of Business Analysts and Quality Assurance Specialists towards professional and personal development by setting clear expectations, providing feedback and addressing performance issues promptly</li><li>Coordinate resources by managing project performance and ensuring timely execution of deliverables</li><li>Promote regular attendance, balanced lifestyle and high standard of team wellness</li><li>Conduct formal, written annual performance reviews</li><li>Develop a thorough understanding of MNP’s services, businesses and industry</li> </ul> <strong>Credentials</strong> <ul> <li>Completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in Technology or related discipline preferred</li><li>Minimum of five (5) years of experience in project management in a technology focussed role</li><li>Proven track record of successful program/project execution</li><li>Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate teams and influence across organizational boundaries</li><li>Demonstrated knowledge of modern software development methodologies - Agile/Scrum and Iterative</li><li>Experience with technology and software development projects in a professional services organization would be considered an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Integrity –</strong> professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships</li><li><strong>Energy –</strong> displays enthusiasm, optimism, drive and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle</li><li><strong>Diversity –</strong> understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences</li><li><strong>Communication –</strong> effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others</li><li><strong>Client Service Excellence –</strong> understands the importance of quality client service by being courteous, responding to client requests in a timely manner and monitoring satisfaction</li><li><strong>Teamwork & Relationship Development –</strong> works collaboratively with team members in order to achieve a common goal and develops, maintains and strengthens relationships with others, both inside and outside the Firm</li><li><strong>Accountability –</strong> takes responsibility for one’s own performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals; is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making</li><li><strong>Flexibility –</strong> effectively manages multiple assignments, adapts to changing priorities and is able to work independently or as part of a team</li> </ul> MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events and professional development assistance. <br/><br/> MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world. <br/><br/> #LI-LL1

Title: Manager, Project Management, Operations
Job_Description: <div> Careers / Jobs / Manager, Project Management</div><br/>  <div> <div> <div> Manager, Project Management, Operations <br/>  Calgary, Alberta, Canada</div><br/>  <div> Apply now <br/><br/> Share</div><br/>  <div><strong>Purpose of the position</strong><br/><br/>Reporting to the Director, Strategic Supply Management you will lead a team of project managers responsible for new product introductions, product transfers and customer specific projects. You will be responsible to manage and maintain the NPI process aligned with Smart’s ‘Commercialization’ process.<br/><br/><strong>Responsibilities and accountabilities</strong>    <ul> <li>Ownership and execution of projects post “Commercialization”, managing and interfacing with all functions in Smart to ensure that all aspects of the “product” meet customer and achieve Smart’s objectives in terms of quality, cost, service to the committed schedules.</li> <li>Develop plans, resources and project management methodologies, to ensure that Smart’s “Time to Market” product introductions meet “business case” objectives.</li> <li>Develop and manage individual and team objectives per SMART’s performance management system. Hold people accountable, measure accomplishments, provide feedback, delegate and keep people informed.</li> <li>Manage Operations project management resources in Calgary and in remote locations.</li> <li>Personally, drive key projects specific to Global Operations including those focused on improving processes.</li> <li>Ensure projects are adequately represented and manage resource constraints collaboratively with the other Operations and Product Development Functional managers.</li> <li>Lead analyses on global operational supply chain options related to make versus buy decisions, and expansion/modification of manufacturing, logistics or design sites. Provide business cases to support recommendations.</li> <li>Develop and maintain overall excellence in project management skills and methodologies.</li> <li>Develop and manage annual budgets of the department including departmental expenses, project expenses, and project capital.</li> </ul>  <strong>Supervision provided and received</strong>   <ul> <li>Manage a team of professionals in the new product introduction group including, procurement, component engineering, quality, manufacturing and test engineering extending to other functional groups including Product Development, Product Management, Marketing and Finance.</li>   <li>Receive guidance on overall company objectives and individual performance from Director, Strategic Supply Management.</li> </ul>  <strong>Working conditions</strong>   <ul> <li>Significant travel will be required as part of this role. Travel can be both in Canada and internationally.</li> <li>This position will require frequent conference calls outside of normal business hours.</li> </ul>  <strong>Education and work experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Degree in Engineering preferred. MBA an asset.</li> <li>Strong leadership skills with 5+ years’ experience as a people Manager</li> <li>10 years of relevant operations and/or project management with a broad understanding of key manufacturing areas including: planning, procurement, logistics and manufacturing engineering</li> <li>Experience with a variety of technologies including, electronics assembly, plastics, metal fabrication and test systems.</li> <li>Excellent communication, presentation, written, and interpersonal skills</li> <li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, uses multiple problem-solving skills and techniques and great at gleaning meaning from what-ever data is available</li> <li>Extremely, strong organization skills, coupled with project management, and collaboration aptitudes.</li> <li>Demonstrated success in a dynamic, team-based environment</li> <li>Experience using PLM system an asset, ie. Agile, Windchill</li> <li>Project Management certification preferred.</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>   <div> <div> Apply now <br/><br/> Share</div>  </div>  </div> <br/>

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Category : Construction<br>Location/City : BC - Fort St. John<br><br>Athenian Group is a full-service placement agency providing Professional Technical Recruitment, Staffing and Payroll services to Canada's top Consulting, Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction companies.Our focus is on providing businesses with the highest quality of worker for both contract and permanent staff positions.Our client, is a Leading Energy Services company with multiple business lines operating across Western Canada.Currently we are recruiting for a British Columbia based;Senior Project ManagerThe Senior Project Manager is a hands-on role accountable for budget, schedule, safety, quality and overall project performance; ensuring quality work is completed on schedule in an economical manner. This position is also responsible for providing leadership and direction for all levels of project leadership, along with promoting amicable relationships with all parties involved, including clients, engineers, suppliers and sub-contractors. This role reports to the District Manager.Key Responsibilities:	Working with the District Manager to develop and implement policies and procedures relating to effective project management.	Interface with the client Project Manager through project development, execution and completion.	Execute the contract to the client requirements and specifications. Ensure the scope of work, terms and conditions, and specifications are clearly understood and communicate them to management.	Ensure all components of the overall project execution plan are developed and directed at meeting project goals and objectives. Follow the company's project execution process, ensuring the development of:	Safety Management Plan	Quality Management Plan	Materials & Equipment Plan	Subcontractor Management Plan	Accounting Plan	Cost and Schedule Control Plan	Change Management Plan	Project Controls Plan	Develop the original budget, manage changes, determine progress, and generate forecasts.	Promote and ensure safety compliance in all areas of responsibility and actively resolve safety issues or concerns.	Provide direction to the Project Controls group; formally evaluate their performance and provide feedback, ensuring performance issues are resolved.	Identify capability gaps and ensure sufficient training opportunities are available to Supervisors and field staff.	Ensure all Supervisors clearly understand their roles and responsibilities.	Ensure project budget is maintained and adjusted as necessary with appropriate client and management communication and authorization.	Report performance to financial targets.Qualifications:	Superior client service skills.	Demonstrated ability to multi-task, probe, analyze and solve complex issues. Ability to work in a constantly changing environment and achieve quality standards. Strong organizational skills, including effective prioritization and follow-up. Working knowledge of such computer programs as spreadsheets, word processing, scheduling software, and project management software. Strong knowledge of quality control and construction safety. Strong understanding of Project Control mechanisms.Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree in commerce, engineering or technical trade certificate. PMI certification or post-secondary project management training is preferred. Minimum 10 years' management and supervisory experience. Minimum 10 years' experience managing multi-million dollar projects.If you or someone you know is interested in this position, please contact;Jason Wahljason@atheniangroup.caCalgary â 403-969-9962Toll Free â 877-877-5522<br><br>

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: <ul>    <ul>  <li> <strong>Reference Number</strong>: Senior Project Manager</li> <li> <strong>Location</strong>: Calgary, Canada</li> <li> <strong> Salary</strong> : $100 – $130K + package</li> <li> <strong>Sector</strong>: Construction Recruitment</li> </ul>    </ul>  <div> My Client’s Western Region continues to attract exciting project opportunities, and they are seeking a Senior Project Manager to join the team in Calgary.<br/><br/>Are you a professional who has built their reputation on effective leadership? Does your track record of project success set you apart from your peers? Does the idea of being able to stretch yourself professionally appeal to you? <br/><br/> The Senior Project Manager acts as a trusted advisor to it’s clients, representing their interests at all times and providing technical and project leadership to the teams they oversee. <br/><br/> Our people are not only Project Managers, they are Project Leaders who take a client centric approach to project delivery and are given the opportunity to demonstrate their skills and expertise on a diverse range of projects that vary in scope and complexity appropriate to their level of experience.<br/><br/>Why Senior Project Manager?<br/><br/>My client has built a solid reputation as an unrivalled, trusted leader of capital projects and is founded on a single powerful idea: a dedicated project leader working on behalf of the facility owner to bring value and ensure project success.
