Title: Senior Project Manager, Engineering- Port Coquitlam
Job_Description: <strong>Senior</strong> <strong>Project Manager, Engineering-</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Calgary, AB or Port Coquitlam, BC</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Director, Engineering, the Senior Project Manager, Engineering is accountable for successful completion of various capital projects while providing technical support and guidance in troubleshooting plant equipment and service issues. This position provides diligence, rigour, cost control and effective project management skills to deliver successful execution of major capital projects ranging in value from $5K-$2M. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Accountable for leading efforts to drive continuous improvement with regards to engineering and capital projects within multiple facilities.</li> <li>Manage various capital projects at our Port Coquitlam plant, Abbotsford plant and Hatchery from concept through to commissioning including budget preparation, cost tracking and negotiating with vendors.</li><li>Participate in the development of long term capital plan to support plant reliability and future growth.</li><li>Working with the plant managers and their teams, assess and prioritize process/project opportunities and manage it from beginning through to completion.</li><li>Provide technical support and guidance in troubleshooting plant equipment and services.</li>  </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>Post-Secondary Degree in Engineering, Mechanical Engineering preferred;</li><li>A minimum of 10 years of progressive engineering/technical experience in a manufacturing environment Minimum of 5 years’ experience in managing capital projects;</li><li>Experience in food manufacturing is required, meat manufacturing preferred;</li><li>Excellent organization and project management skills including planning, scheduling, assigning, budgeting and managing;</li><li>Travel is required</li>  </ul> <strong>Build your career, apply today!</strong>

Title: IT Project Manager
Job_Description: <div>We are Systematix and we are currently looking for an <strong>IT</strong><strong>Project Manager</strong> to work as part of our client’s global IT service team to deliver system solutions to meet business needs.</div>  <br/> <div><strong>ABOUT THE PROJECT:</strong></div><div></div><div>As Project Manager, you will be working to support and maintain production applications as well as new development and infrastructure projects. You will follow Agile methodologies for software development. Many of the project teams are located outside of Canada and offshore. Some travel will be required.</div><div><strong>ABOUT THE</strong> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong><strong>:</strong></div><div></div>  <ul> <li>Managing all components of moderately complex IT and/or business projects</li><li>Co-ordinating activities of team, identifies necessary resources and develops schedules to meet completion deadlines</li><li>Developing detailed work plans, schedules, project estimates, resource plans and status reports</li><li>Verifying team adherence to control and risk implementations as well as standards and process changes</li><li>Applying comprehensive understanding of how multiple areas collectively integrate within IT project leadership to contribute towards achieving business objectives</li><li>Persuading and influencing others through strong communication and negotiations skills</li><li>Utilizing comprehensive knowledge of multiple areas within technology to achieve technology objectives</li> </ul>  <div></div> <br/> <div><strong>ABOUT THE REQUIRED SKILLS:</strong></div><div></div>  <ul> <li>College/University level education in areas such as Computer Science, Information Technology or Business Administration</li><li>5+ years of experience with project management</li><li>PMP certification</li><li>2+ years experience in Agile environment</li><li>Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills</li><li>Excellent oral and written English skills</li><li>Ability to work and think globally</li> </ul>  <div></div> <br/> <div><strong>ABOUT THE ROLE:</strong></div><div></div><div>This is a 6 month contract with a strong likelihood of renewal to be carried out at our client’s location in Calgary, AB. Possible travel will necessitate a valid passport.</div><div></div><div><strong>APPLY NOW:</strong>  <br/><br/> If you are interested in finding out more please contact us or submit your resume to jobs@systematix.com</div><br/>  <div><strong>ABOUT SYSTEMATIX:</strong></div><div>Systematix is one of Canada’s largest privately owned National Consulting and Resourcing firms. With offices across Canada, we provide the highest caliber consulting solutions to hundreds of Regional, National, Provincial and Federal Government clientele.</div> <div>At Systematix, we pride ourselves in taking care of our consultant partnerships - by doing the little things that matter - like taking the time to get to know you, knowing when an opportunity is the perfect fit, informing you every step of the way, and building the foundation for long term relationships. We do the same with our clients, concerning ourselves more with the project than the position, so that we have the information you need to ensure an opportunity is right for you. We only work with people who enjoy making a difference.</div> <div>At Systematix, we bring people and projects together!</div><br/>

Title: Mechanical Project Manager
Job_Description: <strong>JOB DESCRIPTION</strong> <br/>  <br/> Since 1964 the MCW Group has built a solid reputation for the delivery of Professional Consulting Engineering Services, Energy Management Services, and Engineering Development Services. The systems designed by the MCW Group of Companies are built to deliver energy effectively in the form of lighting, heating and cooling, as well as information in the form of voice and data. By the very nature of the solutions provided, the MCW Group of Companies help to create the environments required for Clients to live, educate, work, play and heal. <br/><br/> We have created for our clients the largest block of verified carbon emissions savings of any Canadian consulting firm. For more than two decades MCW Consultants Ltd., and its sister company, MCW Custom Energy Solutions Ltd. have been providing sustainable building designs with the goal to permanently reduce our clients' environmental footprint and create sustainable communities. <br/><br/> For further Information please check out our website: www.mcw.com. <br/><br/> The <strong><em>Project Manager</em></strong> is the primary point-person responsible for planning, executing, and delivering engineering projects on time, within budget, and in accordance to specifications. To achieve these important goals, the Project Manager will define project requirements and scope, acquire project resources, and supervise the efforts of project team members. Efficient delivery of project deliverables, effective quality control, clear communication of expectations to stakeholders, and upward reporting to senior management are critical tasks that must be performed throughout each projects lifecycle. <br/><br/> <strong>Position:</strong> Mechanical Project Manager <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Edmonton, Alberta, OR Toronto, Ontario OR Vancouver, British Colombia OR Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> The Responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to the following:   <ul> <li>Manage and oversee Mechanical engineering projects of various sizes and complexity</li> <li>Analyze customer design proposals and specifications to determine cost effective solutions</li> <li>Ensure professional quality services in all facets of work</li> <li>Lead a project team to ensure technical accuracy of project deliverables</li> <li>Manage a team to ensure cost effective, safe and timely completion of projects to meet or exceed client expectations</li> <li>Manage project activities throughout lifecycle, including the allocation of adequate resources, documentation and other factors necessary for Title: Technical Manager - Fluids
Job_Description: <strong>Technical Manager Fluids</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Inland Technologies</strong> <br/><br/> For more than 25 years, Inland Technologies has specialized in the delivery of airport environmental compliance programs. Built on a foundation of continuous innovation, Inland Technologies is a vertically integrated company offering a range of airport services including spent aircraft de-icing fluid collection and recycling, wastewater management, and aircraft de-icing fluid manufacturing for reuse. We deliver services at small and large airports across North America and internationally using a range of technologies and customized equipment systems that are purpose-built to meet our clients needs. <br/><br/> Inland Technologies is a member of the Inland Group of Companies, consisting of:  <ul> <li>Inland Technologies, specializing in airport environmental services,</li> <li>IDS, delivering aircraft de-icing services, &</li> <li>Quantem Aviation Services, specializing in airport ground and cargo handling.</li> </ul> Quantem and IDS have been Inland Group members since 2015. <br/><br/> Collectively, the Inland Group operates in more than 50 airports in five countries. Each member of our family of companies is a leader, focused on the delivery of superior customer service and innovation. <br/><br/> <strong>Overview:</strong> <br/><br/> The Technical Manager - Fluids uses their technical knowledge and experience to support the Operations and Business Development functions of the Inland Group of Companies in the production and continuous improvement of industry-related glycol based fluids. <br/><br/> <u><strong>The position is based at any Inland facility including Charlotte, NC, Portland, ME (PWM); Denver, CO (DEN); Calgary, AB (YYC); or Halifax, NS (YHZ) and will be responsible to liaise with all Inland Fluids stakeholders.</strong></u> <br/><br/> <strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Ensure compliance with all occupational health, safety and environment laws, regulations and operating permits;</li> <li>Keep abreast of industry trends and inform relevant employees regarding up-to-date de-icing fluid certification requirements ensuring that Inlands de-icing fluid products meet or exceed those requirements;</li> <li>Participate in research and development project teams to ensure customers are provided with business solutions resulting from continuous and ongoing innovation;</li> <li>Work with relevant stakeholders in the development of new products and other fluid related projects through chemical experiments, testing, and analysis using techniques such as chromatography, spectroscopy, physical and chemical separation techniques and microscopy;</li> <li>Take steps to ensure fluid quality and provide emergency support for any product quality issues;</li> <li>Contribute to collaborative projects as required;</li> <li>Utilize spreadsheets to monitor quality metrics and perform statistical calculations;</li> <li>Liaise with relevant stakeholders to coordinate resolution of any fluid quality issues;</li> <li>Develop and implement compliance programs consistent with applicable professional practice and exceeding industry standards;</li> <li>Provide direction to and development of QA/QC Technicians;</li> <li>Develop and deliver applicable training to QA/QC employees, supervisors and the management team to ensure up-to-date knowledge and compliance with standard operating procedures relevant to fluid production;</li> <li>Ensure fluid production plans are aligned with operational need, corporate goals and sales targets;</li> <li>Develop and implement internal compliance programs and perform visual observation audit of all production processes and related reporting;</li> <li>Audit of all third-party toll blending facilities;</li> <li>Support winter operations team with lab testing for preseason and midseason samples from storage tanks, deicing trucks and nozzles;</li> <li>Support winter operations team through supply of sample kits, issuing reports, providing technical support and interpretation of lab results and sampling;</li> <li>Ensure advanced maintenance and calibration on analytical instrumentation is performed according to established methods, monitoring product quality to ensure compliance to standards, specifications and continued improvement;</li> <li>Oversee product quality and technical issues at customer locations, production sites and terminals;</li> <li>Provide internal and external technical and quality guidance related to fluid products;</li> <li>Monitor technical documentation to ensure up-to-date information and practices;</li> <li>Other duties as assigned by management.</li> </ul> <strong>As the ideal candidate you possess the following qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelors Degree in Science (Chemistry preferred) or completion of a two (2) to three (3) year college program in Chemical, Biochemical or Chemical Engineering Technology or closely related discipline;</li> <li>Minimum of five (5) years of experience supporting fluid development products in an industrial environment;</li> <li>Experience working in a chemical production environment;</li> <li>Experience utilizing various types of viscometers;</li> <li>Knowledge of and experience handling thixotropic fluids;</li> <li>Knowledge and experience working with OSHAs Hazard Communication Standard;</li> <li>Demonstrated knowledge, understanding and experience interpreting and implementing various occupational health, safety and environment laws;</li> <li>Computer literacy in Microsoft Office applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Office 365 and Access;</li> <li>Ability to self-manage multiple, simultaneous projects on deadline;</li> <li>Self-motivated and able to work independently while achieving outcome expectations;</li> <li>Strong attention to detail and analytical ability;</li> <li>Quick-thinking and resourceful;</li> <li>Above average written and oral communication skills;</li> <li>Open-minded, consultative and collaborative style;</li> <li>Represent the company at industry-related forums;</li> <li>Ability to work under pressure in a safety-sensitive industrial environment while maintaining professionalism in all interactions.</li> </ul> <strong>Travel:</strong> Approximately 30% travel to facilities throughout Canada and the U.S., possibly on short notice to meet immediate business needs. <br/><br/> Inland Technologies takes pride in growing and developing key talent. If your experience and ability meet with the above minimum requirements, please forward your cover letter and resume before May 22, 2018, quoting posting number 18-15. <br/><br/> We conform to all laws, statutes and regulations concerning equal employment opportunities and affirmative action. We strongly encourage women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and veterans to apply to all of our job postings. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, age, disability status, Genetic Information & Testing, Family & Medical Leave, protected veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law. We prohibit Retaliation against individuals who bring forth any complaint, orally or in writing, to the employer or the government, or against any individuals who assist or participate in the investigation of any complaint or otherwise oppose discrimination. <br/><br/> If you need assistance applying for this position please contact our Corporate Human Resources team by calling (902) 895-6346 ext. 324. You may also write to us and we will be happy to assist you with the application. <br/><br/> Human Resource Services <br/><br/> 14 Queen Street <br/><br/> PO Box 253 <br/><br/> Truro, NS <br/><br/> B2N 5C1 <br/><br/> <strong>Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer</strong>

Title: Project Manager - Industrial
Job_Description: Tracking Code <br/><br/> 630-104 <br/><br/> Job Description<br/><br/>Trotter & Morton Group of Companies are a diverse group of building trades experts offering unique and integrated construction solutions from earthworks and demolition services to commercial, institutional, and industrial construction to facility services and building maintenance. Since 1927, our skilled workforce has brought their high-quality workmanship, experience, and passion to a diverse project portfolio that includes some of Western Canada's most iconic structures. <br/><br/> Trotter & Morton Industrial Services is now looking to add a Project Manager to our Calgary Team to work on existing and future projects. The successful candidate will be an individual who is looking to grow with Trotter & Morton, who shares our entrepreneurial spirit, and who is looking for a long term partnership with an exceptional company. <br/><br/> <strong>Roles and Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Manage and supervise day to day operations of all staff teams on all assigned projects</li>  <li>Initiate, review and oversee all required project administration and documentation</li>  <li>Ensure contract agreements are expeditiously secured, reviewed, processed and executed</li>  <li>Review, finalize and distribute project budget</li>  <li>Conduct pre-construction turnover meetings for all assigned projects</li>  <li>Conduct planning meetings with the team throughout all phases of the project life cycle</li>  <li>Ensure all required permits and licenses are obtained and posted</li>  <li>Initiate set-up, monitoring and update of project schedule with project team</li>  <li>Coordinate all required procurement of materials and equipment</li>  <li>Responsible for subcontract agreement negotiation, preparation, processing and execution</li>  <li>Ensure release and expediting of all materials and equipment</li>  <li>Price, negotiate and process all change conditions and change work order. Maintain all required change related and change order logs</li>  <li>Oversee all tools and equipment rentals, ensuring unused tools are returned immediately</li>  <li>Responsible for overall financial performance of assigned projects, including continual cost control, management and forecasting</li>  <li>Establish project baselines with team. Measure and review variances throughout project life cycle</li>  <li>Manage all subcontractors and suppliers</li>  <li>Assist Division Manager as necessary to address, resolve and settle project disputes and/or claims</li>  <li>Ensure all projects are staffed with appropriate field forces and review labour productivity</li>  <li>Manage employees through performance appraisals and discipline</li>  <li>Other duties as required</li> </ul>  Required Skills   <ul> <li>Professional, approachable and customer-service oriented</li>  <li>Strong work ethic and positive team attitude</li>  <li>Attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy</li>  <li>Good mathematical and analytical skills</li>  <li>Ability to prioritize workloads and utilize planning & time management skills to adhere to strict deadlines</li>  <li>Strong oral and written communication skills</li>  <li>Be fluent and adapt throughout the project life cycle</li> </ul>  Required Experience   <ul> <li>Ability to budget/estimate mechanical work</li>  <li>Ability to understand and communicate advanced mechanical concepts</li>  <li>Advanced computer skills (MS Office, Project and Access)</li>  <li>Completion of a Mechanical Engineering Degree or CET</li>   <li>Journeyman ticket would be an asset</li>  <li>PMP or equivalent is strongly recommended</li>  <li>Minimum of 4 years of experience required, within construction</li> </ul> We offer an excellent, competitive salary along with a comprehensive benefit package. <br/><br/> We firmly believe our employees are our best assets and we are committed to providing ongoing training and support to allow them to reach their full potential. Trotter & Morton Group of Companies is an industry-leader in safety, and we strive for an incident-free workplace in all aspects of our operations. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Commitment to Diversity</strong> <br/><br/> The Trotter & Morton Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to hiring talented, qualified professionals without regard to race, age, gender, or any other protected ground and to providing an environment without discrimination. <br/><br/> Every effort is made to provide fair and equal employment and development opportunities and to ensure that our policies regarding hiring, compensation, promotions, and transfers are based solely on skills and capabilities, job requirements, job performance, and other job-related criteria. <br/><br/> If you have a strong work ethic and commitment to excellence, apply today and build a rewarding career as a member of our high-performing team. <br/><br/> Click New Resume/CV to begin the online application process. Click Existing Resume/CV if you have previously applied to a position and would like to update your online application profile. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance, however, we will only contact candidates selected for an interview.<br/><br/>Job Location <br/><br/> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/><br/> Position Type <br/><br/> Full-Time/Regular

Title: Project Manager/Engineer
Job_Description: We have an opening for full-time <strong>Project Manager/Engineer</strong> in our <strong>Calgary</strong> office that will be responsible for executing integrated construction projects while following corporate quality standards throughout the project life cycle within our Power & Building Solutions group. <br/><br/> <strong>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <ul>  <li>Manage large scale electrical based (low and medium voltage) projects such as Electrical and VFD buildings from quotation throughout design, construction, delivery and support.</li> <li>Act as project subject matter expert (SME) for supplied integrated equipment.</li> <li> Act as the primary point of contact for clients, subcontractors, senior management and the project team. Manage multiple stakeholders and vendors while maintaining and developing client relationships throughout the project and post-completion review.</li> <li>Be an active participant in the high level design, including general arrangements and optimizing building layouts. Manage and provide input on all drawing review cycles from IFA to As Built from the client, subcontractors and internal teams.</li> <li>Have a working knowledge of the document control process to properly expedite supplier and client data deliverables based on the approved Vendor Drawing and Data Requirements (VDDR) list.</li>  <li>Manage project execution to ensure adherence to budget, schedule, change management, risk management, scope and specifications.</li> <li>Chair and manage all project meetings including kickoff meetings, pre fabrication meetings, client status reviews and executive status updates.</li>  <li>Take an active role in the execution and construction of projects including subcontractor site visits, fabrication yard inspections and testing programs.</li> <li>Support the Inside Sales Team during the Request for Quotation (RFQ) process.</li> <li>Prepare periodic status and progress reports/presentations for clients and Tundra’s Executive Committee.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Minimum 5-10 years of project management experience, focusing on industrial construction.</li> <li>A bachelor’s degree/diploma in engineering from an APEGA or ASET with a focus in electrical engineering.</li>  <li>PMP Designation is an asset.</li> <li>Thorough understanding of electrical design, schematics, specifications and codes/standards.</li> <li>Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills – both verbal and written.</li> <li>Applied understanding of document control processes and tracking change through the project life cycle.</li> <li>Proficiency of the Microsoft Office Suite including MS Project, Excel, Word, PowerPoint.</li> <li>SAP experience an asset.</li> <li>Must have a valid driver’s license and passport.</li> <li>Minimal travel required.</li>  </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> We offer a base salary with benefits and a generous compensation package. We have a strong philanthropic presence within Alberta and work closely with charities such as The Kids Cancer Care Foundation of Alberta, motionball and others. We are always looking to provide our employees with different opportunities to give back to the community, often during work hours.

Title: Project Manager - Advanced Inspection Technologies
Job_Description: <div> Apply <br/> <br/>  Project Manager - Advanced Inspection Technologies</div> <br/>ROSEN is a leading privately owned company that was established as a one-man business in 1981. Over <br/> the last 35 years, ROSEN has grown rapidly and is today a worldwide technology group that operates in <br/> more than 120 countries with over 3,000 employees. <br/><br/> ROSEN is an extended team of people with a passion for technology and innovation. <br/> Our claim “empowered by technology” is the key to our sophisticated and highly innovative products and <br/> services to the oil and gas and other engineering industries. The focus of all our research efforts and high <br/> tech solutions is on a safe operation of assets and therefore provide protection for both people and the <br/> environment.<br/><br/>Description<br/><br/>At ROSEN Canada we work collaboratively to get the job done. We recognize that each person and every department are integral to meet the needs of our clients and to continue to be a leader in what we do. We also recognize that our employees have different needs and we want to make sure they are being taken care of. <br/> Due to our rapid growth, we are currently seeking a qualified full time permanent Project Manager to join our Project Management team. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Detailed duties include:</u> <br/><br/> </strong>   <ul> <li>Fully responsible for the coordination of all internal processes related to project activities;</li> <li>Read and understand customer specifications and fully ensure product/project are aligned with customer requirements;</li> <li>Work in close cooperation with the Sales Manager to validate commercial, technical and contractual specifications (terms & conditions) for the assigned projects</li> <li>Lead and manage the project team</li> <li>Timely, in-quality and in-budget provision of required deliverables;</li> <li>Build and maintain relationships internally and externally;</li> <li>Close consultation with the client in accordance with internal quality standards;</li> <li>Monitor project planning, progress, quality, cash flow and budget of projects;</li> <li>Provide project information for internal processes as well as managing and coordinating these processes;</li> <li>Approve final project deliverables</li> <li>Project evaluation and identification of potential process improvements;</li> <li>Timely, accurate and complete reporting on the project progress & closure.</li> <li>Main point of contact for supply chain, data evaluation, field services, maintenance and external suppliers.<br/><br/>Requirements<br/><br/><u><strong>Qualifications and Skills Required:</strong></u></li> <li>A minimum of 10 years of experience in a technical/commercial role, preferably in the Oil & Gas, Pipeline or Pipeline Inspection industry is required;</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree (within a technical discipline is preferred) or equivalent experience;</li> <li>PMP designation and/or specialized project management or business administration courses in an asset;</li> <li>Registration with APEGA is an asset.</li> <li>Superior written and verbal English communication skills are required.</li> <li>Ability to travel (local and international) as required.</li> <li>Ability to be proactive as well as trouble shoot and resolve issues as they occur.</li> <li>PC literacy with MS office packages.</li> <li>Excellent analytical, organizational, interpersonal and negotiation skills;</li> <li>Establish and maintain effective working relationships with internal and external customers.</li> <li>Demonstrated positive QHSE attitude.</li> <li>Strong organizational skills, the ability to multi-task and handle multiple priorities and changes with professionalism</li> <li>Ability to apply Management of Change (lessons learned) as well as to multiply and train</li> <li>Ability to implement and follow related company policy and procedures for daily operations.</li> <li>Work independently, as well as within a team, in a fast paced, customer service driven team environment.<br/><br/>We offer<br/><br/>ROSEN offers a competitive compensation package, including a comprehensive benefit plan, Health & Wellness program, RRSP matching, flexible work hours, a great learning environment, interesting & challenging work and the opportunity for career advancement.</li> </ul>  Pre-employment Criminal Record check is required as part of the pre-employment process for selected candidates. Please note only those candidates selected for interview will be contacted – no phone calls please.

Title: Project Development Manager
Job_Description: <strong>Manager, Project Development</strong> <br/><br/> Based in Calgary, the Manager, Project Development, will report to the Vice President, Project Development. The Manager, Project Development will be responsible to promote, develop and manage Clark Builders strategic relationships to seek and attract business to ensure growth and success of the Southern Alberta Business Unit, and Clark Builders as a whole. This includes seeking opportunities across Western Canada. <br/><br/> <strong>Duties/Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li><div>Execute the business development strategy to achieve growth targets</div></li><li><div>Initiate and maintain excellent relationships with new and existing clients in the primary strategic area of focus; seniors, healthcare, commercial, institutional, public assembly, residential, education</div></li><li><div>Recognize opportunities for business that may arise in secondary areas of focus: self perform concrete, metal building solutions, metal cladding solutions, solar and energy</div> </li><li><div>Understand client needs and be able to communicate with confidence how Clark Builders can successfully meet those objectives</div></li><li><div>Research in order to identify emerging market opportunities and monitor competitor activities</div> </li><li><div>Review and understand request for proposals in order to complete pre-qualification requirements for projects and attend pre-bid meetings</div></li><li><div>Work with the Estimating and Project Development team to provide and create proposal content, complete prequalification documents to successful outcomes, manage pre-construction estimates and create development strategies to secure projects</div></li><li><div>Help develop and implement market strategies and identify target market groups and areas</div></li><li><div>Attend pre-award meetings as required and assist in the negotiation of final contracts</div></li><li><div>Identify new work leads and manage lead follow-up, record keeping and information distribution</div></li><li><div>Follow up with clients after the award of a project to ensure superior customer service and identify opportunities for additional work</div></li><li><div>Assist other members of the in the development and creation of effective promotional literature for the business unit</div></li><li><div>Work with associations, industry and community groups to help develop the Clark Builders brand</div></li><li><div>Coordinate and facilitate Clark Builders industry outreach and networking events</div></li><li><div>Other duties and responsibilities as required</div></li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Knowledge:</strong> <ul> <li><div>Track record of success with excellent relationships in the commercial construction business community</div> </li><li><div>Well-established network of industry contacts</div> </li><li><div>Strong personal motivation and business development skills needed to proactively generate and win major project opportunities</div></li><li><div>Proven ability to build strategic relationships with high level influencers</div> </li><li><div>Resource development experience</div></li><li><div>Superior communication skills (verbal, written & presentation)</div></li><li><div>Friendly, outgoing demeanour with strong diplomatic skills to deal with a large variety of personalities with an ability to explain, defend and present ideas</div></li><li><div>Strong team player who is able to work effective with a wide array of individuals</div> </li><li><div>Excellent organizational, analytical and negotiation skills</div></li><li><div>Capable of working under pressure to meet deadlines and prioritize work</div> </li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications & Experience:</strong> <ul> <li><div>Post Secondary Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Business</div> </li><li>A minimum of 10+ years relevant experience with a commercial construction company</li><li>Existing relationships with key stakeholders in the specific sectors of focus considered a definite asset</li><li>Strong knowledge and understanding of industrial site construction will be considered as asset</li><li>Proven track record in delivering and managing the preconstruction process for complex projects</li><li>Experience with estimating, project management, and/or preconstruction</li><li>Experience and success with RFQ/RFP response creation, content development, and execution from submission to award.</li> </ul>

Title: Environmental Project Manager
Job_Description: Reporting to the Territory Manager, Site Assessment and Remediation – Alberta North, the Environmental Project Manager supports the full life cycle of a project. The position entails the following responsibilities: <br/><br/> Set and maintain project schedules and budgets; makes decisions with respect to overall technical execution of the project; liaises with technical specialists or other senior project managers to ensure the technical integrity of the project. <br/> Provide technical expertise for contaminated site investigation and remediation programs. <br/> Interprets findings and preparation and/or review of technical reports. <br/> Supervision and mentorship of junior professional staff involved in carrying out field programs, ensuring project requirements are communicated and health and safety protocols are adhered to. In addition, completing annual performance reviews, objective setting, and support for direct reports to achieve set objectives. <br/> Actively promote Health and Safety programs and culture. <br/> Active in business development activities and maintaining client relationships. <br/> Participates in the preparation of proposals and cost estimates. <br/> Participates in short and long range planning within assigned clients group or offices. <br/> TECHNICAL SKILLS REQUIRED: <br/><br/> Experience with the interpretation of provincial and federal environmental regulations. <br/> Experience completing Phase I and Phase II Environmental Site Assessments on a variety of contaminated sites (e.g., downstream, midstream, upstream oil & gas, etc.). <br/> Characterize environmental aspects of site based on interpretation of data collected during site investigation, sampling and analysis (for example, contaminants, their concentration and general extent). <br/> Determine the need and scope for sampling program, including environmental indicators, chemicals of concern, and sampling constraints. <br/> Develop environmental sampling protocols, the frequency and timing of sampling, optimum locations for continuous or discrete sampling, data capture systems, and parameter list for analysis. <br/> Assess the accuracy and precision of analytical results by applying good practice guidance or established QA/QC methods. <br/> Interpret analytical data to identify trends, significant changes from historical patterns, deviations, or evidence of environmental stresses, etc. <br/> Ensure site assessment is completed properly and that action plans are developed and implemented to satisfactorily achieve the desired outcomes. <br/> Prepare site assessment report(s) to meet regulatory and other requirements, identifying potential risk and scope of further action by appropriate stakeholders, if necessary. <br/> Communicate results of site assessment to stakeholders such as property owners, responsible party, regulators, the public, etc. via a public consultation or other appropriate communication process. <br/> MINIMUM EDUCATION: University Degree in a relevant field <br/><br/> FIELD(S) OF STUDY: Chemistry, Engineering, Environmental, Environmental Assessment, Environmental Science, Forestry, Geology, Hydrogeology, Land Reclamation, Soil Science, Biology & Environmental Studies, Ecosystem Restoration, Agronomy <br/><br/> YEARS OF EXPERIENCE: 7 to 15 <br/><br/> ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS: Must have the ability to acquire professional designation within two years of employment if not currently registered. <br/><br/> RANSFERABLE SKILLS REQUIRED: <br/><br/> PROFESSIONAL ETHICS AND WORK STYLE <br/><br/> Maintains good standing in professional associations, practicing professional ethics and remaining current in practice requirements. <br/> Demonstrates professional, ethical conduct, such as trust, integrity, confidentiality and discretion during the conduct of all work activities. <br/> Cooperates willingly with others in dealing with changing situations, conditions, and expectations. <br/> Balances the need for attention to detail with a focus on goals and objectives to achieve the desired outcomes. <br/> Applies principles of quality assurance and scientific rigour in all work activities. <br/> LEARNING AND CREATIVITY <br/><br/> Stays current on the theory and practice pertinent to ones roles and responsibilities. <br/> Continuously pursues personal learning and development opportunities to promote professional growth and development. <br/> COMMUNICATING EFFECTIVELY <br/><br/> Prepares clear, well-formatted reports and other written communications that meet established protocols and are appropriate to the target audience. <br/> Communicates clearly and respectfully using verbal and nonverbal language appropriate to the cultural and social context <br/> Conveys technical information accurately, clearly and concisely, interpreting it appropriately and effectively for the target audience. <br/> COLLABORATION <br/><br/> Builds constructive networks inside and outside the organization to facilitate the accomplishment of results. <br/> CRITICAL THINKING/JUDGEMENT <br/><br/> Makes decisions in a timely manner, committing to a course of action that considers pertinent data, information, options and implications. <br/> PLANNING AND ORGANIZING WORK AND PROJECTS <br/><br/> Develops work/project plans, identifying the work to be accomplished, the risk/contingencies that may arise, and how they will be addressed. <br/> Coordinates resources (including financial, logistical, supplies, etc.) needed to implement work/project plans and achieve desired results. <br/> LEADING/INFLUENCING OTHERS <br/><br/> Manages the work of others, including project teams, working groups and contractors. <br/> Identifies the individual/and or team competencies that are required to accomplish work/project objectives and deliverables. <br/> Mentors peers and team members to facilitate their technical competence and on-going professional development. <br/> Creates an environment that promotes innovation, creativity and entrepreneurial thinking within the organization. <br/> BUSINESS ACUMEN <br/><br/> Identities clients stated and underlying needs, and the work activities and methodologies that will best address these needs.

Title: Project Coordinator
Job_Description: <div>We are looking for a qualified Rotating Equipment Project Coordinator with the ability to work within a multi-discipline engineering team and vendors. We serve many different market sectors including Oil & Gas, Mining & Metals, Chemical & Petrochemical, Pulp & Paper, Municipal Water & Wastewater Treatment etc.</div><br/>  <div>?</div>  <br/><strong><div>ACCOUNTABILITY:</div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <div><strong>Broad position responsibilities will include:</strong></div> <ul>  	<li>Being accountable under direction of project manager for the day-to-day functions related to coordination and driving projects towards ensuring on time performance, superior quality and profitability</li>  <li>Be a main point of contact for customers, the company?s internal organization, represented manufacturers and suppliers as they relate to projects.</li>  <li>Act as a facilitator in the absence of the Project Manager.</li>  <li>Represent Project Team in the daily production meeting.</li>  <li>Uphold the corporate values of The Company.</li>  <li>Customer satisfaction and meeting agreed deadlines/schedules.</li>  <li>Follow company policies and developing long-range goals and objectives to ensure continuous growth and improvement.</li> </ul>  <div><strong>CORE AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:</strong></div> <ul>  	<li>Acting as a project team leader, assist the Project Manager for projects in coordinating, planning, communicating and executing the delivery of core project component.</li>  <li>Plan, coordinate and administer the Hand-Over Process from Estimation / Inside Sales to Projects Team. Maintain, organize and update project binder during the course of project.</li>  <li>Plan project, procure resources, monitor profitability and develop high level schedule for projects and provide weekly updates of such</li>  <li>Coordination with Document control for the timely submission of documents according to forecast submittal dates and monitor document status.</li>  <li>Set-up project meetings with internal and external stakeholders and prepare meeting agendas</li>  <li>Assist the Project Manager in the quotation process</li>  <li>Manage project invoicing, financial updates and cost tracking.</li>  <li>Administrate project close-out, archive project documents</li>  <li>Coordinate with shop manager/supervisors and QC department for the smooth execution and completion of fabrication, assembly & production as per project schedule.</li>  <li>Facilitate goods returns with Inventory Management & Purchasing.</li>  <li>Any other duties as required for the execution and completion of projects as advised by immediate Supervisor?</li> </ul>

Title: Project Manager - 1 Year Limited Term Contract

Systems, databases and systems integration.</LI> <LI>Ability to work independently and as a part of a team and manage multiple tasks in an ever-changing environment.</LI> <LI>Able to work with different client types to understand their needs, identify root causes of problems, and implement creative and pragmatic solutions.</LI> <LI>Ability to develop rapport with various client groups and travel may be required, including to the United States</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Work is expected to be completed at the client’s office in downtown Calgary</DIV> <DIV> </DIV></LI></UL>

Title: Project Manager - Branch
Job_Description: <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Manage the event crew, operational elements, and & clients expectations while on show <br/> site. Ensure successful and profitable execution of projects from signed sales proposal to <br/> final invoicing. Assist the sales team in determining event technical requirements and <br/> communicate with all parties involved to collect and disseminate information required for <br/> execution. Analyze equipment and labor requirements, coordinate the fulfillment of these <br/> requirements, and communicate execution plan. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Job Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Event and Labor Management</strong> <br/><br/> Schedule and supervise on-site crew including full-time and part-time employees. Negotiate <br/> rates for outside labor. Prepare and implement technical production schedules as <br/> necessary to coordinate all crew, vendors and deliveries. Supervise and coordinate any <br/> required purchase orders, travel requirements, or per diem requests for assigned <br/> crewmembers. Communicate project scope, execution plan, and individual responsibilities <br/> with crew and manage to plan requirements. Designate crew leads and review all <br/> necessary information to ensure successful event for the client and PSAV. Operate <br/> equipment as necessary. Utilize and mentor regional PSAV technicians on event execution <br/> and best practices to help improve the local knowledge base and overall level of experience <br/> in the market. Conduct local training sessions as directed. <br/><br/> <strong>Event Planning</strong> <br/><br/> Generate schedules and drawings, contact venue to coordinate project including load in / <br/> out procedures, power, loading dock permissions, etc. Maintain focus on client needs by <br/> attending client meetings, creating and maintaining organized show files, and responding to <br/> client concerns, questions, and problems. Assist the sales team to help determine <br/> equipment needs and technical solutions for assigned project. Supervise the creation of <br/> CAD documents and renderings that are accurate and convey the intent of the technology. <br/> Review all sales documents to confirm that the equipment and technical positions will in fact <br/> meet the clients needs, and that profit forecast assumptions are attainable.<br/><br/><strong>Required Skills</strong>   <ul> <li>5 years technical experience in the Corporate Staging or Broadcast industry, including 1 year in a supervisory role</li> <li>Proven track record managing projects and multiple priorities in a fast paced environment</li> <li>Works well under pressure</li> <li>Ability to multi task</li> <li>Strong written and oral communication skills</li> <li>Strong Technical Background</li> <li>Strong Client relationship skills</li> <li>MS Office experience preferred</li> <li>CAD knowledge / experience preferred</li> <li>HS Diploma required</li> </ul> <em>PSAV is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices. PSAV will provide accommodation to people with disabilities upon request throughout our recruitment process.</em> <br/><br/> #LI-LD1<br/><br/><strong>Required Experience :</strong><br/><br/>5 years tech experience in the Corporate Staging or Broadcast industry, including 1 <br/> year in a supervisory role <br/> Strong written and oral communication skills <br/> Strong Technical Background <br/> Strong Client relationship skills <br/> Works well under pressure <br/> Ability to multi task <br/> MS Office experience preferred <br/> CAD knowledge / experience preferred <br/> HS Diploma required<br/><br/><strong>Job Location</strong> <br/> Calgary,Alberta,CA <br/><br/> <strong>Position Type</strong> <br/> Full-Time/Regular

Title: Project Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>ROLE:</strong> <br/><br/> As Project Engineer, your primary role will be to work with the Manager of Engineering and the rest of the team to successfully deliver projects to clients in the municipal and land development industries. In addition, you will work with and support the business development and marketing aspects of the team. <br/><br/> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul> <li>Successful completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering from an accredited University.</li> <li>5 plus years’ experience in engineering discipline, specifically in municipal and land development.</li> <li>Must be a registered member of the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA).</li> <li>Experience with Civil 3D software.</li> <li>Experience in Stormwater Management design is an asset.</li> <li>Strong presentation, verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.</li> <li>Business development drive and entrepreneurial acumen.</li> <li>Strong technical skills and attention to detail.</li> </ul> <strong>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with engineering manager, project managers, engineers and drafting technicians to successfully deliver quality projects on-time and on-budget for a variety of land development and municipal projects.</li> <li>Design of various municipal and land development projects.</li> <li>Review technical drawings, details, and specifications to ensure quality and oversight.</li> <li>Supervise junior engineers and technologists.</li> <li>Prepare proposals.</li> <li>Develop relationships for partnering with other firms.</li> <li>Develop business opportunities with existing and potential clients.</li> </ul> <strong>COMPANY INFORMATION:</strong> <br/><br/> Since 1983, Watt Consulting Group has been a multi-disciplinary civil engineering, transportation planning and land survey practice, operating out of offices in Calgary, Victoria, Vancouver, Kelowna, Edmonton and Lloydminster. We provide transportation planning, engineering and geomatics services to a wide variety of public and private sector clients throughout Western Canada. We strive to achieve our Vision of being a recognized leader in the creation of vibrant and livable communities. You will be joining a team that is passionate about what they do and who hold themselves to a high standard of excellence. We take our work to “<strong>HEART</strong>”. These are the values we hold high and strive to live by every day: Honesty, Excellence, Accountability, Respect and Teamwork. <br/><br/> <em>If you are looking for an exciting opportunity and to grow your career in a dynamic organization, owned and led by employees, submit your resume to careers@wattconsultinggroup.com.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Ownership opportunities will also be available to the successful candidate.</em> <br/><br/> <em>We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. WATT Consulting Group is an equal opportunity employer</em>.

Title: Divisional Industrial Project Manager
Job_Description: <strong>Position:</strong> Divisional Industrial Project Manager <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary, AB <br/><br/> Westburne, a division of Rexel (RXL: Euronext Paris), is a Canadian market leader in energy, lighting, wire and cable, automation and connected network solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>DESCRIPTION</strong> <br/><br/> We are currently looking for a self-motivated individual to become an integral part of our team at our Calgary location. If you want to work in a dynamic team environment and you excel when being trusted with responsibility, then Westburne is the place for you. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Management of industrial project groups</li> <li>Apply organizational policies and ensure adherence to implemented procedures at all levels</li> <li>Train and manage employees within the departments</li> <li>Resolve customer and supplier disputes</li> <li>Review supplier and customer terms and condition documents</li> <li>Maintain contact with customers and vendors to build a lucrative business relationship</li> <li>Conduct regular job status update meetings with sales force and management</li> <li>Evaluate job closing losses</li> <li>Obtain and analyze quote requests from contractors, sales representatives and bid depository</li> <li>Overlook specifications and determine if product requirements are achievable and profitable to the company</li> <li>Coordinate the quotation from various sources to organize a complete package for the customer</li> <li>Oversee order placements with manufacturers for quoted material on project orders</li> <li>Release reviewed material for shipment and expedite orders according to stipulated delivery schedule</li> <li>Review schedule of delivery dates</li> <li>Complete closing sheets on all quoted jobs</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>  <li>College diploma in business/sales/marketing or equivalent education and/or experience</li> <li>5 years of related experience in the industry, including a minimum of 1 year personnel management experience</li> <li>Project management experience</li> <li>Product knowledge of the electrical business is essential</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal, time management and negotiation skills</li> <li>Computer literacy – proficient with MS Office, Internet & IBM AS/400 knowledge</li> <li>Experience in quotations/project coordination is a definite asset</li>  </ul> <strong>Why Westburne?</strong> <br/><br/> Westburne, a division of Rexel, is the Canadian market leader in the B2B supply of electrical, alternative energy, lighting, wire and cable, automation and connected enterprise solutions. With over 100 locations, we are proud to offer rewarding careers to over 1000 Canadians across the country. <br/><br/> <strong>What We Can Offer You</strong> <br/><br/> Our employees enjoy a dynamic and ever-changing work environment. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and pension packages, and the opportunity for continued growth across the organization. <br/><br/> Westburne provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants. We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. <br/><br/> Learn more about life at Westburne by visiting lifehere.westburne.ca or our page on LinkedIn. <br/><br/> If you require any accommodation in the application process, please contact us with the “Need Help” button in Fitzii.

Title: Project Manager - Future Opportunity
Job_Description: <strong>Business Line</strong> Oil + Gas <br/><br/> <strong>Position Title</strong> Project Manager - Future Opportunity <br/><br/> Canada - Alberta <br/><br/> Calgary <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is seeking a Project Manager to be based in our Calgary, Alberta office location. <br/><br/> This position generally works under the supervision of a senior PM or above or Regional Operations Manager, demonstrates and provides project leadership in their area of responsibility. This position is fully responsible for the overall operation of a maintenance contract to include the safety and well-being of its employees, safeguarding company funds and property, and generally represents the company with respect to the client. This position will also complete projects to the satisfaction of the client, consistent with cost, schedule and contractual requirements. Ensuring that established company goals are realized while maintaining client relations that will enhance future business. <br/><br/> May include the following responsibilities: <br/><br/> <strong>Execution Planning</strong>  <ul> <li>Understands and executes the project, employing the Project Execution Plan developed in the proposal stage and expanding it to be effective and in compliance with requirements for each project phase.</li>  <li>Ensures development and adherence to the project Work Breakdown Structure, Asset Management, and Workflow Management elements.</li>  <li>Expands the Project Execution Plan for subsequent phases (Project Initiation, Project Execution, Construction, etc.) and communicates and coordinates the implementation of the enhancements with the project team.</li>  <li>Utilizes key Project Team Training modules (e.g., Pre-Project Planning, Team Building, Project Controls & Change Management) as part of an effective project kickoff.</li>  <li>Establishes, tracks and reports status against key performance indicators or contractual metrics on a routine basis.</li>  <li>Participates in the establishment of project organizational structure in support of proposal efforts.</li> </ul> <strong>Leadership</strong>  <ul> <li>Leads and motivates desired behaviors (e.g., coaching the project team and mentoring one or more individuals).</li>  <li>Capable of managing other Project Managers.</li>  <li>Leads by example with integrity and candor.</li>  <li>Leads proposal efforts for large and complex projects.</li>  <li>Able to lead multi-Group and/or joint venture teams on impact projects.</li> </ul> <strong>Judgment & Management of Project Risk</strong>  <ul> <li>Within his/her area of responsibility, consistently demonstrates the ability to proactively identify potential project problems or opportunities, analyze the issues using all appropriate resources, develop alternatives, and arrive at the most optimum approach to mitigate problems or exploit opportunities.</li> </ul> <strong>Contracts</strong>  <ul> <li>Understands the Companys Contract Commandments and can apply their basic principles.</li>  <li>Understands the scope of work, technical requirements, and commercial terms of the project contract for their area of responsibility.</li>  <li>Monitors and ensures contract compliance.</li> </ul> <strong>Client Relationship</strong>  <ul> <li>Clearly understands scope of work and contract requirements for his/her area of responsibility.</li> </ul> <strong>Negotiation</strong>  <ul> <li>Supports BD, and Group management in Contract negotiations with customers.</li>  <li>May serve as the proposal manager of a medium sized project.</li> </ul> <strong>Presentation Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>Supports or conducts formal presentations to clients and/or management.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Education:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in Engineering, Construction Management, Project Management, Facility Management or other relevant discipline.</li>  <li>Demonstrated equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.</li> </ul> <strong>Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Entrants to this position generally possess an average of 8 years engineering, operations/maintenance, M&O, construction, project controls, and/or procurement experience.</li>  <li>Have a record of proven performance as Maintenance Professional on previous contracts.</li>  <li>Capable of performing as the project manager on a low risk, low complexity project.</li>  <li>Capable of successfully performing on a $50 million project/contract.</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test.</li>  <li>MBA</li>  <li>P.Eng</li>  <li>MMP or PMP</li> </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <br/><br/> At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees. <br/><br/> <em>NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Job Category</em></strong> <em>Maintenance</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Business Group</em></strong> <em>Construction Services Group (CS)</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Country</em></strong> <em>Canada</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Position Status</em></strong> <em>Full-Time</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Requisition/Vacancy No.</em></strong> <em>185965BR</em> <br/><br/> <em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.</em>

Title: Project Manager - Midstream Gas Program
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/><br/>Reporting to the Director of Operations – Western Canada, the Midstream Gas Program Project Manager position will involve the below three distinct responsibilities, each relating to SNC-Lavalin’s strategic plan of increasing the company’s share of the Midstream EP, EPCM, & EPC market within the Midstream Gas market in Canada. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li><strong><strong>Project Manager</strong></strong> (75% of time) - Responsible for the full execution of the feed / detailed engineering / construction phases of gas compression projects in Western Canada. Direct the efforts of the full engineering, procurement, construction management, and commissioning team in creating the execution plans, organization, and contracts needed to deliver the project within the stated cost and schedule. Continue to build a positive relationship with highly important & strategic clients who have significant future work in the area. Full project accountability that is monitored through monthly reporting to the project sponsors. Portfolio may include projects for the SNC-Lavalin ”Production & Processing Solutions” (PPS) business.</li></ul>  <ul> <li><strong><strong>Proposal Manager</strong></strong> (15% of time) - Responsible for developing and managing Midstream Gas proposals within Western Canada. Working with sales, engineering, procurement, construction, and high-value remote offices to develop winning project execution plans, manhour estimates, and detailed cost estimates. Collaborate with SNC construction to form strategic alliances and partnerships where required to execute construction. Collaboration with commercial and risk managers to appropriate the proper risk and contingency allowances required to achieve set P&L goals.</li></ul>  <ul> <li><strong><strong>BD Support</strong></strong> (10% of time) – Responsible to work with the local Western Canada Business Development Director to promote EPC solutions for clients in Western Canada (BC and Alberta). Increase the existing client base to include new clients and elaborate existing E&P relationships to grow SNC’s scope to include EPC solutions.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>Professional Engineer (P.Eng)</li> <li>Mechanical background preferred</li><li>10 – 15 Years experience in the EPC industry</li><li>Significant gas compression experience</li><li>Experience managing projects in the $10MM to $60MM TIC range.</li><li>Strong technical apprehension and awareness of regulatory codes & requirements</li><li>Knowledge of local Western Canadian engineering and construction practices</li><li>Past experience with Tier 1 & Tier 2 Midstream Gas Producers</li><li>Proven ability to manage multiple clients and contractor interfaces</li><li>Superior skills in managing client relationships</li><li>Both lump sum and unit rate contract experience</li><li>Field experience as a Field Engineer, Engineering Manager, or Coordinator is an asset</li><li>Strong commercial, risk management, and change management skills.</li> <li>Computer skills - MS office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)</li>  </ul>  <strong>Worker Type</strong>Employee<strong>Job Type</strong>Regular

Title: Project Manager – Civil Works
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/>   <div> <div><strong>03/26/2018</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>001450</strong> </div> <br/><strong>Pomerleau</strong> is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder. <br/><br/> Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do. <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT WILL YOU DO IN A WEEK? :</strong> <br/><br/> Under the supervision of the project director, the project manager for civil projects ensures the comprehensive supervision and coordination of all the steps of a construction project, namely collaboration with subcontractors, close relationship with the client, and monitoring of costs and schedules.   <ul> <li>Coordinate work in collaboration with the superintendent—schedule, manpower and equipment requirements, etc.;</li> <li>Manage changes and instructions pertaining to project;</li> <li>Manage plans, specs, and addenda;</li> <li>Establish work methods in collaboration with the superintendent and the technical supervisor and always seek out ways to optimize them.</li> </ul>  Project Coordination   <ul> <li>Draw up list of activities in order to enable preparing the prevention program;</li> <li>Establish a list of items for monitoring costs and project accounting;</li> <li>Issue purchase orders for construction site materials through the Saint-Georges office;</li> <li>Settle disputes in collaboration with the superintendent;</li> <li>Perform breakdown and invoicing;</li> <li>Organize and conduct construction site meetings as required;</li> <li>Supervise site wrap-up manual preparation with administrative assistant.</li> </ul>  Project Follow-Up   <ul> <li>Perform administrative follow-up—costs, contingencies, boards, claims, etc.;</li> <li>Coordinate technical follow-up and quality inspections—technical data sheets, inspections, etc.;</li> <li>Follow up on notices of change—estimation, bid to client, negotiation, issuance of orders and/or of contract;</li> <li>Follow up on payments with accounts payable department and accounts receivable department;</li> <li>Authorize payments to subcontractors and suppliers;</li> <li>Perform guarantee follow-up;</li> <li>Coordinate preliminary inspection of the work in collaboration with project team;</li> <li>Coordinate commissioning in collaboration with superintendent;</li> <li>Deliver the project in collaboration with the superintendent and obtain client’s final acceptance;</li> <li>Supervise the gathering and creation of site wrap-up documents;</li> <li>Evaluate client’s satisfaction;</li> <li>Archive documents with administration department;</li> <li>Prepare project wrap-up—construction method, productivity ratio, unit prices, etc. <br/><br/> <strong>DO YOU HAVE THESE QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS? :</strong> <br/><br/> • Bachelor’s degree or diploma in civil engineering or other related discipline</li> <li>At least 5 years’ relevant experience</li> <li>Strong skills in management, communication, negotiation, and problem solving</li> <li>Ability to exercise initiative and leadership</li> <li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office software and MS Project <br/><br/> <strong>WHY JOIN POMERLEAU`S TEAM? :</strong></li>  </ul>    <ul> <li>Competitive salary</li> <li>4 weeks’ vacation</li> <li>Group insurance (health spending account)</li> <li>Group RRSP</li> <li>Monthly public transit pass paid by employer</li> <li>Fitness center membership: 50% reimbursed by employer</li> <li>Employee assistance program</li> <li>Ongoing training offered throughout the year</li> <li>Young, dynamic Title: Project Manager - Freight / Heavy Rail
Job_Description: Manage projects including interfacing and reporting to clients, monitoring and managing budgets and schedules, and general project coordination; <br/> Manage complex, multi-disciplinary, high-risk projects from start to close-out to meet Hatch commitments; <br/> Scheduling, budgeting, and coordination of design disciplines and sub consultants; <br/> Plan, organize and work with technical groups in the delivery of rail engineering project requirements including the provision of technical support to designers; <br/> Provide leadership on technical design and deliverable requirements including: vertical and horizontal alignments; quantity and construction cost estimates; engineering design reports; technical specifications; material and equipment selection; cost estimates; construction contract documentation; compilation of design/construction drawings; etc.; <br/> Provide support to business development and strategic initiatives, including preparation of proposals; <br/> Provide local / remote support to other Canadian regions in the development and delivery of project requirements; <br/> Through project efforts and involvement in industry activities, develop and maintain client relations. <br/><br/> Qualifications: <br/><br/> A Civil Engineering degree from a recognized university; <br/> P. Eng designation is required, PMP would be an asset; <br/> 8+ years of project management experience for heavy rail and/or large complex transit projects; <br/> Technically familiar with railway engineering design requirements and projects; <br/> In depth understanding of CP, CN and AREMA specifications; <br/> Experience and a successful track record working on CN and/or CP heavy rail projects would be a definite asset for this position; <br/> Past work experience with a railway, consulting or construction firm would be an asset; <br/> Must have sound knowledge of current engineering and construction principles, methods and practices; <br/> Some familiarity with various civil engineering software design tools would be an asset; <br/> Track record of delivering projects on time and to budget; <br/> Experience with Railway Rules and Regulations and Safety /Operations Procedures is an asset; <br/> Ability to communicate effectively and professionally with all levels of staff and clients (both written and orally); <br/> Excellent technical writing skills; <br/> Ability to work with minimal supervision; <br/> Ability to maintain good working relationships with the various parties involved in the process; <br/> Time management skills and ability to adapt to change; <br/> Ability to effectively switch between various tasks and assignments; <br/> Excellent analytical, problem-solving, attention to detail and decision-making skills; <br/> Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills in complex and changing environments.

Title: Project Manager - Industrial Pipeline Coating
Job_Description: <div> Apply <br/> <br/>  Project Manager - Industrial Pipeline Coating</div> <br/>ROSEN is a leading privately owned company that was established as a one-man business in 1981. Over <br/> the last 35 years, ROSEN has grown rapidly and is today a worldwide technology group that operates in <br/> more than 120 countries with over 3,000 employees. <br/><br/> ROSEN is an extended team of people with a passion for technology and innovation. <br/> Our claim “empowered by technology” is the key to our sophisticated and highly innovative products and <br/> services to the oil and gas and other engineering industries. The focus of all our research efforts and high <br/> tech solutions is on a safe operation of assets and therefore provide protection for both people and the <br/> environment.<br/><br/>Description<br/><br/>At ROSEN Canada we work collaboratively to get the job done. We recognize that each person and every department are integral to meet the needs of our clients and to continue to be a leader in what we do. We also recognize that our employees have different needs and we want to make sure they are being taken care of. Due to our rapid growth, we are currently seeking a qualified full time permanent Project Manager to join our production team. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Detailed duties include:</u> <br/> </strong>   <ul> <li>Read and understand customer specifications and fully ensure product/project are aligned with customer requirements;</li> <li>Responsibility and accountability for delivery of the project goals established with client;</li> <li>Work in close collaboration with the Production Team to validate all aspects of the project planning and execution phases.</li> <li>Monitor and control all contractual commitments to assure all work is being performed in accordance with the specifications, drawings, terms of the contract and client expectations.</li> <li>Coordinate all client contacts, including major correspondence between ROSEN and client, maintain working relationships at all levels required;</li> <li>Monitor project cost, quality, cash flow and budget of projects.</li> <li>Conduct regular project progress and client meetings to review the progress and issues in all disciplines of the project;</li> <li>Timely, accurate and complete reporting on the project progress & closure;</li> <li>Direct and review functions throughout the project lifecycle and ensure that the leads actively manage best practices within each of their fields;</li> <li>Ensure that that project documentation (contractual, engineering, third party vendor and workplace change related) is managed (received, reviewed, comments incorporated, responded and incorporated in plant records);<br/><br/>Requirements<br/><br/>• 3-7 years of experience in a project management and engineering role, preferably in the Pipeline Coating/Materials industry;</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Engineering/Technology;</li> <li>Registration with APEGA is an asset.</li> <li>Experience in Oil Sands Projects is an asset.</li> <li>Knowledge of Canadian standard pipeline design codes and specifications, ASME B 31.3 and 31.4 as well as to ASME Section IX.</li> <li>PC literacy with MC office packages.</li> <li>Hands-on project controls experience with focus on schedule development, tracking and accurately reporting progress on a regular basis.</li> <li>Experience managing vendor commitments.</li> <li>Experience identifying, assessing, and communicating project risks.</li> <li>Knowledge of Canadian standard pipeline design codes and specifications.</li> <li>Strong analytical and problem solving skills.</li> <li>High attention to detail and results.</li> <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li> <li>Ability to manage 4-5 medium size projects at the same time.</li> <li>Willing to travel.<br/><br/>We offer</li>  </ul>
