Title: Senior Project Manager, P3 Transit
Job_Description: <strong>Business Line</strong> Transportation <br/><br/> <strong>Position Title</strong> Senior Project Manager, P3 Transit (Calgary) <br/><br/> Canada - Alberta <br/><br/> Calgary <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> AECOMs Transportation practice is seeking a Senior Project Manager for large and complex multi-disciplinary Transit-Rail projects (heavy rail and LRT) based in our Calgary, AB office. <br/><br/> The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:  <ul> <li>Managing large and complex projects for transit clients</li>  <li>Preparing P3 bids/proposals for new work</li>  <li>Business development / developing leads aiding in winning new work</li>  <li>Preparing, monitoring and forecasting budgets/costs and project schedules</li>  <li>Building project teams and managing project staffing (using a disbursed engineering model)</li>  <li>Preparing and monitoring scopes of work and methodologies</li>  <li>Chairing frequent meetings (internal and client)</li>  <li>Overseeing quality review process for submittals</li>  <li>Non-project management project, or non-core, work could include some or all of design reviews, scheduling, report writing, presenting</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in relevant field</li>  <li>10+ years of experience, with 3+ years managing transit projects</li>  <li>Have been the project manager or design manager for projects with fees greater than $25 million and/or construction values of greater than $500 million</li>  <li>Have P3 / Alternative Delivery project experience (including both Bid and Execution phases)</li>  <li>Have experience managing large and complex multi-disciplinary projects (e.g. track, civil, systems, structural, architectural, environmental, electrical, streetscaping, operations, vehicles, etc.)</li>  <li>Must have Transit project management experience (ideally transit-rail experience)</li>  <li>Must have experience managing projects with fees greater than $25 million and/or construction values of greater than $500 million</li>  <li>Must have P3 / Alternative Delivery project experience (including both Bid and Execution phases)</li>  <li>Significant experience in project management</li>  <li>Experience in budgeting, reporting, scheduling</li>  <li>Experience writing and winning significant proposals</li>  <li>Experience with business development</li>  <li>Experience interacting at an executive level (both internal and external)</li>  <li>Must have experience managing multi-disciplinary Transit projects</li>  <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)</li>  <li>Proficiency in MS Word and Excel</li>  <li>Must have experience dealing with both clients and technical staff</li>  <li>Must have experience interacting at an executive level (both internal and external)</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>20+ years of experience, with 3+ years managing transit projects</li>  <li>PMP designation</li>  <li>P.Eng designation</li>  <li>MBA designation</li>  <li>Foundational experience that might include design and/or site work and/or construction / operations</li>  <li>Experience working on projects for TransLink, Edmonton Transit, Calgary Transit, Sound Transit, TriMet, or similar</li>  <li>US or overseas experience is considered acceptable / equivalent to Canadian experience, but regional (Western Canada or US Pacific North-West) experience is ideal</li>  <li>Experience with various delivery / procurement methods is required including design-build and P3</li>  <li>Should have a demonstrable network of client and engineering contacts</li> </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <br/><br/> At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees. <br/><br/> <em>NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Job Category</em></strong> <em>Program and Project Management</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Business Group</em></strong> <em>Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS)</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Country</em></strong> <em>Canada</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Position Status</em></strong> <em>Full-Time</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Requisition/Vacancy No.</em></strong> <em>185213BR</em> <br/><br/> <em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.</em>

Title: Senior Project Manager – Civil Works
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/>   <div> <div><strong>04/03/2018</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>001613</strong> </div> <br/><strong>Pomerleau</strong> is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder. <br/><br/> Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do. <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT WILL YOU DO IN A WEEK? :</strong> <br/><br/> Under the supervision of the Project Director, the Senior Project Manager for Civil works ensures the overall supervision and coordination of all the steps of the various construction projects, namely collaboration with subcontractors, close relationship with the client, and monitoring costs and schedules.   <ul> <li>Coordinate the work in collaboration with the superintendent—schedule, manpower and equipment requirements, etc.;</li> <li>Manage changes and instructions;</li> <li>Manage plans, specs, and addenda.</li> </ul>  Manage calls for bids and related contracts—can change from one project form to another   <ul> <li>Prepare all the documents to launch calls for bids;</li> <li>Draw up a detailed schedule—dates, main construction steps, constraints, work method;</li> <li>Launch and manage calls for bids;</li> <li>Finalize plans and specs;</li> <li>Analyze and negotiate bids;</li> <li>Prepare recommendations as well as contract awards and then obtain client’s approval;</li> <li>Award contracts;</li> <li>Set up and conduct initial meetings with major subcontractors on the project.</li> </ul>  Project Coordination   <ul> <li>Establish work methods in collaboration with the superintendent;</li> <li>Draw up list of activities in order to enable preparing the prevention program;</li> <li>Establish a list of items for cost follow-up and project accounting;</li> <li>Issue purchase orders for construction site materials at construction site;</li> <li>Settle disputes in collaboration with the superintendent;</li> <li>Perform breakdown and invoicing;</li> <li>Organize and conduct construction site meetings as required;</li> <li>Supervise site wrap-up manual preparation with administrative assistant.</li> </ul>  Project Follow-Up   <ul> <li>Perform administrative follow-up—costs, contingencies, boards, claims, etc.;</li> <li>Confirm implemented technical follow-up—technical data sheets, inspections, etc.;</li> <li>Follow up on notices of change—estimation, bid to client, negotiation, issuance of orders and/or of contract. <br/><br/> <strong>DO YOU HAVE THESE QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS? :</strong> <br/><br/> • Bachelor’s degree or Diploma in Civil Engineering or another construction related discipline</li> <li>At least 8 years’ experience managing Civil construction projects</li> <li>Strong skills in management, communication, negotiation, and problem solving</li> <li>Ability to exercise initiative and leadership, offering mentorship to more junior team members <br/><br/> <strong>WHY JOIN POMERLEAU`S TEAM? :</strong></li>  </ul>    <ul> <li>Competitive salary</li> <li>4 weeks’ vacation</li> <li>Group insurance (health spending account)</li> <li>Group RRSP</li> <li>Monthly public transit pass paid by employer</li> <li>Fitness center membership: 50% reimbursed by employer</li> <li>Employee assistance program</li> <li>Ongoing training offered throughout the year</li> <li>Young, dynamic environment</li> <li>Excellent career opportunities</li> <li>Summer hours</li> </ul> <strong>PARTICULARITY:</strong>  <ul> <li>The retained candidate will be subject to an administrative security check</li> </ul> At Pomerleau, we focus on results-oriented, passionate and rigorous people who participate in ambitious and complex projects. You have the profile we are looking for? Apply now to be part of our team. <br/><br/> Only retained candidates will be contacted. We may consider your CV for other positions. <br/><br/> Pomerleau is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive working environment where all employees are treated fairly.</div>  <br/>

Title: Manager, Planning and Projects
Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 22583 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the director, central enablement, you will be responsible for the strategic development and evaluation, as well as the selection and process requirements of our field logistics initiatives. You will manage the executive of step change initiatives for field logistics to drive business goals and objectives. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Support field logistics leaders to develop strategic plans, advise and measure progress of the plans </li><li>Managing the execution of step change initiatives for field logistics to drive business goals and objectives</li><li>Developing project and change management capabilities within the field logistics organization</li><li>Support the development of our budget, business plan, key performance indicators (KPIs) and monthly stewardship reports</li><li>Oversee development and maintenance of operational reporting capabilities</li><li>Support and provide guidance as it relates to project management accountabilities and responsibilities</li><li>Develop and lead effective change management techniques, plans and related deliverables </li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education: <ul> <li>Ten or more years of experience in project management, with a focus on continuous improvement of projects, and/or operations</li><li>Integrated project delivery, business process improvement and business transformation experience preferred</li><li>Three or more years of experience leading a team</li><li>Experience in the oil and gas industry is preferred</li><li>Post-secondary degree is required</li><li>Project or Change management certification is considered an asset</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge: <ul> <li>Good knowledge of project and program management methodologies and processes</li><li>In-depth understanding of communications and strategic framework and operating model development</li><li>Capable of managing complex budgets; budget development, cost control and financial analysis</li><li>You are someone that fosters a continuous improvement mindset within the team</li><li>You have demonstrated leadership experience, including consultative leadership to cross functional teams at all levels within the organization</li> </ul> <strong>Working Conditions</strong> <ul> <li>Some travel may be required, primarily to the Wood Buffalo region</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Suncor is committed to accessibility and accommodations will be provided to applicants upon request. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. <br/><br/> Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong> <br/><br/> JOB CATEGORY: Business Professionals

Title: Team Lead, Financial Analysis
Job_Description: Team Lead, Financial Analysis – Calgary, AB <br/> 13-Month Contract<br/><br/>Reporting to the VP, Finance, you will be accountable for financial analysis that supports organizational strategy, business planning, performance reporting, acquisition and disposition activities. <br/><br/> This 13-month contract position—beginning July 2018—requires you to lead the daily activities of the financial planning team and prepare presentations used by senior management and directors to make strategic decisions. You will actively participate in the A&D process by developing project economics, financial models and business cases for acquisition opportunities, development projects and organic expansion. You will report on current information regarding business, economic and corporate developments in the market relevant to NAL’s business. <br/><br/> To qualify for this position, you have a minimum of 10 years of experience in financial analysis and reporting and a bachelor’s degree in finance or accounting. You also have very strong written communication skills and excellent interpersonal skills. Oil and gas experience and completion of an MBA, CFA, CBV and/or CPA designation will be considered assets. Proven experience in strategic and corporation planning; financial valuation of acquisitions and dispositions; corporate finance; and equity research or investment banking experience is desirable. <br/><br/> NAL provides a fast-paced, team-orientated environment and competitive compensation. To apply for this position, please submit your resume to jobs@nal.ca, referencing the position title in the subject line. <br/><br/> We appreciate the interest of all applicants; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> View All Opportunities

Title: Project Manager (Industrial Refrigeration) - Houston, TX
Job_Description: The role of the Project Manager-Industrial Refrigeration in the Service Department is to lead and guide the execution of all engineering, design, procurement, fabrication, field construction (if applicable), and scope changes from project award, to kick-off, through project execution, and to field commissioning of project. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Specifications</strong>  <ul>  <li>15+ years of Project Management Experience.</li>    <li>15+ years of engineering, design, applications or sales, EPC (turnkey) and manufacturing shop floor experience.</li>    <li>BS Degree in Engineering is preferred and a Professional Engineering License is a plus.</li>   </ul>    <ul>  <li>Must be able to read & understand piping diagrams, block flow diagrams, specifications, & refrigeration drawings.</li>    <li>Must have experience with PSM (process safety management) for end user processing facilities utilizing NH3 as a refrigerant.</li>    <li>Experienced with the installation of pipe & fittings utilizing good piping practices following industry standards for NH3 ammonia systems.</li>    <li>Knowledgeable in piping different systems correctly such as; high-side, low-side, booster discharge, discharge, economizing, equalizing, high pressure liquid, pumped liquid, and condenser drain.</li>    <li>Familiarity with the different manufacturers of industrial refrigeration equipment such as: Frick, Mayakawa, Howden, & GEA screw compressors, Evapco airside, RVS vessels, Alfa Laval heat exchangers, Vogt ice makers, & others.</li>    <li>Familiarity with the function and installation of different NH3 control and isolation valves manufactured by Danfoss, Hansen Technologies, & R/S.</li>    <li>Some experience with programmable logic controllers and NH3 detection systems.</li>    <li>Some experience with polystyrene insulation installation practices.</li>    <li>Some experience with installation of MIRO or PHP piping support systems.</li>    <li>Familiar with IIAR (International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration) standards & bulletins.</li>    <li>Familiarity with the type of food, poultry, & beef processing facilities and cold storage warehouses owned by food processors such as; Tyson Foods, Pilgrims Pride, Conagra, Sara Lee, Fieldale Farms & others.</li>    <li>Experienced with job-site safety. Weekly tool box meetings, making sure that all employees and subcontractors are utilizing the correct PPE (personal protective equipment), & daily site safety inspections.</li>    </ul> <strong> <strong>Principle Duties & Responsibilities</strong></strong>  <ul>  <li>Manage all technical, commercial, contractual and fabrication requirements, from project initiation to closeout, in accordance with Enerflex internal processes and the project execution plan as established in the proposal phase.</li>    <li>Prepare and/or participate with the development of proposals.</li>    <li>Concurrent management of multiple projects.</li>    <li>Customer main point of contact.</li>    <li>Customer relationship building.</li>    <li>Preparation of progress report including managing of performance and progress against the plan and ensure accurate forecasts with commensurate action plans.</li>    <li>Communication of all customer needs and work-scope inside Enerflex.</li>    <li>Validation and oversight of project schedule timelines.</li>    <li>Initiating as required all internal / external meetings.</li>    <li>Communicate specifications, inspection, and QC requirements inside Enerflex.</li>    <li>Participate in P&ID, Hazop and Design reviews.</li>    <li>Participate in technical & project execution questions and problems.</li>    <li>Coordination and supervision of all activities related to the overall project execution including engineering, material requisition/expediting, schedule preparation, cost control, delivery/shipping and quality.</li>    <li>Resolve issues that impact schedule, problem solve potentialdesign, commissioning and/or warranty issues for highly customized projects.</li>    <li>Mentor junior project engineers and project team members.</li>    <li>May involve travel to site locations to verify scope and / or provide commissioning and start-up support.</li>    <li>Demonstrates strong scope control skills and change management skills.</li>    <li>Demonstrates knowledge of the financial goals of the project and what they represent.</li>    <li>Demonstrates knowledge of the Cost Control tools and procedures.</li>    <li>Demonstrates knowledge of the schedule tools, procedures, and work process.</li>    <li>Supports the project team in negotiations with major suppliers, subcontractors, licensors, consultants, and others.</li>    <li>Consistently advises management concerning client relations/issues.</li>    <li>Demonstrates consistency and clear judgement as unexpected problems or opportunities arise.</li>    <li>Maintains the Management of Risk Plan and communicates the plan to the project team and management.</li>    <li>Demonstrates Integrity and company core values.</li>    <li>Ensures quality standards are met in compliance with health, safety, security and environmental codes and standards.</li>    </ul> <strong> <strong>Working Conditions</strong></strong> <br/><br/> Fast-paced general office environment. Many tasks have high degrees of time sensitivity. Domestic and international travel is possible on occasion. <br/><br/> <strong>About Enerflex</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex Ltd. is a single source supplier of natural gas compression, oil and gas processing, refrigeration systems, and electric power generation equipment plus related engineering and mechanical service expertise. The Companys broad in-house resources provide the capability to engineer, design, manufacture, construct, commission, and service hydrocarbon handling systems. Enerflexs expertise encompasses field production facilities, compression and natural gas processing plants, refrigeration systems, and electric power equipment servicing the natural gas production industry. Headquartered in Calgary, Canada, Enerflex has more than 2,000 employees globally and operates in over seven regions around the world. <br/><br/> Enerflex puts its Values of Integrity, Commitment, Creativity and Success into action in all aspects of business. The Company values passionate people who want to put their career into overdrive. We will help match your skills with a position that challenges you to reach new heights, rewards you for outstanding performance and allows you to grow with the Company throughout your life-long career. Join the Enerflex team and apply now. <br/><br/> <strong>What Enerflex Offers You</strong>  <ul>  <li> <div>Competitive Compensation</div></li>   <li> <div>Cost Shared Health and Dental Benefits</div></li>   <li> <div>Employee Share Purchase Program</div></li>   <li> <div>Employer Matched 401K</div></li>   <li> <div>Incentive Programs</div></li>   <li> <div>Professional Development Opportunities</div> </li>   </ul> <strong>Disclaimer</strong> <br/><br/> The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. <br/><br/> <strong>ENERFLEX IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex grants equal employment opportunity to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, genetic information, mental or physical disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Equal employment opportunities are provided in recruitment, hiring, promotions, wages, benefits, and other terms, conditions and privileges of employment. <br/><br/> Please visit our website at www.enerflex.com > Careers and apply <br/><br/> .

Title: Project Manager (Alberta)
Job_Description: We are looking for an experienced Alberta based Project Manager to join our growing team, and to lead our growth in the Alberta market. Novacom has had a presence in Alberta for 18 years, and due to the rapid growth in volume over the past 4 years we're no longer able to manage this work out of our Vancouver office. <br/><br/> This position is more than just a Project Management opportunity, it's a chance to join an established and fast growing company and be a part of building a great Alberta team. The role would be based out of a home office or co-working space, and would be supported by our Vancouver Head Office and our team of Alberta based Site Superintendents. The projects would be located throughout Alberta and Saskatchewan. <br/><br/> Novacom is a leading Construction Manager and General Contractor based in Surrey, BC and working throughout Western Canada. We value people, relationships, innovation and culture. We believe in constantly improving ourselves to provide the best possible service to our clients. Our core business is commercial construction and renovations of financial institutions, restaurants, offices and retail spaces. <br/><br/> We're doing construction differently, and we're thinking outside the box about how we can improve our company and our industry. If you're looking for a company with a family dynamic where you can have opportunities to grow, be challenged and known by your co-workers, then come join us! <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Personal Characteristics:</strong> <ul>  <li>Driven - self-motivated and driven to push things forward no matter the circumstance</li> <li>Energetic - engaged personality that takes on complex challenges with enthusiasm</li> <li>Independent - ability to communicate effectively with team, but also act authoritatively on your own</li> <li>Humble - willingness to admit when you've made a mistake and take ownership</li> <li>Administrative - ability to track schedules, change orders, field reports, weekly progress reports etc.</li> <li>Financial Focus - desire to meticulously manage project budgets and financial reporting</li>  <li>Personable - able to build and maintain solid relationships with vendors and clients</li> <li>Communicator - good at proactively with subtrades and team, strong verbal & written communication skills</li> <li>Organizer- meticulous in site organization</li> <li>Mobile - willing to travel to various sites across Alberta & Saskatchewan for site meetings, visits, interface etc.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul>  <li>5-10 years' experience in the commercial construction field, preferably in a Project Management capacity</li> <li>Construction knowledge - overall understanding of construction process, sequencing, etc.</li>  <li>Post-secondary, technical education (BCIT) or similar in a construction or industry-related program</li>  </ul> <strong>Responsibilities</strong><strong>:</strong> <ul>  <li>Project Startup -- issuing contracts, requesting insurance and bonds, WCB notices, etc.</li>  <li>Project Documentation -- using Timberline and Microsoft software to manage labour, materials, and equipment, cost coding, submittals, schedules, meeting minutes, change orders, etc.</li> <li>Subtrade/Supplier Management -- ability to manage construction subtrades and suppliers, and mitigate issues that may arise in the course of a project</li> <li>Site Superintendent Interface -- ability to work in partnership with Site Superintendent to deliver a high quality finished product while managing the schedule and budget</li> <li>Client Interface -- meeting with architects, consultants, and clients to manage project issues and maintain positive working relationships</li> <li>Budget Management -- continuous monitoring and management of project budget, ability to minimize project costs through inventive methods and regular financial reporting to management</li> <li>Invoicing -- preparation of monthly progress claims, review and approval of subtrade and supplier invoices</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul> <li>Salary will be commensurate with experience</li> </ul>

Title: Project Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>Company Overview</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Do you want to work with one of Canada’s top oil and gas companies represented by an award-winning staffing agency? Look no further and join the Spirit circle today!</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> Our large oil and gas company in Calgary, AB is currently recruiting 5 Project Engineers for a 5 month contract. The shift will be Monday-Friday, 8 hrs/day. The embedded contractors will support upcoming expense/capital jobs as part of PES Staffing plan (e.g.hydrogen, Plant pressure relief, and other OpEx work.) An embedded contractor would be expected to act on the company’s behalf Engineering overseeing engineering deliverables created at engineering contractor offices. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong>  <ul> <li>Management of quality of engineering deliverable</li> <li>Management of change (MOC) for scope, cost, schedule and quality</li> <li>Support design basis development</li> <li>Stakeholder alignment and interface management</li> <li>Cost and schedule estimate support</li> <li>Develop engineering surveillance plan and liaison with SCL technical resources to ensure quality engineering deliverables from engineering contractor</li> <li>Support “cradle to grave” project engineering philosophy (PE may be required to travel to Ft Mac 3-5 days a week to provide field engineering support during construction)</li> </ul> <strong> Qualifications and Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>P.Eng registration in Alberta</li> <li>Minimum 5 years project engineering / operations technical support experience in the oil & gas industry (owner/operating experience preferred)</li> <li>Excellent communication skills</li> <li>Successfully pass a criminal background check</li> <li>This position is classified as safety sensitive, therefore you must also be able to pass a drug & alcohol test</li> <li>Possession of or eligible to obtain a passport</li> <li>Valid OSSA BSO or OSSA Orientation and CSTS</li> </ul> <strong>**We thank all applicants for applying, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted directly**</strong>

Title: Project Coordinator
Job_Description: ABOUT US Aecon Group Inc. is an industry-leading construction and infrastructure development company at the forefront of our economys strongest growth sectors Infrastructure, Energy, Mining. Aecon and its subsidiaries provide services to private and public sector clients throughout Canada and on a selected basis internationally. Aecon Utilities is Ontario's premier utility contractor, averaging more than 1000 skilled trades people, project managers and clerical staff. Our respected personnel are well equipped with more than 1500 major pieces of equipment, including one of the largest directional drilling fleets in Ontario.POSITION OVERVIEWReporting to the Manager, Operations, the Project Coordinator will be responsible for accurately tracking the cost of labour, equipment, subcontractors and materials for the installation or relocation of underground utilities within multi-faceted infrastructure projects.Also, coordinating related contract administration, procurement and invoicing functions for awarded projects.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES *Provides Manager of Operations with data and project analysis<br/> *Supports project Superintendent and Foremen in management of projects and crews<br/> *Tracks productivity, costs and progress on projects<br/> *Performs quantity take-off from construction drawings<br/> *Monitors and provides job cost reports to management on active projects<br/> *Creates and submits progress and final invoicing <br/> *Coordinates the preparation and submission of shop submittals and as-built drawings<br/> *Provides data and input for month-end reconciliations<br/> *Communicates with customer technical support departments<br/> *Provides technical support to field staff<br/> *Maintains files and correspondence on active and completed projects<br/> *Performs other duties and responsibilities as required<br/><br/>KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS *Graduate from Civil or Electrical Engineering/ Technologist / Construction Management program or equivalent<br/> *Minimum of 2 years of experience in the construction industry in a similar role<br/> *Experience in the utility industry is a strong asset<br/> *Capable of reading and understanding construction drawings and documents<br/> *Sound computer skills MS Excel, MS Word, MS Project<br/> *Experience with SAP is a strong asset<br/> *Strong communication skills oral and written<br/> *Self motivated with good organizational skills<br/> *Ability to work accurately under pressure<br/> *Adaptable to flexible work schedule when required to meet deadlines<br/> *Ability to work with others as a team<br/> *Valid drivers license and access to reliable transportation<br/> *Willing to travel for specific project assignments is a strong asset<br/><br/>Aecon accommodates. Upon request, Aecon accommodates candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

Title: Senior Civil Engineer / Project Manager
Job_Description: Our Water sector, which brings together many of the world’s top engineers and scientists, sees water a bit differently—as a single holistic system rather than as unconnected networks divided by jurisdictional boundaries. We use this perspective to help communities tap into water’s potential. Throughout the life cycle of capture, use, reuse, and discharge, our team optimizes every facet of a water system. <br/> Whether a project calls for planners, designers, construction managers, or facility operators, we have the right experts to provide creative, yet practical, water solutions. Through our cost-effective strategies, we’re helping communities increase their water efficiency and protect their water resources for future generations. Join our team as we create new ways to tap into water’s vast potential. <br/> Stantec’s Calgary office is seeking a Senior Civil Engineer / Project Manager to join our Water group. <br/> Your Duties <br/> Managing projects, administering contracts and controlling budgets. <br/> Coordination of design teams (Project Engineers and Drafting Personnel) and various discipline professionals. <br/> Civil engineering planning and design for <br/> Municipal conveyance infrastructure (potable water distribution, sanitary and storm sewer systems, and related components) <br/> Site grading designs <br/> Site development plans <br/> Contract document preparation, including detailed design drawings and specifications <br/> Construction contract administration and site inspection services <br/> Proposal writing and business development initiatives <br/> Your Capabilities and Credentials <br/> The successful candidate will possess the following <br/> Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Civil Engineering. <br/> Minimum of 8 years of consulting experience, primarily in municipal infrastructure, with a minimum of 4 years’ experience in project management of civil/municipal infrastructure projects (conveyance of water, storm and wastewater.) <br/> Registered with APEGA as an Engineer (P.Eng.) <br/> Excellent written and verbal communication skills. <br/> Desire to learn and grow in your career.

Title: Supervisor, Project Engineering
Job_Description: <div>Requisition Id: 15286 <br/><br/> Department: Operations Engineering Department <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is seeking a Supervisor, Project Engineering (Operations), to join our Conventional Business Unit (CBU) in Calgary, Alberta. Reporting to the Manager, Operations Engineering, the successful candidate will coordinate and manage the Project Engineering team within the Operations Engineering group. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:  <ul>  	<li>Working with the Manager, Operations Engineering to clearly establish project management processes, templates, and execution strategies for the project management team;</li> <li>Accountable to manage projects from inception to completion of commissioning and turnover which will include coordination with Operations personnel, management of engineering resources (either internal or external), development and management of procurement and contract activities, management of construction execution teams and management of commissioning activities;</li> <li>Development of PMO (Project Management Office) documents as required;</li> <li>Liaising with and coordinating project stakeholders to manage project scope, timing, resourcing, and execution;</li> <li>Working with the engineering team to coordinate the delivery of technical deliverables;</li> <li>Working with the SCM (Supply Chain Management) team to coordinate procurement and contracts as necessary for successful project execution;</li> <li>Working with the Pembina commissioning and Operations teams as necessary to ensure the project is appropriately commissioned and turned over;</li> <li>Working with the Pembina document control team to ensure all project deliverables are appropriately numbered, compiled and available for turnover to close out the project;</li> <li>Maintaining appropriate cost control and schedule to ensure successful project management and forecasting are in place;</li> <li>Coordinate and manage as necessary to establish construction contracts, construction supervisors, EHS professionals and other support staff as necessary to ensure successful field execution of the project;</li> <li>Coordinate as necessary with SPCC (Sherwood Park Control Center) and SCADA to coordinate commissioning activities, shutdown activities and other non-routine events as necessary for successful project execution;</li> <li>Consult and coordinate as necessary with the Pembina LARE (Land, Aboriginal, Regulatory and Environmental) group; and</li> <li>Other general coordination duties as required to ensure the necessary stakeholders are considered as part of the project.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Preferred candidate would have at least 10 years of combined construction and engineering project experience with either a P.Eng. or CET designation.;</li> <li>A background in the mechanical trades is a definite asset;</li> <li>Demonstrated experience in project coordination between design; engineering, field execution teams, commissioning teams and Code inspectors;</li> <li>Previous EPC design experience is a definite asset; and</li> <li>Fluent in the tools of project management including cost control, scheduling, contracts, execution planning and project closeout.</li> </ul> <strong>No agency calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. <br/><br/> Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. <br/><br/> Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. <br/><br/> Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. <br/><br/> Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. <br/><br/> ></div>  <br/>

Title: Disability Case Manager - Team Lead
Job_Description: <strong>Disability Case Manager - Team Lead - Full Time - Calgary, AB</strong> <br/> <div><div>As the <strong>Disability Case Manager Team Lead</strong> with Lifemark you will have many opportunities to challenge yourself through applying a broad range of skills to your work. Our company symbolizes an exciting direction in managing non-occupational and occupational disability management claims. We pride ourselves in providing exceptional adjudication, case management, absence management and consulting services. As an industry leader, we focus on exceeding the expectations of all our clients through a unique relationship and approach that leads to positive outcomes and results. <br/><br/> In this role, you will work with assigned accounts to oversee non-occupational disability management programs. In this capacity, you will ensure disabilities are managed in an effective, timely and cost effective manner. You may also be required to assist with program development and implementation and provide a high standard of service for our clients. <br/><br/> This position requires interaction with a diverse group of people including, but not limited to, employers, unions, physicians, insurers and others groups and/ or individuals. You have an understanding of medical terminology, with a high aptitude to provide an outstanding experience for the clients you serve. <br/> You also possess strong written and verbal communication skills and enjoy working with people. If you would like to work in a dynamic, team-oriented atmosphere and possess a high level of motivation in the area of disability management, then we are looking for you! <br/><br/> <strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Proactively managing of non-occupational disability claims, often involving situations of a complex nature.</li> <li>Ability to effectively manage physical and psychological disability situations.</li><li>Working closely with client management, unions and employees to ensure timely return to work occurs.</li><li>Implementing early intervention strategies for an employees quick recovery and return to work.</li> <li>Arranging / Coordinating suitable medical assessments, treatment programs and/other activities to effectively manage disability cases</li><li>Liaising with physicians and other health care professionals.</li><li>Coordinating and developing suitable and sustainable return to work plans.</li><li>Maintaining regular contact with injured/ill employees with a focus on early return to work and enhancing recovery.</li><li>Liaising with applicable insurers and workers compensation boards as necessary.</li><li>Fulfilling any other assigned duties as required</li><li>Potential additional responsibilities, based on experience</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar role.</li><li>Undergraduate degree Ability to speak and write in English (French is a strong asset)</li><li>Experience mentoring and training staff would be an asset.</li><li>NIDMAR or other related professional designations preferred.</li><li>Demonstrated track record of managing disabilities and absenteeism.</li><li>Knowledge and understanding of WCB</li><li>Excellent decision making and problem solving skills.</li><li>Strong ability to perform functions of the position with minimal supervision.</li><li>Strong multi-tasking, time-management, negotiation and communication (verbal and written) skills.</li><li>Strong diplomacy skills with an ability to be flexible and also give and take direction well.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to build relationships with clients and team members.</li><li>Excellent documentation and time management skills. <br/> Strong computer literacy skills</li> </ul> <strong>Visit us at</strong> https://www.lifemark.ca<strong> for more information.</strong></div></div>

Title: Housekeeping Team Lead
Job_Description: A Housekeeping Inspector is responsible for inspecting designated guest rooms and/or public areas in the hotel's continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability.<br/><br/><strong>What will I be doing?</strong><br/><br/>As a Housekeeping Inspector you will be responsible inspecting designated guest rooms and/or public areas in the hotel's continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability. Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards: <ul> <li>Inspect rooms, verify and report status and/or discrepancies of rooms and enter into property management system (as needed)</li><li>Complete work orders, as needed - Perform Room Attendant and/or House person duties, as needed</li><li>Assist in training Room Attendants, as needed</li><li>Respond to special guest requests in a timely, friendly and efficient manner</li> </ul>  <strong>What are we looking for?</strong><br/><br/>Housekeeping Inspectors serving Hilton Brand hotels are always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow: <ul>  <li>Previous experience in a Housekeeping supervisory role</li><li>A successful track record of managing a team</li><li>Strong organizational and analytic skills</li><li>An attention to details</li><li>Strong communication skills</li><li>A passion for delivering exceptional levels of guest service</li><li>Proficiency, preferred, with computers and computer programs, including Microsoft Office</li> </ul>  <strong>What will it be like to work for Hilton?</strong><br/><br/>Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all! <br/><br/> EOE/AA/Disabled/Veterans

Title: Infrastructure Project Coordinator Student

This role will allow you to develop your business knowledge of the Oil and Gas industry, project coordination skills and communication skills through extensive collaboration within Imperial Oil and ExxonMobil nationally across Canada and globally around the world. <br/><br/> Examples of specific job responsibilties: <br/><br/> As a member of the Canada Operations team, you will:  <ul>  	<li>Provide Area Operations facilitation to Projects requiring IT Infrastructure (i.e. Server/Network, etc.) and Facilities (i.e. Data Centre) involvement</li> <li>Act as a focal point for EMIT Project Management Groups for incoming IT Infrastructure and Facilities projects in Canada</li> <li>Communicate to Site Coordinators, Management and other (local and global) groups to ensure appropriate resource allocation</li> <li>Provide consultation so that projects follow Area Ops processes</li> <li>Ensure Security & Control requirements are met prior to Area Operations accepting steady state operations</li> <li>Review/communicate work efforts to Area Operations (i.e. stewardship reports)</li> <li>Be responsible for cost estimation, obtaining funding, establishing meetings with other technical support groups who will be completing the activitie</li> <li>Support the team SharePoint website and project stewardship dashboard</li> <li>Create and review formal documentation/processes as required (e.g. Transition Checklist/ Document from Project to Steady Operations State)</li> <li>Work and learn the industry business standard problem management system (BMC Remedy/ITSM) for ticket handling and asset management</li> <li>Use continuous improvement techniques to improve support performance</li> <li>Interface with external suppliers and various global technical support teams</li> <li>Recommend, develop and implement enhancements for current workflow or support model</li> <li>Provide hands on support to Calgary Area Operations Support team when required (e.g. racking and stacking of servers in Data Center, Asset Verification, etc.)</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Academic:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Completion of 2nd year Computer/Electrical/Software Engineering, Computer Science or Information Systems students interested in a career in information technology</li> <li>To be considered for employment, your most recent unofficial transcript(s) must be submitted with your application</li> </ul> <strong>Other:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Strong interpersonal, listening, verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Process/Detailed oriented, strong ability to prioritize tasks and organize work</li> <li>Ability to work effectively in a team environment to accomplish organizational goals</li> <li>Demonstrate sound analytical and problem-solving skills</li> <li>Highly motivated individual able to work with minimum supervision</li> <li>Maintain effectiveness in a changing environment</li> <li>Good working knowledge of company process/procedures and ethics</li> <li>Experience in ticket handling systems such as Remedy/ITSM</li> <li>Fluent in Microsoft suite of office tools with focus in MS Excel, MS PowerPoint and MS Word</li> <li>Familiarity with SharePoint would be an asset</li> <li>Basic server and networking knowledge</li> </ul> <strong>Start date:</strong>September 2018 (start date negotiable) <br/><br/> <strong>Work term:</strong> 12 months preferred, 8 months considered <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> <strong>Your benefits</strong> <br/><br/> This position will provide you with an opportunity to leverage your skills in support of a large integrated resource company. You will be provided an opportunity to:  <ul>  	<li>Work in a team of 25+ team members located across Canada, the team is focused on L1 IT infrastructure and facility support/management.Work in a high caliber, collaborative learning environment.</li>   <li>Receive on-the-job experience, coaching and training.</li> <li>Gain knowledge/experience in project coordination and implementation skills, IT Infrastructure and IT Facilities.</li> <li>Gain technical and business background in the operations of the oil & gas resource industry through participation in various networking programs</li> <li>Deliver optimum technical solutions within data and technology architecture</li> <li>Utilize desktop, client/server, network and network technologies</li> </ul> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> At ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada ULC (EMBSCC) we are an integral part of a worldwide network of business support centres that provide financial, technical, information service, transactional, and customer service support for ExxonMobil’s global operations. <br/><br/> <strong>Other considerations</strong>  <ul>  	<li>For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required.</li> <li>We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.</li> </ul> <strong>Eligibility to work in Canada</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada. Proof of eligibility must be in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, Canadian certificate of permanent residence or work permit. Document must be current and valid (not expired, cancelled or voided). Work permit must be valid for the duration of the term. Proof of eligibility is required if an offer is made. Failure to provide the appropriate documentation within a reasonable timeframe (generally 6 weeks prior to your start date) may result in the offer being rescinded or a delay in your start date. <br/><br/> <strong>Application deadline:</strong> May 13, 2018</div> <br/>The ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. <br/><br/> In certain situations, ExxonMobil may use your application to consider your suitability for other positions within the Company and may also provide the information to its affiliates, including Imperial Oil and affiliates of Exxon Mobil Corporation, in connection with possible opportunities at those affiliates.</div>  </div>  </div>  </div> <br/><strong>Job Segment:</strong>  <br/>  Developer, Electrical, Engineer, Information Systems, Data Center, Technology, Engineering</div>  <br/>Apply now »<br/>   <div> Apply now    <ul>    <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with LinkedIn</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Facebook</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Xing</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Seek</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/>  Apply Now</li><br/>  <div> <div> <div> Start</div>  </div>  </div>  <br/><li>  <div> <strong>Please wait...</strong></div> </li>  </ul>   </div> </div>  <br/>

Title: Project Coordinator
Job_Description: <strong>Project Coordinator (Calgary)</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Are you looking to be part of an Innovative, Environmentally conscious and Collaborative team? If so, look no further.</em> <br/><br/> One of the top ten general contractors in Canada and part of the largest construction organization in North America, Clark Builders serves industrial, commercial and institutional market sectors. Clark Builders core values represent the spirit that our company was founded on: Respect Others, Have a Can-Do Attitude, Succeed as a Team, Lead with Courage, Deliver Results. They are more than words: each one underlies the commitment that we bring to every person we meet, every team we build and every project we work on, start to finish. We are looking for team members interested in working in an Innovative, environmentally conscious and collaborate team. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Project Manager(s), the Project Coordinator will be responsible for assisting the Project Manager(s) in all aspects of the project that is assigned. Project Coordinator role is diverse, varies between each project. With your Project Manager(s) oversight, duties and responsibilities include and are not limited to: <br/><br/> <strong>Duties and Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Project Start Up</strong> <ul> <li>Tendering and bid evaluations.</li><li>Utilities and site services applications.</li><li>Permit applications.</li><li>Quantity take-offs for a various scopes of the project.</li><li>Letter of intent and Subcontracts preparation.</li> <li>Development of the project communication plan.</li><li>Schedule preparation.</li> <li>Project Execution and Document Control</li> </ul> <strong>Document Control</strong> <ul> <li>Request for Information (RFI).</li><li>Site Instructions (SI).</li><li>Submittals.</li><li>Change Requests (CRX).</li><li>Change Orders (CO).</li><li>Monitor and maintain the quality plan (QA/QC).</li><li>Monitor and maintain the schedule.</li><li>Facilitate meetings.</li><li>Record and compile meeting minutes.</li><li>Follow up on meeting minute action items.</li><li>Track productivity and performance of the project.</li><li>Project accounting basics.</li>  </ul> <strong>Project Closeout</strong> <ul> <li>Review, track and communicate punch and deficiency lists.</li><li>Administrative duties around the project closure.</li><li>Remove all insurance.</li><li>Closeout utilities and site services.</li><li>Remove temporary facilities.</li><li>O & M Manuals.</li><li>Assist with inspections, owner training and coordinate owner occupancy.</li> <li>Support and grow ongoing subtrade and client relationships</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Knowledge:</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills.</li><li>The ability to efficiently assist and administer multiple tasks.</li> <li>Analytical thinker to interpret information in order to understand issues.</li> <li>Ability to make decisions on a variety of levels of complexity, ambiguity and risk.</li> <li>Can define tasks and milestones to achieve objectives while ensuring optimal use of resources.</li> <li>The ability to read, understand and interpret technical drawings and specifications.</li><li>Skills and knowledge with the construction process.</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications & Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>A Post-Secondary Certificate/Degree in Engineering or the equivalent of a designated Professional Engineer or a Technical School graduate in a Construction related discipline.</li><li>Must have experience working in a Project Coordinator role for a Commercial, Industrial, or Institutional Construction organization.</li><li>Experience must include competently delivering on Project Coordinator tasks with in the phases of the construction process from project startup to project closeout.</li>  </ul> <strong>Competencies:</strong> <ul> <li>Networking and relationship building;</li> <li>Customer focus;</li> <li>Teamwork;</li><li>Interpersonal skills;</li> <li>Results focus; and</li> <li>Integrity.</li>  </ul>

Title: Supervisor, Project Engineering
Job_Description: <div>Requisition Id: 15286 <br/><br/> Department: Operations Engineering Department <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is seeking a Supervisor, Project Engineering (Operations), to join our Conventional Business Unit (CBU) in Calgary, Alberta. Reporting to the Manager, Operations Engineering, the successful candidate will coordinate and manage the Project Engineering team within the Operations Engineering group. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: <ul> <li>Working with the Manager, Operations Engineering to clearly establish project management processes, templates, and execution strategies for the project management team;</li><li>Accountable to manage projects from inception to completion of commissioning and turnover which will include coordination with Operations personnel, management of engineering resources (either internal or external), development and management of procurement and contract activities, management of construction execution teams and management of commissioning activities;</li><li>Development of PMO (Project Management Office) documents as required;</li><li>Liaising with and coordinating project stakeholders to manage project scope, timing, resourcing, and execution;</li><li>Working with the engineering team to coordinate the delivery of technical deliverables;</li><li>Working with the SCM (Supply Chain Management) team to coordinate procurement and contracts as necessary for successful project execution;</li><li>Working with the Pembina commissioning and Operations teams as necessary to ensure the project is appropriately commissioned and turned over;</li><li>Working with the Pembina document control team to ensure all project deliverables are appropriately numbered, compiled and available for turnover to close out the project;</li><li>Maintaining appropriate cost control and schedule to ensure successful project management and forecasting are in place;</li><li>Coordinate and manage as necessary to establish construction contracts, construction supervisors, EHS professionals and other support staff as necessary to ensure successful field execution of the project;</li><li>Coordinate as necessary with SPCC (Sherwood Park Control Center) and SCADA to coordinate commissioning activities, shutdown activities and other non-routine events as necessary for successful project execution;</li><li>Consult and coordinate as necessary with the Pembina LARE (Land, Aboriginal, Regulatory and Environmental) group; and</li><li>Other general coordination duties as required to ensure the necessary stakeholders are considered as part of the project.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>Preferred candidate would have at least 10 years of combined construction and engineering project experience with either a P.Eng. or CET designation.;</li><li>A background in the mechanical trades is a definite asset;</li><li>Demonstrated experience in project coordination between design; engineering, field execution teams, commissioning teams and Code inspectors;</li><li>Previous EPC design experience is a definite asset; and</li><li>Fluent in the tools of project management including cost control, scheduling, contracts, execution planning and project closeout.</li> </ul> <strong>No agency calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. <br/><br/> Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America&apos;s energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers&apos; products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. <br/><br/> Powering Pembina&apos;s growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. <br/><br/> Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. <br/><br/> Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta&apos;s Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. <br/><br/> ></div>

Title: Infrastructure Services Team Lead
Job_Description: <strong>BE Totally Engaged. BE Business Savvy. BE the Right Partner</strong>. Be all that and more at Colliers Project Leaders. Join our team as an Infrastructure Services Lead in Calgary, AB. <br/><br/> At Colliers Project Leaders, we help our clients succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed. <br/><br/> In this role, you’ll join our team of experts who lead building and infrastructure projects. Through our <strong>Get it Right Solution™,</strong> you’ll ensure we get it ready, get it built and get it performing -- so investors, owners and occupants are certain of success. <br/><br/> This is a senior leadership opportunity for a professional who is ready to take on the challenge of growing an established service offering within a recognized project leadership company. <br/><br/> With over 600 employees and 27 + office locations throughout Canada and the Middle East, Colliers Project Leaders offers a multi-cultural, multi-generational work environment where we cultivate excellence, develop leaders and deliver on our clients’ vision. Colliers Project Leaders is part of Colliers International Group Inc. (NASDAQ: CIGI; TSX: CIGI), an industry leading global real estate with more than 16,000 skilled professionals operating in 66 countries. To learn more about Colliers Project Leaders, visit www.colliersprojectleaders.com. <br/><br/> We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> We’re looking for an experienced professional who is looking for the right opportunity to leverage their strong reputation in the municipal infrastructure into a successful leadership role. You bring a wealth of experience leading projects varying in scope and complexity in municipal civil works, water and waste water facilities, heavy civil works, bridges, transportation infrastructure, major land development, and various other forms of horizontal infrastructure. <br/><br/> You’re already known as a trusted advisor to your clients and have built strong, lasting relationships with senior leaders in large municipalities in Alberta that can be leveraged to develop further opportunities to support capital project delivery. You bring in-depth knowledge and have led and managed complex infrastructure projects from start to finish – on time and on budget. <br/><br/> Are you looking to build upon your reputation as a project leader to make a difference for new clients and businesses? Look no further. <br/><br/> <strong>What success looks like:</strong> <ul> <li>You’ve led a number of municipal and civil infrastructure projects, varying in size and scope ideally in either bridges, transportation, land development or other horizontal infrastructure sectors</li><li>Your clients trust you and rely on your knowledge, skills and expertise to achieve their business goals and objectives.</li> <li>Your clients are impressed with your ability to represent their best interests regarding contractual and technical issues</li><li>You are a subject matter expert in the infrastructure sector, developing and growing business and the team within the region</li><li>Your project teams rely on your ability to manage change, communicate and coordinate between multiple stakeholders, resolve issues, and deliver projects on time and on budget</li><li>You maintain contact with existing and prospective clients and respond to business development and sales opportunities with support from the Business Development Team, Principal or Regional Vice President</li> </ul> <strong>What you bring:</strong> <ul> <li>A university degree or diploma in civil engineering or an equivalent engineering discipline</li><li>At least 15 to 20 years of experience in project coordination and management, representing owners to deliver projects of varying size and scope on horizontal infrastructure and large civil projects</li><li>A solid foundation of experience, track record and reputation as a professional consultant to owners and developers of horizontal infrastructure and large civil projects</li><li>Strong relationships with large municipalities and demonstrated prior experience delivering large profile projects for municipal, regional, provincial or federal authorities</li><li>Understanding of development charges and knowledge of the municipal environment including the functioning of various departments in municipalities and cities</li><li>Professional industry credentials such as PMP, P.Eng., CET, or other similar industry recognized designation is considered a strong asset</li><li>Experience with the preparation of Requests for Proposals, Tenders and Tender Closing/Award procedures</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus skills and experience:</strong> <ul> <li>Strong leadership and organizational skills with a proven ability to effectively influence others and resolve client, project and technical issues</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills</li><li>Proficient in MS Project, MS Word and MS Excel</li> </ul>

Title: Project Coordinator
Job_Description: Job Description<br/> <div>You want a career where you utilize your exceptional communication skills. You are capable of coordinating all the city construction approvals. You want to embrace our vision and our values around our people (learning, growing, and having fun), our business (longevity, sustainability, growth), and our community (pride, impact, legacy). <br/><br/> Join our fast-paced and motivated team at Strategic Group, Calgary, as the<strong> Project Coordinator.</strong> You will work with and support the Project Manager, Superintendent and other members of the team.</div> <br/>Job Requirements <br/><br/> As our <strong>Project Coordinator,</strong> you will:  <ul> <li>Have a minimum of 2 years construction experience</li> <li>Have a certificate or degree in a related field</li> <li>Receive all invoices, maintain all the related paper administrative work on site and act as main liaison with the team in Head Office</li> <li>Issue all change orders and site instructions to subtrades on site</li> <li>Prepare, submit and track requests for information</li> <li>Coordinate all the shop drawings from subtrades and ensure they have been communicated to all the stakeholders</li> <li>Deal with the procurement for the day to day operations on site</li> <li>Send award and rejection letters for subtrades</li> <li>Coordinate and schedule utilities</li> <li>Coordinate weekly meetings and take minutes</li> <li>Liaison with City for construction needs</li> <li>Create and maintain hand over manuals to client</li> <li>Track inventory and rental equipment on site</li> <li>Be efficient in MS Office and MS Project</li> <li>Have a proficient knowledge on budgets</li> </ul>

Title: Team Lead, Utility Infrastructure Planning - AMENDMENT
Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div><div> <div><strong>Reporting to the Leader – Development Planning, The Team Lead, Utility Infrastructure Planning is responsible for leading a team of professionals by providing strategic utility servicing planning oversight pertaining to greenfield (new growth) development/ redevelopment (inner-city densification) files and ensuring that Water Resources input is incorporated into policy. This position will also help set business unit direction on capital budget investments in the Water Infrastructure Investment Plan (WIIP) pertaining to Corporate greenfield development and redevelopment priorities. Primary duties include:</strong></div><ul>	<li>	<div>Plan, manage and deliver a portfolio of development related work that supports Corporate Growth Management priorities on behalf of Water Resources focused on water, sanitary and stormwater utility servicing.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Supervise and support Local Area Planning staff in making timely and strategic decisions on behalf of Water Resources related to development planning and growth management related work.</div> </li>		<li>	<div>Identify and assist in the prioritization growth projects that require capital funding in the Water Infrastructure Investment Plan (WIIP) Communicate with internal Planning & Development, Transportation, Parks and other Business Units; and external stakeholders Consultants, Developers, Landowners, General Public on long range planning issues.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Build and maintain strategic and beneficial relationships with critical partners and stakeholders to support Corporate Growth Management Priorities (e.g. attend regular meetings with Planning and Building Industry and Land Development.</div> </li>	</ul></div> </div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div> <strong> <strong> <strong> <strong> <strong> <strong> Qualifications</strong></strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </div>  <div>  <ul>  <li> <div> A degree in Urban and Regional Planning or a degree in a discipline related field to water resources planning.</div> </li>  <li> <div> 8 years of business experience including progressively responsible assignments in areas such as watershed planning, water or environmental management, sustainability, building stakeholder relationships, influencing, and/or policy development.</div> </li>  <li> <div> Membership with the Alberta Professional Planners Institute (APPI) would be considered an asset.</div> </li>  <li> <div> Expertise in developing and executing planning policy projects and major land use planning and development.</div></li>  <li> <div> Utility or infrastructure planning experience is highly desirable.</div> </li>  <li> <div> Ability to work effectively in a team and facilitate consensus in a multiple stakeholder environment.</div> </li>  <li> <div> Ability to understand, interpret, and apply municipal laws, regulations, policies, procedures, and standards related to water, sanitary and storm utility servicing management to specialized, complex or diverse development proposals or to policy, plan or strategy development (long range planning).</div> </li>  <li> <div> Supervisory and leadership experience is preferred.</div> </li>  <li> <div> Ability to lead high functioning technical professionals.</div> </li>  <li> <div> Equivalent combinations of experience and education will be considered.</div> </li> </ul> </div> <br/>  <div> <strong> <strong> <strong> <strong> <strong> <strong> <strong> Pre-employment Requirements</strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </div>  <div>  <ul>  <li> Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.</li> </ul> </div> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div> <div> <div> <div>Union: Exempt</div>  <div>Business Unit: Water Resources</div></div> <div> <div>Position Type: Permanent</div>  <div>Location: 625 25 Avenue S.E</div></div> <div> <div>Compensation: Level F $88, 307 - $135, 252 per annum</div> <div>Days of Work: This position typically works a 5 day</div> <div>work week with one day off in a 3 week cycle.</div></div> <div> <div>Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week</div></div> <div> <div>Audience: Internal/External</div>  <div>Apply By: May 25, 2018</div></div> <div> Amendment: Opened Externally and Closing Date Job ID #: 300815</div> </div> Title: Recreation Program Coordinator
Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div>As a Recreation Program Coordinator, you will be responsible for the leadership, execution and direction of work on a program portfolio supporting the overall delivery of products and services of Calgary Recreation. Primary duties include: <ul>  <li> Provide program management through research, strategy development, implementation plans, evaluation and budget administration.</li>  <li> Build and foster relationships, alliances, partnerships or collaborations to enhance the delivery of programs and/or services.</li>  <li> Represent work unit and/or business unit on internal and/or external committees</li>  <li> Recruit, interview, provide on-boarding support, schedule, supervise and evaluate union/non-union staff, volunteers and work placement/practicum students.</li>  <li> Respond to inquiries from the public, internal and external partners, and Council regarding program information and complaints.</li>  <li> Participate in long term, strategic and annual planning for Calgary Recreation and the completion of grant and funding applications.</li> </ul> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Qualifications</strong></strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </div> <div>  <ul> 	<li>A completed 2 year certificate or diploma in Recreation, Physical Education, Kinesiology, Education, Diversity Studies or a closely related field, combined with at least 5 years of related experience including staff supervision; OR</li> 	<li>A degree in any of the above listed (or a closely related) field, with at least 3 years of related portfolio experience, including staff supervision.</li> 	<li>A valid Class 5 Driver’s Licence (or provincial equivalent) and the use of a personal vehicle for business purposes is required.</li> 	<li>Knowledge and experience working in two or more of the following will be considered an asset: physical literacy, active play, children and youth, volunteers, older adults, access and inclusion and community building.</li> 	<li>Strong critical thinking skills and demonstrated leadership and facilitation skills along with well-developed communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a diverse range of audiences.</li> </ul></div> <br/> <div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Pre-employment Requirements</strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </div> <div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.</div> </li>	</ul></div> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div> <div> <div> <div>Union: CUPE Local 38</div> <div>Business Unit: Calgary Recreation</div></div> <div> <div>Position Type: 1 Temporary (up to 12 months)</div> <div>Location: 2808 Spiller Road S.E.</div></div> <div> <div>Compensation: Pay Grade 11 $39.46 - 52.76 per hour (2017 rates)</div> <div>Days of Work: This position works a 5 day</div> <div>work week with one day off in a 3 week cycle.</div></div> <div> <div>Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week</div></div> <div> <div>Audience: Internal/External</div> <div>Apply By: May 16, 2018</div></div> <div> <div>Job ID #: 300796</div></div> </div> </div><div>About our organization</div> </div> </div> </div></div>

Title: Intermediate Project Engineer – Process –
