Job_Description: <div><div> Intermediate Project Engineer – Process – Calgary SE</div><br/>  <div> <div>  <div> <strong>Openings</strong> 1</div> <div> <strong>Location Name</strong> Enerflex - Canada - Alberta - Calgary <br/> Calgary, Alberta, CA</div> <div> <strong>Operating Unit</strong> Enerflex - Canada</div> <div> <strong>Date Posted</strong> May 03, 2018</div> <div> <strong>Profession</strong> Engineering</div> <div> <strong>Experience Level</strong> Not Specified</div> <div> <strong>Job Type</strong> Permanent, Full Time</div> <div> <strong>Education Level</strong> University - Bachelors</div> <div> <strong>Job ID</strong> job-3209</div> </div><div> Position Summary</div> <div><strong>Company Profile:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex Ltd. is a single source supplier of natural gas compression, oil and gas processing, refrigeration systems, and electric power generation equipment – plus related engineering and mechanical service expertise. The Company’s broad in-house resources provide the capability to engineer, design, manufacture, construct, commission, and service hydrocarbon handling systems. Enerflex’s expertise encompasses field production facilities, compression and natural gas processing plants, refrigeration systems, and electric power equipment servicing the natural gas production industry. Headquartered in Calgary, Canada, Enerflex has more than 2,000 employees globally and operates in over seven regions around the world. <br/><br/> Enerflex puts its Values of Integrity, Commitment, Creativity and Success into action in all aspects of business. The Company values passionate people who want to put their career into overdrive. We will help match your skills with a position that challenges you to reach new heights, rewards you for outstanding performance and allows you to grow with the Company throughout your life-long career. Join the Enerflex team and apply now. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex is looking for an Intermediate <strong>Project Engineer - Process</strong> to lead engineering projects in a high energy manufacturing environment. Reporting directly to the Manager, Process Engineering, this role would be in charge of designing and building large million dollar plus gas processing facilities, while working with our fabrication department to see the project come to life in our facility. This position is responsible for all aspects of the project from design through to commissioning. Work with a strong leadership team who will mentor you through every aspect of the job and share valuable industry knowledge. <br/><br/> Candidate must be able to work in a customer centred team environment. Focus is on projects being accurate, complete and timely. <br/><br/> With a foundation of integrity, the candidate would use commitment and creativity to drive our organization forward. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> This role will offer the right candidate variety in their daily work life, learning opportunities and the chance to add value to our current gas processing projects. We require someone with strong communication skills, matched with sound problem solving and decision making skills. Your ability to ensure project deliverables are accurate, complete and timely while remaining customer focused, will enable you to deliver the results you need to be successful in this role. You must be able to work effectively within a multi-stakeholder environment and seek to be collaborative on all fronts.  <ul> <li>Design process flow and piping / instrument diagrams</li> <li>Review general arrangements and 3D model</li> <li>Ensure accuracy, completeness and timeliness on responsible projects</li> <li>Take part in HAZOP and SIL review meetings.</li> <li>Implement project specifications</li> <li>Size PSV’s and control valves based on process information</li> <li>Size tanks, PVRV’s and EPRV’s</li> <li>Size vessels and piping based on process information</li> <li>Select and order all hand valves and instrumentation on a portion of a gas plant project</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>5-10 Years of experience with an Engineering Degree or Technical Diploma.</li> <li>Preference for P. Eng designation</li> <li>Working knowledge of gas processing and fabrication</li> <li>Experience in pressure vessel and piping design is required.</li> <li>ASME Section VIII and B31.3 helpful but not required</li> <li>Experience sizing pressure relief valves, control valves and piping will be considered an asset</li> <li>Experience with Hysis process simulation software will be considered an asset</li> </ul> <strong>What Enerflex Offers You:</strong><ul> <li>Competitive Compensation</li> <li>Employer Paid Health and Dental Benefits</li> <li>Employee Share Purchase Program</li> <li>Employer Matched Pension Program</li> <li>Vacation and Flex Days</li> <li>Safety Focused Culture</li> <li>Incentive Programs</li> <li>Professional Development Opportunities</li> </ul> <strong>Interested:</strong> Please apply online at www.enerflex.com Careers & Training → Current Openings.</div> <div> <div> Facebook <br/>  Twitter <br/>  Print <br/>  Email <br/><br/> 0Share</div>  </div><br/>  <div> Powered by <br/> Hire Ground Software</div><br/>   <div> Technical Support for Applying Online</div> </div> 	</div>  <br/>

Title: Project Coordinator
Job_Description: <strong>Why the Stampede?</strong> <br/><br/> For over 100 years the Calgary Stampede has been the heart and soul of our city. It is both where and how we come together to celebrate our unique brand of western hospitality and community spirit. As we embark on the next chapter of our story, we will deliver exceptional experiences that entertain, educate and engage visitors. We will build inspired spaces to bring our community together to celebrate, and we will further energize the brand that has come to define our city. Our vision is to create a world-class, year-round gathering place for the community. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/><br/> The Project Coordinator is an administrative support role within the Business Service team. The successful candidate will implement operational plans, contributing to and supporting both the Business Service team and other teams in the Calgary Stampede as well as internal and external stakeholders. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to: <ul> <li>Conduct administration, accounting, reporting and process maintenance. This will also include risk mitigation factors.</li><li>Develop process maps and training throughout the park.</li><li>Develop plans for implementation of net new or updated processes</li><li>Responsible for research and development around the Calgary Stampede policies.</li><li>Support project teams in organizational project delivery <br/> <strong>Qualifications</strong></li> </ul> The ideal candidate will be proactive, optimistic and have worked in a dynamic environment where they have experience delivering on multiple priorities and will hold the following qualifications: <ul> <li>At least, High School Diploma</li><li>Working Knowledge of Microsoft Project and Visio will be an asset</li><li>Strong organizational skills</li><li>Basic understanding of Business Analyst and Project Management methodologies</li><li>A minimum of two years experience in an administrative support role or related experience <br/> <strong>Benefits</strong></li> </ul> The Calgary Stampede offers a unique and exciting work environment, an excellent total compensation package and the opportunity for advancement and employee training. <br/><br/> <strong>To Apply</strong> <br/><br/> To apply, please submit your resume. <br/><br/> All applicants are thanked in advance and only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Title: Construction Manager
Job_Description: Construction Manager, Development, Calgary <br/><br/> Your new company <br/> Hays Specialist Recruitment are working with a dynamic real estate, development and management company in their search for a Construction Manager for their Calgary office. This company participate in all stages of the business including acquisition, zoning, servicing, development marketing and sales/leasing, and has active projects throughout Alberta, BC and Arizona. <br/><br/> Your new role <br/> As the Construction Manager you will be responsible for providing overall direction for assigned projects and assume responsibility for project performance including costs, schedule, quality assurance and status. You will be the front line contact working with the General Contractor as well as coordinating and interfacing with consultants, architects, engineers and municipalities during all phases of development. You will assist in the provision of pre-construction services including pre-qualification estimating, value engineering, construction plans and scheduling. You will develop and monitor the project schedule and budget ensuring the team are fully aware of all contract requirements. You will oversee the evaluation and comparison of bids for construction to select the appropriate contractor. <br/><br/> What you'll need to succeed <br/> As the successful candidate, you will have at least 5 years' experience working for a General Contractor as a Construction/Senior Project Manager having completed projects valued from $5,000,000 to $100,000,000, experience working for a Developer would be considered an asset. You will hold a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Construction Management or equivalent. Experience with mixed use developments would be an asset. You will demonstrate the ability to lead and be extremely comfortable working with executives and key stakeholders. An ability to prioritize workloads and consistently meet deadlines will be essential to your success. <br/><br/> What you'll get in return <br/> This is a rare opportunity for the right individual to join a dynamic, growing company at a senior level. This company is offering a competitive compensation package along with the opportunity to work with some very driven and entrepreneurial people. <br/><br/> What you need to do now <br/> If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Title: Intern, Project Coordinator - Buildings Division
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/>   <div> <div><strong>Internship</strong></div> <br/> <div></div> <br/> <div><strong>05/11/2018</strong></div> <br/> <div></div> <br/> <div><strong><strong>Internship</strong></strong></div> <br/> <div><strong></strong></div> <br/> <div></div> <br/> <div><strong>Pomerleau</strong> is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder.</div> <br/>Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do. <br/><br/> <strong>The Opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> Curious about interesting and impactful work in construction? Even going as far as gaining real world work experience? What about being a part of a student community with many other students during your work term? Peaked your interest yet? If this speaks to you, it’s your time to shine. <br/><br/> Pomerleau is home to an innovative environment allowing students like you an opportunity to thrive. Working with and supporting our Project Management teams, you can take your ideas and passion for construction to the next level. Get hands-on experience working on state-of-the-art projects and develop skills working with some of the best minds in the industry. The pace and path you choose to grow and launch your career is your choice – but let us help you get there. As a key member of our team, we will <strong>rethink construction together</strong>, <strong>from idea to completion</strong>. <strong>Everywhere</strong>. <strong>All the time</strong>. <strong>Period</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>What YOU Will Do</strong>  <ul> <li>Jump in and experience first-hand the on-site construction project management process</li> <li>Assist the project team with daily tasks, coordination and project support</li> <li>Take pride in learning about shop drawings and effectively monitor them</li> <li>Collaborate and keep the lines of communication open when working with team members, trade partners, consultants and clients</li> <li>Embrace the learning experience and be open to taking on new challenges</li> </ul> <strong>What YOU Will Bring</strong>  <ul> <li>Currently enrolled in a recognized Engineering or Construction Management degree or diploma program</li> <li>Solid written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Strong computer skills with enthusiasm for innovation</li> <li>A positive mindset and sense of excitement for being in the action everyday on-site</li> <li>A proven track record of team collaboration</li> <li>The ability to work throughout the Greater Alberta Area</li> </ul> <strong>What’s in it for YOU?</strong>  <ul> <li>The Ability to make a difference and build something <strong>extraordinary</strong> with our team</li> <li>The chance to work with leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities</li> <li>Getting to work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team</li> <li>Opportunities to do challenging work</li> <li>Opportunities to building close relationships peers and other business partners</li> </ul> At Pomerleau we focus on results-oriented, passionate and rigorous people who participate in ambitious and complex projects. You have the profile we are looking for? Apply now to be part of our team. <br/><br/> Only retained candidates will be contacted. We may consider your CV for other positions. <br/><br/> Pomerleau is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive working environment where all employees are treated fairly. </div>  <br/>

Title: Project Coordinator
Job_Description: <div>We are looking for a qualified Rotating Equipment Project Coordinator with the ability to work within a multi-discipline engineering team and vendors. We serve many different market sectors including Oil & Gas, Mining & Metals, Chemical & Petrochemical, Pulp & Paper, Municipal Water & Wastewater Treatment etc.</div><br/>  <div>?</div>  <br/><strong><div>ACCOUNTABILITY:</div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <div><strong>Broad position responsibilities will include:</strong></div> <ul>  	<li>Being accountable under direction of project manager for the day-to-day functions related to coordination and driving projects towards ensuring on time performance, superior quality and profitability</li>  <li>Be a main point of contact for customers, the company?s internal organization, represented manufacturers and suppliers as they relate to projects.</li>  <li>Act as a facilitator in the absence of the Project Manager.</li>  <li>Represent Project Team in the daily production meeting.</li>  <li>Uphold the corporate values of The Company.</li>  <li>Customer satisfaction and meeting agreed deadlines/schedules.</li>  <li>Follow company policies and developing long-range goals and objectives to ensure continuous growth and improvement.</li> </ul>  <div><strong>CORE AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:</strong></div> <ul>  	<li>Acting as a project team leader, assist the Project Manager for projects in coordinating, planning, communicating and executing the delivery of core project component.</li>  <li>Plan, coordinate and administer the Hand-Over Process from Estimation / Inside Sales to Projects Team. Maintain, organize and update project binder during the course of project.</li>  <li>Plan project, procure resources, monitor profitability and develop high level schedule for projects and provide weekly updates of such</li>  <li>Coordination with Document control for the timely submission of documents according to forecast submittal dates and monitor document status.</li>  <li>Set-up project meetings with internal and external stakeholders and prepare meeting agendas</li>  <li>Assist the Project Manager in the quotation process</li>  <li>Manage project invoicing, financial updates and cost tracking.</li>  <li>Administrate project close-out, archive project documents</li>  <li>Coordinate with shop manager/supervisors and QC department for the smooth execution and completion of fabrication, assembly & production as per project schedule.</li>  <li>Facilitate goods returns with Inventory Management & Purchasing.</li>  <li>Any other duties as required for the execution and completion of projects as advised by immediate Supervisor?</li> </ul>

Title: Leases Project Analyst (Temporary)
Job_Description: <strong>Leases Project Analyst (Temporary), Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> Why work at Nutrien? Great question! <br/><br/> Safety is a core value at Nutrien. Keeping every employee safe, healthy and secure is our top priority. Nothing is more important than seeing our people go home safe at the end of every single day. <br/><br/> While working here you will have the opportunity to grow your career while helping us feed the future. We pride ourselves in hiring from a variety of backgrounds and truly believe that it is our differences that make us stronger so we hope you will join us. <br/><br/> In addition to exciting and challenging opportunities, Nutrien offers competitive salaries, great benefits and performance based incentives. <br/><br/> Outside of the skills and necessary qualifications, you will be committed to sustaining our safe and positive work environment while welcoming working side by side others in a diverse culture. Culture at Nutrien is the core of everything we do and all employees are respectful of diverse opinions and views. <br/><br/> The purpose of the Business Analyst role is to document and assist in implementation of the future state business processes that will be impacted by the new standard International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) 16 – Leases. This is to gain a complete understanding of the impact and aid our business partners in identifying the future processes and documenting those processes to support the transition to the new standard. <br/><br/> *Please note that this is a temporary, full-time position (40 hours per week), expected to end February 2019* <br/><br/> <strong>Key Tasks:</strong> <ul>  <li>Facilitation of information gathering and process design through interviews, existing documentation analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and business process modeling this will primarily be for the future state process redesign to support the new accounting standards</li> <li>Acting as a Liaison between Finance and our Business Partners to uphold a clear understanding of future state process requirements and to ensure functional deliverables align with the stakeholders needs</li> <li>Proactive communication and collaboration with external and internal stakeholders to develop: Process Flows, Report design, Test Plans, Defect / Enhancement tracking, Business Process Procedures (BPPs)</li> <li>Working independently with stakeholders, as well as under the direction of project managers. Collaboration with subject matter experts and functional business leads to establish the future state process and impacts</li> <li>Producing deliverables according to standard templates appropriate for project scale</li> <li>Assist in user acceptance testing, test planning, development of test cases and test execution management to ensure alignment with original requirements, process definition and future compliance.</li>  </ul> <strong>Skills:</strong> <ul>  <li>Knowledge of Agriculture, Manufacturing and Supply Chain an asset</li> <li>Competent and proficient understanding of a variety of technology platforms, including ERP’s such as SAP and PeopleSoft, as well as current Microsoft and Internet technologies</li> <li>Excellent analytical and organizational skills with expert fluency in Excel, Visio and PowerPoint.</li> <li>Previous project experience</li> <li>Business aptitude for strategy and benefits realization alignment</li> <li>Knowledge and experience with Business Process modeling tools and techniques</li> <li>Understanding of the IT Life Cycle</li> <li>Proven capability and experience managing requirements gathering initiatives across multiple teams and business areas</li> <li>Exceptional communication, both written and verbal, and facilitation skills</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul>  <li>A Finance background with knowledge of accounting practice.</li> <li>A background of 3 years minimum of practical experience in business analysis and processes</li> <li>A professional degree or a combination of education and experience may also be considered</li>  </ul> Nutrien is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We encourage applications from all well qualified candidates who reflect the diversity of the regions where we operate. This includes recognizing the voluntary identification of status such as gender, sexual orientation, visible minority, Indigenous status, persons with disabilities, and veterans, where applicable. <br/><br/> If this sounds like a good match, apply now. This job will remain posted until filled. You may be required to undergo a background check and substance test in accordance with Nutrien policies. <br/><br/> While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Title: Project Director - Real Estate
Job_Description: Graham Group (Graham) is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with a history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, you will be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. You will also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. <br/><br/> Graham ranks among Canadas largest construction companies, is a Platinum Member of Canadas 50 Best Managed Companies and is seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If youre eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. <br/><br/> Gracorp Capital Advisors Ltd. (Gracorp), a subsidiary of Graham, is a private market real estate developer with offices in Vancouver, Calgary and Toronto. On its own, or in partnership, Gracorp develops multi-family residential, industrial, retail, office and hospitality projects across Western Canada and the US Pacific Northwest. Gracorp is currently involved in developing projects in excess of $1 billion and has numerous additional projects in the development pipeline. <br/><br/> The <strong>Project Directo</strong>r will help manage Gracorps real estate development projects that leverage the capabilities and geographical presence of the Graham Group. Reporting to the <strong>Director of Real Estate - Calgary</strong>, the <strong>Project Director</strong> will help construct and manage multiple real estate development opportunities and oversee the various general contractor relationships and interface with both the architect and sub-consultants. <br/><br/> <em><strong>As Project Director at Gracorp you will:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Manage the real estate construction process by working with the general contractor, architect, subconsultants and the owner and have the ability to influence the outcome of your projects.</li>   <li>Manage contractual aspects of CCDC and RAIC contracts to represent Gracorps or investors interests and maintain good relationships with all stakeholders.</li> <li>Engage in the planning, budgeting and scheduling process with Gracorps development team to ensure that the project is constructed in accordance with design, budget, and schedule.</li> <li>Assist, review, and negotiate contracts; liaise with legal counsel (as appropriate), in conjunction with the development team.</li> <li>Monitor and control progress, costs, and budgets throughout the project and manage the general contractor relationship.</li> <li>Manage the construction draw process with lenders representatives.</li> </ul> <em><strong>To be successful at Gracorp, you will have the following qualifications and experience:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Relevant post-secondary education in a related discipline; a PMP designation is an asset and you may have previously been an owners representative.</li> <li>Five or more years of experience in real estate development or construction related projects.</li> <li>Experience in the development of land, multi-family residential, retail, industrial, hotel or office projects would be an asset.</li>   <li>Experience working with various municipalities through land use re-designations, planning and permitting.</li> <li>Management of construction projects in excess of $40 million.</li> <li>Passion for real estate development with a proactive and independent nature including strong analytical, planning, negotiation and problem-solving skills.</li> <li>Keen insight and analytical capabilities coupled with business acumen, including the ability to manage diverse opportunities in various markets sectors.</li> <li>A demonstrated thoroughness and attention to detail as well as the ability to consider the bigger picture and corporate strategic objectives.</li> <li>The ability to prioritize tasks and work on multiple assignments in a team environment.</li> <li>Experienced communication skills, both written and oral.</li> <li>Knowledge of and experience with various construction delivery methods, project management models, applicable building codes and knowledge of Built Green and LEED standards is an asset.</li> </ul> <em><strong>Compensation and Benefits:</strong> </em>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary with annual bonus potential</li> <li>Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan.</li> <li>Ownership and long term equity opportunities</li> <li>What We Can Offer You</li> <li>Strong commitment to safety in the workplace</li> <li>Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector</li> <li>Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America</li> </ul> Gracorp is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. <br/><br/> <strong>We're Building careers, not filling jobs.</strong> <br/><br/> View available job opportunities and submit your application online at www.graham.ca/careers <br/> Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. <br/> Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you. <br/><br/> Gracorp Capital Advisors Ltd. <br/> 10840 27th Street SE <br/> Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 <br/> Fax: 403.570.5000

Title: Accounts Payable Team Lead
Job_Description: Do you have what it takes to be a great DIRTTBag? DIRTT Environmental Solutions is an unconventional company (this is a term we use in polite circles). We have no HR Department. Instead we run a Talent Agency, where people, known lovingly as DIRTTBags, don't face lengthy policies, procedures, or forms. What they do find is a highly motivated group of individuals who embrace the entrepreneurial spirit of DIRTT. Everyone is hands-on, regardless of position. We celebrate our successes together. We have fun, and we work hard. Our culture is like no other. We achieve what others only dream about. <br/><br/> This is not a conventional Accounts Payable position; our processes and procedures are as custom as our products.We are looking for an individual who is interested in thinking outside the box in addressing traditional AP situations. <br/><br/> The successful candidate will be responsible for: <br/><br/> Full cycle accounts payableutilizing a completely paperless workflow, technology nerds take note <br/> Buildingrelationships across all departments <br/> Monthly review of accruals <br/> Manage, coordinate, and reconcile the corporate credit card program <br/> Prepareand review weekly cheque and EFT runs before sign off by Controller <br/> Helpto improve and streamline AP processes <br/> Manages and maintains vendor relations <br/> Train/mentor the AP team <br/> Assist with other duties as needed, DIRTTbags are multi-purpose <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> Minimum3-5 years of accounts payable supervisory experience, full cycle experience a plus <br/> Team player were looking for someone to live the full DIRTT experience <br/> Strong computer skills Excel junkies need apply <br/> Problem solver with the ability to think analytically and outside the box <br/> Ability to balance multiple tasks and prioritize <br/> People oriented with an ability to establish a high degree of credibility with staff and vendors <br/> Excellent organizational skills <br/> Attention to detail to ensure accuracy in everything you do <br/> Excellent written and verbal communication skills <br/> An energetic self-starter with a willingness to keep learning <br/><br/> To apply for this position please email us at: careers@dirtt.net and include the position title in your subject line. <br/><br/> DIRTT is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Project Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>ROLE:</strong> <br/><br/> As Project Engineer, your primary role will be to work with the Manager of Engineering and the rest of the team to successfully deliver projects to clients in the municipal and land development industries. In addition, you will work with and support the business development and marketing aspects of the team. <br/><br/> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul> <li>Successful completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering from an accredited University.</li> <li>5 plus years’ experience in engineering discipline, specifically in municipal and land development.</li> <li>Must be a registered member of the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA).</li> <li>Experience with Civil 3D software.</li> <li>Experience in Stormwater Management design is an asset.</li> <li>Strong presentation, verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.</li> <li>Business development drive and entrepreneurial acumen.</li> <li>Strong technical skills and attention to detail.</li> </ul> <strong>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with engineering manager, project managers, engineers and drafting technicians to successfully deliver quality projects on-time and on-budget for a variety of land development and municipal projects.</li> <li>Design of various municipal and land development projects.</li> <li>Review technical drawings, details, and specifications to ensure quality and oversight.</li> <li>Supervise junior engineers and technologists.</li> <li>Prepare proposals.</li> <li>Develop relationships for partnering with other firms.</li> <li>Develop business opportunities with existing and potential clients.</li> </ul> <strong>COMPANY INFORMATION:</strong> <br/><br/> Since 1983, Watt Consulting Group has been a multi-disciplinary civil engineering, transportation planning and land survey practice, operating out of offices in Calgary, Victoria, Vancouver, Kelowna, Edmonton and Lloydminster. We provide transportation planning, engineering and geomatics services to a wide variety of public and private sector clients throughout Western Canada. We strive to achieve our Vision of being a recognized leader in the creation of vibrant and livable communities. You will be joining a team that is passionate about what they do and who hold themselves to a high standard of excellence. We take our work to “<strong>HEART</strong>”. These are the values we hold high and strive to live by every day: Honesty, Excellence, Accountability, Respect and Teamwork. <br/><br/> <em>If you are looking for an exciting opportunity and to grow your career in a dynamic organization, owned and led by employees, submit your resume to careers@wattconsultinggroup.com.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Ownership opportunities will also be available to the successful candidate.</em> <br/><br/> <em>We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. WATT Consulting Group is an equal opportunity employer</em>.

Title: ERP Implementation Consultant
Job_Description: <div> <div> Apply Now</div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> <strong>SAP B1 Implementation Consultant - Canada Central region <br/> Full Time / Permanent</strong> <br/> <strong>Location: Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> Vision33 Inc. (www.vision33.com) is the number one global value added reseller (VAR) for SAP Business One. Vision33 helps growing enterprises challenge their business processes and find efficiencies that help them attain goals and achieve their vision for growth and success. As an SAP gold channel partner, Vision33 services over 700 customers across the globe; providing each with the right balance of software, world-class consulting and support services. The company’s broad global presence builds upon its local market insight from sales offices and US headquarters in Irvine, California; Canadian headquarters in Vancouver, British Columbia; and UK headquarters in London, England. <br/><br/> Vision33 offers enterprises access to the world’s largest and most experienced team of SAP Business One consultants and is consistently honored for its customer dedication, earning the prestigious 2016 SAP® Pinnacle Award in the customer choice category. <br/><br/> We have an immediate need for a talented <strong>SAP B1 Implementation Consultant</strong> to support our growing customer base. As an SAP Business One Implementation Consultant, you will have the opportunity to work alongside some of the brightest minds in the ERP consulting industry. <br/><br/> <strong><em>You will be responsible for:</em> </strong>   <ul>  	<li>Providing implementation consultation, project management, and support services during SAP Business One installations, upgrades and customizations</li> <li>Recognizing and addressing gaps between SAP Business One solutions and the business practices of the clients</li> <li>Effectively communicating and building consensus with clients</li> <li>Supporting the preparation of the scope of work by providing task/time details</li> <li>Designing and conducting master data migration from legacy systems into SAP Business One</li> <li>Training, coaching, and mentoring Junior Implementation Consultants</li> <li>Developing and maintaining expert knowledge of SAP Business One</li> <li>Achievement of individual billable utilization targets</li> </ul>  <strong>Ideal candidates would possess the following qualifications:</strong>   <ul>  	<li>A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business (Accounting) and/or Information Systems from a recognized post-secondary institution</li> <li>Excellent communication skills, both written and oral</li> <li>Superior people skills; team-oriented, fast learner and very personable</li> <li>Self-motivated and driven to achieve success within a consulting environment</li> <li>Experience in an ERP implementation role with SAP Business One preferred, but not required. (Also beneficial would be implementation experience in SME space with other products such as Microsoft Dynamics, Sage, Epicor, and/or Netsuite)</li> <li>Experience with software implementations, operational accounting, product distribution and fulfillment, warehouse management, manufacturing, or other applicable business processes.</li> <li>Experience with MSSQL Server query development/tuning, HANA database engine, Crystal Reports development, data migration, or functional software integration design.</li> <li>Experience managing software implementation projects including balancing budget, timeline, scope, and resource availability.</li> </ul>  We offer a competitive total rewards program including: salary, incentive plans, training and development, paid-vacations, retirement plans, health and wellness program and employee benefits; along with exciting opportunities for global and diverse project opportunities, internal mobility, travel, and so much more. We are looking for motivated individuals to join our energetic team of professionals. If you want to get involved in an environment where you can really make a difference and where you can apply your knowledge to achieve results and work with an award-winning SAP Business Partner; please submit an online application today.</div> <br/> <div> <div> <div>Recruitment Team <br/> www.gzed.com</div></div> </div> </div>  <br/>

Title: Int. Project Administrative Assistant
Job_Description: Recognized as a leader in the EPC industry and ranked as the #2 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine for the second consecutive year, we provide planning, design, build, and maintenance of upstream and midstream oil and gas facilities and infrastructure. With over 5,000 employees across North America, we service exploration, production, storage, and transportation of crude oil and natural gas to end users, both offshore and onshore. We bring together many different aspects including Pipeline and Facilities groups, onshore and offshore offices, and engineering services to help meet the demands of our clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/><br/> Performs a variety of administrative/clerical support tasks for a specific project, business, or technical unit. Labor charges or normally billed to client contracts. Exercises more independence in day-to-day operations. Individuals would generally support a senior manager, function or group. Duties would normally require in-depth knowledge of one or more software products or specialized knowledge of a particular administrative function or area. May be responsible for assigning tasks to or overseeing the work of individuals at lower levels. <ul> <li>Maintains project specific procedures manuals, project filing systems</li><li>Assemble project deliverables and prepare transmittals of data</li><li>Employee development including daily on the job training</li><li>Type drafts and finals of correspondence, reports, specifications and transmittals from typed and handwritten copy</li><li>Scheduling meetings using outlook</li><li>Maintain calendars and schedule appointments</li><li>Supporting Project Administrator Lead</li><li>Organize catering for meetings and performing pre / post-meeting functions</li><li>Assisting with travel arrangements for project</li><li>Prioritizing workload, working independently, multitasking</li><li>Providing quality �self-check� of documents produced</li><li>Distribution of project materials, mail, etc.</li><li>Assisting other Administrators in overload situations</li><li>Photocopying as required</li></ul>  <ul> <li>High School graduate or equivalent required</li><li>5ǉ years' of relevant experience required</li><li>Microsoft Office including: Word, Excel, Outlook and Power Point required</li><li>Exceptional oral and written communication skills required</li> </ul> At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.

Title: Project Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/><br/><strong>SNC-Lavalin, a Tier1 Canadian Engineering & Construction company with presence in all corners of the globe, are currently seeking to identify the availability of highly qualified candidates for a potential Oil & Gas EPC mega-project that may be constructed in a remote region of the Middle East. Still in the early stages of development and qualification, this project will require a large and highly skilled team of people who will be hand-selected based on their professional experience and past working history on similar projects. We require candidates in all Disciplines to support the Detailed Engineering and Procurement stage of the project that may be executed out of our Western Operations centre in downtown Calgary. SNC-Lavalin invites candidates with specific experience in engineering, procurement, and construction of Gas Processing facilities (Separation, Storage, Compression, Treatment, Sulphur Recovery, U&O) in the Middle East, and for Clients specific to that region, to submit their Resume for our review. Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada, and only candidates with experience specific to this region and its associated Clients will be considered.</strong><br/><br/><strong>Worker Type</strong>Employee<strong>Job Type</strong>Regular<br/><br/>At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

Title: IT Team Lead/Account Manager - Ottawa
Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> Search results <br/><br/> <strong> APPLY NOW</strong> <br/><br/> Add to shortlist <br/><br/> Send to a friend</div><br/>  <div> IT Team Lead/Account Manager (OTT0100)<br/><br/><strong>Reference</strong> <br/> OTT0100 <br/><br/> <strong>Salary</strong> <br/> CAD100,000 - 120,000/annum <br/><br/> <strong>Location</strong>   <ul> <li>Canada -- Ontario -- Ottawa <br/><br/> <strong>Job type</strong></li> </ul>  Permanent <br/><br/> <strong>Posted</strong> <br/> May 3, 2018</div>  </div><br/>  <div><strong>Why Work For Us</strong> <br/><br/> HAYS celebrates and empowers those employees who made it all possible. A career at HAYS means great people, a great atmosphere, and career advancement opportunities. Our employees thrive with ongoing training and leadership programs for all while working in an engaging and fun environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Commitment to You:</strong>  <ul> <li><strong>Compensation & Benefits</strong>: We offer competitive uncapped commission plans with a base salary + flexible benefit plans, RRSP matching, internal incentives, semi-annual trips, 3 weeks’ vacation and so much more!</li></ul>   <ul> <li><strong>Industry Leading Training</strong>: You will receive cutting-edge sales training throughout all levels of your career at Hays. We will equip you with the required skills, knowledge and support so you can win business, achieve success and really make a name for yourself. We care about our employees and acknowledge the contribution each one of them makes to our success. Working with us means being part of one big family.</li> </ul> <strong>The Position</strong>  <ul> <li>As an <strong>I.T Team Lead Account Manager</strong>, you will be responsible for developing your own fees, growing and managing a client portfolio, as well as ongoing development of new business opportunities all while managing a team.</li> <li> You will be responsible to motivate and manage a diverse team of direct reports towards measured success. You will need to regularly motivate the team by providing continual coaching, feedback and recognition for successes. Set clear performance goals and provide ongoing direction, coaching and guidance.</li> <li>You will also spend time managing your own client accounts and communicating with Hays Recruiters to provide quality information so that they can assist you in sourcing key talent to fill vacancies.</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Working with Hays will give you the competitive advantage that will differentiate you in the marketplace. Through our unique digital recruitment strategy and our world-class database that’s integrated with LinkedIn, you will have the necessary tools to pro-actively source new business and provide industry expertise to your clients.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Diploma or degree from a post-secondary institution, or relevant work experience</li> <li>4-8 years of experience managing Key Accounts and/or a Sales team</li> <li>Experience and knowledge in the technology sector</li> <li>Strong business/financial acumen, strategic focus and experience influencing change management</li> <li>A leader who demonstrates a high personal commitment along with a proven capacity to develop a team</li> <li>Strong drive and sense of urgency: ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, changing environment</li> <li>Able to work within a cross-functional team environment and build strong interpersonal relationships both internally and externally</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Strong skills in Microsoft Office applications, able to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies</li> <li>Previous experience with CRM tools such as Salesforce.com</li> <li>Demonstrated negotiation and contract management skills</li> <li>Able to identify, manage and overcome obstacles in order to secure new business</li> <li>The ability to understand market opportunities, as well as the ability to champion a solution and drive the joint value proposition with customers</li> <li>Strong customer focus, both internal and external, at the senior level</li> <li>Highly organized with strong attention to detail</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div> Contact information<br/><br/>Una Karanovic</div><br/>  <div>Share this Advert</div><br/>  <div> Search results <br/><br/> <strong> APPLY NOW</strong> <br/><br/> Add to shortlist <br/><br/> Send to a friend</div>  </div>

Title: Project Lead, Paediatrics, Cumming School of Medicine
Job_Description: <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> The <strong>Department of Paediatrics</strong> in the <strong>Cumming School of Medicine</strong> invites applications for a <strong>Project Lead</strong>. This Full-time Fixed Term position is for approximately 6 months (based on length of grant funding), with the possibility of extension. <br/><br/> This position reports to the Principal Investigator. The Project Lead, Innovative Models of Acute Paediatric Mental Health and Addiction Care, will play a vital role in the sucess of the project. <br/><br/> The main goal of this position is to oversee and be responsible for the design and implementation of the core elements of this project. These core elements have been identified but now require stakeholder buy-in to implement. The Project Lead will work closely with the Principal Investigators to maintain effective day-to-day operation and maintenance of key regional, provincial and national linkages. The Project Lead will be responsible for ensuring that all elements of the studies are running smoothly, that the rights and well-being of participants are protected, and that the data collected are accurate, complete, and verifiable. <br/><br/> The individual will be extensively involved in overseeing the integration of this project into the other operations of the Pediatric Emergency Research Team (PERT). <br/><br/> Position is located at the Alberta Children's Hospital. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Key Responsibilities</strong> (job functions include but are not limited to): <br/><br/> Leadership <ul> 	<li>Develop and maintain relationships with key project stakeholders</li>	<li>Provide primary support to the project Principal Investigators, identifying key strategic and governance issues, planning meetings, preparing reports and papers for consideration, and ensuring their decisions and requests are addressed and implemented</li>	<li>Foster effective team work among the project team</li>	<li>Conduct official correspondence on behalf of the Principal Investigators as appropriate</li>	<li>On an ongoing basis, seek out partnerships and alliances to support the project</li> </ul> Pilot project implementation <ul> 	<li>Rapidly identifying stakeholders</li>	<li>Working with them to design projects</li>	<li>Rolling out projects</li>	<li>Collecting key data elements</li>	<li>Analyzing and interpreting data</li> </ul> Operational planning and management <ul> 	<li>Assist in the develop of a business plan which incorporates goals and objectives that support the project</li>	<li>Oversee the efficient and effective day-to-day operation of the project and grant preparation</li>	<li>Draft project procedures, review as needed, and recommend changes as appropriate</li>	<li>Ensure that project files are securely stored and privacy/confidentiality is maintained</li>	<li>Leads, manages, or participates in projects as assigned.</li>	<li>Analyzes issues, and defines project objectives, scope, implementation plans, resource requirements, and timelines</li>	<li>Designs and manages all assigned phases of projects and programs</li>	<li>Provides input into the day-to-day operational aspects of a project/program, including identifying and resolving issues and conflict</li> </ul> Budget/Resource planning and management: <ul> 	<li>Accountable for fiscal management including expenditures and sound bookkeeping/accounting procedures</li>	<li>Administer funds according to approved budget and monitor monthly expenditures</li>	<li>Provide the funder with a comprehensive report on project expenditures</li>	<li>Supports the preparation and monitoring of budgets for the research including operational activities consistent with the plans and general guidelines</li>	<li>Monitors projects and plans and reports any variance from expected outcomes to the Principal Investigators</li>	<li>Collaborates with the Principal Investigators, staff and key stakeholders to meet financial targets</li> </ul> Strategic and Operational Planning: <ul> 	<li>Supports the development and implementation of the planning and program development processes</li>	<li>Organizes meetings, committees, locations, agendas, goals and next-steps</li>	<li>Works collaboratively with the different committees to determine priorities, establish goals and objectives, develop and implement action plans, identify performance measures/targets, and monitor/evaluate progress toward performance targets</li>	<li>Develop and oversee the implementation of key initiatives as part of the project planning and grant preparation</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications / Requirements:</strong> <ul> 	<li>University degree, masters preferred along with knowledge of mental health/addiction care and/or Alberta Health Services operations.</li>	<li>5 years of experience as a project/program manager.</li>	<li>Experience working with health care providers, AHS officials and consumer groups</li>	<li>Experience working with a variety of stakeholders to develop relationships and achieve shared goals</li>	<li>Superior skills and success experience in motivating and collaborating with others to build successful partnerships</li>	<li>Knowledge and understanding of healthcare research</li>	<li>Knowledge and understanding of University of Calgary research services, financial procedures, policies and agreements</li>	<li>High level skills in organizational management and ability to manage multiple priorities</li>	<li>Highly developed skills in project management and coordination including planning, development, implementation, and evaluation</li>	<li>Strong interpersonal skills</li>	<li>Ability to organize ideas and information, and to communicate clearly and concisely in both oral and written forms</li>	<li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team</li> </ul> ¿<strong>Application Deadline:</strong> May 16, 2018 <br/><br/> <em>We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> This position is part of the AUPE bargaining unit, and falls under the <em><strong>Specialist/Advisor Job Family, Phase III</strong></em>. <br/><br/> To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Management and Staff Careers website</strong>. For more information about the Cumming School of Medicine visit <strong>Careers in the Cumming School of Medicine</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong>ucalgary.ca</strong>. <br/><br/> <em>The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.</em>

Title: Software Developer (Product Owner)
Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting contract opportunity for a Product Owner in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Missions Systems-Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. The Scrum teams operate within a larger Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be a Product Owner for one of the Scrum teams. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <ul> <li>The Product Owner is a content management leader who prioritizes and grooms the backlog and ensures that the team understands what they are working on. The Product Owner’s responsibilities include:</li><li>Working with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) product manager and other stakeholders to understand their needs</li><li>Provides vision and roadmap for what the Product Owner wishes to be built</li><li>Clearly communicates this vision in understandable product backlog items</li><li>Ordering and prioritizing the items in the product backlog to best achieve goals and missions</li><li>Optimizing the value of the work the development team performs</li><li>Ensuring that the product backlog is visible, transparent, clear to all, and shows what the Scrum team will work on next</li><li>Ensuring the development team understands items in the product backlog to the level needed</li><li>The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the product backlog</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Minimum of four years experience in software engineering</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li> <li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li> </ul> Skills & Experience – Nice to have: <ul> <li>Previous experience as a Product Owner or Scrum Master on an Agile team</li><li>Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification</li><li>Previous experience leading teams in an agile environment</li><li>Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0)</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required</li> </ul> Other: <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace.Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Team Lead (Packager)
Job_Description: <strong>We are excited to share an exciting announcement: Acrodex Inc. will officially rebrand as PCM Canada, a subsidiary of PCM Inc. Backed by PCMs extensive North American capabilities and resources, we now take an important step forward with plans to grow our reach across Canada, bolster our service catalog, and improve delivery efficiencies. PCM Canada customers stand to benefit from deepened relationships with vendors and from a strategic partnership with sister company, Stratiform.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Working at PCM Canada</strong> <br/><br/> PCM Canada supports clients in reaching their business goals. PCM Canada is an exciting and rewarding place to work for both IT and business professionals. We strive to provide the highest standard of service, while leveraging the latest technology. The deep, long-lasting relationships with our loyal clients are a testament to our award-winning and industry recognized people and processes. <br/><br/> Here at PCM Canada, we've built an environment that is fast-paced and dynamic; constantly evolving to the changing technology industry. Our innovative approach promotes consistent growth and expansion that have created numerous career and advancement opportunities. This is echoed in our all of our internal practices as PCM Canada provides its employees with the latest training, programs and devices needed to complete their jobs to the best of their abilities. <br/><br/> <strong>Kick-start your IT career by joining our PCM family</strong> <br/><br/> PCM Canada has delivered the right technology to clients for over 30 years. Over the decades, PCM Canada has partnered with top technology brands like Apple, HP, Dell, Microsoft and Cisco to offer our customers the best IT solutions available on the market. This success wouldn't be possible without the dedicated, motivated PCMers that make up our growing family. <br/><br/> We offer a full benefits program which includes Life Insurance, Accidental Death and Dismemberment, Short and Long Term Disability, Extended HealthCare (including a Vision Care program), and Dental care. We also follow a comprehensive workplace health and safety program to ensure our employees are given the most comfortable and productive work environment possible. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Company</strong> <br/><br/> PCM Canada, is a full spectrum, enterprise-wide technology solutions provider that has been in the IT business since 1984. We deliver end-to-end IT solutions to clients across Canada, such as application innovations; systems integration services; hardware and software procurement services; and managed services (computer facilities management, application management, support/help desk and life cycle management services, etc.). With 600 IT professionals and support staff, we deliver quality service from our office locations in Edmonton, Calgary, Fort McMurray, Richmond Hill, Markham, Etobicoke, Winnipeg, and Vancouver. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Title: PRT Team Lead/Software Packager</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Business Unit: Program Services</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Reports to (Title): Service Delivery Manager</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Location: Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>General Accountability:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>The Team Lead, Software Packager reports to the Manager, Service Delivery. The Lead is responsible for applying software packaging techniques to application and configuration changes, resulting in efficient, automated, distribution processes that will reliably run in the managed desktop environment. In addition, the team lead will also be involved in day to day packaging duties 50% of the time.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Team Lead</strong> <br/><br/> • Take ownership and responsibility for problem resolution. <br/><br/> • Have the necessary leadership, team building, motivation, and delegation skills to efficiently coordinate the efforts of a team toward accomplishing a common goal. <br/><br/> • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with all levels of individual. <br/><br/> • Ability to meet attendance standards and work the hours necessary to perform the essential functions of the job. <br/><br/> • In Depth knowledge of Windows O/S and COTS Software packages. <br/><br/> • ITIL Service Management. <br/><br/> • Ability to manage multiple priorities. <br/><br/> • Maintains a positive attitude. <br/><br/> • Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize. <br/><br/> • Team player <br/><br/> • Delivers to timescales <br/><br/> • Complete required performance appraisals and disciplinary action <br/><br/> • High degree of accuracy and attention to detail. <br/><br/> • Create documentation including Knowledge Base articles and Technical Alerts. <br/><br/> • Ensure SLAs are achieved and client expectations are met (or exceeded). <br/><br/> • Providing regular (weekly/monthly) management reporting of performance against SLAs and fault trend analysis to senior management. <br/><br/> • Participate & contribute to service improvement plans. <br/><br/> • Build services relationships with clients. <br/><br/> • Develop and manage daily schedules for direct reports. <br/><br/> • Build and maintain effective working relationships with operational colleagues. <br/><br/> • Share knowledge and experiences to assist with the learning of colleagues throughout the department. <br/><br/> Packager: <br/><br/> • Write, modify, integrate and test computer packages for the City to meet standard endpoint specifications under non-privileged login account and/or specialized accounts as required <br/><br/> • Validate software license information <br/><br/> • Support existing packages with appropriate troubleshooting <br/><br/> • Identify and communicate technical problems, processes and solutions <br/><br/> • Perform peer Quality Assurance on all packages and installation documentation <br/><br/> • Prepare reports, manuals and other documentation on the status, operation and maintenance of software; <br/><br/> • Maintain existing packages by making modifications as required; <br/><br/> • Monitoring and supporting software change implementation processes. <br/><br/> • Monitor and support software distribution infrastructure <br/><br/> • Utilize Industry Best practices <br/><br/> • Update ticketing system to maintain appropriate communication <br/><br/> • Follow City processes and procedures for IT service Management <br/><br/> • Other related duties and functions as required <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications (Education/Experience/Skills & Abilities)</strong> <br/><br/> • Degree/Diploma in related field <br/><br/> • Experience with application packaging for central distribution or application virtualization <br/><br/> • Experience with supporting Windows 7 and higher <br/><br/> • Experience with VMware, HyperV <br/><br/> • Experience with scripting tools such as Win Batch, VBScript, PowerShell <br/><br/> • Experience with knowledge and experience of MS Windows security <br/><br/> • Proven ability to retaining new information and being adaptive in a rapidly changing IT environment <br/><br/> • Familiar with the following toolsets <br/><br/> • InstallShield / AdminStudio <br/><br/> • Microsoft App-V/ ThinAppAs a condition of employment, this job is subject to the successful completion of the following Pre-employment conditions: Reference Checks, Criminal Background Checks and a Drivers Abstract if required for the role.

Title: Program Advisor, Team Lead, Undergraduate Science Centre, Faculty of Science
Job_Description: <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> The <strong>Undergraduate Science Centre</strong> in the <strong>Faculty of Science</strong> is currently seeking a Full-time Regular <strong>Program Advisor, Team Lead</strong>. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manger, Undergraduate Science Centre, the Program Advisor, Team Lead supervises the workload of the Program Advising team, provides advising and program management support for a wide range of student cohorts served by the Undergraduate Science Centre including the coordination and administration of the Academic Review process for the Faculty of Science. The Program Advisor, Team Lead provides student affairs expertise related to student admission, registration and progression through degree programs to graduation. This position involves considerable liaison with student advisors from other faculties, departments, Enrolment Services, Admissions and student support units. <br/><br/> Regular hours are Monday to Friday, 8:30-4:30 however occasional overtime may be required. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong> Summary of Key Responsibilities</strong> (job functions include but are not limited to): <ul>  <li> Support the Manager and the Senior Undergraduate Specialist to ensure that program advising needs for the Faculty of Science students are being met</li>  <li> Supervise the workloads of the USC Program Advising team, organizes and prioritize advising tasks, including the scheduling management of phone, emails and appointments</li>  <li> Address performance management concerns for the program advising team and collaborates with the Manager to resolve the identified issues</li>  <li> Provide support on complex advising matters and system troubleshooting</li>  <li> Advise, support, provide outreach and create communication plans for target populations (Indigenous, Pathways to Medicine scholarships, STEPS)</li>  <li> Recommend adjustments to schedules, policies and procedures within the Faculty of Science to support both the advising team and Faculty of Science students</li>  <li> Provide communication to Faculty of Science students and the greater University community related to Program Advising matters</li>  <li> Support all academic related processes of student advising, including coordination of admissions (Change of Program and Diverse Qualifications), graduation list, prerequisite check</li>  <li> Maintain and foster cooperative and trusting relationships with advisees, faculty and campus staff including Admissions and Enrolment Services and other student affairs offices across campus in order to provide seamless and efficient student support processes</li>  <li> Act as a central resource and supports training for departments on student-related academic advising matters. This includes creating and maintaining faculty-wide advising training tools and identifying external training opportunities</li>  <li> Gather statistical information to improve student advising services, including ATP data</li>  <li> Maintain the Undergraduate Science Centre website</li>  <li> Coordinate/manage the training of Program Advising staff (new and continuing training)</li>  <li> Participate in cross-training to assist in other areas when needed and to meet Undergraduate Science Centre priorities</li>  <li> Identify professional development needs and skill priorities for the Advising team; continue own personal development, learning and training; keeps current with post-secondary developments</li>  <li> Ensure the integrity of information provided to students when advising and provide advising with discretion and tact to avoid misunderstandings or difficult encounters</li>  <li> Advise current/prospective students in both a one-on-one and group setting regarding degree requirements and university policies and procedures</li>  <li> Assist students in making informed decisions, setting short and long term goals, and fulfilling the requirements of their degree choice</li>  <li> Process degree audits, credit evaluations and graduation applications using academic software</li>  <li> Proactively monitor students' progression through their degree program to graduation to ensure requirements are met</li>  <li> Provide advice and assistance to students on all aspects of their academic experience, including progression and requirement matters for their chosen degree</li>  <li> Resolve student program conflicts as they arise</li>  <li> Use a thorough knowledge of program degree requirements as detailed in the University of Calgary calendar, to recommend programs of study that will allow students to successfully meet their goals</li>  <li> Adhere to all University policy and regulatory requirements, including FOIP legislation.</li>  </ul> <strong> Qualifications / Requirements:</strong> <ul>  <li> Bachelor Degree and at least five year of student services, student affairs, or program advising experience</li>  <li> Ability to successfully handle a large student workload with a positive student-centric</li>  <li> Outstanding interpersonal communication skills, including written, oral, one-on-one and group</li>  <li> The ability to analyse information quickly, and think creatively to resolve problems or act on or develop opportunities is required</li>  <li> A high attention to detail and proven organizational skills required</li>  <li> Strong critical thinking, judgement and decision making skills</li>  <li> Ability to work under pressure to meet strict and multiple timelines</li>  <li> Effective leader, and the ability to work individually and as a team member</li>  <li> Demonstrated ability to be resourceful, creative, innovative, and flexible</li>  <li> Experience developing and providing presentations for students</li>  <li> Computer skills include: MS Office Suite including Work, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel and Access, Peoplesoft, and Orbis</li>  <li> Thorough knowledge of University policies, procedures and requirements including the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act</li>  </ul> <strong> Application Deadline:</strong>  May 18, 2018 <br/><br/> <em> We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> This position is part of the AUPE bargaining unit, and falls under the <em><strong>Specialist/Advisor Job Family, Phase III</strong></em>. <br/><br/> To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Management and Staff Careers website</strong>. For more information about the Faculty of Science visit <strong>Careers in the Faculty of Science</strong> . <br/><br/> <strong>About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong>ucalgary.ca</strong>. <br/><br/> <em>The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.</em>

Title: Product Owner
Job_Description: <strong>Who You Are:</strong> <br/><br/> The Product Owner brings knowledge of software technology (e.g. websites, applications, enterprise services, platforms), business value prioritization methods, critical path dependency identification and solution options for stakeholders in accordance with their vision and goals focused on business value. The PO translates goals and objectives into iterative deliverables for implementation. Balancing competing factors (discovery, dependencies, mitigation of risks, highest-ROI, etc.) to prioritize the backlog to ensure optimal delivery. Manages ongoing negotiation of time, scope and plan of attack with business stakeholders. Empathetically communicates risk, tradeoffs, status, and targets for delivery of the teams work in timely and adaptive fashion. <br/><br/> <strong>Your Next Challenge:</strong> <br/> Our Product Management team is responsible for the creation, development and management of products across our global organization, including Getty Images and iStock. The Product Owner: <ul> <li>Collaborates with the business partners and software development teams to provide solutions that shape and define Gettys Products & Services</li> <li>Exhibits a strong sense of responsibility and ownership for the success of software development from prioritization to delivery (including post-deploy monitoring of performance)</li><li>Defines and champions best practices for the systems and technology they are responsible for</li><li>Provides knowledge and leadership in specific domains and/or applications</li><li>Work with business partners to understand and translate goals and objectives into deliverables</li><li>Elaborates Portfolio needs into user stories that are granular enough to be implemented by developers and provide incremental value to our customers</li><li>Comfortable leading regular agile ceremonies: daily stand ups, development reviews, product and team retrospectives, kick-offs, planning, sizing, demos and be the voice of the user by communicating the value behind each product and prioritization decision</li><li>Prioritizes and sequences the backlog according to business value.</li><li>Conveys the Vision and Goals at the beginning of implementation and inspects the progress for each story to own acceptance or rejection of completed work</li><li>Defines Service Level Agreements and maintains communication regarding application performance</li><li>Communicates implementation status and health updates to both business and technology management (formal and informal, regular cadence and ad-hoc)</li><li>Ensures testing strategy is implemented, maintained and adequate to support health of systems and services </li> </ul>  <strong>What Youll Need:</strong>  <ul> <li>Demonstrated business analyst skills</li> <li>Domain knowledge in the following areas: Website, mobile applications, enterprise services and/or platforms</li><li>Business knowledge in software/high tech industry</li><li>Enterprise software development (experience as a developer, SDET, architect, etc. a plus)</li><li>A can do attitude with the ability to juggle multiple workstreams and operational support in a fast paced environment</li><li>Story management</li><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills, specifically around status, risk, trade-offs, and target delivery reporting</li><li>Demonstrated ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority</li><li>Desired 3 years relevant experience in this field</li><li>Well versed in the principles of Lean and Agile software development, preference for Kanban experience</li> </ul> <strong>Who We Are:</strong> <br/> Getty Images is among the worlds leading creators and distributors of award-winning still imagery, video, music and multimedia products, as well as other forms of premium digital content, available through its trusted house of brands, including iStockphoto© and Thinkstock©. With its advanced search and image recognition technology, Getty Images serves business customers in more than 100 countries and is the first place creative and media professionals turn to discover, purchase and manage images and other digital content. Its best-in-class photographers and imagery help customers produce inspiring work which appears every day in the worlds most influential newspapers, magazines, advertising campaigns, films, television programs, books and online media. Visit Getty Images at www.gettyimages.com to learn more about how the company is advancing the unique role of digital media in communications and business, and enabling creative ideas to come to life. <br/><br/> For the stories behind our content and our technology, visit the Getty Images Blog at blog.gettyimages.com.
