Find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/gettyimages and Twitter at www.twitter.com/gettyimages.com. Getty Images is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace.

Title: ERP Implementation Consultant
Job_Description: <strong>SAP B1 Implementation Consultant - Canada Central region <br/> Full Time / Permanent</strong> <br/> <strong>Location: Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> Vision33 Inc. (www.vision33.com) is the number one global value added reseller (VAR) for SAP Business One. Vision33 helps growing enterprises challenge their business processes and find efficiencies that help them attain goals and achieve their vision for growth and success. As an SAP gold channel partner, Vision33 services over 700 customers across the globe; providing each with the right balance of software, world-class consulting and support services. The companys broad global presence builds upon its local market insight from sales offices and US headquarters in Irvine, California; Canadian headquarters in Vancouver, British Columbia; and UK headquarters in London, England. <br/><br/> Vision33 offers enterprises access to the worlds largest and most experienced team of SAP Business One consultants and is consistently honored for its customer dedication, earning the prestigious 2016 SAP® Pinnacle Award in the customer choice category. <br/><br/> We have an immediate need for a talented <strong>SAP B1 Implementation Consultant</strong> to support our growing customer base. As an SAP Business One Implementation Consultant, you will have the opportunity to work alongside some of the brightest minds in the ERP consulting industry. <br/><br/> <strong><em>You will be responsible for:</em> </strong>   <ul> <li>Providing implementation consultation, project management, and support services during SAP Business One installations, upgrades and customizations</li>  <li>Recognizing and addressing gaps between SAP Business One solutions and the business practices of the clients</li>  <li>Effectively communicating and building consensus with clients</li>  <li>Supporting the preparation of the scope of work by providing task/time details</li>  <li>Designing and conducting master data migration from legacy systems into SAP Business One</li>  <li>Training, coaching, and mentoring Junior Implementation Consultants</li>  <li>Developing and maintaining expert knowledge of SAP Business One</li>  <li>Achievement of individual billable utilization targets</li> </ul>  <strong>Ideal candidates would possess the following qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business (Accounting) and/or Information Systems from a recognized post-secondary institution</li>  <li>Excellent communication skills, both written and oral</li>  <li>Superior people skills; team-oriented, fast learner and very personable</li>  <li>Self-motivated and driven to achieve success within a consulting environment</li>  <li>Experience in an ERP implementation role with SAP Business One preferred, but not required. (Also beneficial would be implementation experience in SME space with other products such as Microsoft Dynamics, Sage, Epicor, and/or Netsuite)</li>  <li>Experience with software implementations, operational accounting, product distribution and fulfillment, warehouse management, manufacturing, or other applicable business processes.</li>  <li>Experience with MSSQL Server query development/tuning, HANA database engine, Crystal Reports development, data migration, or functional software integration design.</li>  <li>Experience managing software implementation projects including balancing budget, timeline, scope, and resource availability.</li> </ul>  We offer a competitive total rewards program including: salary, incentive plans, training and development, paid-vacations, retirement plans, health and wellness program and employee benefits; along with exciting opportunities for global and diverse project opportunities, internal mobility, travel, and so much more. We are looking for motivated individuals to join our energetic team of professionals. If you want to get involved in an environment where you can really make a difference and where you can apply your knowledge to achieve results and work with an award-winning SAP Business Partner; please submit an online application today. <br/>

Title: Call Centre Team Lead
Job_Description: Call Centre Team Lead is primarily responsible for leading a team that are responsible for marketing our private services and interfacing with our customers or potential customers in a professional, confidential, safe and efficient manner. <br/><br/> CBI Home Health is looking for a talented and results-driven Team Leader. The ideal candidate should have experience coaching employees, monitoring progress, enforcing rules and ensuring quality compliance. <br/><br/> Primary Duties <br/><br/> As a Call Centre Team Lead, you will: <ul> <li>Staff Development, Mentoring and Training</li><li>Ensure great customer service</li><li>Responsible for marketing to our customers and potential customers with information regarding our service</li><li>Review and analyze various data including call activity and performance measures. Use data to identify and remove obstacles preventing optimal team performance</li><li>Documentation as required <br/> QUALIFICATIONS</li> </ul> To take on the role of Call Centre Team Lead, you must: <ul> <li>Post secondary education</li><li>2 years of supervisory experience</li><li>Call center inbound and/or outbound call centre experience</li><li>Excellent communication and leadership skills</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft office suite and the ability to learn other programs specific to the business</li><li>Relevant home care experience as asset</li> </ul> About CBI Health Group: <br/> CBI Health Group is Canadas largest provider of integrated community healthcare. For over 40 years, we have remained totally committed to improving the health and enriching the lives of Canadians. <br/> What sets us apart is our ability to work as a unified network dedicated to the ongoing learning that allows us to foster best practices, improve access to care and create better results for our patients. We organize our teams and services to ensure the right professionals and caregivers provide the right service, at the right time, in the right place. <br/> In over 250 facilities, our services are provided by a dedicated team of more than 11,000 administrators, support staff and care providers that include physiotherapists, occupational therapists, registered massage therapists, kinesiologists, chiropractors, speech-language pathologists, psychologists, physicians, nurses, dietitians and behaviour therapists. <br/> The CBI group of companies includes CBI Health Centres, CBI Home Health, We Care Home Health Services, Monarch House, CBI Workplace Solutions, and CBI Assessment Services. Our expanding transitional and residential community care network now numbers more than 60 homes nationwide. <br/> At CBI, our people really care and believe that by working together, we can aim higher and make great things happen every day. <br/> Facebook: facebook.com/cbihealthgroup | Twitter: twitter.com/cbihealthgroup |CBI"> www.cbi.ca <br/> CBI Health Group is committed to accommodating people with disabilities as part of our hiring process. If you have special requirements, please advise Human Resources during the recruitment and selection process.

Title: Team Lead - High Profile
Job_Description: <div>Req Id 75686 - Posted 05/02/2018 - Protective Services - Physical Security - Canada - Alberta - Calgary <br/><br/> We are currently hiring Team Lead - High Profile Downtown <br/><br/> <strong>Your mission at GARDAWORLD:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Scope of Position:</strong> <br/><br/> The Team Lead, is accountable to the Supervisor and/or Manager, Security & Life Safety and is responsible for the administration of the base building and tenant access control systems, including the facilitation of passcard issuance. <br/><br/> <strong>Main Responsibilities:</strong> presentation. <br/><br/>  In consultation with the Manager, Security & Life Safety, co-ordinate card reader installation and commissioning. <br/><br/>  Customer correspondence and email processing. Access and CCTV systems. <br/><br/>  Accountable to ensure that all company policies, standards, core values and the Code of Conduct is observed. <br/><br/>  Other duties as assigned. <br/><br/> <strong>Education and Skills:</strong> <br/><br/>  Post-secondary level or equivalent work experience. <br/><br/>  A diploma from a recognized institution in Security technology or equivalent would be an asset. <br/><br/>  Minimum 2+ years in a physical security environment. <br/><br/>  Certified Protection Professional (CPP) designation or equivalent would be an asset. <br/><br/> <strong>Special Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/>  Minimum 2 years access control system management experience. <br/><br/> Minimum 2 years supervisory experience <br/><br/>  Superior customer service / interpersonal skills. <br/><br/>  Superior communication skills (verbal / written) <br/><br/>  Time Management skills. <br/><br/>  Certified in First Aid. CPR and Defibrillator. <br/><br/>  WHMIS trained <br/><br/>  Professional and self motivated. <br/><br/>  Courteous <br/><br/>  Trained in the four Customer Service Training modules. <br/><br/>  Able to work in a team environment or independently as required. <br/><br/>  Trained in Operational Awareness of Environmental Regulations and Compliance. <br/><br/>  Excellent MSOffice skills. <br/><br/>  Strong knowledge of access control and CCTV systems. <br/><br/>  Strong Interpersonal relationship skills. <br/><br/>  Ability to prioritize job functions under stressful circumstances. <br/><br/>  Commitment to continued learning.  <li>Interested? Join our workforce!</li>  To apply for this position or view other job opportunities please visit the “careers” page of our website at www.gardaglobal.com/careers <br/><br/> Headquartered in Montreal, Canada, GARDAWORLD is the world’s largest privately owned security services company. Over 62,000 highly trained, dedicated professionals serve clients in North America, Latin America, Europe, Africa, Asia and the Middle East. <br/><br/> GARDAWORLD has great opportunity for personal growth and advancement, fosters a collaborative environment, and encourages team cooperation. Title: Program Director, JACK 96.9
Job_Description: At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>JACK 96.9</strong> has a rare programming opportunity. <br/><br/> We’re seeking a <strong>Program Director</strong> to lead JACK back to the top of the ratings in Calgary. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> We are looking for someone who will be excited to roll up his or her sleeves and create the product; every minute of every day of every week of every… ok, you get the idea! We want someone who is going to truly obsess about the listener experience. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Our next PD will need to act as the Executive Producer of the station working with talent, producers, promotions and marketing to develop a memorable brand experience. That's a fancy way of saying you'll be expected to <em>"make the station sound and look great!"</em> <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> We like to keep things simple so, as PD you'll have just one objective; <strong>to</strong> <strong>make JACK 96-9 the #1 station in Calgary.</strong> Now, if that objective scares you then this isn't the gig for you. That's cool; it's not for everyone. If however it excites and motivates you, then you're our kind of crazy and we'd like to hear from you. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Send whatever you think is going to impress us (we suspect that will include your resume) to Paul Kaye, VP Product & Talent, at Paul.Kaye@rci.rogers.com.  <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Deadline for applications is Friday May 18, 2018.  <br/><br/> All applications will be treated in the strictest of confidence.<br/> <div> </div><div><strong>Schedule:</strong> Full Time</div><div><strong>Shift:</strong> Day</div><div><strong>Length of Contract:</strong> Not Applicable (Regular Position)</div><div><strong>Work Location: </strong>535 7th Avenue Sout West (811), Calgary, AB </div><div><strong>Travel Requirements:</strong> Up to 10%</div><div><strong>Posting Category/Function:</strong> Broadcasting & Programming</div><div><strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 121370</div><div> </div><div><strong>WHY ROGERS?</strong></div><div> </div><div>As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.</div><div> </div> <br/> <div><strong>We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:</strong></div><div> </div>  <ul> <li>Simplify and innovate</li><li>Take ownership of the what and the how</li><li>Equip people to succeed</li><li>Execute with discipline and pride</li><li>Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver</li> </ul>  <div> </div><div>Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today.</div><div> </div><div>What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered.</div><div> </div><div>We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. Title: Construction Manager, Senior
Job_Description: <strong>Business Line</strong> Oil + Gas <br/><br/> <strong>Position Title</strong> Construction Manager, Senior <br/><br/> Canada - Alberta <br/><br/> Calgary <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is seeking a Senior Construction Manager to be based at our Calgary, Alberta office location. Please note, this position is also site-based at times. <br/><br/> This position is responsible for the organization, direction, supervision and coordination of construction activities on a project site as delineated in the applicable PEPs, Site Specific Safety Plan and PXP. <br/><br/> May include the following responsibilities:  <ul> <li>Responsible for work procedures, scheduling, cost control, project specification conformity, establishment of manpower levels, monitoring and implementation of safety programs, project conformance to national, local and/or company building codes and the maintenance of accurate records.</li>  <li>Responsible for the satisfactory conduct of all construction operations and task accomplishment in an economical, efficient and timely manner on a project.</li>  <li>Monitors craft performance relative to budget, schedules and deadlines.</li>  <li>Monitors manpower utilization, effectiveness and productivity.</li>  <li>Facilitates the efficient use of personnel and equipment.</li>  <li>Implements and enforces work rules.</li>  <li>Coordinates movement and use of equipment and supplies with Material Management.</li>  <li>Requisitions tools, materials and equipment in accordance with established procedures and necessary lead times.</li>  <li>Prepares and reviews plans, specifications, drawings and schedules to determine work phases and work priorities.</li>  <li>Determines and recommends solutions to construction and architectural discrepancies.</li>  <li>Inspects fieldwork to evaluate construction progress, efficiency of operation and cost control.</li>  <li>Responsible for overall project workmanship and goal attainment.</li>  <li>Implements the construction portion of the assigned project through day-to-day direction of all field activities and is responsible for all job site activities.</li>  <li>Ensures timely and efficient execution of fieldwork.</li>  <li>Acts as the primary client contact for all construction project field activities.</li>  <li>Ensures all construction is in compliance with design specifications, is completed on schedule, adheres to budget, meets accounting requirements and is built to quality standards.</li>  <li>Functions as a Project Manager on a direct-hire construction-only project or as the field manager on an engineering/ procurement/construction management project.</li>  <li>Responsible to a member of the Project Managers job family or the Operations Manager job family.</li>  <li>Under general direction, responsible for managing very large and/or complex construction projects.</li>  <li>Conducts work requiring independent evaluation, selection, adaptation and modification of standard construction techniques.</li>  <li>Demonstrates the ability to work on unusually complicated projects.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Education:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in a Construction related discipline or demonstrated combination of equivalent education and experience.</li> </ul> <strong>Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Extensive construction and project related experience.</li>  <li>Possesses a thorough knowledge of all engineering disciplines, construction technologies and job site management.</li>  <li>This is a senior level construction management position.</li>  <li>This position will be required to drive a vehicle on behalf of AECOM and therefore will require the candidate to submit a satisfactory driver's abstract for review.</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> N/A <br/><br/> AOGCA1 <br/><br/> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <br/><br/> At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees. <br/><br/> <em>NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Job Category</em></strong> <em>Construction Management</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Business Group</em></strong> <em>Construction Services Group (CS)</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Country</em></strong> <em>Canada</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Position Status</em></strong> <em>Full-Time</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Requisition/Vacancy No.</em></strong> <em>186589BR</em> <br/><br/> <em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.</em>

Title: Manager, Project Management, Operations
Job_Description: <div> Careers / Jobs / Manager, Project Management</div><br/>  <div> <div> <div> Manager, Project Management, Operations <br/>  Calgary, Alberta, Canada</div><br/>  <div> Apply now <br/><br/> Share</div><br/>  <div><strong>Purpose of the position</strong><br/><br/>Reporting to the Director, Strategic Supply Management you will lead a team of project managers responsible for new product introductions, product transfers and customer specific projects. You will be responsible to manage and maintain the NPI process aligned with Smart’s ‘Commercialization’ process.<br/><br/><strong>Responsibilities and accountabilities</strong>    <ul> <li>Ownership and execution of projects post “Commercialization”, managing and interfacing with all functions in Smart to ensure that all aspects of the “product” meet customer and achieve Smart’s objectives in terms of quality, cost, service to the committed schedules.</li> <li>Develop plans, resources and project management methodologies, to ensure that Smart’s “Time to Market” product introductions meet “business case” objectives.</li> <li>Develop and manage individual and team objectives per SMART’s performance management system. Hold people accountable, measure accomplishments, provide feedback, delegate and keep people informed.</li> <li>Manage Operations project management resources in Calgary and in remote locations.</li> <li>Personally, drive key projects specific to Global Operations including those focused on improving processes.</li> <li>Ensure projects are adequately represented and manage resource constraints collaboratively with the other Operations and Product Development Functional managers.</li> <li>Lead analyses on global operational supply chain options related to make versus buy decisions, and expansion/modification of manufacturing, logistics or design sites. Provide business cases to support recommendations.</li> <li>Develop and maintain overall excellence in project management skills and methodologies.</li> <li>Develop and manage annual budgets of the department including departmental expenses, project expenses, and project capital.</li> </ul>  <strong>Supervision provided and received</strong>   <ul> <li>Manage a team of professionals in the new product introduction group including, procurement, component engineering, quality, manufacturing and test engineering extending to other functional groups including Product Development, Product Management, Marketing and Finance.</li>   <li>Receive guidance on overall company objectives and individual performance from Director, Strategic Supply Management.</li> </ul>  <strong>Working conditions</strong>   <ul> <li>Significant travel will be required as part of this role. Travel can be both in Canada and internationally.</li> <li>This position will require frequent conference calls outside of normal business hours.</li> </ul>  <strong>Education and work experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Degree in Engineering preferred. MBA an asset.</li> <li>Strong leadership skills with 5+ years’ experience as a people Manager</li> <li>10 years of relevant operations and/or project management with a broad understanding of key manufacturing areas including: planning, procurement, logistics and manufacturing engineering</li> <li>Experience with a variety of technologies including, electronics assembly, plastics, metal fabrication and test systems.</li> <li>Excellent communication, presentation, written, and interpersonal skills</li> <li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, uses multiple problem-solving skills and techniques and great at gleaning meaning from what-ever data is available</li> <li>Extremely, strong organization skills, coupled with project management, and collaboration aptitudes.</li> <li>Demonstrated success in a dynamic, team-based environment</li> <li>Experience using PLM system an asset, ie. Agile, Windchill</li> <li>Project Management certification preferred.</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>   <div> <div> Apply now <br/><br/> Share</div>  </div>  </div> <br/>

Title: Senior Project Engineer – Process – Engineered Systems –
Job_Description: <div><div> Senior Project Engineer – Process – Engineered Systems – Calgary SE</div><br/>  <div> <div>  <div> <strong>Openings</strong> 1</div> <div> <strong>Location Name</strong> Enerflex - Canada - Alberta - Calgary <br/> Calgary, Alberta, CA</div> <div> <strong>Operating Unit</strong> Enerflex - Canada</div> <div> <strong>Date Posted</strong> May 02, 2018</div> <div> <strong>Profession</strong> Engineering</div> <div> <strong>Experience Level</strong> Not Specified</div> <div> <strong>Job Type</strong> Permanent, Full Time</div> <div> <strong>Education Level</strong> University - Bachelors</div> <div> <strong>Job ID</strong> job-3184</div> </div><div> Position Summary</div> <div><strong>Company Profile:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex is the single source supplier for natural gas compression, oil and gas processing, refrigeration systems and electric power equipment – plus in-house engineering and mechanical services expertise. The Company’s broad in-house resources provide the capability to engineer, design, manufacture, construct, commission and service hydrocarbon handling systems. Enerflex’ s expertise encompasses field production facilities, compression and natural gas processing plants, processing plants, refrigeration systems and electric power equipment serving the natural gas production industry. Headquartered in Calgary, Canada, Enerflex has more than 2,000 employees globally and operates in over seven regions around the world. <br/><br/> Enerflex puts its Values of Integrity, Commitment, Creativity and Success into action in all aspects of business. The Company values passionate people who want to put their career into overdrive. We will help match your skills with a position that challenges you to reach new heights, rewards you for outstanding performance and allows you to grow with the Company throughout your life-long career. Join the Enerflex team and apply now. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex is looking for a <strong>Senior</strong> <strong>Project Engineer - Process</strong> to lead engineering projects in a high energy manufacturing environment. Reporting directly to the Manager, Process Engineering, this role would be in charge of designing and building large million dollar plus gas processing facilities.This individual will mentor junior engineers and work with our fabrication department to see the project come to life in our facility every day, responsible for all aspects of their team’s projects from design through to commissioning. <br/><br/> Candidate must be able to work in a customer centred team environment. Focus is on projects being accurate, complete and timely. <br/><br/> With a foundation of integrity, the candidate would use commitment and creativity to drive our organization forward. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> This role will offer the right candidate variety in their daily work life, learning opportunities and the chance to add value to our current gas processing projects. We require someone with strong communication skills, matched with sound problem solving and decision making skills. Your ability to lead by influence, mentor, be organized, establish clear objectives and monitor key measures, will enable you to deliver the results you need to be successful in this role. You must be able to work effectively within a multi-stakeholder environment and seek to be collaborative on all fronts.  <ul> <li>Design process flow and piping / instrument diagrams</li> <li>Review general arrangements and 3D model</li> <li>Ensure accuracy, completeness and timeliness on responsible projects</li> <li>Take part in HAZOP and SIL review meetings</li> <li>Implement project specifications</li> <li>Size PSV’s and control valves based on process information</li> <li>Size vessels and piping based on process information</li> <li>Complete final checks on P&ID’s Models and other project deliverables</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>10+ Years of experience with an Engineering Degree or Technical Diploma</li> <li>Professional engineer designation</li> <li>Working knowledge of gas processing and fabrication</li> <li>Experience in plant layout and how it relates to equipment design</li> <li>Experience sizing pumps, heat exchangers, Air coolers, and compressors required</li> <li>Experience in pressure vessel and piping design is required</li> <li>ASME Section VIII and B31.3 helpful but not required</li> <li>Experience sizing pressure relief valves, control valves and piping is required</li> <li>Experience with Hysis process simulation software will be considered an asset</li> </ul> <strong>What Enerflex Offers You:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive Compensation</li> <li>Employer Paid Health and Dental Benefits</li> <li>Employee Share Purchase Program</li> <li>Employer Matched Pension Program</li> <li>Vacation and Flex Days</li> <li>Safety Focused Culture</li> <li>Incentive Programs</li> <li>Professional Development Opportunities</li> </ul> <strong>Interested:</strong> Please apply online at www.enerflex.com Careers & Training → Current Openings.</div> <div> <div> Facebook <br/>  Twitter <br/>  Print <br/>  Email <br/><br/> 0Share</div>  </div><br/>  <div> Powered by <br/> Hire Ground Title: Project Manager - Industrial Pipeline Coating

records);<br/><br/>Requirements<br/><br/>• 3-7 years of experience in a project management and engineering role, preferably in the Pipeline Coating/Materials industry;</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree in specifications, ASME B 31.3 and 31.4 as well as to ASME Section IX.</li> <li>PC literacy with MC office packages.</li> <li>Hands-on project controls experience with focus on schedule development, tracking and accurately reporting progress on a regular basis.</li> <li>Experience managing vendor commitments.</li> <li>Experience identifying, assessing, and communicating project risks.</li> <li>Knowledge of Canadian standard pipeline design codes and specifications.</li> <li>Strong analytical and problem solving skills.</li> <li>High attention to detail and results.</li> <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li> <li>Ability to manage 4-5 medium size projects at the same time.</li> <li>Willing to travel.<br/><br/>We offer</li>  </ul>

Title: Project Controls Associate
Job_Description: <strong>Who We Are:</strong> <br/><br/> Alstar Oilfield Contractors has been providing quality construction services to the oil and gas industry since 1969. We are a leader in the oil and gas industry for turn-key new construction, maintenance and prefabrication and modular construction services. Located in Hinton, Calgary, and Fort St. John we have grown to employ over 350 employees and service Western Canada. <br/><br/> <strong>Who You Are:</strong> <br/><br/> Every day, you walk into work ready to learn, grow and innovate. You are passionate about customer service and project management. <br/><br/> If you are ready to join one of the leading oilfield construction companies in Western Canada, read on… <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Alstar is hiring a Project Controls Administrator to work in Alstar’s Calgary office. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing administrative support to the Project Controls Team, with emphasis on managing multiple priorities and directives. This position requires a strong team player with excellent organizational and planning skills, a strong initiative, and the ability to work independently. Superior time management ability and effective communication is essential for working as a part of a collaborative, high-performing, deadline driven team. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul>  <li>Support the Project Manager / Construction Manager in preparation of Requests for Change (RCO), Purchase Orders (PO) and Requests for Information (RFI)</li> <li>Accurate and detailed data entry</li> <li>Support the initiation of projects within Hard Dollar software</li> <li>Monitor project payment requests and invoices</li> <li>Develop clear understanding of scope of work and WBS (Work Breakdown Structure)</li> <li>Complete other duties, projects, and special assignments as required</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul>  <li>2-5 years of experience in an administrative position, post-secondary in Administration would be considered an asset</li> <li>Previous experience in relation to manufacturing or fabrication would be considered an asset</li> <li>Experience with Google Drive, Sheets and Docs is considered an asset</li> <li>Ability to function in a fast paced, deadline driven environment with multiple time sensitive priorities</li> <li>Technically inclined with strong attention to detail and accuracy</li> <li>Ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and with confidence</li> <li>Self-directed, able to shift and set priorities</li> <li>Highly organized self-starter</li> <li>High degree of competence, reliability, and judgement demonstrated in all aspects of work</li> <li>Commitment to continuous improvement</li> </ul>

Title: Client Service Manager
Job_Description: <strong>Client Service Manager</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Reporting to the Regional Manager Client Service this position will be responsible for managing Livingston client satisfaction. The CSM will be the client’s key business contact for all lines of business, building strong relationships with financial decision makers, increasing client retention and identifying opportunities for up-selling all lines of business.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul>  	<li><strong>Manages client relationships:</strong> Manages all aspects of client's portfolio. This is a client facing position. Conducts client visits to understand their cross-border trade requirements. Understands client history, running appropriate reports on revenue and transactions, analyzing client information in appropriate systems (SFDC) determine strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats. Establishes strong relationship with clients’ financial decision-maker as their single point of contact for all lines of business.</li> <li><strong>Up-sells/Negotiations:</strong> Identifies client needs for other lines of business, reviews data, creates pricing assessment and recommendations to client.</li> <li>Main contact with our clients.</li> </ul> <strong>EXPERIENCE NEEDED</strong>  <ul>  	<li>5 years Customer Relationship Management experience in similar environment (Account Management, Relationship management).</li> <li>1-2 years customs brokerage (import / export) experience</li> <li>Knowledge and experience with project management methodology and techniques.</li> <li>Comfortable preparing and making presentations to small and large audiences</li> </ul> (Preferred) Customs Brokerage License or CCS Designation

Title: Sr. Project Administrative Assistant
Job_Description: Recognized as a leader in the EPC industry and ranked as the #2 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine for the second consecutive year, we provide planning, design, build, and maintenance of upstream and midstream oil and gas facilities and infrastructure. With over 5,000 employees across North America, we service exploration, production, storage, and transportation of crude oil and natural gas to end users, both offshore and onshore. We bring together many different aspects including Pipeline and Facilities groups, onshore and offshore offices, and engineering services to help meet the demands of our clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/><br/> Performs a variety of administrative/clerical support tasks for a specific project, business, or technical unit. Labor charges or normally billed to client contracts. Exercises more independence in day-to-day operations. Individuals would generally support a senior manager, function or group. Duties would normally require in-depth knowledge of one or more software products or specialized knowledge of a particular administrative function or area. May be responsible for assigning tasks to or overseeing the work of individuals at lower levels. <ul> <li>Maintains project specific procedures manuals, project filing systems</li><li>Assemble project deliverables and prepare transmittals of data</li><li>Employee development including daily on the job training</li><li>Type drafts and finals of correspondence, reports, specifications and transmittals from typed and handwritten copy</li><li>Scheduling meetings using outlook</li><li>Maintain calendars and schedule appointments</li><li>Supporting Project Administrator Lead</li><li>Organize catering for meetings and performing pre / post-meeting functions</li><li>Assisting with travel arrangements for project</li><li>Prioritizing workload, working independently, multitasking</li><li>Providing quality �self-check� of documents produced</li><li>Distribution of project materials, mail, etc.</li><li>Assisting other Administrators in overload situations</li><li>Photocopying as required</li></ul>  <ul> <li>High School graduate or equivalent required</li><li>8 years' of relevant experience required</li><li>Microsoft Office including: Word, Excel, Outlook and Power Point required</li><li>Exceptional oral and written communication skills required</li> </ul> At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.

Title: Project Coordinator - Buildings
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/>   <div> <div><strong>05/08/2018</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>001762</strong> </div> <br/><strong>Pomerleau</strong> is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder. <br/><br/> Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do. <br/><br/> <strong>The Opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> Jump onboard and join our collaborative project team to explore and support project growth and execution. With a proven track record of coordination experience, your drive for project excellence is unparalleled. Focused on supporting your fellow Project team members, you will drive for results through the coordination of all project activities. <br/><br/> Organization, finding meaning in the details, solutions and growth are your passion. As a Project Coordinator, you manage several activities and deadlines to gain a clearer picture of client, team and project needs. Imagine the possibilities as your role focuses on growth opportunities in the project management field. The pace and path you choose to grow is your choice – but let us help you get there. As a key member of our team, we will <strong>rethink construction together</strong>, <strong>from idea to completion</strong>. <strong>Everywhere</strong>. <strong>All the time</strong>. <strong>Period</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>What YOU Will Do</strong>  <ul> <li>Assist the project team with coordination and project support</li> <li>Collaborate and keep the lines of communication open when working with team members, trade partners, consultants and clients</li> <li>Take pride in your ability to effectively review, interpret and update the construction schedules</li> <li>Utilize your passion for organization through maintenance, review and follow-up of shop drawings, RFI’s, material purchase orders, change notice quotes and project completion documents</li> <li>Effectively collect, review and analyze project quotes with emphasis on obtaining the very best prices in the market</li> <li>Take pride in compiling and completing companywide project reports;</li> <li>Assemble, attend, document and emphasize the importance of project meetings</li> <li>Demonstrate leadership in Health, Safety and Environmental Protection on the project. Effectively apply the requirements of the project specific safety standards to promote Pomerleau’s HS&E standards, applicable OH&S acts, regulations and codes with all employees and trade partners on the project</li> <li>Embrace the learning experience and be open to internal career opportunities;</li> <li>Celebrate proect success and completion and be a key member of the project wrap-up process</li> </ul> <strong>What YOU Will Bring</strong>  <ul> <li>1-3 years’ experience in the ICI construction industry</li> <li>A University Degree/Technology Diploma in Engineering, or a combination of education and industry experience</li> <li>A proven track record of project coordination and team collaboration;</li> <li>Solid written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Strong computer skills with enthusiasm for innovation</li> <li>Knowledge of the Canadian construction market and ability to work throughout the Alberta area</li> </ul> <strong>WHY JOIN POMERLEAU`S TEAM? :</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary</li> <li>4 weeks’ vacation</li> <li>Group insurance (health spending account)</li> <li>Group RRSP</li> <li>Monthly public transit pass paid by employer</li> <li>Fitness center membership: 50% reimbursed by employer</li> <li>Employee assistance program</li> <li>Ongoing training offered throughout the year</li> <li>Young, dynamic environment</li> <li>Excellent career opportunities</li> <li>Summer hours</li> </ul> <strong>PARTICULARITY:</strong>  <ul> <li>The retained candidate will be subject to an administrative security check</li> </ul> At Pomerleau, we focus on results-oriented, passionate and rigorous people who participate in ambitious and complex projects. You have the profile we are looking for? Apply now to be part of our team. <br/><br/> Only retained candidates will be contacted. We may consider your CV for other positions. <br/><br/> Pomerleau is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive working environment where all employees are treated fairly.</div>  <br/>

Title: Co-op Student, Pipeline Projects
Job_Description: Co-op Student, Pipeline Projects - 15611 Description Job Title: Co-op Student, Pipeline Projects Location: Calgary, AB Start Date: September 4, 2018 Length of Term: 12 or 16 months Business Unit: Downstream Commercial Application Deadline: May 20, 2018 or once the position has been filled Key Responsibilities may involve: · Provide support toproject managers and engineers during design and execution of projects · Prepare variousdocuments including project reports to assist in proper execution of theprojects · Work with corporatetechnical services and project management office to ensure all criticaldocuments are prepared as per corporate requirements · Work withoperations, engineering house and various other project stakeholders to assistin ensuring project meets all deliverable requirements · Assist withevaluating, coordinating and managing project risk register · Travel to work site location asneeded (up to 5%) Qualifications Qualifications: · Mustbe currently enrolled in a post-secondary Co-op or Internship program · Strong academic background in Electrical, Mechanical, or Civilengineering · Completion of third year university preferred · Minimum GPA of 2.9 or above is required · Computer skills (MSOffice and databases) are essential · Previous experienceworking with MS Project would be considered an asset · Previous experiencewith project management would be considered an asset · Previous experiencein oil and gas experience would be considered an asset · Ability to be aself-starter · Must be able towork effectively in a team environment · Effective writtenand oral communication skills Benefits of a Husky StudentPosition: · Opportunities to: take part in impactful business projects network with experienced professionals engage in a strong student network gain valuable exposure in the Oil and Gas industry · Relevant experiencein your field of study · Competitive wages · Relocationassistance Submission: Please submit a resumeand transcript. Applications without a recent transcript will not beconsidered. Relocation: Students moving for their work term may be eligible to receive a lumpsum payment to assist with relocation expenses. Additional Information: New graduates are not eligible forstudent opportunities. Please note that only those selectedfor an interview will be contacted. At Husky,we respect diversity and embrace an inclusive culture. We value uniqueness anddifferent perspectives as they play a critical role in our success. To achievethis, individuals are selected based on qualifications, merit, and abilitiesand we encourage applications from everyone including visible minorities,Aboriginal people, women, and persons with disabilities. About Husky: One of Huskys advantages is that weare an integrated oil and gas company. From exploration to development,production, refining and marketing, weve got it all! Combine this with a rangeof learning and development tools and an inclusive work environment, and youare well-positioned for a successful career at Husky. We have training, mentoring andcareer development programs and resources to help you develop both personallyand professionally as an employee or a leader. We offer many internalleadership and business skills courses along with tuition reimbursementprograms for qualified employees. Title: Manager, Operations
Job_Description: Coordinator, Security and Life Safety<br/>  	<div> Location:Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> Department:Security and Life Safety</div><br/>  <div> <div>Brookfield Properties is a leading owner, operator and developer of office and multifamily assets. Our signature office properties define the skyline of dynamic cities around the world, including gateway cities such as New York, London, Berlin, Toronto, and Sydney. Our multifamily business owns, develops, renovates and manages approximately 40,000 high quality rental apartment buildings in supply constrained markets of major cities such as New York and London, as well as high growth markets in the suburban U.S. <br/><br/> <u><strong>DESCRIPTION</strong></u>: <br/><br/> This Coordinator, Security and Life Safety at Fifth Avenue Place will provide support to the Assistant/Property Manager and Senior Manager, Security and Life Safety in all facets of security and life safety.. The Coordinator, Security and Life Safety will gain a thorough understanding of the building and its security and life safety systems requirements. The successful incumbent will provide support in the recruitment and selection process of the security and life safety staff, development of all security and life safety policies, SOPs, and manuals; ensure all staff are trained properly and in a timely manner. The successful candidate will be flexible and will have the ability to evolve with the constant changes that the property team will be facing. <br/><br/> This position will oversee the day-to-day Security and Life Safety operations for a Class “A” downtown commercial mixed use property including, but not limited to, the management of both in-house and contract security staff and equipment to ensure compliance with the highest standards of service while meeting all required government regulations. <br/><br/> <u><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong></u>:  <ul> <li>Oversee day-to-day security operations for the property, with guidance from the Assistant/Property Manager and Senior Manager, Security and Life Safety, ensuring that all security related activities function ethically, efficiently and effectively with the utmost professionalism;</li> <li>Develop, implement, maintain and audit security policy and procedures for the property;</li> <li>Ensure incident reports are written by staff for all incidents via the incident reporting database and meet Brookfield standards;</li> <li>Oversee day-to-day activities related to the maintenance and contract requirements of the building’s access control, CCTV, intercoms, portable radios, etc.;</li> <li>Addressing security concerns, investigate and recommend corrective actions to Property Manager and Senior Manager, Security and Life Safety;</li> <li>Monitor and ensure the building access control program is being maintained, including but not limited to, key card room management, completion of work permits, lock up, unlock, etc.</li> <li>Assist Senior Manager, Security and Life Safety with conducting security risk assessments;</li> <li>Ensure an inventory of all security systems, supplies, etc are kept up to date;</li> <li>Lead, plan, direct, and control for responses to emergency situations and evacuations, including acting as Incident Commander;</li> <li>Supports the Senior Manager, Security and Life Safety in organizing and leading the annual fire evacuation drill;</li> <li>Modify the emergency action plans, life safety policy and procedures for the property as required for review by the Senior Manager, Security and Life Safety;</li> <li>Participate in the Health and Safety committee meetings;</li> <li>Ensure staff are properly trained in and follow safe work practices at all times;</li> <li>Provide guidance, motivation and direction to security staff in accordance with all Brookfield’s policies and procedures;</li> <li>Support the recruitment, selection and retention of security staff;</li> <li>Manage the performance management process for all security staff, with support from the Assistant/Property Manager;</li> <li>Maintain the staff schedule, time sheets, vacation tracking and creation of payroll;</li> <li>Lead the security staff training program, including ensuring Supervisors are properly training staff, correcting deficiencies, and maintaining training records;</li> <li>Build and manage relationships with tenants ensuring security issues are addressed in a timely manner;</li> <li>Provide recommendations to the Assistant/Property Manager and Senior Manager, Security and Life Safety on the yearly operational and capital expenditure budgets and participate in building wide capital projects from the planning stages forward;</li> <li>Other duties and projects as assigned.</li> </ul> <u><strong>SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS</strong></u>: <br/><br/> This position requires constant contact with staff, tenants, contractors, suppliers and the general public. The high level of interaction with internal and external customers demands an individual with a keen service orientation and strong leadership skills as exemplified by the consistent demonstration of the F.I.R.S.T. Principles. The ideal candidate will have excellent team-building, interpersonal, and communication skills. The successful candidate will have the skills and experience to supervise, coach and mentor a diverse group of Security Guards, on a continuing basis. <br/><br/> <u><strong>EXPERIENCE & TECHINCAL SKILLS</strong></u>: <br/><br/> Previous supervisory experience in the Security field, preferably within a multi-tenant environment. <br/> Previous experience with Access Control Systems, electronics and CCTV is required. Thorough knowledge of the Criminal Code and Occupational Health and Safety industry is required. <br/><br/> <u><strong>EDUCATION / DESIGNATIONS / LICENSES</strong></u>: <br/><br/> Must be a High School Graduate. Candidates must have or be working towards accreditation as a Certified Security Supervisor Manager. You must be in application or have received a valid Alberta Security Licence. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for pre-screening will be contacted. <br/><br/> Brookfield is committed to accommodating the individual needs of all applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process as an organizational best practice and as required under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.</div> </div>  <br/>

Title: Manager - People Advisory Services
Job_Description: <DIV>EY’s people in more than 150 countries are committed to operating with integrity, quality and professionalism in the provision of audit, tax and transaction advisory services. We strive to help all of our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone's contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth, and provides continuous opportunities for development. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Our People Advisory Services professionals assist our clients in successfully managing and sustaining people, process and/or technology change. This may include the identification and management of stakeholders, organizational design, training, cultural assessment and the planning and execution of strategic communications.<BR> </DIV> <DIV><B>Responsibilities</B></DIV> <DIV><B> </B></DIV> <DIV>Demonstrate a thorough understanding of complex change concepts. Lead client engagement teams and work with a wide variety of clients to deliver professional services. Develop and successfully manage to project budget. </DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Deliver quality services. Value and model excellent client service by establishing goals and implementation plans to achieve a high quality deliverables and within expected timeframes. Monitor progress, manage risk and confirm key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Develop and maintain productive relationships with client management. Focus on deliverables and client business priorities. Manage expectations of service. Understand the client's industry and recognize key performance drivers and business trends.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Develop people. Provide constructive on-the-job feedback/training. Foster an innovative and team-oriented work environment.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Demonstrate high levels of technical and professional knowledge and quickly assimilate new knowledge. Keep up-to-date with current developments and trends in advisory services capabilities and industry knowledge.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Generate new business opportunities. Understand Ernst & Young and its service lines and actively assess/present ways to serve clients. Develop long-term client relationships and networks. Develop relationships with other Ernst & Young team members across all practices to serve client needs.</DIV> <DIV>To qualify, candidates must have:</DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>a bachelor's degree and approximately 5-8 years of related work experience; or a graduate degree and approximately 4-6 years of related work experience </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>a degree and/or Master's degree with an emphasis in Business, Human Resources, Psychology</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>approximately 4 years of experience in providing advisory services in a number of the following change enablement areas: Change Management, Stakeholder Management, Communications, Organizational Design, Leadership Development, Training, Governance, Workforce Strategies, Human Resources Transformation, Talent Management and Culture </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>experience in selling and delivering projects that cover the full life-cycle of Assessment, Design and Implementation support </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>demonstrated record in driving revenue within existing clients and in developing new prospects at the "C" level of Fortune 500 companies </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>project management experience </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>work collaboratively in a team environment (knows when to lead and when to follow) </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>experience managing staff on multiple projects and providing direction to team members </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>strong analytical and problem solving skills </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>excellent oral and written communication skills , including proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, etc… </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>high level of motivation and a self starting attitude </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>ability to think outside of the box, thrive on new challenges </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>strong work ethic </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>flexibility and ability to travel</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>willingness to travel on short notice to meet client needs; travel is estimated at 20> </DIV></LI></UL> <DIV><B>EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.</B></DIV>

Title: Senior Project Manager – Civil Works
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/>   <div> <div><strong>04/03/2018</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>001613</strong> </div> <br/><strong>Pomerleau</strong> is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder. <br/><br/> Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do. <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT WILL YOU DO IN A WEEK? :</strong> <br/><br/> Under the supervision of the Project Director, the Senior Project Manager for Civil works ensures the overall supervision and coordination of all the steps of the various construction projects, namely collaboration with subcontractors, close relationship with the client, and monitoring costs and schedules.   <ul> <li>Coordinate the work in collaboration with the superintendent—schedule, manpower and equipment requirements, etc.;</li> <li>Manage changes and instructions;</li> <li>Manage plans, specs, and addenda.</li> </ul>  Manage calls for bids and related contracts—can change from one project form to another   <ul> <li>Prepare all the documents to launch calls for bids;</li> <li>Draw up a detailed schedule—dates, main construction steps, constraints, work method;</li> <li>Launch and manage calls for bids;</li> <li>Finalize plans and specs;</li> <li>Analyze and negotiate bids;</li> <li>Prepare recommendations as well as contract awards and then obtain client’s approval;</li> <li>Award contracts;</li> <li>Set up and conduct initial meetings with major subcontractors on the project.</li> </ul>  Project Coordination   <ul> <li>Establish work methods in collaboration with the superintendent;</li> <li>Draw up list of activities in order to enable preparing the prevention program;</li> <li>Establish a list of items for cost follow-up and project accounting;</li> <li>Issue purchase orders for construction site materials at construction site;</li> <li>Settle disputes in collaboration with the superintendent;</li> <li>Perform breakdown and invoicing;</li> <li>Organize and conduct construction site meetings as required;</li> <li>Supervise site wrap-up manual preparation with administrative assistant.</li> </ul>  Project Follow-Up   <ul> <li>Perform administrative follow-up—costs, contingencies, boards, claims, etc.;</li> <li>Confirm implemented technical follow-up—technical data sheets, inspections, etc.;</li> <li>Follow up on notices of change—estimation, bid to client, negotiation, issuance of orders and/or of contract. <br/><br/> <strong>DO YOU HAVE THESE QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS? :</strong> <br/><br/> • Bachelor’s degree or Diploma in Civil Engineering or another construction related discipline</li> <li>At least 8 years’ experience managing Civil construction projects</li> <li>Strong skills in management, communication, negotiation, and problem solving</li> <li>Ability to exercise initiative and leadership, offering mentorship to more junior team members <br/><br/> <strong>WHY JOIN POMERLEAU`S TEAM? :</strong></li>  </ul>    <ul> <li>Competitive salary</li> <li>4 weeks’ vacation</li> <li>Group insurance (health spending account)</li> <li>Group RRSP</li> <li>Monthly public transit pass paid by employer</li> <li>Fitness center membership: 50% reimbursed by employer</li> <li>Employee assistance program</li> <li>Ongoing training offered throughout the year</li> <li>Young, dynamic environment</li> <li>Excellent career opportunities</li> <li>Summer hours</li> </ul> <strong>PARTICULARITY:</strong>  <ul> <li>The retained candidate will be subject to an administrative security check</li> </ul> At Pomerleau, we focus on results-oriented, passionate and rigorous people who participate in ambitious and complex projects. You have the profile we are looking for? Apply now to be part of our team. <br/><br/> Only retained candidates will be contacted. We may consider your CV for other positions. <br/><br/> Pomerleau is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive working environment where all employees are treated fairly.</div>  <br/>

Title: Project Engineer - Industrial
Job_Description: Tracking Code <br/><br/> 629-104 <br/><br/> Job Description<br/><br/>Trotter & Morton Group of Companies are a diverse group of building trades experts offering unique and integrated construction solutions from earthworks and demolition services to commercial, institutional, and industrial construction to facility services and building maintenance. Since 1927, our skilled workforce has brought their high-quality workmanship, experience, and passion to a diverse project portfolio that includes some of Western Canada's most iconic structures. <br/><br/> Trotter & Morton Industrial Services is now looking to add a Project Engineer to our Calgary Team to work on existing and future projects. The successful candidate will be an individual who is looking to grow with Trotter & Morton, who shares our entrepreneurial spirit, and who is looking for a long term partnership with an exceptional company. <br/><br/> The Project Engineer will work directly with our Project Managers and provides technical information and interpretation of plans, detail sheets and specifications; ensures mechanical work complies with all engineering standards, codes, specifications and design instructions; and ensures sub-trade work is high quality and completed on schedule. This role may also include project scheduling, purchasing and inventory management responsibilities as well. <br/><br/> <strong>Roles and Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Ensure full compliance with Trotter & Morton Safety programs on jobsites</li>  <li>Assist the Project Manager and Superintendent in day to day duties of project administration including labour management plans, project plans and schedules (P6 and MS Project).</li>  <li>Assist in plan and spec analysis in order to provide clear trackable and coordinated interpretations of the design/drawings for construction</li>  <li>Responsible for drawings, site instructions, delivery schedules</li>  <li>Responsible for project start up and close out documentation</li>  <li>Act as a liaison with subcontractors in expending drawings and related information</li>  <li>Follows the Trotter & Morton Industrial Services Inc.’s policies and procedures for procurement</li>  <li>Maintain accurate and up-to-date logs (RFI, Vendor/Subcontractor, Purchase, Owner etc.) track responses and advise the Project Manager and Superintendent of the status of RFI’s</li>  <li>Receive and monitor the progress of all approved material requisitions</li>  <li>Source products from local vendors</li>  <li>Create purchase orders and notify vendors of purchase order changes</li>  <li>Contact vendors concerning rate adjustments or shipment of incorrect materials</li>  <li>Develop and maintain positive and effective relations with vendors to facilitate timely and accurate processing of orders</li>  <li>Communicate vendor and product issues with the appropriate person</li>  <li>Ensure accurate tracking and reporting of all field and labour management, rentals and sub trades to formalize monthly billings to client</li>  <li>Understand and follow company Quality Control Program</li>  <li>Other duties as assigned</li> </ul>  Required Skills   <ul> <li>Ability to lead and foster a positive work environment</li>  <li>Attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy</li>  <li>Good mathematical and analytical skills</li>  <li>Ability to prioritize workloads and utilize planning & time management skills to adhere to strict deadlines</li>  <li>Strong oral and written communication skills</li>  <li>Strong work ethic, result driven</li>  <li>Ability to multi-task</li>  <li>Strong computer skills including but not limited to Microsoft Office, Bluebeam and Adobe Pro</li> </ul>  Required Experience   <ul> <li>Mechanical Engineering Degree or Technologist Diploma or equivalent combinations of trade training plus a minimum of four years mechanical experience</li>  <li>2 years of relevant experience</li>  <li>Scheduling experience</li>  <li>Construction industry experience</li> </ul> <strong>Additional requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Travel as required</li>  <li>Ability to work out on Job Site – As required</li>  <li>CSTS</li>  <li>H2S Alive (site specific)</li>  <li>Drug and Alcohol testing (site specific)</li> </ul> We offer an excellent, competitive salary along with a comprehensive benefit package. <br/><br/> We firmly believe our employees are our best assets and we are committed to providing ongoing training and support to allow them to reach their full potential. Trotter & Morton Group of Companies is an industry-leader in safety, and we strive for an incident-free workplace in all aspects of our operations. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Commitment to Diversity</strong> <br/><br/> The Trotter & Morton Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to hiring talented, qualified professionals without regard to race, age, gender, or any other protected ground and to providing an environment without discrimination. <br/><br/> Every effort is made to provide fair and equal employment and development opportunities and to ensure that our policies regarding hiring, compensation, promotions, and transfers are based solely on skills and capabilities, job requirements, job performance, and other job-related criteria. <br/><br/> If you have a strong work ethic and commitment to excellence, apply today and build a rewarding career as a member of our high-performing team. <br/><br/> Click New Resume/CV to begin the online application process. Click Existing Resume/CV if you have previously applied to a position and would like to update your online application profile. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance, however, we will only contact candidates selected for an interview.<br/><br/>Job Location <br/><br/> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/><br/> Position Type <br/><br/> Full-Time/Regular
