Title: Learning & Development Manager and Coach
Job_Description: Learning & Development Manager and Coach <br/><br/> 10-May-2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/> BCG's mission is to inspire the very best people with unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth. Accordingly, our people development processes are a key differentiating success factor and core to BCG’s continuing success. The Learning & Development experience is designed to prepare our Consulting Team for both their current roles and the next level of challenges in their career progression. <br/><br/> BCG is building a best-in-class team of former Consulting Team Principals and Project Leaders dedicated to coaching and training our Associates, Consultants, Project Leaders, and Principals. This “Coaching Faculty” is a unique opportunity to build next generation people development capabilities within BCG, experience the satisfaction of coaching and teaching, and continue to differentiate BCG's value proposition to our people. This team also serves as Lead Faculty for our Regional Trainings. These individuals serve as senior thought-partners with their respective Office and System Leadership. <br/><br/> The L&D Manager and Coach role is responsible for coaching and training non-partner consulting staff. This includes: (a) providing coaching to Associates, Consultants, Project Leaders, and Principals on both hard and soft skills; (b) overseeing and delivering high quality, impactful training in the System offices, as well as helping to facilitate NAMR Regional trainings; (c) identifying training needs across cohorts and assessing existing offerings vs. those needs, (d) working as part of the NAMR Coaching Faculty team to prioritize and create new/improved offerings, (e) engaging with local leadership and CDC on development issues and how to address them, and (f) supporting the local operations team. Key clients of this role, in addition to the Consulting Team staff, include the local Office Administrator and People Team leadership in the office. This position will work closely with the System L&D Team, and more broadly with the NAMR L&D Team. <br/><br/> <strong>Job ID</strong> <br/> <strong>6254BR</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Company Information</strong> <br/> The Boston Consulting Group (BCG) is a global management consulting firm and the world’s leading advisor on business strategy. We partner with clients from the private, public, and not-for-profit sectors in all regions to identify their highest-value opportunities, address their most critical challenges, and transform their enterprises. Our customized approach combines deep insight into the dynamics of companies and markets with close collaboration at all levels of the client organization. This ensures that our clients achieve sustainable competitive advantage, build more capable organizations, and secure lasting results. Founded in 1963, BCG is a private company with offices in more than 90 cities in 50 countries. For more information, please visit bcg.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Employee Type</strong> <br/> Regular <br/><br/> <strong>Basic Job Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>BS/BA required, MBA or advanced degree (PhD, JD, MD) preferred</li><li>Consulting background, PL or Pr level (management experience); deep understanding of our target audience's needs and skills associated with consulting role</li><li>Position implies ~30% - 40% travel to attend CDC meetings, lead trainings and provide coaching, attend system and/or NAMR L&D and other People Team meetings, etc. This type of travel is highly predictable and scheduled far in advance. Full week travel to host regional trainings or attend BCG conferences may be required 2-3 times a year</li>  </ul>  <strong>Key Competencies</strong>  <ul> <li>Demonstrated experience/ passion for people development and training (e.g., strong upward feedback – particularly around people development and apprenticeship, former presenter, champion for trainings)</li> <li>Strong credibility with senior consulting staff and office and system leadership</li><li>Ability to put oneself in the shoes of participants or presenters and understand their needs</li><li>Relentless focus on customer and business needs</li><li>Strong listening skills – ability to ask the right questions and help others uncover underlying issues, drivers, and path forward</li><li>Intellectual agility, problem solving, ability to focus on big picture and on detail, analytical skills and decision making</li><li>Ability to leverage creativity and training expertise to design learning experiences that fit audience need</li> <li>Excellent project management skills, including multi-tasking across projects and teams and ability to plan long term and adjust last minute</li><li>Proactive, self-motivated, sound judgment and “get it done” attitude</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills, at all levels of the organization, including senior leadership – ability to build credibility fast</li><li>Comfort presenting and facilitating with both small and large groups</li><li>Effective influencing and teaming skills, in a networked environment and within virtual teams</li><li>Ability to interact and team effectively at all levels of the organization, including most senior and most junior</li> <li>Ability to handle confidential performance and HR information with professionalism and confidentiality</li> <li>Comfort with resolving people-related issues</li> </ul>  <strong>Job Type</strong> <br/> Full time <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/> <strong><u>Accommodations for Individuals with Disabilities:</u> <br/> </strong> <br/> Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application or interview process, or those needing job postings in an alternative format, may contact Canada Human Resources <br/><br/> Please note: part-time of 80% may be considered <br/><br/> <strong>Non-discrimination Statement</strong> <br/> The Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws. <br/><br/> <strong>Country</strong> <br/> Canada <br/><br/> <strong>City/Town</strong> <br/> Calgary, Montreal, Toronto <br/><br/> <strong>Function</strong> <br/> Human Resources <br/><br/> <strong>Job Responsibilities</strong> <br/> <strong>1:1 Coaching</strong> <br/><br/> The most critical component of this role and the largest allocation of time is to provide one-on-one coaching to Associates, Consultants, Project Leaders, and Principals. Coaching candidates will usually be identified through CDC/PDC process, or may be self-referred or referred by case leadership. Types of coaching may include:  <ul> <li>Core consulting skills (e.g., structuring analysis, developing a workplan, designing a model)</li> <li>Communication (e.g., slides and storylines, meeting management, internal case communication)</li> <li>People and project management</li><li>Complex stakeholder management</li><li>Managing stress and confidence in Consulting Team roles</li><li>Interpretation and action planning based on CDC/PDC and/or upward feedback</li> </ul>  <strong>Training</strong> <br/><br/> Ensure high quality, high impact delivery of training programs  <ul> <li>Serve as Facilitator/Faculty for trainings delivered in local System offices, as well as assigned Regional Trainings (Advanced Consultant Training, Project Leader Readiness Training, etc)</li><li>Ensure core first-year, PL and Principal local curricula are delivered with excellence (e.g., ELST II, PL Foundations)</li><li>Recruit, develop, and prepare local trainer cadre for in-office trainings, as well as ELST</li> </ul>  Training development and execution  <ul> <li>Assess needs and skill gaps</li><li>Team with Coaches from across Region to set priorities and develop new offerings</li><li>Experiment/pilot new offerings in the System</li><li>Identify opportunities to proactively leverage BCG's rich on-demand learning programs in coaching and trainings, especially with new hires</li> </ul>  <strong>Linkage to local leadership and People functions</strong>  <ul> <li>Participate in all CDC meetings to understand both individual and overall cohort training/development needs</li><li>Team closely with CDC Advisors to help customize L&D plans for their advisees</li><li>Build awareness of L&D resources among Project Leaders, Principals and Partners</li><li>Work with Office Administrator (OA) and People Team leadership in the office to maximize support for training engagement and attendance</li><li>Support local leadership on rollout of firm and region initiatives, e.g., Proposal Excellence, Unconscious Bias, Advanced Analytics</li> </ul>  <strong>Support of local operations team</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with the System L&D Operations coordinator to support and empower L&D Operations Assistants and Associates with full ownership end-to-end management of local training events</li><li>As requested, provide line management for System L&D Operations coordinator</li><li>As required, oversee budget for local training initiatives</li>  </ul>  <strong>Other</strong>  <ul> <li>Team with and support the System OAs, People Team leadership, and CDC Heads in people development related initiatives</li><li>Build and maintain expert knowledge of BCG's on demand learning resources, and make timely referrals based individual consultant needs</li><li>Perform other duties as assigned or required by the NAMR L&D Director or Head of North America Coaching Faculty</li> </ul>  <strong>Job Title</strong> <br/> Learning & Development Manager and Coach <br/>

Title: Project Lead, Paediatrics, Cumming School of Medicine
Job_Description: <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> The <strong>Department of Paediatrics</strong> in the <strong>Cumming School of Medicine</strong> invites applications for a <strong>Project Lead</strong>. This Full-time Fixed Term position is for approximately 6 months (based on length of grant funding), with the possibility of extension. <br/><br/> This position reports to the Principal Investigator. The Project Lead, Innovative Models of Acute Paediatric Mental Health and Addiction Care, will play a vital role in the sucess of the project. <br/><br/> The main goal of this position is to oversee and be responsible for the design and implementation of the core elements of this project. These core elements have been identified but now require stakeholder buy-in to implement. The Project Lead will work closely with the Principal Investigators to maintain effective day-to-day operation and maintenance of key regional, provincial and national linkages. The Project Lead will be responsible for ensuring that all elements of the studies are running smoothly, that the rights and well-being of participants are protected, and that the data collected are accurate, complete, and verifiable. <br/><br/> The individual will be extensively involved in overseeing the integration of this project into the other operations of the Pediatric Emergency Research Team (PERT). <br/><br/> Position is located at the Alberta Children's Hospital. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Key Responsibilities</strong> (job functions include but are not limited to): <br/><br/> Leadership <ul> 	<li>Develop and maintain relationships with key project stakeholders</li>	<li>Provide primary support to the project Principal Investigators, identifying key strategic and governance issues, planning meetings, preparing reports and papers for consideration, and ensuring their decisions and requests are addressed and implemented</li>	<li>Foster effective team work among the project team</li>	<li>Conduct official correspondence on behalf of the Principal Investigators as appropriate</li>	<li>On an ongoing basis, seek out partnerships and alliances to support the project</li> </ul> Pilot project implementation <ul> 	<li>Rapidly identifying stakeholders</li>	<li>Working with them to design projects</li>	<li>Rolling out projects</li>	<li>Collecting key data elements</li>	<li>Analyzing and interpreting data</li> </ul> Operational planning and management <ul> 	<li>Assist in the develop of a business plan which incorporates goals and objectives that support the project</li>	<li>Oversee the efficient and effective day-to-day operation of the project and grant preparation</li>	<li>Draft project procedures, review as needed, and recommend changes as appropriate</li>	<li>Ensure that project files are securely stored and privacy/confidentiality is maintained</li>	<li>Leads, manages, or participates in projects as assigned.</li>	<li>Analyzes issues, and defines project objectives, scope, implementation plans, resource requirements, and timelines</li>	<li>Designs and manages all assigned phases of projects and programs</li>	<li>Provides input into the day-to-day operational aspects of a project/program, including identifying and resolving issues and conflict</li> </ul> Budget/Resource planning and management: <ul> 	<li>Accountable for fiscal management including expenditures and sound bookkeeping/accounting procedures</li>	<li>Administer funds according to approved budget and monitor monthly expenditures</li>	<li>Provide the funder with a comprehensive report on project expenditures</li>	<li>Supports the preparation and monitoring of budgets for the research including operational activities consistent with the plans and general guidelines</li>	<li>Monitors projects and plans and reports any variance from expected outcomes to the Principal Investigators</li>	<li>Collaborates with the Principal Investigators, staff and key stakeholders to meet financial targets</li> </ul> Strategic and Operational Planning: <ul> 	<li>Supports the development and implementation of the planning and program development processes</li>	<li>Organizes meetings, committees, locations, agendas, goals and next-steps</li>	<li>Works collaboratively with the different committees to determine priorities, establish goals and objectives, develop and implement action plans, identify performance measures/targets, and monitor/evaluate progress toward performance targets</li>	<li>Develop and oversee the implementation of key initiatives as part of the project planning and grant preparation</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications / Requirements:</strong> <ul> 	<li>University degree, masters preferred along with knowledge of mental health/addiction care and/or Alberta Health Services operations.</li>	<li>5 years of experience as a project/program manager.</li>	<li>Experience working with health care providers, AHS officials and consumer groups</li>	<li>Experience working with a variety of stakeholders to develop relationships and achieve shared goals</li>	<li>Superior skills and success experience in motivating and collaborating with others to build successful partnerships</li>	<li>Knowledge and understanding of healthcare research</li>	<li>Knowledge and understanding of University of Calgary research services, financial procedures, policies and agreements</li>	<li>High level skills in organizational management and ability to manage multiple priorities</li>	<li>Highly developed skills in project management and coordination including planning, development, implementation, and evaluation</li>	<li>Strong interpersonal skills</li>	<li>Ability to organize ideas and information, and to communicate clearly and concisely in both oral and written forms</li>	<li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team</li> </ul> ¿<strong>Application Deadline:</strong> May 16, 2018 <br/><br/> <em>We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> This position is part of the AUPE bargaining unit, and falls under the <em><strong>Specialist/Advisor Job Family, Phase III</strong></em>. <br/><br/> To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Management and Staff Careers website</strong>. For more information about the Cumming School of Medicine visit <strong>Careers in the Cumming School of Medicine</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong>ucalgary.ca</strong>. <br/><br/> <em>The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.</em>

Title: HR Manager
Job_Description: Are you a results-driven HR Manager that can execute a wide variety of HR practices that lead to business growth? Are you an HR consultant who would prefer to spend more time on service delivery? Do you enjoy collaborating with other like-minded professionals? We want to speak with you! <br/><br/> We are looking for an HR Manager to work on a large scale project and ongoing HR delivery with a client of ours in the service sector. <br/><br/> The role will involve managing a recruiting team to deliver on an aggressive recruitment campaign and ramp up of staff, delivery of an HR infrastructure for the clients ramp up, then ongoing HR support. This will involve in depth understanding of both HR Best Practices as well as solid Project Management experience. <br/><br/> <strong>What you will be doing</strong>  <ul> <li>Provide HR consulting to TPD client(s)</li> <li>Partner with the TPD team to deliver business outcomes by applying leading solutions for any of the following areas:   <ul> <li>Compliance Management</li> <li>Employee Relations</li> <li>Employer Branding</li> <li>Organizational Culture</li> <li>Change Management</li> <li>Employee Engagement</li> <li>Recruitment Strategy</li> <li>Performance Management</li> <li>Training and Development</li> <li>Leadership Coaching</li> <li>Career Pathing</li> <li>Succession Planning</li> <li>Workforce Planning</li> <li>Health and Safety</li> </ul>  </li> </ul> <strong>What you bring to the table</strong>  <ul> <li>Project Management experience a MUST</li> <li>Understanding and mastery of many of the above concepts and areas of HR</li> <li>Minimum five years progressive experience in a HR Role</li> </ul> <strong>What you will get in return</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive Salary</li> <li>Benefits package including health and dental</li> <li>The support and expertise of a team of HR Professionals and consultants</li> </ul> If this sounds like the right fit, submit your resume today!

Title: Project Administrator
Job_Description: <strong>ISL Engineering and Land Services Ltd.</strong> is an award-winning full-service consulting firm dedicated to working with all levels of government and the private sector to deliver planning and design solutions for transportation, water, and land projects. <br/><br/> Our commitment to client success is built on a strong foundation: we know the communities we serve. This local knowledge, combined with our range of expertise and depth of experience, helps us meet the unique challenges of every project and better understand the role of sustainable solutions in all phases of a project’s life cycle. <br/><br/> ISL Engineering and Land Services is proud to be among Canada’s 30 most environmentally-conscious employers as well as a Platinum Level Small and Medium Best Employer in Canada. ISL supports diversity and is an employment equity employer. <br/><br/> ISL offers opportunities for career development, an employer paid benefits plan, Group RRSP program and competitive salaries with opportunities for an annual bonus.<br/><br/>We are seeking a Project Administrator for our Calgary office. In this role, you will be assisting Managers and Project Managers within our Transportation discipline on project and business-related administrative tasks. This is a deadline-driven, hands-on, full-time, salaried position and is intended for career-oriented applicants who are seeking a long-term career in office administration. <br/><br/> The position is a new role within ISL’s Calgary office and we envision the successful candidate will be a self-starter who helps refine and expand their role with time, including by observing and working with the team so that you come to anticipate and address their organization needs in advance. By taking on these administrative tasks, the success of this role will be demonstrated in measurably freeing up the time of our management team to focus on project-related and strategic priorities. The role will be well suited to applicants who are passionate and driven to grow their administrative career in an industry-leading organization. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Responsibilities may include:</u></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Preparation of meeting minutes</li> <li>Maintain a project database for use in revenue and resource workload projections</li> <li>Maintain and develop project checklists</li> <li>Maintain lists for client contacts, events and sales pipeline opportunities</li> <li>Maintain lists for staff events, training courses and conferences</li></ul>   <ul>  	<li>Arrange registration and travel for events, training courses and conferences</li> <li>Maintain a team experience and project database for use with preparation of proposals</li> <li>Assistance with preparation of proposals</li> <li>Assistance with technical writing, proof reading and checking final reports</li> <li>Production of technical reports, drawing packages, or other documents</li> <li>Quality assurance checks of drawings, reports and documents (for appearance / aesthetics, nomenclature, spelling, and annotation)</li> <li>Assist in the implementation and ongoing maintenance of SharePoint sites for projects or teams</li> <li>Preparation of client transmittals and communications</li> <li>Digital and hard-copy filing</li> <li>Organize and assist in the implementation of project-specific digital filing systems</li> <li>Transcribing and summarizing public engagement feedback or similar information</li> <li>Preparation of formal agreement documents</li> <li>Maintain a compiled list of Professional Services and Sub-consultant Agreements</li> <li>Assistance with project accounting and invoicing</li> <li>Organize meetings including room management, booking, catering, etc.</li> <li>Working proactively with the general office administration team to coordinate tasks or obtain assistance in their areas of responsibility</li> <li>In future, potentially assisting with recruitment and training of other Project Administrators to support other office disciplines</li> </ul>  <strong><u>Requirements:</u></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Minimum 3-5 years of office experience</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written English communication skills</li> <li>High level of attention to detail</li> <li>Demonstrated strong work ethic and commitment to quality and support of process improvement</li> <li>Self-motivated and proactive administrator who seeks to understand the needs of the team with time, and to proactively learn, anticipate and address organization needs in advance</li> <li>Expert knowledge of Microsoft Word including templates</li> <li>Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel including filters, formulas and pivot tables</li> <li>Strong time management and organizational skills, with demonstrated ability for self-management of multiple simultaneous priorities or deadlines</li> <li>Ability to read and interpret instructions, identify problems or missing information and address them proactively</li> <li>Creative problem solver who works in a professional and ethical manner</li> </ul>  <strong><u>Qualities Considered an Asset:</u></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Prior experience in the civil engineering consulting industry</li> <li>Formal education / diploma in office administration or management</li> <li>Accounting experience (invoicing, budgets, etc.)</li> <li>Experience using other Microsoft Office products (Outlook, PowerPoint, Project, OneNote)</li> <li>Experience using PDF software for combining files, adding bookmarks, and completing markups</li> <li>Experience using SharePoint or other document management software</li> </ul> <strong>Want to find out more about this or other ISL career opportunities?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Visit us online at www.islengineering.com</strong> <br/><br/> Department: Transportation <br/> This is a permanent full time position

Title: RPA – Manager
Job_Description: <DIV>EY's people in more than 150 countries are committed to operating with integrity, quality and professionalism in the provision of audit, tax, transaction and advisory services. We strive to help all of our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone's contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth, and provides continuous opportunities for development. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>We currently have career opportunities for Manager in our IT Advisory Services team. The individuals will work directly with clients to transform their business challenges into technology solutions. The goal is to support our clients' efforts to make their business units more effective and efficient and, where required, provide services in connection with the development and implementation of technology solutions. Our experience is also important to the analysis of specific business requirements for alignment with technology architecture, technology infrastructure design, and vendor selection decisions that support the line of business IT organizations of our clients.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>This position falls within our IT Advisory team, which helps our clients enhance the effectiveness of Operations functions by assisting them as they shift their emphasis from transaction-level control, processing and reporting to more value driven, decision support and analytics. </DIV> <DIV><B>Responsibilities</B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Participate in project teams through all phases of the technology enablement life cycle. Lend specific subject matter knowledge to the design and integration phase of each project, helping to give specificity to the appropriate architecture, data model, and system design and interfacing requirements.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Advise clients on a variety of business process services that help identify, assess, manage and measure the organization's capabilities. Team with client technology professionals, and/or third-party strategic alliances to provide implementation of technology solutions. Participate in engagement management, engagement execution and reporting, and client relationship building and management.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>We are looking to expand our Practice area to include a team of people with experience in RPA (Robotic Process Automation). This team will work with our clients to help implement such RPA tools as Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, Openspan and Workfusion. You must be able to develop and document RPA configuration best practices, configure new RPA processes and objects using core workflow principles that are efficient, well structured, maintainable and easy to understand. Have an understanding to support existing processes and implementing change requirements as part of a structured change control process as well as problem solving issues that arise in day to day running of RPA processes and providing timely responses and solutions as required.<BR><BR></DIV> <DIV><B>Qualifications</B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Desired qualifications include:</DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Demonstrated experience through all phases of the technology life cycle, including project planning, requirements definition, architecture design, build/configuration, testing and operational transition.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong track record implementing RPA Tools (e.g. Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, Openspan and Workfusion.)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Involved in IT strategy and transformation engagements (IT long range plan, roadmap, operating model, governance, enterprise architecture, etc.)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>C# and/or Java, html, css</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Microsoft Technology (VB .NET, Windows, Internet Explorer, SQL Server, Web Services)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Scripting languages (e.g., python, perl, powershell, bash, vbs, etc.)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Approximately 5 years of related work experience; or a graduate degree </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>A degree in computer science, engineering, accounting, finance or a related field; MBA or MS degree preferred.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, client service and technical writing skills, coupled with a strong interest in further developing and integrating operations with technology skills.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Comfortable researching client inquiries and emerging issues, including regulations, industry practices, and new technologies.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>A high level of motivation, strong work ethic and self-starting attitude.</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B><U>Willingness and ability to travel approximately 50-80>.</U></B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.</B></DIV> <DIV><BR></DIV>

Title: Co-op Student, Oil Sands Project Development
Job_Description: Co-op Student, Oil Sands Project Development - 15580 Description Job Title: Co-op Student, Oil Sands ProjectDevelopment Location: Calgary, AB Start Date: September 4, 2018 Length of Term: 8, 12 or 16 months Business Unit: Oil Sands ApplicationDeadline: May 20, 2018 or once the position has been filled OpportunityDetails: The OilSands Projects team has a Co-op opportunity to support various projects in theOil Sands Business Unit. Oil Sands Projects offers a dynamic opportunityto experience the full lifecycle of a project from design concept toconstruction and the critical measure of performance acceptance. The position will support the project leadusing the Husky Project Delivery Model to deliver fit for purpose projects. Theposition will work out of the Calgary office with travel to site expected (upto 20%). Key Responsibilities may involve: Develop project summaries and economic justification Refine project plans, schedules, and cost estimates Participate in risk assessment analysis using PHA Pro and MS Excel Update engineering drawings and technical documents Manage a small project under the supervision of a project lead Participate in field walk down to verify build status Co-ordinate project and construction resources to complete close out templates Qualifications Qualifications: Must be currently enrolled in a post-secondary Co-op or Internship program Strong academic background in Mechanical, Chemical, Process, Civil or Electrical engineering Preference given to students in their 3rd or 4th year of study Familiarity with gated project delivery model considered an asset Computer skills (MS Office and MS Excel) are essential Must be able to work effectively in a team environment Effective written and oral communication skills Excellent organizational and planning skills Small project design or execution considered an asset Previous experience in construction or operating environment considered an asset Benefits of a Husky StudentPosition: Opportunities to: take part in impactful business projects network with experienced professionals engage in a strong student network gain valuable exposure in the Oil and Gas industry Relevant experience in your field of study Relocation assistance Competitive wages Submission: Please submit a resume andtranscript with application. Applications without recent transcripts willnot be considered. Relocation: Students moving for theirwork term may be eligible to receive a lump sum payment to assist withrelocation expenses. Additional Information: New graduates are not eligible forstudent opportunities. Please note that only those selectedfor an interview will be contacted. At Husky, we respect diversityand embrace an inclusive culture. We value uniqueness and differentperspectives as they play a critical role in our success. To achieve this,individuals are selected based on qualifications, merit, and abilities and weencourage applications from everyone including visible minorities, Aboriginalpeople, women, and persons with disabilities. About Husky: One of Huskys advantages is that we are anintegrated oil and gas company. From exploration to development, production,refining and marketing, weve got it all! Combine this with a range of learningand development tools and an inclusive work environment, and you arewell-positioned for a successful career at Husky. We have training, mentoring and career developmentprograms and resources to help you develop both personally and professionally as an employee or a leader. We offer many internal leadership and businessskills courses along with tuition reimbursement programs for qualifiedemployees. Every year, a significant number of our employees are able to takeon new roles within the company thanks to our strong focus on hands-on learningand development. #LI-DNP Job Student Primary Location CA-AB-Calgary

Title: Team Lead, Financial Analysis
Job_Description: Team Lead, Financial Analysis – Calgary, AB <br/> 13-Month Contract<br/><br/>Reporting to the VP, Finance, you will be accountable for financial analysis that supports organizational strategy, business planning, performance reporting, acquisition and disposition activities. <br/><br/> This 13-month contract position—beginning July 2018—requires you to lead the daily activities of the financial planning team and prepare presentations used by senior management and directors to make strategic decisions. You will actively participate in the A&D process by developing project economics, financial models and business cases for acquisition opportunities, development projects and organic expansion. You will report on current information regarding business, economic and corporate developments in the market relevant to NAL’s business. <br/><br/> To qualify for this position, you have a minimum of 10 years of experience in financial analysis and reporting and a bachelor’s degree in finance or accounting. You also have very strong written communication skills and excellent interpersonal skills. Oil and gas experience and completion of an MBA, CFA, CBV and/or CPA designation will be considered assets. Proven experience in strategic and corporation planning; financial valuation of acquisitions and dispositions; corporate finance; and equity research or investment banking experience is desirable. <br/><br/> NAL provides a fast-paced, team-orientated environment and competitive compensation. To apply for this position, please submit your resume to jobs@nal.ca, referencing the position title in the subject line. <br/><br/> We appreciate the interest of all applicants; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> View All Opportunities

Title: Project Administrator
Job_Description: <div>WESCO International, Inc. (NYSE : WCC) est une société de portefeuille Fortune 500 cotée en bourse, dont le siège social est situé à Pittsburgh, en Pennsylvanie. Elle est un fournisseur de premier plan de produits électriques, de produits de construction, de produits de maintenance, de réparation et d’exploitation (MRO) et d’équipementier, de services de gestion de chaîne d’approvisionnement et de services logistiques. Les ventes annuelles de 2016 étaient d’environ 7,3 milliards de dollars. La société emploie environ 9 000 personnes, entretient des relations avec plus de 25 000 fournisseurs et compte plus de 80 000 clients actifs à travers le monde. Les clients comprennent des entreprises commerciales et industrielles, des entrepreneurs, des organismes gouvernementaux, des institutions, des fournisseurs de télécommunications et des services publics. WESCO exploite neuf centres de distribution entièrement automatisés et environ 500 agences de services complets en Amérique du Nord et sur les marchés internationaux, offrant une présence locale à ses clients et un réseau mondial desservant des entreprises à emplacements multiples et des multinationales. <br/><br/> WESCO International, Inc. (NYSE: WCC), a publicly traded Fortune 500 holding company headquartered in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, is a leading provider of electrical, industrial, and communications maintenance, repair and operating (MRO) and original equipment manufacturers (OEM) products, construction materials, and advanced supply chain management and logistic services. 2016 annual sales were approximately $7.3 billion. The company employs approximately 9,000 people, maintains relationships with over 25,000 suppliers, and serves approximately 75,000 active customers worldwide. Customers include commercial and industrial businesses, contractors, government agencies, institutions, telecommunications providers, and utilities. WESCO operates nine fully automated distribution centers and approximately 500 full-service branches in North America and international markets, providing a local presence for customers and a global network to serve multi-location businesses and multi-national corporations.</div><div> Brief Description</div> <div>L'administrateur de projet est responsable de la gestion des opérations quotidiennes en ce qui a trait aux projets assignés. <br/><br/> The Project Administrator is responsible for handling the day to day operations for assigned projects.</div> <div> Detailed Description</div> <div>· Assurer l'administration de projet pour les projets assignés à l'intérieur de l'entreprise. <br/><br/> · Offrir un soutien aux exécutions courantes et la supervision des projets. <br/><br/> · Instaurer des objectifs pour les projets qui correspondent aux besoins de l'entreprise. <br/><br/> · Coordonner les exigences techniques associées au projet avec les clients internes et les clients externes. <br/><br/> · Développer les coûts, les prix et planifier les données des projets. <br/><br/> · Faire en sorte que les projets soient instaurés et menés à terme. <br/><br/> Effectuer la liaison avec le personnel et les directeurs de services compétents lors de la réalisation du projet, le cas échéant. <br/><br/> · Provide project administration on assigned projects within the company. <br/><br/> · Support day-to-day implementation and direction for projects. <br/><br/> · Implement project requirements consistent with business needs. <br/><br/> · Coordinate project-related technical requirements with internal and external customers. <br/><br/> · Develop cost, pricing, and schedule data for projects. <br/><br/> · Insure implementation and completion of projects. <br/><br/> · Liaison with appropriate personnel and department managers as appropriate when performing project activities. <br/><br/> Performs other duties as required</div> <div> Job Requirements</div> <div><STRONG>EXPÉRIENCE</STRONG> <br/><br/> Expérience de travail directe en gestion de projet, y compris dans tous les aspects de l'élaboration et de l'exécution de projet. - 2 <STRONG>Exigée</STRONG> <br/><br/> <STRONG>EXIGENCES ET APTITUDES</STRONG> <br/><br/> Solides aptitudes à la résolution de problèmes et capacité d'analyser les processus du travail pour les clients internes et les clients externes. <br/><br/> Apte à mener des recherches sur les questions et les produits liés au projet. <br/><br/> Capacité à fixer des priorités et d'exécuter des tâches efficacement. <br/><br/> Excellente aptitude à la communication orale et écrite. <br/><br/> Solides connaissances en informatique. <br/><br/> <STRONG><U>Environnement de travail</U></STRONG> <br/><br/> <strong>Travail de bureau</strong> – En général, le travail s'effectue dans un bureau doté de l'équipement standard. L'éclairage et la température sont adéquats, et il n'y a aucun danger ni aucune condition désagréable comme le bruit, la poussière, etc. <br/><br/> <STRONG><U>exigences liées à la condition physique</U></STRONG> <br/><br/> Le travail est habituellement sédentaire, mais peut exiger de se tenir debout ou de marcher pour une période allant jusqu'à 10 % du temps. <br/><br/> <STRONG><U>exigences mentales</U></STRONG> <br/><br/> L'employé doit organiser et coordonner des emplois du temps. <br/><br/> L'employé doit analyser et interpréter des données complexes. <br/><br/> L'employé doit faire de la résolution de problèmes. <br/><br/> L'employé doit communiquer avec le public. <br/><br/> L'employé doit gérer d'autres employés. <br/><br/> <STRONG><U>REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES</U> </STRONG> <br/><br/> · Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze workflow/processes to support internal and external customers <br/><br/> · Adept at conducting research into project-related issues and products <br/><br/> · Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks <br/><br/> · Strong written and verbal communication skills <br/><br/> · Strong computer skills <br/><br/> <strong><U>EXPERIENCE</U></strong> <br/><br/> 2 - 3 years direct work experience in a project management capacity, including all aspects of project development and execution</div> <div> Additional Details</div> <div>For WESCO locations in Canada, we offer a competitive compensation and flexible benefit plan, pension plan, educational assistance plan and more. Please note, in the recruitment process accommodations for applicants with disabilities are available upon request. <br/><br/> WESCO values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.</div> <div>Press "Apply Now" below.</div> <div> Currency CAD</div> <div> Country Canada</div> <div> Canada</div>

Title: Junior Designer - Special Projects & Restoration
Job_Description: JOB SUMMARY <br/><br/> Based in Calgary and reporting to the Leader of Special Projects and Restoration, the Junior Designer, will be involved in small and medium projects and assist in maintaining a high level of service for the Special Projects and Restoration practice at Entuitive. This will entail working closely with the other service groups in the firm to ensure consistent, consolidated and leading edge service delivery. This position will primarily be responsible for assessment of existing buildings as well as structural analysis/design and will also offer the opportunity for growth into both office and field responsibilities. You will be working collaboratively with the project team from initial evaluation through to construction completion. We would like to supplement our existing team with a self-motivated individual, with leadership skills and a desire to work in a collaborative team environment. <br/><br/> KEY RESPONSIBILITIES <br/><br/> The role includes the following general tasks:  <ul> <li>A mix of field and office work</li> <li>Office work typically includes   <ul> <li>Writing reports subsequent to field work</li> <li>Computer aided analysis and design of structures</li> <li>Preparation of detailed structural design including calculations complying with Canadian Codes and Standards, specifications, drawings and sketches</li> <li>Working with the project team from initial evaluation through design to construction completion</li> <li>Review of submittals and shop drawings during construction</li> <li>Generation of contract administration documentation</li> </ul>  </li> <li>Field work typically includes   <ul> <li>Investigation and condition assessments of existing structural systems for buildings and parking facilities to identify the extent and cause of deterioration</li> <li>Working with structural restoration engineers during investigation and testing of post-tension facilities</li> <li>Attendance at construction progress meetings</li> <li>Completion of periodic field review during construction</li> </ul>  </li> <li>Actively participate in learning, reinforcing and contributing to Entuitive’s one-company philosophy.</li> <li>Participate in the delivery of a consistently high level of service</li> <li>Internal roles to establish our technical standards and design tools</li> <li>Such other duties and responsibilities as Entuitive may assign to you from time to time</li> </ul> SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE  <ul> <li>4 year degree in engineering from accredited school</li> <li>Hands on construction experience and/or work with existing facilities is considered an asset</li> <li>Strong communication skills both verbal and written with the ability to work with people at all levels including project stakeholders and clients</li> <li>Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities and deliverables on an ongoing basis</li> <li>Working knowledge of construction materials and products used in building construction, with a focus on concrete, steel, and wood</li> <li>Interest in applying new technology to support project processes</li> <li>Must have a working knowledge and ability to use programs such as SAP, Bluebeam, and various Office programs</li> <li>A valid driver’s license</li> </ul>

Title: Project Coordinator - Interiors
Job_Description: <strong><em>This position can be based out of our Calgary, Edmonton, or Vancouver office.</em></strong> <br/><br/> The Project Manager is responsible for all projects that require some level of coordination or other factors deemed necessary to require dedicated project management. This position will handle a variety of sized projects and can span all activities of supporting a project (i.e. site visits, oversee installation, walk throughs, product selection, product specification, applying appropriate discounting, preparing proposals, order management, installation management and punch list resolution). <br/><br/> This position will work very closely with the Furniture Account Manager, Furniture Coordinator and CAD Specifier or may need to work independently to ensure the customer’s needs are met. This position requires some for independent judgment to ensure projects reach completion. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Act as point of contact from order entry to completion of project, working with internal and external customers for planning and executing of each project, and ensure all logistical requirements are being met.</li> <li>Participate with internal team to understand scope of each project and gain all installation and/or delivery costs.</li>   <li>Attend client meetings, on-site measurements / inventory, construction meetings, and vendor meetings as required.</li> <li>Deficiency resolution – work with internal team to manage and resolve all deficiencies.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Secondary School completion; Product Management training and/or experience in contract furniture industry.</li> <li>2-3 years experience in handling furniture related processes and and/or installation experiences.</li> <li>Project management, safety training, and/or LEED certification a plus.</li> <li>Written and verbal communication skills with the ability to influence multiple stakeholders at all levels of the organization.</li>   <li>Ability to develop and sustain productive customer relationships.</li>   <li>Ability to lead and engage a work team to deliver results and achieve project objectives in a timely manner.</li>   <li>Ability to identify project and sales opportunities to drive company revenue.</li>   <li>Ability to travel within a given market or geography.</li> </ul> Grand & Toy offers competitive wages and benefits packages based on education and experience. We proudly provide comprehensive training for all new associates, along with incentives such as our associate/corporate discounts and rewards programs for management positions. We celebrate employment equity and diversity. We are committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Customer Success Manager
Job_Description: <strong>The Company</strong> <br/><br/> Diligent is the leading provider of secure corporate governance and collaboration solutions for boards and senior executives. Over 12,000 clients in more than 90 countries and on all seven continents rely on Diligent for secure distribution of board materials, secure messaging, integrated compliance, board evaluation and entity management. Diligent’s Governance Cloud is the only solution that meets the evolving governance needs of leading organizations. Visit diligent.com or follow us on Twitter @diligentHQ to learn more. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Diligent is looking for a highly professional and motivated individual to coordinate successful customer onboarding, training and ongoing customer relationships to insure long-term satisfaction, upgrades, add-on sales and referral sales. The successful candidate will be very comfortable articulating information and concepts both in-person and via telephone/email to virtually every level of corporate hierarchy. This position requires the Customer Success Manager to interface directly with Directors and Executives of Fortune 500 companies, and other large multi-national companies, as well as Corporate Legal Counsel/Administration, and IT project teams. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Provide an excellent customer experience for all accounts, by anticipating and resolving customer issues in a manner that exceeds customer expectations.</li> <li>Seamless project management through all phases of the customer relationship - coordinating with the client project team, administrative staff, IT Team, and most importantly, the users of the Diligent Boards application: Board Directors and Corporate Executives.</li> <li>Remain in constant contact with the customer to evaluate satisfaction and proactively identify upcoming needs, including expansion of use of Diligent’s products and services.</li><li>Coordinate with technical personnel as needed to meet customer needs, while managing customer expectations to prevent overload or missed deadlines.</li> <li>Provide customer feedback on the Diligent Boards solution in order to assist in continuous improvement of the Diligent products.</li><li>Maximise revenue growth via upsell/cross-sell of the product and various modules into different areas of the client’s business.</li> </ul> <strong>Required Experience/Skills:</strong> <ul> <li>5+ years’ experience in account management, sales, or technical project management.</li><li>Track record of over-achieving quota</li> <li>A passion for collaboration and a deep understanding of the technology involved in SaaS.</li><li>Excellent Project Management expertise and experience.</li><li>Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal.</li><li>Strong Presentation skills and experience working with C-Level Executives and Directors.</li><li>Strong technical focus and detailed knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications.</li><li>Superb personal organizational skills to ensure all client commitments are met.</li><li>Customer focused. Able to deliver extremely high levels of customer satisfaction.</li><li>Able to perform well in the face of tight deadlines and tough technical and organizational challenges.</li> <li>Bi-lingual in English and French or Spanish is ideal but not essential</li><li>Potential travel of up to 50%.</li><li>Bachelor’s degree.</li> </ul>

Title: Canola Brand Manager
Job_Description: <P>At <STRONG>BASF</STRONG>, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.</P> <P> </P> <P>We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in, and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.</P> <P> </P> <P>And we are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF Canada has been recognized as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for 2018, as well as one of Greater Toronto’s Top Employers for 2018.</P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG><EM>Where the Chemistry Happens…</EM></STRONG></P> <P><STRONG><EM></EM></STRONG> </P> <P>The <STRONG>Brand Manager </STRONG>is responsible for the brand strategy as it relates to the overall crop solution campaign, ensuring the annual product-on-ground (POG) budget/s are achieved as well as managing the associated advertising, sales and promotion (ASP) budget. </P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG><EM>Formula for Success: You Will…</EM></STRONG></P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Lead the development of the brand indication as part of the overall crop solution by working closely with Technical Service, Sales, the Associate Brand Manager (ABM), and Customer Service Team (CST) to implement an effective campaign for growers, retailers, and retail agronomists</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Develop annual Canola Strategy, linked to annual overall canola crop solution plan, based on confirmed grower needs/trends utilizing advice, services and products to achieve an annual POG budget while effectively directing an annual associated ASP budget for content creation</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Manage profitability of the Canola portfolio through market mix, lifecycle management, competitive insights, and accurate financial planning that drives 10Y planning and resources</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Brand champion for assigned focus brand/ ensuring a consistent brand positioning across crops by working with other Crop Managers</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Align their brands to the overall crop solution campaign with the overall go-to-market strategy of BASF Canada, be involved with the product launch excellence (PLE) process at submission on assigned brands, and work closely with the Market Manager to set annual financial and accrual budgets as well as long-term forecasts</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate the coordination, communication and integration of the Canola Crop Solution campaign internally with Sales, CST and Marketing as well as externally with Channel partners as assigned</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Work closely with Canola Market Manager and Associate Brand Manager/s to support the annual financial and accrual budget development as well as providing input into long-term forecasting and planning </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Provide support to market program development and participate on Head Office account customer strategies. Interaction with regional marketing to generate support and provide project justification as appropriate to meet long range market objectives and support current and future product offers</DIV></LI></UL> <P> </P> <P><STRONG><EM>Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You…</EM></STRONG></P> <P> </P> <P>Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you—the whole you—in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry.</P> <P> </P> <P>The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans, to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career. <BR></P> <P><STRONG><EM>Ingredients for Success: What We Look for in You…</EM></STRONG></P> <UL> <LI>BSc in Business/Marketing or Agriculture</LI> <LI>Minimum 5 years in sales and / or a marketing-support role, preferably within the agricultural industry</LI> <LI>Sound understanding of marketing, sales and customer relationship management</LI> <LI>An understanding of growers, distributors and agronomy for the crop protection industry</LI> <LI>Must possess strong analytical and critical thinking skills as well as a proven record of achieving goals</LI> <LI>Strong interpersonal skills including listening, presenting, writing, team work and the ability to lead a team</LI> <LI>Proficient with Microsoft Office</LI> <LI>Ability to travel across Canada</LI></UL> <P><STRONG><EM>We welcome and encourage applications from all persons. BASF has a robust policy of accommodating employees who are able to perform the essential duties of the job upon accommodation. In particular, applicants with disabilities are entitled to a recruitment process and accessible materials.</EM></STRONG></P> <P></P>

Title: Project Manager (Alberta)
Job_Description: We are looking for an experienced Alberta based Project Manager to join our growing team, and to lead our growth in the Alberta market. Novacom has had a presence in Alberta for 18 years, and due to the rapid growth in volume over the past 4 years we're no longer able to manage this work out of our Vancouver office. <br/><br/> This position is more than just a Project Management opportunity, it's a chance to join an established and fast growing company and be a part of building a great Alberta team. The role would be based out of a home office or co-working space, and would be supported by our Vancouver Head Office and our team of Alberta based Site Superintendents. The projects would be located throughout Alberta and Saskatchewan. <br/><br/> Novacom is a leading Construction Manager and General Contractor based in Surrey, BC and working throughout Western Canada. We value people, relationships, innovation and culture. We believe in constantly improving ourselves to provide the best possible service to our clients. Our core business is commercial construction and renovations of financial institutions, restaurants, offices and retail spaces. <br/><br/> We're doing construction differently, and we're thinking outside the box about how we can improve our company and our industry. If you're looking for a company with a family dynamic where you can have opportunities to grow, be challenged and known by your co-workers, then come join us! <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Personal Characteristics:</strong> <ul>  <li>Driven - self-motivated and driven to push things forward no matter the circumstance</li> <li>Energetic - engaged personality that takes on complex challenges with enthusiasm</li> <li>Independent - ability to communicate effectively with team, but also act authoritatively on your own</li> <li>Humble - willingness to admit when you've made a mistake and take ownership</li> <li>Administrative - ability to track schedules, change orders, field reports, weekly progress reports etc.</li> <li>Financial Focus - desire to meticulously manage project budgets and financial reporting</li>  <li>Personable - able to build and maintain solid relationships with vendors and clients</li> <li>Communicator - good at proactively with subtrades and team, strong verbal & written communication skills</li> <li>Organizer- meticulous in site organization</li> <li>Mobile - willing to travel to various sites across Alberta & Saskatchewan for site meetings, visits, interface etc.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul>  <li>5-10 years' experience in the commercial construction field, preferably in a Project Management capacity</li> <li>Construction knowledge - overall understanding of construction process, sequencing, etc.</li>  <li>Post-secondary, technical education (BCIT) or similar in a construction or industry-related program</li>  </ul> <strong>Responsibilities</strong><strong>:</strong> <ul>  <li>Project Startup -- issuing contracts, requesting insurance and bonds, WCB notices, etc.</li>  <li>Project Documentation -- using Timberline and Microsoft software to manage labour, materials, and equipment, cost coding, submittals, schedules, meeting minutes, change orders, etc.</li> <li>Subtrade/Supplier Management -- ability to manage construction subtrades and suppliers, and mitigate issues that may arise in the course of a project</li> <li>Site Superintendent Interface -- ability to work in partnership with Site Superintendent to deliver a high quality finished product while managing the schedule and budget</li> <li>Client Interface -- meeting with architects, consultants, and clients to manage project issues and maintain positive working relationships</li> <li>Budget Management -- continuous monitoring and management of project budget, ability to minimize project costs through inventive methods and regular financial reporting to management</li> <li>Invoicing -- preparation of monthly progress claims, review and approval of subtrade and supplier invoices</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul> <li>Salary will be commensurate with experience</li> </ul>

Title: Technical Account Manager
Job_Description: Maximize your IT investments by pairing your business with a dedicated support team of the world’s top Microsoft subject-matter experts. Providing customizable solutions complete with enhancement and add-on services, Premier Support helps our customers proactively address risks, minimize downtime, and streamline operations to improve efficiency and accelerate business growth. The Premier Support Team is part of the Microsoft Services division and consists of Support Professionals, Premier Field Engineers and Technical Account Mangers (TAM). A Technical Account Manager (TAM) is a trusted business advisor to Microsoft's Premier Support customers providing valuable guidance around operations and optimization of their IT infrastructure through quality Service Delivery Management. <br/><br/> The TAM works closely with the customer to provide proactive support assistance to prevent issues from occurring. By maintaining a long-term relationship with their customers a TAM gains an understanding of their IT organizations' impact on overall business, their IT goals, and their challenges. This knowledge is used by the TAM to construct a Service Delivery Plan ensuring their customers' operational success with Microsoft Technologies. The TAM plays a pivotal role in ensuring that Microsoft is considered and viewed as a key technology partner in the successful operation of the customers IT environment. The Technical Account Manager will also have excellent working relationships with other representatives of Microsoft who will be active within his/her account(s).<br/><br/>Responsibilities<br/><br/>• Achieve customer health through service delivery, planning and execution; customer satisfaction; emphasis on prevention and consultative advice (ITIL); management of support services to Enterprise customers. <br/><br/> • Establish a long term and sustainable relationship with their customers for support <br/><br/> • Organize regular support delivery and contract status review meetings with customers <br/><br/> • Establish and document future client projects and IT initiatives in order to best support their customers <br/><br/> • Create and maintain a Service Delivery Plan per customer account <br/><br/> • Clearly plan, request resources and maintain project leadership of the various components of the Microsoft Premier Support Services (Health checks, Workshops, pro-active services, etc.) <br/><br/> • Work and collaborate with various Microsoft resources (consultants, engineers and account teams) <br/><br/> • Be the ambassador for Microsoft at their customer and an advocate for their clients within Microsoft. <br/><br/> • Manage, escalate and drive satisfactory resolution of customers’ technical support, service and infrastructure issues based on Microsoft product and technology <br/><br/> • Proactively and reactively interface on-site with customers in the management of technical issues as well as collaborating in planning, implementation, skills and knowledge transfer and day-to-day operation of new/upgraded Microsoft technologies <br/><br/> • Provide information and recommend best practices for the management of Microsoft technologies in accordance with the <br/> Microsoft Operations Framework (MOF). <br/><br/> • Proactively monitor technical issues pertaining to Microsoft technologies at customer sites and make recommendations to reduce the risk/impact of similar future problems. <br/><br/> • Maintain and expand working knowledge of current and pre-released Microsoft systems and products, as well as their integration and methods of support delivery. <br/><br/> • Maintain current knowledge on industry issues/trends and competitive products. <br/><br/> • Lead in sharing of best practices with team members to contribute to enhance the quality and efficiency of customer support.<br/><br/>Qualifications<br/><br/>• 5+ years’ experience in an enterprise support environment with a strong understanding of corporate account support needs and knowledge of support industry <br/><br/> • Exceptional Time Management skills <br/><br/> • Exceptional Customer Service skills <br/><br/> • Strong communication and presentation skills <br/><br/> • Experience with managing customer facing critical and complex situations or incidents <br/><br/> • A positive and constructive minded team player <br/><br/> • Account management experience and/or customer engagement responsibility <br/><br/> • General Knowledge of Microsoft’s Enterprise Products <br/><br/> • MCITP-EA Certification is considered an asset <br/><br/> • ITIL certification is considered an asset <br/><br/> • University degree in Technology or related Certifications are considered an asset <br/><br/> Considering a Career with Microsoft Canada? At Microsoft Canada, people are the source of our energy. The people at Microsoft Canada are creative, from all types of backgrounds, bringing passion and new ideas, meeting challenges, and realizing their potential. Our benefits and resources are designed to keep our most important asset - our employees - healthy, happy and equipped with the resources they need to be successful and realize their full potential. Microsoft Canada provides a flexible work environment, with career advancement potential and most importantly, the opportunity to make a difference. <br/><br/> As a Microsoft employee you have the opportunity to participate in the following programs: <br/><br/> • Stock Awards & Employee Stock Purchase Plan <br/><br/> • Registered Retirement Savings Plan <br/><br/> • Employee Software Purchase Program <br/><br/> • Fitness Membership & Subsidy <br/><br/> • I Volunteer (5 Paid Volunteer Days) <br/><br/> • Employee Assistance Program And so much more… <br/><br/> At Microsoft, we share a passion for technology, customers and our partners. We aspire to be more than just a good company- we aspire to be a great company. What will make us great is our commitment to our mission of enabling people and businesses throughout the world to realize their full potential. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer and supports workforce diversity. <br/><br/> Microsoft is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities up to the point of undue hardship during the recruitment, assessment and selection process. Please notify Microsoft if you require accommodation in respect of the materials or procedures used at any time during this process. If you require accommodation Microsoft will work with you to determine how to meet your need.

Title: Project Engineer
Job_Description: <div> Our Facilities Engineering group works on a wide range of diverse, cutting edge oil and gas projects; from a small well tie-in to a large multi-million dollar SAGD facility. <br/><br/> Due to the tremendous growth of our Facilities Engineering group we are looking for several experienced Project Engineers who are interested in working on challenging, fast-paced, and diverse projects. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manager of Project Engineering, you will be responsible for coordinating with the various internal disciplines, as well as the client to ensure the successful completion of the project. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>   <ul>  	<li>Client interactions and single-point technical interface;</li>  <li>Guiding and coordinating the activities of the assigned engineering and design staff;</li>  <li>Coordinating with the various internal disciplines for initiation of performing complex engineering tasks including detailed calculations as required by the project;</li>  <li>Develop the Project Design Basis Memorandum and assist in the development of execution plan, budgets and schedules</li>  <li>Preparing P&IDs and Plot Plan</li>   <li>Ensuring appropriate multi-disciplinary review of project documents; approve all technical deliverables;</li>  <li>Conducting engineering quality control to meet WSP and Client quality standards;</li>  <li>Timely project reporting.</li>  </ul>  <strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <br/><br/> Our successful candidate will hold an engineering degree. We are looking for a candidate who has experience working as a Project Engineer on Gas Plant Projects in the Oil and Gas industry; ideally you will have a minimum of 10 years’ experience in a similar role. In addition you will also have:   <ul>  	<li>Superior communication skills;</li>   <li>Proven track record of working effectively with both internal and external clients;</li>  <li>Have a proven ability to multi-task and efficiently respond to changing priorities;</li>  <li>Familiarity with CSA Z662 and ASME B31.3;</li>  <li>P.Eng designation in Alberta.</li> </ul>  <div> Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits). <br/><br/> To learn more about our firm and the projects we have been involved in, please visit our <strong> World of Possibilities</strong> microsite. <br/><br/> <em><strong>WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</strong></em> <br/><br/> <em><strong>WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.</strong></em> <br/><br/> <em><strong>WSP Canada Inc.</strong></em></div> </div> </div><div></div>

Title: Project Administrator
Job_Description: <strong>ISL Engineering and Land Services Ltd.</strong> is an award-winning full-service consulting firm dedicated to working with all levels of government and the private sector to deliver planning and design solutions for transportation, water, and land projects. <br/><br/> Our commitment to client success is built on a strong foundation: we know the communities we serve. This local knowledge, combined with our range of expertise and depth of experience, helps us meet the unique challenges of every project and better understand the role of sustainable solutions in all phases of a project’s life cycle. <br/><br/> ISL Engineering and Land Services is proud to be among Canada’s 30 most environmentally-conscious employers as well as a Platinum Level Small and Medium Best Employer in Canada. ISL supports diversity and is an employment equity employer. <br/><br/> ISL offers opportunities for career development, an employer paid benefits plan, Group RRSP program and competitive salaries with opportunities for an annual bonus.<br/><br/>We are seeking a Project Administrator for our Calgary office. In this role, you will be assisting Managers and Project Managers within our Transportation discipline on project and business-related administrative tasks. This is a deadline-driven, hands-on, full-time, salaried position and is intended for career-oriented applicants who are seeking a long-term career in office administration. <br/><br/> The position is a new role within ISL’s Calgary office and we envision the successful candidate will be a self-starter who helps refine and expand their role with time, including by observing and working with the team so that you come to anticipate and address their organization needs in advance. By taking on these administrative tasks, the success of this role will be demonstrated in measurably freeing up the time of our management team to focus on project-related and strategic priorities. The role will be well suited to applicants who are passionate and driven to grow their administrative career in an industry-leading organization. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Responsibilities may include:</u></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Preparation of meeting minutes</li> <li>Maintain a project database for use in revenue and resource workload projections</li> <li>Maintain and develop project checklists</li> <li>Maintain lists for client contacts, events and sales pipeline opportunities</li> <li>Maintain lists for staff events, training courses and conferences</li></ul>   <ul>  	<li>Arrange registration and travel for events, training courses and conferences</li> <li>Maintain a team experience and project database for use with preparation of proposals</li> <li>Assistance with preparation of proposals</li> <li>Assistance with technical writing, proof reading and checking final reports</li> <li>Production of technical reports, drawing packages, or other documents</li> <li>Quality assurance checks of drawings, reports and documents (for appearance / aesthetics, nomenclature, spelling, and annotation)</li> <li>Assist in the implementation and ongoing maintenance of SharePoint sites for projects or teams</li> <li>Preparation of client transmittals and communications</li> <li>Digital and hard-copy filing</li> <li>Organize and assist in the implementation of project-specific digital filing systems</li> <li>Transcribing and summarizing public engagement feedback or similar information</li> <li>Preparation of formal agreement documents</li> <li>Maintain a compiled list of Professional Services and Sub-consultant Agreements</li> <li>Assistance with project accounting and invoicing</li> <li>Organize meetings including room management, booking, catering, etc.</li> <li>Working proactively with the general office administration team to coordinate tasks or obtain assistance in their areas of responsibility</li> <li>In future, potentially assisting with recruitment and training of other Project Administrators to support other office disciplines</li> </ul>  <strong><u>Requirements:</u></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Minimum 3-5 years of office experience</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written English communication skills</li> <li>High level of attention to detail</li> <li>Demonstrated strong work ethic and commitment to quality and support of process improvement</li> <li>Self-motivated and proactive administrator who seeks to understand the needs of the team with time, and to proactively learn, anticipate and address organization needs in advance</li> <li>Expert knowledge of Microsoft Word including templates</li> <li>Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel including filters, formulas and pivot tables</li> <li>Strong time management and organizational skills, with demonstrated ability for self-management of multiple simultaneous priorities or deadlines</li> <li>Ability to read and interpret instructions, identify problems or missing information and address them proactively</li> <li>Creative problem solver who works in a professional and ethical manner</li> </ul>  <strong><u>Qualities Considered an Asset:</u></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Prior experience in the civil engineering consulting industry</li> <li>Formal education / diploma in office administration or management</li> <li>Accounting experience (invoicing, budgets, etc.)</li> <li>Experience using other Microsoft Office products (Outlook, PowerPoint, Project, OneNote)</li> <li>Experience using PDF software for combining files, adding bookmarks, and completing markups</li> <li>Experience using SharePoint or other document management software</li> </ul> <strong>Want to find out more about this or other ISL career opportunities?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Visit us online at www.islengineering.com</strong> <br/><br/> Department: Transportation <br/> This is a permanent full time position
