Title: Market Mall Team Lead
Job_Description: Job Description: <br/><br/> The Team Lead is responsible for supporting the management team in all aspects of the shop in order to maximize sales and profitability through exceptional customer service.<br/> <div> To be committed to maintaining high professional standards in the areas of sales performance, customer service, support with visual presentation, inventory management, and shop operations. The Team Lead will demonstrate and uphold the commitment and vision of The Body Shop.</div>  <br/><strong>Key Job Accountabilities:</strong> <ul>  <li>Assist the Shop Manager and Assistant Manager to achieve shop sales targets in conjunction with the achievement of individual sales goals established by The Body Shop</li> <li>To be fully engaged in driving all sales and new product launches within the shop</li> <li>To be an Ambassador of the “FIT and Focus on the Customer” program leading by example, offering in-the-moment coaching to team members and ensuring the program is consistently being utilized on the shop floor</li> <li>Adhere to all Company Policies and Procedures as per The Body Shop Employee Handbook, Shop Operations Manuals, Body Talk and advise the Shop / Assistant Shop Manager if violations occur</li> <li>Perform opening and closing procedures for the store as per The Body Shop’s operational standards including the completion of all audit documentation</li> <li>Effectively execute visual merchandising directives (product launches), utilizing all directives provided</li> <li>To exemplify The Body Shop grooming guidelines and support the store team to reflect the brand image</li> <li>Responsible for maintaining the ethical standards of The Body Shop including minimizing the environmental, health and safety risks in the workplace. Report potential risks, near misses and real accidents to relevant managers and Body Talk</li> <li>Adhere to all Health and Safety and Loss/Profit Prevention policies and procedures to ensure the safety of customers and all colleagues</li> <li>Maintain the shop to the highest standards of cleanliness and hygiene</li> <li>The Team Lead will demonstrate and uphold the commitment and vision of the Company.</li>  </ul> <strong>Other :</strong> <ul> <li><div> Maintain regular attendance and punctuality for all scheduled shifts</div></li><li><div>To undertake any other duties as and when directed by store management</div></li> </ul> <strong>Working Relationships</strong> <br/><br/> The Body Shop Employees / Customers <br/><br/> <strong>Experience:</strong> <ul>  <li>Previous sales experience working in a customer service/ retail environment is preferred</li> <li>Experience in a customer service environment working with both sales and service targets</li> <li>Working knowledge of shop operation processes</li> <li>Highly resourceful, flexible and have the proven ability to solve problems in a timely manner</li> <li>Ability to work flexible hours, including holidays, nights and weekends to meet the needs of the business</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li><div> Basic computer skills</div> </li><li><div>High School Diploma or GED (preferred)</div> </li> </ul> <strong>The Body Shop International plc is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.</strong> <strong>Should you require any accommodation in the interview process, please notify human resources or the interviewer.</strong> <br/><br/> Apply

Title: Project Director - Civil & Infrastructure
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/>   <div> <div><strong>05/01/2018</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>001750</strong> </div> <br/><strong>Pomerleau</strong> is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder. <br/><br/> Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do. <br/><br/> <strong>The Opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> Lead the way and imagine the possibilities as a Project Director with Pomerleau. Influence organizational growth by building strong and knowledgeable teams, giving strength to innovative ideas and developing trusting, company-wide relationships. <br/><br/> Using your proven experience and leadership capabilities, you embrace your role as mentor and advisor to your motivated and resourceful team. Empowering them with your expertise and guidance, they will soon match your confidence and drive for excellence. <br/><br/> With your solution focused and team oriented attitude, you will pave the way in project management and delivery while developing new and existing client relationships in your consistently increasing market. You embrace the role of being a trusted leader for our team and steadfast advisor for our clients, ensuring every Pomerleau project is executed and completed successfully. <br/><br/> Success is in the details and the core of what you do. As a Project Director, you are a born leader keeping project goals, execution, people and communication always top of mind. As a key member of our team, we will <strong>rethink construction together</strong>, <strong>from idea to completion</strong>. <strong>Everywhere</strong>. <strong>All the time</strong>. <strong>Period</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>What YOU Will Do</strong>  <ul> <li>Inspire your teams to strive for excellence by leading by example, encouraging professional development and showing confidence and encouragement in their abilities.</li> <li>Provide constructive advice and feedback to Project Managers and Project Coordinators to aid their growth and organizational development.</li> <li>Utilize your experience in trade partner selection and coordination of their activities.</li> <li>Direct all projects for your division, offering advice and support to Project Delivery Teams, while staying ahead of the game with schedules and budgets.</li> <li>Develop and maintain strong relationships with trade partners, consultants and clients to achieve project goals and vision.</li> <li>Encourage efficiency and proactiveness by coaching your team to tackle problems head on and turn technical nightmares into profitable successes. .</li> <li>Make the impossible possible. Demonstrate effective negotiation skills that provide positive outcomes for all parties while prioritizing project goals.</li> <li>In collaboration with our dedicated HS&E team, actively promote and sustain our leading HSE program. Effectively apply requirements of project specific safety standards to promote applicable OH&S acts, regulations and codes with all employees and trade partners on our projects.</li> <li>Use your attention to detail and methodical approach to ensure compliance with our first-class Quality program.</li> <li>Share your financial management experience to help Project Managers plan, manage and respect project budgets, costs and associated purchasing.</li> <li>Encourage open lines of communication regarding project status and updates;</li> <li>Be an expert in risk management to ensure any associated project risk is minimized;</li> <li>Celebrate project success and completion and be a key member of the project wrap-up process.</li> </ul> <strong>What YOU Will Bring</strong>  <ul> <li>10+ years’ experience in the construction industry;</li> <li>Previous civil construction experience specifically building bridges, tunnels, roads and infrastructure.</li> <li>University Degree/Technology Diploma in Engineering, or a combination of education and industry experience;</li> <li>A proven track record of project success and team leadership;</li> <li>Outstanding communication and organizational skills with the ability to effectively influence others and successfully resolve a variety of client, project and technical issues to bring the project to successful completion;</li> <li>Strong knowledge of construction and project methodologies, financial management, as well as building codes and associated legislation;</li> <li>A passion to develop teams and for organizational growth and success.</li> <li>Good computer skills and previous experience with scheduling software;</li> <li>Knowledge of the Alberta construction market.</li> </ul> <strong>WHY JOIN POMERLEAU`S TEAM? :</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary</li> <li>4 weeks’ vacation</li> <li>Group insurance (health spending account)</li> <li>Group RRSP</li> <li>Monthly public transit pass paid by employer</li> <li>Fitness center membership: 50% reimbursed by employer</li> <li>Employee assistance program</li> <li>Ongoing training offered throughout the year</li> <li>Young, dynamic environment</li> <li>Excellent career opportunities</li> <li>Summer hours</li> </ul> <strong>PARTICULARITY:</strong>  <ul> <li>The retained candidate will be subject to an administrative security check</li> </ul> At Pomerleau, we focus on results-oriented, passionate and rigorous people who participate in ambitious and complex projects. You have the profile we are looking for? Apply now to be part of our team. <br/><br/> Only retained candidates will be contacted. We may consider your CV for other positions. <br/><br/> Pomerleau is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive working environment where all employees are treated fairly.</div>  <br/>

Title: Project Administrator
Job_Description: <div>WESCO International, Inc. (NYSE : WCC) est une société de portefeuille Fortune 500 cotée en bourse, dont le siège social est situé à Pittsburgh, en Pennsylvanie. Elle est un fournisseur de premier plan de produits électriques, de produits de construction, de produits de maintenance, de réparation et d’exploitation (MRO) et d’équipementier, de services de gestion de chaîne d’approvisionnement et de services logistiques. Les ventes annuelles de 2016 étaient d’environ 7,3 milliards de dollars. La société emploie environ 9 000 personnes, entretient des relations avec plus de 25 000 fournisseurs et compte plus de 80 000 clients actifs à travers le monde. Les clients comprennent des entreprises commerciales et industrielles, des entrepreneurs, des organismes gouvernementaux, des institutions, des fournisseurs de télécommunications et des services publics. WESCO exploite neuf centres de distribution entièrement automatisés et environ 500 agences de services complets en Amérique du Nord et sur les marchés internationaux, offrant une présence locale à ses clients et un réseau mondial desservant des entreprises à emplacements multiples et des multinationales. <br/><br/> WESCO International, Inc. (NYSE: WCC), a publicly traded Fortune 500 holding company headquartered in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, is a leading provider of electrical, industrial, and communications maintenance, repair and operating (MRO) and original equipment manufacturers (OEM) products, construction materials, and advanced supply chain management and logistic services. 2016 annual sales were approximately $7.3 billion. The company employs approximately 9,000 people, maintains relationships with over 25,000 suppliers, and serves approximately 75,000 active customers worldwide. Customers include commercial and industrial businesses, contractors, government agencies, institutions, telecommunications providers, and utilities. WESCO operates nine fully automated distribution centers and approximately 500 full-service branches in North America and international markets, providing a local presence for customers and a global network to serve multi-location businesses and multi-national corporations.</div><div> Brief Description</div> <div>L'administrateur de projet est responsable de la gestion des opérations quotidiennes en ce qui a trait aux projets assignés. <br/><br/> The Project Administrator is responsible for handling the day to day operations for assigned projects.</div> <div> Detailed Description</div> <div>· Assurer l'administration de projet pour les projets assignés à l'intérieur de l'entreprise. <br/><br/> · Offrir un soutien aux exécutions courantes et la supervision des projets. <br/><br/> · Instaurer des objectifs pour les projets qui correspondent aux besoins de l'entreprise. <br/><br/> · Coordonner les exigences techniques associées au projet avec les clients internes et les clients externes. <br/><br/> · Développer les coûts, les prix et planifier les données des projets. <br/><br/> · Faire en sorte que les projets soient instaurés et menés à terme. <br/><br/> Effectuer la liaison avec le personnel et les directeurs de services compétents lors de la réalisation du projet, le cas échéant. <br/><br/> · Provide project administration on assigned projects within the company. <br/><br/> · Support day-to-day implementation and direction for projects. <br/><br/> · Implement project requirements consistent with business needs. <br/><br/> · Coordinate project-related technical requirements with internal and external customers. <br/><br/> · Develop cost, pricing, and schedule data for projects. <br/><br/> · Insure implementation and completion of projects. <br/><br/> · Liaison with appropriate personnel and department managers as appropriate when performing project activities. <br/><br/> Performs other duties as required</div> <div> Job Requirements</div> <div><STRONG>EXPÉRIENCE</STRONG> <br/><br/> Expérience de travail directe en gestion de projet, y compris dans tous les aspects de l'élaboration et de l'exécution de projet. - 2 <STRONG>Exigée</STRONG> <br/><br/> <STRONG>EXIGENCES ET APTITUDES</STRONG> <br/><br/> Solides aptitudes à la résolution de problèmes et capacité d'analyser les processus du travail pour les clients internes et les clients externes. <br/><br/> Apte à mener des recherches sur les questions et les produits liés au projet. <br/><br/> Capacité à fixer des priorités et d'exécuter des tâches efficacement. <br/><br/> Excellente aptitude à la communication orale et écrite. <br/><br/> Solides connaissances en informatique. <br/><br/> <STRONG><U>Environnement de travail</U></STRONG> <br/><br/> <strong>Travail de bureau</strong> – En général, le travail s'effectue dans un bureau doté de l'équipement standard. L'éclairage et la température sont adéquats, et il n'y a aucun danger ni aucune condition désagréable comme le bruit, la poussière, etc. <br/><br/> <STRONG><U>exigences liées à la condition physique</U></STRONG> <br/><br/> Le travail est habituellement sédentaire, mais peut exiger de se tenir debout ou de marcher pour une période allant jusqu'à 10 % du temps. <br/><br/> <STRONG><U>exigences mentales</U></STRONG> <br/><br/> L'employé doit organiser et coordonner des emplois du temps. <br/><br/> L'employé doit analyser et interpréter des données complexes. <br/><br/> L'employé doit faire de la résolution de problèmes. <br/><br/> L'employé doit communiquer avec le public. <br/><br/> L'employé doit gérer d'autres employés. <br/><br/> <STRONG><U>REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES</U> </STRONG> <br/><br/> · Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze workflow/processes to support internal and external customers <br/><br/> · Adept at conducting research into project-related issues and products <br/><br/> · Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks <br/><br/> · Strong written and verbal communication skills <br/><br/> · Strong computer skills <br/><br/> <strong><U>EXPERIENCE</U></strong> <br/><br/> 2 - 3 years direct work experience in a project management capacity, including all aspects of project development and execution</div> <div> Additional Details</div> <div>For WESCO locations in Canada, we offer a competitive compensation and flexible benefit plan, pension plan, educational assistance plan and more. Please note, in the recruitment process accommodations for applicants with disabilities are available upon request. <br/><br/> WESCO values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.</div> <div>Press "Apply Now" below.</div> <div> Currency CAD</div> <div> Country Canada</div> <div> Canada</div>

Title: Sr. Implementation Consultant
Job_Description: The Sr. Implementation Consultant will be the accounting lead role responsible for translating accounting business requirements into designs. Role would be responsible for configuration and testing of the accounting functions along with supporting users through training and testing. Would be responsible for leading up to 3 consultants. <br/><br/> Requirements: <ul>  <li>5 years in services delivery role with experience leading oil and gas software implementations</li> <li>Oil and Gas accounting experience, preferably in midstream and transportation</li> <li>Experience working in a flexible fast-paced high performance company</li> <li>Proven communication and organizational skills</li> <li>Strong people and relationship building skills</li> <li>Proven track record of operating with strong ethical standards</li> <li>Aptitude for problem solving and collaboration; excels at working in a team environment</li> <li>Track record of developing and delivering on goals and objectives</li> <li>Track record of mentoring and developing staff</li> <li>Drive consistency in delivery of software solutions</li> <li>Ability to manage a small team of resources, including managing and tracking to budgets and timelines</li> <li>Ensure that customers are satisfied and that the requirements are being met</li> <li>Build trust based relationships with customer project team and business personnel</li>  </ul> Technical / Functional Skills Preferred: <ul>  <li>Experience working with NGL marketing platforms (Allegro, RightAngle, Entero, etc.)</li> <li>Experience implementing or integrating with SAP Financial Accounting (FI)</li> <li>Experience with Full Absorption Product Costing: identifying variables and fixed costs, supporting invoice statement generation, automated journal entry creations, bookkeeping, chart of accounts management, and product inventory management</li> <li>Experience delivering projects leveraging multiple methodologies with an emphasis on execution of projects leveraging Agile techniques</li> <li>Experience working in Cloud/SaaS project delivery model</li> <li>Strong Microsoft SQL skills and experience working with a variety of reporting and business intelligence tools</li> <li>Relevant professional certificate (CPA, PMP, etc.)</li>  </ul>

Title: Project Engineer
Job_Description: <div> Our Facilities Engineering group works on a wide range of diverse, cutting edge oil and gas projects; from a small well tie-in to a large multi-million dollar SAGD facility. <br/><br/> Due to the tremendous growth of our Facilities Engineering group we are looking for several experienced Project Engineers who are interested in working on challenging, fast-paced, and diverse projects. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manager of Project Engineering, you will be responsible for coordinating with the various internal disciplines, as well as the client to ensure the successful completion of the project. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>   <ul>  	<li>Client interactions and single-point technical interface;</li>  <li>Guiding and coordinating the activities of the assigned engineering and design staff;</li>  <li>Coordinating with the various internal disciplines for initiation of performing complex engineering tasks including detailed calculations as required by the project;</li>  <li>Develop the Project Design Basis Memorandum and assist in the development of execution plan, budgets and schedules</li>  <li>Preparing P&IDs and Plot Plan</li>   <li>Ensuring appropriate multi-disciplinary review of project documents; approve all technical deliverables;</li>  <li>Conducting engineering quality control to meet WSP and Client quality standards;</li>  <li>Timely project reporting.</li>  </ul>  <strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <br/><br/> Our successful candidate will hold an engineering degree. We are looking for a candidate who has experience working as a Project Engineer on Gas Plant Projects in the Oil and Gas industry; ideally you will have a minimum of 10 years’ experience in a similar role. In addition you will also have:   <ul>  	<li>Superior communication skills;</li>   <li>Proven track record of working effectively with both internal and external clients;</li>  <li>Have a proven ability to multi-task and efficiently respond to changing priorities;</li>  <li>Familiarity with CSA Z662 and ASME B31.3;</li>  <li>P.Eng designation in Alberta.</li> </ul>  <div> Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits). <br/><br/> To learn more about our firm and the projects we have been involved in, please visit our <strong> World of Possibilities</strong> microsite. <br/><br/> <em><strong>WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</strong></em> <br/><br/> <em><strong>WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.</strong></em> <br/><br/> <em><strong>WSP Canada Inc.</strong></em></div> </div> </div><div></div>

Title: Senior Project Engineer
Job_Description: Compression & ProcessCalgary, AB<br/><br/>Startec Refrigeration Compression & Process Solutions is a thriving privately owned company headquartered in Calgary that produces custom mission critical compression and refrigeration systems for a variety of industries. Startec devotes their industry leading expertise in refrigeration & compression technologies to solve their clients’ most technically challenging needs. We create reliable solutions for extreme operating conditions and provide exceptional service, which is a cornerstone of our business. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Engineer Manager the Project Engineer is responsible for all Project Engineering and Project Management required to deliver gas compression and process packages on budget and on schedule <br/><br/> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul> <li>8+ years Project Management experience preferably in the oil and gas industry</li><li>A background in plant operations or gas compression is an asset</li><li>Project Management Professional Certification (PMP or PMI)</li> <li>Knowledge of process simulation software e.g. Hysis, VMG</li> <li>Good knowledge of ASME / ANSI / API Codes, knowledge of CSA Codes, knowledge of Code requirements for overseas customers is desirable</li> <li>Efficient in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint), Strong technical, analytical and problem solving capabilities</li><li>Experience with sizing and selection for all parts and equipment of packages</li><li>Ability to work well with customers, vendors, designers and fabrication staff</li><li>Strong communication skills with a good ability to influence, negotiate and resolve conflict</li><li>Capable of working with minimal direct supervision</li>  </ul> <br/><br/><strong>JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong><br/><br/><ul> <li>Assists the Project Manager to resolve conflict as required.</li><li>Communicates clearly with various project personnel and provides technical insight for resolution of problems.</li><li>Provides guidance and technical direction to the Junior Project Engineers and Engineering Technologists.</li><li>As required by the Engineering Manager, takes responsibility for areas of the technical direction and development of the engineering department including drafting.</li><li>Ensures appropriate quality and integrity of product design, including taking responsibility for the stamping of required drawings (P&ID, Line List, PSV Table, Piping Registration, Etc.).</li><li>Acts as one of the Responsible Members for the company’s permit to practice for APEGA.</li><li>Communicates effectively between various departments.</li> <li>Completes engineering deliverables on time and on budget.</li><li>Reviews all customer specifications that are applied to the project, ensures package is as sold and as built to customer agreed specifications.</li><li>Is responsible to update the project “Scheduler” and ensures engineering deliverables are completed.</li> <li>Is responsible for understanding the proposal and the clients’ project specifications that have been accepted.</li><li>Reviews the process simulation, checks or performs all major equipment sizing – vessel- compressor, driver, separators, pumps, filters, and heat exchangers.</li><li>Performs any additional process design including simulation to determine pipe sizing, and equipment blow-down rates.</li><li>Prepares vessel datasheets, performs sketch of internals, determines nozzle size and location, supervises vessel design, ensures vessel drawings are approved and issued to meet the project requirements.</li><li>Prepares equipment datasheets (Vessels, Exchangers, Pumps, Etc.).</li><li>Prepares and issues purchase requisitions to purchasing group as required and obtains comparative pricing for equipment where agreed.</li><li>Prepares draft P&IDs, supervises designers to prepare the drawing, arranges and chairs in-house P&ID review meeting going through P&ID checklist, submits P&ID to customer and arranges for revisions</li><li>Prepares the Bill Of Material (BOM), performs detail sizing of PSVs, control valves, Instrumentations Etc. and insures material selection, electrical classification, certification requirements are met</li><li>Issues BOM to purchasing, customer, designer and arranges for revisions.</li><li>Supervises the designers during preparation of the 3D model, GA, structural drawing and spool drawings in following customer’s specific requests and customer or in-house specs.</li><li>Prepares weight estimates, selects preliminary structural beam sizes and communicates with the third party structural engineer for optimization and final approval.</li><li>Arranges and chairs in-house 3D model review meeting with designers and manufacturing staff going through the design review checklist.</li><li>Prepares control philosophy and shutdown key.</li><li>Participates in safety studies such as HAZOP’s as required.</li><li>Captures and defines the scope of project change orders and communicates them to the Project Manager.</li><li>Prepares all project operating and maintenance manuals.</li> <li>Performs project final P&ID, walkthrough and signoff off our STA-ISO-010 Manufacturing Commissioning Sheet.</li><li>Completes project “Ship Loose List” in conjunction with manufacturing.</li><li>Participates in project “Closeout”, start-up and “Lessons Learned” meetings by providing feedback to Project Managers.</li> <li>Incorporates previous projects “Lessons Learned” into the engineering of current projects.</li> <li>Provides support to the service group during equipment commissioning and start-up which can include potential trip to site.</li> <li>Prepares any other calculations and technical documentation as required.</li> <li>Supervises third party engineering providers, review and approving all such work (Torsional analysis, Fugitive Emission Study, Stress Analysis, Vibration/Pulsation Study)</li><li>Reviews, approves and issues, via Document Control, all drawings according to Startec drawing approval procedures and in following project schedule.</li><li>Reviews and approves all vendor drawings in following project schedule.</li> </ul> We offer competitive wages, training, flexibility and a dynamic and exciting work environment. <br/><br/> It is mandatory for all applicants to complete the Pro.file People Survey below when submitting their application. Please proceed using the link below: <br/><br/> <strong>http://www.profileperformancesystem.com/survey.html?SL=55094</strong> <br/><br/> We thank you for your application and interest in our organization. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Team Lead, Food Services
Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div> <div><strong>Date Posted:</strong></div>3/26/2018</div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>Location:</strong></div>Calgary</div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>Address:</strong></div>88 Canada Olympic Road S.W.</div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>City:</strong></div>Calgary</div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>Province:</strong></div>AB</div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>Country:</strong></div>Canada</div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>Category:</strong></div>Permanent Full-Time</div><br/>  <div> <div>Description</div>  <br/> <div><strong>Discover, Develop, and Excel with WinSport:</strong> <br/><br/> Working with WinSport means you will be part of creating one of the most unique winter sport institutes in the world. You will be rubbing shoulders with athletes of all levels and disciplines, and you will be working in a world-class facility that showcases exceptional services to support our guests in training and maintaining an active lifestyle. You will thrive and be supported as you discover, develop and excel in your role at WinSport. <br/><br/> <strong>What the role is all about:</strong> <br/><br/> WinSport’s Food and Beverage team provides world class services for hundreds of guests, athletes, businesses, weddings and various events. Working with the team will expose you to some of the most unique and innovative trends in the food and beverage industry. <br/><br/> As Team Lead, Food and Beverage, you will be reporting to the Manager Food and Beverage and are responsible for the front of house team. Locations include: WinSports’ Garden Café, Food Court, and Coffee Market. You, along with your team, will work together closely to ensure that operations within Food and Beverage run effectively, while providing support to the other areas of the division when required, including the kitchen. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Maintain POS database as per Food and Beverage department standards</li><li>Open and close the outlet according to standard procedures, including cash outs</li><li>Order front of the house goods (all beverages and packaged goods)</li><li>Assist in recruiting, training and scheduling team members</li> <li>Assist in conducting performance reviews and performance management of team members as per WinSport’s Team & Culture processes.</li><li>Assist in development of barista, beverage, and non-prep menus</li></ul></div> </div><br/>  <div> <div>Minimum Requirements</div>  <br/> <div><strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>1-3 years’ experience in leading team in a quick food service environment an asset</li><li>Working knowledge of OH&S standards in a food & beverage environment</li><li>Proserv certification as per AGLC</li><li>Previous experience with Profitek POS is an asset</li><li>Class 5 Alberta Driving License</li> </ul> <strong>Work Conditions:</strong> <ul> <li>Fast paced environment</li><li>Evening and weekend work required</li><li>Prolonged standing, walking, lifting, squatting, twisting and bending</li><li>Heavy lifting of up to 50lbs</li><li>Occasional work outside in a variety of weather conditions</li><li>Exposure to slippery and wet surfaces</li>  </ul> <strong>What We Can Offer You:</strong> <br/><br/> If an unforgettable experience and working alongside an amazing team weren't enough for you, this full time permanent position also includes health, dental and pension benefits. As a member of the WinSport team you also receive the added benefits of enjoying a free park passes, reciprocals at other ski resorts, food, beverage, retail and program discounts, along with access to our Performance Training Center.</div> </div> </div><br/>  <div> Apply Now</div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> <ul>  <li> <br/><br/> Back to Results</li> <br/><br/> <li>Save this Job</li> <br/><br/> <li>Refer this Job</li> </ul> </div> </div></div></div>

Title: Project Director - Infrastructure
Job_Description: Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, youll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. Youll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. <br/><br/> We rank among Canadas largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canadas 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If youre eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. <br/><br/> As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). <br/><br/> <em>As a <strong>Project Director, Water</strong> at Graham you will:</em>  <ul> <li>Establishing and managing a tendering team, which may incorporate resources from joint-venture partners, suitable for specific projects and including construction and design management professionals, estimators and schedulers, commercial managers, sub-contracted design firms, and other construction management support staff.</li> <li>Establishing and maintaining relationships with public and private sector clients, construction joint-venture partners, financing partners, and key specialist sub-contractors.</li> <li>Developing and executing tendering strategies focused on optimizing cost, schedule, Safety, Quality, and other relevant aspects of client requirements.</li> <li>Providing leadership and guidance in negotiating partnerships and teaming arrangements, developing construction and design innovations, and executing commercial procurement strategies.</li> <li>Working with the Construction Manager, Design Manager, Commercial Manager and Project Scheduler to plan the construction requirements of the project and to deliver the project on time and on budget.</li> <li>Ensure project commercial and risk management systems, including health and safety, quality, accounting, finance, insurance, legal, and communication functions are implemented effectively and are compliant with corporate procedures.</li> <li>Ensure compliance with all Federal, Provincial and local laws, particularly applicable. Occupational Health & Safety Acts / Construction Safety Act regulations and environmental requirements as they relate to the project scope of work.</li> <li>Act as a principal point of contact and project representative for the contractor or construction joint-venture to the private or public sector client.</li> <li>Manage and lead construction tendering and execution teams.</li> <li>Prepare regular reports for company executives and project steering committees detailing status of the project and recommending actions to be taken.</li> <li>Ability to lead a team in meeting difficult project timelines, provide support and supervision to staff, and successfully complete project work.</li> </ul> <em>Qualifications/Experience:</em>  <ul> <li>8+ years of progressive experience in a Manager role, responsible for large water/waste water projects at least 200 million dollars in value</li> <li>Must have experience working in a medium to large General Contractor environment</li> <li>Successful completion of a Civil Engineering degree. Completion of a MBA would be an asset</li> <li>Experience leading and executing water, waste water, renewable energy and transportation projects</li> <li>A solid track record in managing large infrastructure water projects</li> <li>Excellent communication skills, the ability to build respect at the job level, possess executive presence with strong relationship building and business development skills</li> <li>Strong management skills, with an in-depth knowledge of restructuring and change management</li> <li>Advanced understanding of large project operational and financial risk management practice</li> </ul> <em>Compensation and Benefits:</em>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary with annual bonus potential</li> <li>Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan.</li> <li>Ownership and long term equity opportunities</li> </ul> <em>What we can offer you:</em>  <ul> <li>Strong commitment to safety in the workplace</li> <li>Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector</li> <li>Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America</li>  </ul> Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Title: Team Lead, Ski & Snowboard School
Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div><div>Date Posted:</div>  4/25/2018 </div> <div><div>Job Code:</div>  126 </div>    <div><div>Location:</div> Calgary </div>    <div><div>Address:</div> 88 Canada Olympic Road S.W. </div>    <div><div>City:</div> Calgary </div>  <div><div>Province:</div> AB </div>  <div><div>Country:</div> Canada </div>  <div><div>Category:</div> Temporary </div>                        <div>     <div>Description </div> <div>  <p><strong>Discover, Develop and Excel with WinSport:</strong></p><p>Working with WinSport means you will be part of creating one of the most unique winter sport institutes in the world. You will be overseeing day-to-day operations of our Outdoor Programs and contributing to the supervision of the team. You will be working in a world-class facility that showcases world-class services to support our customers in training and maintaining an active lifestyle. You will thrive and be supported to provide excellence in leadership and customer service for all guests.</p><p> </p><p><strong>What the role is about: </strong></p><p>Reporting to the Program Manager, Ski and Snowboard School, you will be responsible for providing students and guests with a premium experience through the implementation of on hill program preparation and delivery. You will assist the Manager in managing, scheduling and delivering training to Ski & Snowboard Instructors. <br> </p><p> </p><p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Provide excellent customer service by conducting call backs and responding to emails in a timely fashion.</li><li>Track inventory of equipment, progress cards, class cards and distribute accordingly.</li><li>Assist with set up of lessons and help customers with check in process.</li><li>Act as first point of contact for Instructors. </li><li>Accurately keep track of Instructor shifts by timekeeping and managing instructor’s hours in a timely manner.</li><li>Implement training and development to instructors.</li><li>Create schedule and ensure it is fair, accurate and is distributed in a timely fashion.</li><li>Provide feedback to instructors throughout the season and act as a mentor/role model to the team. </li><li>Organize and assign classes to instructors for all assigned programs. Work with the Manager to ensure quality control in the delivery of all lessons.</li><li>Liaise with the Manager and Guest Services to provide consistent product delivery and premium guest experience. This includes indoor pre-program preparation to facilitate quick, efficient organization of classes on the snow.</li><li>Maintain accurate documentation of programs, students and instructors.</li><li>Responsible for in-depth product knowledge and understanding of all Ski & Snowboard programs as well as all WinSport products, policies and procedures</li><li>Assist with enforcement of Ski & Snowboard School and WinSport rules and regulations. Be especially vigilant in ensuring that all staff, hill users and other guests adheres to Duty of Care policies and the Alpine Responsibility Code</li><li>Act as an ambassador for the Snow School and WinSport</li><li>Ensure safety orientation is completed with all new or returning employees covering all the required safety hazards and specific safety training for specific areas</li><li>Other duties as required</li></ul> </div>     </div>                          <div>     <div>Minimum Requirements </div> <div>  <p><strong>Qualifications: </strong></p><ul><li>1- 3 years of leadership experience in a related or other fields</li><li>3-5 years of working with youth and adult programs</li><li>Standard First Aid and CPR “C”.</li><li>Experience dealing with a large team made up of various cultures and demographics is considered an asset.</li><li>Strong Leadership skills are required</li><li>Must be CSIA, CASI or foreign equivalent certified and up to date.</li><li>Excellent communication and organizational skills</li><li>Organization, multi tasking and prioritizing skills are essential</li><li>Demonstrate and apply leadership skills and excellent customer service</li><li>Previous conflict resolution experience is an asset</li><li>Strong decision making skills are essential. </li><li>Strong pedagogy and mentoring skills are essential</li><li>Good understanding of Ski/Snowboard industry is considered an asset. </li><li>Knowledge of Microsoft programs such as Word, and Excel is an asset.</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>Physical Demands:</strong></p><ul><li>Seasonal, winter position</li><li>Dynamic working environment</li><li>Activities will concentrate primarily outdoors. Some indoor activities and preparation is required</li><li>Must act as an example and role model to all Snow Academy instructors and other Canada Olympic Park team members</li><li>Must be able to lift, carry, push or pull objects up to 20lb occasionally.</li><li>Be prepared to work in all weather conditions</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>What's in it for you?:</strong></p><p>If an unforgettable experience and working alongside an amazing team weren't enough for you, WinSport offers its seasonal employees some really great perks; free hill passes, reciprocals at other resorts, food, beverage and retail discounts, and a gym membership at our BNTC, just to name a few things that will make you love it here.</p> </div>     </div>          </div>      <p>    </p>     <div>            Apply Now              </div>  </div>       <div>  <div>    <ul>    <li>              Back to Results          </li>             <li>Save this Job</li>                 <li>Refer this Job</li>                      </ul>      <div></div></div></div></div></div>

Title: Team Lead, Production Engineering
Job_Description: With over 300 employees, we are committed to professional development to build upon the strengths of the team. At Progress we encourage initiative and career growth, and offer a positive, dynamic and challenging working environment. With a competitive total compensation package and a track record of success, Progress seeks the brightest and most talented professionals in their area of expertise to join our team to meaningfully contribute to the ongoing success of our company. <br/><br/> <u><strong><strong>The Role</strong></strong></u><br/><br/>Progress Energy currently has a vacancy for a Team Lead, Production Engineering to join our team in Calgary. Reporting to the Manager, Production Engineering, the successful candidate will lead the team activities, ensuring the effective execution of tasks and activities, coordinating and allocating resources, establishing team operational priorities and resolving issues. The incumbent will lead the assigned area of production engineering team activities, providing operational and technical expertise and direction to ensure quality results within designated deadlines, due diligence and compliance with codes, standards and regulations.<br/><br/><u><strong><strong>Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities</strong></strong></u> <ul> <li>Coordinate day-to-day operational activities of the team by assigning and managing work/workloads, reviewing results/outputs, monitoring work quality and adherence to technical/professional principles, department policies, practices and protocols and provides input into training and development opportunities for team members</li><li>Provide subject matter expertise to internal/external stakeholders, managing complex tasks and activities, providing feedback and technical guidance, and identifying opportunities to influence outcomes</li><li>Identify opportunities to improve engineering practices/processes by monitoring industry best practices and emerging trends, conducting research and analyses, and presenting recommendations for management approval</li><li>Lead department/process improvement projects and initiatives. Responsible for preparing proposals and business cases, developing project scope and objectives, managing deliverables, timelines, resources and related budgets, resolving issues and preparing and presenting status/progress reports</li><li>Manage area budgets and reporting activities by identifying budget requirements, preparing forecasts and projections, explaining variances, and reviewing AFE/project expenditures within budget</li><li>Lead the design and development of pipelines and production facilities to bring on new wells in a timely and cost efficient manner, partnering with other functional areas on design elements and workplan budget development, preparing production forecasts and determining production optimization/market pricing strategies and tactics to optimize results</li><li>Monitor production engineering key performance indicators and operating expenditures to manage production target achievement, reviewing and analyzing production data and results, and preparing regular performance variance reports for senior management review</li><li>Lead regulatory compliance activities, ensuring well/ wellbore services, tests and status are in compliance with regulatory codes and standards, facilitating on-site inspections, reviewing results and activities, investigating areas of non-compliance and providing recommendations on tactics to address/correct issues</li><li>Provide technical expertise and guidance to resolve field/on-site issues, providing solutions to maximize production and minimize operating costs.</li><li>Manage relationships with internal stakeholders to review production plans, data and results, coordinate initiative execution, collaborate on issue resolution, and identify opportunities to influence outcomes</li> </ul> <u><strong><strong>Required Education, Experience and Skills</strong></strong></u> <ul> <li>Completion of an Engineering degree, within the Petroleum, Mechanical or Chemical discipline</li><li>Hold a current P. Eng designation</li> <li>Minimum 10+ years of progressively more responsible experience within the oil and gas industry with direct exposure to natural gas</li> <li>Exposure to BC operations, Oil & Gas Commission (OGC) regulations and field experience would be an asset</li><li>Experience with coaching and mentoring junior staff</li> <li>The ability to develop strong working relationships with all levels of individuals</li><li>Able to prioritize work, multi-task and adapt to changing priorities in a fast paced, high volume team environment</li><li>Demonstrated initiative in recognizing opportunities for improvement and efficiency</li><li>Excellent communication and team leadership skills</li><li>Total commitment to a safety first attitude</li><li>Valid safety training such as; Standard First Aid, H2S Alive, TDG, WHMIS</li><li>Valid Class 5 driver’s license</li> </ul>

Title: Project Engineer (Process/Mechanical)
Job_Description: A thriving energy industry is critical to a healthy economy for Alberta and Canada. Breakthroughs in technology can drastically reduce the environmental footprint, greenhouse gas emissions and overall performance of this important industry. <br/><br/> Exergy is expanding it's capability to study design alternatives to tackle some of the oil sands biggest challenges. We are a dynamic and disruptive group ready make a positive change to our industry. If you love to invent, build and tinker this is the place for you! <br/><br/> We are looking for an individual who can help grow Exergy's business in the area of research, innovation and FEED stage project development. This is an opportunity to work with a highly creative team and make a real impact. This role requires a multi-talented individual with the capability to perform hands-on work to construct machines in our operating additive manufacturing and process automation lab. The individual must be open-minded to try new approaches to problem solving and expand their knowledge and experience in a broad range of disciplines. <br/><br/> <strong>Area of duties and responsibilities but not limited to;</strong> <ul>  <li>Bring creative engineering solutions to Exergy's customers</li> <li>Meeting with clients and prospects to represent the Exergy brand</li> <li>Direct responsibility for coordination of the design and drafting team</li> <li>Confident and knowledgeable to carry out all process/mechanical engineering functions</li> <li>Equipment selection, sizing and vendor selection</li> <li>PFD, material balance and P&ID design development</li>  <li>Responsible for construction and operation of lab apparatus with assistance from co-workers</li> <li>Field work for P&ID verification and pilot plant activity ( <li>Project management budgeting, planning and scheduling</li>  <li>Approval of timesheets and resource planning</li> <li>Mentor and guide more junior team members</li> <li>Establish the companies engineering and design practices</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul>  <li>10+ years experience in process or mechanical engineering</li> <li>Degree / diploma from an accredited design institution</li> <li>Understanding and experience with Oil Sands extraction and tailings would be an asset</li> <li>Knowledge in mineral processing, setting and particle separation is an asset</li> <li>Overall understanding of project development or some project engineering experience</li> <li>Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint, Word</li> <li>Experience with AutoCAD, Solidworks, Fusion 360 is preferred</li> <li>Understanding of popular process simulation software such as Hysys and VMG would be an asset</li> <li>WHMIS and H2S Alive required (Training can be provided)</li> <li>Must be a member of APEGA with P.Eng.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> We offer a comprehensive employer paid benefits program <br/><br/> <strong>**Online applications accepted only. Please do not contact us by phone.</strong>

and tear down of events</li> <li>Responsible for all Inventory within the Catering Department including liquor control and storage</li><li>Responsible for training new employees on policies, procedures and day to day catering tasks</li><li>Maintains a high level of employee engagement to keep employee turnover at a low</li><li>Ensures all original Catering sheets are filled out properly by all staff and brought back to the office for invoicing</li><li>Ensures that all related food and beverage outlets are constantly maintained in a neat, clean and orderly fashion and that all equipment is in good working condition</li><li>Ensures the rooms are stocked weekly with the appropriate levels of all liquor, pop and supplies and assists with restock of other venues</li><li>Ensures that WinSport’s high standards of service are consistently met for each function held at the Park and that all guests are served pleasantly, efficiently, and professionally</li><li>In charge of catering van maintenance, i.e., oil, tune ups, filling with gas, keeping it clean, windshield wiper fluid</li><li>Checks the building’s exterior along with interior constantly for maintenance and communicates to Catering Manager on things that need to be fixed</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div> <div>Minimum Requirements</div>  <br/> <div><strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>2 years of supervisory or management experience in the food and beverage and/or event industry is required.</li><li>Strong organizational skills</li><li>Knowledge and ability to effectively direct employees, assign work, appraise and manage performance, and recommend any necessary changes</li><li>A proven history of engaging employees while achieving the goals and objectives of the department</li><li>Post-secondary training in the Food & Beverage or Event field is an asset</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>Work Conditions:</strong> <ul> <li>Flexible schedule with the ability to work evenings, nights and weekends when required</li><li>Must be able to push, pull, lift or carry up to 50 lbs. frequently</li><li>Must be able to stand and walk for extended periods of time</li><li>Must be able to work long hours at a computer</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>What We Can Offer You:</strong> <br/><br/> If an unforgettable experience and working alongside an amazing team weren't enough for you, WinSport offers its team members some really great perks; free hill passes, reciprocals at other resorts, food, beverage and retail discounts, and a gym membership, just Title: Senior Manager – Risk (Internal Audit)
Job_Description: <DIV>EY's people in more than 150 countries are committed to operating with integrity, quality and professionalism in the provision of audit, advisory, tax and transaction advisory services. We strive to help all of our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone's contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth, and provides continuous opportunities for development. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Our Internal Audit (Risk) practice, a specialty group within Advisory Services, provides comprehensive advisory services through a suite of strategic, outsourcing, and industry-focused operational services to clients. These services help companies around the world evaluate and enhance their internal control and risk management functions including internal audit, as well as their key business processes. Our Advisory practice seeks a consummate team player with a strong work ethic and excellent consulting skills for the role of Senior Manager in Calgary. This professional will plan, lead and perform advisory engagements as a member of the management team and in accordance with the client's plan, risk management strategy and EY's methodologies.</DIV><B> <P><BR> </P></B> <DIV><B>Responsibilities</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Work with high-growth clients and other market leaders in industries such as Oil and Gas, retail, consumer products and Government Public Sector.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Establish objectives and scope of work; establish the engagement budget; and take responsibility for the overall execution of the project through wrap-up and final report delivery, in compliance with EY quality requirements.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Lead internal audit engagements and risk assessments.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Manage and oversee Sarbanes Oxley (SOX) audit procedures of a complex nature, including establishing a top down risk based approach, and the proper nature, timing, and extent of procedures, and planning and coordinating SOX activities related to internal controls documentation and testing</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Maintain a strong client focus by effectively serving client needs and developing productive working relationships with client personnel.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Stay abreast of current business and economic developments and new pronouncements/standards relevant to the client's business.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Display teamwork, integrity and leadership.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Work with team members to set goals and responsibilities for specific engagements.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Foster teamwork and innovation.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Utilize technology and tools to continually learn and innovate, share knowledge with team members and enhance service delivery.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Understand EY and its service lines.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Actively encourage team members to contribute ideas and identify potential opportunities to apply EY's services.</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV>To qualify for this challenging and rewarding opportunity, candidates must have:</DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>a bachelor's degree in accounting, finance or a business-related field</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>a minimum of 8 years of related business experience in internal control and internal audit experience</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Solid experience in Internal Controls over Financial Reporting (ICFR), including SOX, Bill 198, COSO 2013 and integrated audit</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience in internal audit and good knowledge of IIA Standards required</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience in enterprise risk management (ERM), data analytics and continuous control monitoring (CCM) and GRC considered an asset</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>CIA or CPA certification required</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>willingness to travel throughout Canada and the United States</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>demonstrated consistency in values, principles, and work ethic</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>strong skills in project management and engagement management</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>strong skills in leading a team of diverse employees </DIV></LI></UL> <DIV><B>EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.</B></DIV>

Title: Senior Manager - Restructuring and Turnaround
Job_Description: KPMG Restructuring & Turnaround offers a comprehensive range of restructuring and turnaround services. We provide guidance on financial restructuring and insolvency matters for companies facing adverse conditions, as well as bondholders, creditors' committees, single creditor classes and secured creditors. Our direction and leadership are provided with a view to achieving lasting operational and performance improvement. KPMG also acts in a fiduciary capacity in formal insolvency proceedings including receiverships, CCAA and bankruptcy proceedings. Our service team also includes turnaround work and interim management roles. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Position Summary</STRONG> <br/><br/> We are seeking a strong professional at the <STRONG>Senior Manager</STRONG> level to join our Calgary team. <br/><br/> Working in multi-disciplinary teams, you will apply your professional and technical skills on a wide variety of transactions and at different stages of the transaction process. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Role and Responsibilities</STRONG> <ul> <LI>Conduct financial analysis (including development of complex financial models) of companies in a variety of industries, including review of operations and cash flow.</LI> <LI>Participate in independent business reviews and assist in restructuring/refinancing of underperforming companies.</LI> <LI>Take possession and securing of assets, including assisting in receivership activities.</LI> <LI>Assist with preparation and distribution of reports.</LI> <LI>Communicate directly with a variety of parties including clients, other advisors and stakeholders.</LI> <LI>Assist with proactive business development initiatives.</LI> <LI>Provide analytical and market research information.</LI> <LI>Educate clients on legislative and compliance issues.</LI> <LI>Use negotiation skills to identify common ground and potential solutions beneficial to all parties.</LI> <LI>Business Development and obtaining new clients</LI> <LI>Delivery of projects to clients and make sure all projects are delivered on time and to client needs</LI> </ul>  At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Employees may also need to travel for client engagements. Likewise, people need time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Skills & Qualifications</STRONG>  <ul> <LI>2-3 years of experience in restructuring and insolvency experience.</LI> <LI>1-2 years of experience at a Manager level or equivalent at a recognized professional firm.</LI> <LI>Proven ability to interpret and apply the Companies’ Creditors Arrangement Act (CCAA) and the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act (BIA).</LI> <LI>CIRP certification and Trustee License in progress.</LI> <LI>Professional designation in Accounting, CPA designation would be an asset.</LI> <LI>Ability to work collegially as part of a high-performing team.</LI> <LI>Ability to prepare detailed, functional financial models, including financial projections.</LI> <LI>Strong technical ability and a conscientious approach to assignments.</LI> <LI>Good business judgment and strong analytical skills and computer skills (particularly, modeling in Excel).</LI> <LI>A willingness to take on key responsibilities in a fast-paced intensive work environment.</LI> <LI>Demonstrated skill in managing conflicting demands and priorities.</LI>  </ul>  <strong><DIV>#LI-HH1</DIV></strong>

Title: Senior Project Engineer – Process – Engineered Systems –
Job_Description: <div><div> Senior Project Engineer – Process – Engineered Systems – Calgary SE</div><br/>  <div> <div>  <div> <strong>Openings</strong> 1</div> <div> <strong>Location Name</strong> Enerflex - Canada - Alberta - Calgary <br/> Calgary, Alberta, CA</div> <div> <strong>Operating Unit</strong> Enerflex - Canada</div> <div> <strong>Date Posted</strong> May 02, 2018</div> <div> <strong>Profession</strong> Engineering</div> <div> <strong>Experience Level</strong> Not Specified</div> <div> <strong>Job Type</strong> Permanent, Full Time</div> <div> <strong>Education Level</strong> University - Bachelors</div> <div> <strong>Job ID</strong> job-3184</div> </div><div> Position Summary</div> <div><strong>Company Profile:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex is the single source supplier for natural gas compression, oil and gas processing, refrigeration systems and electric power equipment – plus in-house engineering and mechanical services expertise. The Company’s broad in-house resources provide the capability to engineer, design, manufacture, construct, commission and service hydrocarbon handling systems. Enerflex’ s expertise encompasses field production facilities, compression and natural gas processing plants, processing plants, refrigeration systems and electric power equipment serving the natural gas production industry. Headquartered in Calgary, Canada, Enerflex has more than 2,000 employees globally and operates in over seven regions around the world. <br/><br/> Enerflex puts its Values of Integrity, Commitment, Creativity and Success into action in all aspects of business. The Company values passionate people who want to put their career into overdrive. We will help match your skills with a position that challenges you to reach new heights, rewards you for outstanding performance and allows you to grow with the Company throughout your life-long career. Join the Enerflex team and apply now. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex is looking for a <strong>Senior</strong> <strong>Project Engineer - Process</strong> to lead engineering projects in a high energy manufacturing environment. Reporting directly to the Manager, Process Engineering, this role would be in charge of designing and building large million dollar plus gas processing facilities.This individual will mentor junior engineers and work with our fabrication department to see the project come to life in our facility every day, responsible for all aspects of their team’s projects from design through to commissioning. <br/><br/> Candidate must be able to work in a customer centred team environment. Focus is on projects being accurate, complete and timely. <br/><br/> With a foundation of integrity, the candidate would use commitment and creativity to drive our organization forward. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> This role will offer the right candidate variety in their daily work life, learning opportunities and the chance to add value to our current gas processing projects. We require someone with strong communication skills, matched with sound problem solving and decision making skills. Your ability to lead by influence, mentor, be organized, establish clear objectives and monitor key measures, will enable you to deliver the results you need to be successful in this role. You must be able to work effectively within a multi-stakeholder environment and seek to be collaborative on all fronts.  <ul> <li>Design process flow and piping / instrument diagrams</li> <li>Review general arrangements and 3D model</li> <li>Ensure accuracy, completeness and timeliness on responsible projects</li> <li>Take part in HAZOP and SIL review meetings</li> <li>Implement project specifications</li> <li>Size PSV’s and control valves based on process information</li> <li>Size vessels and piping based on process information</li> <li>Complete final checks on P&ID’s Models and other project deliverables</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>10+ Years of experience with an Engineering Degree or Technical Diploma</li> <li>Professional engineer designation</li> <li>Working knowledge of gas processing and fabrication</li> <li>Experience in plant layout and how it relates to equipment design</li> <li>Experience sizing pumps, heat exchangers, Air coolers, and compressors required</li> <li>Experience in pressure vessel and piping design is required</li> <li>ASME Section VIII and B31.3 helpful but not required</li> <li>Experience sizing pressure relief valves, control valves and piping is required</li> <li>Experience with Hysis process simulation software will be considered an asset</li> </ul> <strong>What Enerflex Offers You:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive Compensation</li> <li>Employer Paid Health and Dental Benefits</li> <li>Employee Share Purchase Program</li> <li>Employer Matched Pension Program</li> <li>Vacation and Flex Days</li> <li>Safety Focused Culture</li> <li>Incentive Programs</li> <li>Professional Development Opportunities</li> </ul> <strong>Interested:</strong> Please apply online at www.enerflex.com Careers & Training → Current Openings.</div> <div> <div> Facebook <br/>  Twitter <br/>  Print <br/>  Email <br/><br/> 0Share</div>  </div><br/>  <div> Powered by <br/> Hire Ground Title: Contracts Manager –

This includes the Master Service Agreements, day to day maintenance agreements and full life cycle agreements. standard contracts require legal input</li> <li>Work closely with the Project Management Team to ensure complete understanding of the contracts and that these are priced accordingly</li> <li>Manage financial and technical obligations to ensure profitability and consistency</li> <li>Provide monthly reports of status of contracts</li> <li>Work with Project Director and Corporate Legal counsel for reviewing legality and be in-line with Core Values</li> <li>Lead the cross functional support team focused on securing and delivering profitable contract services</li> <li>Act as primary contact for outside service suppliers for contract services</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications: </strong>  <ul> <li>University degree supported by legal or contracts training with a minimum of 10 years' contracts bidding</li> <li>Good planning and organization skills, analytical and strategy skills, change management skills, open to new ideas</li> <li>Excellent oral and written communication skills, outstanding negotiation skills</li> <li>Team player and self-motivated, good people skills with customer-driven personality</li> <li>Ability to multi-task in the areas of legal issues, technical
