outside business contacts</li> <li>Ability to work under tight deadlines and work independently in fast paced work environment</li> <li>Experience in manufacturing or construction industry is an asset</li> <li>Must be detail oriented</li> <li>Demonstrated customer service expertise</li> <li>Must be proficient in Microsoft Office products. Experience with iMACS and SAP is an asset</li>  </ul> <strong>What Enerflex Offers You:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive Compensation</li> <li>Employer Paid Health and Dental Benefits</li> <li>Employee Share Purchase Program</li> <li>Employer Matched Pension Program</li> <li>Vacation and Flex Days</li> <li>Safety Focused Culture</li> <li>Incentive Programs</li> <li>Professional Development Opportunities</li> </ul> <strong>Interested:</strong> Please apply online at www.enerflex.com Careers & Training → Current Openings. <br/><br/> <strong>This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found.</strong></div> <br/> <div> <div> Facebook <br/>  Twitter <br/>  Print <br/>  Email <br/><br/> 0Share</div>  </div><br/>  <div> Powered by <br/> Hire Ground Software</div><br/>   <div> Technical Support for Applying Online</div> </div> 	</div>  <br/>

Title: Project Accountant
Job_Description: <div>CEDA is a leader in providing best in class industrial maintenance and turnaround services to our various clients worldwide. As a trusted partner, the talented and passionate people of CEDA are committed 24/7 to delivering world class service through innovative technologies, equipment and processes, safely every time. <br/><br/> We are committed to putting the right people, in the right place at the right time while offering an inclusive work environment, opportunities for development, a competitive compensation package and excellent benefits. <br/><br/> <em>If you’re ready to turn-around your career, CEDA has opportunities for you!</em></div> <div>  Position Summary</div> <div> Summary: The Project Accountant plays a key role in the organization’s finance activities and is responsible for the financial information for the region. Working closely with the Vice President, Regional Service Line Directors and Operational team, the Project Accountant establishes and maintains accounting practices and procedures, and coordinates the analysis of project results.</div> <div><div> Description</div> <div><strong>Key Duties & Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Key liaison and financial advisor to the Regional VP and staff in regards to monthly statements and job cost statements</li>  <li>Assist with, review and analyse monthly financial statements and project reports to ensure the timeliness and integrity of the Region’s financial results. Responsible for all functions of month end (and yearend) close including journal entries, reconciliations and reports</li>  <li>Contract & Project Set-up ensuring compliance to contract/billing/rates. Key role in communicating project set up and customer billing requirements to all internal stakeholders</li>  <li>Prepare analysis and reporting as requested by Directors and VP’s. This includes project reporting, margin analysis, cost reviews, revenue by customer, various others as required</li>  <li>Key role in the monthly scorecard creation, forecasts and annual budget while working closely with Operational Leaders</li>  <li>Troubleshooting field ticketing system and accounting software issues and project adjustments as needed</li>  <li>Follow up with any project billing or costing discrepancies as required</li>  <li>May manage regional finance staff</li>  <li>All other related duties as required</li> </ul> <strong>Role Specifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Business diploma or University degree in Accounting, Finance or Business</li>  <li>Attained or working towards a professional accounting designation (CA, CPA, CMA or CGA) would be considered an asset</li>  <li>3 years related experience in project accounting position</li>  <li>Knowledge of oil and gas, energy or industrial service industries</li>  <li>Exposure to a “daily field capture” system would be an asset</li>  <li>Strong computer skills – Excel, Word, Outlook</li>  <li>Financial/Project Accounting applications – ERP experience would be an asset</li> </ul>  </div> </div><div>  Career Package</div> <div>CEDA offers competitive wages, pension and benefit packages. We provide training and opportunities for advancement. In addition, CEDA is committed to maintaining a positive and safe work environment. <br/><br/> We are always recruiting qualified individuals who are career driven. Having a successful and diverse workforce is essential to meeting our current and future needs. By creating an inclusive workplace, CEDA aims to promote Indigenous recruitment and provide opportunities that are mutually beneficial to both CEDA and Indigenous peoples. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities and provide accommodations on request for these candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. <br/><br/> If you are ready to "Turn Around" your career and you meet or exceed our qualification requirements, please fill out an on-line application and forward your resume as directed on the website. Please include copies of your academic qualifications and training certificates. Incomplete applications may not be considered.</div> <div></div><br/> <div>  Are you a returning applicant?</div> <div> <strong><div>  <div>Previous Applicants:</div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <strong><div>Email:</div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <div><strong>Password:</strong></div><div> If you do not remember your password click here.</div> </div> </div><div> Back to Search Results</div><br/>  <div> New Search</div>  <br/>

Title: Manager, NGL Market Development
Job_Description: <div>Requisition Id: 15393 <br/><br/> Department: NGL Market Development Department <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> The Marketing Business Unit provides strategic direction and commercial execution in areas involving marketing, market development, new ventures/opportunities and acquisitions. In supporting the long-term strategy and vision Marketing looks across commodity value chains, optimizing capacity and margins derived therefrom, and developing and implementing plans based our commodity portfolio (natural gas, NGLs, crude oil, and associated products), using our logistics capabilities and our knowledge and understanding of the ever-changing global market dynamics. <br/><br/> Pembina’s Marketing Business Unit is searching for a Manager, NGL Market Development to join their Calgary team. The successful candidate will provide support to the business unit through identifying new market opportunities and providing economic analysis to support international project development as it relates to new growth within the business unit. <br/><br/> The primary responsibilities, deliverables and accountabilities include, but are not limited to: <br/><br/> Business Acumen/Strategy <ul> <li>Develop and maintain a five-year marketing plan for the department’s various NGL streams;</li><li>Conduct detailed financial analysis/valuation related to Pembina’s current and future business opportunities including major projects, expansions, and other corporate initiatives; and</li><li>Support market development for liquefied petroleum gas by evaluating commercial initiatives through conceptualization, economic, competitive and strategic analysis and assisting in determining the commercial terms of future arrangements.</li> </ul> Market Development <ul> <li>Lead Pembina’s international marketing initiatives including sales strategies at its Prince Rupert LPG Export Terminal and other infrastructure or market opportunities;</li><li>Evolve commercial models to support supply aggregation into Unit’s LPG capacity and markets;</li><li>Negotiate and execute short and long-term commercial agreements with marine transportation providers, infrastructure and storage operators, and international hydrocarbon buyers on a timely basis and in advance to support infrastructure development and capacity utilization;</li><li>Develop and maintain relationships with international counterparties to support Pembina’s Marketing and New Ventures Divisions; and</li><li>Support other ongoing growth initiatives and special projects as required.</li> </ul> Work Effectiveness <ul> <li>Take initiative to drive results, assembling internal and external resources, and leading business teams for delivering successful outcomes; and</li><li>Build internal relationships applicable Business and Service Units to ensure that information flows to and from the Business Unit occur in a coordinated and effective manner.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>Demonstrated business acumen, creativity and innovation as it relates to understanding of value proposition for midstream marketing infrastructure;</li><li>Track record of initiating, developing and implementing new profitable term structured business opportunities, identifying market imperfections and creating lasting competitive advantages;</li><li>Minimum of 15 years of related experience with a specific focus on LPG’s markets, commodity pricing, market egress for Canadian production, and international midstream fundamentals;</li><li>Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in one of the following: Economics, Business Administration, Finance, Engineering or Marketing. Possess or working toward advanced education (MA in Economics, MBA);</li><li>Excellent Excel, financial modeling, presentation and PowerPoint capabilities;</li><li>Outstanding interpersonal, communication and organizational skills; and</li><li>International and domestic travel will be required.</li> </ul> <strong>No agency calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. <br/><br/> Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America&apos;s energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers&apos; products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. <br/><br/> Powering Pembina&apos;s growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. <br/><br/> Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. <br/><br/> Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta&apos;s Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. <br/><br/> ></div>

Title: Project Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>Company Overview</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Do you want to work with one of Canada’s top oil and gas companies represented by an award-winning staffing agency? Look no further and join the Spirit circle today!</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> Our large oil and gas company in Calgary, AB is currently recruiting 5 Project Engineers for a 5 month contract. The shift will be Monday-Friday, 8 hrs/day. The embedded contractors will support upcoming expense/capital jobs as part of PES Staffing plan (e.g.hydrogen, Plant pressure relief, and other OpEx work.) An embedded contractor would be expected to act on the company’s behalf Engineering overseeing engineering deliverables created at engineering contractor offices. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong>  <ul> <li>Management of quality of engineering deliverable</li> <li>Management of change (MOC) for scope, cost, schedule and quality</li> <li>Support design basis development</li> <li>Stakeholder alignment and interface management</li> <li>Cost and schedule estimate support</li> <li>Develop engineering surveillance plan and liaison with SCL technical resources to ensure quality engineering deliverables from engineering contractor</li> <li>Support “cradle to grave” project engineering philosophy (PE may be required to travel to Ft Mac 3-5 days a week to provide field engineering support during construction)</li> </ul> <strong> Qualifications and Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>P.Eng registration in Alberta</li> <li>Minimum 5 years project engineering / operations technical support experience in the oil & gas industry (owner/operating experience preferred)</li> <li>Excellent communication skills</li> <li>Successfully pass a criminal background check</li> <li>This position is classified as safety sensitive, therefore you must also be able to pass a drug & alcohol test</li> <li>Possession of or eligible to obtain a passport</li> <li>Valid OSSA BSO or OSSA Orientation and CSTS</li> </ul> <strong>**We thank all applicants for applying, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted directly**</strong>

Title: Manager, Elections and Census
Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div> <div><strong>This position reports to the City Clerk, and in the capacity of elections the Returning Officer. As the Manager of Elections and Census, you will develop and lead a high performing team in delivering the election program. The election program consists of conducting an annual census, receiving and validating petitions, administering ward boundary revisions, and conducting the general municipal elections and by-elections as required on behalf of the City, The Public School Board and Calgary Separate School District. In addition to these duties you will:</strong></div><ul> <li> Lead election program innovation projects that deliver a citizen-centric program.</li>  <li> Work collaboratively with other City departments to deliver the election program.</li>  <li> Deliver the election program ensuring all legislative requirements and stakeholder expectations are met.</li>  <li> Work collaboratively with all orders of government and other Alberta municipalities.</li>  <li> Manage financial resources for the division.</li>  <li> Participate in various corporate programs including preparing and managing the Division operations and capital budgets through business and strategic planning.</li>  <li> Work with your various election program teams to ensure continuity and maintain a positive work environment.</li>  <li> Develop and promote outreach and education programs in support of the election program.</li>  <li> Report and establish performance measures related to all aspects of the election program.</li> </ul> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Qualifications</strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>A degree in a related field such as Arts, Public Administration, Law or Social Sciences and a minimum of 8 years of management experience; OR a completed 2 year certificate/diploma and a minimum of 10 years of senior management experience.</div> </li>		<li>	<div>Previous experience managing organizing and directing the operations of large (800-3000 people), high-profile, public events (such as Election) would be an asset.</div> </li>		<li>	<div>Proven successful project delivery.</div> </li>		<li>	<div>Excellent ethical standards, decision-making, judgment, analytical and communication skills.</div> </li>		<li>	<div>Equivalent combinations of experience and education may be considered.</div></li>	 </ul>  <div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Pre-employment Requirements</strong> </strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></div><div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>A security clearance will be conducted.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.</div></li>	</ul></div> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div> <div> <div>Union: Exempt</div>  <div>Business Unit: City Clerk's Office</div></div> <div> <div>Position Type: Permanent</div>  <div>Location: 1103 - 55 Avenue N.E.</div></div> <div> <div>Compensation: Level F $88,307 - 135,252 per annum</div> <div>Days of Work: This position typically works a 5 day</div> <div>work week, earning 1 day off in each 3 week cycle.</div></div> <div> <div>Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week</div></div> <div> <div>Audience: Internal/External</div> <div>Apply By: June 4, 2018</div></div> <div> <div>Job ID #: 300843</div></div> </div> <div>About our organization</div> </div> </div> </div></div>

Title: Executive Relationship Manager
Job_Description: Executive HR Relationship Manager - At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP. <br/>  <br/> Client support at ADP: It's all about enabling the clients we serve to be more effective employers. You can make it happen by collaborating with other ADP Associates to ensure our products and services deliver winning results. The expert support you provide can make our workforce solutions stand out in an increasingly competitive global marketplace. <br/>  <br/> ADP Canada is actively searching for an Executive Human Resources Relationship Manager to join our Service Team and provide expert HR Support to our Workforce Now HR clients of varying size and complexity. <br/>  <br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>This role is the primary point of accountability and is responsible for setting and managing the client expectations.</li> <li>Develops and enhances business partnerships by fully engaging and building trust with our client's key decision makers to drive client satisfaction, retention, and an overall positive client experience for the Major and National Accounts Comprehensive Services clients.</li> <li>Possesses an understanding of our clients' business objectives and requirements to proactively demonstrate and deliver increased value through the life cycle of the client.</li> <li>Proactively delivers increased value by demonstrating continuous improvement and change management best practices throughout the life cycle of the client.</li> <li>Applies industry and practitioner knowledge to understand and support our client's business objectives and strategic direction through utilization of our offering.</li> <li>Acts as a liaison between the client and ADP by serving as an empowered internal client advocate and coordinating communication among the various internal business partners including implementation, service, sales and other support teams.</li> <li>Proactively works with the client as their needs change and grow to ensure product alignment is optimal.</li> <li>Responsible for the maintaining client satisfaction and client retention; oversees the entire client experience.</li> <li>Partners with ADP Sales for alignment and sales opportunities through communication of the business, governance, and service delivery model through sales presentations for prospective clients.</li> <li>Creates strategic account reviews and determines goals and objectives for the client.</li> <li>Monitors and manages the change and risk associated with the client's business requirements, applies communication skills, and partners with the client to successfully manage change with ADP Standard Operating Procedures and incorporates Change Control process as applicable with the ADP Team.</li> <li>Internal Process Compliance -- complies with defined methodology for all deliverables during client implementation and ongoing services for escalated issue management and resolution with service teams.</li> <li>Maintains ongoing education for competitive business intelligence and keeps abreast of new trends in the marketplace.</li> <li>Shares information internally and with Product Management to ensure our technology and services maintains competitive advantage.</li> </ul>  <strong>Education:</strong>   <ul> <li>Bachelor's Degree preferred or equivalent in HR experience.</li> <li>CHRP Designation is strongly preferred.</li> </ul>  <strong>Knowledge, Experience, and Skills Required:</strong>   <ul> <li>A minimum of 7-10 years of progressive career experience with demonstrated proficiency in managing large, complex client account relationships with multi-process HCM technology and outsourcing services combined with HR Practitioner experience (preferably in an HR management capacity)</li> <li>French/English Bilingualism required</li> <li>Human Resources practitioner and/or Payroll and Benefits industry experience.</li> <li>Extensive experience building relationships with clients is essential.</li> <li>Advanced MS Word and Project Management software capabilities</li> <li>An understanding of ADP's infrastructure and ADP's tradition and new product/services business processing and outsourcing is helpful.</li> </ul>

Title: Senior Manager / Manager, Technology Advisory Services
Job_Description: <strong>BDO. Because relationships matter.</strong> <br/><br/> There are many world-class accounting & advisory firms. Far fewer that offer a culture so rich in professional opportunity, personal fulfillment, and long-term growth. At BDO, we understand that exceptional service to our clients begins – and ends – with exceptional regard for our people. Because at its core, our business is not about numbers or spreadsheets, dollars or pence, but about people working with, for, and in service of others. In short, because relationships matter. <br/><br/> <strong>Senior Manager/Manager, Technology Advisory Services</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About BDO IT Solutions</strong> <br/><br/> BDO Canada LLP has spent more than 90 years providing assurance, accounting, tax, and advisory services to a broad range of clients across the country. And as a member firm of the international BDO network, we leverage access to resources and advisors in more than 150 countries around the world. <br/><br/> BDO IT Solutions (BDO ITS) is the technology advisory practice within BDO Canada LLP’s portfolio of professional services, focusing on the midmarket segment of the Canadian geography. While our team can address the business and technology needs of all organizations across the country, our primary focus is on the Energy & Natural Resources, Manufacturing & Distribution, Financial Services, Retail and Not-For-Profit industries. The BDO ITS practice has set some very aggressive growth targets through 2020 and the addition of this role to the team directly complements the desire to achieve those targets. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Based in either Calgary, Toronto or Vancouver, the role of Senior Manager/Manager, Technology Advisory Services (TAS), will be a key contributor to BDO ITS’ go-to-market strategy, leading key advisory engagements within both new and existing client environments across all of BDO’s targeted industry sectors.</strong> Over the past decade, BDO ITS has established an impressive track record of delivering practical technology advice to our clients, maintaining an absolute focus on aligning business objectives with tangible IT strategies. Continuing in 2018 and beyond, the TAS practice will continue to work closely with BDO ITS industry and technology experts (Partners, Senior Managers, etc.) while delivering advisory-centric engagements focused on technology assessments, roadmaps and strategies as well as cloud, security and data & information strategies. <br/><br/> Partnering with our valued clients, every member of our TAS team establishes long-term working relationships while providing sound advice to help organizations maximize the return on their investments in technology. TAS members have proven skills in structuring and leading sophisticated advisory engagements, significant exposure to complex business operations and wide-ranging exposure to both legacy and modern information technologies. <br/><br/> As a member of the rapidly expanding TAS team, you will report directly to the BDO Partner in charge of strategy & market development while receiving operational guidance from the Senior Manager, Technology Advisory Services (TAS). <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities & Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li><div>Identification and documentation of complex client requirements.</div></li><li><div>Preparation and presentation of comprehensive technical solutions to non-technical audiences.</div></li><li><div>Leveraging your business and technology knowledge and experience to architect short and long-term sustainable technology initiatives for our clients.</div> </li><li><div>Prioritization and balancing of multiple tasks including leading consulting engagements, researching and analyzing client business and technology requirements, leveraging the BDO ITS team’s problem-solving capacity and, communicating effectively in written and verbal formats to varied audiences in a professional business environment.</div> </li><li><div>Delivery of clear requests for information and/or requirements, both internally and with our clients.</div></li><li><div>Demonstrating the capacity to prioritize and complete tasks as well as the ability to communicate potential conflicts to team members.</div> </li><li><div>Collaboration with and contribution to your peers while developing strong working relationships; Regular interfacing with all groups within BDO ITS including project managers and technology and industry team members.</div></li><li><div>Leading and participating in multiple concurrent projects.</div></li> </ul> <strong>Experience, Education & Professional Skills/Knowledge:</strong> <ul> <li><div>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or related field.</div> </li><li><div>Familiarity with multiple back office technology suites, including ERP, BI and Cloud-centric solutions (experience with Microsoft back office technologies such as Dynamics and Azure is preferred)</div></li><li><div>Ability to provide guidance on technology strategy, architecture, governance & systems.</div></li><li><div>Ability to advise clients on emerging technologies and strategies consistent with their business strategies.</div> </li><li><div>Ability to develop technology and implementation roadmaps that align technology investments with key business priorities, all while accounting for critical risks.</div> </li><li><div>Ability to foresee and identify solution related risks, provide options and recommendations to addressing these risks to the project leadership.</div> </li><li><div>Experience conducting application and information management maturity and/or needs assessments, identifying and prioritizing opportunities/projects, and developing technology roadmaps and estimates.</div></li><li><div>Experience with the architecture, design and development of technology solutions for the midmarket and enterprise segments on the Canadian landscape.</div></li> </ul> <strong>Our Vision:</strong> <br/><br/> One Firm engaged to make a difference through valued relationships with our people, clients and communities.<strong><br/> </strong> <br/><br/> #LI-MM1

Title: Accounting Manager
Job_Description: Recognized as a leader in the EPC industry and ranked as the #2 <br/> engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine, we <br/> primarily serve the oil & gas, refining & petrochemical and chemicals <br/> industries providing engineering and construction of some of the world's <br/> largest refinery and petrochemical complexes. Our services include execution of <br/> major revamps and grassroots projects across petroleum refining, gas <br/> processing, liquefied natural gas, and associated offsite and environmental <br/> facilities worldwide. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <ul> <li>Prepare reports and analysis of company operations and key performance indicators for senior management</li><li>Facilitate the annual budget and monthly forecasting processes ensuring accurate, timely and efficient execution</li><li>Analyze financial information to determine present and future financial performance. Identify trends and recommend improvements accordingly</li><li>Develop and deliver effective and timely business analysis</li><li>Drive process improvement and identify opportunities for cost savings</li><li>Provide ad-hoc analysis as required</li></ul>  <ul> <li>A Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field.</li> <li>Strong experience in supporting central corporate functions as well as Lines of Businesses/Business Units</li><li>Strong modelling skills balanced with sound business judgment</li><li>Very strong and proven analytical and problem solving skills, must be able to proactively engage financial data to make recommendations</li><li>Ability to analyze, problem-solve and think strategically</li><li>Ability to work cross functionally and build strong relationships throughout the organization</li><li>8 years of relevant experience in a commercial business environment</li><li>Excellent oral, written and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of management and external auditors</li><li>Ability to work in a fast, dynamic environment, and prioritize competing priorities</li><li>Outstanding Excel and Microsoft Office skills required</li> </ul>  <div>At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and <br/> challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, <br/> expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an <br/> environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive <br/> benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace <br/> injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.</div> <br/>

Title: Team Lead (Packager)
Job_Description: We are excited to share an exciting announcement Acrodex Inc will officially rebrand as PCM Canada a subsidiary of PCM Inc Backed by PCMs extensive North American capabilities and resources we now take an important step forward with plans to grow our reach across Canada bolster our service catalog and improve delivery efficiencies PCM Canada customers stand to benefit from deepened relationships with vendors and from a strategic partnership with sister company Stratiform Working at PCM Canada PCM Canada supports clients in reaching their business goals PCM Canada is an Title: Manager, Natural Gas Market Development
Job_Description: <div><p>Requisition Id: 15389</p><p>Department: Market Development Department </p><p><strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong></p><p> </p><p>The Marketing Business Unit provides strategic direction and commercial execution in areas involving marketing, market development, new ventures/opportunities and acquisitions. In supporting the long-term strategy and vision Marketing looks across commodity value chains, optimizing capacity and margins derived therefrom, and developing and implementing plans based our commodity portfolio (natural gas, NGLs, crude oil, and associated products), using our logistics capabilities and our knowledge and understanding of the ever-changing global market dynamics. </p><p>Pembina’s Marketing Business Unit is searching for a Manager, Natural Gas Market Development to join their Calgary team. The successful candidate will be a key contributor to the success of Pembina’s gas group, turning opportunity into growth. The candidate will identify new market opportunities and provide economic analysis to support production egress from Western Canada and capacity utilization. They will also be able to solve complex and unstructured business opportunities.</p><p> </p><p>The primary responsibilities, deliverables and accountabilities include, but are not limited to:</p><p> </p><p>Business Acumen/Strategy</p><ul><li>Develop and maintain a five-year marketing plan for the department natural gas businesses;</li><li>Conduct detailed financial analysis/valuation related to Pembina’s current and future business opportunities including major projects, expansions, and other corporate initiatives; and</li><li>Support market development for natural gas by evaluating commercial initiatives through conceptualization, economic, competitive and strategic analysis and assisting in determining the commercial terms of future arrangements.</li></ul><p> </p><p>Market Development</p><ul><li>Lead Pembina’s natural gas marketing initiatives including sales strategies for incremental market penetration;</li><li>Evolve commercial models to support supply aggregation into capacity managed by Marketing and existing and future markets;</li><li>Negotiate and execute short and long-term commercial agreements on a timely basis and in advance to support infrastructure development, transportation and storage access, and capacity utilization, in concert with supply and trading desks;</li><li>Develop and maintain relationships with markets, infrastructure operators and producers to support Pembina’s Marketing and New Ventures Divisions; and</li><li>Support other ongoing growth initiatives and special projects as required.</li></ul><p> </p><p>Work Effectiveness</p><ul><li>Take initiative to drive results, assembling internal and external resources, and leading business teams for delivering successful outcomes; and</li><li>Build internal relationships applicable Business and Service Units to ensure that information flows to and from the Business Unit occur in a coordinated and effective manner.</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>Qualifications</strong></p><p> </p><ul><li>Demonstrated business acumen, creativity and innovation as it relates to understanding of value proposition for midstream marketing infrastructure, including understanding of risk mitigation strategies related to markets, contracts and hedging;</li><li>Track record of success in sales/origination roles with clear results against deliverables;</li><li>Track record of initiating, developing and implementing new profitable term structured business opportunities, identifying market imperfections and creating lasting competitive advantages;</li><li>Minimum of 10 years of related experience with a specific focus on upstream and downstream natural gas markets, North American infrastructure and LNG, including factors impacting pricing and logistics;</li><li>Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in one of the following: Economics, Business Administration, Finance, Engineering or Marketing. Possess or working toward advanced education (MA in Economics, MBA);</li><li>Outstanding interpersonal, communication and organizational skills dealing at all levels in the organization; and</li><li>Travel will be required.</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>No agency calls please.</strong></p><p>Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process.</p><p>Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America&apos;s energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers&apos; products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right.</p><p>Powering Pembina&apos;s growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities.</p><p>Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. </p><p>Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta&apos;s Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada.</p><p>></p><p> </p><p></p><p></p><p> </p></div>

Title: Regional Branch Manager
Job_Description: Description  <p> We are currently looking for a Regional Branch Manager to join our team, and flexible with considering candidates located anywhere in British Columbia, Alberta, Manitoba or Ontario, and open to considering the candidate working remotely.<br><br>Reporting to the Coordinator for Regional Branch Managers, the Regional Branch Manager will be responsible for providing coverage to a number of branch and sub-branch locations within a specific geographical territory. The key responsibilities of this position will be to provide compliance oversight to our network of mutual fund sales people. Please note, some travel may be required. <br><br>Responsibilities: <br>•Tier 2 and Tier 1 Supervision;<br>•Providing training/coaching to independent Branch Managers/representatives<br>•Ensuring policies and procedures are maintained at each office within their region; <br>•Ensuring compliance with suitability requirements; <br>•Reviewing and approving new account openings; <br>•Providing supervision of trades and advice given to clients; <br>•Supervising Branch Manager activities; <br>•Reviewing and following up on previous day’s trades; <br>•Following up on questionable trades and escalating as necessary; <br>•Completing KYC update review and approval; <br>•Participating in compliance conferences; <br>•Providing training and education to the field; <br>•Monitor trends, communicating findings and implementing corrective actions; <br>•Being a resource for the field. <br>•Other projects as assigned </p>   Qualifications  <p> •University degree or equivalent post-secondary education. <br>•Excellent knowledge of the mutual fund industry. <br>•Minimum of 2-3 years of compliance supervision experience and 3-5 years in the Mutual Fund Industry. <br>•Completion of the Canadian Investment Funds Course or Canadian Securities Course. <br>•Completion of the Branch Managers Course and either the Officers, Partners and Directors (OPD) Course or Partners, Directors and Officers (PDO) Course. <br>•Ability to understand, analyze and interpret Regulatory legislation. <br>•Excellent problem solving, organizational and communication skills. <br>•Excellent learning capacity, judgement, initiative and accountability.<br>•Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.<br><br>iA Financial Group is committed to fostering a workplace that promotes diversity and inclusion. We can provide accommodation in our recruitment and selection processes to applicants with disabilities where required. Please contact your Recruiter, or send an email to accessiblecareers@ia.ca </p>

Title: Manager, Web Services, Application and Web Services, Information Technologies
Job_Description: <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Solutions & Service Delivery</strong> within<strong> Information Technologies</strong> is currently seeking a Full-time Regular <strong> Manager, Web Services</strong> . <br/><br/> This position reports to the Associate Director, Applications and Web Services, in Information Technologies. The Manager, Web Services is responsible for leading the Web Services team in the development and support of websites within the Enterprise Web Content Management System (based on the Drupal platform). Integration and collaboration with the University Relations (UR) Marketing team is an essential and continuous activity in this position. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Key Responsibilities</strong> (job functions include but are not limited to): <br/><br/> LEADERSHIP (60%) <ul> 	<li>Responsible for team leadership,incident delegation and performance management</li>	<li>Hold delegated timesheet approval for the team</li>	<li>Responsible for budgeting and purchasing approvals when the Associate Director, Applications and Web Services is absent</li>	<li>Hold shared responsibilities with the Associate Director, Applications and Web Services, in screening applicants and in conducting job interviews</li>	<li>Identify, recognize and document opportunities for process improvement carried out by the team</li>	<li>Collaborate with University Relations (UR) to ensure the Web Services team maintains alignment with the digital experience defined by UR</li>	<li>Advise and mentor team members, internship students and student employees on proper operational procedures and guidelines</li>	<li>Ensure team members, internship students and student employees have accurate and relevant technical information</li>	<li>Continually show leadership in customer service and web development</li>	<li>Ensure all standards and policies are communicated and adhered to</li>	<li>Regular attendance of UC IT change management meetings to ensure adherence to processes, and identify potential issues with service interruption</li>  </ul> DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE (15%) <ul> 	<li>Support the Web Services development team with overall technical direction</li>	<li>Provide oversight for specific development challenges if they arise, working with the developers for timely and appropriate solutions</li>	<li>Ensure that Web Services callers receive confirmation of the receipt of their request</li>	<li>Ensure trouble calls assigned to this position are resolved and that adequate notes are kept</li>  </ul> CLIENT SERVICES (10%) <ul> 	<li>Demonstrate good comprehension of the UC IT services and processes</li>	<li>Define and lead the Web Services service catalog</li>	<li>Arrange and implement the migration of websites for faculties and departments</li>  </ul> COMMUNICATION/RELATIONSHIPS (10%) <ul> 	<li>Demonstrate friendly, complete, competent customer service and support at all times in all situations</li>	<li>Demonstrate a willingness to participate in team environment for information, skills and knowledge sharing</li>	<li>Demonstrate a willingness to keep technical knowledge current</li>  </ul> PROJECT MANAGEMENT (5%) <ul> 	<li>Show a willingness to provide input to strategic planning for the Web Services support, to ensure that the level of service is constantly improving</li>	<li>Work with the UR Marketing group to coordinate work intake, with appropriate scoping for definition, planning, development, and release</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications / Requirements:</strong> <ul> 	<li>Completion of an undergraduate degree related to computer science or equivalent combination of skills and experience in a development or support area is required</li> 	<li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to work productively with technical and non-technical staff and clients. The ability to explain complicated technical issues in non-technical terms is a considerable asset</li>	<li>Previous supervisory experience is necessary; experience in a unionized environment is an asset</li>	<li>Proven customer service skills</li>	<li>High organizational skills with ability to prioritize and meet deadlines</li>	<li>Experience with web site design, development, delivery, and maintenance</li>	<li>High-level of knowledge of web content management systems,specifically in the Drupal platform</li> </ul> Specific qualifications include: <ul> 	<li>Experience with LAMP development</li>	<li>Experience PHP 7/PSR-2 standards</li>	<li>Experience with UNIX systems administration; Bash shell scripting is an asset</li>	<li>Experience with web programming (HTML5, CSS3, Javascript/jQuery)</li>	<li>Experience with MySQL / MariaDB</li>	<li>Experience with SEO/SEM, Accessibility (WCAG, Section 508)</li>	<li>Knowledge of best practices for digital design and an understanding of the principles of responsive design</li>	<li>Experience with Agile methodologies</li>	<li>Experience with data integration, such as working with XML, JSON and REST API</li>	<li>Familiar with current digital design practices and the ability to design for a variety of audiences</li>	<li>Experience multi-branch Git development; using CI/CD processes would be an asset</li>	<li>Experience with Service Management / Incident Tracking software would be an asset</li> </ul> Desired additional experience: <ul> 	<li>Testing and integrating community contributed Drupal modules</li>	<li>Custom Drupal module development</li>	<li>ITIL certification</li>	<li>Demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple tasks of varying complexity, to work autonomously and under pressure</li>	<li>This position requires a general knowledge of the culture and operating procedures of the university</li>  </ul> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong>  May 28, 2018 <br/><br/> <em>We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> This position is classified in the<strong> Management Career Band, Level I</strong> of the Management and Professional Staff Career Framework. <br/><br/> To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Management and Staff Careers website</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong>ucalgary.ca</strong>. <br/><br/> <em>The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.</em>

Title: Intermediate Process/Project Engineer – Job No. PRINT
Job_Description: <strong>Description:</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manager, Facilities Engineering as an Intermediate Project / Process Engineer at Integrated Sustainability Consultants Limited, you will be an integral part of the Facilities Engineering Team, developing technical solutions in the water, waste and energy fields. <br/><br/> Your extensive process engineering and design experience in industry and/or consulting, as well as your project and team management skills will allow you to take a leadership role in a challenging and dynamic team environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Integrated Sustainability:</strong> <br/><br/> Integrated Sustainability Consultants Ltd. is an innovative leading provider of professional services based out of Calgary that integrates world-class front-end project consulting and delivery teams to execute sustainable <em>Water, Waste</em> and <em>Energy</em> solutions. Our goal is to engage public, industrial, and natural resource sector clients from early project thinking to successfully engineered project delivery completion by an employee owned team who value long-term social and environmentally sustainable solutions. <br/><br/> We are passionate about managing the water lifecycle from source protection and resource management, to water and wastewater treatment and disposal. We strive to find total lifecycle solutions through a risk management approach, while implementing efficient fit-for-purpose engineering design and scientific solutions. To meet these challenges, we have attracted a dynamic, energetic team of professionals who are highly recognized specialists in their field of expertise and love coming to work every day! <br/><br/> We have been recognized as a <em>Top Service Provider (Environmental Consultants)</em> by the Consumer Choice awards in for the last two years, as the <em>2015 Water Management Company of the Year</em> through the Oil & Gas Awards and the <em>2014 ATB Small Business of the Year</em> through the Calgary Chamber of Commerce and are committed to employing the best people. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in process, chemical, or mechanical engineering from an accredited post secondary institution</li> <li>5-10 years applicable engineering experience in North American industrial water treatment, oil and gas, mining, or other process industries, including at least 3-5 years in engineering or consulting</li> <li>Registration with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) or equivalent;</li> <li>Excellent English communication skills, and experience in preparing and reviewing technical reports</li> <li>Proven leadership and communication skills, with business development and client communication skills</li> <li>Thorough understanding of other disciplines’ roles in the design process</li> <li>Ability to work under own initiative to meet deadlines and manage priorities</li> </ul> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Coordinate small to large sized teams and projects with water, waste and energy as central concepts</li> <li>Undertake and oversee detailed data characterization and analysis</li> <li>Complete front end feasibility, preliminary and detailed engineering design in a variety of technical contexts</li> <li>Undertake construction management and system optimization where required to meet clients’ requirements</li> <li>Develop and implement complex science, engineering and field programs</li> <li>Foster critical relationships with clients, technical and non-technical staff, government representatives, and technology suppliers</li> <li>Supervise junior technical and field staff</li> <li>Establish cost and schedule for project deliverables</li> <li>Preparing Progress reports</li> <li>Works and communicates well in a team oriented setting within a rapidly changing environment and with minimum supervision</li> <li>Interface with other departments as required to develop and implement multi-disciplinary project strategies</li> <li>Assisting in field during construction and commissioning</li> <li>Undertake process lead roles for process & facilities deliverables: Design Basis, PFDs, Material Balance, Process Narratives, P&IDs, Line Lists, Tie-In Lists, Mechanical Equipment Lists, Instrument Datasheets</li> <li>Sizing equipment, hydraulic analysis, process analysis, process modeling and plant optimization projects</li> <li>Preliminary design, and detailed design of process plants and water treatment plants in western Canada and elsewhere</li> <li>Process optimization studies including process simulation and troubleshooting</li> <li>Must be fluent in English and legally able to work in Canada</li> </ul> To apply, please send your resume with cover letter to careers@integratedsustainability.ca <br/><br/> <strong>Please ensure to include the job number (PRINT0309) in the email subject line.</strong> <br/><br/> We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Marketing Manager -Home Solutions & Complementary Channels (Temporary)
Job_Description: <strong>Ready to create new opportunities in uncharted territory?</strong><br/>  <div><strong>Join our team!</strong></div> <br/>The Community Strategy, Planning & Execution team is looking for an energetic and motivated individual who can successfully market our TV, Internet, Home Phone and Mobility products to the Western Canadian market. In this role, you will lead the evolution and growth of the grocery and retail strategy across AB and BC, including the evolution of our marketing activations targeted at multicultural segments. In this exciting and dynamic role, you will develop new partnership opportunities, uncover new paths to market, drive sales objectives and drive best in class events and activations. <br/><br/> <strong>Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together!</strong> <br/><br/> You’re a strategic thinker who understands our wireline and wireless products and how to best market them to our customers. You will be an expert in developing marketing and sales strategies for activations in grocery, retail, mall and event channels. You will work with people within our own team, with our agency partners and with the larger TELUS organization to ensure execution excellence and a robust event strategy.<br/>  <div><strong>Here's how…</strong></div>   <ul>  <li>Work with our agency partners and internal stakeholders to build the strategy for, and execution of best in class activations across new and existing sales channels, including grocery, retail, mall and events</li> <li>Using data, and consumer insights, and testing, optimize activations to ensure sales and yield targets are being met</li> <li>Build and deliver program plans with clearly established business objectives and measurable results to tangibly demonstrate marketing return on investment</li> <li>Develop program briefs, executive summaries, status reports, post-execution analysis documents, and presentation decks reporting results</li> <li>Grow the multicultural go to market strategy, increasing sales of TELUS products/services and brand awareness</li>  </ul>  <div><strong>You're the missing piece of the puzzle…</strong></div>   <ul>  <li>Prior experience leading projects, including planning, communicating, follow-up, executive communication and stakeholder management</li> <li>Knowledge of wireline and mobility products an asset</li> <li>Knowledge of Multicultural Marketing considered an asset</li> <li> <div>Understanding of channel execution an asset</div></li> </ul>  <div><strong>Great-to-haves…</strong></div>   <ul>  <li><strong>Collaborative Team Player:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Builds relationships with partners, by understanding their requirements and perspective, and leveraging those to meet shared goals</li> <li>Excel in a collaborative and cross-functional setting, with an ability to co-create and execute with other team members</li> </ul></li> <li><strong>Proactive Self-starter:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Takes ownership of a program or launch, bringing it to fruition and measuring impact</li> <li>Demonstrated initiative and problem solving skills</li> <li>Proven success in developing and managing multiple programs/priorities at one time</li> <li> <div>Strong analysis and business planning skills</div></li></ul></li> </ul>  <div><strong>Who is TELUS?</strong></div> <br/> <div> <div>We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.</div> <br/> <div>Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.</div> <br/> <div>Do you share our passion?</div><br/>  <div>At TELUS, <strong>you</strong> create future friendly® possibilities.</div> <br/> <div>At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.</div></div>

Title: Senior Market Manager - Copper to Fibre Migrations
Job_Description: <strong>Ready to create innovative solutions and best practices?</strong><br/>  <div><strong>Join our team!</strong></div>  <br/>Within the Consumer Lifecycle & Upsell Marketing team, the new Legacy Copper to Fibre (C2F) Migrations program is a top strategic priority. Our focus is promoting the many benefits of migrating legacy copper customers to PureFibre. <br/><br/> We are looking for a self-motivated innovator with the ability to influence, collaborate, and challenge the status quo. <br/><br/> <strong>Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together!</strong> <br/><br/> As a Senior Market Manager on the Copper to Fibre Migration team, your role is to lead the marketing aspects of legacy copper to fibre migrations and be an advocate the end of to end customer experience. <br/><br/> As a strategic thinker, you will have talent for gathering actionable insights from your peers, key stakeholders, internal and external customers. You will leverage these, as well as promote the benefits of PureFibre, to develop the marketing program to make migration as easy as possible for our customers and execution teams.<br/>  <div><strong>Here's how...</strong></div>  <ul>  <li>Create and deliver integrated marketing programs including development of budget, value prop and KPIs</li> <li>Develop go-to-market strategies, including managing and launching end-to-end campaigns</li> <li>Engage in qualitative and quantitative research for effective marketing campaigns and programs</li> <li>Optimize strategy in the development of initiatives while integrating organizational and corporate priorities</li> <li>Review and analyze program metrics, making changes as required to optimize effectiveness</li> <li>Collaborate with Business Intelligence, Pricing, Offers, Brand & Experience, etc. to achieve desired business outcomes</li> </ul> <strong>You're the missing piece of the puzzle...</strong> <ul>  <li>5-8 years of marketing experience, preferably in a large company</li> <li>Developed innovative programs based on customer insight and quantitative analysis</li> <li>Bias to action with the ability to work independently to produce the required results</li> <li>Analyzed complex processes and suggested improvements</li>  <li>Strong presentation and communication skills (with experience interacting with senior leaders in a large organization)</li> <li>Proven ability to create a business case to support strategy, including completing a sound financial analysis</li> <li>Solid business acumen, a thirst for driving for results, and a good understanding of key financial performance measures</li> <li>Passion for working in a fast paced and high performance culture</li> <li>You are able to deal with ambiguity</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Great-to-haves...</strong></div>  <ul>  <li>Master of Business Administration (MBA) degree</li> <li>Project Management Professional (PMP) designation</li> <li>Consulting background</li> <li>Process Improvement (Lean Six Sigma)</li> <li>Previous Customer Base Management experience</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Who is TELUS?</strong></div> <br/>  <div>We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.</div> <br/>  <div>Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.</div> <br/>  <div>Do you share our passion?</div><br/>   <div>At TELUS, <strong>you</strong> create future friendly® possibilities.</div> <br/>  <div>At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.</div>

Title: Project Director - Civil & Infrastructure
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/>   <div> <div><strong>05/01/2018</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>001750</strong> </div> <br/><strong>Pomerleau</strong> is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder. <br/><br/> Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do. <br/><br/> <strong>The Opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> Lead the way and imagine the possibilities as a Project Director with Pomerleau. Influence organizational growth by building strong and knowledgeable teams, giving strength to innovative ideas and developing trusting, company-wide relationships. <br/><br/> Using your proven experience and leadership capabilities, you embrace your role as mentor and advisor to your motivated and resourceful team. Empowering them with your expertise and guidance, they will soon match your confidence and drive for excellence. <br/><br/> With your solution focused and team oriented attitude, you will pave the way in project management and delivery while developing new and existing client relationships in your consistently increasing market. You embrace the role of being a trusted leader for our team and steadfast advisor for our clients, ensuring every Pomerleau project is executed and completed successfully. <br/><br/> Success is in the details and the core of what you do. As a Project Director, you are a born leader keeping project goals, execution, people and communication always top of mind. As a key member of our team, we will <strong>rethink construction together</strong>, <strong>from idea to completion</strong>. <strong>Everywhere</strong>. <strong>All the time</strong>. <strong>Period</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>What YOU Will Do</strong>  <ul> <li>Inspire your teams to strive for excellence by leading by example, encouraging professional development and showing confidence and encouragement in their abilities.</li> <li>Provide constructive advice and feedback to Project Managers and Project Coordinators to aid their growth and organizational development.</li> <li>Utilize your experience in trade partner selection and coordination of their activities.</li> <li>Direct all projects for your division, offering advice and support to Project Delivery Teams, while staying ahead of the game with schedules and budgets.</li> <li>Develop and maintain strong relationships with trade partners, consultants and clients to achieve project goals and vision.</li> <li>Encourage efficiency and proactiveness by coaching your team to tackle problems head on and turn technical nightmares into profitable successes. .</li> <li>Make the impossible possible. Demonstrate effective negotiation skills that provide positive outcomes for all parties while prioritizing project goals.</li> <li>In collaboration with our dedicated HS&E team, actively promote and sustain our leading HSE program. Effectively apply requirements of project specific safety standards to promote applicable OH&S acts, regulations and codes with all employees and trade partners on our projects.</li> <li>Use your attention to detail and methodical approach to ensure compliance with our first-class Quality program.</li> <li>Share your financial management experience to help Project Managers plan, manage and respect project budgets, costs and associated purchasing.</li> <li>Encourage open lines of communication regarding project status and updates;</li> <li>Be an expert in risk management to ensure any associated project risk is minimized;</li> <li>Celebrate project success and completion and be a key member of the project wrap-up process.</li> </ul> <strong>What YOU Will Bring</strong>  <ul> <li>10+ years’ experience in the construction industry;</li> <li>Previous civil construction experience specifically building bridges, tunnels, roads and infrastructure.</li> <li>University Degree/Technology Diploma in Engineering, or a combination of education and industry experience;</li> <li>A proven track record of project success and team leadership;</li> <li>Outstanding communication and organizational skills with the ability to effectively influence others and successfully resolve a variety of client, project and technical issues to bring the project to successful completion;</li> <li>Strong knowledge of construction and project methodologies, financial management, as well as building codes and associated legislation;</li> <li>A passion to develop teams and for organizational growth and success.</li> <li>Good computer skills and previous experience with scheduling software;</li> <li>Knowledge of the Alberta construction market.</li> </ul> <strong>WHY JOIN POMERLEAU`S TEAM? :</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary</li> <li>4 weeks’ vacation</li> <li>Group insurance (health spending account)</li> <li>Group RRSP</li> <li>Monthly public transit pass paid by employer</li> <li>Fitness center membership: 50% reimbursed by employer</li> <li>Employee assistance program</li> <li>Ongoing training offered throughout the year</li> <li>Young, dynamic environment</li> <li>Excellent career opportunities</li> <li>Summer hours</li> </ul> <strong>PARTICULARITY:</strong>  <ul> <li>The retained candidate will be subject to an administrative security check</li> </ul> At Pomerleau, we focus on results-oriented, passionate and rigorous people who participate in ambitious and complex projects. You have the profile we are looking for? Apply now to be part of our team. <br/><br/> Only retained candidates will be contacted. We may consider your CV for other positions. <br/><br/> Pomerleau is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive working environment where all employees are treated fairly.</div>  <br/>

Title: Executive HR Relationship Manager
Job_Description: Executive HR Relationship Manager - At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP. <br/><br/> Client support at ADP: It's all about enabling the clients we serve to be more effective employers. You can make it happen by collaborating with other ADP Associates to ensure our products and services deliver winning results. The expert support you provide can make our workforce solutions stand out in an increasingly competitive global marketplace. <br/><br/> ADP Canada is actively searching for an Executive Human Resources Relationship Manager to join our Service Team and provide expert HR Support to our Workforce Now HR clients of varying size and complexity. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> This role is the primary point of accountability and is responsible for setting and managing the client expectations. <br/><br/> Develops and enhances business partnerships by fully engaging and building trust with our client's key decision makers to drive client satisfaction, retention, and an overall positive client experience for the Major and National Accounts Comprehensive Services clients. <br/><br/> Possesses an understanding of our clients' business objectives and requirements to proactively demonstrate and deliver increased value through the life cycle of the client. <br/><br/> Proactively delivers increased value by demonstrating continuous improvement and change management best practices throughout the life cycle of the client. <br/><br/> Applies industry and practitioner knowledge to understand and support our client's business objectives and strategic direction through utilization of our offering. <br/><br/> Acts as a liaison between the client and ADP by serving as an empowered internal client advocate and coordinating communication among the various internal business partners including implementation, service, sales and other support teams. <br/><br/> Proactively works with the client as their needs change and grow to ensure product alignment is optimal. <br/><br/> Responsible for the maintaining client satisfaction and client retention; oversees the entire client experience. <br/><br/> Partners with ADP Sales for alignment and sales opportunities through communication of the business, governance, and service delivery model through sales presentations for prospective clients. <br/><br/> Creates strategic account reviews and determines goals and objectives for the client. <br/><br/> Monitors and manages the change and risk associated with the client's business requirements, applies communication skills, and partners with the client to successfully manage change with ADP Standard Operating Procedures and incorporates Change Control process as applicable with the ADP Team. <br/><br/> Internal Process Compliance -- complies with defined methodology for all deliverables during client implementation and ongoing services for escalated issue management and resolution with service teams. <br/><br/> Maintains ongoing education for competitive business intelligence and keeps abreast of new trends in the marketplace. <br/><br/> Shares information internally and with Product Management to ensure our technology and services maintains competitive advantage. <br/><br/> <strong>Education:</strong>  <ul> <li>Must have HR and payroll experience.</li><li>Bachelor's Degree preferred or equivalent in HR experience.</li><li>CHRP Designation is strongly preferred.</li> </ul>  <strong>Knowledge, Experience, and Skills Required:</strong>  <ul> <li>A minimum of 7-10 years of progressive career experience with demonstrated proficiency in managing large, complex client account relationships with multi-process HCM technology and outsourcing services combined with HR Practitioner experience (preferably in an HR management capacity)</li><li>French/English Bilingualism a plus</li><li>Human Resources practitioner and/or Payroll and Benefits industry experience.</li><li>Extensive experience building relationships with clients is essential.</li><li>Advanced MS Word and Project Management software capabilities</li><li>An understanding of ADP's infrastructure and ADP's tradition and new product/services business processing and outsourcing is helpful.</li> </ul>  Powerful Technology + Real People = Awesome Results. Consistently named one of the "Most Admired Companies" by FORTUNE® Magazine, and recognized by DiversityInc ® as one of the "Top 50 Companies for Diversity," ADP powers the working world with hire-to-retire solutions. Whether it's a small business on Main Street or a global enterprise, ADP's leading solutions and expert guidance help over a half-million clients around the globe reduce costs, stay compliant, and unlock their people's potential. Less paperwork. More teamwork. <br/><br/> At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, non-job related physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance. <br/><br/>

Title: Project Controls Lead - Future Opportunity
Job_Description: <strong>Business Line</strong> Oil + Gas <br/><br/> <strong>Position Title</strong> Project Controls Lead - Future Opportunity <br/><br/> Canada - Alberta <br/><br/> Calgary <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is seeking a Project Controls Lead to be based in Calgary, Alberta. This is a Future Opportunity position. <br/><br/> Lead in the development of all reports set forth in the client business requirements as well as indicated in the corporate reporting procedures. Provide daily direction to the Project Controls team members as well as mentor and train team members on the Project Controls Process/Procedures. Interface and provide ongoing support to the Construction team and/or Clients. <br/><br/> May include the following responsibilities:  <ul> <li>Supervises the Project Control team in effort to maintain schedules, cost controls, forecasting and in all level reporting.</li>  <li>Conduct annual Performance Management process for all project controls team members assigned to the project.</li>  <li>Coach, monitor, assist, and assign tasks to project controls team as well as provide support to Project.</li>  <li>Controls Leads throughout the division. Review outstanding tasks with team members and update priority list and/or projects and/or clients with any changes.</li>  <li>Conduct review sessions on project status with project management and/or client and highlight adverse schedule and cost variances for corrective actions.</li>  <li>Lead in the development of all reports set forth in the client business requirements as well as indicated in the corporate reporting procedures.</li>  <li>Review, approve and submit Trend logs to the Client.</li>  <li>Review detailed forecasting of all indirect and equipment costs.</li>  <li>Review forecast hours at completion by discipline.</li>  <li>Review weekly coordination of data. (Cost/Schedule/Trends/Progress).</li>  <li>Ensure that all Project Controls activities are in accordance with set Project Procedures and Job.</li>  <li>Instructions. Includes preparation of schedules, cost reports, cash flow and variance analysis.</li>  <li>Develop and maintain project controls plan and procedures outlining methodologies and responsibilities while ensuring alignment with processes and procedures.</li>  <li>Review and provide feedback on miscellaneous project reports.</li>  <li>Provide construction with forward looking mitigation plans and data.</li>  <li>Verify integrity of Earned Value Management System.</li>  <li>Prepare and/or review contract change notices.</li>  <li>Coordinate with and respond to queries from internal and external clients</li>  <li>Attend team meetings to provide assistance in resolving issues review progress reports and ensure assignment of new tasks.</li>  <li>Analyze and provide input to technical and performance criteria on Project Controls systems to Business</li>  <li>Information Systems.</li>  <li>Provide recommendations and guidance to other Functional groups with regards to processes, monitoring and system requirements.</li>  <li>Provide input for business operations reports.</li>  <li>Review and approve team members timesheets and submit to administration. Ensuring that the appropriate overtime approvals have been complete for upcoming overtime, these approvals are to be submitted with the corresponding timesheets.</li>  <li>Complete and submit any monthly summaries to the appropriate departments. (e.g. P-card summaries, expense reports, etc).</li>  <li>May be required to perform other duties as assigned not otherwise captured in this position description.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Project), JD Edwards, Primavera 6, and Prism.</li>  <li>Entrants to this position require 8 years of experience with engineering, procurement and construction projects or operating industrial facilities. Must have both cost and schedule experience with 2+ years in whichever discipline is secondary. Some field experience required with 5+ years preferred.</li>  <li>1:1 years of experience ratio may be considered in lieu of formal education.</li>  <li>1 to 2 years of supervisory experience.</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>University education with applicable further development in Industrial Project Management would be preferred.</li>  <li>Industrial construction experience preferred.</li> </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <br/><br/> At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees. <br/><br/> <em>NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Job Category</em></strong> <em>Program and Project Management</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Business Group</em></strong> <em>Construction Services Group (CS)</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Country</em></strong> <em>Canada</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Position Status</em></strong> <em>Full-Time</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Requisition/Vacancy No.</em></strong> <em>185127BR</em> <br/><br/> <em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.</em>
