Title: Manager, Natural Gas Market Development
Job_Description: <div>Requisition Id: 15389 <br/><br/> Department: Market Development Department <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> The Marketing Business Unit provides strategic direction and commercial execution in areas involving marketing, market development, new ventures/opportunities and acquisitions. In supporting the long-term strategy and vision Marketing looks across commodity value chains, optimizing capacity and margins derived therefrom, and developing and implementing plans based our commodity portfolio (natural gas, NGLs, crude oil, and associated products), using our logistics capabilities and our knowledge and understanding of the ever-changing global market dynamics. <br/><br/> Pembina’s Marketing Business Unit is searching for a Manager, Natural Gas Market Development to join their Calgary team. The successful candidate will be a key contributor to the success of Pembina’s gas group, turning opportunity into growth. The candidate will identify new market opportunities and provide economic analysis to support production egress from Western Canada and capacity utilization. They will also be able to solve complex and unstructured business opportunities. <br/><br/> The primary responsibilities, deliverables and accountabilities include, but are not limited to: <br/><br/> Business Acumen/Strategy  <ul>  	<li>Develop and maintain a five-year marketing plan for the department natural gas businesses;</li> <li>Conduct detailed financial analysis/valuation related to Pembina’s current and future business opportunities including major projects, expansions, and other corporate initiatives; and</li> <li>Support market development for natural gas by evaluating commercial initiatives through conceptualization, economic, competitive and strategic analysis and assisting in determining the commercial terms of future arrangements.</li> </ul> Market Development  <ul>  	<li>Lead Pembina’s natural gas marketing initiatives including sales strategies for incremental market penetration;</li> <li>Evolve commercial models to support supply aggregation into capacity managed by Marketing and existing and future markets;</li> <li>Negotiate and execute short and long-term commercial agreements on a timely basis and in advance to support infrastructure development, transportation and storage access, and capacity utilization, in concert with supply and trading desks;</li> <li>Develop and maintain relationships with markets, infrastructure operators and producers to support Pembina’s Marketing and New Ventures Divisions; and</li> <li>Support other ongoing growth initiatives and special projects as required.</li> </ul> Work Effectiveness  <ul>  	<li>Take initiative to drive results, assembling internal and external resources, and leading business teams for delivering successful outcomes; and</li> <li>Build internal relationships applicable Business and Service Units to ensure that information flows to and from the Business Unit occur in a coordinated and effective manner.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Demonstrated business acumen, creativity and innovation as it relates to understanding of value proposition for midstream marketing infrastructure, including understanding of risk mitigation strategies related to markets, contracts and hedging;</li> <li>Track record of success in sales/origination roles with clear results against deliverables;</li> <li>Track record of initiating, developing and implementing new profitable term structured business opportunities, identifying market imperfections and creating lasting competitive advantages;</li> <li>Minimum of 10 years of related experience with a specific focus on upstream and downstream natural gas markets, North American infrastructure and LNG, including factors impacting pricing and logistics;</li> <li>Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in one of the following: Economics, Business Administration, Finance, Engineering or Marketing. Possess or working toward advanced education (MA in Economics, MBA);</li> <li>Outstanding interpersonal, communication and organizational skills dealing at all levels in the organization; and</li> <li>Travel will be required.</li> </ul> <strong>No agency calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. <br/><br/> Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. <br/><br/> Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. <br/><br/> Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. <br/><br/> Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. <br/><br/> ></div>  <br/>

Title: Territory Manager (Mat Leave)
Job_Description: Territory Manager (Mat Leave) <br/><br/> Salaried (Canada) <br/><br/> Facility: AB-Calgary <br/><br/> Department: Tree of Life Canada<br/> <div> <div><strong>Our core purpose is “To Help Canada Eat Well and Live Well”.</strong> <br/><br/> For more information please visit our website at http://www.treeoflife.ca.</div> <br/><strong>Tree of Life Canada ULC</strong> is an Employer who strives to provide an inclusive work environment that involves everyone and embraces the diverse talent of its people. We are committed to meeting the needs of persons with disabilities. If selected for an interview, we will be happy to work with you to ensure your interview is accessible and accommodation is provided. When your interview is being scheduled, please advise the Recruiter of how we might be able to support your participation. <br/><br/> <strong>** NOTE:</strong> Reference checks <u>will be</u> conducted for potential candidates and the information collected will be used in making the final hiring decision. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Job</strong> <br/><br/> The Territory Manager position is primarily responsible for product sales to a set of customers. The Territory Manager sells product by suggesting new items, line extensions and new placements, presenting promotional opportunities and displays to store management, suggesting items for cross merchandising, identifies and pursues opportunities to increase sales of current and new items. The position also has responsibility for receiving product and/or stocking shelves. As with all positions at Tree of Life Canada we expect that all actions will be consistent with Tree of Life Canada’s Mission, Vision and Values. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Accountabilities</strong> <br/><br/> · Conduct sales calls, merchandise and explain product set to appropriate retail store locations. <ul>  <li>Present and sell new items, new placements, and recommend item replacement for slow or discontinued items.</li> <li>Present available promotional opportunities.</li> <li>Propose items for cross-merchandising.</li> <li>Using independent judgment and sales techniques to recognize and increase sales.</li> <li>Present and sell items for seasonal, holiday, or other displays to maximize revenue.</li> <li>Check-in / receive orders. Stock, merchandise, and ensure proper placement of product.</li> <li>Maintain adequate inventory level by removing out-of-date or un-saleable products and reorder as necessary.</li> <li>Audit store shelves to ensure shelf tags are in place, identify slow or discontinued items, and write / transmit orders for replenishment.</li> <li>All GAP data must be updated after every call.</li> <li>Participate in resets and/or promotional / marketing planning for assigned customers.</li> <li>Prepare and process all paperwork and reports including, but not limited to, sales activity reports, handwritten orders, credits, and expense reports.</li> <li>Resolve store issues by working with store management and enlist appropriate company support.</li> <li>Understand and react accordingly when a “sense of urgency” arises. Be action-oriented with positive results in mind.</li> <li>Resourcefulness</li> <li>Team Player – helping out when needed</li> <li>Attend and participate in Trade Shows as requested.</li> <li>Maintain store information and territory route lists to be current.</li> <li>Maintain strong product knowledge.</li> <li>Other duties and special projects as requested.</li> <li>Must maintain good attendance, maintain safe work practices and maintain safeguards of confidential company information. <br/><br/> <strong>Experience and Qualifications Required</strong></li> </ul>  <ul>  <li>Minimum of two (2) years sales/marketing experience in food sector or consumer packaged products preferred.</li> <li>Must have High School Diploma. Proficiency in MS Office required.</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Business, Sales or Marketing preferred.</li> <li>Must have current and valid driver’s license and proof of insurance and be able to travel.</li> <li>Technical skills (computer literacy).</li> <li>Should have ability to prioritize multiple tasks with high energy level, comfortable performing multi-faceted tasks in conjunction with day-to-day activities.</li> <li>Should have strong organization and time management skills with ability to work independently without direct on-site supervision.</li> <li>Sales oriented with strong communication skills (oral and written) and fluent in English with above average presentation skills.</li> </ul></div> <br/>

Title: Senior Project Engineer
Job_Description: Compression & ProcessCalgary, AB<br/><br/>Startec Refrigeration Compression & Process Solutions is a thriving privately owned company headquartered in Calgary that produces custom mission critical compression and refrigeration systems for a variety of industries. Startec devotes their industry leading expertise in refrigeration & compression technologies to solve their clients’ most technically challenging needs. We create reliable solutions for extreme operating conditions and provide exceptional service, which is a cornerstone of our business. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Engineer Manager the Project Engineer is responsible for all Project Engineering and Project Management required to deliver gas compression and process packages on budget and on schedule <br/><br/> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul> <li>8+ years Project Management experience preferably in the oil and gas industry</li><li>A background in plant operations or gas compression is an asset</li><li>Project Management Professional Certification (PMP or PMI)</li> <li>Knowledge of process simulation software e.g. Hysis, VMG</li> <li>Good knowledge of ASME / ANSI / API Codes, knowledge of CSA Codes, knowledge of Code requirements for overseas customers is desirable</li> <li>Efficient in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint), Strong technical, analytical and problem solving capabilities</li><li>Experience with sizing and selection for all parts and equipment of packages</li><li>Ability to work well with customers, vendors, designers and fabrication staff</li><li>Strong communication skills with a good ability to influence, negotiate and resolve conflict</li><li>Capable of working with minimal direct supervision</li>  </ul> <br/><br/><strong>JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong><br/><br/><ul> <li>Assists the Project Manager to resolve conflict as required.</li><li>Communicates clearly with various project personnel and provides technical insight for resolution of problems.</li><li>Provides guidance and technical direction to the Junior Project Engineers and Engineering Technologists.</li><li>As required by the Engineering Manager, takes responsibility for areas of the technical direction and development of the engineering department including drafting.</li><li>Ensures appropriate quality and integrity of product design, including taking responsibility for the stamping of required drawings (P&ID, Line List, PSV Table, Piping Registration, Etc.).</li><li>Acts as one of the Responsible Members for the company’s permit to practice for APEGA.</li><li>Communicates effectively between various departments.</li> <li>Completes engineering deliverables on time and on budget.</li><li>Reviews all customer specifications that are applied to the project, ensures package is as sold and as built to customer agreed specifications.</li><li>Is responsible to update the project “Scheduler” and ensures engineering deliverables are completed.</li> <li>Is responsible for understanding the proposal and the clients’ project specifications that have been accepted.</li><li>Reviews the process simulation, checks or performs all major equipment sizing – vessel- compressor, driver, separators, pumps, filters, and heat exchangers.</li><li>Performs any additional process design including simulation to determine pipe sizing, and equipment blow-down rates.</li><li>Prepares vessel datasheets, performs sketch of internals, determines nozzle size and location, supervises vessel design, ensures vessel drawings are approved and issued to meet the project requirements.</li><li>Prepares equipment datasheets (Vessels, Exchangers, Pumps, Etc.).</li><li>Prepares and issues purchase requisitions to purchasing group as required and obtains comparative pricing for equipment where agreed.</li><li>Prepares draft P&IDs, supervises designers to prepare the drawing, arranges and chairs in-house P&ID review meeting going through P&ID checklist, submits P&ID to customer and arranges for revisions</li><li>Prepares the Bill Of Material (BOM), performs detail sizing of PSVs, control valves, Instrumentations Etc. and insures material selection, electrical classification, certification requirements are met</li><li>Issues BOM to purchasing, customer, designer and arranges for revisions.</li><li>Supervises the designers during preparation of the 3D model, GA, structural drawing and spool drawings in following customer’s specific requests and customer or in-house specs.</li><li>Prepares weight estimates, selects preliminary structural beam sizes and communicates with the third party structural engineer for optimization and final approval.</li><li>Arranges and chairs in-house 3D model review meeting with designers and manufacturing staff going through the design review checklist.</li><li>Prepares control philosophy and shutdown key.</li><li>Participates in safety studies such as HAZOP’s as required.</li><li>Captures and defines the scope of project change orders and communicates them to the Project Manager.</li><li>Prepares all project operating and maintenance manuals.</li> <li>Performs project final P&ID, walkthrough and signoff off our STA-ISO-010 Manufacturing Commissioning Sheet.</li><li>Completes project “Ship Loose List” in conjunction with manufacturing.</li><li>Participates in project “Closeout”, start-up and “Lessons Learned” meetings by providing feedback to Project Managers.</li> <li>Incorporates previous projects “Lessons Learned” into the engineering of current projects.</li> <li>Provides support to the service group during equipment commissioning and start-up which can include potential trip to site.</li> <li>Prepares any other calculations and technical documentation as required.</li> <li>Supervises third party engineering providers, review and approving all such work (Torsional analysis, Fugitive Emission Study, Stress Analysis, Vibration/Pulsation Study)</li><li>Reviews, approves and issues, via Document Control, all drawings according to Startec drawing approval procedures and in following project schedule.</li><li>Reviews and approves all vendor drawings in following project schedule.</li> </ul> We offer competitive wages, training, flexibility and a dynamic and exciting work environment. <br/><br/> It is mandatory for all applicants to complete the Pro.file People Survey below when submitting their application. Please proceed using the link below: <br/><br/> <strong>http://www.profileperformancesystem.com/survey.html?SL=55094</strong> <br/><br/> We thank you for your application and interest in our organization. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Consultant, SAP Project System
Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Vancouver<br/> <div> <strong>Job description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Technology</strong> <br/><br/> Our technologists help clients implement innovative technologies to drive their business’ forward. Our consultants link technology insights to clients’ organizational goals to fit within their full operating models, accounting for their people, intellectual capital, and processes. <br/><br/> <strong>SAP</strong> <br/><br/> The full potential of SAP solutions isn't just about technology, it's also about driving sustainable business value. At Deloitte, our SAP specialists deliver the technology and services to help our clients meet business performance goals and improve processes. As an SAP Global Partner we provide a broad range of consulting services, from HR, CRM and supply chain to finance transformation. <br/><br/> As a Senior Consultant focused on SAP Project System you are expected to: <ul> <li>Lead and support SAP Project System pursuits and Practice Development initiatives</li><li>Deliver SAP projects successfully</li><li>Supervise and coach junior colleagues and manage parts of client engagements</li><li>Develop external eminence for Deloitte</li><li>Promote and foster collaboration and knowledge sharing between practitioners within Deloitte</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>Completed undergraduate degree with outstanding academic credentials</li><li>Functional proficiency with at least 2+ full lifecycle SAP implementations and 4+ years of industry and/or consulting experience in the SAP space</li><li>At least 4 years of SAP experience implementing SAP Project System</li><li>Strong SAP Project System knowledge and experience as well as integrations with other modules</li><li>SAP certification is an asset</li><li>Experience in providing post implementation support</li><li>Thorough understanding of SAP Project System processes</li><li>Strong understanding of the integration points with other modules</li><li>Strong commitment to professional client service excellence</li><li>Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams</li><li>Superior verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Ability to develop and present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions</li><li>Proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving</li><li>Canadian travel required, occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignments</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 31743</div>

Title: Disability Case Manager - Team Lead
Job_Description: <strong>Disability Case Manager - Team Lead - Full Time - Calgary, AB</strong> <br/> <div><div>As the <strong>Disability Case Manager Team Lead</strong> with Lifemark you will have many opportunities to challenge yourself through applying a broad range of skills to your work. Our company symbolizes an exciting direction in managing non-occupational and occupational disability management claims. We pride ourselves in providing exceptional adjudication, case management, absence management and consulting services. As an industry leader, we focus on exceeding the expectations of all our clients through a unique relationship and approach that leads to positive outcomes and results. <br/><br/> In this role, you will work with assigned accounts to oversee non-occupational disability management programs. In this capacity, you will ensure disabilities are managed in an effective, timely and cost effective manner. You may also be required to assist with program development and implementation and provide a high standard of service for our clients. <br/><br/> This position requires interaction with a diverse group of people including, but not limited to, employers, unions, physicians, insurers and others groups and/ or individuals. You have an understanding of medical terminology, with a high aptitude to provide an outstanding experience for the clients you serve. <br/> You also possess strong written and verbal communication skills and enjoy working with people. If you would like to work in a dynamic, team-oriented atmosphere and possess a high level of motivation in the area of disability management, then we are looking for you! <br/><br/> <strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Proactively managing of non-occupational disability claims, often involving situations of a complex nature.</li> <li>Ability to effectively manage physical and psychological disability situations.</li><li>Working closely with client management, unions and employees to ensure timely return to work occurs.</li><li>Implementing early intervention strategies for an employees quick recovery and return to work.</li> <li>Arranging / Coordinating suitable medical assessments, treatment programs and/other activities to effectively manage disability cases</li><li>Liaising with physicians and other health care professionals.</li><li>Coordinating and developing suitable and sustainable return to work plans.</li><li>Maintaining regular contact with injured/ill employees with a focus on early return to work and enhancing recovery.</li><li>Liaising with applicable insurers and workers compensation boards as necessary.</li><li>Fulfilling any other assigned duties as required</li><li>Potential additional responsibilities, based on experience</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar role.</li><li>Undergraduate degree Ability to speak and write in English (French is a strong asset)</li><li>Experience mentoring and training staff would be an asset.</li><li>NIDMAR or other related professional designations preferred.</li><li>Demonstrated track record of managing disabilities and absenteeism.</li><li>Knowledge and understanding of WCB</li><li>Excellent decision making and problem solving skills.</li><li>Strong ability to perform functions of the position with minimal supervision.</li><li>Strong multi-tasking, time-management, negotiation and communication (verbal and written) skills.</li><li>Strong diplomacy skills with an ability to be flexible and also give and take direction well.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to build relationships with clients and team members.</li><li>Excellent documentation and time management skills. <br/> Strong computer literacy skills</li> </ul> <strong>Visit us at</strong> https://www.lifemark.ca<strong> for more information.</strong></div></div>

Title: Project Director - Infrastructure
Job_Description: Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, youll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. Youll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. <br/><br/> We rank among Canadas largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canadas 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If youre eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. <br/><br/> As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). <br/><br/> <em>As a <strong>Project Director, Water</strong> at Graham you will:</em>  <ul> <li>Establishing and managing a tendering team, which may incorporate resources from joint-venture partners, suitable for specific projects and including construction and design management professionals, estimators and schedulers, commercial managers, sub-contracted design firms, and other construction management support staff.</li> <li>Establishing and maintaining relationships with public and private sector clients, construction joint-venture partners, financing partners, and key specialist sub-contractors.</li> <li>Developing and executing tendering strategies focused on optimizing cost, schedule, Safety, Quality, and other relevant aspects of client requirements.</li> <li>Providing leadership and guidance in negotiating partnerships and teaming arrangements, developing construction and design innovations, and executing commercial procurement strategies.</li> <li>Working with the Construction Manager, Design Manager, Commercial Manager and Project Scheduler to plan the construction requirements of the project and to deliver the project on time and on budget.</li> <li>Ensure project commercial and risk management systems, including health and safety, quality, accounting, finance, insurance, legal, and communication functions are implemented effectively and are compliant with corporate procedures.</li> <li>Ensure compliance with all Federal, Provincial and local laws, particularly applicable. Occupational Health & Safety Acts / Construction Safety Act regulations and environmental requirements as they relate to the project scope of work.</li> <li>Act as a principal point of contact and project representative for the contractor or construction joint-venture to the private or public sector client.</li> <li>Manage and lead construction tendering and execution teams.</li> <li>Prepare regular reports for company executives and project steering committees detailing status of the project and recommending actions to be taken.</li> <li>Ability to lead a team in meeting difficult project timelines, provide support and supervision to staff, and successfully complete project work.</li> </ul> <em>Qualifications/Experience:</em>  <ul> <li>8+ years of progressive experience in a Manager role, responsible for large water/waste water projects at least 200 million dollars in value</li> <li>Must have experience working in a medium to large General Contractor environment</li> <li>Successful completion of a Civil Engineering degree. Completion of a MBA would be an asset</li> <li>Experience leading and executing water, waste water, renewable energy and transportation projects</li> <li>A solid track record in managing large infrastructure water projects</li> <li>Excellent communication skills, the ability to build respect at the job level, possess executive presence with strong relationship building and business development skills</li> <li>Strong management skills, with an in-depth knowledge of restructuring and change management</li> <li>Advanced understanding of large project operational and financial risk management practice</li> </ul> <em>Compensation and Benefits:</em>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary with annual bonus potential</li> <li>Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan.</li> <li>Ownership and long term equity opportunities</li> </ul> <em>What we can offer you:</em>  <ul> <li>Strong commitment to safety in the workplace</li> <li>Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector</li> <li>Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America</li>  </ul> Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. <br/><br/> <strong>We're Building careers, not filling jobs.</strong> <br/><br/> View available job opportunities and submit your application online at www.graham.ca/careers. <br/><br/> Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. <br/><br/> <em><strong>Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Graham Management Services LP <br/><br/> 10840 27th Street SE <br/><br/> Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 <br/><br/> Fax: 403.570.5130 <br/><br/> #LI-LS

Title: Office Manager
Job_Description: The<strong> Office Manager</strong> directs, administers, supervises and supports all aspects of the administrative and HR functions as well as supports Operations Management in their area of responsibility. This position reports to the General Manager. <br/><br/> <strong>Essential Duties & Responsibilities</strong>: <ul> <li>Assists General Manager in the development of vacation schedules, work schedules and annual review schedules.</li><li>Directs all payroll preparation efforts and assures that payroll checks are accurate and on time. This includes adherence to Payroll policy.</li><li>Monitors payroll and the labor management system to ensure are incented in the appropriate manner.</li><li>Maintains all payroll records in a confidential and organized manner.</li><li>Directs all accounts payable activities including purchase requisition process and payable voucher process in accordance with corporate issued standards.</li><li>Coordinates accounts receivable activities with Corporate Accounts Receivable Department. This will include receivable collection efforts and review of billing issues/errors.</li><li>Ensures that all telecommunication equipment is maintained.</li><li>Responsible for aspects of new hire onboarding experience.</li><li>Partners with Corporate Human Resources (HR) for local HR on site issues or questions.</li><li>Produces weekly Flash and Accounts Receivable Interface.</li><li>Audits and ensures that proper back up is maintained for customer inventory and billing transactions.</li><li>Ensures that back up and transactional documents are achieved properly and an organized record of items in storage is maintained.</li><li>Audits weekly activity records to ensure accurate daily statistics are produced.</li><li>Coordinates the distribution of corporate materials as necessary.</li><li>Ensures that security policy for visitors is handled properly and followed.</li><li>Ensures that proper levels of required supplies are maintained.</li><li>Ensures that mail is handled in an expedited manner.</li><li>Performs duties or projects as needed by the General Manager.</li>  </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>High School Diploma required, Bachelor's Degree preferred</li><li>At least 5 years of Manager/Supervision experience.</li><li>Computer applications using MS Office based software.</li><li>KRONOS, payroll system experience</li><li>Must be flexible in adapting to changing environments</li><li>Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.</li><li>Excellent analytical and mathematical skills.</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills.</li><li>Experience in Distribution/fulfillment center.</li><li>Human resources experience preferred.</li><li>Bi-lingual (French) is preferred, not required.</li>  </ul> <strong>Other:</strong> <ul> <li>Ability and availability to work irregular or extended hours including nights, weekends and holidays as needed by the customer.</li><li>Must be able to stand/walk for up to 10-12 hours.</li><li>Lift and move up to 50 pounds.</li><li>Regular bending, lifting, stretching and reaching both below the waist and above the head.</li><li>Walking in the FC and around area with great frequency; facilities are over a quarter mile in length.</li><li>Should be able to work in environments with variable noise levels, lighting conditions and temperature variation and able to access all areas of building without limitations</li> </ul>

Title: Housekeeping Team Lead
Job_Description: A Housekeeping Inspector is responsible for inspecting designated guest rooms and/or public areas in the hotel's continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability.<br/><br/><strong>What will I be doing?</strong><br/><br/>As a Housekeeping Inspector you will be responsible inspecting designated guest rooms and/or public areas in the hotel's continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability. Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards: <ul> <li>Inspect rooms, verify and report status and/or discrepancies of rooms and enter into property management system (as needed)</li><li>Complete work orders, as needed - Perform Room Attendant and/or House person duties, as needed</li><li>Assist in training Room Attendants, as needed</li><li>Respond to special guest requests in a timely, friendly and efficient manner</li> </ul>  <strong>What are we looking for?</strong><br/><br/>Housekeeping Inspectors serving Hilton Brand hotels are always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow: <ul>  <li>Previous experience in a Housekeeping supervisory role</li><li>A successful track record of managing a team</li><li>Strong organizational and analytic skills</li><li>An attention to details</li><li>Strong communication skills</li><li>A passion for delivering exceptional levels of guest service</li><li>Proficiency, preferred, with computers and computer programs, including Microsoft Office</li> </ul>  <strong>What will it be like to work for Hilton?</strong><br/><br/>Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all! <br/><br/> EOE/AA/Disabled/Veterans

Title: New Product Development Manager
Job_Description: <strong>New Product Development Manager</strong> <br/> Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> The position of New Product Development Manager is to lead and contribute to R & D programs. Leads and manages the design/plan/validation and implementation of new packaging technologies, line extensions, package/product improvement and technical service that meet product offering requirements. Works closely with Technical, Marketing, Operations, and suppliers to ensure packaging objectives are met and implement effective strategies to optimize packaging. <br/><br/> Our client expands and shares their expertise in packaging technology, new product development, and product improvement initiatives so these can profit their business partners. If you are dedicated to set the highest standard for your line of work this might be the opportunity for you. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong>   <ul> <li>Candidates from Calgary, Alberta are considered or who willing to relocate to Calgary, Alberta;</li>  <li>Graduate/Bachelors degree in related field (Packaging Engineering, Chemistry, Food Science etc.);</li>  <li>5-10 years experience in the packaging industry required;</li>  <li>5 years experience in new product development required;</li>  <li>5 years experience in a management role required;</li>  <li>Project Management experience required with the understanding of experimental and analytical research processes and interpretations;</li>  <li>Must be able to speak, read, write and understand the English language at a level adequate to perform job functions;</li>  <li>Ability to apply safe practices and procedures for performing the essential functions of the job;</li>  <li>Ability to apply logical thinking to solve problems or accomplish tasks;</li>  <li>Ability to understand and follow oral and written directions promptly and accurately;</li>  <li>Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of individuals;</li>  <li>Work well in a progressive, team-oriented environment;</li>  <li>Have a positive attitude and be a self-starter.</li> </ul>  <strong>Essential duties</strong>   <ul> <li>Plans, organizes, coordinates and leads the development and implementation for key packaging projects;</li>  <li>Influences project direction by providing end-users input through the planning and decision-making process;</li>  <li>Develops product concepts that are innovative, high-quality, cost-appropriate, that satisfies all stakeholders (customer, manufacturing, material, etc.) needs and requirements through the full product realization value stream;</li>  <li>Uses prior knowledge and experience to create and build an innovative pipeline with solid ideas;</li>  <li>Provides expertise, keeping abreast of technical developments and proposes projects to capitalize (cost savings, innovation, material science, and quality improvement projects);</li>  <li>Oversees the development of packaging specifications, in-process control points and establishes testing requirements and operating guidelines. Provides complete, accurate specifications to help ensure the optimal execution of packaging projects;</li>  <li>Conducts validation of packaging equipment, packaging validation, packaging development, selection of sampling plans for packaging testing, and in-process controls at the end-user level. Supports and manages process validation activities from a planning and technical perspective. Utilizes technical expertise to ensure success upon launch;</li>  <li>Conducts deliverable reviews (including design reviews) to make sure projects are meeting requirements and that remaining risks and work are understood, and that deliverables are achievable;</li>  <li>Supports, coordinates and conducts trials and startup of new products and cost reduction projects;</li>  <li>Ensures all activities in compliance with established safety standards and Good Manufacturing Procedures (GMPs);</li>  <li>Creates intellectual property and assists with the filing of patent applications;</li>  <li>Assists process development, operations and technical groups in developing and implementing process improvements;</li>  <li>Prepares, presents and follows up on research proposals and project documentation.</li> </ul>

Title: Retail Key Account Manager
Job_Description: <strong>A Career in Beer:</strong> <br/><br/> Our purpose at Molson Coors is to delight the world’s beer drinkers. We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world. We’re TalentBrewers - we believe in our brands and our people, we believe that a truly inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate self-starters who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get fired up about making a real difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you. <br/><br/> <strong>The Headlines<em>:</em> </strong> <br/><br/> In the role of Retail Key Account Manager (KAM) working in Alberta, you will be part of the Canadian Commercial Team. The person will be responsible for the development and execution of the strategies for a group of key Retail customers. The KAM will be measured on their ability to deliver short term and long term sustainable profit and volume growth for Molson Coors while delivering against the specific needs of their customers. <br/><br/> This position reports to Anthony Purchase the Director of Sales, Alberta and will be based out of Calgary, AB. The role works closely with the members of the Commercial team, leadership teams and has cross-functional touchpoints in many parts of the business. They also communicate and coordinate with field sales (and other departments) daily on where appropriate to execute customer/brand plans. <br/><br/> <strong>The Responsibilities<em>:</em></strong> <ul> <li>Responsible for achieving sustainable share and profit growth, as per annual operating plan, and in alignment with Molson Coors Canada’s First Choice ambition</li><li>Through a First Choice Lens, build and support relationships with key customers, business partners, industry associations, government and suppliers to provide winning value and optimize go-to-market strategies and priorities</li><li>Improve Molson Coors Canada’s Outlet Execution quality by embedding and evolving Molson Coors Field Sales Management</li><li>Maintain and develop strong customer relationships and customer matched contact list</li><li>Ensure solid results management fundamentals including financial and volume forecasting, post-activity evaluation, and market opportunity identification and pursuit</li> </ul> <strong>The Other Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>You love a challenge. You complete complex projects quickly and adeptly with your understanding of the business priorities. You act with appropriate urgency to various market events and trends that require a quick turnaround in plans and strategy</li> <li>You are confident and competent. You are diplomatic, professional and exercise great judgment in developing and maintaining excellent business relationships within the business</li> <li>You are a motivated leader that can inspire others; you respect your commitments and are able to obtain optimal results from your team through respect and development</li> <li>You are a skilled negotiator focused on the client; your constant curiosity fosters your innovative style and you can equally execute ideas given to you</li> </ul>  <ul> <li>You exhibit our core values and demonstrate our Molson Coors Success Factors</li><li>You have a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing or other relevant field;</li><li>You have 3-5 years of sales/marketing experience in a packaged goods or beverage alcohol industry, with 1-2 years’ experience in handling key/national accounts.</li> <li>As part of the recruitment process, the candidates will be required to provide consent to complete a criminal background check (if locally applicable).</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Work Perks that You Need to Know About<em>:</em></strong> <ul> <li>We’re one of Canada's Most Attractive Employers</li><li>As the world’s family brewer we have the scale to make big things happen and still get to know colleagues on a first name basis across the globe</li><li>We play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks – giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are.</li><li>Flexible work programs like working from home, no meetings after 1pm on Fridays, year-long summer hours and flexible start and end times</li><li>You can become a Certified Beer Enthusiast through in-house training that includes everything from brewing techniques to beer tasting and food pairings</li> <li>Access to cool brand clothing and swag, top events, beer allotment, an Employee Assistance Program and discount plans</li><li>Participation in our Total Rewards program with a competitive base salary, incentive plans, parental leave, health, dental and pension benefits</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Molson Coors: Building Careers in Beer</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Molson Coors Canada is an Equal Opportunity Employer; we are dedicated to providing our employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Molson Coors Canada are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications. Our employees are our greatest asset, we have accommodation process in place, by supporting our employee’s ability to work effectively and providing them with the tools they need to succeed, we are ensuring that Molson Coors Canada is the kind of company where talented people of all backgrounds want to work. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.</em>

Title: Manager, National Tax
Job_Description: At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career. <br/><br/> Join the momentum. We are seeking a Manager for our growing National Tax team. Delivering quality in everything we do, MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Our Tax team works with individuals and organizations in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors providing comprehensive strategies that minimize risk, meet tax compliance and reporting requirements, drive efficiencies and maximize returns. Specifically, our National Tax team works internally to support the delivery of tax services, the development and coordination of tax training materials and the communication of tax matters throughout the firm. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Expectations</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop and maintain firm standards, processes and tools for use by all MNP team members in the delivery of tax services to our clients</li><li>Assist with troubleshooting queries relating to preparation of tax returns through the firm’s tax software</li><li>Manage and maintain tax templates utilized by MNP team members in accordance with the latest tax updates</li><li>Develop internal training materials and practice aids to support the implementation of firm standards</li><li>Facilitate and assist with firm-wide learning & development events as needed</li><li>Research and keep up to date with the latest changes in local tax legislation as well as draft internal and external tax publications</li><li>Issue tax technical research and information/support to professionals throughout the firm</li> <li>Prepare and participate in internal tax compliance and planning projects</li>  </ul>  <strong>Credentials</strong>  <ul> <li>Completion of a Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation</li><li>Completion of level 1 and 2 of the In-Depth Tax Program</li><li>Four (4) or more years of relevant work experience in the tax practice of a public accounting firm</li> <li>Extensive knowledge of and experience working in Canadian Tax</li><li>Solid understanding of business, accounting, management and practice development principles</li><li>Experience preparing and reviewing domestic tax compliance and implementing tax reorganizations</li><li>Experience working with accounting and tax software such as Caseware, Profile and Taxprep</li><li>Strong computer literacy including effective working skills of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint</li><li>Proven technical writing and research skills</li><li>Demonstrated project management abilities</li> <li>Prior experience with private companies and owner-manager taxation is considered an asset</li> </ul>  <strong>Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics</strong>  <ul> <li><strong>Integrity –</strong> professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships</li><li><strong>Energy –</strong> displays enthusiasm, optimism and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle</li><li><strong>Diversity –</strong> understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences</li><li><strong>Communication –</strong> effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others that make an impact and persuade their intended audience(s)</li><li><strong>Client Service Excellence –</strong> understands the importance of quality client service, proactively identifies client needs and creates strategies to proficiently serve clients</li><li><strong>Business Development –</strong> looks for and seizes profitable business opportunities while focusing on the ability to gain increased presence in the community</li> <li><strong>Forward Thinking –</strong> anticipates the implications of situations, takes appropriate action as needed and prepares for possible contingencies</li><li><strong>Agility with Change –</strong> initiates, sponsors and implements change by taking a facilitative catalyst role</li> <li><strong>People Management & Leadership –</strong> goal-driven leader who effectively manages self, others and teams to achieve goals</li><li><strong>Coaching –</strong> takes responsibility for one’s own and team members’ performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals, promptly addresses performance issues, is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making</li><li><strong>Accuracy –</strong> pays close attention to detail and ensures work and information are complete and thorough</li> </ul>  MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events and professional development assistance. <br/><br/> MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world. <br/><br/> <strong>#LI-KM2</strong>

Title: Manager, HR
Job_Description: <div>COMPANY PROFILE <br/><br/> Headquartered in Tomball, Texas, BJ Services is the largest North American-focused, pure-play pressure pumping services provider. BJ Services provides hydraulic fracturing and cementing services to leading upstream oil and gas companies engaged in the exploration and production of North American oil and natural gas resources. We operate field locations serving all major North American oil and natural gas shale basins. Our shared culture is built by an unwavering pursuit for perfecting operational execution in the oilfield. <br/><br/> POSITION LOCATION <br/><br/> Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> MAIN DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES <br/><br/> Responsible for ensuring strong HR partnership with the business and supporting the employee experience by coaching people leaders to hire, inspire, develop, and retain the talented employees that create customer success. Title: Manager, Real Estate Finance
Job_Description: <DIV>CIBC is a leading Canadian-based global financial institution. Through our three major businesses – Retail and Business Banking, Wealth Management and Wholesale Banking – we provide a full range of financial products and services to 11 million individual, small business, commercial, corporate and institutional clients in Canada and around the world. We invest in our businesses, our clients, our people and our communities to deliver consistent and sustainable earnings to our shareholders. To learn more about CIBC’s Lines of Business, please visit our website. </DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>CIBC delivers access to career and development opportunities, safe and healthy workplaces, effective training, and positive work-life balance – so that employees are able to perform at their best, contribute to their communities and focus on cultivating deeper relationships with our clients.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Every year, CIBC is recognized for its business successes, community commitment and employee initiatives. We are proud of these successes and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace and an environment where all employees can excel. </DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>To learn more about CIBC and the CIBC Group of Companies please visit <U>CIBC.com</U><U>.</U> </DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV> <P><B>CIBC Real Estate Finance Division</B> focuses exclusively on providing financing to real estate companies on both an interim/construction and term basis across Canada. The team is comprised of experienced real estate professionals with offices located in Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton Toronto, Ottawa, London, Hamilton and Montreal. We apply industry expertise to offer full-service financial solutions to real estate companies and users across Canada.</P> <P> </P></DIV> <DIV><B>Job Overview</B></DIV> <DIV>As part of the Real Estate Finance team, the Manager will be responsible for the development and delivery of credit and strategic solutions for Canada’s leading real estate companies – taking lead responsibility for mid-tier clients and prospects, and serving an integral support role to the Director on major strategic relationships. </DIV> <DIV>Success will be measured, both, in terms of the Manager’s individual performance as well as his/her contribution to the achievement of the team’s objectives.</DIV> <DIV><B> </B></DIV> <DIV><B>What You’ll Be Doing</B></DIV> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> </DIV> <DIV><B><U>Business Development</U></B></DIV> <DIV>Working with other team members, to develop proposals for clients and prospective clients regarding senior and mezzanine credit. </DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Identify and analyze business opportunities and determine the feasibility of potential financing transactions.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Conduct industry research to determine industry trends and drivers.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Develop/interpret financial models, including the assumptions and methodology.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Liaise with other units of CIBC, creating and leading account teams in the crafting of proposals.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Lead and/or assist in preparation of discussion papers, offering memorandums, credit agreements and marketing materials.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Lead and conduct transactional due diligence.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Originate new client relationships that leverage knowledge and expertise, CIBC’s capabilities and that meet CIBC risk tolerances and profitability hurdles, to grow the Commercial Banking business. </DIV></LI></UL> <DIV><B><U>Portfolio Management</U></B></DIV> <DIV>Conducting annual/interim account reviews.</DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Monitor risk status of loan portfolio and, as needed, re-define and re-negotiate loan structures.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Update the client's history, financial information, etc. and to identify new business opportunities.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Develop financing proposals and pricing strategies to ensure achievement of profitability hurdle rates (RAROC).</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Maintain ongoing correspondence with the bank’s risk management group.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Structure, negotiate and document credit arrangements with clients and prospects. Negotiate all terms of credit with Corporate & Commercial Adjudication (“CCA”) and appropriately assess risk in the relationship. Act as the Transaction Sponsor within CIBC. Ensure that all documentation is accurately captured and up-to-date.</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV><B><U>Relationship Management</U></B></DIV> <DIV>Broadening and deepening client ties.</DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Interact with clients, responding to questions and inquiries regarding products, services and advice.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Track industry developments, regulatory issues and economic trends and communicate their relevance to clients.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Attend client functions as appropriate.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Proactively assess client needs and propose products/solutions to meet those needs and the client’s broader business objectives. Ensure that clients continue to be aware of the benefits of using these products, as well as new products available to them. Continuously update knowledge on new products that may be of value to clients.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Demonstrate CIBC core values of Trust, Teamwork and Accountability, and provide support in a manner consistent with the highest quality standards and CIBC objectives.</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV><B>What We’re Looking For</B></DIV> <UL> <LI>5 years work experience in the real estate, financial services and/or advisory industry</LI> <LI>minimum of 2 years business development experience</LI> <LI>minimum of 2 years credit-related experience</LI> <LI>Small team leadership capabilities, with aspiration and ability to assume greater market facing and internal management responsibilities over time.</LI> <LI>Excellent analytical ability including demonstrated knowledge of valuation techniques and practices, including cash-flow analysis.</LI> <LI>Knowledge of accounting principles relating to financial statement preparation and business combinations.</LI> <LI>Demonstrated job commitment and motivation, and personal flexibility when needed to meet client requirements.</LI> <LI>Well-developed organizational skills in order to respond to shifting priorities on several simultaneous projects.</LI> <LI>Excellent interpersonal, presentation, oral and written communication skills in order to actively lead or participate in development and maintenance of productive relationships.</LI> <LI>Familiarity with Microsoft Office software including Excel modelling capabilities.</LI></UL> <DIV><B>What CIBC Can Offer You</B></DIV> <UL> <LI>Flexible health benefits, stock purchase plan, competitive incentive pay and recognition programs</LI> <LI> <DIV>Competitive salary and banking benefits </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Career growth, development and continuous learning opportunities</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Opportunity to be involved in CIBC events that help our communities</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Click to learn more about Rewards & Recognition, Learning & Development, and Employee Community Involvement</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>What You Need To Know</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Must be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work permit or study permit that allows the candidate to fulfill the requirements of the role</DIV> <DIV><B> </B></DIV></LI></UL>

Title: Client Relationship Manager
Job_Description: <strong><DIV>What YOU Do:</DIV> <br/> </strong> <br/> <strong></strong> <br/><br/> The Senior Client Service Manager is a client advocate within TELUS, championing the clients concerns and proactively communicating with clients for all service delivery and service assurance issues or escalations. In this role you will proactively manage the services, support and retention of select clients in both public and private sector, while developing long-term relationships with all levels of management within the customer’s organization. This role will work with the Sales and Solution teams to advise on technology and service delivery concepts in support of the client's strategic direction and business plan. <br/>  <br/> <strong></strong> <br/>  <br/> <strong><DIV>What YOU Get:</DIV>  <br/></strong>   <ul> <li>Opportunity to grow and maintain relationships with some of TELUS’ largest customers, and transform the underlying support model building on TELUS’ Customers First promise</li> <li>Great pay, profit sharing bonus, optional stock purchase plan, dedication to a diverse and inclusive team culture with loads of career development opportunities, flexible Total Rewards benefit plan with many innovative options and programs including a DC Pension, flexible work styles, and more</li> <li>Working within a collaborative team to deliver as promised</li> <li>We believe in spirited teamwork</LI> </ul>  <strong><DIV>YOU get to:</DIV>  <br/></strong>   <ul> <li>Develop long-term relationships with all levels of management acquiring feedback and aligning expectations with contractual deliverables to ensure overall customer satisfaction</li> <li>Facilitate and support a continuous service improvement culture thereby establishing value to the partnership beyond monetary value</li> <li>Ensure that contracted services are operating within expected profitability forecast - where required will work with extended stakeholder teams to improve EBITDA contributions accordingly</li> <li>Promote TELUS capabilities to the client</li> <li>Identify opportunities to support growth and provide feedback to the TELUS stakeholder teams</li> <li>Provide thought leadership and technical insight into client's business direction and decisions through a continual service improvement discipline</li> <li>Manage service level agreements including negotiating with the client</li> <li>Manage governance framework at varying levels within the client to ensure alignment on TELUS performance and priorities for the relationship</LI> </ul>  <strong><DIV>Key Accountabilities:</DIV>  <br/></strong>   <ul> <li><strong>Relationship Management</strong>: Establish and manage strategic partnerships to ensure overall customer satisfaction and deliver on contractual requirements</li> <li><strong>Escalation Management:</strong> Provide a single point of accountability (SPOA) in line with client expectations and TELUS service capabilities on a 7x24 basis</li> <li><strong>Incident Management:</strong> Support of post-incident review & investigations</li> <li><strong>Contract Management:</strong> Interpret, negotiate, and manage the delivery of operational obligations within the agreed to time frames</li> <li><strong>Financial Management:</strong> Help drive revenue growth and EBITDA improvements to the accounts</li> <li>Review of account income statement; profitability, loss while correlating revenue spikes to project activities, facilitating reviews on cost overruns with internal stakeholders</li> <li><strong>Stakeholder Management:</strong> Collaborate with stakeholder teams, assist in building, review and present standardized performance reporting to support daily, weekly, monthly, annual governance meetings; capture learnings and innovation to support continuous service improvement</li> <li><strong>Organizational Support:</strong> Leverage and empower the stakeholder community in fulfilling operational duties and contractual obligations</LI> </ul>  <strong><DIV>What YOU Bring:</DIV>  <br/></strong>   <ul> <li>Customers First passion</li> <li>Strong leadership attributes and abilities: Collaboration, communication, creative thinking and decision making skills</li> <li>Executive Communications: Executive acumen and communications; expert ability and proven experience simplifying complex concepts via PowerPoint presentations</li> <li>Proven experience working with and managing client relationships</li> <li>Ability to effectively identify, collect, and package data to support decisions against business priorities and or contractual obligations</li> <li>Excellent oral and written communications skills</li> <li>Knowledge of ICT industry technologies and services</li> <li>Highly motivated and self-sufficient, able to work successfully under pressure and in the face of ambiguity – proactively identify when it’s necessary to take certain steps and move ahead with confidence</li> <li>ITIL certification, professional certification in Business Relationship Management (e.g. BRMI) or equivalent work and educational experience is an asset</LI> </ul>  <DIV><strong>Who is TELUS?</strong></DIV> <br/> <strong><br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.</DIV> <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.</DIV> <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>Do you share our passion?</DIV> <br/> <strong></strong> <br/>  <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>At TELUS, <strong>you</strong> create future friendly® possibilities.</DIV> <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.</DIV></DIV>

Title: Strategic Account Manager
Job_Description: Strategic Account Manager , Sales , Industrial , Engineering, <br/><br/> Strategic Account Manager <br/> Calgary Alberta <br/> <strong>$170,000 - $200,000</strong> <br/><br/> A global Industrial Equipment organization with multiple offices worldwide are looking to add a Strategic Account Manager to their well-established sales division in their Calgary office. They have an excellent reputation within their sector and looking to add a strong Strategic Account Manager professional with experience in sales and client management to start as soon as possible. <br/><br/> In this role as a Strategic Account Manager you will be in charge of developing and supporting strategic account relationships to achieve profitable sales targets and strategic objectives. You are the primary point of contact for assigned clients, responsible for maintaining strong relationships and managing all client communication for sales and account development. Responsibilities will include; Build influential partnering relationships with key personnel in assigned accounts. Fully understand the customer's goals, needs and expectations are met. Be able to meet the goals, needs and expectations of the customer. Target information and solutions based on customer's requirements. Recommend and sell solutions that serve the customer's business objectives. Build Develop sustainable executive relationships with a network of contacts in his /her assigned accounts. Networks should include key customer personnel in procurement, engineering maintenance, operations(process owners) and senior management. Build and maintain a strategic profile of the customer including key locations in Canada, areas of business, projected short and long term spending plans. The profile should include competitive analysis at each customer location. Regularly visit key customer locations on an ongoing basis. Direct and manage customer activities across Canada for targeted accounts. Develop an intimate knowledge of the customer. Develop yearly sales plan based on market and product mix. Work closely with National Sales Manager & Marketing Manager to monitor and analyze market trends and competitive issues. Attend trade shows and seminars that add value from a technical business development point of view. Other duties as assigned by management. <br/><br/> To be successful in the position you will: have 10-15+ years of outside sales experience. Business & Strategic account development experience. Comfortable in an EPC environment (Engineering procurement consulting) Project sales experience - comfortable planning and implementing projects sales strategies. Instrumentation background preferred. Oil & Gas but more on the gas side and the oil on refineries and pipeline side or other related industries. Networking capabilities and ideally an existing network of connections in the industry. Effective communication skills. <br/><br/> For more information on this job please connect with us at your earliest opportunity. Please note while we thank all for their interest only those who are successful in moving on to the next stage will be contacted.
