Title: Marketing Manager
Job_Description: The role focuses on supporting, promoting and enhancing EY’s services and solutions to the Canadian Energy market and regionally in Alberta and Saskatchewan, along with additional national BMC initiatives as required. <br/> The successful candidate must be an organised self-starter with qualifications in marketing or a related discipline and have strong marketing experience in a B2B or professional services marketing environment. In addition, the candidate will have excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong project management and campaign management experience and be able to work part of a team. People skills are essential to ensure successful relationships are developed with a broad cross-section of internal and external stakeholders. <br/> In your role as a Marketing Manager you’ll: <br/> Drive integrated BMC multifaceted campaign, brand plans and events including managing project budgets and reporting on campaign return on investment (ROI) within allocated timeframes. <br/> Provide strategic advice and counsel to leadership on communications and branding strategies, internal engagement best practices and more. <br/> Lead local campaigns and projects, ensuring high-quality deliverables and execution of strategy from start to finish in a fast-paced environment. <br/> Help plan and develop branding and communications that drive marketing programs, such as thought leadership, advertising copy, drafting client invitations, webpages and digital content. <br/> Project manage strategic sponsorships or alliances that enable EY to position our brand as number 1 in the market and underpin our purpose of building a better working world. <br/> Manage a team of direct reports, empowering team members to support the full marketing mix, including large-scale brand activation programs, sponsorships, speaking engagements, hosted events, PR, social media and thought leadership, internal engagement, sector marketing and corporate responsibility to ensure tactics are aligned and consistent with market segment goals. <br/> Support the BMC transformation by implementing process improvement and designing support models to drive efficiencies through our marketing programs. <br/> We’re looking for people with the following experience: <br/> 7+ years of integrated marketing experience <br/> Bachelors or Master’s degree in marketing, journalism, communications or public relations <br/> B2B financial services or professional services marketing experience highly preferred <br/> First-class communication skills - excellent written and oral communications (including presentations) as well as listening and interpretation skills <br/> Project management and budget management is essential <br/> Proven ability to work cross functionally, and strong track record of developing and implementing high profile events <br/> Cross border teaming experience essential <br/> Ability to be self-motivated, solution focused, and experienced at managing internal and external client relationships

Title: Senior Product Manager
Job_Description: <div><div><strong>Who You Are:</strong> <br/><br/> Are you passionate about products and their ability to delight customers? Are you equally expert in solving customer, business and technology puzzles? Do you have a proven track record in delivering innovative solutions in modern technologies? Do you love building and leading world-class teams? Would you enjoy working with a highly collaborative, passionate, fun-loving group of people? If so, then we have the career opportunity of your life, as the Senior Product Manager at Getty Images. <br/><br/> Getty Images is the worlds leading creator and distributor of still imagery, video, music and other premium content. Our goal is to inspire communicators - and give them the tools to create inspiring work of their own. You have the opportunity to transform the way creators use digital media to communicate their ideas. <br/><br/> <strong>Your Next Challenge:</strong> <br/><br/> Our Product Management team is responsible for the creation, development and management of products across our global organization, including Getty Images and iStock. The Senior Product Manager for Getty Images is advanced in their product management skillset and will lead large, strategic initiatives on the site or platforms, with a specific focus on developing new experiences that delight customers and solve their pain points. You will be responsible for defining execution product strategy, business models, developing and executing a roadmap, operating and improving business results for high-potential areas of the business. <br/><br/> The Senior Product Manager for Getty Images will work cross-functionally with senior leadership, general managers, sales, marketing, business & user intelligence, and technology to translate this strategy into action whether it be launching new products and services, or optimizing those already in market. This will be done while keeping a very keen eye toward driving commercial success through KPIs. Any new strategies will need to be validated by robust analysis with both a customer and competitive lens to ensure we meet both current and future business requirements. <ul> <li>Ability to define Customer problems and deliver an execution strategy (requirements, prioritization, roadmaps) to solve those painpoints.</li><li>Own every aspect of experiences being launched by defining and reviewing key performance metrics, aggregating user feedback and reporting performance to a broad group of stakeholders on a regular basis</li><li>Develop and own the product backlog. Maintain a clear ranking of priorities for the development team to effectively plan and deliver against.</li><li>Work closely with Content, Operations, Sales, Business Intelligence, Finance, Marketing and Technology to execute in a way that maximizes the companys overarching strategies and approach.</li><li>Drive the development of market insights, competitive analysis, audience opportunity, etc. Analyze trends by region, customer segment, distribution channel, content source and product line to strengthen current market position and identify potential opportunities. Proactively evolve plans on the basis of such market intelligence. Turn strategy into a value proposition and actionable plans.</li><li>Deliver value in-market on an ongoing and iterative basis using the lean agile methodology.</li> </ul> <strong>What Youll Need:</strong> <ul> <li>5+ years relevant experience in web or digital product management</li><li>Proven track record of successful product management, including development and launch of new products, preferably including mobile and video</li><li>Experience with content-based business preferred</li><li>Experience in strategic planning or consulting experience a plus</li><li>High level of maturity and confidence</li><li>Experience with lean agile development preferred.</li><li>Experience in managing and delivering multiple complex projects across functional, geographic and cultural borders</li><li>Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Experience working in a fast paced creative environment. Must be flexible and comfortable in a state of change</li><li>A history of positive peer feedback as a collaborator and communicator who drives results</li><li>Relevant Bachelors Degree; MBA preferred</li> </ul> #LI-AC1 <br/><br/> <strong>Who We Are:</strong> <br/><br/> Getty Images is the most trusted and esteemed source of visual content in the world, with over 200 million assets available through its industry-leading sites www.gettyimages.com and www.istock.com. The Getty Images website serves creative, business and media customers in almost 200 countries and is the first place people turn to discover, purchase and share powerful content from the world's best photographers and videographers. Getty Images works with over 200,000 contributors and hundreds of image partners to provide comprehensive coverage of more than 130,000 news, sport and entertainment events, impactful creative imagery to communicate any commercial concept and the world's deepest digital archive of historic photography. <br/><br/> Visit Getty Images at www.gettyimages.com to learn more about how the company is advancing the unique role of still and moving imagery in communication and business, and enabling creative ideas to come to life. For company news and announcements, visit our Press Room, and for the stories and inspiration behind our content, visit Stories & Trends. Find Getty Images on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterest and Tumblr, or download the Getty Images app where you can explore, save and share the world's best imagery. <br/><br/> Getty Images is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace.</div></div>

Title: Infrastructure Services Team Lead
Job_Description: <strong>BE Totally Engaged. BE Business Savvy. BE the Right Partner</strong>. Be all that and more at Colliers Project Leaders. Join our team as an Infrastructure Services Lead in Calgary, AB. <br/><br/> At Colliers Project Leaders, we help our clients succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed. <br/><br/> In this role, you’ll join our team of experts who lead building and infrastructure projects. Through our <strong>Get it Right Solution™,</strong> you’ll ensure we get it ready, get it built and get it performing -- so investors, owners and occupants are certain of success. <br/><br/> This is a senior leadership opportunity for a professional who is ready to take on the challenge of growing an established service offering within a recognized project leadership company. <br/><br/> With over 600 employees and 27 + office locations throughout Canada and the Middle East, Colliers Project Leaders offers a multi-cultural, multi-generational work environment where we cultivate excellence, develop leaders and deliver on our clients’ vision. Colliers Project Leaders is part of Colliers International Group Inc. (NASDAQ: CIGI; TSX: CIGI), an industry leading global real estate with more than 16,000 skilled professionals operating in 66 countries. To learn more about Colliers Project Leaders, visit www.colliersprojectleaders.com. <br/><br/> We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> We’re looking for an experienced professional who is looking for the right opportunity to leverage their strong reputation in the municipal infrastructure into a successful leadership role. You bring a wealth of experience leading projects varying in scope and complexity in municipal civil works, water and waste water facilities, heavy civil works, bridges, transportation infrastructure, major land development, and various other forms of horizontal infrastructure. <br/><br/> You’re already known as a trusted advisor to your clients and have built strong, lasting relationships with senior leaders in large municipalities in Alberta that can be leveraged to develop further opportunities to support capital project delivery. You bring in-depth knowledge and have led and managed complex infrastructure projects from start to finish – on time and on budget. <br/><br/> Are you looking to build upon your reputation as a project leader to make a difference for new clients and businesses? Look no further. <br/><br/> <strong>What success looks like:</strong> <ul> <li>You’ve led a number of municipal and civil infrastructure projects, varying in size and scope ideally in either bridges, transportation, land development or other horizontal infrastructure sectors</li><li>Your clients trust you and rely on your knowledge, skills and expertise to achieve their business goals and objectives.</li> <li>Your clients are impressed with your ability to represent their best interests regarding contractual and technical issues</li><li>You are a subject matter expert in the infrastructure sector, developing and growing business and the team within the region</li><li>Your project teams rely on your ability to manage change, communicate and coordinate between multiple stakeholders, resolve issues, and deliver projects on time and on budget</li><li>You maintain contact with existing and prospective clients and respond to business development and sales opportunities with support from the Business Development Team, Principal or Regional Vice President</li> </ul> <strong>What you bring:</strong> <ul> <li>A university degree or diploma in civil engineering or an equivalent engineering discipline</li><li>At least 15 to 20 years of experience in project coordination and management, representing owners to deliver projects of varying size and scope on horizontal infrastructure and large civil projects</li><li>A solid foundation of experience, track record and reputation as a professional consultant to owners and developers of horizontal infrastructure and large civil projects</li><li>Strong relationships with large municipalities and demonstrated prior experience delivering large profile projects for municipal, regional, provincial or federal authorities</li><li>Understanding of development charges and knowledge of the municipal environment including the functioning of various departments in municipalities and cities</li><li>Professional industry credentials such as PMP, P.Eng., CET, or other similar industry recognized designation is considered a strong asset</li><li>Experience with the preparation of Requests for Proposals, Tenders and Tender Closing/Award procedures</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus skills and experience:</strong> <ul> <li>Strong leadership and organizational skills with a proven ability to effectively influence others and resolve client, project and technical issues</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills</li><li>Proficient in MS Project, MS Word and MS Excel</li> </ul>

Title: Senior Manager, U.S. Personal Tax
Job_Description: At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career. <br/><br/> Join the momentum. We are seeking a Senior Manager for our growing U.S. Personal Tax team. Providing the highest level of excellence, MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Our Tax team works with individuals and organizations in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors providing comprehensive strategies that minimize risk, meet tax compliance and reporting requirements, drive efficiencies and maximize returns. Specifically, our U.S. Personal Tax team assists businesses with cross-border issues to strategically plan and manage their tax liability. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Expectations</strong> <ul> <li><div>Lead multiple client facing engagement teams responsible for the completion of U.S. personal tax engagements involving advice on tax planning opportunities, tax minimization strategies, and compliance issues</div></li><li><div>Assist organizations in deciding which US corporate structure will be the most effective from a tax perspective – subsidiary, branch, or joint-venture partnership; as well as assisting clients in choosing effective methods of capitalization and financing that are efficient</div></li><li><div>Accountable for the delivery of industry and technical expertise relating to complex tax and assurance issues through high quality deliverables such as: client interactions, reports, technical work, and management presentations</div></li><li><div>Perform due diligence or modeling with respect to potential acquisitions by Canadian entities of US subsidiaries, partnerships or business operations</div></li><li><div>Review domestic/international federal and multi-state corporate/partnership information returns</div></li><li><div>Manage project financials (budgets, WIPS, timely billing and collection and variance recognition)</div></li><li><div>Correspond with team members and clients in response to specific personal tax queries</div> </li><li><div>Review, investigate and correct discrepancies and irregularities in financial entries and reports</div> </li><li><div>Research client issues that arise from compliance or planning work such as the effects of various tax treaty provisions on the taxpayer (capital gains, dividends, business profits, etc.)</div></li><li><div>Contribute to the preparation and delivery of competitive proposals to meet client needs</div></li><li><div>Collaborate with client engagement team prior to commencement of client work to discuss roles and responsibilities, risk areas, materiality and deadlines</div></li><li><div>Think strategically about client needs by understanding their business and key risks</div></li><li><div>Identify ways to maximize the relationship with clients and deliver added value</div></li><li><div>Maintain high quality control by reviewing tax returns and other work done from other team members for accuracy and completeness; provide feedback to team members</div></li><li><div>Monitor project timelines against targets, adjust where necessary; advise clients of project status and seek clarification on discrepancies where applicable</div></li><li><div>Network and take a leadership role in the local professional, business, and community while raising awareness of MNP and looking for new business development opportunities</div></li><li><div>Leverage team appropriately to ensure proper documentation is prepared for the client and procedures relating to the file are followed accordingly</div></li><li><div>Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes</div></li><li><div>Develop, coach, and train team members towards professional and personal development</div></li><li><div>Conduct formal, written annual performance reviews</div></li><li><div>Promote regular attendance, balanced lifestyle and high standard of team wellness</div></li><li><div>Attend internal MNP courses to further develop accounting and assurance knowledge</div></li> </ul> <strong>Credentials</strong> <ul> <li><div>Completion of a Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation or U.S. Certified Public Accountant (CPA) designation</div></li><li><div>Working towards or possesses a Master’s Degree in U.S. Taxation or Law or Member of the Bar is considered an asset</div></li><li><div>Five (5) to eight (8) years of relevant work experience in public accounting and/or tax consulting</div> </li><li><div>Extensive knowledge of and experience working in U.S. Personal Tax</div></li><li><div>Solid understanding of business, accounting, management and practice development principles</div></li><li><div>Experience preparing and reviewing S. tax compliance and implementing of tax reorganizations</div></li><li><div>Working knowledge of transfer pricing tax concepts</div></li><li><div>Experience working with, or exposure to, accounting and tax software such as CaseWare, GoSystem, ProSystem and Profile</div></li><li><div>Strong computer literacy including effective working skills of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint</div></li><li><div>Some travel may be required</div></li> </ul> <strong>Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Integrity –</strong> professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships</li><li><strong>Energy –</strong> displays enthusiasm, optimism and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle</li><li><strong>Diversity –</strong> understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences</li><li><strong>Communication –</strong> effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others that make an impact and persuade their intended audience(s)</li><li><strong>Client Service Excellence –</strong> understands the importance of quality client service, proactively identifies client needs and creates strategies to proficiently serve clients</li><li><strong>Business Development –</strong> looks for and seizes profitable business opportunities while focusing on the ability to gain increased presence in the community</li> <li><strong>Forward Thinking -</strong> anticipates the implications of situations, takes appropriate action as needed and prepares for possible contingencies</li><li><strong>Agility with Change –</strong> initiates, sponsors and implements change by taking a facilitative catalyst role</li> <li><strong>People Management & Leadership –</strong> goal-driven leader who effectively manages self, others and teams to achieve goals</li><li><strong>Coaching –</strong> takes responsibility for one’s own and team members’ performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals, promptly addresses performance issues, is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making</li> </ul> MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events, and professional development assistance. <br/><br/> MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world. <br/><br/> #LI-MM2

Title: Manager, Investment Operations, Global Asset Management
Job_Description: The Manager of Investment Operations will be one of the main escalation points for issues of investment operations to effectively and efficiently support the business in its day to day activities including accuracy and completeness of Investment Book of Record (IBOR). Responsibilities include: oversight of portfolio accounting, trade settlement, reconciliations, corporate actions, performance reporting, application support, client billing & input into client statements and participate/lead business projects as necessary. The Manager of Investment Operations is one of the escalation point for the team and will work to resolve issues as well as work closely with the Head of Investment Operations on daily deliverables and projects. <br/><br/> Business Delivery and Operations <br/><br/> · Provide guidance to the team to ensure accuracy and completeness of Investment Book of Record (IBOR), portfolio accounting, trade settlement, reconciliations, corporate actions, performance reporting, application support, client billing and input into client statements <br/><br/> · Oversee creation of new accounts, benchmarks and indexes for Institutional client accounts <br/><br/> · Work with other Investment Operations/Business Technology team members to make sure system is up to and functioning during required hours <br/><br/> · Provide internal expertise and support to Portfolio Management and Trading Systems processes <br/><br/> · Supports the team that provides Portfolio Managers and Traders with on-going problem resolution. Address portfolio manager/trader requests including ad-hoc reporting, production run inquiries, prices issues and provide necessary support and development for the portfolio management systems <br/><br/> · Act as one of the escalation point for issues on daily processes, work to resolve, escalate as necessary <br/><br/> · Work on internal controls and oversight of day to day processes <br/><br/> · Maintain appropriate KPIs for Management Reporting and also review KPIs of external partners <br/><br/> · Assist in the development of procedural documentation to support work flow changes, new system functionality, and/or operational changes <br/><br/> · Develop and maintain relationships with internal and external business partners such as Fund Accounting, custodians <br/><br/> · Work closely with and provide support to Head of Investment Operations and Head of Operations as required <br/><br/> Project Management and Implementation <br/><br/> · Participate in project initiatives where applicable to support operational effectiveness, regulatory change as well as strategic direction, including system upgrades, conversations and new applications and processes <br/><br/> People Management <br/><br/> · Provide direction and guidance to other team members as escalation point for issues. <br/><br/> · Provide input to Head of Investment Operations for staff communication of objectives, accountabilities and performance evaluation <br/><br/> · Work with the Head of Investment Operations to optimize team integration by articulating the mandates and authorities of roles on the team and how roles within the team work collaboratively with one other to fulfill team objectives <br/><br/> Qualifications <br/><br/> Knowledge: <br/><br/> University degree or college diploma <br/><br/> Experience in asset management firm (10 years) <br/><br/> Successful completion of Canadian Securities Course <br/><br/> Graduate courses such as CPA, CFA, MBA would be an asset <br/><br/> Strong knowledge of markets which would include investment management strategies, most financial instruments and products, different client types and accounts, etc. <br/><br/> Knowledge of investment management and trading systems and processes <br/><br/> Strong working knowledge of securities and portfolio accounting processes/products and related procedures <br/><br/> Experience in problem analysis and resolution <br/><br/> Strong working knowledge MS Excel, VBA Macros preferred. <br/><br/> Expert working knowledge of Asset management software: SimCorp Dimension, SS&C Net <br/><br/> Strong working knowledge of other software: Charles River, Vermillion and Custodial systems <br/><br/> Skills: <br/><br/> Experience managing or supervising a team is preferred and an asset <br/><br/> Detail-oriented <br/><br/> Strong analytical, decision making, problem solving, and planning skills <br/><br/> Organized, efficient, accurate and ability to prioritize and meet deadlines <br/><br/> Ability to identify problems and independently identify well researched and documented solutions, escalating to management as required <br/><br/> Takes initiative, ownership and personal responsibility <br/><br/> Strong communication skills (written and verbal) <br/><br/> Able to multi-task and thrive in a rapidly changing environment

Title: Manager, Administrative Services Department, Cumming School of Medicine
Job_Description: <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> The <strong>Administrative Services Department</strong> in the <strong>Cumming School of Medicine</strong> is currently seeking a Full-time Limited Term <strong>Manager</strong> for approximately 12 months. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manager, Administrative Services Department, Cumming School of Medicine, the Administrative Services Manager will take a proactive role in assisting in the organization and management of the administrative support staff who currently support approximately 400 faculty members within the Cumming School of Medicine. <br/><br/> The Administrative Services Manager role will be the first point of contact for all administrative support staff issues, including full cycle recruitment, performance management, direct workflow, training, supervision, involvement with disciplinary action, implementation and coordination of the University of Calgary policies and procedures. The role is complex as the organization is structured as a matrix organization and there is an expectation that the Administrative Services Manager will work with internal and external clients while managing the daily administrative operations. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Key Responsibilities</strong> (job functions include but are not limited to): <ul> 	<li>Coordination of business practices, business processes, communication, development of best practices, troubleshooting and liaison for all central administrative staff</li>	<li>Develops procedures/practices to streamline administrative work to create administrative and service efficiencies</li>	<li>Formulation and implementation of policies, strategies, tactics and processes that are critical to the functioning of the Administrative Services Department</li>	<li>Ongoing communication and liaison with outside stakeholders such CLS, ACB and AHS as well as internal stakeholders such as department and institute leadership</li>	<li>Responsible for the full cycle recruitment and hiring of Administrative staff</li>	<li>Directs and supports the work of the Administrative Assistants by meeting regularly to discuss workplace issues and provide guidance in areas of work equity, space issues and workplace conflict</li>	<li>Responsible for decision-making and recommendations regarding the Administrative Services Department</li>	<li>Complete performance evaluations feedback, job profiles and staff development</li>	<li>Responsible for dealing with confidential and sensitive matters pertaining to work related issues of the Administrative Support Staff Team</li>	<li>Responsible for understanding and applying the AUPE Collective Agreement for the University of Calgary. Liaises with HR Services in the management of Administrative Assistants attendance, sick leave, workplace accommodations, conflict and other personnel matters</li>	<li>Develops processes and procedures to streamline administrative work to create service efficiencies while working in accordance with the University of Calgary policies and procedures</li>	<li>Support staff to develop professionally in their roles</li>	<li>Ensures Administrative Services Team receives relevant training and that knowledge transfer/cross-training occurs in order to continually develop strong administrative skills within team</li>	<li>Develops and implements administrative guidelines to meet faculty needs. Provides quality leadership to the Administrative Services Team, develops positive working relationships with staff as well as faculty members and external and internal stakeholders</li>	<li>Manage staff time-off requests; vacation, flex and overtime liability in accordance with AUPE Collective Agreement and University of Calgary Policies and Procedures</li>	<li>Act as role model and mentor to new, existing and temporary staff to ensure staff feel supported in their roles</li>	<li>Timely approval of all payroll exceptions ensuring department and university policies and procedures are adhered to at all time</li>	<li>Ensures employees work in a positive, safe and healthy work environment</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications / Requirements:</strong> <ul> 	<li>Post-secondary Degree/Diploma preferable in Business Management, or a related field</li>	<li>3 to 5 or more years of directly related management and administration experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience</li>	<li>Experience managing/supervising in a unionized environment an asset. Previous experience supervising and leading a team is required</li>	<li>Technical expertise and knowledge of complex University systems processes is considered to be a strong asset</li>	<li>Excellent computer skills including proficiency with Microsoft Office is required</li>	<li>Demonstrated understanding of a collective agreement and interpretations</li>	<li>Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to lead, develop and direct others in a competent and professional manner is key</li>	<li>Proven organizational skills with an ability to set priorities and complete multiple tasks within specified timelines in order to meet deadlines</li>	<li>Demonstrated ability to take initiative and work both independently and as part of a team within a large, complex, dynamic and sophisticated organization</li>	<li>Excellent oral and written communication skills to draft clear, concise correspondence, as well as to respond to inquiries with tact, confidentiality and discretion</li>	<li>Experience in project management an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong> May 21, 2018 <br/><br/> <em>We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> This position is classified in the<strong> Management Career Band, Level 1</strong> of the Management and Professional Staff Career Framework. <br/><br/> To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Management and Staff Careers website</strong>. For more information about the Cumming School of Medicine visit<strong> Careers in the Cumming School of Medicine.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong>ucalgary.ca</strong>. <br/><br/> <em>The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.</em>

Title: Product Manager Servicing
Job_Description: <div><u>Product Manager - Servicing</u> <br/><br/> Paysafe Group is looking for a product leader to take on the key responsibility of guiding the vision and delivering our servicing proposition for both consumers and our merchant base. The person will take on the role of Product Owner who understands what developers want and work closely and collaboratively to translate the needs of our customers (internal or external) into terms that our servicing engineering team can understand. <br/><br/> The role requires you to work closely with our customers, sales, product and operational teams across the PaySafe Group to understand their needs and how we can evolve our platform(s) and technology to meet those needs. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Objectives</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Work with Head of Product – BaU Operations to make interacting with PaySafe a low effort, high satisfaction experience. Define & prioritise a backlog for how we deliver on that strategy</li> <li>Be the product leader that defines the Servicing Proposition Vision, Strategy & Roadmap to improve servicing speed, customer satisfaction and NPS</li> <li>Write User Stories and manage backlog to communicate and clarify feature requirements and product needs to our engineering team</li> <li>Conduct usability testing for all servicing user interfaces & touchpoints as part of a continuous improvement programme; capturing feedback to help inform the roadmap, work closely with our UX, merchant and internal teams</li> <li>Work cross functionally particularly with our Customer Service and Merchant Service to optimise and create the right tools, systems and procedures to scale our support functions and accelerate our digital service offering</li> <li>Understand the market and trends, perform gap analysis of our servicing capabilities to identify new requirements for your portfolio working with our dedicated engineering team to deliver in an iterative, agile way Scrum with quality</li> <li>Define our migration strategy , as we transition the business from a number of servicing based platforms across through group through to a unified technology stack</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Comfort and experience in delivering products in an agile environment as the Product Owner</li>   <li>Bachelors Degree in Computer Science</li> <li>3-5 years’ experience, having contributed to multiple software projects throughout the entire development cycle</li> <li>Understanding and experience in shipping customer service and backend B2B servicing technologies to market, measuring and evolving these product iteratively over their lifecycle</li> <li>Technical background with experience working with API technologies – REST, OAuth, JSON as well as common programming languages such as PHP, Python, Ruby, Java etc</li> <li>Proven track-record: past projects were consistently successful (i.e. met the customer need, met business objectives, delivered on-time with no/few surprises)</li> <li>Sound business judgment: the ability to identify the business objectives, develop and implement a business strategy; capable of making reliable business decisions during execution.</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills</li> <li>Experience with designing or optimising self service registration experiences</li> <li>Clear thinker & communicator, ability to lead co-located, cross functional & remote based teams in a fast paced, dynamic environment</li> <li>Working Knowledge of User Experience Design & Digital Prototyping</li>  </ul> <strong>Preferred</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Experience within the online payments would be an advantage but is not essential</li> <li>Masters in Computer Science</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>

Title: Manager, Assurance and Accounting - Private Enterprise
Job_Description: At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career. <br/><br/> Join the momentum. We are seeking a Manager for our growing Assurance and Accounting – Private Enterprise team. As an entrepreneurial firm built for entrepreneurs, MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm for private enterprise. Our team of trusted advisors develop customized strategies and programs to assist business owners in responding to emerging trends, anticipating risk effectively, improving performance and operating more efficiently so they can maximize operations and better grow their bottom line. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Expectations</strong> <ul> <li><div>Lead multiple client facing engagement teams</div> </li><li><div>Responsible for the completion of audits, reviews, notice to reader, compliance tax engagements, budgeting, internal controls, financial and accounting transactions</div></li><li><div>Deliver industry and technical expertise in audit and assurance through client interactions, reports, technical work, management presentations and the creation of high quality deliverables</div></li><li><div>Manage project financials (budgets, WIPS, timely billing and collection and variance recognition)</div></li><li><div>Execute transactions through the provision of client services including planning, budgeting, scheduling and coordinating engagements</div></li><li><div>Review, investigate and correct discrepancies and irregularities in financial entries and reports</div> </li><li><div>Contribute to the preparation and delivery of competitive proposals to meet client needs</div></li><li><div>Develop a thorough understanding of MNP’s services, businesses and industry</div></li><li><div>Collaborate with client engagement team prior to commencement of client work to discuss roles and responsibilities, risk areas, materiality and deadlines</div></li><li><div>Think strategically about client needs by understanding their business and key risks</div></li><li><div>Identify ways to maximize the relationship with clients and deliver added value</div></li><li><div>Maintain high quality control by reviewing work done from other team members for accuracy and completeness; provide feedback to team members</div></li><li><div>Monitor project timelines against targets, adjust where necessary; advise clients of project status and seek clarification on discrepancies where applicable</div></li><li><div>Network and take a leadership role in the local professional, business, and community while raising awareness of MNP and looking for new business development opportunities</div></li><li><div>Leverage team appropriately to ensure proper documentation is prepared for the client and procedures relating to the file are followed accordingly</div></li><li><div>Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes</div></li><li><div>Liaise and correspond professionally with clients, colleagues and the firm leadership team</div></li><li><div>Develop, coach, and train team members towards professional and personal development</div></li><li><div>Conduct formal, written annual performance reviews</div></li><li><div>Promote regular attendance, balanced lifestyle and high standard of team wellness</div></li><li><div>Attend internal MNP courses to further develop accounting and assurance knowledge</div></li> </ul> <strong>Credentials</strong> <ul> <li><div>Completion of a Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation</div></li><li><div>Minimum four (4) to five (5) years of relevant work experience in public accounting</div></li><li><div>Extensive knowledge of and experience working with Accounting Standards for Private Enterprise (ASPE)</div></li><li><div>Experience in the design of engagement procedures based on risk and materiality</div></li><li><div>Solid understanding of business, accounting, management and practice development principles</div></li><li><div>Experience working with accounting and tax software such as Caseware, Profile, Quickbooks and Simply Accounting</div></li><li><div>Strong computer literacy including effective working skills of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint</div></li><li><div>Some travel may be required</div></li> </ul> <strong>Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics</strong> <ul> <li><div><strong>Integrity –</strong> professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships</div></li><li><div><strong>Energy –</strong> displays enthusiasm, optimism and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle</div></li><li><div><strong>Diversity –</strong> understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences</div></li><li><div><strong>Communication –</strong> effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others that make an impact and persuade their intended audience(s)</div></li><li><div><strong>Client Service Excellence –</strong> understands the importance of quality client service, proactively identifies client needs and creates strategies to proficiently serve clients</div></li><li><div><strong>Business Development –</strong> looks for and seizes profitable business opportunities while focusing on the ability to gain increased presence in the community</div> </li><li><div><strong>Forward Thinking –</strong> anticipates the implications of situations, takes appropriate action as needed and prepares for possible contingencies</div></li><li><div><strong>Agility with Change –</strong> initiates, sponsors and implements change by taking a facilitative catalyst role</div> </li><li><div><strong>People Management & Leadership –</strong> goal-driven leader who effectively manages self, others and teams to achieve goals</div></li><li><div><strong>Coaching –</strong> takes responsibility for one’s own and team members’ performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals, promptly addresses performance issues, is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making</div></li> </ul> MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events and professional development assistance. <br/><br/> MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world.

Title: Maintenance Manager
Job_Description: Canada Bread Company, Limited is a leading producer and distributor of packaged fresh bread and bakery products with brands such as Dempsters®, Villaggio®, POM®, Bon Matin®, Bens®, Healthy Way® and McGavins®. Dempsters is the national brand leader and a market leader in the health and well-being segment of bread products in Canada. The growth strategy is to focus on market leadership in all commercial bread categories. The company operates 19 bakeries and employs approximately 4,550 associates across Canada. It seeks to create value by leading innovation in products and service delivery in the bakery industry, enhancing distribution services and processes, and continuing to grow premium white and whole grain breads, tortillas, bagels, rye, buns, and rolls. <br/><br/> As an independent business unit of Grupo Bimbo, Canada Bread seeks to grow value-added bakery segments by focusing on health and well-being and penetrating new bakery segments and channels of distribution. The business will continue to grow market leadership and margins by investing in the premium whole grain product category, and by delivering continued product innovation in other bakery and snack categories. <br/><br/> <strong>MARKETS:</strong> <br/> Canada Bread serves major grocery chains, retail outlets, and foodservice operations across Canada. The company distributes branded products in the discount, mainstream, and super-premium segments, and is the leading producer in most major bakery categories. It also produces private label products for grocery and foodservice outlet. <br/><br/> <strong>PURPOSE:</strong> <br/> Management of the Maintenance Department <br/> <strong>DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>   <ul> <li>Ensure implementation of Preventive Maintenance Program (MAXIMO)</li>  <li>Formulate CERs (Capital Expenditure Requests) for the electronic approval process</li>  <li>Direct mechanic/electrical team, Maintenance Supervisors, administrator and purchaser.</li>  <li>Manage, design & implement capital projects</li>  <li>Bring forth new ideas to improve on existing production processes</li>  <li>Propose energy conservation ideas</li>  <li>Lead Environmental Committee and the implementation of the Manufacturing excellence chapter</li>  <li>Active member of site leadership team</li>  <li>Provide Value-based leadership / drive leadership edge in department</li>  <li>Complete PADs for direct reports</li>  <li>Training & Development / Muscle building / Top grading</li>  <li>Hourly & Salaried Recruitment & Selection & Onboarding</li>  <li>Committed to strong Labor Relations in the faculties</li>  <li>Support Employee Relations Initiative in the facility</li>  <li>Facilitate open communication creating cross functional relationships</li>  <li>Ensure customer satisfaction by maintaining product integrity; practicing highest levels of GMPs and conforming to HACCP pre-requisite program and all associated SOPs.</li>  <li>Internal and external audits</li>  <li>Member of site Food Safety Committee</li>  <li>Active participate in Food Safety initiatives including implementing policy and procedures.</li>  <li>Department Budget control with approval from Operations Manager.</li>  <li>Perform work in a safe and healthy manner;</li>   <li>Participation in ongoing H&S training, audits etc.</li>  <li>Facilitates Health & Safety Policies</li>  <li>Ensure contractor compliance as it relates to plant safety program orientation and confidentiality statements</li> </ul>  <strong>REQUIREMENTS:</strong>   <ul> <li>Licensed Electrical / Mechanical Technical Certificate with Degree/diploma in engineering</li>  <li>3-5 years as a supervisor experience & 3 years experience in maintenance environment as a qualified tradesperson an advantage</li>  <li>Excellent planning, analytical & organizational skills</li>  <li>Strong Leadership and communication skills (both Verbal & Written); Ability to interact with all levels of business Strong oral & written skills, proven ability to communicate in an ESL work environment.</li> </ul>  Please note all offers of employment at Canada Bread Company, Limited are conditional upon the successful completion of a pre-hire background check. This may include anything up to and including a criminal history check, reference checks and/or credit check. <br/><br/> Canada Bread Company, Limited is an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity in the workplace and encourages applications from qualified women, men, visible minorities, aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. We welcome applications from all interested individuals; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> Job seekers with disabilities who require accommodation during the recruitment process or would like more details about accessibility should contact Canada Bread Accessibility at CB_Accessibility@grupobimbo.com. <br/><br/>

Title: Manager, Landscape Architecture
Job_Description: <div><div></div>  <div>  <div><br> At EXP, we know that great experiences start with the right people. We believe that work should be challenging, and the challenge should be fun. We also believe that exponential possibilities are more likely to occur with a respectful, satisfying and empowering company. We value and respect our employees - their experience and expertise as well as their energy, passion and diversity - and their innovative approach to work and to life.</div>  <div> </div>  <div><strong>Your Challenge</strong></div>  <div> </div>  <div>EXP is searching for a <strong>Manager, Landscape Architecture</strong> to join our Land Development / Infrastructure team in our Calgary, AB office. Reporting to the Infrastructure Practice Manager, the successful applicant will lead teams to provide landscape architecture services to major land development clients, and to provide these services to a variety of projects across the Western Canada region.</div>  <div><br><strong>Your Responsibilities</strong></div>  <div> </div>  <div>Initiating and managing a variety of Landscape Architecture projects, including proposal preparation for new projects that require Landscape Architecture expertise, including large scale residential, industrial, and commercial developments in and around the Calgary and Edmonton regions.<br> Duties will include:<br> •Leading the Landscape Architecture group in delivering services to a variety of land development clients;<br> •Executing proven business development skills to generate Landscape Architectural services in the Calgary and Edmonton region;<br> •Participating in business development efforts including writing and pricing proposal efforts, securing new projects/clients;<br> •Preparing proposals in response to RFPs for projects requiring Landscape Architectural services;<br> •Planning and executing required projects;<br> •Developing and executing annual budgets and monitoring ongoing financial results;<br> •Managing projects to achieve the objectives, which are required by the client, including briefing and control of staff and contractors allocated to the project, scheduling work, cost control (expenses and budget control as well as utilization management);<br> •Liaising with clients, contractors, consultants, municipal staff, and other stakeholders;<br> •Coaching, mentoring and developing junior and intermediate architectural employees.</div>  </div>  </div>  <div>  <div>    Job Requirements    </div>  <div>  <div><strong>The Skills, Knowledge and Abilities We Seek</strong></div>  <div> </div>  <div>•Bachelor’s Degree in Landscape Architecture with a post-graduate degree preferred;<br> •A minimum of 10 years of relevant experience in Landscape Architecture, preferably obtained in a consulting environment;<br> •Ability to lead and develop the architectural group;<br> •5 years’ experience as a Manager, leading a team of junior to intermediate level professionals;<br> •Management of multiple projects at one time;<br> •Excellent interpersonal skills, written and verbal communication skills;<br> •Ability to exercise diplomacy and tact when interacting with fellow staff, clients, consultants and contractors;<br> •Strong organizational and time management skills, including multi-tasking and prioritizing;<br> •Familiarity with local specifications, current construction procedures and industry trends;<br> •Ensure health and safety polices are adhered to at all sites and report to Manager and Joint Health and Safety Committee Members.</div>  <div><br><strong>What EXP Can Offer</strong></div>  <div> </div>  <div>With a mission to understand, innovate, partner and deliver, EXP provides engineering, architecture, design and consulting services to the world’s built and natural environments.</div>  <div><br> Our heritage dates back to 1906, when the earliest of EXP’s predecessor companies started its engineering infrastructure practice. Today, over 3,000 creative EXP professionals across North America provide the passion and expertise needed to deliver successful projects around the world.</div>  <div><br> Our promise is to offer you a challenging career in a positive and dynamic work environment, and it's a promise we take seriously.</div>  <div><br> Join a dynamic team at EXP that provides you with innovative projects, the capacity to develop your career, a full range of benefits, flexible working hours, and much more! When you explore what EXP has to offer, you’ll find exponential possibilities.<br>  <br> For more information, visit www.exp.com.<br>  <br> #LI-AO1</div>  </div>  </div>

Title: CORPORATE SECURITY MANAGER
Job_Description: <strong>Join the Repsol team</strong><br/><br/>We provide the opportunity to grow professionally and develop your career at one of the world’s leading international energy companies. At Repsol, you will work on challenging projects with some of the best and brightest of your peers in the energy industry.<br/><br/><strong>POSITION OVERVIEW</strong><br/><br/>The Corporate Security Manager oversees the Canada Security program and functions, as well as the safety of employees and the protection of company assets and interests. Key responsiblities include development and direction of policies, guidelines and programs to promote a safe and secure work environment, management of security operations and crisis management activities and overall strategic planning. This role is also responsible for leading confidential investigations and acting as liaison with local and federal law enforcement agencies when necessary.<br/><br/><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Oversees all Security programs and plans in Canada including developing security guidelines and policies relative to employee safety, building access, physical security</li><li>Strategically reviews, establishes and implements operational procedures to protect employees and property from any security threat (such as bomb threats, active shooter, etc.)</li><li>Participates in a multi-discipline Workplace Violence prevention team, which is charged with the early and safe resolution of threatening or potentially violent situations</li><li>Conducts due diligence on third parties and sensitive investigations relating to employee misconduct, theft, property damage, fraud and other issues involving standards of business conduct; works closely with HR and Business Unit representatives to resolve such incidents in a timely manner</li><li>Confers with representatives of local, state or federal agencies to ensure cooperation and coordination of activities with law enforcement</li><li>Works closely with security staff, all corporate areas and business departments throughout the organization as appropriate to minimize risks to the company</li><li>Accountable for the maintenance and continuous development of a network of security professionals to ensure access to industry best practices and security resources</li><li>Coordinates any function related to travel tracker and VIP / executive protection</li><li>Responsible for the supervision of the contract guard force in Canada</li><li>Conducts routine audits to ensure compliance</li> </ul>  <strong>QUALIFICATIONS AND PREFERRED SKILLS</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor degree or higher in Criminal Justice or related field</li><li>8+ years of previous security / military / law enforcement experience working in a corporate setting or in an internal security department or equivalent environment</li><li>Forward looking, strategic leader that works well within a fast-paced, dynamic, multi-cultural business environment and is comfortable working with all levels of the organization</li><li>Demonstrated ability to work with a wide range of sensitive and confidential issues</li><li>Ability to negotiate compromises between others</li><li>Proven discretionary judgment with ability to resolve both routine and non-routine issues</li><li>Ability to work in a team-based environment with other business professionals</li><li>Experienced in strategic planning, budget process and resource allocation</li><li>Demonstrated ability to multi-task within a rapidly changing environment</li><li>Strong project management, organizational and analytical skills</li><li>Demonstrated ability to: establish and cultivate professional relationships; analyze both data and situations for appropriate response; positively affect organizational dynamics; and manage special projects</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communications</li><li>Ability to meet deadlines</li><li>Bilingual in Spanish</li><li>Strong investigative and case management skills</li><li>Knowledge of business continuity and crisis management planning and procedures</li><li>Knowledge on information security planning measures</li><li>Federal law enforcement or intelligence experience</li><li>Professional certifications such as CPP, PSP, CFE, etc.</li> </ul>  <strong>ADDITIONAL INFORMATION</strong>  <ul> <li>Only applicants who are legally permitted to work in Canada will be considered</li><li>Posting close date: May 24, 2018</li> </ul> <strong><strong>By applying for this position you consent to the collection, use and necessary disclosure of the personal information provided during the application and selection process.</strong></strong>

Title: Account Manager - Outside Sales
Job_Description: <strong>THE OPPORTUNITY:</strong> <br/><br/> We are currently looking for a qualified Account Manager to complement our Heat and Power team in Calgary, AB . The successful candidate will report to the Regional Sales Manager with the primary goal of increasing rentals and sales of the wide variety of products WesternOne offers on the Heat side of the business. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Responding to our customers needs is the highest priority;</li> <li>Solving problems as quickly and effectively as possible; no matter where or what time of day it is;</li> <li>Acquiring new customers while retaining our invaluable existing customers satisfied;</li> <li>Gaining knowledge of our Industry clientele</li> <li>Driving to potential customer sites to promote WesternOne products and services;</li> <li>Uncovering other opportunities to generate profitable revenue with existing and new clients</li>   <li>Working within our sales process to identify cross sales between departments;</li> <li>Working closely with our Branches to ensure customer satisfaction with our products and services;</li> <li>Documenting all opportunities and contacts in PIPEDRIVE, our CRM system.</li> </ul> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul> <li>Ideal candidates will have a passion for sales and believe in making the best decisions for our customers;</li> <li>Experience with Outside Sales, including cold calling and visiting job sites is required;</li> <li>This role requires you to work effectively with all operations staff (including drivers, dispatchers, counter staff and service technicians) and understand that the relationships with these team members are critical to your success;</li> <li>Experienced sales professionals should apply and have experience in wholesale or B2B markets;</li> <li>Previous rental or construction industry experience is preferred but not required;</li> <li>Clean driver's abstract is required.</li> </ul> <strong>ABOUT US:</strong> <br/><br/> WesternOne provides aerial lifts and temporary heat services. We service large scale construction projects, home builders, commercial constructors, industrial customers, movie customers and other specialty niches. <br/><br/> We have 15 locations in Western Canada with plans to extend throughout the rest of the country. We deliver outstanding service to our customers, and are industry leaders in our areas. Our mission is to help our customers do their jobs safer, easier and faster by being the experts in what we do. <br/><br/> WesternOne is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all who respond; however, please note that only those applicants being considered will be contacted.

Title: Director, Senior Account Manager, Real Estate
Job_Description: The Senior Account Manager – (SAM) is accountable to provide project financing, relationship management and holistic solutions to a portfolio of existing Corporate Finance Clients and prospects. This role will work in concert with the Senior Relationship Manager, on matters concerning clients. The role has accountability to know the local market and to retain, sustain and develop new and valuable opportunities, as well as referral opportunities to specialized areas (i.e.: Cash Management, Retail, etc.), to grow share of wallet and increase profitability of the assigned real estate portfolio. <br/><br/> The Senior Account Manager will apply effective and professional consultative sales and business development principles, practices and techniques to identify negotiate structure and provide the initial underwriting for real estate business transactions. This role will make credit decisions and recommendations in accordance with sound credit-granting principles and will ensure compliance with internal and external requirements and regulations. <br/><br/> This role transacts deals in the $2,500,000 – $15,000,000 segment. <br/><br/> KEY AREAS OF ACCOUNTABILITY: <br/><br/> Business Delivery and Operational Effectiveness: <br/><br/> Apply relationship selling and relationship management principles and techniques to an assigned portfolio of CFD clients, reviewing and enhancing holistic financial solutions to meet all client needs. <br/><br/> Retain and expand Corporate Finance relationships to achieve portfolio and client retention, sales, service, and profitability objectives, and proactively develop relationships with new clients <br/><br/> Manage the risk of the assigned portfolio in a timely and precise manner, focusing on quality of information, analysis, profitability, and credit recommendations to ensure the profitable execution of sales credit/non-credit products and services to CFD clients. Directly manage the annual review process, interim reviews, specified quarterly reports and resolution of exceptions advised by Portfolio Management. <br/><br/> Maintain accurate documentation and manage the timely validation from the Global Financial Services (GFS) that security continues to exist with all registrations and adherence to prescribed policies and procedures and overall safety of the Bank’s position is ensured. <br/><br/> Work with the SRM and deal team on new client acquisitions, establishing a working relationship with key decision makers, seamlessly assuming accountability for the relationship and risk management of the client when appropriate. <br/><br/> Sales and Service <br/><br/> Apply relationship selling and relationship management principles and techniques to an assigned portfolio of CFD clients, reviewing and enhancing holistic financial solutions to meet all banking needs working with the SRM when necessary on significant new project or acquisition applications. <br/><br/> Provide timely and effective problem resolution, escalating customer issues as necessary and per the established process to maintain customer satisfaction. <br/><br/> Be highly visible in the market and with a long-term focus, develop an internal and external network of sources to identify sales opportunities. This will include Commercial Account Managers, financial investors, financial professional and consultants. <br/><br/> Establish linkages with CFD & BMO Capital Partners, and “Industry Specialty” Groups, to leverage sales and referral opportunities, improve share of wallet, and to acquire and retain profitable relationships <br/><br/> Develop and maintain expertise in lending and keeping current with the changing economics of the industry <br/><br/> Follow processes that ensure accurate comprehensive investigation; analysis and due diligence is conducted in the documentation of acceptable transactions sourced for adjudication under the Commercial Lending Process <br/><br/> Manage risk and minimize losses through monitoring and control reports, ensuring compliance requirements, audits, and verifications are completed in accordance with Bank Policies & Procedures and all legal, regulatory and ethical requirements <br/><br/> Develop an understanding of cross channel sales referral processes, local market, and existing business relationships to maximize share of wallet, increase revenue, and to acquire new clients <br/><br/> Establish and enhance the Bank’s profile by participating in meaningful and focused business and community activities and seeking out and creating opportunities to generate new business <br/><br/> Apply business development and relationship management sales and service principles, practices and techniques, to support the achievement of target level sales and the full suite of commercial products and services <br/><br/> Champion a sales environment that achieves consistent, superior customer service and good working relationships with Corporate Finance Customer Service Officers <br/><br/> Leverage technology and tools to identify and refer profitable sales opportunities and to ensure optimal effectiveness, efficiency, and delivery of Commercial products and services <br/><br/> Prepare credit application for new business opportunities for both existing and new clients. <br/><br/> Planning <br/><br/> Work with Senior Relationship Managers to develop, implement, review, revise and manage a 1 – 2 year Relationship Development and Sales Plan, focusing on identifying opportunities that will strengthen and build existing profitable relationships that will result in meeting or exceeding revenue and service targets. <br/><br/> Review and monitor revenue, profitability and service performance against plan, identify gaps, address accordingly and share best practices. <br/><br/> Contribute to Corporate Finance Business Plan (as appropriate), regarding new business opportunities, increased profitability and portfolio growth potential, based on knowledge of local marketplace <br/><br/> Co-ordinate and share planning, implementation and review activities with key BMO Capital Partner Groups (All Corporate Finance Specialty Groups, Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, Wealth Management, BMO Harris Private Banking, etc.) and identify opportunities to ensure client’s needs and expectations are profitably met and/or exceeded. <br/><br/> Review sales and service plans on an ongoing basis to reflect opportunities and changes in assigned portfolio and competitive local market environment; develop an action plan, and update Area Manager on any changes that may impact the Business Plan <br/><br/> Risk Management <br/><br/> Protect the Bank’s assets and maintain portfolio quality by adhering to Commercial lending processes, policies & procedures, legal and ethical requirements and regulations, audit requirements, and established risk guidelines. Ensure all business is in conformity with Bank Policies and prescribed guidelines <br/><br/> Follow processes that ensure accurate comprehensive investigation; analysis and due diligence is conducted in the documentation of acceptable transactions sourced for adjudication under the Commercial Lending Process. <br/><br/> Manage risk and minimize losses through monitoring and control reports, ensuring compliance requirements, audits, and verifications are completed in accordance with Bank Policies & Procedures and all legal, regulatory and ethical requirements <br/><br/> Document and follow-up on any discrepancies to procedures, with significant operational risk and escalate as required <br/><br/> Maintain up-to-date knowledge and understanding of products, processes, and relevant legal, regulatory and technology requirements through audits and quality checks, to ensure decisions are adequately documented, and clearly communicated. <br/><br/> Exercise individually held Commercial unilateral discretionary limits as well as any held prescribed approval discretionary limits (ie overdraft, credit applications), ensuring credit decisions and recommendations are in accordance with sound credit-granting principles and in compliance with the Bank’s policies and related procedures (e.g. Lending Directives, Commercial Lending Policy etc.) completing analysis; confirming security valuations; completing and approving credit applications for authorizations under Commercial Lending Policy <br/><br/> Initiate engagement of appropriate CFD partners and Credit early in the process when significant deteriorating trends are evident, working with them to engage other BMO specialty roles &/or SAMU, as appropriate <br/><br/> Adhere to Know Your Client Rules and Bank Policies & Procedures for the prevention of loss due to fraud, counterfeiting, money laundering, or defalcation; identify and report suspicious and other reportable transactions or patterns of activity that are suspected to be related to money laundering <br/><br/> Qualifications <br/><br/> SKILLED KNOWLEDGE AND ROLE REQUIREMENTS: <br/><br/> Business Acumen In-depth <br/><br/> Business Valuation Working <br/><br/> Environmental Understanding In-depth <br/><br/> Financial Understanding In-depth <br/><br/> Conflict Management & Resolution In-depth <br/><br/> Market Strategy & Planning Working <br/><br/> Negotiation In-depth <br/><br/> Problem Solving In-depth <br/><br/> Relationship Management In-depth <br/><br/> Risk Management In-depth <br/><br/> Sales & Service In-depth <br/><br/> ROLE REQUIREMENTS <br/><br/> Credit Qualified with commercial limits <br/><br/> Credit Adjudication Experience <br/><br/> In-depth understanding of area of product expertise (ie. Real Estate, Dealership Finance, Diversified Industries), Commercial Lending Process, Commercial Lending Directive, supporting processes and technology

Title: Strategic Account Manager
Job_Description: <div><strong>Position Title:</strong> Strategic Account Manager - Calgary <br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> <strong>The Company:</strong> <br/><br/> FireEye is the intelligence-led security company. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. FireEye has over 5,800 customers across 67 countries, including more than 40 percent of the Forbes Global 2000. <br/><br/> <strong>The Role:</strong> <br/><br/> The Enterprise Account Manager (EAM) is responsible for sales opportunities of the FireEye family of products within a defined list of accounts. Specifically, this position is responsible for assessing opportunities, developing account plans, contract negotiations, and post sales account management of the assigned Enterprise accounts. The successful EAM is expected to leverage and partner with the Channel Sales team on lead generation, account planning and new account development and/or expanding existing accounts. Further, the EAM is expected to sell the entire FireEye product line and must effectively represent FireEyes full suite of products and services using technical, organizational and customer knowledge to influence customers and assist them in applying the products/services to their needs, resulting in revenue generation. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>This role requires a deep understanding of the market and technologies that FireEye sells, including our business/industry, our competitors and the ability to use this knowledge to plan for the future. The successful EAM drives a superior customer experience by delivering technology solutions tailored to customer needs and is able to meet and beat their assigned quota. Additionally, the EAM must demonstrate success in the following areas:</li> <li>Opportunity Assessment: Personally oversee and be the primary point-of-contact for named Enterprise accounts. Key deliverable: Value-add product, maintenance, and services opportunities are clearly identified and validated with partners and other FireEye resources.</li>   <li>Account Plan Development: Working with FireEyes Partner and Channel resources, the successful EAM will develop and prepare an actionable strategic sales plan for top accounts with the largest sales opportunities. Key deliverable: Clearly documented strategic sales and account plans, including short and long-term goals and actions for each named account and associated requirements for team members throughout sales cycle.</li> <li>Contract Negotiations: Participate in contract negotiations for named accounts. Key deliverable: Financially sound and resource supported contracts that are clearly aligned with FireEyes financial objectives while delivering value-added products, maintenance, and services to meet customer requirements.</li> <li>Post Sale Management: Maintain awareness and status of all key contractual obligations within an assigned list of accounts, facilitating customer meetings and communications regarding deliverables where necessary. Key deliverable: Customer expectations are managed upfront, with ongoing status project updates, escalating unresolved issues to account team members and/or key customer sponsor. Effectively matrix-manages cross functional areas to achieve a high level of customer service.</li> </ul>  <strong><div> Requirements:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>8 10 years of enterprise field sales experience</li> <li>Ability to successfully complete solo sales meetings and presentations, with little or no supervision at the highest level of an organization</li> <li>Understand the sales process, with acute listening and sales skills</li> <li>Ability to clearly articulate issues and concerns to management and support</li> <li>Willingness to travel, work odd hours, and be very available</li> <li>Excellent business writing and presentation skills</li> <li>Instinctive understanding of customer service and satisfaction, with ability to manage both</li> <li>BS/BA or higher level degree in relevant field (CS, EE, MIS) strongly preferred</li> <li>Relevant FireEye or vendor certifications (Cisco, Juniper, Netapp, VMWare) preferred</li> </ul>  <strong><div>Additional Qualifications:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Build strong business consulting relationships within assigned accounts and ensure alignment of internal resources i.e. Support, Systems Engineering, and Professional Services, to ensure consistency in the planning and implementation of high value solutions.</li> <li>Exercise strong financial skills in the evaluation and preparation of sales opportunities and sufficient organizational and project management skills to manage customer needs and drives issues to resolution; the EAM must also effectively matrix-manage cross functional areas to deliver total solutions based on regional requirements.</li> <li>Lead sales strategy sessions for named accounts while contributing to and coordinating the execution of the account plans, ensuring the accurate production of account plans, business case preparation, appropriate contract presentation, and the effective delivery of account plan activities.</li> <li>Collect and communicate marketing requirements and competitive data, including pricing, feature needs, license models and value proposition strategies to product stakeholders.</li> <li>Maintain and ensure the accuracy and consistency of all sales data across all sales systems</li> <li>Consistently demonstrate strong product knowledge and ability to articulate our value proposition.</li> </ul>  <li>LI-SW1</li>

Title: Assistant Store Manager of Sales and Service - Pottery Barn
Job_Description: <div>Requisition Number: PB-11801 <br/> Area of Interest: Retail <br/> Organization: Retail <br/> Brand/Division: Pottery Barn Canada <br/> Position Type: Full-time <br/><br/> <strong>JOB DESCRIPTION</strong> <br/><br/> Support management team in achieving goals by providing World-Class service. Serve as a role model for building relationships with customers. Maintain presence through store supervision to ensure appropriate staff coverage in all areas of the store. Perform operational functions to ensure the store meets Company guidelines. Implement visual changes and maintain store standards.
