ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:   <ul> <li>Provide exceptional customer service in the store to achieve World Class Service standards.</li> <li>Serve as a role model for sales associates in sales generation and customer service by making the customer experience the priority.</li> <li>Reinforce customer service principles by coaching staff on their successes and challenges.</li> <li>Utilize GUEST and training resources to educate team on product, improve selling skills, and achieve business goals.</li> <li>Contribute in management and store meetings, offering suggestions for associate development, sales opportunities, and organizational improvements.</li> <li>Effectively perform operations functions: opens and closes the store, register, and back office management procedures.</li> <li>Maintain visual standards, including merchandise presentation, signage, lighting, and general maintenance.</li> <li>Monitor Inventory levels and communicate discrepancies to Assistant or General Manager.</li> <li>Assume additional management responsibilities in the absence of Assistant or General Manager.</li> <li>Perform projects and assignments as directed by the Assistant or General Manager.</li> <li>Comply with all Company policies and procedures.</li> <li>Maintain an environment where all associates are treated fairly and with dignity and respect, in accordance with our People First Philosophy.</li> </ul>  <strong>REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS</strong>   <ul> <li>1-3 years retail sales experience with management experience preferred.</li> <li>1-2 years experience in home related design or visual merchandising preferred. Specialty retail preferred.</li> <li>Effective communication, organization and leadership skills.</li> <li>Proven ability to motivate and influence others through personal actions and examples.</li> <li>Ability to be mobile on the sales floor for extended periods of time.</li> <li>Availability to work a minimum of three shifts per week, minimum of three Saturdays per month and two Sundays per month, annual inventory and entire holiday season (November and December).</li> <li>Ability to lift and mobilize medium to large items, up to 75 lbs., while utilizing appropriate equipment and safety techniques.</li> <li>College degree preferred or equivalent job experience.</li> </ul>  This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship. <br/><br/> Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <br/><br/> Williams-Sonoma, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, or other applicable state or local laws and ordinances.</div>

Title: Production Manager
Job_Description: We are currently looking for a <strong>Production manager</strong> to join our growing team. At Goodfood, the production team is at the center of our operations. They portion fresh ingredients and assemble them into recipe bags to be delivered to our clients. This is a great opportunity to join a dynamic team! <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Planning of resources</strong>  <ul> <li>Participate in workforce requirement planning by defining hiring needs</li> <li>Define required supplies, tools and equipments for operations</li> <li>Validate accuracy of data required for the execution of operations particularly at critical points * Operational execution</li> <li>Support the production team and and resolve any issues that may arise</li> <li>Lead, coach, train and supervise the team of front line supervisors</li> <li>Maintain constant and clear communication with the teams and departments</li> <li>Manage relations with different stakeholders and suppliers</li> <li>Track performance metrics and act proactively to resolve any potential issues</li> </ul> <strong>Optimization of processes</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop and maintain training package, standard operations procedures and policies</li> <li>Improve quality of products delivered to our customers, health and safety standards and cross-departmental collaboration</li> <li>Participate in the identification and prioritization of the improvement projects</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Completed Bachelor's degree (Business, Engineering, Finance, or any relevant major), MBA (asset)</li> <li>4-5 years experience</li> <li>Strong knowledge of Excel, data manipulation and analysis</li> </ul> <strong>Why work with Goodfood</strong> <br/><br/> E-commerce/Startup work environment. <br/><br/> Competitive Group Insurances. <br/><br/> Personal -No Questions asked- days. <br/><br/> Monthly all-employee bonus program. <br/><br/> Directly contribute to company results.Free Coffee & Parking! <br/><br/> Full Time Position <br/><br/> Job Type: Full-time

Title: Technical Sales Manager
Job_Description: <div><div><strong> <br/> Technical Sales Manager</strong><br/>  <div> <div> Location <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Canada - AB - Calgary</strong> </div><br/>  <div> Job Code <br/><br/> <strong>30004964</strong> </div><br/>  <div> # of Openings <br/><br/> <strong>1</strong> </div> </div> </div>  <br/>Apply Now</div><br/>  <div><div> Job Brief<br/><br/>Purpose <br/> Sell and support all company product lines by aligning products and services with customer needs through a high level of engagement and face to face support .</div> <br/><em>Dyno Nobel, a wholly owned subsidiary of Incitec Pivot Limited, a global leader in</em> <em>diversified industrial chemicals that manufactures and distributes industrial explosives, industrial chemicals and fertilizers. We provide blasting solutions and quality explosives products throughout North America and Australia, as well as selected customers in the Asia Pacific region. Due to continued results and world-leading innovation, customers in the mining, quarry, construction, pipeline and geophysical exploration industries choose Dyno Nobel</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Technical Sales Manager</strong> <br/><br/> <strong><u>Purpose</u></strong> <br/><br/> Sell and support all company product lines by aligning products and services with customer needs through a high level of engagement and face to face support at customer locations. Pursue efforts to expand customer base, and maintain high levels of customer satisfaction according to the company marketing plan, objectives, and ethical business practices. Provide on-site support with application training, support and troubleshooting. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Core Accountabilities</u></strong> <br/><br/> Essential Functions:  <ul> <li>Demonstrate and/or lead the commitment to the pursuit of achieving Zero Harm through behavioral based safety. (Ensure SAO, JSA, Take 5’s, stretching, and all safety rules are being completed.)</li>  <li>Ensure compliance with applicable Company HSE Performance Standards, as well as applicable acts and regulations.</li>  <li>Live and foster the IPL Corporate Values.</li>  <li>Supports BEx initiatives and ensures participation from all areas of responsibility.</li>  <li>Develop and maintain professional relationships with both internal and external customers to successfully meet objectives and add value for customers.</li>  <li>Accurate input using the LMS pricing tool to make all pricing recommendations in the execution of the company’s marketing plan and objectives to establish a fair price for the customer, remain competitive in the market, and achieve profitability objectives.</li>  <li>Work to achieve high levels of positive working relationships with customers to optimize sales of DNA products and services.</li>  <li>Represent DN at trade shows and arrange product demonstrations to build customer base.</li>  <li>Observe industry and competitor activities to find areas for expansion and improvement of DN’s products and services.</li>  <li>Develop leads and pursue new customers to maintain and expand current product sales.</li>  <li>Effectively influence actions and opinions of others, accept feedback from others.</li>  <li>Understand and enhance service requirements to continually improve customer profitability.</li>  <li>Implement continuous improvement programs by following management policies and procedures to meet customer expectations, business objectives and budget goals. Contribute to achieving budgeted customer profitability as measured by EBIT, EBITA, EBITDA.</li>  <li>Maintain the highest standards of presentation and professionalism</li>  <li>Identify, recommend, and implement initiatives to reduce overall cost of doing business.</li> </ul> <strong><u>Technical Competencies</u></strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Education:</strong>  <ul> <li>Four-year degree in technical or business area preferred, or five years’ experience in related field.</li>  <li><strong>Experience:</strong> </li>  <li>Experience working in a strong Safety focused environment.</li>  <li>Significant experience in the mining industry with an emphasis on underground mining and/or construction.</li>  <li>Preferred 3 – 5 years working experience with progressively increasing professional responsibility with leading edge technology to achieve results.</li>  <li>Preferred experience in project management, value/efficiency improvement projects, six sigma or Lean.</li> </ul> <strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Ability to safely perform all aspects of role and proactively engage in all Safety related actions.</li>  <li>Strong administrative, organizational, and business software skills. SAP, Office Software</li>  <li>Must have strong personal and communication skills.</li> </ul> <strong>Work Environment and Physical Requirements</strong> <em>(Required in USA)</em> <br/> The demands described here are representative of those that must be met by the employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions (Refer to PD Guidelines).  <ul> <li>Ability to physically travel between offices and remote field locations.</li>  <li>Ability to work outdoors and underground for long periods of time in extreme weather conditions.</li>  <li>Ability to wear personal protective equipment where required.</li>  <li>Occasional lifting of up to 60 pounds.</li> </ul> <em>Dyno Nobel is an equal employment opportunity employer and will give all qualified applicants consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.</em> <br/><br/> Being a part of the Dyno Nobel team is a combination of everything that is unique about Dyno Nobel: our culture, our core values, our commitment to safety, but most importantly, it is our people. It is what sets us apart from your average employer, and is everything that makes Dyno Nobel a great place to work. At Dyno Nobel, we are committed to equal employment opportunity. <br/><br/> Dyno Nobel does not accept resumes from headhunters, placement agencies, or other suppliers that have not signed a formal agreement with us. Our supplier base is restricted to specified hiring needs. Therefore, any resume received from an unapproved supplier will be considered unsolicited, and Dyno Nobel will not be obligated to pay a referral or placement fee.</div> <br/>

Title: Manager, Hardware Verification
Job_Description: As the Manager or Team Lead for the Hardware Verification team, reporting directly to the Senior Manager of HW Verification and Regulatory Compliance, you will utilize both your proven technical and functional leadership skills to guide the team through numerous verification programs and to provide the mentorship and decision-making support to ensure that programs meet their project commitments. NovAtel’s Hardware Verification team works closely with the Hardware and Software development teams to ensure that all NovAtel products meet stringent reliability, robustness, regulatory, environmental, and safety requirements. <br/><br/> You will be accountable for the planning and execution of the team deliverables and must effectively implement continuous improvements to process, planning, testing, reporting and quality assurance practices. You will work closely with your team members and project teams to ensure effective decisions are made and roadblocks and issues are managed well. Your high level of experience and interest in functional management ensures you are fully engaged with your team and an outstanding dynamic is maintained. It is expected that you follow the best in class management practices at NovAtel. <ul> <li>Lead and own the Hardware Verification process; seek to understand how activities can be continually improved to reduce waste, reduce risk and reduce time to market</li><li>Interacts with the Senior Manager of HW Verification and Regulatory Compliance in a collaborative and productive way to strategize on key issues and the future state of the team</li><li>Hold regular meetings (both formally, including bi-annual performance appraisals, and informally) with the individuals in the team to understand and support their scope of work, career goals, skill development and any areas of concern</li> <li>Oversee and optimize project planning, estimation, work execution and deliverables for the hardware verification team</li><li>Creation of test plans, test procedures, test records, reports, component qualification, debugging prototype hardware, investigation of design defects and testing of design changes. Organize and perform detailed product testing at the system and component levels.</li><li>Proactively remove roadblocks by working directly and collaboratively with the other functional domain owners (HW, SW, Mechanical and Systems)</li><li>Provide support and ensure all test activities are coordinated effectively, internally and externally - properly interpreted, planned and vetted for purpose and location</li><li>Provide HW Verification test standard interpretation, testing and design expertise</li><li>Ensure the team is ISO 16949 compliant with all processes and proactively address any process defects or improvements that are required</li> </ul> <strong>Must-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Engineering degree or Technology diploma from a recognized institution</li><li>10+ years of experience in the areas of hardware verification, product integrity, and/or regulatory compliance testing including extensive understanding of product test methodologies and best practices</li><li>7+ years of functional management experience in a high technology development environment with large teams</li><li>Proficiency with MS Office programs and computer skills</li> </ul> <strong>Key Success Factors:</strong> <ul> <li>A balance of technical and functional management skills with an open and honest demeanor</li><li>Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, teamwork skills and work habits</li><li>A positive can-do attitude</li><li>Problem solver, self-motivated and enjoy learning</li><li>A high expectation for success and strong attention to details</li><li>Ability to find solutions, reduce roadblocks and adapt to ambiguous needs</li><li>Ability to manage an environment of trust, innovation and accountability</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with ISO 17025, ISO 16949, ISO 14001</li><li>Knowledge of GPS/GNSS</li> </ul>

Title: General Manager - Insurance Restoration Services
Job_Description: <strong>Peak Installations Inc.</strong> is Canada’s largest B2B and B2C home installations’ company. Each year we help thousands of home owners renovate, beautify and add value to their homes. We are an important and rapidly growing supplier to Canada’s largest insurance companies, helping thousands of policy holders restore homes damaged by extreme weather events. <br/><br/> Peak is a highly valued, strategic partner of Home Depot, the world’s largest home improvement retailer. We have been honored to receive The Home Depot Partner of the Year Award 8 times! <br/><br/> Peak Installations Inc. is now looking for an experienced <strong>General Manager – Insurance Restoration Services</strong> to lead our fast growing Insurance Restoration division. <br/><br/> <strong>Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> What makes the General Manager – Insurance Restoration Services such an exceptional opportunity? Here are just some of the reasons: <ul> <li>You will play a crucial role in overseeing sustained and profitable growth of the business by providing clear leadership to the team, closely monitoring daily operations, and launching targeted new business initiatives</li><li>You will enjoy a national presence and will work closely with the senior leadership team of Peak to ensure ambitious goals are attained</li><li>Your expertise in the insurance restoration industry will be fully utilized as you will ensure no stone is left unturned, and no opportunity is missed</li><li>You will be challenged daily, yet you will thrive in an environment where success is celebrated.</li>  </ul> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Full P&L oversight responsibility for the Insurance Division</li><li>Achieve the insurance sales plan for recognized revenue</li><li>Rapidly grow the current successful business using best practices in the insurance restoration industry, building strong relationships with insurance companies, and providing coaching to the team</li><li>Prepare proposals and deliver presentations to generate new insurance partnerships and incremental sales growth</li><li>Lead a national team of project managers, provide oversight to project coordination and other teams</li><li>Monitor contractual obligations with Peak as well as adherence to Peak’s policies, standard industry practices, the expectations of insurance customers and the end policyholder</li><li>Resolve insurance company satisfaction issues quickly and efficiently</li><li>Assess major competitors for each market area, including their insurance sales approach, value proposition, pricing strategies and develop an action plan to manage competition</li><li>Establish and maintain strong and lasting relationships with internal departments and management.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>7+ years’ experience in a leadership role, preferably in insurance industry or with a large restoration company</li><li>Experience leading a large team of project managers</li><li>Sound knowledge of exterior restorations and building codes</li><li>Working knowledge of Xactware and Eagleview</li><li>Demonstrable track of sales, profitability, and operations success</li><li>Strong relationship building skills</li><li>Outstanding communication and sales skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Ability to work evenings and weekends, as required.</li>  </ul> The Peak Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We respect the dignity and worth of every individual in the workplace and value the importance of diversity, fairness, and trust. We offer a dynamic work environment and a competitive compensation package. Our goal is to attract, develop, and engage employees with exceptional ability and diverse backgrounds. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls or personnel agencies please.

Title: Construction Manager, Senior
Job_Description: <strong>Business Line</strong> Oil + Gas <br/><br/> <strong>Position Title</strong> Construction Manager, Senior <br/><br/> Canada - Alberta <br/><br/> Calgary <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is seeking a Senior Construction Manager to be based at our Calgary, Alberta office location. Please note, this position is also site-based at times. <br/><br/> This position is responsible for the organization, direction, supervision and coordination of construction activities on a project site as delineated in the applicable PEPs, Site Specific Safety Plan and PXP. <br/><br/> May include the following responsibilities:  <ul> <li>Responsible for work procedures, scheduling, cost control, project specification conformity, establishment of manpower levels, monitoring and implementation of safety programs, project conformance to national, local and/or company building codes and the maintenance of accurate records.</li>  <li>Responsible for the satisfactory conduct of all construction operations and task accomplishment in an economical, efficient and timely manner on a project.</li>  <li>Monitors craft performance relative to budget, schedules and deadlines.</li>  <li>Monitors manpower utilization, effectiveness and productivity.</li>  <li>Facilitates the efficient use of personnel and equipment.</li>  <li>Implements and enforces work rules.</li>  <li>Coordinates movement and use of equipment and supplies with Material Management.</li>  <li>Requisitions tools, materials and equipment in accordance with established procedures and necessary lead times.</li>  <li>Prepares and reviews plans, specifications, drawings and schedules to determine work phases and work priorities.</li>  <li>Determines and recommends solutions to construction and architectural discrepancies.</li>  <li>Inspects fieldwork to evaluate construction progress, efficiency of operation and cost control.</li>  <li>Responsible for overall project workmanship and goal attainment.</li>  <li>Implements the construction portion of the assigned project through day-to-day direction of all field activities and is responsible for all job site activities.</li>  <li>Ensures timely and efficient execution of fieldwork.</li>  <li>Acts as the primary client contact for all construction project field activities.</li>  <li>Ensures all construction is in compliance with design specifications, is completed on schedule, adheres to budget, meets accounting requirements and is built to quality standards.</li>  <li>Functions as a Project Manager on a direct-hire construction-only project or as the field manager on an engineering/ procurement/construction management project.</li>  <li>Responsible to a member of the Project Managers job family or the Operations Manager job family.</li>  <li>Under general direction, responsible for managing very large and/or complex construction projects.</li>  <li>Conducts work requiring independent evaluation, selection, adaptation and modification of standard construction techniques.</li>  <li>Demonstrates the ability to work on unusually complicated projects.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Education:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in a Construction related discipline or demonstrated combination of equivalent education and experience.</li> </ul> <strong>Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Extensive construction and project related experience.</li>  <li>Possesses a thorough knowledge of all engineering disciplines, construction technologies and job site management.</li>  <li>This is a senior level construction management position.</li>  <li>This position will be required to drive a vehicle on behalf of AECOM and therefore will require the candidate to submit a satisfactory driver's abstract for review.</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> N/A <br/><br/> AOGCA1 <br/><br/> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <br/><br/> At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees. <br/><br/> <em>NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Job Category</em></strong> <em>Construction Management</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Business Group</em></strong> <em>Construction Services Group (CS)</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Country</em></strong> <em>Canada</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Position Status</em></strong> <em>Full-Time</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Requisition/Vacancy No.</em></strong> <em>186589BR</em> <br/><br/> <em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.</em>

Title: Manager In Training
Job_Description: <strong>Manager in Training (MIT): What Does It Take To Be A Property Manager?</strong> <br/><br/> The MIT position is an entry level position. It requires an energetic and driven individual with a passion for working with people, and the desire to take full ownership of a multi-million dollar community. Your primary objective is to develop the skills required for consistently meeting monthly income and expense budgets for your community. From customer service to annual budgets, marketing to maintenance, you will become familiar with all aspects of residential property management. <br/><br/> The successful MIT will accomplish this objective by actively engaging with onsite teams as well as participating in class room training modules geared towards making you the best at what you do.<br/><br/><strong>Key Learning Objectives:</strong>  <ul> <li>Sales and Marketing: Learn how to target the ideal customer for your individual property, and the sales techniques that go into closing the deal</li><li>Establish a Budget: Working with both accounts receivable and payable, learn how to create and manage an operating budget for your property</li><li>Projections: Through the use of an effective marketing plan, and careful monitoring of your budget, learn how to make monthly financial projections for your property</li><li>Facility Maintenance: Become familiar with the maintenance needs of a multi-million dollar rental property. From the beautification of its landscaping, to the efficiency of its utilities, learn how effective maintenance impacts and improves your bottom line</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Entry level position – no experience in property management is preferred</li><li>Ability to work in a fast paced professional environment</li><li>Have excellent interpersonal communication skills</li><li>Excellent salesmanship and customer service abilities</li><li>Highly organized</li><li>Excellent time management abilities</li><li>Excellent problem solving skills</li> </ul> Must have a Bachelor’s Degree to qualify for program

Title: Product Manager, Calgary AB
Job_Description: <div>Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the mining, forestry, industrial and construction industries that maximizes value for customers through innovative solutions. With a full line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies and global service network, we help customers safely and sustainably optimize their operations. Our Komatsu, P&H, Joy and Montabert equipment and services are used to extract fundamental minerals and develop modern infrastructure. <br/><br/> This Position Reports to: Manager, Sales and Business Development <br/><br/> Shift: 5 x 2 - Mon to Fri with some weekend work (as required) <br/><br/> Location: Calgary, Alberta or Saskatchewan <br/><br/> Relocation: This position offers relocation to Canadian Residents / This position does not offer relocation. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Continue to develop our underground equipment presence in Canada, with the end objective of supporting and building a cost effective and profitable local business and end user engagement</li> <li>Liaise with technical product support, engineering personnel and Komatsu Canada Account Managers. Advise Engineering, Quality, Manufacturing and purchasing departments of technical issues, potential solutions or product enhancements to mitigate negative impact and protect or grow the overall business.</li> <li>Maintain and grow relationships with the Greenfield customers and EPCM’s</li> <li>Sustain and Grow OE and Service revenue and market share related to the underground product lines</li> <li>Being a Subject Matter Expert and work closely with the regions</li> <li>Work with the sales team to insure the highest possible level of customer satisfaction.</li> <li>Developing and presenting Technical and Commercial proposals to existing and prospective customers. Preparation of quotes and executive summaries.</li> <li>Become recognized industry expert for product(s) participating in development of white papers and speaking opportunities.</li> <li>Develop and execute strategic marketing plans for the Underground products, drive the sales and service function from beginning to end.</li> <li>Conduct market research, competitive intelligence efforts, and lead cross-functional teams to ensure market-driven Underground product direction is achieved, develop product sales strategy.</li> <li>Presentation of all new developments to the product lines on an ongoing basis to existing and new customers.</li> <li>Responsible for guiding and setting the direction for the marketing functions and plans for new product development initiatives from project launch to commercialization throughout Canada.</li> <li>Maintain and grow relationships with the customers</li> <li>Conduct Audits (operational and administrative), and undertake on-site condition assessments of products.</li> <li>Be proactive in understanding and anticipating customer’s needs</li> <li>Dedicated to making the customer equipment work at optimal performance levels requires that the incumbent be action oriented and able to quickly build respected and trusted relationship.</li> <li>Solve complex and routine problems by finding effective solutions that meet and/or exceed the expectations of the customer. This requires the ability to look beyond the first question and probe for the root cause of issues.</li> <li>Understand and anticipate the differing personalities of customers and ability to adapt to those customers.</li> <li>Produce summary and update reports requires written competency, allowing those who would review such reports, internally and externally, to quickly grasp key strengths, issues and concerns.</li> <li>Adapt to differing customer, regulatory, safety and mine site conditions requires a sound ability to listen effectively, and act and behave in a consistent and appropriate manner.</li> <li>Technical competence related to the operation and maintenance of heavy equipment is vital. The ability to present and convey important messages about these products in meeting and training sessions.</li> <li>Time management skills</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Experience:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Trade or engineering qualification, or extensive prior product and technical training within a similar role; Credible knowledge (through work experience and training) of heavy equipment maintenance</li> <li>Must be able to work with minimal supervision</li> <li>Minimum 5 plus years Product and Solution Sales and Commercial experience</li> <li>Full understanding of Site Safety and Environment protocols</li> <li>Demonstrated customer management experience</li> <li>Demonstrated experience in preparing and presenting proposals, and RFQ management</li> <li>Project co-ordination experience and ability to conceptualize and plan a scope of work</li> <li>Computer literacy in Microsoft Office suite (Salesforce knowledge an advantage)</li></ul>   <ul>  	<li>Percentage of Travel: 50% - 75%</li> </ul> Komatsu Mining offers an excellent benefit package. We are an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest however, only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted. <br/><br/> No agency or candidate phone calls please. <br/><br/> Komatsu Mining Corporation welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. <br/><br/> Posting End Date: April 20, 2018 </div> <br/>

Title: Instrumentation and Controls Department Manager
Job_Description: <div><div><em>CIMA+ is currently seeking applications for an experienced <strong>Instrumentation and Controls Department Manager</strong> for our Calgary office. We are seeking a highly motivated, self-directed individual with excellent attention to detail, strong technical knowledge, and a passion for accuracy and efficiency in their work. The ideal candidate will have the ability to work independently as well as part of the team, and will possess strong problem-solving and communication abilities. The successful candidate will represent CIMA+ in all interactions with clients and other project team members, therefore requiring strong interpersonal skills and business acumen.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong>  <ul>  <li>Lead the I&C department</li>    <li>Perform I&C design and prepare engineering work deliverables.</li>    <li>Coordinate and communicate with other disciplines and the client.</li>    <li>Business development with new and existing clients.</li>    <li>Ability to interpret client specifications and multi-disciplinary engineering drawings.</li>    <li>Following QA/QC procedures and guidelines of the CIMA and Client Quality Assurance systems.</li>    <li>Review drawings and documents for completeness, accuracy, and constructability.</li>    <li>Responsible for developing and completing construction work packages.</li>    <li>Completes instrument engineering project responsibilities within scope, budget and schedule.</li>    <li>Assist and support junior personnel within the instrumentation team.</li>    <li>Keep up-to-date with the latest developments and technical innovations in instrumentation engineering.</li>    <li>Provide assistance and advice during procurement, construction and commissioning activities.</li>    <li>Support the development of instrument engineering proposal scope definition and manpower estimates.</li>    <li>Represent CIMA+ and effectively interact with external clients. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong></li>    <li>Post-Secondary Education in a field related to Instrumentation and Controls.</li>    <li>Minimum of 15 years of direct instrumentation design and engineering experience in oil/gas, refining, oil sands, and mining.</li>    <li>Extensive working knowledge of Instrumentation deliverables such as:</li>    <li>Instrument Specifications (Datasheets),</li>    <li>Instrument Location Drawings,</li>    <li>Instrument Installation Details,</li>    <li>Bill of Materials,</li>    <li>I/O Lists,</li>    <li>Loop Drawings,</li>    <li>Cause and Effect Diagrams and Shutdown keys,</li>    <li>Control Narratives,</li>    <li>Construction or Engineering Work Packages,</li>    <li>Panel (JB and Marshalling) Design,</li>    <li>Wiring Drawings,</li>    <li>Material Requisitions.</li>    <li>Extensive working knowledge of Instrumentation Calculation/Selection, such as:</li>    <li>Flow (Orifice Plates, Vortex, Venturi, Magnetic, Ultrasonic meters),</li>    <li>Level Measurement (Radar, Displacers, Gauges),</li>    <li>Temperature (including Thermowells),</li>    <li>Valve (Control & On/Off valves and actuator selection & sizing),</li>    <li>Process Analysers and sampling systems.</li>    <li>Competent use of instrument calculation/selection specific software.</li>    <li>Extensive knowledge of industry and regulatory standards and codes related to Instrumentation system deliverables.</li>    <li>Ability to work as a team player and interact well with others.</li>    <li>Ability to utilize the available time to organize and complete work within given deadlines.</li>    <li>Ability to develop templates and standards to improve efficiency.</li>    <li>Ability to lead, train and mentor less experienced designers and drafters.</li>    <li>Competent use of relevant software such as MS Office Suite.</li>    <li>Excellent interpersonal skills, excellent written and verbal communication skills</li>    </ul>  </div> </div><div></div> <br/> Apply Now!

Title: Property Manager
Job_Description: At Brookfield (Canada) Inc. we are in the business of owning, managing and developing premier office properties globally. The quality and location of our landmark office properties continue to attract the best and most successful organizations across these regions. In Canada, we own and manage properties in three major cities - Toronto, Ottawa and Calgary. We are a leader in the commercial real estate market because of our greatest asset, our people. We look for talented individuals to join our growing organization and share our passion towards service excellence for our tenants and clients. If you possess outstanding interpersonal skills, are customer driven, and are innovative, then we encourage you to take your career to the next level and apply for this exciting opportunity with us. <br/><br/> <u>DESCRIPTION</u>: <br/><br/> The Property Manager is a managerial position responsible for the day-to-day management of Fifth Avenue Place, ensuring all critical operational success factors are properly scheduled and provided in order to successfully operate the building and fully satisfy Tenant needs and operational requirements. <br/><br/> The incumbent will direct all physical operational and administrative functions associated with the property, ensuring that it is managed and operated at the highest possible standard in accordance with Brookfields goals and objectives through sound financial management, timely reporting, lease administration, tenant and client relations, superior tenant service, enhanced tenant satisfaction and retention, and employee engagement and proactive management, all in accordance with applicable codes, environmental requirements and government legislation. <br/><br/> This role is also responsible for promoting Brookfield as the pre-eminent property management company in Canada through superior and innovative strategies designed to increase value and enhance important relationships with new high profile office tenancies. <br/><br/> Focusing on relationship management through constant communication and follow up ensuring a timely resolution to operational and tenant issues. Supervising and providing direction to all Fifth Avenue Place departments to ensure the complex is presented at the highest standard while meeting tenant expectations on a daily basis. <br/><br/> <u>RESPONSIBILITIES</u>:  <ul> <li>Hire, develop and maintain an effective and efficient Property Management team through proper selection, ongoing training/development, and assignment of personnel ensuring a positive and supportive work environment;</li> <li>Lead and manage the property team with the day-to-day administrative and operational functions in a supportive and proactive manner;</li> <li>Ensure all contracted services and maintenance functions are performed in a first class manner;</li> <li>Review and monitor Service Center requests and reports. Ensure Work Order system is achieving or exceeding superior service levels;</li> <li>Create property related specifications, tender, negotiate, document and oversee all service/supplier contracts;</li> <li>Minimize risk and exposure to the property and Brookfield through the process of contract documentation and negotiation;</li> <li>Assist and participate in the development of annual corporate Business Plan;</li> <li>Prepare and develop annual property budgets and forecasts (revenue, operating expenses, capital) for asset management approval;</li> <li>Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual financial reporting requirements;</li> <li>Maintain accurate financial records and ensure departments are operating within their annual budget guidelines, while achieving their goals on annual initiatives;</li> <li>Oversee the final year end Operating Statements;</li> <li>Review property income and expense statements to determine that the property & buildings are operating within the budget and that all corporate income projections are being met;</li> <li>Oversee the preparation of the Monthly Management reports;</li> <li>Oversee and participate in planning and organizing all tenant improvements, renovations, construction and all budgeted and approved capital programs;</li> <li>Provide assistance to office and retail leasing representatives, participate in lease negotiations and renewals as required;</li> <li>Ensure execution of all leases and that administrative responsibilities are being performed;</li> <li>Identify all leasing opportunities including ensuring retail mix fulfills property needs and is both innovative and successful;</li> <li>Manage internal relationships ensuring that national initiatives with emphasis on enhancing asset value for ownership through the implementation of the strategic financial plan including annual operating and capital plans, operating initiatives, corporate objectives, continuing employee development and ensuring the Brookfield service culture is maintained;</li> <li>Participate in regional and national initiatives, offering a leadership role in Brookfields programs;</li> <li>Oversee the development and implementation of the annual Marketing Plan focusing on the fulfillment of Retail tenant needs and requirements to increase traffic and sales performance. Marketing Plan to be regularly reviewed and updated in order to respond to market trends and performance;</li> <li>Provide superior Tenant Management strategies in order to support retention. Ensure tenant needs are being met through the implementation of customer service processes and procedures in order to meet Landlords contractual obligations (leases and use clauses);</li> <li>Respond to all Tenant and public inquiries, requests and issues as may be necessary from time to time;</li> <li>Present the Quarterly Property Report at the Quarterly Asset Meeting ensuring all relevant Financial and Operational issues are updated and reviewed;</li> <li>Actively participate in local committees and industry associations such as BOMA;</li> <li>Other projects as assigned.</li> </ul> <u>SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS</u>: <br/><br/> A proven leader that exhibits and insists on a standard of excellence and shares Brookfields vision to work collaboratively with others in meeting our commitment to providing outstanding customer service. The ideal candidate works independently and has the proven ability to deal with difficult and sensitive situations. In addition, the successful candidate will have strong communication, interpersonal, organizational, and critical thinking skills with the ability to manage competing deadlines. <br/><br/> Outgoing, diplomatic, confident, mature and self-motivated describes the ideal candidate. Strong leadership skills with experience in developing and motivating staff to their highest potential, while continuously improving processes and practices. Must conduct oneself in an honest and ethical manner at all times. <br/><br/> <u>EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS</u>:  <ul> <li>Minimum five (5) years of equivalent managerial experience preferably in class A mixed-use facilities including experience overseeing employee development and dealing directly with employee issues;</li> <li>Experience in preparation of business plans, operating budgets, variance analysis, management/quarterly report preparation, marketing strategies, lease types, leasing strategies, lease negotiations, legal remedies, purchasing, contracts, collections, insurance, operation and maintenance, HVAC systems, building services, security & life safety systems and strategies, special events, and promotions and advertising;</li> <li>Knowledge on general building maintenance and operations;</li> <li>Experience with sustainability programs such as LEED EB:OM, BOMA 360/BESt, or other sustainability programs is an asset;</li> <li>Knowledge of legal contract administration, project management, accounting procedures including budgeting and reporting.</li> <li>Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office software;</li> <li>Strong financial acumen;</li> <li>Effective presentation and negotiation skills.</li> </ul> <u>EDUCATION / DESIGNATIONS / LICENSES</u>:  <ul> <li>University degree is preferred;</li> <li>Possess or actively working toward RPA, FMA or CPM;</li> <li>Possess or actively working toward a Real Estate License is an asset, however not required.</li> </ul> We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for pre-screening will be contacted. <br/><br/> Brookfield Properties (Canada) Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to the inclusion and accommodation of all individuals.

Title: Governance & Operations Manager
Job_Description: <br/><br/> Requisition ID: 27425 <br/><br/> Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Purpose</strong> <br/><br/> The Governance & Operations Manager is responsible for contributing to Private Investment Counsel’s overall success by leading a team and initiatives to minimize regulatory, Tier 1 and reputational risk to the firm. The incumbent will conduct ongoing supervisory activities to a high standard, identifying potential issues and concerns and ensuring appropriate corrective actions are implemented in a timely manner. The Governance & Operations Manager works closely with the Senior Manager, National Field Operations and in market Relationship Managers in order to implement risk and compliance mitigation strategies and programs, regulatory monitoring and to fulfil sales supervisory functions for the assigned Market.  <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> This role will manage a team of assigned Portfolio Administrator’s in the delivery of superior service and operational support to PIC Relationship Managers and their clients. The Governance & Operations Manager is responsible for managing workflows and operational project and initiative rollouts, training, coaching and supporting the professional development of their team members. This includes in-market oversight and leadership to drive operational efficiency through development and implementation of best practices leading to sustainable operational excellence.  <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> The incumbent understands how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions, ensuring that all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <br/><br/> 1. Executes on effective management of tier one compliance and regulatory oversight for the assigned market: <ul> <li>Working closely with the assigned market team to uphold regulatory oversight and risk management standards resulting in enhanced client experience through effective and accurate account opening and asset transfer activities and processes. </li><li>Working with Compliance partners to implement regulatory and fiduciary guidelines into in market best practices.</li> <li>Monitoring adherence to regulatory and internal Bank requirements; ensuring compliance, risk management and regulatory rules, guidelines, policies and standards are followed across the assigned market area. </li><li>Sharing knowledge to the audit function and researching of identified issues to result in favourable audit results.</li> <li>Ensures business level processes and procedures are properly executed, documented, and reviewed for audit purposes as required. </li><li>Supports the audit function both in the preparation stage and issue resolution of findings. </li><li>Conducting quarterly file reviews for assigned markets and associated relationship managers.</li><li>Providing in market support to Senior Manager, National Field Operations to communicate and implement any changes in policies and practices for assigned market. </li><li>Supporting Senior Manager, National Field Operations to identify, research, document and report upon compliance concerns, unusual occurrences, suspicious or fraudulent activities, as per established procedures</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> 2. Leads the delivery of client service and administration to the assigned RMS by: <ul> <li>Ensuring the PA Team provides a high degree of service and administrative support combined with innovative approaches to resolving client and Relationship Manager servicing issues while maintaining an overall low risk profile.</li><li>Demonstrating the expected service standards during client interactions.</li><li>Understanding the PIC value proposition for consistent delivery of the desired client experience during all client interactions and coaching the Admin Team to adhere to the same standards.</li><li>Reviewing processes and providing recommendations to improve the client experience and enhance efficiencies.</li><li>Escalating and resolving any processing concerns or delays with service partners (Custody, IMS Ops)</li><li>Providing oversight for the market in the execution of client transactions and documentation through detailed and accurate management of portfolio administration tasks and activities.</li><li>Governing the end-to-end client onboarding processes with respect to operational and administrative processes.</li><li>Taking full responsibility for all Client inquiries/concerns/complaints Lead to resolve those matters within their discretion to the client’s satisfaction and to documenting the concern to the Compliance as required.</li><li>Ensuring the client service staffing levels/work schedules meet client service and administrative demands, adjusting as required.</li><li>Collaborating with other PIC Governance & Operations Managers across the country to share and enhance business and best practices. </li><li>Executing on National/Executive office operations initiatives</li><li>Working closely with Senior Manager, National Field Operations to provide team updates, service level reporting, develop team goals and objectives. </li> </ul>   <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> 3. Lead and develop the Administration team by: <ul> <li>Leading and developing a team of Portfolio Administrators by providing coaching, direction and guidance.</li><li>Creating an individualized training program for all new hires to ensure their ability to complete job functions.</li><li>Planning and leading one-on-one coaching sessions and skill-building sessions.</li><li>Monitoring and achieving key performance metrics for self and team (referrals, expenses, revenue)</li><li>Recognizing and rewarding successes and managing non-performance.</li><li>Developing and obtaining agreement on individualized Personal Development Plans for all direct reports.</li><li>Identifying and supporting training and developmental needs of team members.</li><li>Monitoring performance concerns of direct reports and establishing a performance management schedule to address and improve poor performance.</li><li>Managing the vacation schedule for the Portfolio Administration Team to ensure service levels are met.</li><li>Developing a strong culture and positive team environment</li><li>Championing the adoption and implementation of new tools, technology and processes.</li><li>Resolving issues and negotiating compromises between team members.</li><li>Recruiting, hiring and promoting team members.</li><li>Completing semi-annual and annual performance appraisals.</li><li>Establishing performance objectives annually for direct reports then monitor to ensure objectives are met.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> 4. Support Business Development within Private Investment Counsel by: <ul> <li>Identifying and referring new business opportunities through ongoing client contact.</li><li>Developing processes and practices for PA/RM engagement focused on business development strategies, for leveraging across the PIC office where possible</li><li>Coaching the Administration Team to identify and refer new sales or referral opportunities through ongoing client contact or annual review meeting preparation.</li><li>Ensuring direct reports have a strong knowledge of all ScotiaWealth offerings.</li><li>Supporting the execution of marketing strategies to attract and retain valuable clients.</li><li>Coordinating the preparation of material for business development activities.</li><li>Working with Market Leaders to enhance the quality of business development activities, prospects, portfolio growth through regular and ongoing support to Relationship Managers of sales strategy execution, client service and Centre-led client events.</li><li>Developing a clear understanding of the departments financial and non-financial goals.</li><li>Establishing and monitoring referral goals for direct reports.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> 5. Support compliance, regulatory and operational risk by: <ul> <li>Minimizing the Bank’s exposure to risk by complying with and ensuring team members’ compliance with all procedures, regulatory activities and guidelines including Privacy, Anti-Money Laundering, Anti-Terrorist Financing, FCAC, Know Your Client, Occupational Health and Safety and Guidelines for Business Conduct.</li><li>Supporting and reinforcing any changes in policies and practices to Relationship Managers.</li><li>Coaching direct reports on effectively understanding and implementing compliance regulations.</li><li>Working with Relationship Managers to strategize towards inclusion of regulatory and compliance best practices.</li><li>Proactively identifying potential and actual compliance issues and concerns and escalating to proper authority.</li><li>Liaising with the compliance department to ensure inquiries are resolved in a timely manner and identifying patterns and on-going issues and escalating as required.</li><li>Ensuring client complaints, claims, legal actions and regulatory reviews, examinations and investigations are handled effectively and corrective actions are implemented in a timely manner.</li><li>Escalating, documenting and reporting any unusual occurrences, suspicious or fraudulent activities as per established procedures and guidelines.</li><li>Supporting the Relationship Managers in maintaining client portfolios in accordance with established firm strategy which includes utilizing the central portfolio models and pools, focusing on client segmentation and risk assessment.</li><li>Co-coordinating and completing any reporting requirements accurately and submitting to the appropriate authority in a timely manner.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>Functional Competencies</strong> <br/><br/> Thorough investment management know-how and depth of experience required as it relates to understanding economic and market data; <br/><br/> Solid understanding of Canadian Wealth Management objectives, strategies and structures & PIC Business Line’s value proposition; <br/><br/> Strong compliance knowledge and experience in Private Wealth and Investment Management <br/><br/> Ability to cultivate and maintain strong relationships; <br/><br/> Highly effective verbal and written communication skills to be able to effectively articulate views both within the Bank and externally; <br/><br/> Extensive knowledge of all applicable regulatory rules, guidelines, policies and requirements. <br/><br/> Strong interpersonal, & listening and people management skills <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Education / Experience</strong> <br/><br/> University Degree (Business, Economics, Accounting, Finance); <br/><br/> Asset: CSC & CIM, or its predecessor CIF, CFA; <br/><br/> Previous experience with Tier 1 compliance/regulation <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Location(s): Canada : Alberta : Calgary <br/><br/> As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

Title: Manager, SOX Compliance and Internal Audit
Job_Description: <div> <div> Manager, SOX Compliance and Internal Audit <br/>  <div> Apply now »</div>  </div> <br/><strong>Date:</strong>  <br/>  May 8, 2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> <br/>  Calgary, AB, CA <br/><br/> <strong>Company:</strong>  <br/>  TransCanada<br/> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong>Manager, SOX Compliance and Internal Audit</strong> <br/><br/> Reference Code: 51021</div> </div> </div><br/>  <div><strong>Location:</strong> Canada (CA) - Calgary, AB</div><br/>  <div><strong>Job Category:</strong> Accounting/Finance</div><br/>  <div><strong>Employment Type:</strong> Employee Full-time</div><br/>  <div><strong>Relocation Eligibility:</strong> This position is not eligible for our relocation program</div> <br/><strong>General Information</strong> <br/><br/> This position reports to the Director, Internal Audit and will be the key driver in integrating TransCanada’s SOX and Internal Audit effort. Driving efficiencies from the two areas of responsibility, this role will be responsible for the coordination and execution activities necessary to ensure requirements of Sections 302 and 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act are met, as well as manage a portfolio of internal audits and be a proactive liaison between SOX and Internal Audit efforts. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Provide leadership and guidance to SOX and Internal Audit team members;</li> <li>Monitor progress of overall SOX program and audits being managed;</li> <li>Identify areas where integrating SOX testing can be integrated into audit testing, and other efficiencies;</li> <li>Lead annual SOX scoping sessions and prepare scoping documentation;</li> <li>Liaison with external auditors and responding to queries;</li> <li>Coordinate the deficiency evaluation process;</li> <li>Coordinate the quarterly SOX sub-certification process;</li> <li>Report on annual SOX program results;</li> <li>Facilitate and assist business process owners in the documentation of relevant business processes and systems as necessary to identify controls required to be reviewed under the Act;</li> <li>Assess internal control design and identify potential weaknesses;</li> <li>Plan, execute and document tests and/or other procedures to evaluate the effectiveness of internal controls;</li> <li>Evaluate control design and operating deficiencies;</li> <li>Coordinate with business units/departments in the execution of activities;</li> <li>Perform quality assurance reviews of file documentation;</li> <li>Communicate with senior management with respect to monthly/quarterly updates;</li> <li>Identify efficiencies, collaboration and integration opportunities between SOX and Internal Audit;</li> <li>Other duties as required.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> You are entrepreneurial and passionate about the contributions you make, and bring a positive, can-do driven attitude with you to work every day. The successful candidate will be creative and innovative in your approach, will be bright, hardworking, fun, focused on results, known and respected for your integrity, and your ability to building trusting relationships with business partners. You are not afraid to challenge traditional thinking in an effort to provide fresh foresight and perspective. Other required qualifications include:  <ul>  	<li>Strong leadership, communication and problem solving competencies;</li> <li>Excellent project management and organizational skills, with an ability to manage multiple and competing priorities under tight deadlines;</li> <li>Strong team player with the ability to develop and maintain collaborative working relationships;</li> <li>A results-oriented approach, combined with a "roll up your sleeves" attitude;</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills combined with the ability to interact effectively with senior management and team members;</li> <li>Experience in the identification, testing and evaluation of financial reporting controls;</li> <li>Understanding of risk-based methodologies;</li> <li>Experience coaching audit staff to identify and report value added recommendations to the business;</li> <li>Knowledge of financial reporting and business processes;</li> <li>Proven ability to work independently and effectively with minimal supervision.</li> </ul> <strong>Education/Experience:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Professional accounting designation required (CPA);</li> <li>University Degree in Business or Commerce;</li> <li>10 or more years of progressive related accounting or auditing experience;</li> <li>Experience with SAP controls and energy industry is a definite asset.</li> </ul> *Depending on the qualifications of the applicants, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or ladder. <br/><br/> Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no restrictions. <br/><br/> Applicants who require accommodation at any stage of the application process or if you would like additional information regarding TransCanada's accommodation policies please contact careers@transcanada.com. <br/><br/> All positions require background screening. Some include criminal and/or credit checks in order to comply with regulations. <br/><br/> <strong>Please apply to this posting by 05/22/2018.</strong> To apply, go to jobs.transcanada.com and enter reference code 51021. Only applications submitted through the TransCanada Careers website will be acknowledged. <br/><br/> TransCanada is an equal opportunity employer. <br/><br/> <strong>Make what you do matter.</strong> <br/><br/> At TransCanada we dream big, think big and do big things. We're looking for people who are ready to take on the most significant challenges of their careers and define energy infrastructure in North America. <br/><br/> Thank you for choosing TransCanada in your career search. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Segment:</strong>  <br/>  Audit, Internal Audit, Compliance, ERP, Manager, Finance, Legal, Technology, Management</div><br/>   <div> <div> Apply now »</div>  </div>  </div> <br/>

Title: Business Development Manager
Job_Description: <div>ecognized as a leader in the EPC industry and ranked as the #2 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine, we primarily serve the oil & gas, refining & petrochemical and chemicals industries providing engineering and construction of some of the world's largest refinery and petrochemical complexes. Our services include execution of major revamps and grassroots projects across petroleum refining, gas processing, liquefied natural gas, and associated offsite and environmental facilities worldwide.</div><br/>  <div>Jacobs serves the Upstream, Midstream, Refining, and Petrochemicals Industries by providing innovative solutions to our clients throughout the globe. For projects of all sizes we provide consulting, front-end engineering, design, procurement, construction, and maintenance services to support our clients.</div> <br/> <strong><div>Position Summary:</div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <div>Develop, maintain, and advance client relationships through sales strategies and client contacts, resulting in new contracts and added value for our clients. Consistently advocates and adheres to sales process and procurement integrity guidelines. Responsible for development and management of sales pursuits / relationships and presentation efforts.</div><br/>  <div>   <ul>   <li>Partners with Regional Management to identify new developments within the exploration and production hydrocarbons markets and proposes growth-related initiatives.</li>   <li>Develops and maintains relationships with midstream clients and internal operations, and sales team, cultivates new midstream clients.</li> <li>Assumes primary responsibility for client relationships and sales strategies.</li> <li>Leads development of sales strategies and win plans to grow accounts.</li> <li>Tracks and shares client relationship developments and prospects.</li> <li>Maintains and enforces client confidentiality, procurement integrity, gatekeeper approval, and company Identity Program compliance.</li> <li>Leads pricing strategy development and pricing reviews, and develops bid & proposal estimates.</li> <li>Negotiates contracts through collaboration with and support from operations, legal, risk, and accounting.</li> <li>Works with sales and operations teams to assess resource availability and assemble project teams.</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div>  <ul> <li>BS or BA required</li><li>Minimum 10 Years in midstream/upstream business, preferably with an EPC contractor but other midstream experience will be considered.</li> <li>Minimum 3 Years of sales or business development experience.</li><li>Project Management experience preferred</li><li>Must be legally authorized to work in Canada for any employer other than your current employer</li></ul></div><br/>  <div>Jacobs serves the Upstream, Midstream, Refining, and Petrochemicals Industries by providing innovative solutions to our clients throughout the globe. For projects of all sizes we provide consulting, front-end engineering, design, procurement, construction, and maintenance services to support our clients.</div>

Title: Manager, Piping & Designing

a major project</li>  <li>Leading and /or providing expert level technical knowledge and guidance in the design and delivery of highly complex and technically challenging engineering projects within and performance management</li>  <li>Provide competent assistance to all levels of design staff, including:   <ul>   <li>3-D modeling and any associated piping outputs (plans and section drawings, piping isometrics, etc.)</li>  <li>PFD/P&ID Creation and Revisions</li>  <li>Plot plan layouts</li>  <li>Communicating with other departments to complete various project deliverables</li> staff</li>  <li>Provide weekly reporting to management regarding staff level/utilization and any workload/schedule or client challenges</li>  <li>Monitor expended design hours vs. budgeted design hours when required</li> </ul> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Technical school graduate with a minimum of 20 years’ piping experience</li>  <li>Completed leadership training/courses</li>  <li>Previous experience in a technical/project lead role</li>  <li>Ability to manage and develop individuals</li>  <li>Ability to develop and execute on a strategic plan</li>  <li>Be a representative to clients, vendors and project team</li> </ul> <strong>KEY COMPETENCIES</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Able to understand, express and apply complex analytical concepts within discipline</li>  <li>Thorough understanding of NBL’s Piping and Design Drafting Group procedures and practices</li>  <li>Ability to assess design manpower requirements and match designer abilities to specific project requirements</li>  <li>Ability to effectively mentor leads and designers at all levels</li>  <li>Solid understanding of engineering principles and related codes</li>  <li>Able to communicate, understand, express and apply basic technical, business or administrative concepts and can effectively interface with internal and external stakeholders</li>  <li>Decision and problem-solving ability</li>  <li>Proven ability to multi-task and efficiently respond to changing priorities</li>  <li>Accepts coaching, knowledge and support from more experienced staff</li>
