Title: Practice Manager, Microsoft Dynamics
Job_Description: <strong>BDO. Because relationships matter.</strong> <br/><br/> There are many world-class accounting & advisory firms. Far fewer that offer a culture so rich in professional opportunity, personal fulfillment, and long-term growth. At BDO, we understand that exceptional service to our clients begins – and ends – with exceptional regard for our people. Because at its core, our business is not about numbers or spreadsheets, dollars or pence, but about people working with, for, and in service of others. In short, because relationships matter. <br/><br/> <strong><strong>Position Summary</strong></strong> <br/><br/> BDO Canada LLP is in the process of recruiting an experienced Microsoft Dynamics Practice Manager, with strong expertise in any of Dynamics NAV, AX and/or GP. <br/><br/> Based out of our Calgary office, this individual will manage a team of professionals focused on implementing, supporting and training components of Dynamics Enterprise Resource Planning solutions at various client sites in Calgary and elsewhere in Alberta. Occasional travel to other parts of Western Canada, Eastern Canada and the United States may also be required. <br/><br/> In addition, this individual will also be responsible for managing all aspects of simple to complex implementation projects as well as mentoring consultants on the team. <br/><br/> BDO Canada LLP is Canada's 6th largest accounting and advisory firm with over 95 offices and over 3,000 advisors across Canada. We focus on meeting the needs of Canadian businesses, individuals, and community-based organizations. We offer a full range of business advisory services to meet the unique needs of our highly diverse clientele. Our Canadian offices are located in the country's larger cities and smaller communities. We are in the unique position of being national and local at the same time - a distinction no other Canadian accounting firm can declare. <br/><br/> BDO Canada LLP’s Advisory Services Solutions group is a full service Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software reseller and ERP business services provider. BDO specializes in providing Microsoft Dynamics NAV, AX and GP value-added business solutions that are aligned with companies’ goals and expectations. BDO Solutions is a Microsoft Gold Certified partner and leading provider of Microsoft integrated solutions in Canada. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Manage and mentor a team of MS Dynamics Consultants</li><li>Provide pre- and post-sales support as required</li><li>Analyze client business requirements and objectives</li><li>Manage Microsoft Dynamics software projects at client sites</li><li>Provide client support and consultation regarding issues with configurations and implementations</li><li>Train BDO Solutions clients</li><li>Work with direct reports to build performance plans</li><li>Conduct yearly reviews of performance plans with direct reports</li><li>Provide regular day to day and career coaching</li> </ul> <strong>Education and Professional Skills/Knowledge:</strong> <ul> <li>Previous people/team management experience</li><li>Previous consulting experience with Microsoft Dynamics products (NAV, AX or GP)</li><li>Design and configuration of Microsoft Dynamics (NAV, AX or GP)</li><li>University Degree or College Diploma in relevant discipline required.</li><li>Accounting Designation (CA, CGA, or CMA) an asset.</li><li>Microsoft Dynamics Certifications an asset.</li><li>The successful candidate should also be an experienced Microsoft Office applications user.</li> <li>Excellent communication and interpretive skills. Communicating with clients and interpreting their needs will be a daily activity.</li><li>Be a committed team player. The success on each project depends on the combined efforts of the implementation team.</li><li>Be well organized and able to work well under pressure both from clients and from team members. Established deadlines must be met on all engagements.</li><li>Be flexible and adaptable to change. We implement change for diverse clients on a daily basis.</li><li>Be self-motivated. Learning new skills without prompting is expected.</li><li>Be willing to travel up to 25% out of province to the US and other countries</li> </ul> <strong>Our Vision:</strong> <br/><br/> One Firm engaged to make a difference through valued relationships with our people, clients and communities <br/><br/> #LI-MM1

Title: Property Manager
Job_Description: <div><div><div>     </div>  <strong> Property Manager </strong> <div> <div>  Location  <strong> Canada - AB - Calgary </strong> </div> <div>  Department  <strong> Real Estate Management Services </strong> </div> <div>  Position Type  <strong> Full time </strong> </div> </div> </div>  Apply Now </div> <div><p>BE Influential. BE Entrepreneurial. BE the Expert. Be all that and more at Colliers International. Join our team as a Property Manager in Calgary.</p> <p> </p> <p>At Colliers International, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.</p> <p> </p> <p>Who you are</p> <p>Strong client relationships are important to you. You enjoy playing a central role in customer care by bringing superior organizational skills, attention to detail, and a positive attitude to everything you do.</p> <p> </p> <p>As a Property Manager, you will be involved in all aspects of managing your assigned portfolio, from operations and financial activities to managing important relationships with our tenants, property owners and vendors. From managing service contracts and overseeing tenant improvements, to completing property inspections and making recommendations, you’ll have the opportunity to share your innovative ideas.</p> <p>What you bring: </p> <ul> <li>Five or more years of progressive experience managing commercial properties, including office portfolios. </li> <li>Strong understanding of financial reports, including variance of actual vs. budget numbers.</li> <li>Demonstrated experience with real estate software such as Yardi, MRI, etc.</li> <li>Must hold a valid Alberta real estate license.</li> </ul> <p>Bonus skills and experience</p> <ul> <li>Experience with capital improvement projects.</li> <li>You communicate clearly and effectively at all levels.</li> <li>You hold a CPM or RPA designation.</li> </ul> <p>What success looks like: </p> <ul> <li>You develop and maintain strong relationships with property owners, tenants, vendors and contractors. </li> <li>You are responsible for annual budget preparation and tenant reconciliations.</li> </ul> <p> </p> <p>BE who you are and what you want to be with Colliers International. We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team.</p> <p>Direct applicants only please, no agencies. </p> <p>Colliers is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. Colliers encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at canada.careers@colliers.com.</p> <p> </p> <p>#LI-KA1</p></div>

Title: Facility Manager, Calgary (Educational Institution) - Request of proposal
Job_Description: <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>ENGIE Services</STRONG> is a provider of energy efficiency, facility management services and outsourcing solutions for companies and communities. Our experts design, develop and manage tailored, smart and sustainable solutions for our customers’ benefit from airports to office parks and industrial sites. <BR><BR><STRONG>ENGIE Services</STRONG> is part of ENGIE in North America, which manages a range of energy businesses in the U.S. and Canada, including electricity generation and cogeneration, natural gas and liquefied natural gas (LNG) distribution and sales, retail energy sales and energy optimization services. ENGIE (formerly GDF SUEZ) employs 154,950 people worldwide.<BR><BR><STRONG>Job Office:</STRONG> Educational Institution in Calgary<BR><STRONG>Position Status:</STRONG> Permanent, Full Time<BR><STRONG>Schedule:</STRONG> Days</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>**RFP process ongoing**</STRONG></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Summary:</STRONG></DIV> <DIV>The Facility Manager is responsible to manage the overall Building and Equipment operation of the educational facilities in areas of safety, comfort, productivity and efficiency to the standards of the contract and to the satisfaction of our customers 24/7/365 and shall include but not be limited to the following duties and responsibilities.</DIV> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Responsibilities:</STRONG><BR></DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Management :</STRONG></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Serve as the on-site manager representing Engie Services; supervise and train employees to ensure compliance with all provisions of the project.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Responsible for day-to-day operations and maintenance, performance, supervision, and control of sites and that these services are performed in an effective and efficient manner.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Monitor the maintenance of the educational facilities.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Produce results as per financial targets through effective management of employees and resources.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Implement and monitor a Quality Assurance Program for the Site.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Implement and manage FMO programs/systems for the Site.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Be fully familiar with the requirements of the project contract, the schedules and ensure the proper skilled staffing is provided and oversee management of various subcontractors.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Meet with the client representative and Engie’s corporate management on matters relating to the services performed with a view toward obtaining effective coordination of all operations. Issue reports and summaries to the client as required.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Develop, implement and communicate improved processes, policies and procedures on a continuous basis, always seeking greater efficiencies and higher customer satisfaction.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Develop, guide, direct, motivate and manage the performance of all direct reports in line with our HR Program to assist in the realization of their potential and to enhance their knowledge-based skills.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Establish and maintain effective business relationships with customers, suppliers and subcontractors, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Foster and maintain excellent business relations at all levels of the client base to encourage and promote the development of new and unique business opportunities.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate in the annual planning process providing input to form an acceptable business plan that blends with contractual and Engie Objectives.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Maintain a direct involvement in all projects, sales and estimating.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate in the achievement of the KPIs as they relate to your job and sites.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate in the prevention of accidents and promote a safe working environment.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ensure that Engie is in compliance both procedurally and in spirit, with provincial, client and company occupational health and safety policies and procedures.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Provides leadership and guidance for Site Personnel for all aspects of the site facility operations and maintenance to ensure high overall standards and performance.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Development of Personnel and labour negotiations in association with Engie Senior Management.</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV></DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Operational</STRONG></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Establish performance standards for each phase of work. Shall be responsible for the adherence to standard practices and quality specifications for all work performed.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Establish a program for the acquisition, storage and accountability of all operating materials, tools, and equipment.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Develop planned preventative maintenance programs for the site.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Co-ordinate with the Purchasing Manager on requirements for maintenance materials and equipment.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Carry out random quality control checks. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ensure that all equipment and materials are of the required standard and that procedures are in place to prevent fraud and safety issues.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Contract and staff Management.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Budgeting and implementing corrective actions to ensure costs are consistent with ENGIE financial plans.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Maximize communication and synergies within the team.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate in upgrading courses to keep abreast of changing policy, technology and growth.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Roll out and monitoring of Quality Assurance program and safety programs.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Review of sub-contractor performance.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Objectives and strategies are in place to achieve zero lost time injuries in the workplace.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>To provide the highest level of service and support for the Customer.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Perform other duties as assigned. </DIV></LI></UL> <STRONG>Requirements:</STRONG>  <DIV> <UL> <LI>Minimum 10 years of experience in Facilities Maintenance; </LI> <LI>Bachelor Degree: building management or construction or business studies or building services engineering or any relevant degree combined with experience will be evaluated;</LI> <LI>Facility Management Administrator (FMA) or Certified Facility Manager (CFM) (an asset);</LI> <LI>Computer literacy (MS Office suite) and knowledge of computerized maintenance programs (CMMS) a must;</LI> <LI>Trouble shooting and problem-solving experience in a medium to large organization;</LI> <LI>Valid Driver’s License;</LI> <LI>Maintain a high level of technical expertise.</LI></UL> <DIV><STRONG>Skills:</STRONG>  <DIV> <UL> <LI>Excellent verbal and written communication;</LI> <LI>Proven track record in managing a maintenance department;</LI> <LI>Safety & Quality oriented;</LI> <LI>High level of customer orientation / understanding;</LI> <LI>Leadership;</LI> <LI>Interpersonal, relationship-building and networking skills;</LI> <LI>Commercial and negotiation skills;</LI> <LI>Problem solving. </LI></UL></DIV></DIV> <P><STRONG>Notes:</STRONG> </P> <P>The Facility Manager is responsible for different buildings in Calgary and will travel between them occasionally. </P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Equal Employment Opportunity:</STRONG></P> <P>ENGIE Services Inc. is committed to the principles of equality in employment and invites women, aboriginals, members of visible minorities, ethnic minorities and persons with disabilities to apply.</P> <P> </P> <P>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation or preference, religion, marital status, citizenship, veteran status, or physical or mental disability.</P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Comment:</STRONG></P> <P></P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>We thank all applicants. Only selected candidates will be contacted.</STRONG></P></DIV>

Title: Manager- US Tax
Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Multiple Locations, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Edmonton; Mississauga; Montreal; Toronto; Vancouver; Vaughan; Winnipeg<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> As a key member of the management team, you will take a lead role in regards to US Tax compliance and planning initiatives and requirements. Your organizational skills will enable you to direct the work of junior staff, including reviewing their work for accuracy and completeness. You will research and prepare tax-planning strategies for our clients and take the lead on the review and preparation of tax returns. The ideal candidate enjoys a challenging work environment and sets the standard for junior staff, by providing ongoing support and opportunities for professional development. <br/><br/> Role and Responsibilities <ul> <li>Assume responsibility for and manage the recurring tax needs of an assigned client base, including both tax compliance and ongoing tax advisory mandates.</li><li>Take a lead role with respect to training and supporting other members of the US Corporate Tax group in regards to tax compliance matters.</li><li>Work closely with a Partner as a senior team member on tax planning work for clients.</li><li>Plan and organize teams for the preparation of tax returns, and conduct/ present tax research.</li><li>Review the work of junior staff for accuracy and completeness.</li><li>Lead the tax engagement team in servicing the tax planning and compliance needs of clients. Communicate with clients clearly and build durable relationships with them.</li><li>Providing ongoing support and mentoring for the professional development of staff.</li><li>Work with other office members in attracting new work to the firm.</li> </ul> <strong>Your role as a Manager at Deloitte:</strong> <ul> <li>Embrace and live the firm’s purpose – to make an impact that matters – by pushing yourself and your team to identify solutions to challenges that are most important for our clients, people, and society</li><li>Develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities</li><li>Deliver exceptional client service by maximizing results and driving high performance from people, while also fostering collaboration across businesses and borders</li><li>Influence clients, teams and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships</li><li>Understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, and align people to them to set appropriate priorities and direction</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <ul> <li>Completed undergraduate degree with outstanding academic credentials;</li><li>A completed U.S. masters degree in Taxation or CPA or LLB (LLM preferred);</li><li>Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience;</li><li>Strong commitment to professional client service excellence;</li><li>Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams;</li><li>Superior verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels of an organization;</li><li>Ability to develop and present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions;</li><li>Proven ability to deliver the full cycle of project management accountabilities;</li><li>Experienced with project problem diagnosis, solution development, client communications, facilitation of decision making, documentation, managing client expectations, project profitability and team leadership;</li><li>Ability to anticipate the long term impact of all decisions and take a broad approach to problem solving;</li><li>Execute a client service plan on complex engagements and work closely with the Partners in exceeding our client's expectations while identifying and mitigating business risks associated with projects;</li><li>Occasional Canadian and U.S. travel required;</li><li>Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignments.</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 30504</div>

Title: Senior Manager, Economic Development
Job_Description: <strong>BDO. Because relationships matter.</strong> <br/><br/> There are many world-class accounting firms. Far fewer that offer a culture so rich in professional opportunity, personal fulfillment, and long-term growth. At BDO, we understand that exceptional service to our clients begins – and ends – with exceptional regard for our people. Because at its core, our business is not about numbers or spreadsheets, dollars or pence, but about people working with, for, and in service of others. In short, because relationships matter. <br/><br/> <strong><strong>Position Summary</strong></strong> <br/><br/> Our Economic Development Services team is looking for a <strong>Senior Manager</strong> to lead its team of consulting professionals. BDO’s Economic Development Services team helps clients achieve two objectives: growing their economies and measuring the economic impact of their decisions. Our consulting projects come from all levels of government – federal, provincial, municipal, and Indigenous – as well as non-profits, trade associations and private businesses. Our clients want to accelerate or revitalize growth in a changing economy. Many want to harness new sectors, technologies, and innovations as drivers of their economic development. Others wish to test the feasibility of business ideas and new ventures, attract investment to their local community, or expand and promote particular economic sectors. <br/><br/> No matter our clients’ unique needs, BDO offers custom solutions to help develop economies and create jobs. Clients are empowered to navigate a complex and ever-changing economy through BDO’s economic development service line. With these services, our economic development consultants aim to provide our clients with the tools necessary to thrive in an increasingly competitive environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities</strong>: <br/><br/> In this role you will lead and contribute to economic development related consulting engagements. More specifically, you will: <ul> <li><div>Conduct and oversee economic research and analysis as necessary in the preparation of consulting project deliverables</div></li><li>Lead individual client initiatives for the delivery of economic development services initiatives</li><li>Manage the development of new opportunities within existing clients and successfully expand the client base through pursuit of new opportunities,</li> <li>Collaborate with BDO managers to develop and grow the economic development service line across Canada</li> <li>Deliver the full cycle of client engagement accountabilities in a cross functional environment</li><li>Have the ability to think critically and problem solve client issues, facilitate the decision making process and document those decisions</li><li>Have a strong commitment to superior professional and client service excellence</li><li>Work with project teams to identify business requirements and desired business outcomes to achieve successful projects</li><li>Collaborate with various internal and external subject matter experts and stakeholder representatives as necessary to prepare consulting project deliverables</li><li>Have strong communication skills and experience preparing for and facilitating workshops to gather input from clients and stakeholders</li><li>Willingness to travel within Canada Title: Manager, Strategic Partnerships
Job_Description: At Arcane, our team is built with passionate innovators and creators with unique skill sets. Each day, we work together to create next generation solutions for our clients that speak to our values and what we believe in. In the office, we are constantly reminded to work smart, stay true to our values and play catch with one of our pups, at least once per day. Together, we are a driving force that likes to put our best foot forward, celebrate our achievements and put family first. <br/><br/> A Manager, Strategic Partnerships at Arcane will support new business development efforts in the Alberta market, with a primary focus on Calgary and the surrounding area. This role will work out of our Calgary, Alberta office focusing on generating new business opportunities, servicing existing or incoming opportunities, and finding efficiencies in their role. <br/><br/> <strong>Duties & Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Opportunity Coordination</em>  <ul> <li>Helps to manage profitability of portfolio, budgets, project scope, and initial client satisfaction</li>  <li>Understands our clients’ key contacts, organization structures, processes, and business plans</li>  <li>Anticipates our team’s needs, identifies solutions, acts in our best interest to increase the value of service</li>  <li>Tracks and manages communication in CRM, uses tracking systems to interact with other team members</li>  <li>Collaborates with the Vice-President to support new business needs, including establishing scope of work and initial estimates for new business jobs</li>  <li>Collaborates with all teams to coordinate the successful and profitable start to new business initiatives</li>  <li>Prepares project budgets as required</li>  <li>Contributes to team morale and to the overall agency culture</li> </ul> <em>Business Development</em>  <ul> <li>Assists in producing new business resources, such as prospect-specific pitches, RFP responses, print support, or coordination</li>  <li>Helps to nurture client relationships, identifies opportunities to add value to client's business</li>  <li>Stays current on industry trends, with strong knowledge of digital technology and marketing tactics</li>  <li>Partners on new accounts and projects, acts as the primary contact for internal account management team in understanding the client needs and project scope</li>  <li>Manages new client process while ensuring their needs are met, allowing for a seamless transition to the internal process</li>  <li>Coordinates ongoing support responsibilities aligned with Strategic Partnership to increase the department’s overall efficiency and profitability</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications & Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>Degree or Diploma in Business Marketing, Business Administration, Communications or equivalent experience</li>  <li>Previous sales and marketing experience</li>  <li>Proven understanding and experience with online marketing, branding, and integrated marketing principles</li>  <li>Previous agency experience is an asset</li>  <li>A passion for technology and marketing and their combined use in driving revenue, client satisfaction, and efficiency</li>  <li>Exceptional communication skills (both written and verbal)</li>  <li>A keen interest in discovering marketing/business needs and opportunities</li>  <li>Ability to build relationships with internal teams, clients, and prospects</li>  <li>A demonstrated passion for search, social, paid, email, Web and mobile solutions and an understanding of how to leverage each to achieve marketing goals</li>  <li>A creative thinker with strategic thinking capabilities to support the development of innovative campaigns</li>  <li>Ability to flex your working schedule to accommodate client and business needs</li>  <li>Eager to bring forward new ideas, have fun, and be creative!</li> </ul> If you are interested in this role, please submit your application by Friday, April 13th, 2018. We thank all candidates who apply, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> Arcane is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Applicants requiring accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process are encouraged to advise accordingly.

Title: Facility Manager, Calgary (Educational Institution) - Request of proposal
Job_Description: <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>ENGIE Services</STRONG> is a provider of energy efficiency, facility management services and outsourcing solutions for companies and communities. Our experts design, develop and manage tailored, smart and sustainable solutions for our customers’ benefit from airports to office parks and industrial sites. <BR><BR><STRONG>ENGIE Services</STRONG> is part of ENGIE in North America, which manages a range of energy businesses in the U.S. and Canada, including electricity generation and cogeneration, natural gas and liquefied natural gas (LNG) distribution and sales, retail energy sales and energy optimization services. ENGIE (formerly GDF SUEZ) employs 154,950 people worldwide.<BR><BR><STRONG>Job Office:</STRONG> Educational Institution in Calgary<BR><STRONG>Position Status:</STRONG> Permanent, Full Time<BR><STRONG>Schedule:</STRONG> Days</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>**RFP process ongoing**</STRONG></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Summary:</STRONG></DIV> <DIV>The Facility Manager is responsible to manage the overall Building and Equipment operation of the educational facilities in areas of safety, comfort, productivity and efficiency to the standards of the contract and to the satisfaction of our customers 24/7/365 and shall include but not be limited to the following duties and responsibilities.</DIV> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Responsibilities:</STRONG><BR></DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Management :</STRONG></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Serve as the on-site manager representing Engie Services; supervise and train employees to ensure compliance with all provisions of the project.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Responsible for day-to-day operations and maintenance, performance, supervision, and control of sites and that these services are performed in an effective and efficient manner.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Monitor the maintenance of the educational facilities.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Produce results as per financial targets through effective management of employees and resources.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Implement and monitor a Quality Assurance Program for the Site.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Implement and manage FMO programs/systems for the Site.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Be fully familiar with the requirements of the project contract, the schedules and ensure the proper skilled staffing is provided and oversee management of various subcontractors.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Meet with the client representative and Engie’s corporate management on matters relating to the services performed with a view toward obtaining effective coordination of all operations. Issue reports and summaries to the client as required.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Develop, implement and communicate improved processes, policies and procedures on a continuous basis, always seeking greater efficiencies and higher customer satisfaction.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Develop, guide, direct, motivate and manage the performance of all direct reports in line with our HR Program to assist in the realization of their potential and to enhance their knowledge-based skills.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Establish and maintain effective business relationships with customers, suppliers and subcontractors, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Foster and maintain excellent business relations at all levels of the client base to encourage and promote the development of new and unique business opportunities.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate in the annual planning process providing input to form an acceptable business plan that blends with contractual and Engie Objectives.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Maintain a direct involvement in all projects, sales and estimating.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate in the achievement of the KPIs as they relate to your job and sites.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate in the prevention of accidents and promote a safe working environment.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ensure that Engie is in compliance both procedurally and in spirit, with provincial, client and company occupational health and safety policies and procedures.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Provides leadership and guidance for Site Personnel for all aspects of the site facility operations and maintenance to ensure high overall standards and performance.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Development of Personnel and labour negotiations in association with Engie Senior Management.</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV></DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Operational</STRONG></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Establish performance standards for each phase of work. Shall be responsible for the adherence to standard practices and quality specifications for all work performed.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Establish a program for the acquisition, storage and accountability of all operating materials, tools, and equipment.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Develop planned preventative maintenance programs for the site.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Co-ordinate with the Purchasing Manager on requirements for maintenance materials and equipment.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Carry out random quality control checks. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ensure that all equipment and materials are of the required standard and that procedures are in place to prevent fraud and safety issues.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Contract and staff Management.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Budgeting and implementing corrective actions to ensure costs are consistent with ENGIE financial plans.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Maximize communication and synergies within the team.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate in upgrading courses to keep abreast of changing policy, technology and growth.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Roll out and monitoring of Quality Assurance program and safety programs.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Review of sub-contractor performance.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Objectives and strategies are in place to achieve zero lost time injuries in the workplace.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>To provide the highest level of service and support for the Customer.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Perform other duties as assigned. </DIV></LI></UL> <STRONG>Requirements:</STRONG>  <DIV> <UL> <LI>Minimum 10 years of experience in Facilities Maintenance; </LI> <LI>Bachelor Degree: building management or construction or business studies or building services engineering or any relevant degree combined with experience will be evaluated;</LI> <LI>Facility Management Administrator (FMA) or Certified Facility Manager (CFM) (an asset);</LI> <LI>Computer literacy (MS Office suite) and knowledge of computerized maintenance programs (CMMS) a must;</LI> <LI>Trouble shooting and problem-solving experience in a medium to large organization;</LI> <LI>Valid Driver’s License;</LI> <LI>Maintain a high level of technical expertise.</LI></UL> <DIV><STRONG>Skills:</STRONG>  <DIV> <UL> <LI>Excellent verbal and written communication;</LI> <LI>Proven track record in managing a maintenance department;</LI> <LI>Safety & Quality oriented;</LI> <LI>High level of customer orientation / understanding;</LI> <LI>Leadership;</LI> <LI>Interpersonal, relationship-building and networking skills;</LI> <LI>Commercial and negotiation skills;</LI> <LI>Problem solving. </LI></UL></DIV></DIV> <P><STRONG>Notes:</STRONG> </P> <P>The Facility Manager is responsible for different buildings in Calgary and will travel between them occasionally. </P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Equal Employment Opportunity:</STRONG></P> <P>ENGIE Services Inc. is committed to the principles of equality in employment and invites women, aboriginals, members of visible minorities, ethnic minorities and persons with disabilities to apply.</P> <P> </P> <P>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation or preference, religion, marital status, citizenship, veteran status, or physical or mental disability.</P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Comment:</STRONG></P> <P></P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>We thank all applicants. Only selected candidates will be contacted.</STRONG></P></DIV>

Title: Assistant Store Manager-Retail
Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div><strong>WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR?</strong> <br/><br/> The Assistant Manager supports the daily operations of the store while acting in accordance to Roots principles and standards. The Assistant Manager is required to provide sales and customer service leadership to employees and project the Roots culture and brand through both excellent customer service and strong visual presentation techniques. Reporting directly to the Store Manager, the Assistant Manager oversees the daily operations of the store and drives the business and develops their people through a balanced leadership style. They are able to lead and create an overall positive customer and employee experience. <br/><br/> To be successful, you’ll need to possess:  <ul>  	 <li>2 + years related experience in a retail apparel environment, luxury retail experience is a plus; </li>  <li>Be a leader that drives results, develops talent, and focuses on the customer;</li>  <li>Demonstrated sales achievements in a retail store;</li>  <li>Strong organization, and problem solving skills;</li>  <li>Passion for upholding an exceptional customer experience;</li>  <li>Experience with visual planning and merchandising;</li>  <li>Collaborate with others, yet be self-motivated;</li>  <li>Outstanding written, verbal, and presentation skills;</li>  <li>Available for varied weekly shifts, including weekends, closing and holidays.</li>  </ul> <strong> </strong> <br/><br/> <strong>THE IMPACT YOU'LL HAVE</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>This is an opportunity to shape our company’s future by:</strong>  <ul>  <li>  Demonstrate a customer obsessed selling culture and build brand loyalty through excellent product knowledge;</li>  <br/> <li>  Assisting the Store Manager in the achievement of the store sales budgets through execution of company standards, policies and procedures while exceeding customers' expectations through superior service at every opportunity;</li>  <br/> <li>  Supporting the Store Manager in providing product knowledge and selling skills training to new and existing staff;</li>  <br/> <li>  Ensure store and team members are presented to the highest possible standards in line with brand expectation, and provide feedback regularly to Store Manager on performance opportunities;</li>  <br/> <li>  Coaches and motivates associates on customer service fundamentals and provides positive feedback;</li>  <br/> <li>  Assisting the Store Manager in the execution of all recruitment activities, and new hire onboarding;</li>  <br/> <li>  Identify and resolve problems in a timely manner. Use feedback to modify and develop alternative solutions and be prepared to make decisions;</li>  <br/> <li>  Oversees and delegates tasks to team to best maximize efficiency of store operations;</li>  <br/> <li>  Collaborate with Store Manager in areas of risk management, physical security (health & safety), store cash controls (bank deposits, safe funds, petty cash), and inventory management (stock take, stock counts)</li>  <br/> <li>  Perform and supervise store opening and closing procedures including counting register funds, completing bank deposits, opening and closing registers and securing facility</li>  <br/> <li>  Ensure visual merchandising directives are implemented efficiently as per direction and visual standards are maintained at all times</li>  <br/> <li>  Partner with Store Manager on all daily store operations to support a sales environment and achieve operational & LP guidelines to protect Roots merchandise and assets;</li>  <br/> <li>  Health and Safety in the workplace applies to everyone at Roots</li> </ul> <strong> </strong> <br/><br/> <strong> </strong> <br/><br/> <strong>WHY JOIN ROOTS?</strong> <br/> Roots is not only a brand, it’s a culture and lifestyle. We look for dynamic individuals who are not only interested in retail and fashion, but who enjoy challenges and share our vision for a safer, cleaner, healthier planet. <br/><br/> In addition to our customers, an intrinsic part of our success has always been the people who work here. Roots is a company in which you can grow and benefit from the great opportunities often available. All members of our team are encouraged to ‘spread their roots’.  <br/><br/> <strong> </strong> <br/><br/> <strong>SOUND LIKE YOU? APPLY NOW!</strong> <br/><br/> We’d like to thank everyone who applies, but we can only contact applicants who are most qualified.  <br/><br/> Roots Corporation offers a culture that fosters inclusion and respect. We are committed to providing accessible employment practices, in compliance with the AODA. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process, applicants are asked to make their needs/requirements known.</div></div><br/>   <div> <div> <div>Salary</div><br/>  	<div>335 - Market Mall, Calgary, Alberta, Canada</div></div>  </div><br/>  <div> Apply Now <br/>  See all jobs</div>  </div> </div> </div>  <br/>

Title: Key Account Manager - Correction Services
Job_Description: Hexagon Positioning Intelligence is at the forefront of developing positioning solutions for autonomous applications. This new position of Key Account Manager - Correction Services is responsible for facilitating the growth and development of new key strategic accounts for correction data products targeted at applications in the automotive, agriculture or telematics markets. The successful applicant for this opportunity can be located in our Calgary, AB office or remote in North America or Europe. <br/><br/> Our GNSS and Inertial positioning products are already well known in this space and combining these superior positoning technologies with correction data products will be a focus of growth for the company. <ul> <li>Create business development plan and selling strategies for correction data products to OEM accounts in telecommunications and Automotive</li> <li>Accountability and ownership of annual key account management plan for correction data accounts focused on understanding B2B needs, providing solutions, revenue growth and exceeding customer satisfaction</li><li>Lead strategic account planning process, financial targets, and critical milestones for a 1, 3 and 5 year period</li><li>Facilitate quarterly business reviews with key accounts to proactively assess, clarify, and validate needs on an ongoing basis</li><li>Manage solution development and implementation timelines that ensure customers’ needs and expectations are understood and met by the company</li><li>Collaborate with cross functional teams of sales, marketing, support, operations and engineering personnel</li><li>Provide quarterly and annual business reviews to senior management on business plan objectives, execution strategies, milestones and results</li> </ul> <strong>Must-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Business or Engineering</li><li>10+ years B2B relationship management</li><li>Practical understanding of telematics data products and services</li><li>Experience developing and growing new accounts</li><li>Demonstrated ability to collaborate with cross functional teams on multiple projects</li><li>Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Proficiency in Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word and Salesforce</li><li>Ability to travel at least 50% North America and International travel</li> </ul> <strong>Key Success Factors:</strong> <ul> <li>Goal oriented and results driven with demonstrated ability to achieve targets</li><li>Ability to create strong working relationships with the customer and internal stakeholders</li><li>Self-motivated with the ability to independently drive results</li><li>Can easily adapt to a changing environment with multiple priorities</li><li>Strong Business Acumen</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Technical background in telecommunications or GNSS</li><li>German language skills</li> </ul> Our customers have ideas. Lots of them. Turning those ideas into a competitive advantage is what we do. As part of the Hexagon group of companies, NovAtel's integrated global positioning solutions deliver success time and time again on land, sea and in the air. We help many of the world's leading companies stay in the lead by consistently delivering OEM global satellite positioning products that are recognized for their technical innovation, unsurpassed quality and industry-leading customer support.

Title: Division Manager
Job_Description: <div><div> <p><b>Division Manager </b></p>  <p><b>Calgary, AB </b></p>  <p><b>About Us </b></p>  <p>Allnorth’s award winning multidisciplinary engineering and technical services team is fortunate to be part of the significant growth of the company over the past few years. Our continuous improvement philosophy, skilled professionals and technical experts have allowed us to take on challenging and exciting projects while servicing clients in the Mining, Oil & Gas, Infrastructure and Pulp & Paper sectors. </p>  <p><b>Our Opportunity </b></p>  <p>The Division Manager is accountable for our People, Profitability and Client objectives in our Calgary Division. The Division Manager has considerable autonomy to grow the Division but it is also expected that collaboration will take place with our Business Development Team, Leadership team and other Division Managers in the best interest of the organization. As a proven leader with strong business acumen, the Division Manager is accountable for acting as an ambassador for Allnorth in the communities and sectors in which we work. </p>  <p><b>Responsibilities </b></p>  <ul> <li> Continue building client and community relationships in and around the Division; </li> <li> Lead by example. Coaching the team in a fashion that emphasizes our safe work culture; </li> <li> Oversee all aspects of the Division’s fiscal metrics and working with the staff to ensure best in class project delivery/client satisfaction; </li> <li> Provide leadership and general direction to the project team as well as the office; </li> <li> Establish resourcing priorities and facilitate communication between various leadership groups; </li> <li> Continue our tradition of team building by attracting the best people in the industry that align with our Corporate Culture. </li> </ul>  <p><b>Requirements </b></p>  <ul> <li> Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Technical diploma in a discipline related to Allnorth’s service offerings (e.g. Civil or Mechanical Engineering) </li> <li> Registered, or eligible to register, as a Professional Engineer (PEng.) in Alberta is preferred. Eligible for registration in other provinces would be an asset. </li> <li> Minimum 10 years of project management experience, preferably in a consulting engineering environment; </li> <li> Solid technical/commercial analysis of project management and effective customer service focus; </li> <li> Completion of a certification in project management (e.g. PMP) is an asset; </li> <li> Proven leadership skills within a multidisciplinary engineering consulting environment; </li> <li> Business Acumen including financial accountability, setting and ensuring margin targets, management of WIP necessary<b>; </b></li> <li> Excellent interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills; </li> <li> Must have valid Canadian driver’s license as regulated by the province applicant resides in. </li> </ul>  <p><b>What We Offer </b></p>  <p>Allnorth is dedicated to its Triple Bottom Line of People, Clients & Partners and Profitability. Empowered and motivated employees are the source of our success and the basis for our growth. We’re proud of our team and committed to providing opportunities for employees to develop both personally and professionally in addition to offering a competitive salary and benefits package. You won’t get lost in the numbers here, but rather enjoy positive guidance as you learn, grow and create an impact. Now is an exciting time to join the Allnorth team. <b>Apply </b>today at http://www.allnorth.com/join-us! </p>  <p>We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note that only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please. </p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>

Title: Analytics, Data Scientist with strong Marketing - Sr. Manager
Job_Description: <strong>Marketing Analytics Data Scientist</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Job level -</strong> Group/Sr. Manager <br/><br/> <strong>Job Location</strong> - Open to any US Location / remote <br/><br/> <strong>*This Role requires specific Marketing Analytics</strong> <strong>experience.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About the role:</strong> <br/><br/> The Group Manager, Marketing Analytics and Insights role oversees and manages the global marketing data and analytics function and is responsible for setting and deploying the marketing data and analytics strategy, managing marketing measurement, reporting and analytics processes, maintaining and managing existing data sources, and generating insights to ensure optimal efficiency, effectiveness and ROI of all marketing campaigns and activities. The role is also engaged in marketing planning, marketing analytics best practice creation, staying abreast of thought leadership in the field and knowledge sharing among the global marketing community. <br/><br/> Day-to-day, you will: <br/><br/> Marketing Data and Analytics Strategy <ul>  <li>Oversee and manage the global marketing data and analytics function with the aim of running a best-in-class function that facilitates data and insights based decision making</li> <li>Define and deploy the global marketing data and analytics strategy to help move the organization from siloed to integrated data collection and reporting with deeper analysis and actionable insights generating capabilities.</li>  <li>Stay abreast of and ensure adherence to industry thought leadership and best practices in marketing analytics and facilitate knowledge sharing and training among the global marketing community</li> <li>Work with Digital Marketing Platforms lead to ensure we have the right marketing technology stack</li> <li>Work with Avanade legal team to ensure we are compliant with internal and external policies, GDPR in particular</li>  </ul> Measurement, Reporting and Insights Generation <ul>   <li>Manage the end-to-end marketing measurement and reporting framework enabling results reporting, marketing business reviews and analytics and insights generation</li>   <li>Manage the monthly and quarterly marketing reporting process and leadership reviews and accountable for the compilation, preparation and translation of complicated data into simple high level information for leadership to communicate marketing results</li>   <li>Work closely with Field, Area and Corporate marketing teams to collect and analyze data and identify key insights to enable data driven decision making</li>   <li>Establish a new and improved reporting platform on Power BI (working with ITS) and transfer all existing Marketing scorecards to new platform Analyze existing data from Marketing data sources and provide insights to the business stakeholders to make informed business decisions</li>   <li>Maintain and manage data sources, develop data strategy and governance and oversee the Marketing Data and Analytics Specialist</li>   <li>Educate and train our "customers" in data interpretation and analysis making them increasingly self-serviced</li>  </ul> Marketing Planning: <ul>  <li>Work closely with Digital & Marketing Effectiveness lead to manage and execute the global marketing annual planning process and ensure appropriate integration and operational alignment with the overall global Avanade planning cadence</li> <li>Manage annual target setting process (aligning plans with measurement and reporting framework)</li> <li>Train and support Field, Area and Corporate marketing functions in development of annual marketing plans and target setting, ensuring plans align with business and marketing goals</li>  <li>Facilitate intergroup communication within marketing teams and with other groups (e.g., Sales, IT) for alignment of plans ensuring adherence to objectives and standards</li> <li>Support in development of annual Global Marketing Business Plan</li> </ul> About Avanade <br/><br/> At Avanade, our vision is to be the leading digital innovator, realizing results for our clients and their customers through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. <br/><br/> Through thousands of projects, weve transformed businesses for the digital world. Weve helped them create compelling experiences for their customers and employees. Weve reduced costs, increased productivity, enabled collaboration and enhanced agility and ultimately improved performance. <br/><br/> Avanade, which is majority owned by Accenture, was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation and has 29,000 professionals in more than 20 countries. Additional information can be found at <u>www.avanade.com</u><br/><br/>Qualifications<br/><br/>Likely years experience <ul>  <li>6+ years of experience in marketing analytics/marketing data science, reporting and data management in a technology industry B2B environment.</li>  <li>Advanced analytical skills and ability to conduct analysis and create reports, dashboards in Excel, Google Analytics and Power BI (Marketo and MS Dynamics CRM a plus)</li> <li>Outstanding organizational skills and attention to detail with ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage time effectively</li> <li>Excellent communication skills both written and verbal</li> <li>Flexibility and ability to thrive in a global, virtual and fast-paced environment and must be able to work with minimal supervision and direction and willing to work remotely</li> <li>Strong ability to interact with all levels of management in a professional manner</li>  <li>Excellent and advanced Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills as well as familiarity with Microsoft collaboration tools such as Microsoft Teams, Visual Studio etc.</li> </ul> Your education likely <br/><br/> Bachelors degree minimum, preferred MS or MBA <br/><br/> About Avanade <br/><br/> Is An Equal Opportunity Employer. Avanade promotes equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, status as a protected disabled or Vietnam Era Veteran, disability, or any other legally protected status. <br/><br/> <strong>Requisition ID - 50657</strong> <br/><br/> Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital and cloud-enabling services, business solutions and design-led experiences, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation and has 30,000 professionals in 24 countries. Visit us at www.avanade.com.

Title: Infrastructure Services Team Lead
Job_Description: Overview<br/><br/><strong>BE Totally Engaged. BE Business Savvy. BE the Right Partner</strong>. Be all that and more at Colliers Project Leaders. Join our team as an Infrastructure Services Lead in Calgary, AB. <br/><br/> At Colliers Project Leaders, we help our clients succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed. <br/><br/> In this role, you’ll join our team of experts who lead building and infrastructure projects. Through our <strong>Get it Right Solution™,</strong> you’ll ensure we get it ready, get it built and get it performing -- so investors, owners and occupants are certain of success. <br/><br/> This is a senior leadership opportunity for a professional who is ready to take on the challenge of growing an established service offering within a recognized project leadership company. <br/><br/> With over 600 employees and 27 + office locations throughout Canada and the Middle East, Colliers Project Leaders offers a multi-cultural, multi-generational work environment where we cultivate excellence, develop leaders and deliver on our clients’ vision. Colliers Project Leaders is part of Colliers International Group Inc. (NASDAQ: CIGI; TSX: CIGI), an industry leading global real estate with more than 16,000 skilled professionals operating in 66 countries. To learn more about Colliers Project Leaders, visit www.colliersprojectleaders.com. <br/><br/> We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> We’re looking for an experienced professional who is looking for the right opportunity to leverage their strong reputation in the municipal infrastructure into a successful leadership role. You bring a wealth of experience leading projects varying in scope and complexity in municipal civil works, water and waste water facilities, heavy civil works, bridges, transportation infrastructure, major land development, and various other forms of horizontal infrastructure. <br/><br/> You’re already known as a trusted advisor to your clients and have built strong, lasting relationships with senior leaders in large municipalities in Alberta that can be leveraged to develop further opportunities to support capital project delivery. You bring in-depth knowledge and have led and managed complex infrastructure projects from start to finish – on time and on budget. <br/><br/> Are you looking to build upon your reputation as a project leader to make a difference for new clients and businesses? Look no further.<br/><br/>Responsibilities<br/><br/><strong>What success looks like:</strong>  <ul>   <li>You’ve led a number of municipal and civil infrastructure projects, varying in size and scope ideally in either bridges, transportation, land development or other horizontal infrastructure sectors</li> <li>Your clients trust you and rely on your knowledge, skills and expertise to achieve their business goals and objectives.</li>   <li>Your clients are impressed with your ability to represent their best interests regarding contractual and technical issues</li> <li>You are a subject matter expert in the infrastructure sector, developing and growing business and the team within the region</li> <li>Your project teams rely on your ability to manage change, communicate and coordinate between multiple stakeholders, resolve issues, and deliver projects on time and on budget</li> <li>You maintain contact with existing and prospective clients and respond to business development and sales opportunities with support from the Business Development Team, Principal or Regional Vice President</li> </ul>  Qualifications<br/><br/><strong>What you bring:</strong>  <ul>   <li>A university degree or diploma in civil engineering or an equivalent engineering discipline</li> <li>At least 15 to 20 years of experience in project coordination and management, representing owners to deliver projects of varying size and scope on horizontal infrastructure and large civil projects</li> <li>A solid foundation of experience, track record and reputation as a professional consultant to owners and developers of horizontal infrastructure and large civil projects</li> <li>Strong relationships with large municipalities and demonstrated prior experience delivering large profile projects for municipal, regional, provincial or federal authorities</li> <li>Understanding of development charges and knowledge of the municipal environment including the functioning of various departments in municipalities and cities</li> <li>Professional industry credentials such as PMP, P.Eng., CET, or other similar industry recognized designation is considered a strong asset</li> <li>Experience with the preparation of Requests for Proposals, Tenders and Tender Closing/Award procedures</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus skills and experience:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Strong leadership and organizational skills with a proven ability to effectively influence others and resolve client, project and technical issues</li> <li>Excellent communication and presentation skills</li> <li>Proficient in MS Project, MS Word and MS Excel</li> </ul>

Title: Account Manager
Job_Description: Account Manager- Calgary, AB <br/>  <strong> <br/>  <div> Calgary, AB</div> </strong><br/>   <div>Reference No:  <br/>  5556</div>  <br/>  What's the role?<br/>   <div>As an account manager, you’ll be visiting our customers, wherever they’re busy working, to find out how we can help them. You could find yourself on construction sites and nuclear plants or in offices and warehouses. <br/> Ours is a model of professional consultative selling, and it’s a really hands-on job. It means rolling up your sleeves to demonstrate some of the most pioneering products in the industry, while selling our state-of-the-art software along with all the services and after-care that come with the Hilti name. Far from traditional cold calling, it’s about building relationships with warm and responsive customers, and helping them find the most innovative and cost-efficient solutions for their needs.</div>  <br/>Who is Hilti?<br/>   <div>If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With some 23,000 people in more than 120 countries, we’re a great place for you to show us your worth as you learn, grow and carve-out your career.</div>  <br/>What does the role involve?<br/>   <div>If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With some 27,000 people in more than 120 countries, which we’re looking to expand, we’re a great place for you to show us your worth, step up to new challenges and grow your career.</div><br/>   <div> <div> Day to day, you’ll report to your regional sales manager, who will also be there to help you manage your career.</div> </div>  <br/>What do we offer?<br/>   <div>We’ll give you everything you need to excel in your role and one-to-one coaching. You’ll enjoy a rare combination of autonomy and camaraderie, as you’ll manage your own book of business while being part of a friendly team. <br/><br/> We’ll give you lots of responsibility, including your own portfolio of customers and these might be trades experts, project managers, or company leaders. From there, we’ll trust you to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results. Go the extra mile and we’ll reward you with unrivaled training, development, and career opportunities as soon as you’re ready for the next challenge. <br/><br/> Day to day you’ll report to , who will also be there to help you manage your career.</div>  <br/>Why should you apply?<br/>   <div>We have an excellent mix of people and some of our best account managers joined us with little or no construction experience. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.</div>  <br/>What you need is:<br/>   <div>  <ul> <li>What you need is:</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience.</li> <li>At least one year prior experience in customer service and/ or sales working directly with customers, preferred (either over phone or face-to-face)</li> <li>Ability to thrive both independently and in a team environment.</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to develop engaged customer relationships and effectively implement strategic concepts.</li> <li>Excellent time and territory management skills.</li> <li>Must be persuasive, sales driven, customer focused, and a team player.</li> <li>Proficient computer skills including MS Office Suite, and smartphones.</li> <li>Must maintain a professional business appearance in accordance with HNA dress policy at all times.</li> <li>Career advancement may require domestic and/or global mobility.</li> <li> Vehicle/ Driver’s License Requirements:</li> <li>Company vehicle provided for carrying tools/fasteners for product demonstration purposes.</li> <li>Must have valid driver’s license and comply with HNA Fleet Safety Policy requirements.</li> <li>Account Manager has responsibility for prudent care and protection of company assets.</li> <li> As part of your interview process, we’ll take you on a day-in-the-life ‘field ride’ to give you a feel for the job and the caliber of our people. We’ll also pay for your travel to the interview.</li> <li> .</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div>Tempted to apply or find out more? Go to hilti.ca/careers</div><br/>  <div> Account Manager- Calgary, AB</div>  <br/>

Title: Manager/Senior Manager - Transfer Pricing
Job_Description: Canada’s Transfer Pricing legislation was introduced almost 20 years ago and has always been a significant area of focus for the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA). Topics such as business restructuring and cross border interest rates and guarantee fees have evolved globally with a measure of influence from developments in Canada. The CRA was a very active participant and supporter of the Base Erosion and Profit Shifting (BEPS) initiatives of the OECD countries and we continue to see an evolving landscape of Transfer Pricing developments in Canada. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Why Calgary?</STRONG> <br/><br/> Popularly known as Canada’s sunshine capital, Calgary is also becoming known as the “Heart of the New West”. Calgary was ranked as the “Best place to work in Canada” by the Globe and Mail. Calgary is Canada’s youngest city, is home of the Canadian energy industry, and has the second highest concentration of head offices in Canada. The city offers 500+ parks and reserves provide rewarding wildlife viewing opportunities and invigorating hiking and biking trails. <STRONG>Calgary is close to nature, including</STRONG> the world renowned Banff National Park and the Rocky Mountains. The city also has plenty of hiking and biking trails, forests, wildlife parks, and lakes to enjoy. <STRONG>Calgary is a great place to live and an even better place to grow your career!</STRONG> <ul> <LI>Our Calgary team is the leading and growing Transfer Pricing practice in the city.</LI> <LI>Significant outbound work for locally-based multinationals</LI> <LI>Development – the size and wide variety of complexity of engagements we deal with in Calgary make it the perfect place for a manager to develop their potential. You will be provided with a unique opportunity to see issues from a different perspective, and gain valuable exposure to various OECD based approaches and methodologies.</LI> </ul>  As a member of the management team in the Transfer Pricing practice, you will take a lead role in addressing the transfer pricing requirements for our clients, including transfer pricing planning initiatives, compliance, and controversy support. You will work closely with KPMG Partners to provide clients with advice that integrates transfer pricing with other areas of tax while considering clients’ operational requirements. Your organizational skills will enable you to allocate work to junior staff where appropriate and direct the work as needed. The ideal candidate enjoys solving problems, interacting with KPMG partners and clients and sets the standard for junior staff by providing ongoing mentoring, support and opportunities for professional development. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Role and Responsibilities</STRONG> <br/><br/> The successful candidate will be responsible for:  <ul> <LI><STRONG>Planning:</STRONG> development and implementation of commercially and fiscally viable transfer pricing policies and execution of effective and sustainable tax-planning strategies.</LI> <LI><STRONG>Dispute Resolution:</STRONG> preparation of appropriate responses to fiscal authority challenges, determination of the strategy, performance of robust economic analyses to support existing policies and negotiation with fiscal authorities. In addition, assistance in the preparation of Competent Authority submissions.</LI> <LI><STRONG>Compliance and Documentation:</STRONG> compliance with local fiscal requirements, design of transfer pricing policies and procedures, technical analysis and preparation of high quality documentation that meets the appropriate standards.</LI> <LI><STRONG>Alternative Dispute Resolution:</STRONG> Assessment of the risks of fiscal authority challenges and identification of appropriate strategies in order to help manage and control our clients’ tax risks. Assistance in the preparation of Advance Pricing Arrangements (APAs) as well as negotiation with relevant fiscal authorities.</LI> <LI><STRONG>Leadership:</STRONG> leading small and medium-sized client engagements and working closely with other members of our team as a senior team member. Fostering a deeply rooted sense of ownership, team and camaraderie within the practice. Providing ongoing support and mentoring for the professional development of staff.</LI> <LI><STRONG>Growth:</STRONG> participation in the practices’ growth through the development of relationships in existing as well as new networks.</LI> <LI><STRONG>Knowledge</STRONG>: maintaining a high level of technical knowledge, writing articles and papers and participating in and leading regular technical sessions.</LI>  </ul>  <STRONG>Skills & Qualifications</STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Professional Accounting Designation</LI> <LI>Degree in economics, statistics, math or business</LI><LI>At least five years of Transfer Pricing experience for Manager level and eight years for Senior Manager</LI><LI>Demonstrated commitment to client service</LI><LI>Excellent team project management skills</LI><LI>Trend of strong performance ratings</LI><LI>Strong command of the English language</LI> </ul> <STRONG>Why Choose KPMG?</STRONG> Making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. Watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at KPMG.

Title: Student Brand Manager - University

know the product ingredients and brand values <br/><br/> Build brand awareness via social media sharing of relevant Red Bull content</div></div>  <br/></li>  <li>  <div> <strong> SALES SUPPORT</strong><br/>  <div>Collaborate with local sales team to maximize sales and visibility on and around campus <br/><br/> Identify new distribution opportunities on and around campus</div></div>  <br/></li>  <li>  <div> <strong> MANAGEMENT AND ADMINISTRATION</strong><br/>  <div>Submit event and project recaps through brief reports with pictures <br/><br/> Maintain key knowledge of school beverage contracts and top sales opportunities on and around campus <br/><br/> Aid in recruitment and training of potential SBMs</div></div>  <br/></li>  </ul>   </div> </div>  </div>  </div><br/>  <div> <div> <div> <div> Your experience includes: <br/>  (proven performance in)</div> <br/> <ul>    <li>Entrepreneurial mindset with comfort in working as part of a team or independently</li>  <li>Creative and innovative thinking</li>  <li>Passionate and energetic personality</li>  <li>Strategic thinking with a proven ability to deliver</li>  <li>Strong written and verbal communication</li>  <li>Project Management skills</li>  <li>Thorough knowledge of their university campus and infused in Student life on campus</li>  <li>Friendly, open-minded and approachable</li>  <li>Professional and autonomous</li>  <li>Available to flexibly work part-time, including evenings and weekends</li>  <li>University student AND/OR active involvement in on-campus groups, community-oriented clubs and associations</li>  <li>Work under diverse weather conditions</li>  <li>Lift/carry a minimum of 1 tray of Red Bull (9lbs)</li>  </ul>   </div><br/>   <div> <div>   <ul>    <li>Full time University or College student at specified school</li>  <li>Fluent in English; Title: Marketing Manager
Job_Description: We are seeking a creative, results-oriented <strong>marketing manager</strong> to help us build brand awareness and generate quality leads for our sales team and reseller channel. The ideal candidate has a passion for the dynamically evolving craft of marketing and relishes the challenge of carving out a meaningful space for a new and disruptive brand. <br/><br/> As part of a multidisciplinary team, you will manage the planning and execution of a wide variety of marketing activities and programs – from paid advertising and sponsorships to website enhancements and sales tools. One day you may be overseeing a photoshoot for a new campaign and the next you’re combing through performance data from one of our media sponsorships. <br/><br/> You are limited only by your own creativity in finding effective ways to engage a broad range of Nureva customers in the remarkable value of our solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>What you will do</strong>  <ul> <li>Lead the development of quarterly marketing plans to drive brand awareness and lead generation for specific product areas</li> <li>Act as project manager in driving key marketing activities, including the development of briefs and project plans</li>   <li>Manage the execution of marketing deliverables in deep collaboration with the in-house creative team and other specialists in events, PR, and media</li> <li>Liaise with various stakeholders outside of marketing including sales, product management, and the executive team</li> <li>Participate in bi-weekly go-to-market planning and alignment sessions and weekly stand-up meetings with the marketing team</li> <li>Manage relationships with third party media properties</li>  </ul> <strong>What you will bring</strong>  <ul> <li>A degree or diploma in marketing</li> <li>7+ years of proven experience in developing and executing successful brand building and lead generation campaigns and programs. Direct experience in B2B technology marketing is a plus.</li>   <li>Experience with inbound approaches to marketing. Familiarity with Hubspot is a plus.</li>   <li>Deep experience in all aspects of marketing project management. Familiarity with agile approaches to marketing and Asana is a plus.</li>   <li>A curious, collaborative mindset and approach to your work</li> <li>A positive attitude and flexibility in responding to changing requirements and priorities</li> <li>The tenacity required to break through the marketing clutter with a new brand</li> </ul> We offer a competitive compensation package, an open and collaborative office in downtown Calgary and a great team environment. <br/><br/> Apply by close of business on <strong>May 30th, 2018</strong>. Please outline how you will make a difference on our team. We will spend time to ensure that you understand the role and our company to ensure that we are a good fit for you.
