Title: Recreation Program Coordinator
Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div>As a Recreation Program Coordinator, you will be responsible for the leadership, execution and direction of work on a program portfolio supporting the overall delivery of products and services of Calgary Recreation. Primary duties include: <ul>  <li> Provide program management through research, strategy development, implementation plans, evaluation and budget administration.</li>  <li> Build and foster relationships, alliances, partnerships or collaborations to enhance the delivery of programs and/or services.</li>  <li> Represent work unit and/or business unit on internal and/or external committees</li>  <li> Recruit, interview, provide on-boarding support, schedule, supervise and evaluate union/non-union staff, volunteers and work placement/practicum students.</li>  <li> Respond to inquiries from the public, internal and external partners, and Council regarding program information and complaints.</li>  <li> Participate in long term, strategic and annual planning for Calgary Recreation and the completion of grant and funding applications.</li> </ul> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Qualifications</strong></strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </div> <div>  <ul> 	<li>A completed 2 year certificate or diploma in Recreation, Physical Education, Kinesiology, Education, Diversity Studies or a closely related field, combined with at least 5 years of related experience including staff supervision; OR</li> 	<li>A degree in any of the above listed (or a closely related) field, with at least 3 years of related portfolio experience, including staff supervision.</li> 	<li>A valid Class 5 Driver’s Licence (or provincial equivalent) and the use of a personal vehicle for business purposes is required.</li> 	<li>Knowledge and experience working in two or more of the following will be considered an asset: physical literacy, active play, children and youth, volunteers, older adults, access and inclusion and community building.</li> 	<li>Strong critical thinking skills and demonstrated leadership and facilitation skills along with well-developed communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a diverse range of audiences.</li> </ul></div> <br/> <div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Pre-employment Requirements</strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </div> <div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.</div> </li>	</ul></div> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div> <div> <div> <div>Union: CUPE Local 38</div> <div>Business Unit: Calgary Recreation</div></div> <div> <div>Position Type: 1 Temporary (up to 12 months)</div> <div>Location: 2808 Spiller Road S.E.</div></div> <div> <div>Compensation: Pay Grade 11 $39.46 - 52.76 per hour (2017 rates)</div> <div>Days of Work: This position works a 5 day</div> <div>work week with one day off in a 3 week cycle.</div></div> <div> <div>Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week</div></div> <div> <div>Audience: Internal/External</div> <div>Apply By: May 16, 2018</div></div> <div> <div>Job ID #: 300796</div></div> </div> </div><div>About our organization</div> </div> </div> </div></div>

Title: Fulfillment General Manager
Job_Description: The Fulfillment Operations General Manager is responsible for the operation and financial performance of a multiple shift fulfillment center by providing direction and leadership to exempt and non-exempt associates at this facility. This position is responsible for developing and leading a team of professionals that will manage the performance of order fulfillment, inventory management, vendor, carrier and customer service operations. Responsible for insuring that orders are selected accurately and packed/shipped without damage for timely delivery from the fulfillment center. This position works closely with the all managers at the Fulfillment Center to maximize the return on the facility operations investment by supporting and contributing to the growth of our customers business. This position reports to a Director of Warehouse Operations. <br/><br/> <strong>Essential Duties & Responsibilities</strong>: <ul> <li>Develop and manage a comprehensive fulfillment strategy for the facility by shaping requirements, assessing deliverables and utilizing resources to help eliminate process problems.</li> <li>Extensive cross collaboration with teams in other fulfillment and distribution facilities working with analytics, transportation, merchandising, and technology.</li><li>Ensure operational procedures for executing activities for incoming and outgoing shipments, handling and disposition of products, and keeping the highest standards of inventory accuracy.</li><li>Drive continuous improvement to safety, quality, cost, and delivery while growing and expanding capabilities within the warehouse.</li><li>Make decisions using data and drive results quickly in a fast paced environment.</li><li>Assure proper staffing and support hiring for all facility operations.</li><li>Work with internal tools such as the site Warehouse Management System (WMS) to optimize order fulfillment and provide operational insights to improve WMS effectiveness.</li><li>Responsible for full P&L for facility and budget preparation.</li><li>Ensures proper percentage of labor is charged to respective departments to ensure proper factoring is achieved to identify accurate productivity.</li><li>Will forge relationships, understand the business needs for each department and implement solutions.</li><li>Prioritize and manage multiple processes and projects in a dynamic and fast paced environment. Ensure facility management team is accountable as well.</li><li>Produce and effectively communicate department goals and individual performance goals that ensure the facility achieves operational success. Including productivity, operational problems, forecasting workload and any other pertinent company information.</li><li>Implements safety and sanitation schedules that ensure the facilities compliance with corporate, OSHA, FDA, AIB or ASI standards.</li><li>Manage and maintain good human resources practices with direct reports, and adherence to established corporate and department policies and procedures.</li><li>Works with Human Resources to resolve employee relation issues, discipline actions, discipline; problem resolution and terminations.</li><li>Conduct regular coaching and feedback on performance, prepare and present formal performance appraisals and make recommendations and approve annual compensation increases.</li><li>Act as a role model for the department in support of corporate mission vision and values.</li>  </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>High School Diploma or GED required</li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Logistics, Operations or related field preferred</li><li>At least 10 years previous management experience leading large scale fulfillment center / warehouse operations.</li><li>Strong analytical skills, experience with automation and other capital projects and excellent business acumen.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience in a cross functions including; Transportation, Process Engineering, Project Management, Inbound / Outbound Operations, Capital Projects or P&L responsibilities.</li><li>Previous experience in a highly mechanized and/or automated e-commerce operation.</li><li>Experience with (Manhattan) Warehouse Management System preferred</li><li>Metrics driven mindset combined with customer service mindset.</li><li>Effective communicator for employees, cross-functional teams and corporate leadership.</li><li>Experience innovating, growing, building or restructuring showing an ability to modify and improve operations.</li><li>Computer applications using Microsoft Office (Word, Excel PowerPoint).</li><li>Ability to work in a fast paced environment.</li><li>Strong time management, organizational, planning and self-motivation skills.</li><li>Bi-lingual (French) is preferred, not required.</li>  </ul> <strong>Other:</strong><ul> <li>Must be on-call for alarm system or problems during off work hours</li><li>Ability and availability to work irregular or extended hours including nights, weekends and holidays as needed by the customer.</li><li>Must be able to stand/walk for up to 10-12 hours.</li><li>Lift and move totes up to 50 pounds.</li><li>Regular bending, lifting, stretching and reaching both below the waist and above the head.</li><li>Walking in the FC and around area with great frequency; facilities are over a quarter mile in length.</li><li>Should be able to work in environments with variable noise levels, lighting conditions and temperature variation and able to access all areas of building without limitations.</li> </ul>

Title: Samsung Regional B2B Sales Account Manager
Job_Description: <div><div>  <div> <p><strong>POSITION OPEN: </strong></p> <p><b>Samsung Regional B2B Sales Account Manager</b></p> </div><div> <p><strong>EMPLOYEE TYPE:</strong></p> <p>Full-time</p> </div><div> <p><strong>OVERVIEW:</strong></p> <p>This position will have a thorough understanding of the territory, customer base and opportunities and will manage relationships and drive sales. This includes developing and planning account and product strategies, introducing new products, making sales presentations.</p>   <p>The Regional Account rep will be responsible for driving and generating distinct revenue within assigned accounts in channels. (B2C and B2B). To meet this objective, the Regional Account manager will be required to develop and maintain Customer relationships. Regular meetings with Customers will serve to establish the Regional manager as a trusted advisor who can effectively communicate Samsung’s vision. A particular emphasis will be placed on knowledge of and the effective communication of the Mobile Communications industry trends in relation to Samsung’s product portfolio. Success in this role will be measured on attainment of revenue and overall creation of sales demand. </p> </div><div> <p><strong>POSITION DESCRIPTION: </strong></p> <p>​</p>   <ul>  <li>Proactively planning SKU listings, targets, budgets, advertising, promotions, etc. to maximize sales and ROI.</li>  <li>Reviewing plans monthly and revising plan on a forward rolling rotation</li>  <li>Providing pre-sale support with respect to solutions that enable wireless access to corporate intranets, messaging systems and custom back office applications.</li>  <li>Have overall responsibility and accountability for all the business sales segments with this Carrier Channel and ability to work with SECA’s Technical Sales Manager and Convergence team when needed to maximize Samsung sales.</li>  <li>Manage the assigned territory in a profitable fashion, through the collection and communication of ideas and Information relating to competition and promotions.</li>  <li>Work closely with the regional account Carrier and Channel partner corporate sales manager to develop sales opportunities.</li>  <li>Identify strategies as they relate to the customer’s software development, application functionality, and systems architecture</li>  <li>Build strong customer awareness of all Samsung products and services.</li>  <li>Attain all objectives assigned to account opportunities to meet or exceed sales targets.</li>  <li>Provide technical support and training to the sales teams as required to identify and qualify new accounts.</li>  <li>Deliver webinars and/or lunch-and-learn sessions to direct sales channels on new technologies and products.</li>  <li>Perform product presentations, both new product introductions and present product offerings to Customers and prospects as prescribed by the Company sales guidelines.</li>  <li>Acquire and report marketing information available in the assigned territory Responsible for creating and delivering compelling sales presentations by leveraging exemplary written and verbal communication skills.</li>  <li>Manage the funnel development for the specific carrier with focus on the carrier B2B commercial and enterprise reps.</li>  <li>Develop partnership between the company and accounts through the coordination of sales, contracts, technical support.</li>  <li>teams, and internal sales on specific accounts to increase Samsung advocates including SLT and regional management terms.</li>  <li>Perform long range planning to increase account penetration, customer satisfaction and sales growth for long term results and achievement of assigned quota.</li>  <li>Roll-up all activity and provide assessment of quarterly projections of revenue and units on a weekly basis.</li>  <li>Accountable for assigned geographic territory, sellers and strategic partners.</li>  <li>Work independently and/or travel 75% of the time.</li>  <li>Controlling territory sales expenses in accordance with Company guidelines.</li>  <li>Work closely with Samsung marketing to maximize sales within each National Account.</li>  <li>Maintain records and files necessary for the proper management of the sales territory.</li>  </ul> </div><div> <p><strong>MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:</strong></p> <ul>  <li>Bi-Lingual (French & English).</li>  <li>Bachelor’s Degree preferred.</li>  <li>3-5 years in Sales preferred.</li>  <li>Experience within the Mobile Industry an asset</li>  <li>Proven selling ability.</li>  <li>Must possess a strong knowledge of industry products.</li>  <li>Strong interpersonal skills, able to interact comfortably with a wide range of levels in organizations: from senior executives to support staff within and outside of the company.</li>  <li>Strong presentation skills.</li>  <li>Excellent organizational and planning skills.</li>  <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li>  <li>Must be highly self-motivated and capable of self-directed work given only broad objectives and limited direct supervision.</li>  <li>Must be capable of planning, organizing and prioritizing multiple and simultaneous projects and assignments.​</li>  </ul> </div><div> <p><strong>BENEFITS:</strong></p> <p>Premium offers a competitive salary along with a full benefits package including health, dental, vision, life insurance, long-term disability, and paid time off. All supplementary benefits and employment practices are in compliance with all Canadian employment laws. </p> </div><div> <p><strong>COMPANY:</strong></p> <p>Premium has been pioneering bold strategies, tools and technologies since 1985 with a single goal: to help our partners advance their industries and the lives of their consumers.</p>   <p>Experts in strategy, merchandising, brand advocacy and support, we employ a tailored approach to answering each client's unique business needs. Together with our clients, we're inventing and leading a new era in retail, moving forward by moving beyond what's expected.</p>   <p> </p> </div><div> <p><strong>PREMIUM CAREERS:</strong></p> <p>Retail experience? Check. An unbeatable work ethic? Check. A burning desire to be part of a team delivering results for a cutting-edge roster of clients? Check. You just might be Premium.</p>   <p>Propel brands to new heights with integrity and imagination. Join our team and be the next big thing.</p>   <p> </p> </div><div> <p> </p> <p>Premium is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we will accommodate your needs under the Human Rights Code. Upon individual request, hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application, interview or selection processes, please contact the Human Resources Department for assistance. Due to the high volume of applicants, only those moving forward in the next step of the selection process will be contacted.</p> </div>  </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>

Title: Manager, Business Operations
Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Job Type: </strong>Permanent <br><strong>Primary Location: </strong>Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br><strong>All Available Locations: </strong>Calgary </p><div><p><p>External Posting Description</p><p><p>Reporting to the Prairie Region Senior Manager of Business Operations, the Manager of Business Operations is responsible for supervising a team of Client Experience Professionals (CEP) as well as supporting the facilities management of the Greenhouse (currently under construction). The Manager of Business Operations will also have broader Business Operations responsibilities to support the Prairie Region.The Manager of Business Operations is responsible for the high-level administrative supervision of the team, identification and adoption of best practices, and coordination of specialized support to ensure a full suite of support is provided. The successful candidate will work on building relationships, supporting Partners and contributes to the positive culture of the office, team members and reflects the Deloitte brand. The Manager of Business Operations possesses the ability to effectively manage business activities with minimal input and direction. The Manager of Business operations also represents the firm in a professional manner in verbal and written communications, builds strong relationships with internal and external clients; delivers high quality results, ensuring business needs and commitments are met.</p><p><u><strong>Overview:</strong></u></p><ul><li>Maximize the quality of our support to Partners by developing value added services, implementing best practices, and identifying opportunities for standardization and process improvement in collaboration with the Senior Manager of Business Operations</li><li>Anchor all actions in a deep understanding of client expectations, needs and challenges (developed and maintained by meeting regularly and actively building relationships with our partners and Paraprofessionals) along with solid knowledge of Business Operations processes and practices.</li><li>Drive change effectively by applying a consultative approach, leading by example and building consensus with key stakeholders – including other Business Operations staff, clients and enabling areas.</li><li>Foster continuous improvement, knowledge sharing and team-building, through periodic meetings, events and networks, and other initiatives</li><li>Coordinate specialized support (such as event management, communications, hospitality, graphic design and research), teaming effectively with enabling areas to generate the ultimate client experience.</li><li>Understand fluid executive support priorities and align resources and delivery priorities accordingly, in an agile manner and with a high tolerance for rapid adjustments</li><li>Lead the performance management process, including: collection and calibration of feedback from clients, contribution to the assessment, ongoing coordination of talent management reviews, communication of annual rating and compensation adjustments (where applicable).</li><li>Collaborate with Talent on recruitment efforts, by refining position descriptions, interviewing candidates and delivering new hire orientation to successful candidates.</li><li>Identify and monitor necessary training for the team which may include delivery of various training sessions and rollout of appropriate tools. Enable achievement and completion of formal learning curricula for PPs.</li><li>Manage leave requests (e.g. vacation, parental), overtime and timesheets. Arrange appropriate backup coverage for seamless partner support and client service delivery.</li><li>Work to create a community of engaged Client Experience Professionals</li><li>Develop effective working relationships with other Business Operations managers and supervisors including Shared Services, and other enabling areas across the practice to foster positive and productive teamwork.</li><li>Actively participate in Regional Management team meetings and other Business Operations initiatives</li><li>Lead Business Operations projects to support and respond to the needs of the team</li></ul></p></p><p><p>External Posting Qualifications</p><p><ul><li>Minimum 7 years of supervisory and operational experience, preferably within a complex professional service work environment.</li><li>Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills with a demonstrated ability to effect change through influence rather than authority in a high-touch environment</li><li>Proven ability to create a standard of excellence through process improvement</li><li>Experience at building relationships with clients and colleagues at all levels.</li><li>Effective skillsets in the areas of organization, priority and time management and problem-solving.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>Ability to speak in French is an asset</li><li>Advanced level knowledge of common industry software, such as Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint), Adobe Acrobat, as well as Deloitte-resident packages</li><li>Demonstrated enthusiasm for continuous learning relevant to the role.</li><li>Flexible hours to meet business needs; working in alternate locations may be required</li><li>Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.</li></ul><p>We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.</p></p></p></div><p><strong>Get your career off to a great start. What impact will you make?</strong></p><p>We’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. At Deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.</p><p>We offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career. Deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. And with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the Deloitte community.</p><p>“Once Deloitte, always Deloitte.”</p><p><strong>Lead yourself. Lead a team. Lead the firm. It’s all possible at Deloitte.</strong></p><p>Deloitte is one of Canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across Canada. At Deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. </p><p><strong>Let Deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. And let your story unfold.</strong></p><p>Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.</p><p>We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.</p><p>34728 </p></div>

Title: Manager Loss Prevention
Job_Description: <div> Manager Loss Prevention Southern AB <br/>  Apply now »<br/>   <div> Apply now    <ul>  <br/>  <div> <div> <div> Start</div>  </div>  </div>  <br/><li>  <div> <strong>Please wait...</strong></div> </li>  </ul>   </div><br/>   <div> Apply now  <br/>  <div> <div> <strong> ×</strong> <br/>  Apply for Job</div><br/>   <div> <div> <div> ×</div><br/>   <div> ×</div><br/>   <div> ×</div><br/>   <div> Enter your email to apply</div> </div>  </div>  </div>  </div>  </div> <br/><strong>Date:</strong>  <br/>  08-May-2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> <br/>  Calgary, AB, CA <br/><br/> <strong>Company:</strong>  <br/>  Sobeys<br/> <div><strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 41287 <br/><br/> <strong>Career Group:</strong> Corporate Careers <br/><br/> <strong>Job Category:</strong> Operations <br/><br/> <strong>Travel Requirements:</strong> 40 - 50% <br/><br/> <strong>Country:</strong> Canada (CA) <br/><br/> <strong>Province:</strong> Alberta (CA-AB) <br/><br/> <strong>City:</strong> Calgary <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Sobeys West Calgary Office <br/><br/> <strong>Postal Code:</strong> <br/><br/> A proudly Canadian retail company, Sobeys began in 1907 as a small meat delivery business in Stellarton, Nova Scotia. Today, Sobeys Inc. serves the food shopping needs of Canadians with approximately 1,500 stores in all 10 provinces under retail banners that include Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, and Lawton’s Drug Stores as well as in-store pharmacies, liquor and more than 350 retail fuel locations. <br/><br/> Together with our 125,000 employees and franchise affiliates and a collective passion for delivering exceptional food and shopping experiences, Sobeys’ purpose is to improve the lives of Canadians by helping them Eat Better, Feel Better and Do Better. . <br/><br/> <strong>All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.</strong><br/> <div>Job Description <br/><br/> As Manager Loss Prevention you will be responsible for the protection of assets and preventing loss. You will support leaders and employees for employee protection and work with law enforcement and government agencies. <br/><br/> <strong>Some of the key things you’ll be responsible for in this role will include:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Provide advice and recommendations to Management personnel regarding the legal and practical aspects of loss prevention</li> <li>Prepare and maintain appropriate documentation, records, reports and statements</li> <li>Provide prompt and thorough investigations as required</li> <li>Review new security technology and strategies and make recommendations to management</li> <li>Assist in the development of security policies and procedures and loss prevention programs</li> <li>Conduct training and development programs in security and loss prevention</li> <li>Conduct loss prevention audits and make recommendations</li> <li>Respond to any emergency situation involving Company personnel, property or assets</li> <li>Ensure compliance with Company policies and procedures</li> <li>Liaise with various law enforcement and government agencies</li> <li>Conduct regular site visits</li> <li>Coordinate contracted services (investigators/security guards/etc.) for store support</li> <li>Ensure all security equipment at designated sites is properly utilized and maintained</li> <li>Ensure compliance with the EAS program (where applicable)</li> <li>Provide protection to all employees (as requested)</li> <li>Promote Regional Sobeys Employee Loss Prevention Recognition program</li> <li>Complete special projects</li> </ul> Job Requirements <br/><br/> Requirements:  <ul>  	<li>Full knowledge of industry operations</li> <li>Three to five years in a security/auditing, loss prevention, or in a police related field</li> <li>Security/ loss prevention AB license/certification such as ASP, CPP, CFE, LPC, or LPQ is preferred</li> <li>Security/ Loss Prevention Experience</li> <li>Proficient in use of Microsoft office suite</li> <li>Clean and valid Class 5 driver’s license</li> <li>Retail experience</li> </ul> Overview <br/><br/> We are currently looking for a Manager Loss Prevention for Southern Alberta to provide overall loss prevention services to Sobeys Inc. affiliated regional banners.</div></div>

Title: Visual Presentation Manager - Hudson's Bay
Job_Description: Job Description<br/><br/>Who We Are: <br/><br/> HBC is a diversified global retailer, focused on driving the performance of high quality stores and their all-channel offerings, growing through acquisitions, and unlocking the value of real estate holdings. Founded in 1670, HBC is the oldest company in North America. Our portfolio today includes formats ranging from luxury to premium department stores to off price fashion shopping destinations, with more than 480 stores and over 66,000 employees around the world. <br/><br/> Our leading banners across North America and Europe include Hudson’s Bay, Lord & Taylor, Saks Fifth Avenue, Gilt, Saks OFF 5TH, Galeria Kaufhof, the largest department store group in Germany, and Belgium’s only department store group Galeria INNO. <br/><br/> We have significant investments in real estate joint ventures. HBC has partnered with Simon Property Group Inc. in the HBC Global Properties Joint Venture, which owns properties in the United States and Germany. In Canada, HBC has partnered with RioCan Real Estate Investment Trust in the RioCan-HBC Joint Venture <br/><br/> A truly global corporate citizen, HBC is committed to responsible business practices to bring about positive change, and we work hard to shape a sustainable future for people and the planet. Our philanthropic initiatives help create healthy families, strong communities, and sport excellence in the cities and countries in which we operate around the world, while striving to create innovative programs and resources that provide flexibility for work-life balance in order to maintain a positive working environment. <br/><br/> What This Position Is All About: <br/><br/> The Visual Presentation Manager will act as the store’s fashion leader, drive store sales, and exceed customer service expectations through visual merchandising and presentation within the store. <br/><br/> Who You Are: <ul>  <li>You get things done by engaging in high level teamwork and flexing your interpersonal skills</li> <li>A natural problem-solver, who is also intuitively analytical and creative</li> <li>You have proven time management skills and are comfortable managing multiple projects and dealing with shifting priorities</li> <li>You can work independently without concern, stay self-motivated and always meet your deadlines</li>  </ul> <br/><br/> You Also Have: <ul>  <li>Post-secondary education preferred</li> <li>2+ years in visual merchandising</li>  </ul> <br/><br/> As The Visual Presentation Manager You Will: <ul>  <li>Oversee and implement all placement, standards of execution, and guideline directives with a strong hand in overall flow, merchandising, and store layout through displays, fixtures, signing, marketing, lighting, wall presentations, and assets</li> <li>Achieve brand consistency and enhancements by supporting corporate branding initiatives: in-store campaigns, windows, etc.</li> <li>Take a leadership role in communication, direction, and flow challenges within the store</li> <li>Create visual impact to provide customer excitement and interest per company guidelines</li>  </ul> <br/><br/> Your Life and Career at HBC: <ul>  <li>Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner-operator!</li> <li>Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.</li> <li>A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance</li> <li>Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).</li> <li>An amazing employee discount</li>  </ul> Note: Only applications submitted online will be accepted. <br/><br/> HBC welcomes all applicants for this position; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Strategic Sourcing & Category Manager, IT / Technical Services
Job_Description: Description de poste<br/><br/>Every day, our passionate employees connect our customers to the world and everything in it – it’s why we exist at Shaw, and it’s why we strive to be the place where the best people choose to work. Our people reflect the richness of our communities, and our culture is inclusive of each individual’s diverse background and perspective, which makes us a stronger team. <br/><br/> At Shaw we believe a diverse workforce fosters diversity of thought and perspective, and more diversity means more solutions. We invite all qualified individuals to apply. <br/><br/> Career Opportunity: Strategic Sourcing & Category Manager, IT / Technical Services <br/><br/> The Strategic Sourcing & Category Manager role will be based in Calgary and will report to the Manager, Strategic Sourcing. This individual contributor will drive the development of Strategic Sourcing & Category Strategies, plans and initiatives for the Strategic Sourcing team in close collaboration with internal business stakeholders. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Develop and Implement Category Strategies for IT and related services spend categories</li> <li>Support the development and implementation of Strategic Sourcing process and methodologies</li> <li>Analyze data, report findings and make sourcing recommendations</li> <li>Gather and provide a current understanding of industry best practices and trends to team members and business partners</li> <li>Manage supplier contracts, governance and control programs to ensure delivery of expectations and comply with corporate and regulatory policies</li> <li>Ensure compliance with purchasing policies and procedures, ethical practices and adherence to relevant laws and regulations. Conduct market data research, investigate supplier capabilities and establish sources for new innovations, technologies and markets as business requirements dictate</li> <li>Lead the development of negotiation strategies and negotiations of high value/risk/complex agreements with large suppliers encompassing key program specifications and functional and commercial objectives</li> <li>Develop and track cost savings initiatives that meet individual targets</li> <li>Implement strategies that positively impact company financial results and growth plans</li> <li>Lead the RFx processes</li> <li>Identify and organize cross functional team resources responsible for Sourcing Strategies</li> <li>Manage and measure cross functional team performance against key business objectives</li> <li>Liaise with internal category teams and business partners and gain a comprehensive understanding of current business requirements as well as long term strategies</li> <li>Collaborate with senior functional leaders to establish short-term and long-term business objectives</li> <li>Identify metrics, tools, and processes to optimize sourcing activities and efficiencies and work collaboratively with team members to prioritize and drive implementation</li> <li>Build and maintain strategic partnerships with a number of our suppliers</li> <li>Develop and negotiate agreements</li> <li>Track initiatives, supplier information and value creation in a central repository for reporting purposes</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience with equipment, software development and service suppliers in a telco or MSO.</li> <li>Understanding of hosting, licencing and maintenance mechanisms and agreements.</li> <li>University or post-secondary degree is required; degree in Strategic Sourcing, Engineering, Finance or Business, or is preferred.</li> <li>7 to 10 plus years of progressive experience in leading large strategic projects, strategic procurement, supply chain management, legal and/or equivalent required.</li> <li>MBA or post-graduate degree in business, finance, or related field would be an asset</li> <li>Proven high level degree of financial and problem solving ability required</li> <li>Some knowledge of/experience with e-procurement processes and systems required</li> <li>Strong and proven business/financial acumen</li> <li>Knowledge of contract law</li> <li>Prior knowledge and experience in multiple commodities and spend categories required with a focus in technical / IT Goods and Services</li> <li>Strong Project Management skills required</li> <li>Understanding/knowledge of Lean, Six Sigma and Project Management methodologies is an asset</li> <li>Experience with equipment and service suppliers in a telco or MSO an asset</li> <li>Experience with should cost modelling for goods and services</li> <li>Thorough knowledge of advanced functions of Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) required</li> <li>Proven ability to perform in a team environment as well manage and lead a cross functional team</li> <li>Excellent knowledge of Strategic Sourcing, Contract and Vendor Management</li> <li>Excellent relationship building, interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills required</li> <li>Ability to influence change and work with ambiguity</li> <li>Proven track of high performance and ability to execute</li> </ul>  If you want to be part of something bigger—part of a dynamic team of people who are aligned, focused, and passionate about working together to care for our customers, then we look forward to meeting you! Join us. <br/><br/> We thank all interested applicants; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted. This position requires the successful completion of a criminal background check. <br/><br/> Shaw Communications, through its third party vendor, collects and stores information applicable to the candidate profile you create when you submit the information asked for below. The use and disclosure of the collected information is for the sole purpose of job search and placement activities for Shaw Communications. The information is subject to Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act. The information will be retained and when disposed of, it is done so in a secure manner. Your profile will become inactive and moved to the archive if you do not access your profile for a period of 1 year.

Title: Maintenance Manager

Title: Manager, Tax
Job_Description: At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career. <br/><br/> Join the momentum. We are seeking a Manager for our growing Tax team. Providing the highest level of excellence, MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Our Tax team works with individuals and organizations in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors, providing comprehensive strategies that minimize risk, meet tax compliance and reporting requirements, reduce costs and maximize returns. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Expectations</strong> <ul> <li><div>Lead multiple client facing engagement teams responsible for the completion of tax engagements</div></li><li><div>Deliver industry and technical expertise taxation and assurance through client interactions, reports, technical work, management presentations and the creation of high quality deliverables</div></li><li><div>Participate in the development of proactive tax strategies for clients to make effective use of business opportunities and ensure businesses run effectively</div></li><li><div>Manage project financials (budgets, WIPS, timely billing and collection and variance recognition)</div></li><li><div>Execute transactions through the provision of client services including planning, budgeting, scheduling and coordinating engagements</div></li><li><div>Liaise with Canada Revenue Agency and relevant provincial ministries on client issues</div> </li><li><div>Correspond with team members and clients in response to specific personal or corporate tax queries or regarding matters that arise from compliance or planning work</div></li><li><div>Review, investigate and correct discrepancies and irregularities in financial entries and reports</div> </li><li><div>Prepare election forms required in corporate reorganizations</div> </li><li><div>Research client issues that arise from compliance or planning work using a variety of sources</div></li><li><div>Assist in the management of the administration of personal and trust tax compliance seasons</div></li><li><div>Contribute to the preparation and delivery of competitive proposals to meet client needs</div></li><li><div>Develop a thorough understanding of MNP’s services, businesses and industry</div> </li><li><div>Collaborate with client engagement team prior to commencement of client work to discuss roles and responsibilities, risk areas, materiality and deadlines</div></li><li><div>Think strategically about client needs by understanding their business and key risks</div></li><li><div>Identify ways to maximize the relationship with clients and deliver added value</div></li><li><div>Maintain high quality control by reviewing tax returns and other work done from other team members for accuracy and completeness; provide feedback to team members</div></li><li><div>Monitor project timelines against targets, adjust where necessary; advise clients of project status and seek clarification on discrepancies where applicable</div></li><li><div>Network and take a leadership role in the local professional, business, and community while raising awareness of MNP and looking for new business development opportunities</div></li><li><div>Leverage team appropriately to ensure proper documentation is prepared for the client and procedures relating to the file are followed accordingly</div></li><li><div>Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes</div></li><li><div>Liaise and correspond professionally with clients, colleagues and the firm leadership team</div></li><li><div>Develop, coach, and train team members towards professional and personal development</div></li><li><div>Conduct formal, written annual performance reviews</div></li><li><div>Promote regular attendance, balanced lifestyle and high standard of team wellness</div></li><li><div>Attend internal MNP courses to further develop accounting and assurance knowledge</div></li> </ul> <strong>Credentials</strong> <ul> <li><div>Completion of a Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation</div></li><li><div>Completion of Level 1 of In-depth Tax Program and other specialist development courses</div> </li><li><div>Four (4) to five (5) years of relevant work experience in public accounting and/or tax consulting</div> </li><li>Minimum three (3) years of managerial experience</li> <li><div>Extensive knowledge of and experience working in Canadian Tax</div></li><li><div>Solid understanding of business, accounting, management and practice development principles</div></li><li><div>Experience working with accounting and tax software such as Caseware, Profile, Quickbooks and Simply Accounting</div></li><li><div>Strong computer literacy including effective working skills of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint</div></li><li><div>Some travel may be required</div></li> </ul> <strong>Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics</strong> <ul> <li><div><strong>Integrity –</strong> professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships</div></li><li><div><strong>Energy –</strong> displays enthusiasm, optimism and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle</div></li><li><div><strong>Diversity –</strong> understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences</div></li><li><div><strong>Communication –</strong> effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others that make an impact and persuade their intended audience(s)</div></li><li><div><strong>Client Service Excellence –</strong> understands the importance of quality client service, proactively identifies client needs and creates strategies to proficiently serve clients</div></li><li><div><strong>Business Development –</strong> looks for and seizes profitable business opportunities while focusing on the ability to gain increased presence in the community</div> </li><li><div><strong>Forward Thinking –</strong> anticipates the implications of situations, takes appropriate action as needed and prepares for possible contingencies</div></li><li><div><strong>Agility with Change –</strong> initiates, sponsors and implements change by taking a facilitative catalyst role</div> </li><li><div><strong>People Management & Leadership –</strong> goal-driven leader who effectively manages self, others and teams to achieve goals</div></li><li><div><strong>Coaching –</strong> takes responsibility for one’s own and team members’ performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals, promptly addresses performance issues, is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making</div></li> </ul> MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events, and professional development assistance. <br/><br/> MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world.

Title: Manager or Lead, SAP HR
Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Vancouver<br/> <div> <strong>Job description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Technology</strong> <br/><br/> Our technologists help clients implement innovative technologies to drive their business’ forward. Our consultants link technology insights to clients’ organizational goals to fit within their full operating models, accounting for their people, intellectual capital, and processes. <br/><br/> <strong>SAP</strong> <br/><br/> The full potential of SAP solutions isn't just about technology, it's also about driving sustainable business value. At Deloitte, our SAP specialists deliver the technology and services to help our clients meet business performance goals and improve processes. As an SAP Global Partner we provide a broad range of consulting services, from HR, CRM and supply chain to finance transformation. <br/><br/> <strong>Manager, SAP RH</strong> <br/><br/> Are you looking for a career trajectory that few other organizations can offer in SAP? What about access to a high-quality portfolio of businesses and clients with opportunities to work across capabilities, industries, and geographies – in roles and on projects aligned with your SAP Profitability Analysis skills? If this matches your interests and aspirations Deloitte may be right for you. <br/><br/> As Manager focused on SAP HR you are expected to: <ul> <li>Lead and support SAP HR pursuits and Practice Development initiatives</li><li>Build strong business relationships with potential clients</li><li>Identify and lead business development opportunities</li><li>Deliver SAP HR projects successfully</li><li>Supervise and coach junior colleagues and manage parts of client engagements</li><li>Develop external eminence across SAP RH</li><li>Promote and foster collaboration and knowledge sharing between practitioners in SAP and across Deloitte</li><li>Act as a trusted business advisor</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>Functional/technical proficiency with at least 4+ full lifecycle SAP implementations and 6+ years of industry and/or consulting experience</li><li>Minimum of 6 years of Experience in offering SAP RH solutions across different Industries</li><li>Certified in SAP</li><li>Experience defining systems strategy, developing systems requirements, designing and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines</li><li>Adept at designing and implementing technology-enabled business solutions for clients as part of a high-talent team and as a team lead or Project Manager on at least 3+ full cycle implementations</li><li>Able to collaborate with clients, identify engagement follow-on opportunities and have a strong desire to excel and be committed to gaining exposure to multiple industries while further developing your career</li><li>Strong current hands-on configuration and design skills</li><li>Canadian travel required and occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignments</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 31763</div>

Title: Oil & Gas Senior Manager
