Title: Manager Loss Prevention
Job_Description: <strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 41287 <br/><br/> <strong>Career Group:</strong> Corporate Careers <br/><br/> <strong>Job Category:</strong> Operations <br/><br/> <strong>Travel Requirements:</strong> 40 - 50% <br/><br/> <strong>Country:</strong> Canada (CA) <br/><br/> <strong>Province:</strong> Alberta (CA-AB) <br/><br/> <strong>City:</strong> Calgary <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Sobeys West Calgary Office <br/><br/> <strong>Postal Code:</strong> <br/><br/> A proudly Canadian retail company, Sobeys began in 1907 as a small meat delivery business in Stellarton, Nova Scotia. Today, Sobeys Inc. serves the food shopping needs of Canadians with approximately 1,500 stores in all 10 provinces under retail banners that include Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, and Lawton’s Drug Stores as well as in-store pharmacies, liquor and more than 350 retail fuel locations. <br/><br/> Together with our 125,000 employees and franchise affiliates and a collective passion for delivering exceptional food and shopping experiences, Sobeys’ purpose is to improve the lives of Canadians by helping them Eat Better, Feel Better and Do Better. . <br/><br/> <strong>All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.</strong><br/> <div>Job Description <br/><br/> As Manager Loss Prevention you will be responsible for the protection of assets and preventing loss. You will support leaders and employees for employee protection and work with law enforcement and government agencies. <br/><br/> <strong>Some of the key things you’ll be responsible for in this role will include:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Provide advice and recommendations to Management personnel regarding the legal and practical aspects of loss prevention</li> <li>Prepare and maintain appropriate documentation, records, reports and statements</li> <li>Provide prompt and thorough investigations as required</li> <li>Review new security technology and strategies and make recommendations to management</li> <li>Assist in the development of security policies and procedures and loss prevention programs</li> <li>Conduct training and development programs in security and loss prevention</li> <li>Conduct loss prevention audits and make recommendations</li> <li>Respond to any emergency situation involving Company personnel, property or assets</li> <li>Ensure compliance with Company policies and procedures</li> <li>Liaise with various law enforcement and government agencies</li> <li>Conduct regular site visits</li> <li>Coordinate contracted services (investigators/security guards/etc.) for store support</li> <li>Ensure all security equipment at designated sites is properly utilized and maintained</li> <li>Ensure compliance with the EAS program (where applicable)</li> <li>Provide protection to all employees (as requested)</li> <li>Promote Regional Sobeys Employee Loss Prevention Recognition program</li> <li>Complete special projects</li> </ul> Job Requirements <br/><br/> Requirements:  <ul>  	<li>Full knowledge of industry operations</li> <li>Three to five years in a security/auditing, loss prevention, or in a police related field</li> <li>Security/ loss prevention AB license/certification such as ASP, CPP, CFE, LPC, or LPQ is preferred</li> <li>Security/ Loss Prevention Experience</li> <li>Proficient in use of Microsoft office suite</li> <li>Clean and valid Class 5 driver’s license</li> <li>Retail experience</li> </ul> Overview <br/><br/> We are currently looking for a Manager Loss Prevention for Southern Alberta to provide overall loss prevention services to Sobeys Inc. affiliated regional banners.</div> <br/>Sobeys is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process and will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process. <br/><br/> While all responses are appreciated only those being considered for interviews will be acknowledged. <br/><br/> <strong>We appreciate the interest from the Staffing industry however respectfully request no calls or unsolicited resumes from Agencies.</strong>

Title: Facility Manager, Calgary (Educational Institution) - Request of proposal
Job_Description: <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>ENGIE Services</STRONG> is a provider of energy efficiency, facility management services and outsourcing solutions for companies and communities. Our experts design, develop and manage tailored, smart and sustainable solutions for our customers’ benefit from airports to office parks and industrial sites. <BR><BR><STRONG>ENGIE Services</STRONG> is part of ENGIE in North America, which manages a range of energy businesses in the U.S. and Canada, including electricity generation and cogeneration, natural gas and liquefied natural gas (LNG) distribution and sales, retail energy sales and energy optimization services. ENGIE (formerly GDF SUEZ) employs 154,950 people worldwide.<BR><BR><STRONG>Job Office:</STRONG> Educational Institution in Calgary<BR><STRONG>Position Status:</STRONG> Permanent, Full Time<BR><STRONG>Schedule:</STRONG> Days</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>**RFP process ongoing**</STRONG></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Summary:</STRONG></DIV> <DIV>The Facility Manager is responsible to manage the overall Building and Equipment operation of the educational facilities in areas of safety, comfort, productivity and efficiency to the standards of the contract and to the satisfaction of our customers 24/7/365 and shall include but not be limited to the following duties and responsibilities.</DIV> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Responsibilities:</STRONG><BR></DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Management :</STRONG></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Serve as the on-site manager representing Engie Services; supervise and train employees to ensure compliance with all provisions of the project.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Responsible for day-to-day operations and maintenance, performance, supervision, and control of sites and that these services are performed in an effective and efficient manner.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Monitor the maintenance of the educational facilities.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Produce results as per financial targets through effective management of employees and resources.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Implement and monitor a Quality Assurance Program for the Site.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Implement and manage FMO programs/systems for the Site.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Be fully familiar with the requirements of the project contract, the schedules and ensure the proper skilled staffing is provided and oversee management of various subcontractors.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Meet with the client representative and Engie’s corporate management on matters relating to the services performed with a view toward obtaining effective coordination of all operations. Issue reports and summaries to the client as required.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Develop, implement and communicate improved processes, policies and procedures on a continuous basis, always seeking greater efficiencies and higher customer satisfaction.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Develop, guide, direct, motivate and manage the performance of all direct reports in line with our HR Program to assist in the realization of their potential and to enhance their knowledge-based skills.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Establish and maintain effective business relationships with customers, suppliers and subcontractors, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Foster and maintain excellent business relations at all levels of the client base to encourage and promote the development of new and unique business opportunities.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate in the annual planning process providing input to form an acceptable business plan that blends with contractual and Engie Objectives.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Maintain a direct involvement in all projects, sales and estimating.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate in the achievement of the KPIs as they relate to your job and sites.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate in the prevention of accidents and promote a safe working environment.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ensure that Engie is in compliance both procedurally and in spirit, with provincial, client and company occupational health and safety policies and procedures.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Provides leadership and guidance for Site Personnel for all aspects of the site facility operations and maintenance to ensure high overall standards and performance.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Development of Personnel and labour negotiations in association with Engie Senior Management.</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV></DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Operational</STRONG></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Establish performance standards for each phase of work. Shall be responsible for the adherence to standard practices and quality specifications for all work performed.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Establish a program for the acquisition, storage and accountability of all operating materials, tools, and equipment.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Develop planned preventative maintenance programs for the site.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Co-ordinate with the Purchasing Manager on requirements for maintenance materials and equipment.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Carry out random quality control checks. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ensure that all equipment and materials are of the required standard and that procedures are in place to prevent fraud and safety issues.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Contract and staff Management.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Budgeting and implementing corrective actions to ensure costs are consistent with ENGIE financial plans.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Maximize communication and synergies within the team.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate in upgrading courses to keep abreast of changing policy, technology and growth.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Roll out and monitoring of Quality Assurance program and safety programs.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Review of sub-contractor performance.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Objectives and strategies are in place to achieve zero lost time injuries in the workplace.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>To provide the highest level of service and support for the Customer.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Perform other duties as assigned. </DIV></LI></UL> <STRONG>Requirements:</STRONG>  <DIV> <UL> <LI>Minimum 10 years of experience in Facilities Maintenance; </LI> <LI>Bachelor Degree: building management or construction or business studies or building services engineering or any relevant degree combined with experience will be evaluated;</LI> <LI>Facility Management Administrator (FMA) or Certified Facility Manager (CFM) (an asset);</LI> <LI>Computer literacy (MS Office suite) and knowledge of computerized maintenance programs (CMMS) a must;</LI> <LI>Trouble shooting and problem-solving experience in a medium to large organization;</LI> <LI>Valid Driver’s License;</LI> <LI>Maintain a high level of technical expertise.</LI></UL> <DIV><STRONG>Skills:</STRONG>  <DIV> <UL> <LI>Excellent verbal and written communication;</LI> <LI>Proven track record in managing a maintenance department;</LI> <LI>Safety & Quality oriented;</LI> <LI>High level of customer orientation / understanding;</LI> <LI>Leadership;</LI> <LI>Interpersonal, relationship-building and networking skills;</LI> <LI>Commercial and negotiation skills;</LI> <LI>Problem solving. </LI></UL></DIV></DIV> <P><STRONG>Notes:</STRONG> </P> <P>The Facility Manager is responsible for different buildings in Calgary and will travel between them occasionally. </P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Equal Employment Opportunity:</STRONG></P> <P>ENGIE Services Inc. is committed to the principles of equality in employment and invites women, aboriginals, members of visible minorities, ethnic minorities and persons with disabilities to apply.</P> <P> </P> <P>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation or preference, religion, marital status, citizenship, veteran status, or physical or mental disability.</P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Comment:</STRONG></P> <P></P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>We thank all applicants. Only selected candidates will be contacted.</STRONG></P></DIV>

Title: Senior Manager, Valuation Services
Job_Description: <div><strong>Service:</strong> Financial Advisory <br/> <strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> The Saskatchewan Financial Advisory services practice is currently searching for a Senior Manager to join our Valuation Services group. As a member of our Financial Advisory team, you’ll help small start-ups to massive multinationals face financial issues with informed confidence. Using your deep technical skills and leveraging our global network of experts, you’ll provide financial advice to companies in every industry, and in every situation. The result? Our clients will be better placed to take control and receive the best solutions to their complex challenges. <br/><br/> Click here to find out more about our Financial Advisory services. <br/><br/> A career in Financial Advisory will offer you the opportunity to: <ul> <li>Work in a fast growing and challenging environment with like-minded people who are eminent in their respective technical field</li><li>Develop solutions through debate and discussion, in our teams and with clients</li><li>Continue your professional development to reinforce and expand your chosen career path</li><li>Work with high profile clients on a variety of Canadian and international engagements</li> </ul> <strong>As a Senior Manager on our Valuations and M&A team you will:</strong> <ul> <li>Provide clients with buy-side valuation advice including pricing/market analysis, target company valuations, and purchase price allocations;</li><li>Provide clients with sell-side valuation advice including preparation of offering documents, divestiture company and asset valuations, and offer analysis;</li><li>Provide valuation support to our audit and tax functions such as impairment analysis, going concern analysis, valuations to support corporate restructuring, and valuations for business combination;</li><li>Lead teams in the delivery of all forms of valuation reports (comprehensive, estimate, and calculation);</li><li>Take a lead role in delivering advisory services to high growth organizations with a diverse team;</li><li>Create long term relationships at a senior client level;</li><li>Execute a client service plan on complex engagements working closely with Partners;</li><li>Identify and lead business development opportunities;</li><li>Actively mentor and coach team members to their highest potential;</li><li>Create a learning environment through leadership.</li> </ul> <strong>Your role as a manager at Deloitte:</strong> <ul> <li>Embrace and live the firm’s purpose – to make an impact that matters – by pushing yourself and your team to identify solutions to challenges that are most important for our clients, people, and society</li><li>Develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities</li><li>Deliver exceptional client service by maximizing results and driving high performance from people, while also fostering collaboration across businesses and borders</li><li>Influence clients, teams and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships</li><li>Understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, and align people to them to set appropriate priorities and direction</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <ul> <li>Completed undergraduate degree with strong academic credentials;</li><li>Must have CBV designation and completion of the CPA designation would be considered a strong asset;</li><li>Minimum 7 years of relevant work experience;</li><li>Strong external consulting or advisory experience;</li><li>Strong commitment to professional and client service excellence;</li><li>Superior verbal and written communication skills;</li><li>Proven ability to deliver all valuation related services;</li><li>Experienced with project problem diagnosis, solution development, client communications, facilitation of decision making, documentation, managing client expectations, project profitability and team leadership;</li><li>Experienced in business development and building a practice;</li><li>Demonstrated evidence of strong leadership in creating a learning environment;</li><li>Ability to anticipate the long term impact of all decisions and take a broad approach to problem solving;</li><li>Execute a client service plan on complex engagements and work closely with the team in exceeding our client's expectations while identifying and mitigating business risks associated with projects;</li><li>Some Canadian travel may be required and occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignments.</li> </ul> </div> <br/>Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.</div>

Title: Manager, Accounting - FGL Sports
Job_Description: <div>Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?</div><br/> <div>Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.</div><br/> <div>The Manager, Accounting, Forzani Group (FGL) will be responsible for providing meaningful accounting and analytical support and insight to the senior management team and business partners of the FGL division of Canadian Tire .</div><br/> <div><strong>What you’ll do</strong></div><br/> <div>As a key area of the focus for Canadian Tire Corporation is One Company, One Customer, you will be part of a the larger Retail and Enterprise Accounting team and will play a key role in implementing standardized procedures, centres of excellences and partnering with the business and FP&A to ensure the accounting structure, processes, and any recommendations made complement their needs. You will regularly collaborate and interact with stakeholders from various teams such as FP&A, Merchandising and Operations to drive recommendations related to the FGL business in order to achieve strong financial results.</div><div><strong>Responsibilities</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Accounting for the FGL group of companies on a monthly basis.</li><li>Ensure financial results have integrity and are complete and accurate and in compliance with IFRS</li><li>Provide timely and accurate quarterly reporting to the External Financial Reporting team to support the preparation of the Quarterly and Annual Financial Reports</li><li>Ensure that internal controls are designed appropriately and operate effectively, and that quarterly certification reviews are successfully met</li><li>Support the preparation of the annual budget, monthly/quarterly forecasts, and monitor results versus budget/forecast and last year on a monthly basis</li><li>Provide quarterly and year-end audit support to our external auditors</li><li>Provide recommendations to senior management that will drive key decision making with respect to the business and ensure accounting implications of strategic decisions are known and considered</li><li>Support the creating of a new accounting structure that supports the One Company initiative, while still helping the business achieve strong financial results.</li><li>Manage and develop a team of 7 direct reports</li><li>Create a high performing team culture with a drive for results and foster an environment of ongoing advancement of skills and capabilities on the team</li><li>Work on special projects as assigned</li></ul></div><br/>  <div><strong>Who you are</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>We are looking for high performing individuals who are:</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment</li><li>Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers</li><li>Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives</li><li>Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward</li> </ul></div><br/>  <div>If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be.</div><br/> <div><strong>What you’ve done</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>University degree or College diploma in Accounting/Finance or business related discipline</li><li>Accounting designation (CPA, CA, CMA, CGA) or MBA</li> <li>5 years of progressive experience in Finance, Analytics, or Merchandise Planning roles with an emphasis on decision support</li><li>2 years of experience in a managerial role leading a team</li><li>Superior analytical skills with an understanding of cause and affect financials</li><li>Ability to clearly and confidently communicate written/verbal recommendations and articulate trade-offs</li><li>Admirable time management and self-management skills</li><li>Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Access, VBA, SQL, and PowerPoint</li></ul></div><br/>  <div><strong>Why us</strong></div><br/> <div>Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.</div> <br/> <div>To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.</div>  <br/>is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Title: Project Coordinator
Job_Description: <strong>Why the Stampede?</strong> <br/><br/> For over 100 years the Calgary Stampede has been the heart and soul of our city. It is both where and how we come together to celebrate our unique brand of western hospitality and community spirit. As we embark on the next chapter of our story, we will deliver exceptional experiences that entertain, educate and engage visitors. We will build inspired spaces to bring our community together to celebrate, and we will further energize the brand that has come to define our city. Our vision is to create a world-class, year-round gathering place for the community. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/><br/> The Project Coordinator is an administrative support role within the Business Service team. The successful candidate will implement operational plans, contributing to and supporting both the Business Service team and other teams in the Calgary Stampede as well as internal and external stakeholders. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to: <ul> <li>Conduct administration, accounting, reporting and process maintenance. This will also include risk mitigation factors.</li><li>Develop process maps and training throughout the park.</li><li>Develop plans for implementation of net new or updated processes</li><li>Responsible for research and development around the Calgary Stampede policies.</li><li>Support project teams in organizational project delivery <br/> <strong>Qualifications</strong></li> </ul> The ideal candidate will be proactive, optimistic and have worked in a dynamic environment where they have experience delivering on multiple priorities and will hold the following qualifications: <ul> <li>At least, High School Diploma</li><li>Working Knowledge of Microsoft Project and Visio will be an asset</li><li>Strong organizational skills</li><li>Basic understanding of Business Analyst and Project Management methodologies</li><li>A minimum of two years experience in an administrative support role or related experience <br/> <strong>Benefits</strong></li> </ul> The Calgary Stampede offers a unique and exciting work environment, an excellent total compensation package and the opportunity for advancement and employee training. <br/><br/> <strong>To Apply</strong> <br/><br/> To apply, please submit your resume. <br/><br/> All applicants are thanked in advance and only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Title: Senior Manager, Assurance and Accounting
Job_Description: At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career. <br/><br/> Join the momentum. We are seeking a Senior Manager for our growing Assurance and Accounting team. Delivering quality in everything we do, MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Our Assurance and Accounting team is committed to providing meaningful and reliable financial information that ensures our clients are always well protected and positioned. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Expectations</strong> <ul> <li><div>Lead multiple client facing engagement teams</div> </li><li><div>Plan, scope, and direct complex audit, review, and compliance tax engagements, as well as budgeting, internal controls, financial and accounting transactions</div></li><li><div>Deliver expert industry and technical expertise in audit and assurance through client interactions, reports, technical work, management presentations and the creation of high quality deliverables</div></li><li><div>Accountable for project financials (budgets, WIPS, timely billing, collection, variance recognition)</div></li><li><div>Manage a portfolio of clients while ensuring their needs are met and that relationships and accounts grow and develop</div></li><li><div>Execute transactions through the provision of client services including planning, budgeting, scheduling and coordinating engagements</div></li><li><div>Review, investigate and correct discrepancies and irregularities in financial entries and reports</div> </li><li><div>Contribute to the preparation and delivery of competitive proposals to meet client needs</div></li><li><div>Develop a thorough understanding of MNP’s services, businesses and industry through experiential learning with clients</div></li><li><div>Collaborate with client engagement team prior to commencement of client work to discuss roles and responsibilities, risk areas, materiality and deadlines</div></li><li><div>Think strategically about client needs by understanding their business and key risks</div></li><li><div>Identify ways to maximize the relationship with clients and deliver added value</div></li><li><div>Maintain high quality control by reviewing work done from other team members for accuracy and completeness; provide feedback to team members</div></li><li><div>Monitor project timelines against targets, adjust where necessary; advise clients of project status and seek clarification on discrepancies where applicable</div></li><li><div>Network and take a leadership role in the local professional, business, and community while raising awareness of MNP and looking for new business development opportunities</div></li><li><div>Leverage team appropriately to ensure proper documentation is prepared for the client and procedures relating to the file are followed accordingly</div></li><li><div>Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes</div> </li><li><div>Liaise and correspond professionally with clients, colleagues and the firm leadership team</div></li><li><div>Develop, coach, and train team members towards professional and personal development</div></li><li><div>Conduct formal, written annual performance reviews</div></li><li><div>Promote regular attendance, balanced lifestyle and high standard of team wellness</div></li><li><div>Attend internal MNP courses to further develop accounting and assurance knowledge</div></li> </ul> <strong>Credentials</strong> <ul> <li><div>Completion of a Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation</div></li><li><div>Minimum seven (7) to eight (8) years of relevant work experience in public accounting</div></li><li><div>Extensive knowledge of and experience working with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS)</div></li><li><div>Experience in the design of engagement procedures based on risk and materiality</div></li><li><div>Solid understanding of business, accounting, management and practice development principles</div></li><li><div>Experience working with accounting and tax software such as Caseware, Profile, Quickbooks and Simply Accounting</div></li><li><div>Strong computer literacy including effective working skills of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint</div></li><li><div>Some travel may be required</div></li> </ul> <strong>Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics</strong> <ul> <li><div><strong>Integrity</strong> – professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships</div></li><li><div><strong>Energy</strong> – displays enthusiasm, optimism and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle</div></li><li><div><strong>Diversity</strong> – understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences</div></li><li><div><strong>Communication</strong> – effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others that make an impact and persuade their intended audience(s)</div></li><li><div><strong>Client Service Excellence</strong> – understands the importance of quality client service, proactively identifies client needs and creates strategies to proficiently serve clients</div></li><li><div><strong>Business Development</strong> – looks for and seizes profitable business opportunities while focusing on the ability to gain increased presence in the community</div> </li><li><div><strong>Forward Thinking</strong> - anticipates the implications of situations, takes appropriate action as needed and prepares for possible contingencies</div></li><li><div><strong>Agility with Change</strong> – initiates, sponsors and implements change by taking a facilitative catalyst role</div> </li><li><div><strong>People Management & Leadership</strong> – goal-driven leader who effectively manages self, others and teams to achieve goals</div></li><li><div><strong>Coaching</strong> – takes responsibility for one’s own and team members’ performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals, promptly addresses performance issues, is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making</div></li> </ul> MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events and professional development assistance. <br/><br/> MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world.

Title: Manager - Financial Management
Job_Description: <STRONG>KPMG Professionals Are...</STRONG> <br/><br/> Individuals who take deep personal accountability for their work, have a passion for excellence, driven to achieve their full potential and understand the value of building relationships with clients, future clients, their communities, the global firm and each other. A KPMG professional should have all the following characteristics: <ul> <LI>Strong work ethic</LI><LI>Thrive on challenges</LI><LI>Dedicated to providing outstanding client service.</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>Position Summary</STRONG> <br/><br/> KPMG’s Financial Management Advisory Practice helps organizations maximize efficiencies and drive business value across the enterprise. We do this by working with CFOs and other finance leaders to help them transform their finance function using the core drivers of change: process optimization, target operating model development, and information technology. <br/><br/> We empower finance functions to become more insightful and true business partners. We are trusted advisors in budgeting, and forecasting, close and consolidation, reporting and analytics, and all other areas of finance. <br/><br/> The KPMG Financial Management Advisory Practice is looking for a Manager to build a highly visible presence for Finance Transformation & Optimization services while responding to the changing needs of external clients. This role will be responsible for leveraging existing capabilities within the Management Consulting group and helping drive expansion opportunities. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Role & Responsibilities of the Manager, Finance Transformation</STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Manage Financial Management Advisory projects including large scale Finance transformation, system implementation and process improvement projects.</LI><LI>Support the development of proposals and marketing events.</LI><LI>Provide leadership, direction, and guidance to senior and executive level client stakeholders.</LI><LI>Help organizations to manage their risks and improve their performance.</LI><LI>Identify business development opportunities for Financial Management Advisory projects.</LI><LI>Work with senior KPMG leaders to enhance and integrate service offerings across the Management Consulting and Advisory practices.</LI><LI>Manage, mentor, and train Consultants and Senior Consultants within the Financial Management Advisory Practice.</LI><LI>Develop relationships and partnerships with other KPMG offices.</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>Skills & Qualifications of the Manager, Finance Transformation</STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Bachelors degree in Business, Accounting, Commerce, or related field or equivalent experience</LI><LI>Completion of MBA or Accounting designation (CA, CGA, CMA, CPA)</LI><LI>Seven to ten (7 – 10) years of experience consulting/advisory in various aspects of Financial Management with a focus on large scale Finance transformation projects</LI><LI>Five or more (5+) years of experience providing Financial Management software (ERP or Performance Management) and system implementation consulting services as part of the finance transformation initiative with knowledge of Hyperion, SAP BPC, or Cognos an asset</LI><LI>Experience working in a client facing role across a variety of industries and businesses</LI><LI>Superior communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate with client stakeholders, work closely in a collaborative team environment and lead teams and project deliverables</LI><LI>Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to clearly and articulately identify and define problems and develop creative solutions to address client requirements</LI> </ul>  <strong><DIV>#LI-HH1</DIV></strong>

Title: Assistant Front Office Manager
Job_Description: <DIV> </DIV> <P><EM></EM> </P> <P></P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Assistant Front Office Manager</STRONG></P> <DIV>Providing engaging, sincere, personalized service is one of the ways our Front Office Colleagues are <EM>turning moments into memories for our guests</EM> at Fairmont Hotels & Resorts. Showcase your interpersonal strengths as Assistant Front Office Manager, where you will lead, train and recognize your team in support of exceptional guest service! </DIV> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Hotel Overview:</STRONG> </P> <DIV>Centrally located in downtown Calgary, The Fairmont Palliser is the city’s premier, landmark hotel. With 407 elegantly appointed guest rooms, and the recent completion of an extensive renovation project, The Fairmont Palliser is truly the place to be.</DIV> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Summary of Responsibilities: <BR></STRONG>Reporting to the Front Office Manager, responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:</P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Assist the Front Office Manager in all aspects of the department and ensure service standards are followed</DIV> <LI> <DIV>Provides managerial support for Reception, Royal Service, Fairmont Gold and Guest Services in the daily operational duties for these areas</DIV> <LI> <DIV>Consistently offer professional, friendly and engaging service</DIV> <LI> <DIV>Ensure proper staffing and scheduling of all Front Office colleagues in accordance to productivity guidelines</DIV> <LI> <DIV>Communicate through pre-shift logs, emails and departmental meetings all pertinent information for the respective shift and areas of operation</DIV> <LI> <DIV>Train supervisors and fulfill training role in the absence of the trainer</DIV> <LI> <DIV>Assist guests regarding hotel facilities in an informative and helpful way</DIV> <LI> <DIV>Follow department policies, procedures and service standards</DIV> <LI> <DIV>Follow all safety policies </DIV> <LI> <DIV>Other duties as assigned</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV> </DIV> <P><STRONG>Qualifications:</STRONG></P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Passion for guest service </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Excellent written and verbal communication, interpersonal and leadership skills</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Highly organized, results-oriented with the ability to be flexible and work well under pressure</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Degree or Diploma in Hospitality Management is an asset</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Fluency in English</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Minimum of 1 year previous proven supervisory experience</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Must have the ability to handle a multitude of tasks and Guest requests</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Knowledge of Micros-Fidelio Property Management System an asset</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Should possess or seek certification in basic first aid</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong guest service orientation and training skills background required</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to work independently and prioritize responsibilities</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with a Hotel loyalty program an asset</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Computer proficiency in a Windows environment (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)</DIV></LI></UL> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Visa Requirements:</STRONG> </P> <P> </P> <P>Must be legally eligible to work in Canada. The hotel is unable to assist candidates in obtaining Canadian work authorization. </P> <P> </P> <P>The Fairmont Palliser is committed to an employment equity program that includes special measures to achieve diversity among staff. We therefore encourage applications from qualified Aboriginal Canadians, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities and women.</P> <P> </P> <P> <BR> <BR><STRONG>APPLY TODAY:</STRONG> Whether you’re launching your career or seeking meaningful employment, we invite you to visit http://www.fairmontcareers.com/ to learn more about Fairmont Hotels & Resorts—and the extraordinary opportunities that exist! </P> <P><BR><STRONG>ABOUT FAIRMONT HOTELS & RESORTS</STRONG> <BR>At Fairmont Hotels & Resorts we offer our guests the finest hospitality experience in each of our destinations. And we know that, to offer our guests the best, we first need to offer our employees the best. That’s why you'll find exceptional work opportunities—throughout North America and the Caribbean, Europe and Africa, the Middle East and Asia Pacific—as well as industry-leading training, career development, recognition and rewards. Fairmont Hotels & Resorts is a celebrated collection of hotels that includes landmark locations like London’s The Savoy, New York’s The Plaza, and Shanghai’s Fairmont Peace Hotel. Our teams are guided by values of Respect, Integrity, Teamwork and Empowerment; we employ the highest ethical and quality standards, treating all colleagues with fairness and dignity. A community and environmental leader, Fairmont is also regarded for its responsible tourism practices and award-winning Green Partnership program. An exciting future awaits!</P> <P> </P> <P><BR></P>

Title: Manager, Human Capital Consulting: HR Transformation & Advisory
Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary<br/> <div> Role Description <br/><br/> <strong>Remarkable people. Remarkable work.</strong> <strong>Remarkable career.</strong> <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we recognize that the days of one set path to career success are long over. We offer you the flexibility and choice to customize a work experience that fuels your passions, strengths and ambitions. We also try to ensure there are plenty of occasions to have fun, relax, play, exercise, and build relationships. At Deloitte, we are redefining what it means to be a professional services firm. We are all about ‘remarkable’: <strong>Remarkable people. Remarkable work. Remarkable career.</strong> (Even our workplace is remarkable!) <br/><br/> <strong>The team</strong> <br/><br/> Our HR Transformation (HRT) practice is leading the way when it comes to helping clients make sense of and draw insights from the rapid changes happening in the market. From being digital, to employee experience, to robotic process automation and the future of work: it is no longer enough to be strategic, HR needs to be the agent of change and innovation, win the war for talent and embrace the workforce disruption. Our ability to provide end-to-end services to our clients – from helping them envision where they want to go, to technology selection and solution design, straight through to implementation – makes us a standout in the market place (analysts consistently rate us as the leading firm in Canada and globally!). The roadmap to becoming a high-impact HR organization has never been more complex, and yet, it has never been more exciting to play in this space. <strong>Possibilities are limitless.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>The role</strong> <br/><br/> As a Manager, you will play a key role in how we deliver our services to clients across a breadth of industries. You will have the opportunity to leverage leading research, analytics, technology and industry insights to impact the future of work and provide strategic and business-focused solutions to our clients. You will be part of a team that loves collaborating, taking on challenges and exceeding expectations. No two days are ever the same, but here is a sample of some of the work you might do in this role: build the infrastructure for new HR capabilities like predictive analytics, robotic process automation and employee experience; deliver engagements that advance strategic HR transformation for clients; develop and maintain client relationships and lead projects from planning through execution; consult with clients to increase effectiveness and reduce costs of HR service delivery through improved processes and technologies; participate in the selection, design and implementation of technology-enabled business and HR solutions for clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> Growing your career and future at Deloitte is within your hands and here is how you’ll succeed: <ul> <li><strong>You are genuinely passionate about HR,</strong> keeping up with trends, having your own point of view on what HR will look like in 10 to 15 years, and staying connected with what is happening in the market today, from an employee and an employer perspective.</li><li><strong>You demonstrate social perceptiveness,</strong> by being aware of others’ reactions and understanding why they react as they do by listening well and encouraging an open exchange of information and ideas using the appropriate communication tools.</li><li><strong>You have a design mindset,</strong> delivering a unique and customized customer service solution by using logic, imagination, intuition, and systemic reasoning to explore possibilities of what could be and by as a means of creating the desired outcomes that benefit the end user.</li><li><strong>You lead from the heart and with a purpose.</strong> You understand what drives those around you, you push them to do their best and you provide your teams with challenging and meaningful opportunities.</li><li><strong>You’re able to influence clients, teams and individuals positively</strong>, leading by example and truly understanding their needs<strong>.</strong> You project confidence, optimism, energy and credibility internally and externally.</li> </ul> <strong>The essentials</strong> <ul> <li>You have a bachelor’s degree in a related field. Master’s degree, CHRP and PMP designations are all attributes we are looking for, but if you have not acquired one yet, we are happy to help you to!</li><li>You have a successful career including progressively responsible roles in management and/or consulting.</li><li>You are experienced in leading teams of varying sizes that work with tight deadlines and with a high standard quality of work.</li><li>You have experience in playing a project manager role and being able to deliver the full cycle of project management accountabilities.</li><li>You are able to travel within Canada, US and, on occasion, internationally.</li> </ul> <strong>Join our team, share your strengths and dare to explore what a remarkable future could mean for you at Deloitte</strong><strong>!</strong> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. Title: Human Resources Manager
Job_Description: Sysco is the global leader in selling, marketing and distributing food products, equipment and supplies to restaurants, healthcare and educational facilities, lodging establishments and other customers who prepare meals away from home. We have a forty year history of consistent success and now serve over 400,000 customers, delivering approximately 1.3 billion cases yearly. (NYSE: SYY) <br/><br/> For more information about Sysco Canada please visit www.sysco.ca or follow us @SyscoCanada at facebook.com/SyscoCanada; twitter.com/SyscoCanada or instagram.com/SyscoCanada <br/><br/> For a full list of opportunities, visit www.sysco.ca/careers <br/><br/> <strong><u>Closing Date</u></strong><strong>:</strong> <br/><br/> May 20, 2018 <br/><br/> <strong><u>Role:</u></strong> <br/><br/> The position works in partnership with our Director of HR and HR Advisor to provide effective Human Resources expertise to support the attraction, development, motivation and retention of approximately 300 employees. The position monitors employment and industry legislative/regulatory trends and provides appropriate consultative advice to employees and management to deliver on company objectives. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Role Responsibilities:</u></strong> <ul> <li>Act as a strategic business partner by providing quality advice and guidance to the Management team team in all areas of Human Resources Management.</li><li>Provide timely responses to associate inquiries by providing guidance and recommendations, redirection or escalation as appropriate.</li><li>Partner with key stakeholders to determine workforce needs based on profit planning. Ensure employment equity and diversity within the organization.</li><li>Oversee recruitment, on-boarding, payroll, employee relations, benefit administration, training and performance management.</li><li>Oversee short-term and long-term disability programs, liaising with benefits consultants and suppliers as required.</li><li>Lead employee engagement initiatives.</li><li>Partner with the Environmental Health & Safety Lead to support Safety initiatives, including injury prevention and ability management as required.</li><li>Partner with the Food Safety Lead to support Food Safety initiatives and ensure compliance with related policies and procedures.</li><li>Coordinate effective communication and ensure compliance with Sysco Canada policies, procedures, programs and mandatory training.</li><li>Support the delivery and successful execution of Sysco Canada initiatives.</li><li>Build and maintain strong relationships across all levels of the organization with both internal and external customers.</li><li>Model organizational values and HR competencies.<strong></strong></li> </ul> <strong><u>Qualifications/Skills/Job Requirements:</u></strong><strong></strong> <ul> <li>University Degree or Diploma in Human Resources.</li> <li>CPHR Designation.</li><li>Minimum 5 years progressive HR experience.</li><li>Clear understanding of Alberta Employment law.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects.</li><li>Flexibility to react and adapt quickly in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.</li> <li>Excellent organizational skills and a strong attention to detail.</li> <li>Proficiency with MSOffice Suite, HRIS programs and web-based programs.</li><li>Ability to manage confidential information with a high degree of diplomacy.</li><li>Well-developed communication skills, both verbal and written.</li><li>Solution-based thinking.</li><li>High degree of self-awareness, authenticity and integrity.</li><li>Experience working in a unionized environment would be an asset.</li>  </ul> <strong>Core Qualities for all Associates:</strong> Sysco’s Leadership Framework Basics<br/> <div>Integrity & Accountability <br/><br/> Flexibility & Adaptability <br/><br/> Proactive Learning</div> <br/>To be successful in this position, strength must also be demonstrated in the following HR Competencies:<br/> <div>HR Business Partner <br/><br/> Change Champion <br/><br/> Credible Activist</div>  <div>Talent and Organizational Coach <br/><br/> HR Functional Expert</div>  <br/> <div>Internal candidates apply via the <strong>Career Centre</strong> on your HR Portal / ADP Workforce Now. <br/><br/> External candidates submit cover letter & resume via <strong>www.sysco.ca/careers</strong></div> <br/><strong>Sysco’s Vision</strong> is to be our customers’ most valued and trusted business partner. <br/><br/> We offer our associates the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds expectations. <br/><br/> Sysco is committed to Employment Equity. Accommodations during the recruitment process are available upon request for candidates with disabilities. <br/><br/> <strong>Here’s a sample of the many benefits Sysco associates enjoy:</strong> <br/><br/> Comprehensive Flexible Benefits including Health and Dental, Health Care Spending and Wellness Accounts • Short-Term and Long-Term Disability • Life Insurance • Company Pension Plan • Group RRSP • Employee and Family Assistance • Stock Purchase Plan • Unlimited on-line learning through Sysco Interactive University • Sysco product discounts • Preferred vendor discounts • Free on-site parking • Employee appreciation events • <br/>  (*benefits may vary based on location or bargaining unit)<br/><br/>

Title: ERP Implementation Consultant
Job_Description: <strong>SAP B1 Implementation Consultant - Canada Central region <br/> Full Time / Permanent</strong> <br/> <strong>Location: Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> Vision33 Inc. (www.vision33.com) is the number one global value added reseller (VAR) for SAP Business One. Vision33 helps growing enterprises challenge their business processes and find efficiencies that help them attain goals and achieve their vision for growth and success. As an SAP gold channel partner, Vision33 services over 700 customers across the globe; providing each with the right balance of software, world-class consulting and support services. The companys broad global presence builds upon its local market insight from sales offices and US headquarters in Irvine, California; Canadian headquarters in Vancouver, British Columbia; and UK headquarters in London, England. <br/><br/> Vision33 offers enterprises access to the worlds largest and most experienced team of SAP Business One consultants and is consistently honored for its customer dedication, earning the prestigious 2016 SAP® Pinnacle Award in the customer choice category. <br/><br/> We have an immediate need for a talented <strong>SAP B1 Implementation Consultant</strong> to support our growing customer base. As an SAP Business One Implementation Consultant, you will have the opportunity to work alongside some of the brightest minds in the ERP consulting industry. <br/><br/> <strong><em>You will be responsible for:</em> </strong>   <ul> <li>Providing implementation consultation, project management, and support services during SAP Business One installations, upgrades and customizations</li>  <li>Recognizing and addressing gaps between SAP Business One solutions and the business practices of the clients</li>  <li>Effectively communicating and building consensus with clients</li>  <li>Supporting the preparation of the scope of work by providing task/time details</li>  <li>Designing and conducting master data migration from legacy systems into SAP Business One</li>  <li>Training, coaching, and mentoring Junior Implementation Consultants</li>  <li>Developing and maintaining expert knowledge of SAP Business One</li>  <li>Achievement of individual billable utilization targets</li> </ul>  <strong>Ideal candidates would possess the following qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business (Accounting) and/or Information Systems from a recognized post-secondary institution</li>  <li>Excellent communication skills, both written and oral</li>  <li>Superior people skills; team-oriented, fast learner and very personable</li>  <li>Self-motivated and driven to achieve success within a consulting environment</li>  <li>Experience in an ERP implementation role with SAP Business One preferred, but not required. (Also beneficial would be implementation experience in SME space with other products such as Microsoft Dynamics, Sage, Epicor, and/or Netsuite)</li>  <li>Experience with software implementations, operational accounting, product distribution and fulfillment, warehouse management, manufacturing, or other applicable business processes.</li>  <li>Experience with MSSQL Server query development/tuning, HANA database engine, Crystal Reports development, data migration, or functional software integration design.</li>  <li>Experience managing software implementation projects including balancing budget, timeline, scope, and resource availability.</li> </ul>  We offer a competitive total rewards program including: salary, incentive plans, training and development, paid-vacations, retirement plans, health and wellness program and employee benefits; along with exciting opportunities for global and diverse project opportunities, internal mobility, travel, and so much more. We are looking for motivated individuals to join our energetic team of professionals. If you want to get involved in an environment where you can really make a difference and where you can apply your knowledge to achieve results and work with an award-winning SAP Business Partner; please submit an online application today. <br/>

Title: Senior Manager, Human Capital Consulting - Western Canada
Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Edmonton; Vancouver <br/><br/> The Opportunity <br/><br/> As a member of the Human Capital Consulting team, you will work with a dedicated team of Consultants, Senior Consultants, Senior Managers, and Partners to solve our client's complex people issues. address the key people issues associated with complex strategic change initiatives (e.g., corporate strategy implementations, new operating model implementations, managing the organizational and talent issues associated with mergers and integrations)</li><li>Developing strategies to manage the people considerations associated with large scale technology implementations (e.g., ERP, CRM, practice</li><li>Ability to anticipate the long term impact of all decisions and take a broad approach to problem solving</li><li>Canadian travel required, occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignments</li> </ul> <strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. Title: Engineering Manager
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/><br/><strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Responsible for all engineering activities on the project.</li><li>Maintain highest standard of relationship with the client.</li><li>Implement standards, execution plans, quality plans, procedures and, other methods, as required, to maintain the required levels of technical quality.</li><li>Coordinate engineering discipline input in the preparation of project schedules, identify risks and suggest mitigation recommendations.</li><li>Recognize impact of design not only on technical side, but also cost and schedule. Coordinate with project engineers to consider cost and schedule impacts before proceeding with design changes.</li><li>Ensure a good flow of communication and coordination between the engineering disciplines and other departments on the project.</li><li>Participate and, ensure participation of various engineering discipline leads and specialists and provide valuable input to the design development, design/engineering reviews (i.e. P&IDs, HAZID, HAZOP, Constructability, 3D Model, Value Improvement Practices etc.).</li><li>Coordinate and supervise the activities of the discipline leads by ensuring that they effectively monitor the technical excellence of Engineering work within their disciplines, respect their budgets, maintain schedule and communicate among themselves.</li><li>Ensure discipline leads update their manpower requirements regularly.</li><li>Review engineering documents (i.e. estimates, design criteria, specifications, data sheets, requisitions, drawings, etc.) for completeness and general consistency with project procedures.</li><li>Provide data for monthly progress reports, as related to engineering.</li><li>Ensure timely reply to vendors’ and construction queries to assure them that the intent of the design is implemented.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>University degree in Engineering.</li><li>Registered professional engineer or eligible for registration in the province of Alberta.</li><li>Minimum of 12 years of relevant engineering experience; minimum of 4 years of experience as a Project Engineering Manager.</li><li>Computer Skills - Word, Excel, Outlook, etc</li> </ul>  <strong>Worker Type</strong>Employee<strong>Job Type</strong>Regular<br/><br/>At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. Title: Strategic Sourcing and Category Manager
Job_Description: Description de poste<br/><br/>Every day, our passionate employees connect our customers to the world and everything in it – it’s why we exist at Shaw, and it’s why we strive to be the place where the best people choose to work. Our people reflect the richness of our communities, and our culture is inclusive of each individual’s diverse background and perspective, which makes us a stronger team. <br/><br/> Are you passionate about technology driven innovation? Do you pride yourself on driving change, creating efficiencies while honing your skills as a negotiator and sourcing expert? Do you have experience facilitating cross-functional collaboration with other teams to solve complex problems and present recommendations to senior management? <br/><br/> At Shaw we have an immediate full time opening for a Strategic Sourcing & Category Manager to work within our Strategic Sourcing Team. <br/><br/> This role will be based in Calgary and will report to the Manager, Strategic Sourcing. This role will be responsible for driving the development of Strategic Sourcing & Category Strategies related to our Network and Infrastructure segments. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Identify and organize cross functional team resources responsible for Sourcing Strategies</li> <li>Develop and implement category strategies for network infrastructure, consumer related technologies to meet our current and future business requirements</li> <li>Lead the development and execution of complex negotiation strategies to deliver high value agreements with industry leading suppliers that encompass key program specifications as well as functional and commercial objectives</li> <li>Gather and conduct market research, investigate supplier capabilities and establish sources for new innovations, technologies and markets as business requirements dictate</li> <li>Become a trusted advisor to the business through the analysis of data, sharing of report findings and the delivery of sourcing recommendations</li> <li>Manage supplier contracts, governance and control programs to ensure delivery of expectations and compliance with corporate and regulatory policies</li> <li>Ensure compliance with purchasing policies and procedures, ethical practices and adherence to relevant laws and regulations</li> <li>Lead strategic sourcing initiatives, including RFx processes</li> <li>Develop and track cost savings initiatives</li> <li>Support the continuous improvement of Strategic Sourcing process using lean methodologies</li> <li>Identify metrics, tools, and processes to optimize sourcing activities and efficiencies and work collaboratively with team members to prioritize and drive implementation</li> <li>Total Cost of Ownership modeling and analysis</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience with data center, infrastructure, consumer electronics or network technologies would be considered an asset</li> <li>Understanding of licensing, maintenance and service level agreements</li> <li>Experience with co-development and introduction of new product(s) with suppliers; Understanding of project management and agile development methods would be an asset</li> <li>University or post-secondary degree or equivalent practical experience is required; MBA or post graduate degree in a related field would be an asset</li> <li>7 to 10 plus years of progressive experience in leading large strategic projects, strategic procurement, supply chain management</li> <li>Excellent relationship building, interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills required</li> <li>Strong financial and problem solving ability; proven business acumen</li> <li>Proven ability to perform in a team environment as well manage and lead a cross functional team</li> <li>Excellent knowledge of Strategic Sourcing, Contract and Vendor Management</li> <li>Ability to influence change and work with ambiguity</li> <li>Proven track record of high performance with an ability to execute</li> </ul>  If you want to be part of something bigger—part of a dynamic team of people who are aligned, focused, and passionate about working together to care for our customers, then we look forward to meeting you! Join us. <br/><br/> We thank all interested applicants; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted. This position requires the successful completion of a criminal background check. <br/><br/> Shaw Communications, through its third party vendor, collects and stores information applicable to the candidate profile you create when you submit the information asked for below. The use and disclosure of the collected information is for the sole purpose of job search and placement activities for Shaw Communications. The information is subject to Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act. The information will be retained and when disposed of, it is done so in a secure manner. Your profile will become inactive and moved to the archive if you do not access your profile for a period of 1 year.

Title: Workday Data Conversion Lead, Manager or Senior Consultant
Job_Description: <strong>KPMG Professionals Are...</strong> <br/>  <br/> Individuals who take deep personal accountability for their work, have a passion for excellence, driven to achieve their full potential and understand the value of building relationships with clients, future clients, their communities, the global firm and each other. A KPMG professional should have all the following characteristics:  <ul> <li>Strong work ethic</li><li>Thrive on challenges</li><li>Dedicated to providing outstanding client service.</li> </ul>  <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/>  <br/> KPMG's Management Consulting group is experiencing exceptional growth, especially within IT Advisory. The rapidly expanding IT Advisory team is seeking a Senior Consultant or Manager for its IT Advisory practice in Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, or Montreal office. Specifically, the practice is looking to fill a Workday Data Conversion Lead position. <br/>  <br/> <strong>Role and Responsibilities</strong> <br/>  <br/> Our IT Advisory team advises clients on executive and management issues in IT, to increase the value that IT delivers within their organization. Working with the senior leadership we assist them to define strategy, identify and champion transformation opportunities and assist with key IT decisions. <br/>  <br/> <strong>As a Senior Consultant/Manager you will:</strong>   <ul> <li>Deliver engagements under the direction of Senior Leadership</li><li>Create relationships with clients and staff</li><li>Contribute to business development actives (i.e. proposal development)</li><li>Positively contribute to the IT Advisory and Workday practice</li> </ul>  <strong>A Workday Data Conversion Lead is expected to:</strong>   <ul> <li>Participate in Workday HCM projects involving strategy, implementation support, and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) optimization related to Information Technology (IT) operations, business processes, security, and data integrity for the Workday applications in Workday projects involving strategy, implementation support, and Workday optimization related to information technology operations, business processes, security, and data integrity for the applications</li><li>Review and map Workday business processes</li><li>Execute the day-to-day activities of Workday advisory engagements for a variety of clients including process design, package implementation lifecycle support, and project reviews</li><li>Review business processes and advise clients on system services available within the Workday application</li><li>Identify and communicate findings to senior management and client personnel</li> </ul>  <strong>Skills & Qualifications</strong> <br/>  <br/> Successful candidates will possess the following skills and behaviors:  <ul> <li>A minimum of three years of enterprise resource planning (ERP), HCM or Financial implementation and data conversion experience</li><li>Completion of one full implementation with Workday Data Conversion and Workday certification in HCM or Integration (Please note that any candidate hired by KPMG into this position that doesn't currently have the aforementioned certification will be required to secure one within three months from the commencement of employment)</li><li>Bachelor's degree in an appropriate field from an accredited college/university</li><li>Strong verbal and analytical skills with the ability to write at a publication quality level</li><li>Detailed understanding of ERP System concepts and general module functionality</li><li>Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Canada without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future</li><li>Canadian travel required, with occasional international travel a possibility.</li> </ul>  <strong>Why Choose KPMG?</strong>  Making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. Watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at KPMG. <br/><br/> <strong>Location</strong> Calgary, AB <br/>  <br/> <strong>Job Title</strong> Workday Data Conversion Lead, Manager or Senior Consultant <br/>  <br/> <strong>Our Values, The KPMG Way</strong> <br/>  <br/> We lead by example | We work together | We respect the individual <br/> We seek the facts and provide insight | We are open and honest in our communication <br/> We are committed to our communities | Above all, we act with integrity <br/><br/> KPMG is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. Title: IT Team Lead/Account Manager - Ottawa

A career at HAYS means great people, a great atmosphere, and career advancement opportunities. Our employees thrive with ongoing training and leadership programs for all while working in an engaging and fun environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Commitment to You:</strong>  <ul> <li><strong>Compensation & Benefits</strong>: We offer competitive uncapped commission plans with a base salary + flexible benefit plans, RRSP matching, internal incentives, semi-annual trips, 3 weeks’ vacation and so much more!</li></ul>   <ul> <li><strong>Industry Leading Training</strong>: You will receive cutting-edge sales training throughout all levels of your career at Hays.
