Title: Senior Manager or Senior Lead, SAP HR
Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Vancouver<br/> <div> <strong>Job description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Technology</strong> <br/><br/> Our technologists help clients implement innovative technologies to drive their business’ forward. Our consultants link technology insights to clients’ organizational goals to fit within their full operating models, accounting for their people, intellectual capital, and processes. <br/><br/> <strong>SAP</strong> <br/><br/> The full potential of SAP solutions isn't just about technology, it's also about driving sustainable business value. At Deloitte, our SAP specialists deliver the technology and services to help our clients meet business performance goals and improve processes. As an SAP Global Partner we provide a broad range of consulting services, from HR, CRM and supply chain to finance transformation. <br/><br/> <strong>Senior Manager or Senior Lead, SAP HR</strong> <br/><br/> As a Senior Manager/ Senior Lead focused on SAP, you will: <ul> <li>Take a lead role in delivering and managing consulting services to high growth organizations with a diverse team of Consultants</li><li>Create long term relationships at a senior client level</li><li>Execute a client service plan on complex engagements working closely with Partners</li><li>Identify and lead business development opportunities</li><li>Achieve expertise in a specialization and a strong reputation as a business advisor</li><li>Actively mentor and coach team members to their highest potential</li><li>Create a learning environment through leadership</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>10+ years of overall combined relevant SAP experience in HR</li><li>A strong Market Development experience</li><li>Experience building / leading a consulting practice</li><li>A strong background in SAP Project Management and/or Program Management</li><li>Completed undergraduate degree with outstanding academic credentials</li><li>Strong commitment to professional client service excellence</li><li>Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams</li><li>Superior verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Ability to develop and present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions</li><li>Proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving</li><li>Strong commitment to building a permanent career with Deloitte in the SAP consulting space</li><li>Canadian travel required, occasional international travel</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 31761</div>

Title: Hotel General Manager, Mont-Tremblant
Job_Description: MasterBUILT® Hotels develops, builds, manages and invests in best-in-class, select service hotels across Canada. MasterBUILT lives and breathes hospitality, developing more ground up hotels than other company in North America. As a two-time winner of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, MasterBUILT believes in investing in the development of talented people with a passion for delivering exceptional results and a desire to learn and grow. <br/><br/> Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham is an all new construction, limited service hotel brand targeting the midscale segment of the market. Part of the Wyndham Hotel Group family of brands, Microtel has won the JD Power & Associates award for top guest satisfaction in its segment 12 of the past 13 years – an unprecedented achievement in any industry – and has consistently been rated #1 in its segment for RevPAR market penetration in the U.S. (based on STR data). <br/><br/> Within Canada, Microtel is the fastest growing new construction brand in the country with over 40 new hotels scheduled to open by 2025. Microtel’s rapid growth is backed by the strength of MasterBUILT® Hotels’ commitment to develop at least 75 Microtel hotels by 2036, making it one of the most dynamic new brands to ever enter the Canadian marketplace. <br/><br/> <strong>NEW OPPORTUNITY:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>GENERAL MANAGER</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Microtel Inn & Suites Mont-Tremblant, QC</strong> <br/><br/> The General Manager will meet and exceed the expectations of the owners, their customers, as well as their employees by achieving profitability and customer service goals all while providing their employees an exceptional place to work. The hotel will be entrenched in, and engaged with, the community in which it operates and the General Manager will succeed by demonstrating the know-how to deliver on the vision, and uphold the culture of a phenomenal hotel chain. <br/><br/> <strong>Experience Required</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum of 5 years’ working experience in the hotel industry, demonstrating progression with each career move</li><li>3 years’ experience in a leadership capacity</li><li>Previous experience with budgeting and forecasting</li> </ul> <strong>Mission Critical Competencies</strong> <ul> <li>Ability to demonstrate being both a leader and team player</li><li>Superior written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills</li><li>Ability to set and monitor goals and provide status updates as required</li><li>Ability to set priorities for self and others in the hotel</li><li>Project planning capabilities coupled with time management and organization techniques</li><li>A fun, positive attitude with a sense of humour</li><li>Bilingual in both English and French</li> </ul> <strong>Desired Education</strong> <ul> <li>A High School Diploma or GED required</li><li>A Diploma in Hospitality Management considered an asset</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Establishing and communicating objectives that support and align with corporate’s vision by developing and implementing strategies to do so</li><li>Monitoring operational efficiencies to ensure profitability while meeting operating and capital budgets</li><li>Implementing marketing initiatives that align with hotel branding</li><li>Maximizing revenue per available room through active yield management</li><li>Providing staff with skills training to provide value-added service to customers and monitor success of training</li><li>Monitoring customer satisfaction ratings and developing plans to maintain or increase customer satisfaction as required</li><li>Attracting, hiring and retaining qualified employees who deliver on key objectives</li><li>Providing leadership and guidance to maintain high morale throughout the hotels</li><li>Communicating daily and weekly with the Regional Director of Operations, Manager, Hospitality Operations and Director, Sales and Marketing</li><li>Ensuring all health and safety standards are exceeded</li><li>Maintaining all month end documentation and providing the accounting department accurate reports</li><li>Represent the hotel and its owners in the local community and industry</li><li>Working alongside the Director of operations to determine pre-opening budgets and business plans</li><li>Coordinating all relevant information pertaining to the opening of new hotels such as property management and room configurations</li><li>Assisting in the coordination of delivery and install of furniture, fixtures and equipment</li> </ul> <strong>MasterBUILT Offers:</strong> <ul> <li>A relocation assistance package available for eligible candidates</li><li>A compensation package that provides incentives and rewards performance</li><li>A flexible benefits package that supports various personal/family situations and work environments</li><li>A rewarding corporate culture that fosters a positive team and family spirit</li><li>A cooperative management team that is strategic and forward thinking</li><li>A fast paced environment with opportunities for advancement</li> </ul> <strong>To Apply:</strong> <br/><br/> Please apply online at https://masterbuiltsuperior.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=46<strong>.</strong> We thank all applicants for their submissions, but only those deemed qualified by our hiring manager will be contacted. No phone calls please. <br/><br/> Please note Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIAs) are not supported for this position. Legal entitlement to work in Canada is required.

Title: Corporate Manager, Safety, Health and Loss Control
Job_Description: Trotter & Morton Ltd. is seeking a Corporate Manager, Safety, Health and Loss Control. Reporting to the President & CEO of the Trotter & Morton Group of Companies, this role develops, directs, and leads Corporate HSE strategy, programs, initiatives, and the overall company direction for the HSE program through collaboration with VPs, GMs, and Division Safety personnel. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate will have the following key responsibilities: <br/><br/> <strong>HSE Strategy/ Oversight</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop and implement safety strategy, ensuring compliance with all federal, provincial, local, Corporate and customer regulations</li>  <li>Promote a “Best-in-Class” culture by raising safety expectations throughout the company and setting standards to maintain and assess a robust, effective HSE Management System</li>  <li>Establish annual HSE organizational goals and objectives with input from Operations Management, HSE Directors, Executive Management, and consultants, as appropriate</li>  <li>Strategically analyse data on injuries/illnesses, program results, audit findings, and other HSE initiatives to determine appropriate direction for continuous improvement</li>  <li>Ensure effective incident investigations and root-cause analyses are conducted throughout the company to identify contributing conditions and implement effective corrective actions and program changes. This would include insurance investigations related to property damage, vehicle, and liability claims</li> </ul> <strong>Leadership</strong>  <ul> <li>Proven ability to build strong and trusted relationships with stakeholders, enabling support and influence for a transformational shift in the approach and integration of safety across the Company</li>  <li>Establish and maintain strong collaborative relationships with senior management, business units, business partners, other safety leads, and key stakeholders to achieve desired outcomes</li>  <li>Develop and lead a team of Safety professionals who manage Trotter & Morton’s Safety programs</li>  <li>Participate in hiring and management of Corporate Safety employees, as well as performance appraisals and discipline</li>  <li>Lead OHS meetings and serve as a principal source of information on OHS issues</li>  <li>Assist Divisions with hiring decisions for HSE personnel, including advisement of credential requirements and candidate evaluation</li>  <li>Champion best practice initiatives and set expectations and timeline for completion</li>  <li>Provide input on Divisional HSE Managers’ career development plans, objectives, and annual performance reviews</li> </ul> <br/><br/> Required Skills   <ul> <li>Canadian Registered Safety Professional (CRSP) designation</li>  <li>Certified Safety Professional (CSP) will be considered a strong asset</li>  <li>Bachelor’s or Associates degree in Occupational Health and Safety or similar field</li>  <li>Additional Health & Safety certifications and education preferred</li> </ul>  <strong>Required Experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Minimum of 10 years of progressive Health & Safety experience, including at least 5 years at a corporate level and at least 5 years in a senior leadership role</li>  <li>Related corporate experience includes OHS management systems, safety auditing, occupational hygiene, contractor management, project management, hazard control, incident management, corporate reporting</li>  <li>Related leadership experience includes managing and supervising Safety professionals</li>  <li>Degree in OHS or related safety organizational or engineering field. Relevant experience may also be considered</li>  <li>Well organized, highly motivated leader able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with excellent written and oral communication skills</li>  <li>Knowledgeable of all Construction Associations in Western Canada</li>  <li>Knowledgeable of all WCB Boards in Western Canada</li>  <li>Knowledgeable of all Provincial OHS Regulations in Western Canada</li>  <li>Experience working in the construction industry which include but not limited to Civil, Industrial, Commercial, and Service is a definite asset</li>  <li>Experience with HSE databases such as ISNetworld,</li>  <li>Experience with HSE Software such as Inform. Industrial Training Services preferred but not mandatory</li>  <li>A Class 5 Driver's Licence (or provincial equivalent) and the use of a personal vehicle for business purposes is required</li> </ul>

Title: Manager FOIP/FOIP Coordinator -AMENDMENT
Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div>Are you interested in protecting privacy and ensuring access to information practices while leading a team of information, access and privacy professionals? The City Clerk’s Office is now seeking a Manager, FOIP/FOIP Coordinator to oversee The City's Corporate FOIP (Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy) program. Your success will be measured by your leadership in the following: <ul> 	<li>Develop directives, procedures, policies, processes and guidelines that ensures The City’s compliance with access and privacy matters.</li> 	<li>Supervise a team of FOIP professionals ensuring the effective operation of the FOIP program including clarifying and advising on access and privacy complaints.</li> Commissioners and other municipalities.</li> 	<li>Lead the FOIP & Information Services team through legislated and corporate program changes to ensure the City FOIP program remains dynamic and effective.</li> 	<li>Participate in Corporate Programs and committees that relate to the oversight of Information Management.</li> 	<li>Champion the release of routine City information through the use of technology.</li></ul></div> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Qualifications</strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>A degree in Arts, Public Administration, Law, Business, Social Sciences or related field.</div> </li>		<li>	<div>A minimum of 8 years senior management experience including work with Alberta’s FOIP Act, or other Access and Privacy Legislation (National/International).</div> </li>		<li>	<div>Knowledge of the concept of Open Government and Open Data is an asset.</div> </li>		<li>	<div>Ability to interact with and make Title: Program Advisor, Team Lead, Undergraduate Science Centre, Faculty of Science
Job_Description: <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> The <strong>Undergraduate Science Centre</strong> in the <strong>Faculty of Science</strong> is currently seeking a Full-time Regular <strong>Program Advisor, Team Lead</strong>. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manger, Undergraduate Science Centre, the Program Advisor, Team Lead supervises the workload of the Program Advising team, provides advising and program management support for a wide range of student cohorts served by the Undergraduate Science Centre including the coordination and administration of the Academic Review process for the Faculty of Science. The Program Advisor, Team Lead provides student affairs expertise related to student admission, registration and progression through degree programs to graduation. This position involves considerable liaison with student advisors from other faculties, departments, Enrolment Services, Admissions and student support units. <br/><br/> Regular hours are Monday to Friday, 8:30-4:30 however occasional overtime may be required. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong> Summary of Key Responsibilities</strong> (job functions include but are not limited to): <ul>  <li> Support the Manager and the Senior Undergraduate Specialist to ensure that program advising needs for the Faculty of Science students are being met</li>  <li> Supervise the workloads of the USC Program Advising team, organizes and prioritize advising tasks, including the scheduling management of phone, emails and appointments</li>  <li> Address performance management concerns for the program advising team and collaborates with the Manager to resolve the identified issues</li>  <li> Provide support on complex advising matters and system troubleshooting</li>  <li> Advise, support, provide outreach and create communication plans for target populations (Indigenous, Pathways to Medicine scholarships, STEPS)</li>  <li> Recommend adjustments to schedules, policies and procedures within the Faculty of Science to support both the advising team and Faculty of Science students</li>  <li> Provide communication to Faculty of Science students and the greater University community related to Program Advising matters</li>  <li> Support all academic related processes of student advising, including coordination of admissions (Change of Program and Diverse Qualifications), graduation list, prerequisite check</li>  <li> Maintain and foster cooperative and trusting relationships with advisees, faculty and campus staff including Admissions and Enrolment Services and other student affairs offices across campus in order to provide seamless and efficient student support processes</li>  <li> Act as a central resource and supports training for departments on student-related academic advising matters. This includes creating and maintaining faculty-wide advising training tools and identifying external training opportunities</li>  <li> Gather statistical information to improve student advising services, including ATP data</li>  <li> Maintain the Undergraduate Science Centre website</li>  <li> Coordinate/manage the training of Program Advising staff (new and continuing training)</li>  <li> Participate in cross-training to assist in other areas when needed and to meet Undergraduate Science Centre priorities</li>  <li> Identify professional development needs and skill priorities for the Advising team; continue own personal development, learning and training; keeps current with post-secondary developments</li>  <li> Ensure the integrity of information provided to students when advising and provide advising with discretion and tact to avoid misunderstandings or difficult encounters</li>  <li> Advise current/prospective students in both a one-on-one and group setting regarding degree requirements and university policies and procedures</li>  <li> Assist students in making informed decisions, setting short and long term goals, and fulfilling the requirements of their degree choice</li>  <li> Process degree audits, credit evaluations and graduation applications using academic software</li>  <li> Proactively monitor students' progression through their degree program to graduation to ensure requirements are met</li>  <li> Provide advice and assistance to students on all aspects of their academic experience, including progression and requirement matters for their chosen degree</li>  <li> Resolve student program conflicts as they arise</li>  <li> Use a thorough knowledge of program degree requirements as detailed in the University of Calgary calendar, to recommend programs of study that will allow students to successfully meet their goals</li>  <li> Adhere to all University policy and regulatory requirements, including FOIP legislation.</li>  </ul> <strong> Qualifications / Requirements:</strong> <ul>  <li> Bachelor Degree and at least five year of student services, student affairs, or program advising experience</li>  <li> Ability to successfully handle a large student workload with a positive student-centric</li>  <li> Outstanding interpersonal communication skills, including written, oral, one-on-one and group</li>  <li> The ability to analyse information quickly, and think creatively to resolve problems or act on or develop opportunities is required</li>  <li> A high attention to detail and proven organizational skills required</li>  <li> Strong critical thinking, judgement and decision making skills</li>  <li> Ability to work under pressure to meet strict and multiple timelines</li>  <li> Effective leader, and the ability to work individually and as a team member</li>  <li> Demonstrated ability to be resourceful, creative, innovative, and flexible</li>  <li> Experience developing and providing presentations for students</li>  <li> Computer skills include: MS Office Suite including Work, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel and Access, Peoplesoft, and Orbis</li>  <li> Thorough knowledge of University policies, procedures and requirements including the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act</li>  </ul> <strong> Application Deadline:</strong>  May 18, 2018 <br/><br/> <em> We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> This position is part of the AUPE bargaining unit, and falls under the <em><strong>Specialist/Advisor Job Family, Phase III</strong></em>. <br/><br/> To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Management and Staff Careers website</strong>. Title: Manager, Accounting - FGL Sports
Job_Description: <div>Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?</div><br/> <div>Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.</div><br/> <div>The Manager, Accounting, Forzani Group (FGL) will be responsible for providing meaningful accounting and analytical support and insight to the senior management team and business partners of the FGL division of Canadian Tire .</div><br/> <div><strong>What you’ll do</strong></div><br/> <div>As a key area of the focus for Canadian Tire Corporation is One Company, One Customer, you will be part of a the larger Retail and Enterprise Accounting team and will play a key role in implementing standardized procedures, centres of excellences and partnering with the business and FP&A to ensure the accounting structure, processes, and any recommendations made complement their needs. You will regularly collaborate and interact with stakeholders from various teams such as FP&A, Merchandising and Operations to drive recommendations related to the FGL business in order to achieve strong financial results.</div><div><strong>Responsibilities</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Accounting for the FGL group of companies on a monthly basis.</li><li>Ensure financial results have integrity and are complete and accurate and in compliance with IFRS</li><li>Provide timely and accurate quarterly reporting to the External Financial Reporting team to support the preparation of the Quarterly and Annual Financial Reports</li><li>Ensure that internal controls are designed appropriately and operate effectively, and that quarterly certification reviews are successfully met</li><li>Support the preparation of the annual budget, monthly/quarterly forecasts, and monitor results versus budget/forecast and last year on a monthly basis</li><li>Provide quarterly and year-end audit support to our external auditors</li><li>Provide recommendations to senior management that will drive key decision making with respect to the business and ensure accounting implications of strategic decisions are known and considered</li><li>Support the creating of a new accounting structure that supports the One Company initiative, while still helping the business achieve strong financial results.</li><li>Manage and develop a team of 7 direct reports</li><li>Create a high performing team culture with a drive for results and foster an environment of ongoing advancement of skills and capabilities on the team</li><li>Work on special projects as assigned</li></ul></div><br/>  <div><strong>Who you are</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>We are looking for high performing individuals who are:</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment</li><li>Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers</li><li>Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives</li><li>Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward</li> </ul></div><br/>  <div>If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be.</div><br/> <div><strong>What you’ve done</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>University degree or College diploma in Accounting/Finance or business related discipline</li><li>Accounting designation (CPA, CA, CMA, CGA) or MBA</li> <li>5 years of progressive experience in Finance, Analytics, or Merchandise Planning roles with an emphasis on decision support</li><li>2 years of experience in a managerial role leading a team</li><li>Superior analytical skills with an understanding of cause and affect financials</li><li>Ability to clearly and confidently communicate written/verbal recommendations and articulate trade-offs</li><li>Admirable time management and self-management skills</li><li>Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Access, VBA, SQL, and PowerPoint</li></ul></div><br/>  <div><strong>Why us</strong></div><br/> <div>Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.</div> <br/> <div>To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.</div>  <br/>is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Title: Area Sales Manager
Job_Description: <u><strong>Job Summary</strong></u> <br/><br/> The Area Sales Manager is responsible for the Sales, Service and Training of Radiodetection Channel partners and stakeholders. They have the strategic responsibility to work with new and existing accounts to plan annual activities, and develop action plans and metrics for ensuring achievement of all performance targets and are the primary interface between the Company and distributors. As such they must constantly assess and communicate market conditions and competitive activity to the Company. Such intelligence is the foundation of effective forecasting and requires sustained effort and attention to detail.<br/> <div><strong>PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES</strong></div>    <ul>  	<li>Sales accountability to achieve growth targets with regards to revenue; market share; unit sales goals; net revenue; and profitability.</li>   <li>Accountability to maintain a productive and effective relationship with channel partners agents and key stakeholders. This includes, but is not limited to; helping channel partners meet growth targets, creation of Distributor sales programs and communication of market intelligence between the Company and the field.</li> <li>Responsibility to coordinate the technical training of Channel Partners; Agents; Contractors and other stakeholders. Training includes Product orientation and Technical Service along with directly delivering training on business processes (e.g. Value Proposition). The ASM, Distribution is responsible for business acumen training to agents.</li> <li>Promote the sale of Radiodetection products to new and existing wholesale distributors located within the sales territory utilizing personal sales calls on distributor principles on a scheduled basis. Distributor principles include top management, sales management, purchasing management, inventory control, sales, warehouse, warranty/claims, accounts payable departments, and other customer functions having any involvement with the sale of Radiodetection products.</li> <li>Identify, aggressively pursue, and close the sale.</li>   <li>Providing regular and accurate forecasts of projected sales based on current order and quotation activity.</li> <li>Preparing detailed reports of weekly activity including call reports and expense reports.</li> <li>Actively engage with new and existing distributors, contractors and end users to promote the sale of Radiodetection products. This activity should include prospecting in a number of formats such as personal calls on contractors and/or end users with and without distributor sales people, at distributor sponsored product shows, meetings, seminars, etc.</li> <li>Ensure that CRM package is fully utilized as a tool for recording customers and tracking quotations/projects for follow-up and forecasting.</li> <li>Participate in activities such as account planning, product presentations, technical presentations, and distributor ride-a-longs relating to the operation of Radiodetection products. Participation to be in conjunction with, but not restricted to, distributor customers.</li>  </ul>  <div><strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES</strong></div>    <ul>  	<li>The ability to demonstrate ‘value add’ to customers through the Radiodetection range of products, technologies and services.</li> <li>Understands product features, functions and benefits delivery.</li> <li>Demonstrates knowledge of technical aspects of product application and operation.</li> <li>Prepared to challenge performance, and critically assess.</li> <li>Strong organizational and communication skills.</li> <li>Proven track record of sales development.</li> <li>Computer literate with experience of Microsoft packages.</li> <li>Strong time management skills-able to prioritize multiple activities at one time.</li> <li>Ability to manage channel conflict and to forge strong, positive business relationships with customer personnel.</li> <li>Demonstrates teamwork abilities and persistence when dealing with customers as well as company departments.</li> <li>Demonstrates ability to negotiate and arrive at creative win/win solutions.</li> <li>Ability to be a self-starter with little supervision.</li> </ul>  <div><strong>EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE</strong></div>    <ul>  	<li>Business or technical degree (or equivalent)</li> <li>Extensive relevant experience in an external sales environment.</li> </ul> Founded in 1970, Radiodetection is headquartered in Bristol, UK, with worldwide sales, service and support achieved through a network of sales channels across the globe. Our product range includes tools for damage prevention to buried services; powerful video systems for pipeline inspection; high-performance dehydrators and cable-test products for telecoms; and our solid-state sensors business. <br/><br/> Radiodetection is part of SPX Corporation. <br/><br/> SPX is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, or any other reason prohibited by applicable law. <br/><br/> Thank you for your interest in our company.<br/><br/><strong>Apply</strong> <br/> Apply Now!

Title: Territory Manager, Acute Care - Distribution
Job_Description: Cardinal Health Canada is currently seeking a Territory Manager who will be responsible for uncovering opportunities and driving sales throughout a specified territory in the Acute Care Hospital market in Southern Alberta. The focus will be strong selling on defined products and focused suppliers. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who thrives on driving sales and cultivating partnerships with new clients. <br/><br/> <strong>ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong> <ul> <li>Implement strategies and tactics to achieve both short and long-term sales objectives, aligned with SAE’s</li><li>Budget, forecast, track, develop and enhance territory profitability.</li><li>Maintain complete product knowledge and serve as an added value to our customer base to distinguish CHC from its competitors.</li><li>Forecast sales opportunities both monthly and quarterly to achieve targets.</li><li>Work in close collaboration with various manufacturers and their reps as required</li><li>Coordinate sales activities with various departments, including Contracts, Operations, Marketing, etc. Work collectively with these departments to drive project and deals through. This may include putting together conference calls, leading all customer related activity, and holding others accountable for deliverables that impact projects for our customers.</li> </ul> <strong>EDUCATION/TRAINING and/or EXPERIENCE:</strong> <ul> <li>Strong Sales background with a track record of closing new business</li><li>A minimum of 5 - 7 years of previous selling, clinical and/or business experience in Canadian healthcare market</li><li>A university degree in a business administration discipline is preferred or equivalent work experience</li><li>Strong interpersonal and communication skills</li><li>Strong analytical skills</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Advanced computer skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)</li><li>Strong project management skills</li><li>Ability to work in a team environment</li> </ul> <strong>Cardinal Health adheres to the principles of employment equity and encourages women, visible minorities, Aboriginal people and persons with disabilities to apply.</strong><br/><br/>Apply

Title: MEP Cost Manager
Job_Description: <strong>Overview of Role:</strong> <br/><br/> We are currently recruiting a MEP Cost Manager to join a client-focused team. This is an exciting opportunity for a high-caliber individual to join and strengthen our office. <br/><br/> The MEP Cost Manager will take the project and pull the necessary components together and establish, in an accurate manner, the anticipated cost of the MEP portions of the project. <br/><br/> This position is responsible for coordinating the mechanical, plumbing, fire protection and electrical aspects of the project with other disciplines to assure complete scope coverage. The ideal candidate should have experience in cost estimating, quantity surveying and/or construction management. <br/><br/> <strong>Essential Functions:</strong>   <ul> <li>Preparation of construction related cost estimates, cost plans, and cost strategies</li> <li>Reviews drawings and specifications to determine scope and quantities to calculate pricing</li> <li>Communicates, solicits and interacts with sub-contractors in various trades to obtain pricing for projects</li> <li>Determines quantities of materials in various trades by using estimating department software.</li> <li>Change order reviews and valuations of work in progress and bid analyses</li> <li>Preparation of studies and plans on value engineering, life cycle costing, and sustainable practices</li> <li>Attends pre-bid meetings and site visits to assess the conditions of the site or existing building, as necessary</li> <li>Solicits and receives MEP bids, reviewing for scopes of work and pricing for completeness.</li> <li>Communicates with bidders for final overview and assures completeness of bid prior to inclusion in an estimate, bid or guaranteed maximum price (GMP)</li> <li>Reviews drawings and specifications for MEP assigned portions of Preconstruction</li> <li>Projects to calculate budgets from schematic through final construction documents as assigned</li> <li>Communicates with team members, bid captains, estimating manager and others as required, convening scopes, pricing, construction details, etc.</li> <li>Prices work as required to budget for MEP trades</li> <li>Provides complete estimates on MEP trades</li> <li>Develops strategies to pursue, estimate and win competitive bids</li> <li>Develops and establishes ability to budget MEP work without 100% of documentation to the point of developing ability to conceptually budget, visualize and plan a project</li> </ul>  The ideal candidate will demonstrate a positive proactive approach to the role, and will be committed to delivering customer service excellence, with good commercial results.   <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Civil, Electrical, or Mechanical Engineering, Construction Management, Quantity Surveying or related field is required</li> <li>Recent experience and specialty in electrical and mechanical cost strategies</li> <li>Cost control in the commercial/institutional/Industrial sector concentrating on vertical construction</li> <li>Experience with conceptual and detailed measurement / pricing</li> <li>Experience in CMGC / GCCM process</li> <li>Experience with estimating software systems, onscreen takeoff software and BIM</li> <li>Professional certifications preferred</li> </ul>  <strong>Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:</strong>   <ul> <li>Indoor office environment. May require work on site location when necessary</li> <li>Equipment used includes: computers and standard office machines</li> <li>Essential physical tasks include: the ability to work on a computer and the ability to answer and speak on a telephone. May require the use of a ladder on occasion</li> </ul>  RLB is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This company does not and will not discriminate in employment and personnel practices based on race, sex, age, handicap, religion, national origin or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Hiring, transferring and promotion practices are performed without regard to the above listed items. <br/>  <br/> Apply for job

Title: Senior Manager, Service Contracts
Job_Description: <strong>Location:</strong><br/><br/>3225 - 12th Street N.E., Calgary, Alberta, T2E 7S9<br/><br/>The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you. <br/><br/> <strong>Why is this role important?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What You’ll Do:</strong> <ul> <li>Responding to emails, messages and phone calls promptly.</li><li>Attend meetings, process invoices, work on assignments and projects as needed.</li><li>Review invoices and SAP Uploads to ensure charges conform to contracts and correct GL accounts are shown.</li><li> Approvals are made in time for period end and assist vendors with missing payments.</li><li>Respond to Store Operations questions regarding Period and Year to Date spend for all categories.</li><li>Ensure that all store conditions are followed, this includes but is not limited to; Night Cleaning, Day Porter Services, Window Cleaning, dusting</li><li>Managing the pest control program, ensuring store conditions (both sanitation and structural) are maintained limiting risk to the business.</li><li>Using reporting and data collected continue to update and challenge stores on their waste diversion responsibilities, company targets and policies.</li><li>Follow all municipal, regional and federal laws relating to waste and how it is managed.</li><li>Provide data and input to the Environmental Affairs team for Region waste tracking</li><li>Monitor industry for new waste diversion opportunities.</li> </ul> <strong>What You’ll Need:</strong> <ul> <li>2-5 years’ of experience.</li><li>Nice to have; Office 360, MS Office tools, Outlook, Skype, Google Chrome, Cisco Jabber, SAP, Ariba, Vendor Portals, ENCORE Online Booking.</li><li>Ability to learn quickly.</li><li>Any waste management experience would be an asset.</li><li>Strong Communication both written and verbal.</li><li>Management of multiple tasks and changing duties.</li><li>Flexibility to travel to different stores, vendors, sessions and trade shows as needed.</li>  </ul> #LI-NK1 <br/><br/> <strong>How You’ll Succeed:</strong> <br/><br/> At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. <br/><br/> If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today. <br/><br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong><br/><br/>Full time<br/><br/><strong><strong>Type of Role:</strong></strong><br/><br/>Regular<br/><br/>Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.<br/><br/>Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.

Title: Operations and HR Manager
Job_Description: Job Description<div>Fast growing software company seeks Operations manager to lead and scale our operations (including human resources). <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  <li> Create a thriving, energetic, organized and efficient work environment for our rapidly growing team</li> <li> Help attract and retain talent as we grow and develop the Userful team</li> <li> Ensure smooth running of the organization and ensure team members all understand their role and company objectives</li> <li> Responsible to overseeing day to day operations as well as strategic initiatives across key areas: HR, Fulfillment, Support, and Internal IT with a team of 10-15 direct reports.</li> <li> Ensure systems are in place to organize and manage hardware stock, shipping and fulfillment through our fulfillment partners. Work to appropriately grow and scale our fulfillment processes and systems to ship and deliver the required hardware and software to Userful partners all over the world.</li> <li> Manage internal IT and CRM infrastructure and associated projects</li> <li> Manage hiring of the right talent to support company’s growth</li> <li> Candidate will ideally have experience overseeing multiple operational areas (e.g., Support, Fulfilment, HR, and Internal IT)</li> <li> The Operations manager will be reporting to Userful CTO.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>  <li> 3 to 5 years managing company’s operations in a software or hardware technology company</li> <li> Strong understanding of software, technology and PC hardware</li> <li> High organizational, prioritization, and multitasking skills</li> <li> Passion for technology; AV industry knowledge or experience an asset</li> <li> Ability to think on your feet quickly and move through tasks efficiently</li> <li> High energy, organized, motivated self-starter</li> <li> Effective team player</li> <li> Passion for, and experience in, developing and managing high functioning teams;</li> <li> A bias toward action / you love to dive in and get stuff done; Ability to successfully manage multiple priorities while maintaining a strong sense of urgency;</li> <li> A passionate coach for your high performing team – an outgoing people person who wants to build and grow a like-minded team, with the ability to consult and provide opinion, facilitate discussion and resolve conflict.</li> <li> Ability to adapt to new environments and changing requirements;</li> <li> Problem solving and strategic thinking with a love of helping people; Outstanding project management skills, and have a track record of achieving the results expected;</li> </ul>  <strong>Compensation:</strong> Salary and health benefit plan. All Userful employees also receive generous stock options program. <br/><br/> <strong>To apply:</strong> <br/><br/> Send a <strong>resume (and optional cover letter)</strong> to: jobs@userful.com (no phone calls please). Be sure to reference "Operations Manager - Calgary" in the subject line. While we sincerely appreciate every application received, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.</div>  <br/>Company Description<div>Userful Corporation is one of the world's leading infrastructure software companies that make it simple and affordable for organizations to drive and centrally manage intelligent displays. Userful supports centrally powered displays from video walls to touch-screens to desktops and beyond with exceptional performance, unique flexibility and the lowest cost on the market. Userful is the trusted provider of over 1 million displays in over 100 countries and works with zero- and thin-client devices from world-class partners such as ViewSonic, Thinglobal, Atrust, Centerm and HP. <br/>  <br/> The Userful platform began as a virtual desktop solution, reducing the cost and simplifying desktop deployments around the world. Delivering cost effective centralized and virtualized desktops however was just the beginning for Userful. Since then, we've developed our software platform to do amazing things for displays of all kinds. Userful also supports high performance video walls, digital signs and locked-down kiosks that are easy to manage and cost effective to deploy. From interactive video walls, to artistic, mosaic-style video walls, or control room video walls, Userful replaces conventional high-end video wall controllers and video wall processors, making it even easier to synchronize and add intelligence to displays.</div>

Title: Brand Manager
Job_Description: The Brand Manager is responsible for the brand strategy as it relates to the overall crop solution campaign, ensuring the annual product-on-ground (POG) budget/s are achieved as well as managing the associated advertising, sales and promotion (ASP) budget. <br/><br/> Formula for Success: You Will… <br/> Lead the development of the brand indication as part of the overall crop solution by working closely with Technical Service, Sales, the Associate Brand Manager (ABM), and Customer Service Team (CST) to implement an effective campaign for growers, retailers, and retail agronomists <br/> Develop annual Canola Strategy, linked to annual overall canola crop solution plan, based on confirmed grower needs/trends utilizing advice, services and products to achieve an annual POG budget while effectively directing an annual associated ASP budget for content creation <br/> Manage profitability of the Canola portfolio through market mix, lifecycle management, competitive insights, and accurate financial planning that drives 10Y planning and resources <br/> Brand champion for assigned focus brand/ ensuring a consistent brand positioning across crops by working with other Crop Managers <br/> Align their brands to the overall crop solution campaign with the overall go-to-market strategy of BASF Canada, be involved with the product launch excellence (PLE) process at submission on assigned brands, and work closely with the Market Manager to set annual financial and accrual budgets as well as long-term forecasts <br/> Participate the coordination, communication and integration of the Canola Crop Solution campaign internally with Sales, CST and Marketing as well as externally with Channel partners as assigned <br/> Work closely with Canola Market Manager and Associate Brand Manager/s to support the annual financial and accrual budget development as well as providing input into long-term forecasting and planning <br/> Provide support to market program development and participate on Head Office account customer strategies. Interaction with regional marketing to generate support and provide project justification as appropriate to meet long range market objectives and support current and future product offers <br/><br/> Qualifications <br/><br/> Ingredients for Success: What We Look for in You… <br/><br/> BSc in Business/Marketing or Agriculture <br/> Minimum 5 years in sales and / or a marketing-support role, preferably within the agricultural industry <br/> Sound understanding of marketing, sales and customer relationship management <br/> An understanding of growers, distributors and agronomy for the crop protection industry <br/> Must possess strong analytical and critical thinking skills as well as a proven record of achieving goals <br/> Strong interpersonal skills including listening, presenting, writing, team work and the ability to lead a team <br/> Proficient with Microsoft Office <br/> Ability to travel across Canada

Title: Team Lead (Packager)
Job_Description: <strong>We are excited to share an exciting announcement: Acrodex Inc. will officially rebrand as PCM Canada, a subsidiary of PCM Inc. Backed by PCMs extensive North American capabilities and resources, we now take an important step forward with plans to grow our reach across Canada, bolster our service catalog, and improve delivery efficiencies. PCM Canada customers stand to benefit from deepened relationships with vendors and from a strategic partnership with sister company, Stratiform.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Working at PCM Canada</strong> <br/><br/> PCM Canada supports clients in reaching their business goals. PCM Canada is an exciting and rewarding place to work for both IT and business professionals. We strive to provide the highest standard of service, while leveraging the latest technology. The deep, long-lasting relationships with our loyal clients are a testament to our award-winning and industry recognized people and processes. <br/><br/> Here at PCM Canada, we've built an environment that is fast-paced and dynamic; constantly evolving to the changing technology industry. Our innovative approach promotes consistent growth and expansion that have created numerous career and advancement opportunities. This is echoed in our all of our internal practices as PCM Canada provides its employees with the latest training, programs and devices needed to complete their jobs to the best of their abilities. <br/><br/> <strong>Kick-start your IT career by joining our PCM family</strong> <br/><br/> PCM Canada has delivered the right technology to clients for over 30 years. Over the decades, PCM Canada has partnered with top technology brands like Apple, HP, Dell, Microsoft and Cisco to offer our customers the best IT solutions available on the market. This success wouldn't be possible without the dedicated, motivated PCMers that make up our growing family. <br/><br/> We offer a full benefits program which includes Life Insurance, Accidental Death and Dismemberment, Short and Long Term Disability, Extended HealthCare (including a Vision Care program), and Dental care. We also follow a comprehensive workplace health and safety program to ensure our employees are given the most comfortable and productive work environment possible. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Company</strong> <br/><br/> PCM Canada, is a full spectrum, enterprise-wide technology solutions provider that has been in the IT business since 1984. We deliver end-to-end IT solutions to clients across Canada, such as application innovations; systems integration services; hardware and software procurement services; and managed services (computer facilities management, application management, support/help desk and life cycle management services, etc.). With 600 IT professionals and support staff, we deliver quality service from our office locations in Edmonton, Calgary, Fort McMurray, Richmond Hill, Markham, Etobicoke, Winnipeg, and Vancouver. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Title: PRT Team Lead/Software Packager</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Business Unit: Program Services</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Reports to (Title): Service Delivery Manager</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Location: Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>General Accountability:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>The Team Lead, Software Packager reports to the Manager, Service Delivery. The Lead is responsible for applying software packaging techniques to application and configuration changes, resulting in efficient, automated, distribution processes that will reliably run in the managed desktop environment. In addition, the team lead will also be involved in day to day packaging duties 50% of the time.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Team Lead</strong> <br/><br/> • Take ownership and responsibility for problem resolution. <br/><br/> • Have the necessary leadership, team building, motivation, and delegation skills to efficiently coordinate the efforts of a team toward accomplishing a common goal. <br/><br/> • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with all levels of individual. <br/><br/> • Ability to meet attendance standards and work the hours necessary to perform the essential functions of the job. <br/><br/> • In Depth knowledge of Windows O/S and COTS Software packages. <br/><br/> • ITIL Service Management. <br/><br/> • Ability to manage multiple priorities. <br/><br/> • Maintains a positive attitude. <br/><br/> • Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize. <br/><br/> • Team player <br/><br/> • Delivers to timescales <br/><br/> • Complete required performance appraisals and disciplinary action <br/><br/> • High degree of accuracy and attention to detail. <br/><br/> • Create documentation including Knowledge Base articles and Technical Alerts. <br/><br/> • Ensure SLAs are achieved and client expectations are met (or exceeded). <br/><br/> • Providing regular (weekly/monthly) management reporting of performance against SLAs and fault trend analysis to senior management. <br/><br/> • Participate & contribute to service improvement plans. <br/><br/> • Build services relationships with clients. <br/><br/> • Develop and manage daily schedules for direct reports. <br/><br/> • Build and maintain effective working relationships with operational colleagues. <br/><br/> • Share knowledge and experiences to assist with the learning of colleagues throughout the department. <br/><br/> Packager: <br/><br/> • Write, modify, integrate and test computer packages for the City to meet standard endpoint specifications under non-privileged login account and/or specialized accounts as required <br/><br/> • Validate software license information <br/><br/> • Support existing packages with appropriate troubleshooting <br/><br/> • Identify and communicate technical problems, processes and solutions <br/><br/> • Perform peer Quality Assurance on all packages and installation documentation <br/><br/> • Prepare reports, manuals and other documentation on the status, operation and maintenance of software; <br/><br/> • Maintain existing packages by making modifications as required; <br/><br/> • Monitoring and supporting software change implementation processes. <br/><br/> • Monitor and support software distribution infrastructure <br/><br/> • Utilize Industry Best practices <br/><br/> • Update ticketing system to maintain appropriate communication <br/><br/> • Follow City processes and procedures for IT service Management <br/><br/> • Other related duties and functions as required <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications (Education/Experience/Skills & Abilities)</strong> <br/><br/> • Degree/Diploma in related field <br/><br/> • Experience with application packaging for Title: Manager, Risk Analytics
Job_Description: <div> <div> Job ID:  <br/>  J1016-0559</div>  <br/><div> Division:  <br/>  NGX</div>  <br/><div> City / Province: <br/><br/> Calgary, Alberta</div>  <br/><div> Job Type:  <br/>  Permanent Full Time</div>  <br/><div> Posted (dd/mm/yyyy):  <br/>  18/10/2016</div>  </div>  <br/><div> The Manager, Risk Analytics is responsible for managing the clearinghouse market and liquidity risks in accordance with NGX’s risk appetite, policies and regulatory requirements through the development and maintenance of risk management systems, processes, and reporting functions. The Manager, Risk Analytics is also responsible for evaluating new product initiatives as well as business development opportunities primarily from a risk management perspective.</div>  <br/><div> Key Accountabilities:   <ul> <li>Responsible for market and liquidity risk management functions:</li> <li>Responsible for identifying and managing NGX clearinghouse market and liquidity risk exposures.</li> <li>Establish procedures for the measurement of risk, implement risk control mechanisms, and provide for the validation of NGX’s risk controls.</li> <li>Provide clearing team members with the information and tools necessary to ensure contracting party exposures are adequately collateralized.</li> <li>Implement processes and allocate resources to ensure that back testing and stress testing functions along with initial margin and margin offset requirements are performed in accordance with regulatory and risk policy requirements.</li> <li>Assess opportunities for improved methods of measuring and managing NGX’s risk exposures.</li>  <strong><li>Regulatory and risk governance requirements:</li>  </strong>  <li>Ensure that NGX meets all market and liquidity regulatory requirements including PFMI, Dodd Frank and CSA standards and rules.</li> <li>Responsibilities include alignment of risk tools, processes and reporting in accordance with regulatory requirements.</li> <li>Responsible for coordination of NGX’s risk management committee functions (internal and board level) ensuring that the committees approvals, reviews, and agendas are in alignment with NGX’s risk policies as well as regulatory requirements.</li> <li>Support NGX’s CRO in the implementation of NGX’s risk policies including determination of key enterprise risks, management of risk control scorecards, and exception reporting.</li>  <strong><li>Provide leadership and team development:</li>  </strong>  <li>Manage risk personnel in a manner that ensures that the risk control mechanisms are properly implemented and maintained.</li> <li>Develop team members through creation and implementation of development plans for key employees, providing cross training opportunities, and exposing personnel to a wide range of work experiences and increasing responsibilities.</li>  <strong><li>New Business Opportunities – Risk Management:</li>  </strong>  <li>Undertake analysis on new products and markets with the aim to support growth opportunities while applying sound risk management practices.</li> <li>Responsible for modeling, measuring and managing the market risk inherent with new business/product lines</li> <li>Support NGX marketing and clearing groups through communication of NGX risk control mechanisms and education of contracting parties and NGX personnel as required.</li> <li>Provide margin clearing function support from time to time as required.</li> <li>Support efforts to implement creative solutions which improve the NGX clearing model, including the provision of advanced risk tools to reduce the occurrence of under or over margining.</li> <li>Provide support and guidance for the implementation of internal and external risk software solutions.</li> <li>Effectively collaborate with staff across a variety of NGX and TMX business units.</li> <li>Maintain proficiency and strong awareness of clearinghouse risk management best practices and, wherever possible, ensure NGX alignment with same.</div></li>  <br/> <br/> </ul>  <strong><div> Must Have Skills:</strong>   <ul> <li>An undergraduate degree in finance, economics or mathematics. A graduate degree would be considered an asset.</li> <li>A professional designation in risk, finance or quantitative analysis.</li> <li>8-12 years of quantitative analysis or risk management experience in the energy (oil, natural gas, power) industry, or at a financial institution.</li> <li>Solid understanding of the clearinghouse and exchange regulatory landscape.</li> <li>Proven team management experience including delegation of responsibilities, development of personnel and ability to motivate performance.</li> <li>Project management experience with a demonstrated ability to lead project execution in cooperation across a variety of disciplines and business units.</li> <li>Strong business communication and presentation skills.</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills; interacting with clients, peers, and other groups within NGX with a high level of professionalism.</li> <li>Strong knowledge of the energy markets, primarily from a credit, risk and clearing perspective.</li> <li>Commitment to TMX Core Values</div></li> <br/><br/> </ul>  <strong><div> Skills:</strong> <br/> <ul> <li>Leadership</li><li>Regulatory Reporting</li><li>Risk</li><li>B.Comm; BA; BSc</li> </ul>  </div>  <br/><div>

Title: Software Developer (Product Owner)
Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting contract opportunity for a Product Owner in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Missions Systems-Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. The Scrum teams operate within a larger Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be a Product Owner for one of the Scrum teams. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <ul> <li>The Product Owner is a content management leader who prioritizes and grooms the backlog and ensures that the team understands what they are working on. The Product Owner’s responsibilities include:</li><li>Working with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) product manager and other stakeholders to understand their needs</li><li>Provides vision and roadmap for what the Product Owner wishes to be built</li><li>Clearly communicates this vision in understandable product backlog items</li><li>Ordering and prioritizing the items in the product backlog to best achieve goals and missions</li><li>Optimizing the value of the work the development team performs</li><li>Ensuring that the product backlog is visible, transparent, clear to all, and shows what the Scrum team will work on next</li><li>Ensuring the development team understands items in the product backlog to the level needed</li><li>The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the product backlog</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Minimum of four years experience in software engineering</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li> <li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li> </ul> Skills & Experience – Nice to have: <ul> <li>Previous experience as a Product Owner or Scrum Master on an Agile team</li><li>Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification</li><li>Previous experience leading teams in an agile environment</li><li>Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0)</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required</li> </ul> Other: <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace.Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Market Manager
Job_Description: The Canola Market Manager is focused on developing mid to long-term portfolio strategies for the Canadian Canola market. These strategies focus on optimizing profitability for BASF, identify growth opportunities and providing customer needs based solutions. <br/><br/> Formula for Success: You Will… <br/> Contribute to the development of a cross portfolio plan related to licensing negotiations and supply agreements for Canada, as well as the life cycle management responsibility (long range plan and post patent strategies) for Canola, and the Indications (H, F, I, ST) within the crop <br/> Provide input and leadership for your Market on commercial issues such as market letters, incentive programming and overall market strategies <br/> Coordinate of Canola crop plans and mentoring of the Canola Crop Managers <br/> Lead the Canola crop team to develop an annual crop solution plan based on confirmed grower needs/trends utilizing advice, services and products to achieve an annual POG budget while effectively directing an annual associated ASP budget for content creation <br/> Lead competitive insights related to Canola and execute together with Technical Services Team on competitive positioning. Develop Canola Strategy Plan that drives 10Y planning and resources, link to and supervise Canola Crop/Indication Plans <br/> Manage profitability of the Canadian Canola portfolio through market mix, lifecycle management and accurate financial planning <br/> Represent Canada on Global/Regional PLE (Operational Readiness and/or Business Core) Teams to provide leadership and direction for Canola to Field Biology, Regulatory, Operations, Finance and BASF Management up to 3y prior to launch <br/> Champion the Canadian Canola crop team to provide leadership and direction to Field Biology, Regulatory, Operations, Finance and BASF Management as it pertains to optimizing market opportunities for current and future portfolio <br/> Provide leadership and management to Canola Crop Managers and Canola Associate Crop Managers <br/> Provide support to market program development and participate on Head Office account customer strategies <br/> Gain competitive insights and incorporate that information to help shape current and future strategy <br/> Interact with regional marketing to generate support and provide project justification as appropriate to meet long range market objectives and support current and future product offers <br/> Coordinate and manage relationships with strategic National organizations and associations essential to achieving Canola objectives <br/><br/> Qualifications <br/><br/> Ingredients for Success: What We Look for in You… <br/><br/> BSc Degree is required. Master’s degree in business is preferred <br/> Minimum 8 years in a related role <br/> Minimum 8 years in a brand or crop equivalent management responsibility, preferably within the agricultural industry <br/> High level of technical, financial, and marketing comprehension for assigned indications and portfolio, competitive products, and overall assigned market <br/> Must have demonstrated initiative and ability to reach set objectives in past job roles <br/> Must possess strong analytical skills, communicate effectively in both written and oral forms, excellent strategic and critical thinking <br/> Proven management and leadership skills <br/> Sound understanding of marketing, sales and accounting principles <br/> Understanding of general agronomy, growers and distributors for the crop protection industry

and</li><li>Mobility: has a vehicle and valid drivers license, is required.</li>  </ul> Top Reasons to Work for Robert Half: <ul> <li><strong>EXCITING CAREER OPPORTUNITIES WITH THE INDUSTRY LEADER</strong>Our more than 65-year history of success and strong client relationships provide a level of stability few companies can match.</li> <li><strong>PERFORMANCE = REWARD</strong>  We offer exceptional earning potential and a competitive benefits package, including a base salary and monthly performance-based bonuses, paid time off as well as group health, life and disability insurance, and a 401(k) or deferred compensation plan. ·</li><li><strong>UPWARD MOBILITY</strong>  With more than 330 locations worldwide, we provide excellent career advancement potential, both locally and beyond.</li> <li><strong>TOOLS FOR SUCCESS</strong> We provide world-class training, client relationship management tools and advanced technology to help you succeed.</li> <li><strong>RESPECTED WORLDWIDE</strong> Robert Half once again was named first in our industry on Fortune® magazines list of World's Most Admired Companies. (March 1, 2017)</li> </ul> You may submit your application materials online or call 1.888.400.7474 for additional ways to apply.<br/><br/>Robert Half International Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
