Title: Inventory Manager / Administrator
Job_Description: Globally, Wolseley is the world’s largest trade distributor of plumbing and heating products and a leading supplier of building materials. In Canada we are the country’s largest national trade distributor of plumbing, hydronic, HVAC/R and PVF products and solutions. <br/><br/> Our customers include professional contractors, retailers and industrial users. We have a network of over 220 branches coast-to-coast, over 2,600 employees and a national team of sales and service specialists. We are known for our knowledge, dependability and expertise which our customers have come to rely on for their ever-changing needs. Our continued growth as an industry leader depends on hiring the best talent and Wolseley Canada is committed to supporting the successes and development of our employees. <br/><br/> <strong>We are an employer of choice through our:</strong> <ul> <li>Career development and training opportunities</li><li>Sustainable profitability and long-term growth strategy</li><li>Commitment to excellence in serving all customers</li><li>Company values – We act with integrity, drive for results and value our people</li><li>Culture that challenges the status quo, seeks innovation and new opportunities</li><li>Competitive benefits and discounts on top brands of plumbing and HVAC/R products</li><li>Recognition of the importance of sustainable living; as such we are committed to supporting sustainable products for the pres­ervation of our natural resources</li><li>National sponsorship of Special Olympics Canada</li><li>Proud support of Habitat for Humanity</li> </ul> <strong>Inventory Manager/Administrator - Calgary Fire Protection</strong> <ul> <li>Attending to Transfer Error Notifications; investigating, correcting, reconciling, and reporting errors</li><li>Maintaining product locations</li><li>Purchasing of new product</li><li>Order entering in system</li><li>Data entry for new product and product line</li><li>Preparing of small quotes as needed for Inside and Outside Sales teams</li><li>Overseeing warehouse inventory is organized and housed in an orderly manner</li><li>Maintain effective levels of product inventory for all locations</li><li>Answering incoming calls as required</li><li>Processing defective and damaged merchandise</li><li>Reviewing variance reports and make adjustments were necessary</li> <li>Oversee and audit the Cycle Count process in all locations</li><li>Coordinate and oversee the Physical Inventory count in all locations</li><li>Help location lower their amount of surplus product through direct vendor negotiations, special sales etc</li><li>Special projects as required</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>Basic computer skills. Knowledge of the AS400 system is an asset</li><li>Experience working and communicating with vendors</li><li>Distribution background in similar business is an asset</li><li>Knowledge and experience with Fire Protection products in a warehouse environment is an asset</li><li>Customer Service experience is required</li><li>Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Word</li><li>Dependable and reliable</li><li>Ability to take ownership and initiative.</li><li>Excellent problem solving, interpersonal and communications skills</li><li>High level of commitment to exceptional customer service</li><li>Requires a self-motivated team player capable of managing multiple priorities in a rapidly changing environment.</li><li>Able to lift a minimum of fifty (50lbs) pounds</li> </ul>

Title: General Manager Water -Infrastructure
Job_Description: Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, youll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. Youll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. <br/><br/> We rank among Canadas largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canadas 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If youre eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. <br/><br/> As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). <br/><br/> The successful applicant will be a key player in Grahams Senior Infrastructure Water Division. The person should be comfortable with large infrastructure projects 500 Million plus including water and waste water, transportation, renewable energy and municipal. The person should have significant experience working for a major contractor. This role is responsible for achieving the expected business plan and financial results for the division and business unit (market share, profitability, client and employee development, quality, etc.) <br/><br/> As General Manager, Water at Graham you will:· Provide overall direction, leadership and management of the operations for the Infrastructure water sector, implementing plans and policies to achieve overall corporate objectives <br/><br/> · Provide overall operational and financial direction and guidance for the sector, and supports Grahams regional infrastructure business <br/><br/> · Contributes to the Companys overall strategic planning and management <br/><br/> · Implements the corporate strategic plan <br/><br/> · Recommends plans and budgets to management <br/><br/> · Oversees the execution of the business and financial plans <br/><br/> · Builds and manages team for sector <br/><br/> · Lead in development, review, and approval of divisional marketing and business development programs <br/><br/> · Maintain an effective and continuous Business Development program that contributes to Company growth objectives <br/><br/> · Contribute positively to the Companys profile in the business community through active participation in business/trade associations and the community at large <br/><br/> Qualifications/Experience:· 10+ years of progressive experience in a Senior Manager role, responsible for large water/waste water projects at least 500 million dollars in value <br/><br/> · Must have experience working in a medium to large General Contractor environment <br/><br/> · Successful completion of a Civil Engineering degree. Completion of a MBA would be an asset <br/><br/> · Experience leading and executing water, waste water, renewable energy and transportation projects <br/><br/> · A solid track record in managing large infrastructure water projects <br/><br/> · Experience in leading and growing an infrastructure organization with a focus on water/waste water projects <br/><br/> · Excellent communication skills, the ability to build respect at the job level, possess executive presence with strong relationship building and business development skills <br/><br/> · The ability to build a talent base to allow for and sustain future growth. A proven track record of previous succession planning skills <br/><br/> · Strong management skills, with an in-depth knowledge of restructuring and change management <br/><br/> · Advanced understanding of large project operational and financial risk management practices <br/><br/> · Strong leadership ability with highest ethical standards <br/><br/> · Microsoft Office experience (Project, Word, Excel) <br/><br/> <strong>Work Location:</strong> <br/><br/> This position will be located in our Calgary Infrastructure office <br/> 10909 - 27th Street S.E. Calgary, AB, T2Z 3V9 <br/><br/> Compensation and Benefits:· Must have legal authorization to work in Canada for anyone other than the current employer <br/><br/> · This is a full-time, permanent role <br/><br/> · Competitive salary ($210,000.00 to $250,000.00) with a potential of an annual bonus, and potential of annual merit increase <br/><br/> · Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan <br/><br/> · Annual paid vacation <br/><br/> · Possibility of relocation assistance <br/><br/> · Possibility of company truck or vehicle allowance provided <br/><br/> · Ownership and long term equity opportunities <br/><br/> What we can offer you:· Strong commitment to safety in the workplace <br/><br/> · Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector <br/><br/> · Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America <br/><br/> Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. <br/><br/> We're Building careers, not filling jobs. <br/><br/> View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/. <br/> Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. <br/> Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you. <br/><br/> Graham Management Services LP <br/> 10840 27th Street SE <br/> Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 <br/> Fax: 403.570.5130

Title: Software Engineer (Product Owner), Senior - EvO (P4)
Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting opportunity for a Product Owner in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> Our Calgary team is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. Software will be developed for Windows 10 laptops and for General Dynamics developed hardware products running embedded Linux. The project includes all phases including system design, software and hardware design, system integration, and system validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area. <br/><br/> The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. The Scrum teams operate within a larger Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be a Product Owner for one of the Scrum teams. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <br/><br/> The Product Owner is a content management leader who prioritizes and grooms the Product Backlog and ensures that the team understands what they are working on. The Product Owner’s responsibilities include: <ul> <li>Working with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) Product Manager and other stakeholders to understand their needs</li><li>Having a vision and roadmap for what the Product Owner wishes to be built</li><li>Clearly expressing this vision in understandable Product Backlog items</li><li>Ordering and prioritizing the items in the Product Backlog to best achieve goals and missions</li><li>Optimizing the value of the work the Development Team performs</li><li>Ensuring that the Product Backlog is visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the Scrum team will work on next</li><li>Ensuring the Development Team understands items in the Product Backlog to the level needed</li><li>The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the Product Backlog</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Minimum of four years experience in software engineering</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li> </ul> Skills & Experience – Nice to Have: <ul> <li>Previous experience as a Product Owner or Scrum Master on an Agile team</li><li>Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification</li><li>Previous experience leading teams in an agile environment</li><li>Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0)</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Project Coordinator, Building Science & Sustainability
Job_Description: <strong>Project Coordinator</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Building Science and Sustainability</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Calgary, Alberta</strong><br/>  <div>Pinchin’s Calgary office is currently recruiting for a full-time Project Coordinator within the Building Science and Sustainability (BSS) group.</div> <br/> <div>Our Building Science Group provides integrated solutions to residential, institutional, industrial and commercial clients who require reliable and cost effective systems in both new and retrofit facilities. The combined skills of our engineers, architects, technicians and support personnel with their diverse backgrounds in design, project management, and construction provide clients with a team recognized as leaders in the field.</div><br/> <div>The technical portion of the job, for the most part, involves coordinating projects, conducting property condition assessments and investigations of building components, and preparing technical proposals and construction reports. Good writing skills will be required to put your findings and recommendations into reports that will be delivered to clients.</div><div>There is another side to the position which will allow you to build on business related skills: participating in initiatives identified by the Marketing department, liaising with clients and contractors; developing business development skills to continue existing client relationships and build new ones. We’ll teach the successful candidate how to cross-sell our services and provide mentorship to assist in the accomplishment of personal goals and development.</div><br/> <div>We would like to see resumes from individuals with a degree in Civil Engineering, Building Engineering, Architecture or a diploma in Architectural/Civil Technology and 2-5 years of experience in engineering or architecture related to building assessments.</div><br/>  <div><strong>We will also look for:</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Experience conducting property condition assessments in accordance with the ASTM Standard E 2018-01 "Standard Guide for Property Condition Assessments"</li> <li>Technical knowledge of building science, building envelope design, and building enclosure construction principles</li> <li>Excellent communication and presentation skills</li> <li>Proficiency with Microsoft Office Products (Word, Excel, Outlook)</li> <li>Experience with Architectural AutoCAD</li> <li>The ability to thrive in a team, working with other successful, energetic people</li> </ul> </div> <br/> <div>In exchange for your hard work and dedication, we offer a competitive salary and benefits package and a fun, relaxed company culture. We also offer annual profit sharing, RRSP matching, and a fitness reimbursement program. Take a look at what our current employees have to say; our Glassdoor profile can be found at http://bit.ly/2mVKycE.</div> <br/> <div>We thank all applicants for their interest in Pinchin, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.</div>

Title: Assistant Store Manager -Williams-Sonoma
Job_Description: <div>Requisition Number: WS-12920<br/>Area of Interest: Retail<br/>Organization: Retail<br/>Brand/Division: Williams-Sonoma Canada<br/>Position Type: Full-time<br/><br/>JOB DESCRIPTION<br/><br/>Discover your purpose...<br/><br/>Support management team in achieving goals by providing world-class service. Serve as a role model for building relationships with customers. Maintain presence through store supervision to ensure appropriate staff coverage in all areas of the store. Perform operational functions to ensure the store meets Company guidelines. Implement visual changes and maintain store standards.<br/><br/>Who we are...<br/><br/>Our mission is to enhance the quality of our customers&apos; lives at home. We put the customer at the center of everything we do, every day. Our corporate values that guide our actions and decisions are our People First culture, customers, quality, shareholders, integrity, and corporate responsibility.<br/><br/>Who you are...<br/><br/>· Passionate about aligning yourself with business needs<br/><br/>· Loves to coach, mentor & help grow your team in order to meet & exceed sales goals<br/><br/>· Results-oriented leader, who has an excellent ability to motivate & influence others through actions & examples<br/><br/>· Thrive in an entrepreneurial environment & are consistently looking for ways to think outside-the-box<br/><br/>· Proven success achieving results both independently & through others by fostering a spirit of teamwork<br/><br/>· Risk-taker who is not afraid to go above & beyond to exceed a customers&apos; expectations in order to close a sale<br/><br/>· Agile leader who loves to prioritize, plan & adjust their schedule to ensure business goals are achieved<br/><br/>· Loves to contribute in management & store meetings, offering suggestions for associate development, sales opportunities & organizational improvements<br/><br/>At Williams Sonoma you will....<br/><br/>· Provide exceptional customer service in the store to achieve World Class Service standards.<br/><br/>· Serve as a role model for sales associates in sales generation and customer service by making the customer experience the priority.<br/><br/>· Reinforce customer service principles by coaching staff on their successes and challenges.<br/><br/>· Utilize GUEST and training resources to educate team on product, improve selling skills, and achieve business goals.<br/><br/>· Contribute in management and store meetings, offering suggestions for associate development, sales opportunities, and organizational improvements.<br/><br/>· Effectively perform operations functions: opens and closes the store, register, and back office management procedures.<br/><br/>· Maintain visual standards, including merchandise presentation, signage, lighting, and general maintenance.<br/><br/>· Monitor Inventory levels and communicate discrepancies to Associate or General Manager.<br/><br/>· Assume additional management responsibilities in the absence of Associate or General Manager.<br/><br/>·Perform projects and assignments as directed by the Associate or General Manager.<br/><br/>· Comply with all Company policies and procedures.<br/><br/>· Maintain an environment where all associates are treated fairly and with dignity and respect, in accordance with our People First Philosophy.<br/><br/>REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS<br/><br/>What we&apos;re looking for...<br/><br/>· College degree or equivalent job experience preferred.<br/><br/>· 1-3 years retail sales experience with management experience preferred<br/><br/>· 1-2 years experience in home related design or visual merchandising preferred. Specialty retail preferred<br/><br/>· Effective communication, organization and leadership skills.<br/><br/>· Proven ability to motivate and influence others through personal actions and examples.<br/><br/>· Ability to be mobile on the sales floor for extended periods of time.<br/><br/>· Availability to work a minimum of five shifts per week, minimum of three Saturdays per month and two Sundays per month, annual inventory and entire holiday season (November and December).<br/><br/>· Ability to lift and mobilize medium to large items, up to 75 lbs., while utilizing appropriate equipment and safety technique.<br/><br/>· Full time associates are expected to have open availability to meet the needs of the business<br/><br/>· Employment/promotion to this role will be contingent on successful completion of a background check.<br/><br/>Williams-Sonoma Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.<br/><br/>This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship or relocation<br/><br/>Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.<br/><br/>Williams-Sonoma, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, or other applicable state or local laws and ordinances.</div>

Title: Program Manager - Standards Development, Petroleum & Natural Gas
Job_Description: <div> <div> Program Manager - Standards Development, Petroleum & Natural Gas <br/> 	<div> <div>To display this page you need a browser with JavaScript support.<br/> <div> <div> Job ID: <br/>  J0418-1125</div><br/>  <div> Job Title:  <br/>  Program Manager - Standards Development, Petroleum & Natural Gas</div><br/>  <div> Job Type: <br/>  Permanent Full Time</div><br/>  <div> Number Of Positions: <br/>  1</div><br/>  <div> <div> Job Summary:<br/><br/>CSA Group has an opportunity for a Program Manager, Standards in the Petroleum & Natural Gas sector. This role is responsible for providing strategic and execution leadership in the development of standards-based solutions for the Oil and Gas program; addressing the needs of industry, government and the public, primarily through the management of a team of Project Managers. <br/><br/> A leader, motivator, and builder, you thrive on developing and executing plans and strategies for expanding CSA’s presence in safety standards. An outstanding relationship builder, you have a track record of developing and maintaining strategic relationships with senior leaders within industry, government and academia. <br/><br/> Facilitative and customer-driven, you have a knack for developing the solutions that pragmatically address CSA clients’ needs. You also understand the importance of effective people and process management, utilizing CSA’s recently introduced metrics to augment your team’s decision-making. <br/><br/> You have proven, well-developed decision-making and communication skills, along with exceptional organizational and people development abilities. You show initiative, ensuring that all financial targets are met (revenue, cost and margin), as well as being someone who is motivated, resilient and flexible. Detail and process orientation is important, as is the ability to work well with people at all levels and with divergent interests.</div><br/>  <div> Responsibility:<br/><br/>• Hires, continually assesses, trains and develops Project Managers, to ensure program objectives are achieved.   <ul> <li>Meets regularly with staff to ensure standards projects are achieving their objectives (e.g. timelines), within prescribed budgets, planning and executing corrective actions as required.</li> <li>Develops annual business plan for the program, including the execution plan and budget.</li> <li>Works with the Director, Manager-Standards and Product Manager, to drive business development opportunities within the scope of the program, including advisory services, to ensure continual growth of the full portfolio of products and services, interfacing with other groups as required (e.g. Learning Services, Sales & Marketing, CSA International).</li> <li>Interfaces with external parties to advance the work of the program, facilitates knowledge transfer, and manages program specific stakeholder issues. This includes working with organizations such as ISO, NGOs, industry associations, strategic partners, government agencies, etc.</li> <li>Committee management, as applicable (e.g., Strategic Steering Committees), including establishing the scope of work to be completed, preparation of meeting agendas/minutes/documents, managing required resources, maintaining current and balanced membership, and providing ongoing project management and strategic leadership in conjunction with the Chair and Vice-Chair.</li> <li>Manages key program funding contracts, as applicable, and relationships with key funders and related stakeholders.</li> <li>Provides support to Standards Manager in development and sustaining of Communities of Interest (COI) for their program area; including developing social media strategy, membership models, participation, funding, and communication with members.</li> <li>Responsible to continuously improve Customer Loyalty and employee engagement in the program area.</li>  <strong><li>Decisions making:</li>  </strong>  <li>Overall project plans submitted by Project Managers, including timelines and budgets.</li> <li>Assignment of responsibility for new projects and product initiatives.</li> <li>Portfolio mix (e.g. standards areas to be withdrawn, new subject areas to be added).</li> <li>Personnel training and development plans.</li> <li>Performance assessment and development planning for personnel.</li> <li>All business travel requests, including attendance of staff at conferences.</li>  <strong><li>Recommendations:</li>  </strong>  <li>Annual strategic and business plans, including budgets, operational execution plans, headcount, etc.</li> <li>Contracting of outside parties (e.g. training organizations, business partners).</li> <li>Disciplinary actions contemplated dealing with committee members, Chairs or Vice-Chairs.</li> <li>Disciplinary actions contemplated dealing with staff.</li>  <strong><li>Additional comments:</li>  </strong>  <li>The role will require a sound understanding of the various processes and procedures of the company, many of which are mandated under the accreditation of CSA Standards by the Standards Council of Canada, which in turn reports to Industry Canada. A key element of the position is to ensure that these processes and procedures are adhered to, and that the timelines of projects are achieved within defined budgets.</li> <li>This requires supporting the activities of Project Managers, and the many members of standards development committees, as well as their Chairs and Vice-Chairs, which can be very demanding, as these people are all volunteers, with no formal reporting relationship to the company. This volunteer membership includes industry executives, academia, and senior government officials. The role requires a capacity to engage and manage a diverse stakeholder community, and an ability to manage conflict. It is the ultimate form of working with, and getting things done through others.</li> <li>The role emphasizes management, leadership and soft skills over technical know-how, and requires the ability to speak on a range of complex subjects as a credible professional, both to internal and external audiences.</div></li>  <br/> <br/> </ul>  <div> Education:<br/><br/>• An undergraduate degree in Engineering, Science or Applied Science.   <ul> <li>A post graduate degree in Management is a definite asset.</div></li>  <br/> <br/> </ul>  <div> Experience:<br/><br/>• Minimum of 5 years’ experience in strategic planning, operational management, and Program or Project management in the Oil & Gas sector, coupled with a solid knowledge of related sector issues and trends.   <ul> <li>Experience with managing people, knowledge of standards development processes and, dealing with teams of high profile experts would also be definite assets.</div></li>  <br/> <br/> </ul>  <div> Skills:<br/><br/>• Knowledge of national and international standards industry.   <ul> <li>Knowledge of the standards industry, government policy, industry landscape, and funding programs/models.</li> <li>Research and analytical skills.</li> <li>High degree of self-motivation.</li> <li>Strong leadership skills.</li> <li>Strong organizational and planning skills.</li> <li>Strong oral and written communication, facilitation and interpersonal skills.</li> <li>Ability to work within a politically sensitive environment.</li> <li>Competency with major Microsoft and Project Management software.</li> <li>Bilingualism would be a definite asset.</div></li>  <br/> <br/> </ul>  <div> Travel:<br/><br/>25% domestic travel is required.</div><br/>  <div><strong>BUILDING A WORLD CLASS TEAM STARTS WITH YOU</strong> <br/><br/> At the heart of CSA Group is a vision: making the world a better, safer, more sustainable place. It’s been part of our mission for nearly one hundred years: from the first engineering standard for railway bridges developed in 1919, to more than 3,500 standards, codes & related products today. <br/><br/> Headquartered in Canada, with a global footprint of more than 30 labs and offices across Europe, Asia and North America, CSA Group tests, inspects and certifies a wide range of products—from every day household items to leading edge technology-to meet exacting requirements for safety, performance and environmental impact. <br/><br/> Our employees take pride in making a difference in people’s lives through the work that we do. We’re looking for people like you to help make it happen.</div>  </div>  </div><br/>  <div> </div></div></div></div></div>

Title: Co-op Student, Plant Engineering – Project Engineering
Job_Description: <p> </p>                          <div> <p>Job Title: <b>Co-op  Student, Plant Engineering – Project Engineering</b></p> </div><div> <p>Location: <b>Lloydminster,  SK (Upgrader)</b></p> </div><div> <p>Start Date: <b>September  4, 2018</b></p> </div><div> <p>Length of Term: <b>8  months</b></p> </div><div> <p>Business Unit: <b>Downstream</b></p> </div><div> <p>Application Deadline: <b>May  20, 2018 or once the position has been filled</b> </p> </div>  <p><b> </b></p>  <p> </p>  <p><u>Key Responsibilities may involve:</u></p>  <p> </p>  <p> ·   Develop a detailed design solution from a front end conceptual study, obtaining project funding and championing projects through to completion while working under the guidance of a senior engineer.</p>  <p> ·   Learn important aspects of project management such as project scheduling, cost estimating, cost control, and risk management.</p>  <p> ·   Provide technical support to the construction group as required and coordinating commissioning of new systems. </p>  <p> ·   Create engineered work packages for projects.</p>  <p> ·   Learn the Upgrader Engineering Work Request and Management of Change processes, Husky Project Development and Execution process, and gaining a basic understanding of the heavy oil upgrading complex.</p>  <p> ·   Locate equipment and verify proposed designs within the facility to guide the engineering design process.</p>   <br> <p>                        </p><p><u>Qualifications:</u></p>  <p> </p>  <p> ·   <b>Must be currently enrolled in a post-secondary Co-op or Internship program</b></p>  <p> ·   Strong academic background in Mechanical Engineering</p>  <p> ·   Previous experience in oil and gas (facility) would be considered an asset</p>  <p> ·   Knowledge of standard engineering design drawings (P&ID’s, Isometric Drawings etc.) would be considered an asset.</p>  <p> ·   Computer skills (MS Office and databases) are essential</p>  <p> ·   Collaboration and Communication would be considered an asset </p>  <p> ·   Must be able to work effectively independently and in team environment </p>  <p> ·   Effective written and oral communication skills</p>  <p> ·   Must be a self-starter who demonstrates effective decision-making skills</p>  <p> </p>  <p> <u>Benefits of a Husky Student Position:</u></p>  <p> ·  Opportunities to:</p>  <p> o  take part in impactful business projects</p>  <p> o  network with experienced professionals</p>  <p> o  engage in a strong student network</p>  <p> o   gain valuable exposure in the Oil and Gas industry</p>  <p> ·   Relevant experience in your field of study</p>  <p> ·   Relocation assistance</p>  <p> ·   Competitive wages</p>  <p> </p>  <p> </p>  <p><u>Submission:</u></p>  <p> </p>  <p>Please submit a resume and transcript. <b>Applications without a recent transcript will not be considered.</b></p>  <p> </p>  <p><u>Safety:</u></p>  <p> </p>  <p>This is a safety sensitive role and as such you will also be required to wear all Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) during required work hours. Furthermore, you will also be required to pass the Husky pre-employment medical and drug/alcohol assessment requirements.</p>  <p> </p>  <p>As this position requires the operation of a motor vehicle, applicants are asked to provide a recent (i.e. issued within the previous 4 weeks) original driver’s abstract, for the preceding 5 year period, if offered the position. A valid Canadian class 5 Drivers License with no restrictions (i.e. non GDL) is a requirement for this role. </p>  <p> </p>  <p><u>Relocation:</u></p>  <p> </p>  <p>Students moving for their work term may be eligible to receive a lump sum payment to assist with relocation expenses.</p>  <p><b>Candidates must have their own means of transportation as there is no public transportation in field locations.</b></p>  <p> </p>  <p><u>Additional Information:</u></p>  <p> </p>  <p><b>New graduates are not eligible for student opportunities.</b></p>  <p> </p>  <p><b>Please note that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.</b></p>  <p> </p>  <p>At Husky, we respect diversity and embrace an inclusive culture. We value uniqueness and different perspectives as they play a critical role in our success. To achieve this, individuals are selected based on qualifications, merit, and abilities and we encourage applications from everyone including visible minorities, Aboriginal people, women, and persons with disabilities.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><u>About Husky:</u></p>  <p> </p>  <p>One of Husky’s advantages is that we are an integrated oil and gas company. From exploration to development, production, refining and marketing, we’ve got it all! Combine this with a range of learning and development tools and an inclusive work environment, and you are well-positioned for a successful career at Husky. </p>  <p> </p>  <p>We have training, mentoring and career development programs and resources to help you develop both personally and professionally – as an employee or a leader. We offer many internal leadership and business skills courses along with tuition reimbursement programs for qualified employees. Every year, a significant number of our employees are able to take on new roles within the company thanks to our strong focus on hands-on learning and development.</p>  <p> </p>  <p>#LI-DNP</p>  <p> </p>   <br><p></p>

Title: Engineering Manager
Job_Description: Longview Aviation Asset Management (LAAM) was established in 2016 to provide attractive financing and lease options, as well as trade-in aircraft capabilities, for aircraft supported and manufactured by Viking Air Limited (Viking). <br/><br/> In 2018, LAAM, in partnership with Viking, formally launched the CL-415EAF "Enhanced Aerial Firefighter" conversion program. The CL-415EAF combines the proven performance of the CL-215 airframe with modern upgrades to create the next generation of the worlds only purpose-built aerial firefighter and multi-mission amphibious platform. <br/><br/> We are immediately seeking an experienced Aerospace Engineering Manager to join our rapidly expanding team in Calgary. <br/><br/> The Engineering Manager is responsible for managing the Methods Engineering functions. Implements industry-standard continuous improvement methodologies to ensure that the product consistently meets all required quality standards while reducing production costs and cycle times. <br/><br/> <strong>MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop & manage a Methods Team in a production plant environment</li> <li>Develop & plan for manufacturing plan deliverables such as product flow, layout, cycle, visual aids, workbooks instructions, tooling, etc.</li> <li>Assess risks and develop a mitigation plan for processes and equipments (FMEAs)</li> <li>Analyse & optimize material flow.</li> <li>Manages development, implementation, optimization and build sequence planning, documentation, provisioning and tooling requirements for parts or assemblies.</li> <li>Manages METs in root cause analysis of production issues and errors.</li> <li>Conduct business/process analysis as required</li> <li>Use sound benchmarking principals and techniques as required for analysis</li> <li>Maintain and develop knowledge of new manufacturing processes within the aerospace industry and in the plant</li> <li>Possess a sound understanding of basic industrial engineering principles as they relate to work study, process analysis and resource planning</li> <li>Leading METs developing and revising Engineering Masters (EMs), planning documents and workbooks ensuring that they properly define HOW the aircraft assembly, subassemblies and parts are manufactured in accordance with the type design by,</li> <li>Identifying tool and equipment requirements for their accountable work areas and to participate in their specifying, sourcing, acquisition and implementation,</li> <li>Defining standard work under LAAM work instructions</li> <li>Supporting Production in solving tactical problems.</li> <li>Defining parts repair processes</li> </ul> <u>Repair Design</u>  <ul> <li>Develop repair designs / solutions for non-conformances</li> <li>Perform analysis in support of repair dispositions</li> <li>Recommend and develop permanent design changes for recurring non-conformances and drawing errors</li> <li>Develop and implement repairs using the standard repair manual</li> <li>Manage flow of repair solutions to meet the production priorities</li> <li>Provide status reports on the development of repair solutions</li> </ul> <u>Engineering Support</u>  <ul> <li>Evaluate and resolve engineering-related production problems</li> <li>Investigate defective, damaged, or malfunctioning parts, assemblies, equipment, or systems to determine nature and scope of problem</li> <li>Support methods engineering and design change using the ECN process</li> <li>Provide engineering support to quality control, material, production, and other department personnel</li> </ul> <strong>EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:</strong>  <ul> <li>Degree or diploma in Engineering; or equivalent combination of education and experience (e.g., senior Aircraft Maintenance Engineer)</li> <li>5-10 years of progressive hands-on experience in a manufacturing environment, preferably in the aerospace industry</li> <li>Knowledge of the repair, fabrication and assembly of aircraft parts</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Working knowledge of cost accounting and cost estimating</li> <li>Experience in an AMO environment would be an asset.</li> </ul> <strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Knowledge of Aerospace engineering and manufacturing principles and techniques.</li> <li>Ability to apply sound engineering principles to operational and process design issues.</li> <li>Ability to read and interpret aircraft engineering drawings.</li> <li>Ability to communicate well orally and in writing.</li> <li>Ability to communicate and document information using a computer and required software.</li> <li>Ability to manage and act on multiple projects and priorities at one time.</li> <li>Ability to work effectively either independently or with others on flexible work assignments.</li> </ul> <strong>JOIN THE TEAM AND BENEFIT FROM:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary</li> <li>Full extended health and benefit plan</li>   <li>The opportunity to join an organization from the ground floor</li>   <li>Great task diversity and unique challenges</li> <li>Company RRSP matching</li>  </ul> Interviews start ASAP! Apply today for consideration! (No cover letter required)

Title: Team Lead for the Murale Mother's Day Experience!

Title: Facilities Manager
Job_Description: Longview Aviation Asset Management (LAAM) was established in 2016 to provide attractive financing and lease options, as well as trade-in aircraft capabilities, for aircraft supported and manufactured by Viking Air Limited (Viking). <br/><br/> In 2018, LAAM, in partnership with Viking, formally launched the CL-415EAF "Enhanced Aerial Firefighter" conversion program. The CL-415EAF combines the proven performance of the CL-215 airframe with modern upgrades to create the next generation of the worlds only purpose-built aerial firefighter and multi-mission amphibious platform. <br/><br/> We are immediately seeking an experienced Facilities Manager to join our rapidly expanding team in Calgary. <br/><br/> The Facilities Manager is the focal point for directing and coordinating the organization, setup and <br/> operation of the LAAM facilities. This includes monitoring, maintenance and oversight in <br/> accordance with relevant local, provincial, and federal standards, laws, and regulations. This is <br/> a key management role reporting to the General manager. The person in this position <br/> supervises a team of two Millwrights and one Electrician. Activities related to maintenance of <br/> the building and grounds are coordinated with the landlord. <br/><br/> <strong>MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Organizes and directs the Facilities Maintenance Department to ensure efficient and</li> <li>timely use of personnel and resources while repairing and maintaining buildings,</li> <li>grounds, systems, equipment, electrical, plumbing, etc.</li> <li>Plans, implements and coordinates a Total Productive Maintenance program within</li> <li>the Company</li> <li>Manages contractors and service providers who complete facilities and equipment</li> <li>related projects and repairs</li> <li>Coordinates facilities-related activities with the landlord as applicable.</li> <li>Plans and supervises activities of Millwrights and Electrician</li> <li>Ensures all Regional, Provincial and Federal facilities and environmental standards and regulations are adhered to and maintains a relationship with relevant oversight bodies.</li> <li>Oversees all HAZMAT programs including wastewater and other HAZMAT disposal programs.</li> <li>Leads facilities-related environmental stewardship programs</li> <li>Ensures efficient and timely use of personnel and resources.</li> <li>Ensures the security of all buildings and contents.</li> <li>Is the On Call person in the case of emergencies.</li> <li>Ensures goals and objectives are met for the facilities department.</li> </ul> <strong>EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:</strong>  <ul> <li>5 years minimum experience in the Maintenance or Facilities Management Field</li> <li>Preference will be given to candidates with experience in a manufacturing environment</li> <li>Strong work ethic, customer service focus, and positive can do team attitude</li> <li>Able to respond to situations with a calm and steady demeanor</li> </ul> <strong>JOIN THE TEAM AND BENEFIT FROM:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary</li> <li>Full extended health and benefit plan</li>   <li>The opportunity to join an organization from the ground floor</li>   <li>Great task diversity and unique challenges</li> <li>Company RRSP matching</li>  </ul> Interviews start ASAP! Apply today for consideration! (No cover letter required)

Title: Lead Estimator / Team Lead
Job_Description: Category : Construction <br/> Location/City : AB - Calgary <br/><br/> Athenian Group is a full-service placement agency providing Professional Technical Recruitment, Staffing and Payroll services to Canadaâ?'s top Consulting, Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction companies.Our focus is on providing businesses with the highest quality of worker for both contract and permanent staff positions.Our client, provides a wide spectrum of services to oil and gas exploration and production companies in the search for and development of oil sands bitumen, light and heavy oil, natural gas and coal bed methane.Currently we are recruiting for;Lead Estimator / Team LeadJob Description	Supervise, mentor, assist, and assign tasks to estimating team as well as provide support to other Estimating Leads throughout the division.	Review outstanding tasks with team members and update priority list and/or projects and/or clients with any changes..	Manages and administers project estimating functions work assignments, sequencing of <br/> priorities, determination of staff resourcing and or equipment requirements, performance <br/> evaluations, etc.	Applies technical and leadership experience to oversee the preparation of Order of Magnitude and Definitive estimates.	Reviews Estimate Plans to ensure technical approach, set up, format, level of detail and organization is planned for.	Populates the necessary estimates/proposals documents such as clarifications lists, tender <br/> forms, work break down structures, rates schedules, etc.	Development of estimating basis identifying utilized estimating methodologies.	Participates in presentation of estimates/proposals to corporate management and or clients.	Identifies potential risks, opportunities, and alternative solutions.	Strives for continual process improvement and or efficiencies.	Collectively maintains estimating historical benchmarking data base.	Development of estimating plan to establish estimate/proposal strategies.	Review contracts and interpret any cost impacts for the division/project.	Generate monthly progress reports for project/supervisors, clients as well as other functions.	Update estimate register with new project information.	Reviews estimates/proposals to ensure completeness, accuracy, and conformity to functional process.	Review technical, specifications and scope of work documents. Obtain revised documents from Corporate Document Management System (FDMS) on a regular basis.	Generates required progress reporting providing updates on progress, projects, and current and or outstanding issues to management, projects, clients, and or other functional groups.	Ensures estimates are reviewed and approved according to policy.	Organize and participate in team as well as functional meetings; provide insight with regards to current/outstanding issues and weekly progress.	Attend and participate in site-visits, pre-bid meeting and post-bid meeting as required.	Collaborate with other functions, engineering firms, and vendors to enhance project success.	Provide recommendations and guidance to other Functional groups with regards to processes, monitoring and system requirements.	Provide assistance in resolving estimating matters during contract negotiations and execution, as required.	Provides independent reviews of estimates led by others.	Ensures all documentation is relevant and available to support the development of <br/> estimates/proposals.	Oversees the maintenance of estimate/proposal files as back-up for the estimate/proposal <br/> including accurate information on qualifications, labour rates, construction equipment rates, material pricing from suppliers, subcontract pricing from third parties vendors, benchmarks of historical productivity figures, etc.	Review and approve team membersâ timesheets and submit to administration. Ensures that the appropriate overtime approvals have been complete for upcoming overtime; these approvals are to be submitted with the corresponding timesheets.	Complete and submit any monthly summaries to the appropriate departments. (e.g. P-card, expense reports, etc.)	Direct Reports: 1 - 15	Mentor, coach and develop direct reports.	Provide daily direction to estimators within the team.	Provide annual information to the functional manager with regards to the direct reports PMP review.	Manage project estimating budget & optimize recoverability of staff.	Complete budget analysis and/or budgetary estimate as required by projects and/or functions.Job Requirements	Minimum of College Diploma/Certification required.	Professional designation preferred.	Registered for certification with one of the following organizations: <br/> o Alberta Society for Engineering Technologist (ASET) <br/> o Association for the Advancement of Cost Engineering (AACE) <br/> o Alberta Quantity Surveyors Association (AQSA)	Minimum of 7 - 10 yearsâ experience required with formal education.	10+ years of extensive, practical and successful experience in organizing and <br/> preparing industrial cost estimates/proposals for construction projects would be <br/> considered equivalent for the formal education requirement.	Thorough knowledge of estimating techniques and strategies.	Thorough knowledge of industrial construction.	Having excellent organizational, supervisory, and decision making/problem solving skills.	Ability to calculate mathematical extensions, analyze and understand construction drawings, associated documentation, contracts, cost coding systems, work breakdown structures, etc.	Ability to assume responsibility and to interface and to communicate effectively with others, <br/> having strong interpersonal skills and self-motivation.	Expert computer skills : Microsoft Excel, Adobe Acrobat, Estimating Software	Intermediate computer skills: Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access, Project) Auto CAD,3-D Modeling Software, Primavera 6If you or someone you know is interested in this position, please contact;Jason Wahljason@atheniangroup.ca10180 â 101 Street, Suite #3400Edmonton, AlbertaT5J 3S4Calgary â 403-969-9962Edmonton â 780-499-5959 <br/><br/>

Title: Residential Sales Manager
Job_Description: <div> <div> <div>","after_title":"","pager":false,"paged":1,"template":"single.tmpl","item_class":"team-single-item","container":false,"custom_class":"team-page-single"}" data-pages="0" data-page="1" data-groups=""><div>Residential Sales Manager – Calgary – Competition #18-075 <br/> <div> <div>Calgary</div></div><br/>  <div> <div>BURNCO Rock Products Ltd. is currently recruiting for an experienced <strong>Residential Sales Manager</strong> for the <strong>Greater Calgary area</strong>. As the ideal candidate you are detail-oriented, organized and possess strong customer service skills. You will handle customer inquiries, assist with billing and collections, receive credit applications, and investigate complaints. You will work closely with dispatch, operations, and contribute to a positive work environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Acquire new customers, develop relationships, and resolve customer concerns or disputes</li> <li>Maintain close contact with existing customer base (both City based and Rural based) to ensure that their requirements for quality and service are being met</li> <li>Strong knowledge of Calgary Residential Market</li> <li>Maintain familiarity of the local market, pricing levels, and industry activity</li> <li>Analyze industry trend data, projects sales, and determine future requirements</li> <li>Implement initiatives to grow revenue</li> <li>Provide product pricing to customers on an annual and “as needed” basis</li> <li>Assists Sales Manager with pricing, complaints, and invoicing as needed</li> <li>Supervise pumping, placing and finishing group to ensure work is performed efficiently and to a high level of quality</li> <li>Grow COD concrete finishing market</li> <li>Assist in Commercial pricing as required</li> <li>Attending Industry related events (occasional evening and out of town events)</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum 5 years of sales experience</li> <li>Post-secondary education in a related field</li> <li>Strong interpersonal skills</li> <li>Exceptional communication skills</li> <li>Strong computer skills with knowledge of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and be willing to learn new software as the position requires</li> <li>Valid Class 5 drivers licence is required</li> </ul> Please submit a resume <strong>quoting competition #18-075</strong> by April 13, 2018 to: <br/><br/> BURNCO Rock Products Ltd <br/><br/> Attention: Human Resources <br/><br/> E-mail: careers@burnco.com <br/><br/> <em>O</em><em>nly those candidates</em><em> selected for an interview will be contacted</em>.</div> </div> </div> </div> </div> </div>  <br/>

Title: Project Engineer
Job_Description: <ul>    <ul>  <li> <strong>Reference Number</strong>: Project Engineer</li> <li> <strong>Location</strong>: Calgary, ALberta, Canada</li> <li> <strong> Salary</strong> : Negotiable contract rates</li> <li> <strong>Sector</strong>: Oil and Gas Recruitment</li> </ul>    </ul>  <div> We are currently recruiting for a Project Engineer to be based on a long term contract basis in Calgary. Title: Team Lead Auto Parts Desk - PartSource
Job_Description: <DIV><strong>Team Lead</strong> <br/><br/> PartSource is a chain of automotive parts specialty stores that offer brand-name auto parts to the medium to heavy ‘do-it-yourselfers,’ automotive enthusiasts and commercial installers. <br/><br/> As part of Canadian Tire Corporation’s growing network of interrelated businesses, PartSource employees are committed to ensuring that our commercial and retail customers enjoy a memorable customer experience. In return, our investment in our people includes a comprehensive total rewards package, including store discount programs and opportunities for career development. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Store Manager the Team Lead is responsible for assisting in the day to day operations of the store including supervising and coaching of store staff. <br/><br/> <strong>Customer Service</strong> <br/><br/> · Leads and supports the drive to build a Sales Obsessed Culture by providing an exceptional in store customer experience. <br/><br/> · Supports Store Management in providing resolution as required to customer complaints. <br/><br/> · Supports the commercial sales team by providing customer service support. <br/><br/> <strong>Operations:</strong> <br/><br/> · Follows up on execution of PS visual compliance standards, store maintenance and pricing standards. <br/><br/> · Executes on daily price changes. <br/><br/> · Executes planograms, and merchandising directives. <br/><br/> · Supports enforcement of audit compliance and standards and rigid inventory control. <br/><br/> · Executes and completes daily shipping /receiving activities including returns processing and documentation according to company policies. <br/><br/> · Provides support in preparation for annual inventories. <br/><br/> · Follows and ensures compliance of all Cash and Audit, and OH&S policies and procedures. <br/><br/> · Provides support or recommends maintenance or repair for overall Store and equipment including PS Fleet. <br/><br/> · Assumes responsibility for Store leadership in the absence of the Store Management. <br/><br/> <strong>Training</strong> <br/><br/> · Provides support to store team, through communication, coaching, feedback and ongoing support <br/><br/> · Follows up on individual sales goals <br/><br/> · Communicates in a clear and concise manner to team, leading effective huddles, keeping team well informed of pertinent information. <br/><br/> · Assists store management in ensuring training compliance and completion. <br/><br/> · Support the Store Management during team meetings. <br/><br/> <strong>Leadership</strong> <br/><br/> · Participates in recognition programs, in store contests, customer compliments, etc. <br/><br/> · Fosters positive and productive partnership with Commercial sales team. <br/><br/> · Actively provides constructive feedback to management on observations of team performance. <br/><br/> · Supports the Store Manager as required in providing coaching to the teams on disciplinary issues consistently and impartially. <br/><br/> · Promotes and maintains a positive and motivating work environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Deliverables</strong> <br/><br/> · Achieves personal sales and supports store sales targets <br/><br/> · Achieves 95" on Store Audits <br/><br/> <strong>Skills</strong> <br/><br/> · Demonstrated leadership skills and ability to influence others to achieve results <br/><br/> · Proven ability to take initiative and execute on plans <br/><br/> · Ability to communicate clearly <br/><br/> · Ability to operate independently, time management and multi task <br/><br/> · 1-3 years retail experience in a leadership role <br/><br/> · High energy, enthusiasm and a drive to succeed <br/><br/> · Fundamental computer skills an asset <br/><br/> · Strong knowledge of automotive parts aftermarket industry <br/><br/> · A good base of knowledge of automotive operating systems including point of sale <br/><br/> · Functional literacy and capability of recognizing part numbers and line codes to ensure the proper selection of parts <br/><br/> · Passion for automotive or automotive enthusiasts <br/><br/> · Able to work retail hours including scheduled evenings, weekends and holidays. <br/><br/> <strong>Assets:</strong> <br/><br/> · Possession of a valid driver's license is an asset <br/><br/> · Automotive Training or Certification is an Asset <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll get</strong> <br/><br/> · Competitive hourly wage <br/><br/> · Benefit package for Full Time Employees <br/><br/> · Employee Preferred Pricing on Hard Parts <br/><br/> · Fun, fast paced environment with like-minded people <br/><br/> · Opportunity to combine your passion for automotive with your love of retail. <br/><br/> <strong>Background Check Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> As a condition of employment, this position is subject to the successful completion of the following
