Title: Assistant General Manager Positon - Smart Home Pros
Job_Description: Job Description<div><strong>VIVINT Calgary Direct Sales - Assistant General Manager Position</strong> <br/><br/> Beyond a welcoming atmosphere, Vivint employees also work together to create an extremely positive and inspiring culture that brings in top talent, keeps drive and motivation high, and makes everyone excited to come to work each day. <br/><br/> <strong>Hard working employees can make $75,000 - $150,000+ first year</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What Interests You Most?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Company | Pay | Product | Culture</strong> <br/><br/> Copy/paste this link to learn more: https://smarthomepros.vivint.com/apply/25915 <br/><br/> <strong>JOB DESCRIPTION</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Overview</strong> <br/><br/> In this role, you will be the face of Vivint Calgary. You are the first person our customers meet along their journey of transitioning to a Smart Home. Your work will make peoples lives more convenient, help give piece of mind and saves lives. If you are willing to work hard, want to make good money, surround yourself around good people and make the world a better place - then this position is an ideal fit. <br/><br/> However, this position is not a 9-to-5 desk job. As a Sales Rep for Vivint, you will be responsible for generating your own leads, primarily by direct to home sales efforts, referrals, and other sales channel methods. You will be working directly with homeowners to lower transition there home to to a Smart Home. This is a full time position at Vivint that has a great commission program linked to performance. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Drive production of sales to meet local team goals and objectives</li> <li>Develop qualified referrals and sales</li> <li>Generate own leads and customer base by directly contacting homeowners, initiate conversations and help the home owner transition to a Smart Home with Vivint Smart Home technology</li>  </ul>   <ul> <li><strong>AFTER</strong> you have proven your ability to produce at a high level leads will be provided</li> </ul> <strong>Skills</strong>   <ul> <li>2 year diploma or 4 year college degree preferred</li> <li>High school diploma required</li> <li>Excellent time management skills</li> <li>A track record of achievement as evidenced by sales awards, beating quota, etc.</li> <li>General understanding of the sales process and experience achieving and exceeding sales quota goals</li> <li>A positive, friendly personality and professional demeanor</li> <li>Flexibility to work within non-standard business hours</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills required</li> <li>Excellent customer service skills required</li> <li>Frequent local travel</li> <li>Frequent walking/standing for 6-8 hours per day</li> <li>Ability to work with daily exposure to outside environment including inclement weather</li> <li>Punctual, regular and consistent attendance</li> <li>A reliable form of personal transportation</li> <li>Must be able to work independently, with minimal supervision</li> <li>Team player with a big picture attitude!</li> <li>High energy, strong drive to win!</li> <li>Highly persuasive</li> <li>Self-disciplined and honest</li> <li>Driven and wants to WIN</li> <li>Interested in long-term career opportunities because we promote from within</li> <li>Able to successfully pass a pre-employment background screen</li> <li>Competitive compensation with many positions incentivized</li> <li>Employee referral program</li> <li>Career path opportunities for top performers <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits of our Program</strong></li>  </ul>   <ul> <li>High level business and sales training is provided</li><li>An industry leading compensation plan</li><li>Advancement opportunities based solely on results & personal performance not seniority. Become a manager within your first year</li><li>Competition prizes, incentives, trips, etc.</li><li>Opportunity for sales reps to advance quickly to become managers and accrue wealth via the long-term incentive plan (LTIP)</li><li>Work in a fun, competitive team atmosphere with a group of other likeminded goal orientated individuals</li><li>Leadership and personal development programs. Past speakers at Vivint:  <ul> <li>Jim Harbaugh</li><li>Peyton Manning</li><li>Urban Meyer</li><li>Eric Thomas</li><li>John Maxwell</li><li>Tony Robbins</li></ul></li> <li>Customer database showing which customers are most likely to buy</li><li>Leads provided for the individuals that excel.</li><li>World class customer service backing you up</li><li>Competitions & Incentives  <ul> <li>Trips – All inclusive incentive trip every year</li><li>Electronics, swag, event tickets etc. - <strong>Inc. Magazine</strong> just rated Vivint 2nd in swag/incentives given to employees</li></ul></li> </ul> <strong>We are currently hiring for entry level management positions focusing on business developement -</strong> Ideal for entrepreneurial individuals and sales professionals with experience who are looking for a top company and program to align themselves with while growing there own franchise within the company. <br/><br/> In the next 3-5 years we need 10 times the leaders we have right now at Vivint. You don't need to reinvent the wheel, just come and plug in and you WILL be successful. <br/><br/> <strong>The possibility of earning a six figure income and beyond is here at Vivint. If selected you will be working side by side multiple other managers already earning this income.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Rapid advancement into management as early as September 2018 is guaranteed for those that excel.</strong> <br/><br/> To learn more about what Vivint and this opportunity is all about watch this video: <strong><em>https://vimeo.com/149355867</em></strong><em>(copy & paste the link into your browser)</em> <br/><br/> <strong>If you are hardworking, self-motivated and have a good attitude we would love to talk to you and see if a position at Vivint might be a good fit for you to take your career to the next level</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We aren’t just looking to fill positions – we are actively seeking talented people to fill leadership roles to grow our company to the next level.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>MANAGEMENT OPPORTUNITIES</strong> <br/><br/> We are hiring salespeople for this year with the intention of developing them into leaders and giving them the opportunity to become future managers within our company. <ul> <li>First year employees who show leadership skills and strong work ethic will have an opportunity to move into management as soon as September 2018</li><li>Managing your own office will provide an opportunity to learn an additional skillset of managing systems and people that will be sure to help advance your career</li><li>Earn a Six Figure Salary</li> </ul> <strong>NOW HIRING</strong> <br/><br/> We are conducting immediate interviews for<strong> professionals seeking immediate employment</strong> – once hired candidates are able to start immediately <br/><br/> <strong>If you think this might be the right opportunity for you and would like to get more info please submit a resume and a brief cover letter explaining why you think you will be a good fit in our program</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>WORKING WITH VIVINT</strong>is more than just a job—it’s an experience. In addition to securing your financial future, you can focus on self-improvement and take part in a truly unique atmosphere. Because this opportunity provides daily interactions with people and invaluable training, you’ll be doing more than just earning a paycheck. <br/><br/> <strong>OVERVIEW</strong> <br/><br/> Do you remember when Nokia ran the cellular market 10 years ago? The only innovation that was happening for 6-8 straight years was the phones were getting smaller and smaller but they weren’t really doing anything. Then along came the iPhone. It shook up the market and introduced something that the consumer didn’t even know they needed. That’s what we are doing at Vivint. <ul> <li><strong>Vivint is a multi billion-dollar start up</strong> that has quickly become the largest and fastest growing Home Automation, Solar and Wireless Company in North America. <strong>We build, design, engineer and create our own unique products and services</strong> that are only available through Vivint.</li><li>The <strong>Smart Home Industry</strong> is projected to be a <strong>100 Billion-Dollar Industry by 2020</strong> and the company that is most uniquely positioned and best positioned to dominate, is Vivint.</li> </ul> We already have the technology; we have the financing, now we need the people to grow our company. <ul> <li>If you are a sales professional currently or have ever thought about entering the sales profession with any aspirations in the business world this is an opportunity that might be the key to unlocking your potential.</li><li>We believe that our fun, upbeat atmosphere develops individuals rapidly and builds both personal and professional relationships.</li> </ul> To learn more about the positioning of Vivint and what is happening within the company and industry right now watch this quick 2-minute video: <br/><br/> <em><strong>https://vimeo.com/122357835</strong> (copy and paste link into your browser)</em></div>Company Description<div>We don’t always get the chance to be a part of something big–something that will change the way people live their lives every day. Vivint gives you that chance. There’s no better time than now; there’s no better place than here.   <ul> <li>Flexible Hours</li> <li>Leadership Development</li> <li>High Pay</li> </ul>  What does your financial plan look like? <br/><br/> Whatever your plans for the future are, it all starts with you. Whether you want to graduate debt free, buy a house or start a business, it begins here. Personal growth and finacial achievements are part of what makes our company great. Use Vivint as a summer job to save money for school or turn this opportunity into a year round career. Which ever route you take we have a program for you. <br/><br/> The average first year rep makes $22,000 in 4 months. <br/><br/> Vivint is currently the largest and best-positioned company in the Smart Home Industry, which is projected to be a $100 Billion-Dollar Industry by 2020. Vivint recently announced partnerships to work with Airbnb and Best Buy in the upcoming year in addition to current product partnerships with Google and Amazon. <br/><br/> Vivint is listed on Forbes Americas Most Promising Companies List as well as Forbes America’s Best Employers List. <br/><br/> The Blackstone Group (the largest alternative investment group in the world) purchased Vivint in 2012 for $2.3 Billion-dollars. Since that transaction Vivint has gone through an explosive growth period and that growth is currently out pacing the leadership available.</div>

Title: Area Sales Manager
Job_Description: <div><u><strong>Job Summary</strong></u> <br/><br/> The Area Sales Manager is responsible for the Sales, Service and Training of Radiodetection Channel partners and stakeholders. They have the strategic responsibility to work with new and existing accounts to plan annual activities, and develop action plans and metrics for ensuring achievement of all performance targets and are the primary interface between the Company and distributors. As such they must constantly assess and communicate market conditions and competitive activity to the Company. Such intelligence is the foundation of effective forecasting and requires sustained effort and attention to detail.<br/> <div><strong>PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES</strong></div>    <ul>  	<li>Sales accountability to achieve growth targets with regards to revenue; market share; unit sales goals; net revenue; and profitability.</li>   <li>Accountability to maintain a productive and effective relationship with channel partners agents and key stakeholders. This includes, but is not limited to; helping channel partners meet growth targets, creation of Distributor sales programs and communication of market intelligence between the Company and the field.</li> <li>Responsibility to coordinate the technical training of Channel Partners; Agents; Contractors and other stakeholders. Training includes Product orientation and Technical Service along with directly delivering training on business processes (e.g. Value Proposition). The ASM, Distribution is responsible for business acumen training to agents.</li> <li>Promote the sale of Radiodetection products to new and existing wholesale distributors located within the sales territory utilizing personal sales calls on distributor principles on a scheduled basis. Distributor principles include top management, sales management, purchasing management, inventory control, sales, warehouse, warranty/claims, accounts payable departments, and other customer functions having any involvement with the sale of Radiodetection products.</li> <li>Identify, aggressively pursue, and close the sale.</li>   <li>Providing regular and accurate forecasts of projected sales based on current order and quotation activity.</li> <li>Preparing detailed reports of weekly activity including call reports and expense reports.</li> <li>Actively engage with new and existing distributors, contractors and end users to promote the sale of Radiodetection products. This activity should include prospecting in a number of formats such as personal calls on contractors and/or end users with and without distributor sales people, at distributor sponsored product shows, meetings, seminars, etc.</li> <li>Ensure that CRM package is fully utilized as a tool for recording customers and tracking quotations/projects for follow-up and forecasting.</li> <li>Participate in activities such as account planning, product presentations, technical presentations, and distributor ride-a-longs relating to the operation of Radiodetection products. Participation to be in conjunction with, but not restricted to, distributor customers.</li>  </ul>  <div><strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES</strong></div>    <ul>  	<li>The ability to demonstrate ‘value add’ to customers through the Radiodetection range of products, technologies and services.</li> <li>Understands product features, functions and benefits delivery.</li> <li>Demonstrates knowledge of technical aspects of product application and operation.</li> <li>Prepared to challenge performance, and critically assess.</li> <li>Strong organizational and communication skills.</li> <li>Proven track record of sales development.</li> <li>Computer literate with experience of Microsoft packages.</li> <li>Strong time management skills-able to prioritize multiple activities at one time.</li> <li>Ability to manage channel conflict and to forge strong, positive business relationships with customer personnel.</li> <li>Demonstrates teamwork abilities and persistence when dealing with customers as well as company departments.</li> <li>Demonstrates ability to negotiate and arrive at creative win/win solutions.</li> <li>Ability to be a self-starter with little supervision.</li> </ul>  <div><strong>EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE</strong></div>    <ul>  	<li>Business or technical degree (or equivalent)</li> <li>Extensive relevant experience in an external sales environment.</li> </ul> Founded in 1970, Radiodetection is headquartered in Bristol, UK, with worldwide sales, service and support achieved through a network of sales channels across the globe. Our product range includes tools for damage prevention to buried services; powerful video systems for pipeline inspection; high-performance dehydrators and cable-test products for telecoms; and our solid-state sensors business. <br/><br/> Radiodetection is part of SPX Corporation. <br/><br/> SPX is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, or any other reason prohibited by applicable law. <br/><br/> Thank you for your interest in our company.</div> <br/>

Title: Team Lead Auto Parts Desk - PartSource
Job_Description: <DIV><strong>Team Lead</strong> <br/><br/> PartSource is a chain of automotive parts specialty stores that offer brand-name auto parts to the medium to heavy ‘do-it-yourselfers,’ automotive enthusiasts and commercial installers. <br/><br/> As part of Canadian Tire Corporation’s growing network of interrelated businesses, PartSource employees are committed to ensuring that our commercial and retail customers enjoy a memorable customer experience. In return, our investment in our people includes a comprehensive total rewards package, including store discount programs and opportunities for career development. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Store Manager the Team Lead is responsible for assisting in the day to day operations of the store including supervising and coaching of store staff. <br/><br/> <strong>Customer Service</strong> <br/><br/> · Leads and supports the drive to build a Sales Obsessed Culture by providing an exceptional in store customer experience. <br/><br/> · Supports Store Management in providing resolution as required to customer complaints. <br/><br/> · Supports the commercial sales team by providing customer service support. <br/><br/> <strong>Operations:</strong> <br/><br/> · Follows up on execution of PS visual compliance standards, store maintenance and pricing standards. <br/><br/> · Executes on daily price changes. <br/><br/> · Executes planograms, and merchandising directives. <br/><br/> · Supports enforcement of audit compliance and standards and rigid inventory control. <br/><br/> · Executes and completes daily shipping /receiving activities including returns processing and documentation according to company policies. <br/><br/> · Provides support in preparation for annual inventories. <br/><br/> · Follows and ensures compliance of all Cash and Audit, and OH&S policies and procedures. <br/><br/> · Provides support or recommends maintenance or repair for overall Store and equipment including PS Fleet. <br/><br/> · Assumes responsibility for Store leadership in the absence of the Store Management. <br/><br/> <strong>Training</strong> <br/><br/> · Provides support to store team, through communication, coaching, feedback and ongoing support <br/><br/> · Follows up on individual sales goals <br/><br/> · Communicates in a clear and concise manner to team, leading effective huddles, keeping team well informed of pertinent information. <br/><br/> · Assists store management in ensuring training compliance and completion. <br/><br/> · Support the Store Management during team meetings. <br/><br/> <strong>Leadership</strong> <br/><br/> · Participates in recognition programs, in store contests, customer compliments, etc. <br/><br/> · Fosters positive and productive partnership with Commercial sales team. <br/><br/> · Actively provides constructive feedback to management on observations of team performance. <br/><br/> · Supports the Store Manager as required in providing coaching to the teams on disciplinary issues consistently and impartially. <br/><br/> · Promotes and maintains a positive and motivating work environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Deliverables</strong> <br/><br/> · Achieves personal sales and supports store sales targets <br/><br/> · Achieves 95" on Store Audits <br/><br/> <strong>Skills</strong> <br/><br/> · Demonstrated leadership skills and ability to influence others to achieve results <br/><br/> · Proven ability to take initiative and execute on plans <br/><br/> · Ability to communicate clearly <br/><br/> · Ability to operate independently, time management and multi task <br/><br/> · 1-3 years retail experience in a leadership role <br/><br/> · High energy, enthusiasm and a drive to succeed <br/><br/> · Fundamental computer skills an asset <br/><br/> · Strong knowledge of automotive parts aftermarket industry <br/><br/> · A good base of knowledge of automotive operating systems including point of sale <br/><br/> · Functional literacy and capability of recognizing part numbers and line codes to ensure the proper selection of parts <br/><br/> · Passion for automotive or automotive enthusiasts <br/><br/> · Able to work retail hours including scheduled evenings, weekends and holidays. <br/><br/> <strong>Assets:</strong> <br/><br/> · Possession of a valid driver's license is an asset <br/><br/> · Automotive Training or Certification is an Asset <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll get</strong> <br/><br/> · Competitive hourly wage <br/><br/> · Benefit package for Full Time Employees <br/><br/> · Employee Preferred Pricing on Hard Parts <br/><br/> · Fun, fast paced environment with like-minded people <br/><br/> · Opportunity to combine your passion for automotive with your love of retail. <br/><br/> <strong>Background Check Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> As a condition of employment, this position is subject to the successful completion of the following pre-employment conditions:  <ul> <li>Employment Verifications</li> <li>Criminal Background Check</LI>  </ul> We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those candidates elected for an interview will be contacted. Alternatively, email your resume and cover letter to careers@partsource.ca.</DIV> <br/> <strong></strong> <br/><br/> PartSource is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Title: Conference Services Manager
Job_Description: <strong><br/> </strong> <br/> <strong>Conference Services Manager</strong> <br/><br/> At Fairmont Hotels & Resorts, our engaging service and delicious cuisine make every special event a truly memorable affair, both within our distinctive surroundings and off-site. Be an ambassador for our exceptional offerings as Conference Services Manager, where you will liaise between multiple departments to meet the needs and exceed the expectations of your clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Hotel Overview:</strong> Centrally located in downtown Calgary, The Fairmont Palliser is the city's premier, landmark hotel. With 407 elegantly appointed guestrooms and the recent completion of an extensive renovation project, The Fairmont Palliser is truly the place to be. <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities:</strong> <br/> Reporting to the Director of Conference Services & Catering, responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:  <ul>   <li> Consistently offer professional, friendly and engaging service</li>    <li> Confirm all event related information with clients and prepare event orders and resumes in a professional and timely manner</li>    <li> Respond to inquiries that arrive via fax, telephone, email or walk in clients in a professional and timely manner</li>    <li> Establish and maintain rapport with clients, prior to, during and post conference, encouraging repeat business</li>    <li> Responsible to service programs assigned and booked by the Corporate Group Sales Managers</li>    <li> Handle bookings with 7 guestrooms or less per night within next 60 days</li>    <li> Responsible for organization and supervision of assigned functions and guestroom blocks from date of booking to departure</li>    <li> Working with booking guidelines and minimum revenues to ensure they are met</li>    <li> Work closely with Group Room Sales Team to ensure all contractual terms agreed upon are carried out and to maximize function space for the highest profitability for the Hotel</li>    <li> Assist clients in meeting their expectations both conceptual and monetary while keeping in mind food costs, labour costs and hotel operations</li>     <li>Assist the client to coordinate with outside suppliers, including entertainment, audiovisual, décor and floral</li>     <li> Organize convention bookings from date of booking to departure, including meeting requirements, guest room requirements, guest room pickup, food & beverage and audio visual</li>    <li> Establish good business and social relationships within the industry and participate in activities related to public relations to further increase sales leads for the department as well as the Hotel</li>    <li> Create floor plans for each event to ensure banquets and clients are in agreement prior to set up</li>    <li> Initiate billing procedures, ensuring any deposits and/or credit applications are received with adequate information and within an acceptable time frame and ensure that Hotel accounting policies are adhered to</li>    <li> Conduct pre-conference meetings with clients and pertinent departments to confirm all relevant details are communicated</li>    <li> Conduct and/or attend daily meeting to review event contracts and ensure last minute changes are communicated with appropriate departments</li>    <li> Be knowledgeable of liquor and fire safety laws and regulations</li>    <li> Help to achieve departmental monthly forecast and yearly budget and goals</li>    <li> Follow departmental policies and procedures</li>    <li> Follow all safety policies</li>    <li> Other duties as assigned</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>    <li>Previous leadership experience within a similar role required</li>     <li> Computer literate in Microsoft Window applications required</li>    <li> University/College degree in a related discipline preferred</li>    <li> Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal required</li>    <li> Strong interpersonal and problem solving abilities</li>    <li> Highly responsible & reliable</li>    <li> Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times</li>  </ul> <strong>Visa Requirements:</strong> Must be legally eligible to work in Canada. The Fairmont Palliser is unable to assist to assist candidates in obtaining Canadian work authorization. <br/><br/> <strong>APPLY TODAY:</strong> Whether youre launching your career or seeking meaningful employment, we invite you to visit www.fairmontcareers.com to learn more about Fairmont Hotels & Resortsand the extraordinary opportunities that exist! <br/><br/> <strong>ABOUT FAIRMONT HOTELS & RESORTS</strong> <br/> At Fairmont Hotels & Resorts we offer our guests the finest hospitality experience in each of our destinations. And we know that, to offer our guests the best, we first need to offer our employees the best. Thats why you'll find exceptional work opportunitiesthroughout North America and the Caribbean, Europe and Africa, the Middle East and Asia Pacificas well as industry-leading training, career development, recognition and rewards. Fairmont Hotels & Resorts is a celebrated collection of hotels that includes landmark locations like Londons The Savoy, New Yorks The Plaza, and Shanghais Fairmont Peace Hotel. Our teams are guided by values of Respect, Integrity, Teamwork and Empowerment; we employ the highest ethical and quality standards, treating all colleagues with fairness and dignity. A community and environmental leader, Fairmont is also regarded for its responsible tourism practices and award-winning Green Partnership program. An exciting future awaits!

Title: Manager, Legal and Compliance
Job_Description: <div> <div>Manager, Legal and Compliance<br/> <div><div><strong>Job ID:</strong></div><div><strong> 999-79</strong></div></div> <br/>  <div><div><strong>Position summary:</strong></div><div>Hitachi ID Systems is searching for a motivated individual to join our growing  <br/>  legal team in our Calgary HQ. Reporting to the Director, Legal Affairs,  <br/>  the Manager, Legal and Compliance will be responsible for:</div> </div> <br/>  <div><div><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></div><div>   <ul>   <li>Supporting the needs of the business by responding to inquiries from  <br/>  business stakeholders, identifying legal issues and providing the  <br/>  appropriate guidance and tools.</li> <li>Drafting and negotiating a wide range of legal agreements, including  <br/>  software licensing, technology partnership agreements, software reseller  <br/>  agreements, professional services agreements, and other corporate  <br/>  agreements.</li> <li>Reviewing and analyzing external legal documents, and providing advice  <br/>  and guidance to business stakeholders.</li> <li>Developing and presenting education materials on legal matters relevant  <br/>  to the business, for the professional development of others in the  <br/>  organization.</li> <li>Working with cross-functional teams and providing legal input on business  <br/>  development opportunities.</li> </ul>   </div> </div> <br/>  <div><div><strong>Qualifications:</strong></div><div>Minimum Requirements:  <ul>   <li>JD, LL.B., or a related and equivalent foreign law degree</li> <li>Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically</li> <li>Some travel, domestic and international, may be required</li> </ul> Preferred background, skills and qualifications:  <ul>   <li>Proactive, and positive approach to solving problems, anticipating  <br/>  issues and developing solutions</li> <li>Exceptional interpersonal skills and a commitment to professionalism  <br/>  and collegiality</li> <li>Organized, and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously</li> <li>Curiosity for new technologies, and for legal developments related  <br/>  to technology</li> </ul>   </div> </div> <br/>  <div><div><strong>Compensation/ <br/> benefits:</strong></div><div>   <ul>   <li>Competitive salary.</li> <li>Extensive health benefits paid by the employer.</li> <li>RRSP and bonus plans.</li> <li>Paid vacation.</li> <li>Flexible work hours.</li> <li>Informal and rewarding work environment staffed with IT <br/>  experts.</li> <li>Be part of a growing, stable company with a great <br/>  reputation.</li> </ul> Hitachi ID Systems is an equal opportunity employer. Together we succeed.</div> </div> <br/>  <div><div><strong>Location:</strong></div><div>Calgary, Alberta</div></div> <br/>  <div><div><strong>To apply:</strong></div><div>Send a resume by e-mail to jobs@Hitachi-ID.com. <br/>  Be sure to include both "Job ID 999-79" in the subject line. E-mails <br/>  that do not include this will not be delivered to the appropriate <br/>  person. <br/>  For technical positions, the resume must be either ASCII text <br/>  or in PDF format. For other positions, MS-Word is also <br/>  acceptable. <br/><br/> Qualified applicants will be contacted within two weeks for a <br/>  preliminary phone interview.</div>  </div></div></div>

Title: Team Lead, Critical Environments
Job_Description: <div><div><strong>SUMMARY</strong> <br/><br/> The Team Lead, Critical Environments is responsible for overseeing a team of Technicians in the delivery of preventative and corrective maintenance, routine and on-demand services for assigned mission critical facilities. Given the risk associated with mission critical facilities, adherence to established processes and risk management practices is important in order to ensure the reliability of operations and achievement of facility uptime objectives. The Team Lead, Critical Environments is responsible for overseeing the execution of activities performed by Technicians to ensure that work is performed in accordance to established mission critical facility processes and procedures and is in compliant with all internal and external requirements including but not limited to environmental, health and safety, fire protection and risk management. In addition to people leadership responsibilities, the Team Lead, Critical Environment also performs and delivers preventative and corrective maintenance as well as routine and on-demand services <br/><br/> <strong>KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>People Leadership</strong> <br/><br/> People leadership responsibilities include but are not limited to:  <ul> <li>Leads a team of individual contributors</li>  <li>Assigns, prioritizes and monitors work progress</li>  <li>Monitors execution of activities and performance to ensure timely completion and adherence to all requirements including but not limited to operating procedures and practices, quality, performance and contract response requirements</li>  <li>Guides, coaches and trains direct reports</li>  <li>Provides input for performance review</li> </ul> <strong>Leads the delivery of as well as performs the following subject to legislative licensing requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>Oversees and monitors the activities and performance of Technicians within mission critical facilities. Ensures that Technicians and/or contractors share in the sense of urgency surrounding mission critical operations and that activities are performed in accordance to established processes as well as internal and external requirements including but not limited to environmental, health and safety, fire protection, risk management</li>  <li>Oversees the proper application and execution of mission critical-specific processes and risk management practices to achieve or exceed facility uptime objectives and mitigate risks</li>  <li>Oversees and performs regular facility, equipment and building systems monitoring and inspection, preventative and corrective maintenance to ensure facility uptime objectives are met, uninterrupted client operation and asset integrity of assigned facilities are maintained. Provides observations about facility, equipment and building systems’ conditions and deficiencies and provides recommendations for enhancement and repair .</li>  <li>Oversees and performs preventative and corrective maintenance on electrical building distribution systems including but not limited to single and redundant electrical distribution systems, generator systems, tie switches, transfer switches, paralleling systems, static switches, UPS and/or battery systems, distribution equipment, relay protection, breakers, panel boards, branch circuit wiring and devices</li>  <li>Oversees and performs preventative and corrective maintenance on mechanical building distribution systems including but not limited to single and redundant cooling distribution systems, steam and heating systems, complex valves, redundant distribution systems, central and package cooling plants, chilled water storage, boiler plants, cooling towers, dry coolers, water treatment, point of delivery cooling components, and complex central building control systems</li>  <li>Participates in and supports training, safety meetings and initiatives, operational meetings, tool box talks, etc</li>  <li>Oversees the maintenance of as well as maintains work order records within service management maintenance database. Initiates documents to obtain formal approval of work required</li>  <li>Assists in the implementation of preventative maintenance program. Ensures that deficiencies are identified, recorded and escalated, and that related documentations are maintained</li>  <li>Coordinates and participates in facility-related projects</li>  <li>Maintains all assigned tools and arranges for repair and replacement where required. Submits all expenditures on a timely basis</li>   <li>Must be able and willing to work shifts, be available for on-call/standby and emergency call-outs as they arise</li>  <li>Assists in enhancing tenant and customer satisfaction and maintaining positive relations through manner in which work is performed and services delivered</li>  <li>Other duties as assigned</li> </ul> <strong>Work Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Must be able to work shifts, be on-call and be available to respond to emergencies</li>  <li>Must be willing to wear personal protective equipment</li>  <li>Must be able and willing to drive to and perform work at multiple sites</li> </ul> <strong>EDUCATION, JOB-RELATED YEARS OF EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>MINIMUM EDUCATION:</strong> High school completion plus a specialized technical or business course <br/><br/> <strong>JOB-RELATED EXPERIENCE:</strong> More than five years up to ten years <br/><br/> <strong>Knowledge & Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>More than 5 years of facility operations and maintenance work experience, with at least 4 years of critical facility operations and maintenance work experience in environments such as internet data centers, raised floor, server farm, etc.</li>  <li>High school diploma plus trades training, certification or licenses</li>  <li>Ability to lead a team of individuals</li>  <li>Advanced level of awareness and understanding of the risk associated with mission critical facilities</li>  <li>Advanced ability to adhere to mission critical facility-related processes and risk management practices, with experience in executing mission critical facility-specific processes and practices</li>  <li>Highly advanced ability to maintain and repair building mechanical and electrical equipment and systems</li>  <li>Highly advanced building mechanical and electrical equipment and system troubleshooting and resolution skills</li>  <li>Current knowledge of fire, life, safety and building codes and standards and ability to research and apply related codes and standards</li>  <li>Possesses a high level of environmental, health and safety mindset. Ability to perform work in a safe manner</li>  <li>Strong client-service orientation along with a high sense of urgency</li>  <li>Effective communication skills for the purpose of data relay, exchange, feedback, and clarification</li> </ul> <strong>Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation</strong> <br/><br/> Trade certification/licensing in one or more of the following - required:  <ul> <li>Journeyman level Refrigeration license</li>  <li>Journeyman level Electrical license</li>  <li>Stationary Engineer Class 1 or Class 2</li> </ul> Trade certification in one or more of the following – preferred:  <ul> <li>Systems Maintenance Technician Certification</li>  <li>Certified Data Center Specialist</li>  <li>Certified Data Center Professional</li>  <li>Certified Data Center Expert</li> </ul> In addition:  <ul> <li>Must meet enhanced security clearance requirements</li>  <li>Must have a valid drivers’ license</li> </ul>  </div> </div><div></div>

Title: Team Lead, Kitchen
Job_Description: <u><strong>Who Are You?</strong></u> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manager, Kitchen the Team Lead, Kitchen is an individual who will lead the afternoon team in prepping, cooking and providing meals to our clients. The successful candidate requires the ability to be pleasant, patient, compassionate and consistent with clients, staff and volunteers at all times. <br/><br/> <u><strong>Hours of Work</strong></u> <br/><br/> Not less than 40 hours per rotation (1pm 9pm); with 5 days on and 2 days off. Some unusual hours may be required from time to time as the need arises. These hours may be altered at the discretion of management. <br/><br/> <u><strong>The Job</strong></u>  <ul> <li>Assists with the day to day operation of the kitchen and to uphold the vision, mission, goals and the ethics of the organization</li> <li>Supervise kitchen staff and volunteers, assigning tasks and following them through to completion</li> <li>Be responsible for preparation, cooking and assembly of all prepared food dishes which includes clean up afterwards</li> <li>Assists in planning and developing a menu dependent on available ingredients</li> <li>Operates a variety of industrial kitchen equipment, including knives, mixers, ovens and dishwasher</li> <li>Ensures work stations are kept clean and sanitized in accordance with health regulations, including all kitchen surface areas, serving utensils, appliances and dishware, etc.</li> <li>Assists with inventory (receiving, moving, storing, etc.) on a daily basis</li> <li>Participates in all tasks related to daily close and/or opening</li> <li>Ensures food supplies are properly handled and properly stored at all times</li> <li>Conducts themselves in a professional manner and take the necessary steps to ensure their conduct does not negatively impact the view of the volunteers</li> <li>Maintains a good working relationship with the Kitchen Manager, kitchen staff, other DI staff and management as well as client volunteers</li> <li>Performs other related tasks that are approved by the Manager, Kitchen and the Directors</li> </ul> <u><strong>Qualifications and Key Skills</strong></u>  <ul> <li>Minimum of two (2) years kitchen experience with proven leadership skills</li> <li>Experience in bulk cooking for large numbers of people (i.e. social service kitchens or banquet cooking) is preferred</li>   <li>Food Handlers Certificate</li> <li>A diploma from a culinary arts or professional cooking program is an asset</li> <li>Ability to lift and move heavy objects (equipment, incoming food, etc.) safely, up to 50 lbs.</li> <li>Energetic and self-directed, with effective time management and organizational skills including the ability to deal with several priorities at the same time</li> <li>Strong strategically-focused analytical skills, good common sense; and proven ability to provide leadership</li> <li>Well-developed interpersonal, conflict resolution and negotiating skills</li> <li>Excellent communications skills, both verbal and written</li> <li>Proficient in Office365 and Microsoft Office Suite 2016</li> <li>Demonstrate essential desktop troubleshooting skills</li> <li>Eager to learn new systems and adopt improved best practices</li> </ul> The DI affords each employee an opportunity to help make a real difference in our community, and more importantly in the lives of people with a history of trauma and marginalization. We take great care in hiring the right people who fit, and who share our outlook on the value of people.

Title: Team Lead, Business Development Proposals
Job_Description: <div><div><strong> <br/> Team Lead, Business Development Proposals</strong><br/>  <div> <div> Operating Company <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Stuart Olson Industrial</strong> </div><br/>  <div> City <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Calgary, AB</strong> </div> </div> </div>  <br/>Apply Now</div><br/>  <div><strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Leadership</strong>  <ul>  <li>Support a culture that encompasses the highest ethical standards aligned with the Company’s core values.</li>    </ul> <strong>Business Development Support</strong>  <ul>  <li>Work as a key member of the Business Development Team.</li>    <li>Support Business Development in the development and execution of:</li>    <li>key account strategies and plans; and</li>    <li>market and business sector strategies and plans.</li>    <li>Conduct client research and maintain information.</li>    <li>Provide oversite and management of sales pipeline leveraging Salesforce.com, including management and administration of dashboards, preparation of sales reports, and supporting Business Development in maintaining opportunity quality and completeness.</li>    <li>Collaborate with Business Development and Proposal Teams on win strategy for bids.</li>    <li>Lead major / strategic proposals, key pursuits, or others especially in high demand periods.</li>    <li>Lead development of collateral, presentations and communications with clients.</li>    <li>Assist in driving an increase in Stuart Olson’s Capture Rate on proposals.</li>    <li>Participate in Business Development meetings, and others, as required.</li>    </ul> <strong>Continuous Improvement</strong>  <ul>  <li>Develop and/or continuously improve consistent and robust Inside Sales processes and procedures within Stuart Olson Industrial’s Project Delivery Framework (PDF).</li>    <li>Ensure that the organization understands, and is in compliance with, Inside Sales processes and the PDF.</li>    <li>Champion knowledge management through development of consistent and standardized filing systems and repositories:</li>    <li>maintain and develop project information files, project profiles, resumes, and other documentation;</li>    <li>obtain project information to create project folders. Manage and update this information as projects progress and upon completion; and ensure team is compliant in using the filing systems and repositories.</li>    </ul> <strong>Proposals</strong>  <ul>  <li>Provide oversight for proposal coordinator(s) and other proposal team members on all proposals:</li>    <li>track proposals – submissions, successes, failures, and set up and participate in debriefing feedback;</li>    <li>act as the single point of contact for all Request For Proposals (RFP), Request for Pre-Qualification (RFPQ), Expressions of Interest (EOI), and other such communications for the Industrial Group;</li>    <li>ensure consistent look and feel for all submittals; and</li>    <li>ensure proposal quality and compliance.</li>    <li>Coordinate the proposal preparation and submission either directly or through Proposal Coordinator(s):</li>    <li>Read and distribute RFPQ/RFP information to the pursuit team;</li>    <li>Create responsibility matrix for the pursuit team for required tasks to win;</li>    <li>Distribute requests for information, internally, as required;</li>    <li>Centralize and standardize RF content;</li>    <li>Set deadlines for content;</li>    <li>Strategize on proposal content and work with identified proposal lead;</li>    <li>Arrange and record proposal team meetings;</li>    <li>Work with proposal lead to draft content;</li>    <li>Technical content to be provided by project director, project manager or <br/> superintendent;</li>    <li>Work with external vendors and stakeholders to obtain their input and information;</li>    <li>Review and editing of proposal material drafted by proposal lead;</li>    <li>Arrange for proposal reviews; and copy, collate, bind, distribute, courier, deliver all proposals.</li>    </ul> <strong>Communications</strong>  <ul>  <li>Liaise with Corporate Communications to ensure consistency of brand and marketing information.</li>    <li>Partner with Corporate Communications to lead the messaging and strategy for, and participate in, industry events.</li>    </ul> <strong>Stuart Olson Corporate</strong>  <ul> <li>Participate in corporate initiatives.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  <li>Undergraduate degree in marking/communications or business</li>    <li>5 years’ experience with inside sales work, preferably in an engineering/design/construction environment or with a large general contractor, industrial maintenance services provider, EPC or other relative organization</li>    <li>Proficient in: Salesforce, Illustrator, Photoshop, and Microsoft Office</li>    <li>Excellent project management skills and understanding of key business processes</li>    <li>Experience with continuous process</li>    <li>Ability to forge, grow and maintain positive relationships</li>    <li>Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously and meet the time demands of unpredictable activities; capable of handling pressure and challenges in a dynamic business environment</li>    <li>Ability to work within tight deadlines and prioritization of work to achieve them</li>    <li>Strong analytical, critical thinking, troubleshooting, problem-solving skills, and a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail</li>    <li>Highly developed interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills</li>    <li>Demonstrates a sense of urgency and strong commitment to achieving goals; ability to work in challenging, fast paced environment</li>    <li>Ability to work collaboratively with a positive attitude</li>    <li>Superior written and verbal communication skills</li>    <li>Supportive of a culture that encompasses the highest ethical standards aligned with the Company Promise</li>    </ul> <strong>Why Choose Stuart Olson?</strong> <br/><br/> Safety, Sustainability, Collaboration, and Integrity are core Company values that encourage innovation and make a lasting difference in meeting the goals of our stakeholders and the communities in which we operate. Stuart Olson strongly supports and encourages employees to get involved and give back in their local communities. We expect our employees to bring their best to work every day and in return, management recognizes and rewards employees for their valued contribution through competitive compensation, robust benefits, health & wellness programs, and learning development opportunities. At Stuart Olson we are committed to creating a culture built on a passion to do great things. <br/><br/> <strong>Who We Are?</strong> <br/><br/> Stuart Olson has been positively impacting the businesses we serve, the communities in which we operate, and the lives we touch since 1911. Our rich history demonstrates our reach and diversity as an integrated, full service organization serving the commercial and industrial markets. <br/><br/> We are a $1.2 billion, fully integrated commercial construction and industrial services provider with offices in British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, and Ontario. We deliver confidence through a client-centered approach that ensures the highest quality of service, reduces risk and delivers results. <br/><br/> <strong>Application Instructions:</strong> All interested candidates can apply directly to the position at www.stuartolson.com/careers. Only candidates being considered for an interview will be contacted directly.</div> <br/>

Title: Market Mall Team Lead
Job_Description: Job Description: <br/><br/> The Team Lead is responsible for supporting the management team in all aspects of the shop in order to maximize sales and profitability through exceptional customer service.<br/> <div> To be committed to maintaining high professional standards in the areas of sales performance, customer service, support with visual presentation, inventory management, and shop operations. The Team Lead will demonstrate and uphold the commitment and vision of The Body Shop.</div>  <br/><strong>Key Job Accountabilities:</strong> <ul>  <li>Assist the Shop Manager and Assistant Manager to achieve shop sales targets in conjunction with the achievement of individual sales goals established by The Body Shop</li> <li>To be fully engaged in driving all sales and new product launches within the shop</li> <li>To be an Ambassador of the “FIT and Focus on the Customer” program leading by example, offering in-the-moment coaching to team members and ensuring the program is consistently being utilized on the shop floor</li> <li>Adhere to all Company Policies and Procedures as per The Body Shop Employee Handbook, Shop Operations Manuals, Body Talk and advise the Shop / Assistant Shop Manager if violations occur</li> <li>Perform opening and closing procedures for the store as per The Body Shop’s operational standards including the completion of all audit documentation</li> <li>Effectively execute visual merchandising directives (product launches), utilizing all directives provided</li> <li>To exemplify The Body Shop grooming guidelines and support the store team to reflect the brand image</li> <li>Responsible for maintaining the ethical standards of The Body Shop including minimizing the environmental, health and safety risks in the workplace. Report potential risks, near misses and real accidents to relevant managers and Body Talk</li> <li>Adhere to all Health and Safety and Loss/Profit Prevention policies and procedures to ensure the safety of customers and all colleagues</li> <li>Maintain the shop to the highest standards of cleanliness and hygiene</li> <li>The Team Lead will demonstrate and uphold the commitment and vision of the Company.</li>  </ul> <strong>Other :</strong> <ul> <li><div> Maintain regular attendance and punctuality for all scheduled shifts</div></li><li><div>To undertake any other duties as and when directed by store management</div></li> </ul> <strong>Working Relationships</strong> <br/><br/> The Body Shop Employees / Customers <br/><br/> <strong>Experience:</strong> <ul>  <li>Previous sales experience working in a customer service/ retail environment is preferred</li> <li>Experience in a customer service environment working with both sales and service targets</li> <li>Working knowledge of shop operation processes</li> <li>Highly resourceful, flexible and have the proven ability to solve problems in a timely manner</li> <li>Ability to work flexible hours, including holidays, nights and weekends to meet the needs of the business</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li><div> Basic computer skills</div> </li><li><div>High School Diploma or GED (preferred)</div> </li> </ul> <strong>The Body Shop International plc is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.</strong> <strong>Should you require any accommodation in the interview process, please notify human resources or the interviewer.</strong> <br/><br/> Apply

Title: Team Lead, Ski & Snowboard School
Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div><div>Date Posted:</div>  4/25/2018 </div> <div><div>Job Code:</div>  126 </div>    <div><div>Location:</div> Calgary </div>    <div><div>Address:</div> 88 Canada Olympic Road S.W. </div>    <div><div>City:</div> Calgary </div>  <div><div>Province:</div> AB </div>  <div><div>Country:</div> Canada </div>  <div><div>Category:</div> Temporary </div>                        <div>     <div>Description </div> <div>  <p><strong>Discover, Develop and Excel with WinSport:</strong></p><p>Working with WinSport means you will be part of creating one of the most unique winter sport institutes in the world. You will be overseeing day-to-day operations of our Outdoor Programs and contributing to the supervision of the team. You will be working in a world-class facility that showcases world-class services to support our customers in training and maintaining an active lifestyle. You will thrive and be supported to provide excellence in leadership and customer service for all guests.</p><p> </p><p><strong>What the role is about: </strong></p><p>Reporting to the Program Manager, Ski and Snowboard School, you will be responsible for providing students and guests with a premium experience through the implementation of on hill program preparation and delivery. You will assist the Manager in managing, scheduling and delivering training to Ski & Snowboard Instructors. <br> </p><p> </p><p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Provide excellent customer service by conducting call backs and responding to emails in a timely fashion.</li><li>Track inventory of equipment, progress cards, class cards and distribute accordingly.</li><li>Assist with set up of lessons and help customers with check in process.</li><li>Act as first point of contact for Instructors. </li><li>Accurately keep track of Instructor shifts by timekeeping and managing instructor’s hours in a timely manner.</li><li>Implement training and development to instructors.</li><li>Create schedule and ensure it is fair, accurate and is distributed in a timely fashion.</li><li>Provide feedback to instructors throughout the season and act as a mentor/role model to the team. </li><li>Organize and assign classes to instructors for all assigned programs. Work with the Manager to ensure quality control in the delivery of all lessons.</li><li>Liaise with the Manager and Guest Services to provide consistent product delivery and premium guest experience. This includes indoor pre-program preparation to facilitate quick, efficient organization of classes on the snow.</li><li>Maintain accurate documentation of programs, students and instructors.</li><li>Responsible for in-depth product knowledge and understanding of all Ski & Snowboard programs as well as all WinSport products, policies and procedures</li><li>Assist with enforcement of Ski & Snowboard School and WinSport rules and regulations. Be especially vigilant in ensuring that all staff, hill users and other guests adheres to Duty of Care policies and the Alpine Responsibility Code</li><li>Act as an ambassador for the Snow School and WinSport</li><li>Ensure safety orientation is completed with all new or returning employees covering all the required safety hazards and specific safety training for specific areas</li><li>Other duties as required</li></ul> </div>     </div>                          <div>     <div>Minimum Requirements </div> <div>  <p><strong>Qualifications: </strong></p><ul><li>1- 3 years of leadership experience in a related or other fields</li><li>3-5 years of working with youth and adult programs</li><li>Standard First Aid and CPR “C”.</li><li>Experience dealing with a large team made up of various cultures and demographics is considered an asset.</li><li>Strong Leadership skills are required</li><li>Must be CSIA, CASI or foreign equivalent certified and up to date.</li><li>Excellent communication and organizational skills</li><li>Organization, multi tasking and prioritizing skills are essential</li><li>Demonstrate and apply leadership skills and excellent customer service</li><li>Previous conflict resolution experience is an asset</li><li>Strong decision making skills are essential. </li><li>Strong pedagogy and mentoring skills are essential</li><li>Good understanding of Ski/Snowboard industry is considered an asset. </li><li>Knowledge of Microsoft programs such as Word, and Excel is an asset.</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>Physical Demands:</strong></p><ul><li>Seasonal, winter position</li><li>Dynamic working environment</li><li>Activities will concentrate primarily outdoors. Some indoor activities and preparation is required</li><li>Must act as an example and role model to all Snow Academy instructors and other Canada Olympic Park team members</li><li>Must be able to lift, carry, push or pull objects up to 20lb occasionally.</li><li>Be prepared to work in all weather conditions</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>What's in it for you?:</strong></p><p>If an unforgettable experience and working alongside an amazing team weren't enough for you, WinSport offers its seasonal employees some really great perks; free hill passes, reciprocals at other resorts, food, beverage and retail discounts, and a gym membership at our BNTC, just to name a few things that will make you love it here.</p> </div>     </div>          </div>      <p>    </p>     <div>            Apply Now              </div>  </div>       <div>  <div>    <ul>    <li>              Back to Results          </li>             <li>Save this Job</li>                 <li>Refer this Job</li>                      </ul>      <div></div></div></div></div></div>

Title: Sr. Implementation Consultant
Job_Description: The Sr. Implementation Consultant will be the accounting lead role responsible for translating accounting business requirements into designs. Role would be responsible for configuration and testing of the accounting functions along with supporting users through training and testing. Would be responsible for leading up to 3 consultants. <br/><br/> Requirements: <ul>  <li>5 years in services delivery role with experience leading oil and gas software implementations</li> <li>Oil and Gas accounting experience, preferably in midstream and transportation</li> <li>Experience working in a flexible fast-paced high performance company</li> <li>Proven communication and organizational skills</li> <li>Strong people and relationship building skills</li> <li>Proven track record of operating with strong ethical standards</li> <li>Aptitude for problem solving and collaboration; excels at working in a team environment</li> <li>Track record of developing and delivering on goals and objectives</li> <li>Track record of mentoring and developing staff</li> <li>Drive consistency in delivery of software solutions</li> <li>Ability to manage a small team of resources, including managing and tracking to budgets and timelines</li> <li>Ensure that customers are satisfied and that the requirements are being met</li> <li>Build trust based relationships with customer project team and business personnel</li>  </ul> Technical / Functional Skills Preferred: <ul>  <li>Experience working with NGL marketing platforms (Allegro, RightAngle, Entero, etc.)</li> <li>Experience implementing or integrating with SAP Financial Accounting (FI)</li> <li>Experience with Full Absorption Product Costing: identifying variables and fixed costs, supporting invoice statement generation, automated journal entry creations, bookkeeping, chart of accounts management, and product inventory management</li> <li>Experience delivering projects leveraging multiple methodologies with an emphasis on execution of projects leveraging Agile techniques</li> <li>Experience working in Cloud/SaaS project delivery model</li> <li>Strong Microsoft SQL skills and experience working with a variety of reporting and business intelligence tools</li> <li>Relevant professional certificate (CPA, PMP, etc.)</li>  </ul>

The Manager (Enterprise Network Architect) reports to the Operations Manager and interfaces with all affected stakeholders both internal and external to ISM Canada in a matrix environment. The Manager (Enterprise Network Architect) will be responsible for designing and architecting network solutions, providing thought leadership and project advisory services, and researching and evaluating new solutions and technologies. Candidates must possess a University degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or an equivalent level of education and experience.  Successful candidates will be results oriented IT professionals with strong analytical and problem solving skills, coupled with proven interpersonal and communication skills.  They must have a demonstrated ability to deliver to client needs, often under tight timelines, to meet or exceed client expectations; and a deep knowledge and proven skills in network routing, switching and internet infrastructure.  A Manager (Enterprise Network Architect) should have 7 or more years of experience in network support functions as well as 3 or more years in a network architecture role.  Cisco or Microsoft Certifications would be asset.  This role is subject to regular business working conditions and occasional travel is a requirement of the role. This role is also expected to evolve as ISM Canada’s business evolves.   Qualifications:  CCIE Certification (either Data Center, Routing/Switching, Service Provider or Security) Cisco Routing/Switching experience Experience with architecting solutions based on Cisco Nexus Switches (5k, 7k, 9k) Experience with routing protocols (EIGRP, OSPF and BGP) Experience with network control protocols (QoS, PoE, NTP, DHCP) Experience with logical design models (L2/L3, VDC, FEX, Datacenter zones, Fabric Path, Spanning tree, Port Channels, VTP, VLANs and physical cabling) Experience with ACI (policies, tenants, application network profile, end-point group, contracts) 7-9 years of network IT experience in various client-facing consulting and delivery roles Knowledge of project management methodologies and tools Proven leadership and ability to drive teams Demonstrated ability to adapt and drive change Strong analytical skills and ability to communicate complex ideas Proven experience managing and/or delivering similar services with increasing degree of responsibility and proven track record with the ability to execute according to plan  If you are interested in this position, please submit your application on the ISM Canada careers portal:  https://careers.ismcanada.com/careers/ before November 14, 2017.   Job Code: CORP17-122FT Manager (Enterprise Network Architect) (Out of Scope)                		Job Title  		Enterprise Network Architect    		Company Name  		ISM Canada    		Email      		Category  Category -> IT / Internet    		Job Type  Job Type -> Full-Time          		Salary      		Location  		Alberta    		Area  Area -> Calgary (General)                     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});      														 									 						 																 						Back | 																	 								 						   | More     » See all jobs by this advertiser

If you are an IT professional with Entrepreneurial aspirations and want to be the lead for applications development, this may be a job opportunity for you. Our company is looking for an Application Software Programmer / Developer with a background in the developing, implementation and ongoing support of process control and general accounting application software.  A working knowledge of Telco billing systems and PBX/VOIP Systems is an asset.  Other job activities include working directly with the clients to enhance products and provide customization's. Our Products The Application Systems have been designed to manage, audit and control all aspects of Telecommunication Infrastructure and expense for large Fortune 1000 corporate, government and institutional clients. Our clients require a full suite of Software programming and related Support / professional services. The Core applications include: Call Detail Recording / Accounting Telecom Inventory Management TELCO Electronic Invoice Process (TELUS Ebod, Bell Canada OBM, Rogers Wireless, TELUS Mobility, Bell Mobility) Telecom Expense Management (TEM) Telecom Work Order Processing (Telecom Adds/Moves/Change)  JOB DESCRIPTION We are seeking a unique individual to drive our core software development of existing applications under the direction of the senior systems designer. Applicants with entrepreneurial skill sets will be an asset. For the successful employee, there will be options for equity positions in in our company as a Junior partner. Our products are designed in the Sunbelt PLB language and a 4GL program generator – Systemaker from InfoPro. The candidate needs to learn this core language (PLB) and Development tool in the delivery of their job duties. (See Sunbelt PLB and InfoPro Web Pages for more detail). The job requires an individual who has a desire to work in a dynamic environment in all facets of the application software design and development. The job also allows the individual to work in the ongoing development of the product as well as new conceptual software design.  JOB DUTIES Core ongoing Applications Development Learning and excelling at programming with the existing Development tools; the PLB Language and InfoPro Systemaker, Kermit Script, Perl, CSV2.xls General module design and programming Maintain the existing application systems Keep up with the New development of both Development tool and Language to transform these applications into a WEB & Mobile based application using a MySQL back-end Ongoing Software Customizations for individual clients and projects Develop new applications using these tools. Take the application to the next level (Web / mobile / MySQL)  Qualification A mandatory requirement to have the ability to learn new programming language and development tools (Sunbelt PLB and InfoPro Systemaker) Minimum 10 years’ experience in Applications Software design, programming and development A background in accounting software Knowledge and experience working with Voice Telecom, PBX/VOIP technologies (Cisco, Avaya) and Telco billing systems is an asset Working knowledge of Linux and Microsoft is preferred Working knowledge of Linux and Microsoft is preferred Knowledge of; Telecom Billing Systems Telco Inventory Systems Telco Work Oder systems Telco Billing systems PBX and VOIP Technologies     We offer a competitive Compensation Package with full benefits, flex time as well as a casual work space.  Offices are in south Calgary. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those selected for an interview will contacted.     Keywords: Software Title: Android Developer
Job_Description: Android Developer   					Posted date [Jan-05-17]  					 (ID: 89176)  				 Robots and Pencils  				               					  » See all jobs by this advertiser        | More     Back|					 								         This post has expired! It was posted more than 60 days ago.    At Robots and Pencils, we’re expanding and looking for an Android Developer to join our talented  and world class robot team.  Who you are: You are someone who prefers to communicate through code.  You love to create and have a strong desire to learn. You have strong opinions but that are weakly held; you are humble yet confident. In fact, you’re the first to pass along the latest headache busting library from Square to your colleagues just minutes after sending a link to a mind clarifying blog post from Romain Guy. You can speak to language best practices and are not afraid of anonymous inner-classes. You never overlook the saved instance state and have contemplated the tradeoffs between activities, fragments and views. You have knowledge of how a RESTful web service works, what makes it RESTful and how it can be accessed from Android. You are also diligent about meeting allocated budgets and can work within time constraints, but you will never sacrifice quality. What you’ll do:  Design, program and test software. Author and maintain relevant documentation for developers, clients and users. Develop and refine prototypes to confirm requirements. Program according to project plans (versions, sprints). Test according to pre-determined test plans. Support release and post-release activities, such as support, versioning and maintenance. Collaborate with our pencils (designers) to create interfaces that conform to the Google design guidelines. Peer review other team members’ code, and learn and adapt from peer review of your own code. Support sales and project managers with technical insights, leading to the creation of budgets and schedules for projects.  Desired skills and experience:  5+ years of delivering software with preference given to those who have a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent Solid understanding and practical knowledge of the full mobile development and application life cycle Solid understanding of Android UX/UI guidelines and best practices Experience with Android using Android Studio and JAVA Experience with a distributed Version Control System Experience with mobile development issues related to performance optimisation, caching and security Excellent communications skills with the ability to share insights and expectations with clients, stakeholders and colleagues, both locally and remotely  Work perks  Working alongside smart, talented people who will push you and help you grow. Support for professional development and access to as many books as you can read. A great work environment and health benefits. Fun activities (like book club and board game nights), biweekly Robo Brews and team parties.  To Apply:  https://robotsandpencils.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=84 About Robots and Pencils Robots and Pencils is an app development company known for its top-ranking consumer apps, transformative enterprise apps and world-first learning platforms. Started in 2009, Robots and Pencils has more than 250 apps used by over 77 million people worldwide, and was named one of North America’s Technology Fast 500 by Deloitte in 2014. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. On top of this, you are comfortable working in cross-functional teams and can share insights and expectations with stakeholders, clients, team members and various levels of management. What you’ll do:  Design, program and test software. Author and maintain relevant documentation for developers, clients and users. Develop and refine prototypes to confirm requirements. Program according to project plans (versions, sprints). Test according to pre-determined test plans. Lead release and post-release activities, such as support, versioning and maintenance. Peer review other team members’ code, and learn and adapt from peer review of your own code. Support sales and project managers with technical insights, leading to the creation of budgets and schedules for projects.
